text: XCOM: Enemy Unknown is a turn-based tactics developed by Firaxis and Published by 2K Games. A great game this is. XCOM: Enemy Unknown is about an alien invasion, well not really a full scale invasion, not yet, but it's an invasion. You are XCOM, an organization that responsible for any threat regarding to allien or anything that comes from outer space. It's quite addictive like Civilization games. XCOM: Enemy Unknown gameplay is so addictive, build up your base, train and promote your soldiers, research technology based on captured allien tech on the field, build interceptors to take down incoming UFO's, stopping alien assault and abduction of humans, assault alien UFO crash site, it never stops. Soldiers can be customized with armors, better rifles or shotguns, give them some laser weapons and they look like a Stormtroopers. There's also a time when your base will be attacked by the X-Rays, it's what they called the alien there since they don't really know what those aliens are, so many creatures. So much to do.  On the battlefield, the game use turn-based gameplay. Just remember if your soldiers died in the field, the're gone forever. Soldiers get wounded also need sometime to heal in the medbay. So you really need to look after your soldiers in the field, make a good decision and think about your strategy. XCOM: Enemy Unknown, for a strategy game, it has quite great graphics and effects, better detailed and all. Soldiers really look so cool, the guns are amazing, the particle effect is great, the alien is really look like an E.T. Performance are perfectly great, no issues whatsoever. If only modding is officially supported, nevertheless I recommend XCOM: Enemy Unknown. Rating 9/10
text_translate: An absolute masterpiece of sound design. I haven‚Äôt played since   a game so acoustically developed! Hunting shadows in the forest with little else to go on but your bow and your ears is an extremely rewarding experience. They kinda crippled you visually with the black & white colour scheme (in which they occasionally use hints of red to nudge you along the way and which can be adapted to full colour if you so wish), but then they built a whole acoustic world for you to compensate for it. The game‚Äôs story is based loosely on the mystery of the Roanoke colony, so I believe the colour palette is supposed to be reminiscent of the engravings we have from that early period of colonisation, but I think the way it looks is also aimed at enhancing the acoustic experience the game set itself to provide. A fully coloured world would have distracted you from the acoustic design, as it would have given you more visual means to deal with its dangers, but with the world painted this way you must rely mainly on what you hear in order to survive in it. They striped the colour from the world only to give you the sounds to colour it with! And, believe me, your brain will gradually learn to detach itself from the scant visuals and pay more and more attention to the richer palette of what can be heard around you, with the world ultimately starting to make more sense as a body of sounds rather than colours. And that makes for a highly original and properly immersive experience. Sadly, though, even on the highest difficulty setting, the 'unseen' enemies don't quite do enough damage to really make the slow-paced stealth, 'based on hearing', approach a necessity. Also, relying mainly on what you hear, the game is kind of an ethereal, disembodied experience, and was criticised at the time for not having enough flesh on its long (black and) white bones. I think this suits the game just fine, though, because it is basically a "ghost story" and, since dealing with ghosts is mainly an 'auditory' kind of endeavour, using an unsubstantial, de-realised setting is a proper way of 'telling‚Äô it. Fleshing it more would have shifted the game‚Äôs focus, I think, and would ultimately have turned it into a different kind of experience than what the developers had in mind.

Quite a good game, modeled after the well-known Minesweeper. Recommended for lovers of puzzles and puzzles, as well as for those who would like to enter the circle of those. For those who like to break their brains, it will be just a good rest from difficult tasks, and for beginners, it will not make you forget about puzzles forever :) The downside of the game is the static nature of the levels. Those. there is no generation of levels, there are only 30 specific puzzles that, when you play it again, will no longer be interesting. Although it may be a plus for someone - if you did not go through everything perfectly the first time, then by reloading the level you can quickly recreate the desired picture. The lack of difficult levels can also be attributed to the disadvantages. Pros of the game: pleasant sound; lightweight graphics that do not hurt the eyes; ACHIVKI !!! It's very easy to get the perfect game. Rating: 9 out of 10.

text: Lo recomiendo en una buena promo o regalado jeje.. hasta 80% de descuento siento que lo vale :D El juego me ha gustado, Los graficos no son buenos que digamos, parecen de la epoca de PlayStation, asi que estan bien . En cuanto a la prensentaci√≥n del juego esta bastante bien, tiene un menu bueno y una presentacion inicial tambien buena, se agradece que desarrolladores independientes le quieran meter su estilo, a mi me ha parecido buena. Por otro lado el juego en base a enemigo hay una gran cantida de enemigos diferentes(El error es presentarlos casi todos en el capitulo uno, luego se pierde porque son repetitivos), uno que otro si te asusta de la manera que salen, pero eso si ninguno presenta un reto, ya que la inteligencia artificial es muy mala, creo que el desarrollaror quiso poner a los enemigos rapidos y que se muevamo como locos para que no les logres dar, pero eso hace que que por lo menos uno de cada raza se buguen jaja. Los enemigos son feos y no lo digo porque den miedo, si no porque parece que alguien dibujo un bosquejo de esos que hacemos en la parte trasera de cualquier libreta y asi tal cual lo anexo al juego jaja  El gran fallo que le encontre al juego es no poder ver tu estado de vida, es bastante frustante porque no sabes cuanto de vida tienes, tampoco te avisa si estas a punto de morir o se pone la pantalla roja, simplemente nada, entre tus disparos un monton de enemigos simplemente mueres.. Los controles son tipicos de  shoter m√°s del espacial horror jajaj otros podria marcar que la falta de mapa sea otro problema pero a mi me parece bien, perderte un rato y dejar de ir de un punto A a uno B, tampoco es que tengas muchos caminos... text: Um criativo jogo rogue-like, tem uma hist√≥ria bem simples, por√©m, n√£o √© o foco do jogo, ent√£o consegue se manter como boa. A diversidade de armas e itens encontrados no jogo √© incr√≠vel, todos tem fun√ß√µes interessantes, al√©m disso o jogo tem v√°rios segredos, provavelmente n√£o descobri nem 1/10 deles. O jogo √© composto por 5 andares, nestes andares temos v√°rias salas, algumas salas especi√°is, salas com ba√∫s que necessitam de chaves, e a sala do boss, os chefes do jogo s√£o desafiadores, todos tem um padr√£o completamente diferente de ataques, sendo completamente imprevis√≠veis em sua primeira batalha contra eles. Os inimigos comuns do jogo variam bastante, temos v√°rios que s√£o apenas re-skin de outros mais simples, e temos os "mini-chefes", presentes em alguma sala, sempre se destacam pelo seu tamanho e pelas suas cores mais vibrantes em sua maioria. A dificuldade do jogo √© grande, voc√™ nunca est√° totalmente preparado no jogo, apenas se tiver uma arma muito forte, as imprevis√≠veis salas do mapa, podem te aguardar com uma horda de inimigos acompanhados com raios laser e cuspidores de bala grudados na parede, ou apenas com uma simples horda de inimigos comuns, por isso o principal elemento de combate no jogo √© o rolamento, onde voc√™ desvia dos tiros inimigos com uma cambalhota. Esse jogo √© uma grande obra, tanto pela criatividade, grande variedade de armas, inimigos e padr√µes de ataque, quanto pela dificuldade, que faz o jogo ter bastante tempo de gameplay, eu por exemplo em v√°rias tentativas s√≥ consegui finalizar o jogo duas vezes ( nenhuma com o final real do jogo ;-; ), bugs s√£o encontrados raramente, s√£o quase inexistentes, o √∫nico grande defeito do jogo √© a falta do multiplayer n√£o local, seria muito interessante e divertido jogar esse jogo com amigos, totalmente recomendado, sua nota √© cerca de 9.

text: THis game is quite the ride, let's make a list of bad and good points first. The BAD: - Maniability is horrendous and I played with a XBOX gamepad, I would suggest this method over keyboard and mouse but it is still bad. - Too many back and forth in the story for its own good, even if there is a narrative reason for it, too much is too much. - It is still only an interactive movie with light gameplay even if it is a step up from Heavy Rain. The GOOD: - This is one of the very best stories I experienced in video game form. - Acting is top notch, and not only from Ellen Page and Willem DAfoe but all supporting characters. - Great production value, game still looks beautiful. - Finishing the game the only thing I want to do is jump in again (using remixed option this time) to see the branching stories. All in all this is a great game and if you like interactive story telling with branching narrative this is definitely reommended. Story will stick with you despite the flaws. For anyone thinking this is just a movie, it took me 15 hours to complete my first playthrough and I do want to jump back in ASAP. For anyone that liked Heavy Rain this is big step up in almost everything.

text: : 2 Thumbs Up! If and only if all early access indie games had this much passion poured into them. This game is meticulously designed and delivers the experience platform action lovers are looking for and more. It's an intriguing story about an angel who has to battle her way out of a demon-infested prison and regain her divine powers. Gameplay is reminiscent of MegaMan so if you're a fan it's right up your alley. Graphics and sound are on point and get you into the apocalyptic atmosphere. The replay value is huge with pro-gen levels so every time you come back or start over there are refreshing differences. I can't recommend it highly enough and I'm extremely excited to see what the full release offers. If you want to dig into Seraph a little more, check out:

text_translate: I have been playing this game on and off for a few years now, and it's a surprise to see they are still actively supporting and updating it. This game has never been better, in my opinion. Sure, it has its share of problems, but as a casual player (I might be in the minority), I really enjoy this game. The weapon mechanics are great, the default maps offer some great variety in visuals and gameplay. It is one of the ever dwindling amount of FPS games right now that don't force you to buy DLC or lock gameplay contents behind a paywall. It's also ridiculously cheap and even more so during sales. And the last part is problem for a lot of competitive players at the moment. You might come across a lot of cheaters and this ruins the competitive aspect of the game. Personally I've only encountered around 3-4 cheaters, but it's a problem that's proving hard to solve, and ruining the game for its most serious players.  This is a great game overall, though. It's super fun to play with friends. The workshop content is absolutely massive. CS:GO has one of the biggest modding communities on Steam and there are tons of maps that offer a wide variety of content. All of them for free. Definitely recommend this game.

Death is a great teacher. Failure in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is, as it always has been for this series, the greatest way to learn where you should have gone, what you shouldn't have done, and how you could have done better. Counter-Strike players spend a lot of time learning -- consequently, they are always getting better. Growth is an important factor in Global Offensive, especially if you're coming into Counter-Strike fresh or after a sabbatical. This is an extremely hardcore, skill-based first-person shooter, and it forces you to think differently than other modern shooters. If you‚Äôre a Call of Duty player, you‚Äôre going to need to change your play style to succeed here. Counter-Strike also tries developing into something new here as well, despite doing little to push itself beyond what it‚Äôs always done best. Global Offensive modifies old maps to keep veterans on their toes, and introduces official new modes that encourage different play styles for the first time in almost 15 years. For the uninitiated, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is a small-scale, team-based first-person shooter with permanent death. When a counter-terrorist kills a terrorist planting explosives in a classic Defusal match, or a CT escort swallows a sniper round in Hostage Rescue, the victim is dead for good and doesn't respawn until the next round. As such, players on both sides must exercise skill and care. The bomb objective, meanwhile, gives everyone a purpose. Of course matches end when everyone on a team is dead, but a clever and coordinated terrorist team will give the CTs the slip, plant their bomb, and protect the bomb site. Between rounds, everyone spends earned cash on better gear and guns, and the cycle continues. Pieces of the Counter-Strike formula are dated at this point, but the superb heart and soul of Global Offensive is timeless. Teams are small, guns are lethal, and rounds are short. There's an addictive just-one-more-round quality to it, because there's a constant desire to do better than last time, to earn a satisfying kill, or to win in a new way. Call of Duty and Battlefield vets will wonder why they can't sprint to escape enemy fire or look down the iron sights to improve aim; Counter-Strike players will feel like they walked into their redecorated home. Certain map redesigns will catch hardcore fans off guard, but the changes are for the best -- the underpass choke point in de_dust, for instance, has a new escape route. Even in the face of genre evolution, Global Offensive doesn‚Äôt care to adapt. CSGO is so dedicated to Counter-Strike's aging ideals despite market and trend changes that it brute-forces its way to success. Part of what makes it such an engaging competitive game is that killing in Global Offensive requires a wholly different skill set than other shooters. Everyone is limited to what they have and can see, with little room for character modification or on-the-fly advantages. Running and gunning is a useless play style, even if you've bought a helmet and kevlar that round, to the point that someone standing still is more likely to score the kill. Walking, crouching, or standing are your best bets to reduce the inaccurate spray of machine-gun fire. Consequently, killing in Global Offensive feels good. There's a sickening sensation to dropping someone dead because you know they're not coming back. It's also satisfying knowing you used limited resources to play smarter than your victim. If players aren't watching corners, providing covering fire, or using smoke grenades and flashbangs, they're more likely to take a headshot from a more delicate and patient triggerman. The desire to experience that distinct feeling is a strong motivator to keep playing, even when you're getting steamrolled by an obviously better team. If you've played Counter-Strike before, Global Offensive probably sounds a whole lot like Counter-Strike. Like Counter-Strike: Source before it, Global Offensive exists simply to modernize the look of the classic competitive shooter, while doing little to disrupt the core form and function. At the same time, it does enough to color outside the lines of tradition to justify your time and effort. Fire is one of the most interesting new combat variables. Molotov cocktails and incendiary grenades either roast groups of guys or force them in another direction. Flames are a useful distraction or scare tactic, too. They're particularly useful during Demolition matches, which focus the fight at a single bomb site rather than giving terrorists two to pick between. The new and modified maps in this mode aren't as big as classic Counter-Strike arenas ‚Äì entire sections have been cut off to direct teams toward a central location ‚Äì but their thoughtful design is as intricate as ever. The Lake map is a standout -- there's a wide open yet densely populated yard around the bomb site, which is inside a sizable lakeside home with plenty of vantage points and hiding spots. To separate Demolition from Defusal, players can't buy between rounds. Instead, it takes a cue from the other new mode, Arms Race, in which each kill unlocks another weapon instantly. The better you do, the more you have to switch up the way you play, and because Demolition is so fast you'll need to be quick on your feet. Unlike other game types, Arms Race allows for respawns. It's the most chaotic and care-free mode in Global Offensive, with players throwing caution to the wind for the sake of climbing the kill ladder as quickly as possible. It's a shame there are only two maps in Arms Race -- a problem that will more likely persist on consoles than PC. If you have the option, playing the PC version is unquestionably the best way to experience Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. Mods, mouse and keyboard, and the usual PC-only options are better than the ports. Plus, Valve is much better about long-term PC support -- it abandoned Team Fortress 2 on consoles, and Portal 2's level editor was PC exclusive. If you prefer to play on consoles, Global Offensive is the same great game

Differences from the previous work 1. The enemy has a grade. In Parkrai 4, the kids with yellow marks appeared as strong grades, but in this work, they were clearly classified as grade 4. At a lower level, it is tricky because it cannot kill enemies of a higher level with a kill move. This is the part that can be covered by upgrading. 2. The enemy's health bar is visible and the damage value is displayed. This was the first time in the Parkrai series, where the enemy's health bar appeared. Also, the damage mark is displayed whether it is close, exploded, or gunshot. It is clearly seen that the higher your level, the more damage. 3. The enemy has become a lot harder. In the previous series, I can feel that enemies that were like paper dolls become tanking to some extent. However, this is also a part that can be solved when the grade goes up. Even beasts such as bears and wild boars felt quite strong. 4. Skill has been simplified. The distribution system after obtaining the trait points from the previous work is the same. In the previous work, A and B skills had to be distributed separately, but in this work, even if only one skill is taken, both A and B are applied. 5. Shields and special weapons were added. It is impossible to jump and sprint with a shield, but it can withstand bullets to some extent and can quickly defeat enemies with the throw function. A mysterious weapon that bounces and kills multiple enemies with a gear launcher has been added. 6. In the air, enemy troops jump off helicopters and invade by parachute. I saw this for the first time in this work. It was pretty fresh. 7. Guard and avoidance occurred in the fist melee attack. It is rarely useful, but it is a new addition. In addition, pressing and holding the right-click will automatically aim. 8. Like Battle Ground, supplies sometimes drop from the sky, and enemy troops come there. There are only a few, so you can get rid of them and get materials. The difference from the bag is that it does not contain weapons. 9. You cannot use any weapon or explosive from the beginning. With the introduction of the rating system mentioned earlier, it can be used by upgrading the building that raises the rating and unlocking it because it is locked at a lower level. 10. The reload motion and kill move have changed. In my personal opinion, the previous work is much better. This could be good news for fans who want a new style. What's the Same 1. My mercenary shoots a carnivore that was barely outrun with stupid AI meat and pulls it aggression, resulting in a fire boss wasting bullets and stamina. If you shoot from a distance, the enemy will still jump and die one by one in a tournament style. 2. Recapture the outpost, save the kidnapped allies, shoot with a truck with a machine gun. 3. Wild animals chasing right after you when you are not physically scared are the most. The final conclusion is fine for killing time. There are narrow release intervals, and there are no numbering side effects, so you have to consider to some extent that there are no major changes. A new rating system, NPCs, maps, etc. will be released, but the feeling that Parkrai 5 is skinned cannot be erased. It's a good game to play if you buy it at an affordable price when it's on sale.

text_translate: Raiders! is a traditional CRPG or perhaps a Major strategical game with RPG mechanics, it takes place in the future in a land resembling a traditional Wasteland. It basically gives of Mad Max vibes and the gameplay reminds me of Stronghold Kingdoms but that‚Äôs just me. The game was developed by Creative Storm Entertainment and published by   . Release Date: 10th November 2020 Last known update: 22nd November 2020 I am very pessimistic about games of this genre as I usually do not want to sink hours into a game in order to just learn the thousands of ‚Äúbasic‚Äù controls. Raiders! on the other hand, feels like a breath of fresh air. I was able to enjoy the game almost instantly and feeling as if I was actually making progress which shows that even the pacing is much better. This is a game that I could sink some decent hours into. As mentioned above the game plays out like a traditional tactical RPG. Now how does that play out in a setting like Raiders? You do have a leader with specific attributes that you choose from at the beginning. These stats will help you or break you in the future so you should be wise with your initial decisions. Throughout the playthrough, you will have to make multiple decisions on random encounters, some examples are to hire a wastelander that will sabotage various areas or an ex-soldier trying to join your team, you do have the classic options and these are to either kill or hire him or her. In addition to these random encounters, you will have to choose whom to fight and whom to avoid as you may lose all of your soldiers. After completing a raid or a fight you might get the chance to capture a hostage. Hostages are high-value people that will give you quite a lot of power if you‚Äôre using them correctly. Usually, I prefer to sell them as that gives me the ability to earn over 5000 chips ( game currency ). The other options are to execute them which will give you fear points and these are useful when it comes to either scare troops away or perhaps demand various resources. Lastly, you can simply eat them which is probably the worst option. The RPG elements aren‚Äôt the only attractive ones, this game is a blast to play as a tactical game as well. I found myself sinking hours in the game just to create the most balanced and efficient squad, let alone all of the traps and fortifications you can build for your hideout. Outside of battle formations and hideout fortifications, you can level up each of your soldiers after completing a successful battle. At first, you can choose the class they will represent, one is basically a tank another one is an offensive-minded soldier and lastly you got the support guy. There is an option if you would like to manually upgrade each stat of your soldier or to let the game handle that. Outside of upgrading attributes you will have to choose from various unlockable perks that can give each soldier the edge in a fight. While in a fight you have the option to either fight them yourself or once again let the game handle the fight which works well enough in my opinion. An 8 man squad is presented when fighting but you can obviously have more soldiers waiting to get substituted. Lastly, the best formation would be to have 4 gunmen and 4 melee men as this would give you the most balanced attacking and defending.  Be aware, spoilers ahead!   There isn‚Äôt much of a story here. As you create your ‚Äúleader‚Äù your goal is to be the strongest you can be. Time will tell if you‚Äôre good enough to capture cities and many businesses or perhaps maintain a very diplomatic relationship with the rest of the cities. It‚Äôs a basic story but let‚Äôs be honest this isn‚Äôt the reason this game exists. The visuals look hand-drawn or let‚Äôs say pretty unique. It is nothing amazing but it surely matches the Wasteland setting the developers tried to follow.                      The Benchmark tool used was MSI Afterburner. Raiders benchmark completed, 10790 frames rendered in 185.906 s                      Average framerate  :   58.0 FPS                      Minimum framerate  :   36.4 FPS                      Maximum framerate  :   60.9 FPS                      1% low framerate   :   10.2 FPS                      0.1% low framerate :    6.4 FPS Raiders! is a game that gave me a lot of quality hours, it does have some flaws but I could easily ignore them which resulted in an excellent experience. Truly a game I would recommend!

text_translate: You haven't known pain until you serve steak with fries. Steak with fries requires you to cut two potatoes, 150g each, into 15g slices. That's 10 slices each, for a total of 20 slices. You are required to cut 20 slices of potatoes within a very tight margin of error. You will understand that very tight margin of error, because apparently every customer you serve steak with fries to brings a little scale to your restaurant. When they receive their order, they will weigh each and every single fry to ensure they are all roughly 15g. If you mess up a single fry, even if your steak is perfect, consider your dish wasted.

text_translate: Toren is an indie title from Swordtales. At just under 10 ‚Ç¨ and about 3 hours of playing time, it might be a bit expensive, but it's definitely worth it. If you look over some small criticisms such as B. - sometimes a bit tricky scripted cutscenes - fixed camera position in most of the game, rarely a 360 degree function - the controls get frustrated every now and then, depending on the situation - graphically not the tip of the iceberg So you still get a game with a terrific storyline on the one hand is transmitted by scrolls and on the other hand by Papyrus our in-game storyteller. As well as a somewhat small but beautiful game world that takes place in the tower in which we wake up, as well as in our dreams, in which we achieve the true strength we need in battle. At the beginning you are concerned with finding out what history surrounds this empty place in which we were born and why all its inhabitants turned to stone. But soon you grow into a young warrior whose destiny will be the fight. Conclusion: Relatively short game, but designed with a lot of love, plus a beautiful and at the same time sad story. For ‚Ç¨ 10, as already mentioned, a bit expensive, so if you don't want to invest so much in such a short title you should rather wait for an offer.

text: Hallo Fleischklops, herzlich willkommen im Krieg der Droiden. Zwar sind wir Maschinen euch Fleischwesen weit √ºberlegen, dennoch sind unsere Kampfstrategien im Voraus berechenbar. Daher brauchen wir deinen niederen Intellekt, damit k√∂nnen wir unsere Feinde derart √ºberraschen, dass der Krieg noch zu unseren Gunsten entschieden werden kann. Wie ich in der Einleitung schon angedeutet habe, bek√§mpfen sich in Taur zwei Druiden Rassen. Du unterst√ºtzt dabei die Tauron im Kampf um deren Heimatwelt Taurea gegen die Imperion. Die Tauron mussten schwere Verluste verkraften und besitzen nur noch eine Kampfbasis. In einem letzten Kraftakt erh√§ltst du, in diesem Tower Defence Spiel, die Kontrolle √ºber diese letzte Kampfstation. Im Gegensatz zu anderen Tower Defence Spielen steht anfangs nur die Hauptwaffe zur Verf√ºgung. Diese wird direkt durch die Spieler gesteuert. Hier hei√üt es gut zielen und die Nachladezeit zu beachten. Zu Beginn des Spiels ist die Anzahl der Gegner aber noch √ºbersichtlich, es dauert also ein paar Runden, bevor es wirklich hei√ü her geht. Zudem l√§sst einem das Spiel oft die Wahl zwischen verschiedenen Kampfgebieten mit unterschiedlichen Belohnungen. Typisch f√ºr das Genre stehen anfangs nur schwache Verteidigungsanlagen zur Verf√ºgung. Diese k√∂nnen aber nicht nur ausgebaut werden, auch ist es m√∂glich neue Technologien und Verbesserungen zu erforschen. Nach jeder Schlacht erh√§lt der Spieler hierf√ºr Rohstoffe in Form von Energie und Kristallen. Neben verschiedenen T√ºrmen k√∂nnen auch direkt eigene Einheiten, die Hauptwaffe und neue F√§higkeiten erforscht werden. Um das Spiel zu gewinnen, ist es notwendig, die Hauptwaffe des Gegners zu zerst√∂ren. Bis dahin gilt es die Kontrolle √ºber den Planeten nicht zu verlieren. Einzelne Schlachten k√∂nnen verloren werden, die Rohstoffe f√ºr zerst√∂rte Verteidigungsanlagen werden wieder erstattet. Eine Art fairer Krieg ums √úberleben! Dasselbe gilt auch f√ºr den Abriss von entsprechenden Anlagen, einzig die Bauslots sind f√ºr die aktuelle Runde gesperrt.  frische ideenreiche Umsetzung  Prim√§r- und Sekund√§rwaffe wird durch Spieler gesteuert  eigene Bode- und Lufteinheiten  R√ºckerstattung von Rohstoffen  Umfangreiche Forschung  gemessen an der Spielzeit zu teuer  ben√∂tigt etwas Einarbeitung  keine Musik im Kampf Ich kann Taur aufgrund des guten Forschungssystems und die damit verbundene Freiheit im Bau der Verteidigungsanlagen nur empfehlen. Negativ f√§llt nat√ºrlich die fehlende Musik und der doch recht hohe Preis auf. Sollten eure Verteidigungst√ºrme zerst√∂rt werden, habt ihr eure Verteidigung nicht gut auf den entsprechenden Gegnertyp abgestimmt. Nutz das es aus, dass die Rohstoffe erstattet werden, und optimiert Forschung und Aufbau entsprechend. Die durch den Spieler gesteuerten Waffen k√∂nnen taktisch gegen Gegnergruppen eingesetzt werden und einzelne Gegner zur√ºckwerfen. Auch helfen euch eigene Bodentruppen dabei nicht √ºberrannt zu werden! Mir sind keine Fehler oder Bugs im Spiel aufgefallen.

La variedad de montruos y eventos, el sistema de PVP (voluntario y no intrusivo, al contrario de la mayor√≠a de los MMORPG online), el soporte t√©cnico instant√°neo y cordial, la estupenda comunidad de jugadores... Lo que no entiendo es c√≥mo este juego pasa casi inadvertido con sus prestaciones y sus caracter√≠sticas. Recomendado 100% No es un juego f√°cil, la curva de aprendizaje es casi una l√≠nea vertical y te puedes abrumar por la cantidad de contenido que incorporan cada liga. text_translate: Wow, what a wonderful little idea for a game. It's like a little window into people's heads where you get to read what people struggle with on a daily basis. It's very interesting how some people talk about big serious issues, while others talk about tiny irrelevant problems and yet they still perceive them as big ones. I was curious about the gameplay concept of it but I certainly wasn't expecting to spend 2 hours sending out all sorts of positive vibes and messages to all sorts of genuine people. This wholesome game is the very definition of the "feels good man" meme. Well done to whoever made it, it's almost Nobel Prize worthy.

text: Big improvements from launch. Better now BUT i am not saying its perfect. Not everyone will like it in other words.
text_translate: I've noticed that a lot of people write pay2win here, but that's not true at all. Cards that can be bought for real money (as well as ingame currency) will give you a maximum bonus to money and exp (tiny) and just the look. They don't add much improvement either, awp gives one shot to the body even though it is +0, so nothing much, those who criticize the game would have to know at least its basics and not play for a few hours and then write a review. The game is definitely free2play and it's just about skill and your movement, logical thinking (estimating the opponent) and aim, without it you won't even cross it (at least in clan matches, now I'm not talking about dm, etc ...) and more I would add that even though it is practically a copy of the ball, at least it is not as destroyed as a game for 14 ‚Ç¨, where you do not hit your head over a long s and even if you squat. So I definitely recommend the game. And before you rate it, play at least 300-400 hours, otherwise your review doesn't even make sense (I don't have a steady 400 hours, because I still play it through their launcher, otherwise I've recorded around 600-700). I hope I helped you :)

text: great!
text_translate: Chivalry Medieval Warfare is a pure multiplayer game, there is no single player or story. At the beginning of a battle you choose between 4 different classes. There are those who are equipped with a bow or crossbow. He has big and heavy weapons that cause a lot of damage such as a two-blade ax. Then there is the one who has light weapons. Finally there is the lance bearer. He has long swords but also lances. In addition, all classes have their own "skills". The fighting takes place in different modes that are mostly known. ,,, Teamobjects, and the. In Deathmatch everyone fights against everyone as usual. In Team Deathmatch you choose one of the 2 factions, Mason or Agatha. This is generally the case in every mode except in Horde, Duel and Deathmatch. Then teams fight against each other. In Capture the Flag you have to bring the opposing flag to your own. Teamobjects are the team missions in which the team has to fulfill different tasks in order to win. One team should fulfill the tasks, the other should prevent it. In duel mode, 2 players duel against each other. The Horde Mode is not a real game mode, because players fight against AI opponents that are getting better and better. ! Chivalry takes a lot of getting used to! The maps are lovingly detailed and the surroundings are pretty. Nice effects are also available give the game a great atmosphere, the medieval music also contributes to this. The guns sound good too. The combat system is on a good level. There are innumerable techniques that can be learned over time, this is nothing to research, just your own fighting technique. The battles are lively and dynamic. Many actions take place in the background of the game, such as the impact of stones on a castle. The operation is simple and easy. At the beginning you can start a training that explains the basics. There are a large number of maps that are due to the updates. Thanks to the Steam Workshop you can create your own maps and play your own maps and those of others, but also create skins and other stuff. At the beginning it takes getting used to, but after a few hours the game is just fun. I hope the review was helpful and if you have any questions write it down below.

Crash Force from Ascanio Entertainment combines genres such as a multiplayer arena shooter with role-playing and racing elements, where players take part in futuristic hovercraft and smash their opponents to rubble! In this game, your vehicle is quite a ‚Äúliving creature‚Äù. You have to groom and cherish him, pumping and taking care of his condition. To be precise - you do not ride these ships, you are - "it"! Each ship (or as they are called in the game - hovercraft, hovercraft) - is designed to be unique. The game has a very nice graphic design, interesting arenas and locations, and in general it is stylistically consistent with a solid 5!
Good game with a lot of potential. To do with the next updates and release in v1 of the game.

text: This game, for early access actually has quite a bit of "meat" in it, so to speak. I've played probably, almost 60 hours into it and I still am learning what characters do what and what works together. I've noticed patches being released in (what I feel) is a timely enough manner.  You get a few starter characters to test and learn the basic functions of the game. You can earn more characters as you play, invitations drop from different zones. You can also create weapons (with recipes) and chest armor. You advance your characters levels through practice points. As you put gear on your character, it can do various things to help boost you a little more. If you hover over the stats it gives a detailed description. Would I recommend this: Yes. As long as you don't mind grinding a bit, there is an auto-adventure mode. You can pick a lower mode you KNOW you can "farm" and set them up. I do not know if they use their abilities besides their main attack, but it's there. It helps a lot in getting practice points. I do not know if auto-adventure continues offline or only when playing the game. With it being an early access game, take any review with a grain of salt, though I have found this incredibly fun. I am looking forward to seeing the direction the developer wants to take the game. Will update if anything changes! -With more detail too, probably.

text: Apex Legends bietet riesige Maps, viele Spieler und ist ein Multiplayer Spiel das echte Team Player f√ºr ein erfolgreiches Abschlie√üen der Missionen ben√∂tigt. text_translate: Dragon rage is a game similar to the classic Rampage series. You‚Äôre a dragon and all you have to do is cause chaos. The game has very cure art-style and some nice music. The game however is way too short, and I am talking like 20 minutes to complete the game short. It is fun though but I think the developer could‚Äôve added a few more levels.  The graphics looks pretty awesome with a cartoony art-style. The screen looks sharp and crisp. The dragon and people are super cute as well.  In the sound department there isn‚Äôt much, the background track is okay, nothing too fancy. When you go in rage mode the track changes into metal-type music. The sound effects are pretty nice too. Basically you‚Äôre a dragon who is on rampage mode. You have to destroy a certain number of buildings and kill anyone who gets in the way, including knights, archers even the royal family itself. You can do certain types of moves including dashing, which will knock anyone in your way like a bowling ball. You can jump, stomp or breath fire down on the people. You also get many bonuses spawning and collecting them will give you food, points etc. You have a health/hunger meter, whenever the dragon breath fire on people or stomp them it takes this bar down and to fill it up again you have to eat people. Throughout the game you have to manage your eating and destroying at the same time. When your health bar gets full you go into rage mode. In this mode the background gets all red and you can only see your dragon‚Äôs silhouette. You can dash infinitely in this mode and jump really high and breath fire faster too. Basically you can cause much more mayhem with this rage mode. Once in this mode the health bar starts depleting again and once the bar is empty you go back to the regular mode. There‚Äôs also an egg meter which when it fills up the dragon will lay an egg. You must protect the egg for a certain time and dragon babies will hatch from the eggs. These little monsters will aid you in destroying everything that exists. When you start off no one is attacking you. Once you start causing chaos the king will send knights to kill you and if they can‚Äôt stop you, archers will arrive. Later the king sends catapults, magicians, horse riding knights and many other types of warriors try to stop you. They even build walls so the dragon cannot move freely. the princess and queen come at a certain point in the game. They give defense bonuses to their armies. Once you destroy the king and 100 buildings, the game is over and you have won. A short gameplay clip can be found below: The game itself if pretty fun. Think of it as a stress reliever. If you‚Äôre angry with some work stuff or real life, you can sit down and take your frustration down on the poor people of the kingdom. $7 is kind of steep though for this short of a game so you can always wait for a bigger sale.

text: I bought this because my pee pee was harder the jack jack's metal dong
text_translate: Alright here goes So I was actually "kinda forced" by a junior brother from my team. So I bought it during the summer sale. I've been playing NFS games since my childhood, starting with NFS 2. Then I played pretty much all of the games in the series. Yes some versions did slip through the cracks but after NFS Rivals, I was solely disappointed on the whole series as it took a completely different turn. I mean, come on guys you just can't argue that Need For Speed Most Wanted 2005 was the best NFS if not the best story driven racing game. And at the same time, if you're a OG NFS fan you still love the soundtracks from NFS underground 2. So about heat, they kinda brought back some vibes from NFS MW and UG. Although it's not comparable to what it was like back in MW or UG. About the game, finally I can say EA did break the ground this time, even though the impact wasn't THAT GREAT, but it's a good comeback (if they can hold it.. that is). In this game, you'll get the vibes of a good story, you'll get the vibes of your old days of NFS MW (if you played NFS MW) when you had a big hate for Razor (blacklist no 1) and Sgt. Cross (the antagonist police). Also you'll get some epic driving mechanics and a good amount of cars to choose from. About the story, it's kinda short but then again this is NFS guys, driving matters more than the story (right?) ! It's story makes a lot of sense when it is compared with NFS Carbon, where you can explore a lot but your story is extremely short. But for Heat, the story is one of the best in the series if not THE best. Downsides of the game, it makes you grind a lot but grinding is fairly easy but you may get bored if you keep racing again and again. You can surely can add some spice on the board by shifting to the night (they got a very cool transition when you shift it to night btw) and fight against the cops. And I must admit, the cops are the elephant of the room when it comes to Heat. Just in case, if you guys played dying light (a survival zombie game) you know in the night time, the volatile zombies come out whom are VERY DANGEROUS TO DEAL WITH IF YOU ARE HAVING A LOW LEVEL. But in that game, during night times you get the best loots and XP. Just like that, in NFS heat during the night time, your rewards will be high (but you'll get XP mainly to level up). But if you're really dedicated, try the high heat races in the night and they will drop you some cool upgrades for your ride. End of the day, The cops are literally zombies in this game. During day time, speed pass the cops, do a drift, break objects and the cops will not care. BUT TOUCH THEIR CAR AND THEY WILL START TO PURSUE YOU (reminds me of old GTA days). More or less, in the day time cops love to enjoy their donuts. But in the night, be a good guy, park your car in a parking lot turning the engine off :D but if the cops spot you, they'll start chasing you (lol :3). FInally, multiplayer. Yeah multiplayer is great and it's a game you'll really enjoy playing if you have friends. The interfaces are really cool and I find them user friendly too. So yeah for me it's bang for the buck Overall ratings Gameplay : 9/10. It's great but I really wanna see more improvements here Story : 10/10. I don't know if a NFS story can be any better than this Enviroment : 9/10. I see room for improvement and I wanna see it in the next game Experiences : 8/10. This game kinda feels repetitive to be honest. Can be upgraded in the future.. I hope Recommended? YES GO FOR IT. Thank me later.

text: Really Really great game. Sure there might be a few bugs or your game crashes but that doesn't happen often. One of the only games that has a first person shooter while robbing banks and doing heist. One of my favorite things about PAYDAY 2 is that you can do a mission stealth or loud. What loud is that you just start robbing shooting people pretty much what you would imagine from a bank robbery in real life. What stealth is that you can be really sneaky and not alert any of the alarms and silently take out all of the guards. You can also get gun skins like most games do. In order to get a gun skin you have to do heists fully done after it shows you collecting the money you will be taken to a card screen. This screen means that you have to select a card and you can get random things like Masks,Guns,Safes and more. In order to get a gun skin though you have to get a safe. The chances of getting a safe is really slim in my opionion i do wish they up the chance of getting one. There are all different tier safes the highest tier will obviously give you better skins that can be worth more in the community market. . They were originally going to stop supporting it sometime in 2017 but decided to support it for longer.  :( Good Job to the developers

text: In Pumpkin Jack you play as the villian, your job is to take over the world. There are skins in the game that are unlocked by finding crow skulls and spending them in the store.  Pros: - Graphics, this game looks and runs amazing (constant 120fps@1440p ultra settings and DLSS with a 2080S and R7 3700X)  - Gameplay, every level has new enemies and different ways of going through a level - Music, the music is pretty good - Controls Cons: - The game is bit short (3-5 hours if you go through it without finding all the secrets, I think 10+ hours if you wanna find all secrets and 100% this game) I recommend this game but I would wait for a sale, 30 euros is a bit expensive for so little gameplay. 25 euros is the max I would pay for this, 20 euros is definitely a buy.

text_translate: I do not think you need to introduce anyone to the most iconic and most famous version of Grand Theft Auto, i.e. San Andreas, of course. In which we play the role of Carl Johnson "CJ" who theoretically only returned to the funeral of his murdered mother, however, when he notices that both his family and his gang, Grove Street Families, are in turmoil, he decides to stay. The events in the game take place in 1992. Many of the missions the player takes part in reflect various events from the beginning of the 1990s in California. Of course, let's not forget that on his return home from the airport, our hero meets three corrupt police officers: Tenpenny, Pulaski and Hernandez, called the "C.R.A.S.H." who set him up for the murder of a policeman so he can't leave the state. After these events, CJ will carry out assignments for his gang, friends and even for C.R.A.S.H.
To become the Rocket League myth is simple: merge Pel√© with Senninha. A game where a car rides a bike and heads a ball is something I've always wanted, and now I can enjoy it, huehuehue

text_translate: 9.4 / 10! SPOILERS! Having gone through the entire storyline, some side quests of millers, finding other ways of passing the same quests, and drawing analogies with The Witcher 3 (I will not do this here): I am ready to say with confidence that this is the 2nd game in my a life that captivated me and showed me how games can be art. In order 1. Plot Although it does not seem very original, and with rather predictable outcomes, in the final scenes I cried like a teenage girl. Live characters, prophetic lines of heroes, a real story served so romantically that you don't want to return to 2D19. Without clich√©d characters who are like Gods, they can summon Lucifer and wipe out Ivan the Terrible with one swing of the sword. No drama-selected plots. This is what KCD takes: simplicity, interesting gameplay, real medieval gameplay. 2. Gameplay This is something new in terms of combat: you have to use the DIRECTION of the strike using MOUSE POSITION. Where else have you seen this? I agree that chains of strikes, changes in the place of hitting in a strike - I did not really use it, and it does not really help much. But when you suddenly pops up "Punch in the face" (for example) - it causes children's delight. How they decided to do herbalism and the use of alchemy is a separate topic. In order not to spoil (although I warned you), I'll just say that this is another innovation in the gaming industry. I expressed everything that I was surprised at, but I want to assure you - everything else, oblique gameplay, is performed at a higher level. 3. Graphics, optimization and performance At the start of sales - Kingdom Come was cheese like potatoes in a cellar. Bugs; optimization that did not exist in principle; broken graphics - in short, everything repelled the players. But then came the Orthodox 2X19 (namely, 11/22/19) and you can already live. I play on an average laptop (i5-7300H, GTX 1050 4gb, 8gb RAM), but at the same time I was calmly playing at ~ 35 FPS, at medium-high settings, with vertical sync. The graphics, although in places grainy, and not particularly capable of drawing, are mesmerizing. Immediately I say - I am a lover of soap, and for those like me, Eden is here. Artifacts were removed altogether, but bugs with voices were often heard, and the inability to save. But this does not prevent the game from being sufficiently presentable. Yes, I wrote that there are spoilers, but I tried not to spoil only the splendor of Kingdom Come: Deliverance here. Summing up, we can put this game ~ 9.4 / 10 (I am a humanist). And to you, dear few readers, I can only wish you acquisitions and the best moments in this game. Good luck

text_translate: Stories Untold developer! In Observation you have control over the AI of a space station. Sounds boring? Not at all! You control the game via cameras and drones, which allows you to explore the station and interact with objects like notes or computer systems. The game also throws you right into the middle of the story. After an unknown incident, you will meet Emma, who may (?) be the only survivor. The space station is heavily damaged, the status of the crew is unknown. Help her to repair systems, prevent catastrophes and find out what happened. Graphics and sound are very good and harmonic, partly creepy. The puzzles range from easy to challenging and are very various.  The game does not take you by the hand, you must show initiative. There is a certain help but mostly you have to find out yourself how things works.

text_translate: Wuppe here just a Mafia 2 review online, which I typed shortly after the release in 2011 based on the PS3 version: ‚ÄúWelcome to Empire Bay!‚Äù - This is Vito Scaletta in his new American home at the beginning of the game greeted by a simple banner on a bridge. He has just emigrated from Sicily with his family to escape the poverty in their old homeland and to experience the American dream first hand. However, the expected prosperity is still a long time coming. That's why Vito and his new best buddy Joe Barbaro try to quench their financial thirst with smaller raids, preferably in the city's jewelry miles. It was foreseeable that this could not go well for long, and so Vito was caught by the law enforcement officers and given a difficult choice: either he went into the kittchen for a few years or he volunteered as a recruit for the US Army in the Second World War, in the time of which the action takes place. He chooses the military, puts the frontline service behind him, and comes back to Empire Bay after the war. There he finds out that the city has changed a lot during his several years of absence. But his buddy Joe, who has now made some contacts with the local mafia, helps him to gain a foothold and also to pay off his father's debts. He gets Vito small jobs, consisting of robberies or blackmail, in order to quickly earn the necessary change. Vito is increasingly enjoying quick money, hot sledges and no less hot ladies who are only too happy to be charmed with plenty of champagne in nightclubs or pubs. And so the eventful mafia career of Vito Scaletta begins ... This would lay the technical basis for the action-blast Mafia 2. Sounds like a typical gangster story - and in principle it is. However, the fun of the game does not suffer from the relatively predictable, but nevertheless well and excitingly told story. A large part of the fun is not only the almost open world, but also the fantastic presentation of the fictional city of Empire Bay. During the individual story chapters, the city is freely navigable and explorable. After the end credits, the expected "free-driving-around-and-messing-around" mode, which is also typical for games of this kind, is a long time coming, which is a shame. One would have liked to continue heating around the city and indulge in small side missions. Much more than chases with the police and collectibles can be found both during and after the main story, because side missions √† la ‚ÄúGTA‚Äù or ‚ÄúRed Dead Redemption‚Äù are not found. It's a shame, because this keeps the urge to keep heating in his chic limousine through the wonderfully designed streets of Empire Bay. At this point, Mafia 2 is giving away a lot of potential. Technically, however, there is almost nothing to complain about. The fictional Empire Bay is bursting with details on every street corner: neon signs on the house facades often shine their halogen light into the urban canyons. Occasionally passers-by slip on snow-covered sidewalks and can barely save themselves from a painful fall onto the asphalt on a snow-covered car. Faithful replicas of the 1950s, from which American blues and jazz classics can be heard, drive the streets. If bad weather obscures the view through the windshield, a detour to one of the car washes works wonders and the vehicle shines in the sun as if it were freshly delivered. One could enumerate dozens of such subtleties, because the level of detail is enormous and one is regularly amazed on his joyride through Empire Bay. However, the frame rate suffers from the attention to detail, which is hardly avoidable on consoles. The extremely positive overall impression is constantly clouded by unsightly stuttering and tearing. This is still very annoying, especially at the beginning of the game, but over time you get so sucked into the 50s feeling and the tough Mafia world that the few technical inadequacies increasingly fade into the background. And for all lovers of classical music, as already mentioned, there is also something for the ears: Mafia 2 has over 100 songs from the 40s and 50s. Coupled with the realistic gun sounds, the melodic roar of multi-cylinder engines and the wonderfully authentic ambient noises, such as rain pounding on the car roof or screeching tires, every gamer experiences a playable sound experience of the extra class. Conclusion: Mafia 2 perfectly captures the flair of an American city in the middle of the 20th century. The nearly 10-hour story is told in an interesting way, even if it is very predictable in places. Technically, the game is convincing across the board, apart from jerks and small things such as tearing or muddy textures in places. Unfortunately, you have to do without an open world that can be freely explored even after the game has ended, with any side missions. However, if you are into mafia action in a wonderfully designed American fictional metropolis, you will have a lot of fun with this game, which is now available for a relatively small thaler.

text: (F2P Battle Match-3/RPG/Card Collector) If   and   -- both highly-addictive -- had a love child, I imagine that this game would be the outcome.   There are separate tabs for Options, and include separate sliders for Music and SFX, Speed (default 1.5x -- I keep mine at 4x), Hints and more.  Under the Graphics tab you'll find a place where you can turn off the holiday themes (such as clown skulls for international clown day or pumpkin skulls for Halloween).  If your game looks wonky and is flickering, etc., make sure that there's nothing sitting on your controller. ;) : Let's face it,   is not about the story.  Each kingdom that you explore has a storyline, and these range from amusing to exasperating (looking at you Princess Elspeth!) -- some are even interesting -- but the stories never were meant to be the driving focus of the experience.  It's all about the... ! The basics of the are simple:  Match gems to gather mana in order to cast spells, and match skulls to do a direct attack on your enemies.     You take a turn, your opponent takes a turn.  Nowhere in the game will you be required to have quick reflexes.   The game starts off with a very good   that will teach you what you need to know in the beginning.  At this point it's very linear, but after you finish the story in the first kingdom, you'll have a bit more freedom.  At this point you can choose which kingdom to unlock next, or you can do one of the following in your completed kingdom(s): : You MUST be connected to the internet to play this game.  There are multiple reasons for this, the primary of which is the fact that there are  and . :   A new troop-of-the-week is released every Monday.  This troop can be obtained via chests or from the shop in the   tab (purchase with glory). The   a  releases.  Let me explain:  is indicated by the color of the border on each card in the following order:  White, Green, Blue, Purple, Orange, Turquoise, with white being common and Turquoise being a mythic quality (and the hardest to get from chests).  Don't worry, there are stars at the top of the cards that show you how rare they are.  The more stars that are colored in, the rarer the card. Every 5 weeks we get a new  to play in, which you'll find in... : As you get close to completing all of the kingdoms in Krystara (our main map), you'll be able to unlock the underworld.  There you will find  , each having its own mini-story.  Once you complete the storyline, you'll be able to do a   at the site. : Delving is a different kind of gameplay than what you've experienced thus far.  You'll still be fighting battles, but this time in a series of 9 rooms -- each with its own rewards -- culminating in a chest of rewards when you either lose your whole team or complete the delve by finishing the boss room. !  It cannot be changed, and if you lose a troop, it's gone for the rest of the delve.  This is a love-it or hate-it type of gameplay, and while it make me really anxious at first, once I obtained some reliably-good troops, I really started to enjoy them! !  If you don't want to talk to anyone and don't want to have requirements, there are guilds out there for you, and you can still get some of the basic rewards, just join one that is the highest level possible so that you can have better stat boosts. If you really like this game and want to play it daily,  .   :  is easy -- Just play the game!  An active guild will require you to collect your seals every day or two 'til you hit your minimum-required for the guild or the game limit of 2000.  The reason for this is the number under Guild Weekly Seals.  When you hit 40,000/40,000, your  , which will get you the highest possible quality out of those seals.  You'll get some of the best troops in the game from those chests, which is why an active guild is recommended! : Use guild seals in the Chests area : Do you have to do PvP?  Nope, but it's a great way to see some interesting troop combinations, and trust me, it's not as painful as you think ;)  The AI handles the other team. Wait... All of this is free-to-play?  Why yes it is!  You can play this game every day of your life and never pay a penny.  There are of course things that you can buy that will help you along the way and/or make your progression faster, but I don't feel like these things give an unfair advantage.  Everything available for purchase is something that you can earn yourself eventually. : This is a highly-addictive battle match-3 game with card collecting (troops) and some RPG aspects (upgrading your classes, kingdoms, troops, etc).  Beware, oh ye of OCD, for your playing of other games ends here!  Gems of War has a surprising depth to it that keeps me coming back day after day, a great community, and above all else, FUN! Full review located

text: Sar√≤ sincero e diretto dicendovi un bellissimo  Sempre basandomi alla mia risposta, magari vi consiglio d'aspettare gli sconti visto che 60 euro sono veramente molti.  Io ho avuto modo di acquistarlo sui 34 euro, se doveste trovare sconti e se il nuovo Re2 vi √® piaciuto, molto Probabilmente vi piacer√† anche questo. Premetto che al momento di questa recensione non ho mai finito Resident Evil 3: Nemesis (quello vecchio) Vi invito quindi a considerarla questa cosa. Questo videogioco rispetto al suo predecessore rimane con il piede su due staffe fra action e survival horror, vi assicuro che ci rimane in maniera egregia. Dallo schivare al momento giusto l'attacco di un nemico, animation dei personaggi ben realizzate, personaggi realizzati in maniera impeccabile, ambientazioni fantastiche e Se non si risparmiano le munizioni, pu√≤ anche essere punitivo (almeno alla prima run); Tutto ci√≤ creano l'atmosfera perfetta per il seguito di Resident Evil 2 Remake. Ho completato il Videogioco gi√† 2 volte nelle seguenti difficolt√†: Normale e poi Estrema, Sinceramente m'aspettavo di pi√π da quest'ultima; Comunque recentemente ho iniziato anche con Incubo, gi√† sembra molto pi√π difficile. Una volta finito il Videogioco, almeno una volta, si sbloccheranno in modo gratuito i vestiti "Old" di Resident Evil 3: Nemesis per Jill Valentine e Carlos Oliveira; Molto ben fatto quello di Jill, Peccato per Carlos che avr√† solo capelli pettinati con un taglio differente e sar√† sbarbato, per il resto non cambia il suo indumento. Si avr√† anche l'accesso ad una sorta di Shop all'interno del menu principale, dove si potranno comprare vari item che ci potranno aiutare nella prossima run.  Fino ad arrivare a tamarrate come lanciarazzi infinito; I punti per comprare i suddetti item e... Item pi√π  , si faranno completando le sfide. In Resident Evil 2 Remake le sfide potevano dare oggetti come coltello infinito, qui invece punti per comprare cose tamarre, comunque ci sta eh... Ah dimenticavo, anche il Costume Per Jill della STARS (molto differente dall'originale ma rende l'idea, √® comunque molto bello) Molti si sono lamentati del fatto che il gioco √® troppo corto.  Beh secondo me non √® che √® troppo corto,  ma √® troppo lineare. Ovvero Il suo essere diretto e intuitivo, ma veramente tanto intuitivo, quasi quanto una mappa di Left 4 Dead. Da l'impressione che il videogioco sia corto, anzi devo dire che la mappa a detta mia √® anche molto grande; Ma ci sarebbero dovute essere pi√π punti come accade nella prima parte del gioco.  Se ci pensate bene all'inizio succedono un sacco di cose e ci sono effettivamente molte vie e punti alternativi da guardare (non voglio cadere in spoiler, se lo avete giocato o avete giocato la demo capirete). Ad un certo punto tutto quello tende quasi a svanire, non sparisce completamente, ma quasi; Tende ad essere Tutto pi√π diretto e questo √® un punto a sfavore. Un alta cosa che mi √® dispiaciuta, √® la quasi assenza di enigmi e questo √® un altro punto a sfavore che dar√† l'illusione che la mappa sia piccola. Il Remake di Re2 non ha avuto tanti enigmi a detta mia, ma rispetto a questo ne ha molti di pi√π e anche abbastanza difficili; Qui sono tutti piuttosto semplici e si possono contare su una mano...Una mano quasi senza dita. Molti si sono lamentati dei posti riciclati, Beh non ci vedo nulla di male nel riutilizzare posti per dare una sorta di spiegazione, anche sul perch√© di alcune cose del due, mi sarebbe anzi piaciuto vedere di pi√π della stazione di polizia; Qualche avanti indietro di troppo per allungare di pi√π il brodo non sarebbe stato male. Sempre molti altri si sono lamentati dell'assenza di alcuni punti e conformazione della mappa; Ma soprattutto di quella benedetta torre dell'orologio, Allora √® vero che (spoiler)  Un altra cosa che non ho gradito, √® come Carlos sia arrivato da jill, non spiegher√≤ tutto in dettaglio per non scendere a spoiler.  Vorrei ricordare che l√¨ Jill ci √® arrivata con un treno...Avrebbero potuto allungare la storia un altra ora bella se avessero dato una spiegazione su quello facendoci vestire i suoi panni fino all'arrivo da Jill. Non ci sar√† la storia di un altro personaggio come √® accaduto in re2 remake, Dove si poteva giocare con Leon o Claire. Ma comunque la storia √® abbastanza bella da essere rigiocata pi√π volte con differenti difficolt√†. Non ci saranno altre altre modalit√† nel gioco oltre alla storia, esatto avete capito bene, √® stano vedere un Resident evil senza altro oltre alla storia, ma purtroppo √® cos√¨. Ma c'√® da dire una cosa, con l'acquisto di questo gioco si ricever√† anche un altro Resident Evil. Ovvero Resident Evil Resistence: Possiamo definirla la modalit√† extra di RE3.  Ma su steam √® come un altro videogioco separato da RE3 (Ma comprendo la scelta visto che sembrano aggiornarlo anche abbastanza e ha il suo peso in GB) Ah √® Multiplayer 1 vs 4. √® ancora un bel po da bilanciare secondo me, ma bellino da giocare.
text_translate: Unfortunately, I was unable to start the game on my PC. After countless attempts and solutions from threads, I finally installed it on my notebook, on which it surprisingly worked. Both systems have Win 10 64 bit (Creators Update), an Intel Core i5 and a graphics card from Nvidia. It is therefore not clear to me why the game is running on one computer but not on the other. That being said, Arkham Asylum is still one of the best games in the series. I had just under 20 hours of fun and would recommend it to anyone (who gets it to work).

I highly recommend this game.

text: Got 2k hours into this game on GOG. I have been playing since the closed beta, it has been such a blast. And I will be playing it forward on. The game is very generous and fun to play.  From the six factions anyone can find a fun way to play. It is the best looking, sounding and fun tactician CCG out there. Play with the faction Northern Realms where characters like Vernon Roche, Keira Metz, Bloody Baron or even the singing troll Trolololo from W3 appear. Or choose Nilfgaard with characters like Leo Bonhart, Vilgefortz, Cahir or Tibor Eggebracht and utilizing tactics like bribery, spying or even slavery. There is a world of mechanics and lore to be explored. So if you are a fan of the Witchers franchise I highly advise you to start slinging those cards!

text_translate: Ladies and gentlemen, this game is a legend. The first video game I played, more than 10 years have passed and I continue to enjoy it like then. If you try it you will not regret it. It is the best strategy video game I know based on the Second World War. GOOD THINGS: - Very comfortable and easy to handle gameplay. - Wide variety of units, weapons and skill points. - A very detailed video game, in all aspects. - You can play with both sides in the confrontation mode. - Different game modes and very interesting tactical combat systems. - One of the few games that let you enjoy both sides. - Realistic tension in single player combat, has an engaging story. - It has expansions that improve it in an incredible way, adding new very interesting units among other things, it even has a multiplayer mode still active and new sides. CONS: - Maybe that an axis campaign is missing and that they add the Soviets with campaign as well. More than a complaint it is a suggestion. I totally recommend this game, I repurchased it for Steam because I had it on a fairly old CD and I've even nominated it for the Steam awards. I hope you have been useful. Greetings community!

A different take on the classic Bioshock universe. Instead of a underwater utopia in the first Bioshock game, it's set in the air. A floating Utopia set in 1912. The game introduces new gameplay such as the traveling and fighing on a skyline rail system.  Overall gameply is similar to the first games. The story is good, but didn't top Bioshock 1.  Pro + New take on the Bioshock universe  +Good Story Con - Nothing special compared to Bioshock 1

text: Doot doot.
text_translate: Our game is a very well-reflected production designed on the vampire fiction in the Spanish flu times. It really plays itself. I really like it. They really gave the emotions! This is a big plus, at the same time, the dialogues with the characters, the information you learn about them and the fact that you learn the stories of these npc's is very nice and I can say that it makes you play like a movie. Personally, the graphics are fine ... Of course I expected 1 click better, but they still provided the atmosphere very well. The only information I can give you: If you are someone who cares about details like me, you will definitely like the game, but you will also be crazy! The reason for this is the situation where the game gets the biggest minus, ie it uses the instant save system ... It really creates extremely annoying situations! Therefore, even if I say prepare yourself for this, it will not be useful, but at least you can start knowing this and try to play more cautiously. Let's list the good and bad aspects of the game that have been derived from my observations; POSITIVE DIAGNOSIS + I loved the script of the game! It progresses and plays really well. I can say that I especially absorbed the main character easily and I enjoyed moving forward. + Graphics and effects are well adapted. They could give the atmosphere. + The fact that we can choose dialogue is definitely a plus, but as we can see in TheWalkingDead, it is a pity that it does not exactly affect the game progress. NEGATIVE DIAGNOSTICS - As I said at the beginning, the most disruptive situation in the game is that it uses the instant save system! You can really get confused ... Because a mistake you will make, if you did not make backups or if you could not exit the game without recording, unfortunately you cannot return to the found task. So you have to start the game over! NOTE: This is not a big deal for NPC indians. NPC hits only increase the XP level of that NPC and let you see its story. You can resist because you missed a part of his story, it's a separate topic. - FPS drop problem is among the factors that affect the game flow badly, but even if you get fps drops, I do not think it will have a bad effect as the instant save system. I did not research it, but in my opinion, the development of the game was stopped, as far as I understand ... Because I cannot give another explanation for the fact that they do not solve these problems. - Target can get very confused in Combat system! You may not be a problem if you get used to it a little bit, but it can be annoying at first. In addition to these troubles that I have seen and told you, it is not a game! Curiously, what will happen in the rest of the story? What is this? What is that? It moves itself in shape. Because I do not want to denigrate the game in your mind. Because I really liked the game, but I cannot praise it as if it lacks! I highly recommend the game, but I recommend you to buy and play by accepting your problems. I bought the game at a price of 60TL while it was on sale with its DLC. Is it worth it, dude? It works fine! But however that Turkey's booming economy and our country that the players should be 45-50TL vicinity of our audience has considerably changed for the price it is fantastic, I think. Now, some of you will say that there are larger-scale games with cheaper or similar prices ... Yes, but those games you mentioned are AAA games. So high budget productions! This game was made with a low budget and it was very good for us. If Vampyr came as a AAA game then it would be incredible amount and praise. Anyway! If my review was helpful to you, please throw William Marshal! Thank you and good Elisabeth's ... Stay with Dr. Reid.

text: ! Disclaimer ! I'm not a huge fan or veteran of a "Hidden Object Game" so my review on it might bias since i didn't play much games of the said genre, the only things i remeber is playing some Artifex Mundi games when i was a teenager, so i pretty much know what to expect & do in these kind of games. "Darkarta: A Broken Heart's Quest" is an award-winning adventure game made by Tuttifrutti Interactive.  I can say for sure that if you like adventures, finding hidden objects, solving puzzles & riddles, things that making your brain work, and you wanna to enjoy a nice story with a happy ending - then you definitely don't want to miss this game.  The Plot of the game is simple on the surface, but complex in the end. An adventure of the loving mother who goes on a quest to save her daughter, filled with mystery, drama, puzzles and a whole cast of unique and memorable characters This game impressed me for real and got me into it's story. It's ADDICTIVE since each puzzle is original, challenging, and none of them frustrating, cause after minute or two you'll be solving em like pancakes! (And it adds a nice flavour when you're feeling yourself smart) Oh and if you're having any trouble with them there are hints available OR alternative puzzle to complete in order to progress (It's always nice to have options). I liked playing this title to my heart's content. And definetely looking forward to a sequel or any other game from these developers.

text: ~~Outlast~~  Created by Red Barrels, in 2013, 'Outlast' is a survival-horror game which, back then, set the standards of horror games. The game is, absolutely, a true horrific experience that will keep you pumped through it's whole story.  Personally, I am a wuss when it comes to scary games but I had some friends who helped played it.  ~Main Story~  You take the role of Miles Upshur, a freelance investigative journalist, who is investigating an Asylum. What he discovers is yours to find out, but you first have to face this psychic house of terrors. You must collect documents, record events, and, the most important of them all, get f*cking scared. Don't get discouraged by how useless you are though, for the story is well writen and will sometimes make you laugh and some other times it is a true horror game. ~Whistleblower DLC~  The DLC takes place, before, after, and in the middle of the story. You are not Miles anymore, as you are Waylon Park, who works at an operation call Murkoff Corporation. He discovers that he made a mistake, which was sending, the main protagonist, Miles the email that got him to explore this Asylum.  ~Overall Impression~  Constantly meeting new enemies and constantly getting jumpscared or having to run away is always awesome. Red Barrels knows what she is doing and, apparently, she did it with 'Outlast II' too which I still have to play. What more is coming in 2021 is 'Outlast Trials', a single-player and CO-OP experience that I am totally waiting for.  Note that I played it with friends and some of them have already played so I was ,sometimes, warned of what was going to happen. That didn't stop me from getting scared so, you know, that thing means a game is good Disclaimer: I got the game for free from Humble Bundle and the DLC was in the key too Thank you for considering my review!

text: This game probably doesn't need another positive review, but I've been having fun with, so I'll add one.  It is essentially a survival crafting game where you try to outsmart the world (which is constantly trying to kill you) in order to live as long as possible and discover it's secrets.  The best aspect of this game is discovering secrets, so play without instruction and discover all these secrets for yourself.  It seems simplistic in the first few hours; then you realize there are lots of fun surprises that let you overcome seemingly impossible obstacles. You will probably die a lot in this process.  And when you die, you start over.  It can get frustrating.  But if you put it down for a while, you will want to come back to it.  The game would have benefited from 'undefined' achievements; e.g. achievements where you don't have instructions on how to achieve them.  This would provide a record of what you have discovered without giving you a grindy laundry list of things to do and wouldn't make you play for the wrong reasons.  The developers (and particularly the forum mod) have a strange attitude of not allowing discussion of development decisions on this topic and others, which is off-putting for those who like to discuss the games they play, but it does not directly impact the enjoyability the game itself. It's a lot of fun, has a great art style, and definitely worth playing.  I only hope it doesn't get too repetitive before I'm able to survive adventure mode.

Nice game, many Rambo action sections, difficult boss fights in which you sometimes have to come up with something and in between QTEs. This game waited for me for too long for my moment, I bought it together with the first part and it finished here for half a year: D. But as soon as I turned two, I bit into it and had to play and play, it was an amazing ride full of action, great story, wonderful graphics and fun, unfortunately the ride ended a little earlier than I would like (it's shorter than the first part), but let me tell you for the money it pays off :) and in addition the discounts are frequent and large, what more could you want? The combat system has also changed for the better, but simpler, annoying loading screens have disappeared and, unfortunately, dubbing with them, but with all newer games, we can't do anything about it. If you are considering buying the third part of the spell trilogy, I really recommend playing the two previous ones, but play them with the fact that you want to play them and not with the fact that it is just a necessity for a sweet icing on the cake (even if the icing is quite long : D). I can only recommend the game :). (you can also find some of my instructions from the game on the profile) + New combat system + Graphics + Low price + Eye-catching story - Shorter * 9/10
