text_translate: The evaluation key of the game comes from the game evaluation activity of ‚ô¨„ÉÜ„É≠„ÅÆÈùíÁ©∫‚ô´. This is a galgame from Taiwan. Because galgame played a lot before, I signed up when I saw evaluation activities. As a result, there has been relatively little time to fish recently, except that the Zijin line was passed through in bits and pieces. If there is any inaccuracy, I will add it after I have a chance to pass the whole line. Generally speaking, the game tells a normal and simple love story. The childhood sweetheart heroine and heroine did not go further after they grew up due to various reasons, but when the hero returned home during the summer vacation, with the help of the unreliable Yue Laojier Next, work hard to bring back the original red line. The story is very simple, not very thrilling, just like our daily life, plain and simple, but there will be some interesting ups and downs in it, allowing people to find a sense of substitution and experience the plot in a relaxed environment development of. 1. BGM praise, the background music of the piano is relaxed and lively, and it matches well with the plot. 2. Chinese dubbing. Although the accent sounds a little uncomfortable, it feels good to hear too much, but in some places, the speech speed is a little slower, obviously the plot is very urgent. 3. The quality of the vertical painting is very good. 4. It‚Äôs a little difficult to choose the degree of goodwill. If you don‚Äôt pay attention, you will deviate from the Zijin line. 1. The number of CGs is a bit small. It may be better to have more CGs in some key plots. 2. There seems to be typos in the subtitles in the simplified Chinese. Although it is harmless, obsessive-compulsive disorder is uncomfortable. 3. Because it is a piecemeal plot, the archives are stored frequently. There have been two cases of missing archives. If possible, I hope to open the cloud archive. All in all, this is a game that tells a casual love story. If you have time, you might as well find a place to relax and experience this game.

text: REMASTERED *WOOT*
text_translate: Quite an addicting game. I didn't even expect it to be so interesting and so addictive. The plot is not complicated, it is rather very primitive. The gameplay is good and interesting. In the game, you need to think well, and not poke at everything randomly. You need to calculate every step, because if you run out of money, you will not be able to buy food, and without food you will not have the strength to work and exercise. There is, of course, one old man who can feed you if there is no money at all, but he will feed only 5 times and that's it, then you can live as you want. You can also earn money on fights without rules. The game has a lot of references to various cult films. All in all, the game deserves a solid 8. I recommend it.

GrizzlyGames has set the bar very high by creating a strategy game. The game is seemingly simple, but once we delve into the mechanics of operation and the diversity of buildings and a whole lot of independence that affect the productivity of a given facility, we will be surprised. A very addictive game with eye-catching visuals. Great optimization and smooth operation. When you fire up this game, you feel that this is not another game that wants to release profitable kitsch to the market. It is an ambitious, well-implemented and well-thought-out project. GrizzlyGames is a small, promising team of talented developers. I look forward to their next run on "low poly". The game is definitely worth its affordable price. A strategy enthusiast will find himself in the game perfectly and will be absorbed by it for many hours. 5/5 ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ

text: Yes
text_translate: If Douglas Adams and Terry Pratchett had teamed up to make Skyrim for the Super Nintendo waaay back in the 1990s, the end result would have been... well, probably terrible, as neither of them were game developers.  Luckily they never tried, so the developers of Mad Nords were free to unleash their own silly version of this nifty mashup on the world. Mad Nords:  Probably an Epic Quest is a retro-styled RPG that features weird, quirky humor along with the open world and quest-branching system of an Elder Scrolls or Fallout game.  The player starts out as a level 1 cannibal/bureaucrat/(insert unusual class of choice) looking for a cucumber for his wife in the next town over. Of course, this simple fetch quest won't be as easy as it should be, and so begins the main questline. As you are continually redirected to new locations to continue with your main, cucumber-seeking quest, the overwhelming temptation to fall into the usual RPG standard of speaking to every person and breaking into every house will eventually get the better of you.  A few hours later, you'll realize that you've explored several towns and dungeons, completed a dozen sidequests, and geared yourself up with a stupendous bladed fork of +3 strength and 15% critical chance - but never really got any closer to finding that cucumber.  Which is just as it should be, as any player who has spent hundreds of hours on an Elder Scrolls game without actually beating the main quest can tell you. Mad Nords' retro graphics and strange sense of humor are pleasantly enjoyable, making this game a fun way to while away a Saturday morning.  The game offers an abundance of fairly amusing quests, plenty of magical loot, and quite a few useful skills to invest in as you level to offer some RPG-progression.  Each starting class also features a few unique skills, which adds variety and even replayability if you want to try a different character.  I do not know how much content the end product will have (this is an Early Access title), but I do know that I came nowhere close to finding my cucumber after several hours of playtime.    Mad Nords is an entertaining parody of open-world questing with a very reasonable pricetag.  I would definitely recommend trying out this quirky game if you get a chance.

text: AINDA N√ÉO INSTALEI
text_translate: This is the first time I've played through Dark Messiah, and for a game that came out in 2006, this game holds up incredibly well. The combat system is fluid and makes you feel like you're actually in control of the weapon in your hand. Plenty of times I found myself patting myself on the back for how badass I just looked in-game. The story is fun and interesting, albeit a bit cliche (which is honestly kind of expected with this type of genre.) It is a bit buggy, though. The game probably crashed 5 or 6 times throughout my playthrough, 2 of which were during the final boss battle. So make sure to save often. Overall, great game. I had a blast with this one, about 10 hours of playtime in one run. Definite replay value to try different builds, weapons, and skills.

text_translate: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare is a first-person shooter like any Call of Duty game but with a Cyberpunk theme. -- Jonathan Irons (Kevin Spacey) The game is set in 2054, with chaos and war slowly coming to an end. It's filled with advancements in technology such are warfare technology and even domestic technology. The game takes you around the world including locations such as the United States of America, Iraq, Nigeria and Greece. -- Mitchell The game features many gameplay mechanics and tools such as wall climbing, grapples, and Exo suits. There's 2 standard Exo suits, the Assault suit and Specialist suit; a 3rd version, used once is the A.S.T. suit, basically a mech/tank suit. There are other tools like mute mines that mute all sound near it. The various tools and mechanics used throughout the game are used at certain points and part of the missions. -- Jonathan irons -- Jonathan Irons Graphically, the game looks amazing at max settings and 1440p. It could be much better, yet it can be overlooked due to the game not intending to be a graphical masterpiece, it's about the gameplay. The best parts are the design rather than graphical quality. The technology looks awesome, with great designs of armor, vehicles and machines. Character models look good and the style of the Atlas corporation is slick, professional, organised and powerful. The audio of the game is pretty good. Music comes is well at key moments  yet I felt it tried to push the sad music during sad scenes a bit much. The lack of character development for some didn't help either. Where the audio really shines is the sound effects. Buullet impacts and explosions sound phenominal and make you seem tactical yet powerful. Subtly things such as walking in the A.S.T. suit is implimented well too.

version of  Very low requirements, could even say none. :D Supported on Windows, Mac and Linux. Numberlink-based puzzle game involving finding paths to connect colored tiles in a grid containing 50 different levels. It's easy to undo and restart in case you mess up.  8 ambient relaxing soundtracks. Thumbs up for those! Also, connect more dots to hear a nicer sound. ;) Game was pretty nice and relaxing. Also, a tiny brainteaser, haha. Features a lot of achievements with nice texts on them. Great for achievement showcasing! ;) Also, a great game for 100% achievements. You'll have all right as you finish the whole game.  Give it a try, it's free! ^-^

Counter-Strike Global Offensive contrary to popular belief is not actually an fps shooter... Because it is much more than that, Counter-Strike Global Offensive otherwise known as "CSGO" is a psychological thriller, It's actually quite enthralling that at a surface level this 2012 arcade fps shooter (based on the original Counter-Strike originally launched back in November 9th of 2000) seems quite innocent and simple almost as if it were comparable to its competitors (ex. Call of Duty, Rainbow Six Siege, Etc) but after more than 2800 hours i can confirm that it surely is not as simple as it may seem. There are so many numerous factors to compute and process each and every second you are playing this game from every corner, angle, box, wall, half wall, barrel, plant (yes plant), doorway, door, pillar, and even possible boosting spots there may be someone hiding away preying on innocent new or inexperienced players. And if that's not enough good luck or fortuna when trying to learn the game because you have to learn communication, aim, map awareness, crosshair placement, economy management, pistol aim, AWP flicks, grenade spots, smoke spots, pop flashes, positioning, bomb plant positions, retake ability, bunny hopping, spray control and most importantly how to get kills. This game is an incredible exercise for your brain because every second every neuron in your body will be firing on all cylinders as the excitement of jump peaks, rushes, and angle holders will surely fill your brain up every time you get into a game. If it wasn't obvious so far i am very passionate about this game something i cannot express for many others of its kind, it is truly amazing that every year since late 2015 i have put in as many hours into CSGO as i have any other game in my library combined. I highly recommend you check out the 20 year old franchises arguably best game yet.

text_translate: Red Barrels masterpiece, plated again for French studio created by Philippe Morin (Prince of Persia: Sands of Time, Assassin's Creed & Uncharted: Drake's Fortune), David Chateauneuf (Designer: Prince of Persia: Sands of Time, Assassin's Creed and Splinter Cell: Conviction) and Hugo Dallaire (Artistic Director: Splinter Cell and Army of Two). This game will give you goosebumps, you will feel persecuted, you will get scared, but the feeling of overwhelm is impressive, the atmosphere that is created with the music and the sounds will make you love or hate it. DO NOT READ THIS IF YOU HAVE NOT PLAYED THE GAME / DO NOT READ THIS IF YOU HAVE NOT PLAYED THE GAME WARNING SPOILER WARNING SPOILER WARNING SPOILER WARNING SPOILER WARNING SPOILER WARNING In this second installment (in my point of view, clearly influenced by horror masterpieces such as " The Shining "," The Prophecy "or" The Devil's Seed ") we will get into the skin of Blake Langermann, a journalist who works with his wife Lynn (Iker Jim√©nez and Carmen Porter), we are on the trail of a woman named Jane Doe, who appeared 8 months pregnant on a highway in the vast American desert, and ended up committing suicide in a hospital. With the theory of the murder and a good story for this couple of journalists, they fly by helicopter to the place, but shortly before reaching the town of Temple Gate, the engines fail and the helicopter crashes. Wounded we are going to look for Lynn and the pilot, but there is nothing but the helicopter on fire, from now on our mission is to find Lynn and get out of there. Our first encounter will be with the Sullivan Knoth sect "The testament of the new Ezekiel" or "The cult", they think that the arrival of the end of the world is near with the birth of a child, who will be the antichrist. We will have to flee from these fanatics until we reach a church where we will find a clearly affected and pregnant Lyn, how is that possible? If you have not been together for 3 hours .... While we try to flee through the deep forest from the hand of Lynn "the cult" hunts us, and when we believe that we are going to die a new sect appears on the scene "The heretics" (they are a more radical branch of the sect and worshipers of Satan, who believes that the antichrist will be born from the womb of our Lynn), they will kill our captors and leave us alive, but they take Lynn. After recovering and advancing, we discovered a part of the sect "The Cult" that are repudiated and live isolated and sick with Syphilis and Gonorrhea, in subhuman conditions, but they remain faithful to "The Cult" so they are faced with "The heretics". SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER In the middle of all this we will have visions in which we will appear in a Catholic school, either as adults, or as children, and the story of Jessica Gray crosses us , but why? Who?. That is our school, and those are our memories, there we met who is our wife today, but also, the remorse of conscience of what we hide at that moment of our childhood with the death of Jessica will haunt us. Father Loutermilch, a teacher, made us his collaborator and cover-up for Jessica's murder, coercing us to say that she hanged herself because she wanted to commit suicide. But memories haunt us, she was our friend. We must go on revealing that it did not happen as Father Loutermich led us to believe, but that she was repeatedly raped by that priest and he killed her in an outburst of her by breaking her neck and throwing her down the stairs. Loutermilch will chase us in the demonic form of him around the school while we find all the scores to see the alternate ending of the game. There are two endings with only a slight difference, in one the priest's plot is not discovered and Jessica appears asking us to pray with bruises and a broken neck, and the alternate ending where she appears without any injury and that we have discovered the whole truth. TAKE SPOILER TAKE SPOILER TAKE SPOILER TAKE SPOILER TAKE SPOILER TAKE SPOILER TAKE SPOILER Why the visions? How pregnant? What has to do with Outlast 1? Has the clamp gone? colacao or nesquik? The Murkoff Corporation, long before the events of Outlast 1, had conducted experiments in that town in the Arizona canyons with something even more experimental than at Mount Massive, which was acquired by the Murkoff Corporation years after passing through here. Due to these experiments we will have the visions by having contact with the characters, who have visions just like us, in their case with the arrival of the end of the world and the antichrist, and we will have to deal with that and also with the remorse of the past. ) Lynn's pregnancy is not an ordinary pregnancy, apparently it is a psychosomatic pregnancy, the result of being exposed to Murkoff's experiments, or that seems to indicate when Lynn says when giving birth "there is nothing there". Outlast 1 is also repeated in several documents psychosmatic pregnancy as a common symptom among women after treatment and in the shadow that is seen taking the baby there is no baby. (Pure assumption) I hope to have a DLC from Lynn's side or to clarify the story more. As a result of the birth, the sect decides that it has failed in its mission and they commit a collective suicide, which is what is seen at the end when we go out with the baby in our arms and we see all the dead inhabitants before having the last vision. For me it is a masterpiece of terror full of topics that are very well embedded and that give fear and anguish. Personally, I would like to have more lighting and clarity in the game to be able to see and enjoy the small details that are many and very good. Rated 10 out of 10

Fast forward to today and its on update 3 with tons more content and released on steam, Now i know you're probably thinking why buy this twice and steam this and epic that, But I wanted to show coffee stain some more support for making a fantastic game and yes i did want/hope for some steam features like a potential workshop support for modding (Please Coffee Stain make it happen) But apart from all that this game is definitely worth the current asking price. text_translate: Hello everyone, For my first evaluation I will tell you about dayz le standalone. to begin with let's talk about the type of game it's a Zombiesurvival / FPS * / TPS ** in clear you play a person who evolves in a world infested by zombies but these are not the greatest danger that lurks around you . And yes many others are waiting for the opportune moment to take your life. As you may have read this game is a Zombie survival game but the reality goes further than that. So as in all self-respecting survival, you will have to feed yourself, keep yourself warm, equip yourself to keep yourself safe and thus face the zombies in good conditions, but not only. Indeed, your greatest ally will turn out to be your greatest enemy. It all depends on the people who make up the server. Free will, the instinct for survival, the mental state and the desires of each person reign supreme. The other players will be for you a saving hand or the finger that presses the trigger. Now let's come to the positive and negative points. The most: + very beautiful graphics if you have the following bike. + the time that passes as in real life. + sunrise / sunset, night, rain and cold. + The cannibalism and the madness that comes with it! + The variety of weapons and items that can be used. Cons: - The hackers bah yes as in all FPS / TPS games. - The bugs are still very present but this is an Alpha *** version so we can claim that they will be fixed for the official release In conclusion Bohemia offers us a good title despite the development problems they had to face. The only fear I have is that Arma 3 being finished releases a zombie mod and steals the show from our dear DayZ which is based on Arma 2 technology. * FPS: First Personnal Shooter or game of first person shooter ** TPS: Third Person Shooter or objective or third person shooter *** Alpha Version: Game version still under development.

text_translate: -There are a total of 6 chapters, with a boss encounter for each. Early stages can be pretty easy, but it can get difficult later on, especially on higher difficulty. It can take you a few attempts during later boss encounters before you figure out their attack pattern and take them down! -The visuals are fantastic for a SHMUP ‚Äì everything is crisp and fluid. I really love the excellent art aesthetics and the look for the mechas. -Also, there are full Japanese voice overs for all of the characters (it's actually pretty good!) Subtitles are available, but you won't be reading much of it during intense fights! -3 attacks are available to you (4 if you count the EX special which has 3 variants) and each attack has a secondary function. Scatter shots can lock on enemies around you, focus shots lock on enemies in a targeted direction and blade attacks can be used to dash across the screen. Destroying enemy shots with the blade will charge the EX meter faster. -You‚Äôll become real familiar with your arsenal ‚Äì you won‚Äôt just spam one attack, especially if you‚Äôre a score chaser. You'll use blade attacks to rack up points, switch between shots depending on your position, cancel enemy projectiles with your blade, line up foes and dash across the screen with the blade dash to destroy enemies or avoid danger, and find the perfect moment to unleash your EX special to annihilate your foes. -You can take some punishment before you die. Your "health" is your shields which recharges over time to a certain degree. -The camera perspective will change during combat keeping each encounter fresh. It switches between side-scrolling, top-down, and 3D perspectives. -Astebreed definitely has replayability. Hard mode is extremely challenging. You also have the option to turn on scoring to test your skills and compete against other players‚Äô scores on the online leaderboards. -There are unlockables! Hard mode, art, model viewer, and the ability to start with a different mecha becomes available after beating the game.

text: dope
text_translate: Star Wars The Old Republic was announced in 2009 and released in 2011. It is a Free-To-Play MMO game about 4000 years before the Star Wars movies. The vast majority of the game is now Free-To-Play. Of course subscribers have a lot of privileges. Before playing the game, I recommend you to watch the trailers in particular. Because the trailers of the game are at a level that greatly increases expectations. However, our game is far from the trailers. Exactly ... Of course, thanks to Ubisoft, we are already used to it. I had the opportunity to play in 2012, especially between 2008-2014 was a rich MMORPG era for me. No matter how many MMORPGs there are in the market, I played the vast majority of them and gave incredible efforts to some. Of course, the monthly payment for LOTRO, WoW and Star Wars The Old Republic; It was available in Single Pay Guild Wars 2 and Tera, but over time some of them became free. The idea of ‚Äã‚ÄãMMORPG in the Star Wars universe was one of the most amazing ideas for me after the MMORPG idea in the Middle Earth universe. (Of course there is Game Of Thrones: D) While he could be the rival of WoW, he lost an incredible player in the following periods, and he could not save even though he released his crazy trailers. This situation has thrown Star Wars The Old Republic on Steam. I last played this game in 2015 and mostly in 2012-2013. Take that into account, but I don't think much has changed. First of all, this game will give you extra pleasure. It is a medicine for KOTOR fans. Our game is just like other Star Wars games released in the past (except for EA's Battlefront series and Fallen Order), which is not surprising since it was released to compete with WoW like many MMORPGs that were already released in this game on time.It is as if the game is Single Player rather than Multiplayer. You can be comfortable with this. And there are different stories for the different character you choose, which increases the playability of the game. If you have played in other MMORPGs you are not used to. (It's not kill 10 hungry alpha blue wolves etc.) And this is GORGEOUS. Every mission is also a dialogue. You earn Dark and Light points with your conversations and you have to talk to your companions by thinking to correct you. Depending on your response, your relationships can progress and regress. Definitely better than most of the MMORPG games on the market. Theme music for each planet, missions and orchestral soundtracks that intervene at crucial moments have brought the game to life. It is a great game for the period we are in. It is not a game that can be thrown aside because its graphics are old .. As I said, because its dialogues are rich, it requires a good knowledge of English. I wish Turkish could support it ... Of course, it is worth mentioning that Turkish players he may come if he shows enough interest in the game, but there is no guarantee of that. ADVICE: It will probably be filled with players who have unlocked lots of jedi and sith lord characters. I have opened a Bounty Hunter as I generally stay away from the characters chosen by the majority. Enjoy using the Jet Pack. There is a problem with subscribing on Steam, young people. Especially with the old subscription subscriptions on steam. Steam says "If you subscribed, no problem, contact EA". If EA is "Enter from Origin." At least, don't subscribe over Steam until 1-2 months have passed. It's not a problem for everyone, but those who have problems are not in the minority.

text: Even with its quirks, it's still the best tactical wargame money can buy.
text_translate: This "we save the world" game is a little difficult at first. Everything has an impact on our environment, and that's how it is meant to be. Overexploitation like in other sandbox games is deadly here. Everything is needed, nothing should be exterminated. And not only that, a meteor that constantly circles our pretty globe has to be stopped, otherwise it will destroy everything. This is only possible in a team, research and development is required here, but also farming and building. A game for many friends because everything is important. Every profession has its value to achieve the goal. Highly recommended and addicting game.

Great Little side scrolling RPG, Very Atlus inspired for sure. The story is actually quite good, with tight combat and plenty of content for multiple runs since it carries a new game plus mode. Worth a try if your looking for a fun little rpg.

text_translate: 4/5. One of the best otome game I've played so far. I highly recommend it!  ---  This review may contain  In Amnesia: Memories, you first open your eyes to a vast empty space which - you soon learn - is the gateway to many parallel realities. You then meet a spirit (Orion) who basically tells you that he's stuck inside your consciousness; his collision being the cause of your memory loss. The first major choice you make in the game is to pick which reality/world you came from: Heart, Spade, Clover or Diamond, i.e. according to the motifs associated with each of your love interests. There's also an unlockable world (Joker) you can only get after achieving good endings in the other realities.  (5/5) Unlike many other visual novels in which you gradually form a relationship with your chosen love interest, I find it refreshing that in Amnesia: Memories you're already in one at the very start. The five routes (worlds) have a similar theme of you having some sort of relationship issues (plus the memory loss), but the plot in each is very different - giving the game a   Some of the minor characters even have completely different personalities: most notably, Waka, the manager of caf√© you work at. Each route took me about 5-7 hours to complete and the game, around 30 hours. While there are some internal monologues at the end of each route, you are entirely silent unless making a choice. Because of this, I feel that it is   in the story. It's like you're holding a conversation (although one-sided) with Orion throughout the game. Don't worry though, he knows when to make himself scarce during the more romantic scenes. The story itself is lighthearted at the beginning, but around the halfway mark it becomes more suspenseful, tragic and even creepy in some storylines;   Other than that, I truly enjoyed the other routes with Kent's (Clover) and Ukyo's (Joker) being the stand out. At least Kent's route provides some reprieve from the craziness of   And Ukyo...I can probably write an essay on how I feel about his story but I'll just say it's worth experiencing for yourself. There are also a few things I feel that aren't as clearly explained   but overall it's   with only a few, minor typos. I also want to mention the various instances where characters tease you with obscure(?) hints (spoilers really) of what can happen to you in the other routes. I find these very amusing especially if you only realize it after playing a few times.  (3/5) The game   with dialogue branches and unlockable CGs. There are unfortunately   in the game. I would've much preferred to keep all my saves instead of having to overwrite each time I start on a new route. If there is a way to watch the complete ending scenes again, I wouldn't mind as much. But since there's not, I think the game could do with unlimited save slots. The game provides you with a   (shown on the 3rd screenshot) to check the status of your relationship and maybe which ending you get in the end(?), but I think it   The 'Suspicion' meter, in particular, maxes out at some point in the story no matter what you do anyway. The 2 mini games available are simple, short and somewhat enjoyable. What I do appreciate about the Rock-Paper-Scissors mini game is the Hit 'N' Guard mechanic that ensures it relies less on luck and more on your reflexes. It does make the mini game way easier however. There are also a few extra content unlocked after finishing the game including short stories told from the perspective of the love interests that I find interesting. I recommend reading at least Ukyo's.  (3/5) I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the keyboard (and gamepad?)   Although I don't think I would ever need to re-bind anything for this particular game, I do appreciate the devs putting that feature in regardless.   but other than that, I have nothing bad to say about the options menu.  (5/5) Practically   and every voiced dialogue is accompanied by effective use of expressions and eye blinking. The   with little tints of color suit the game in my opinion and   in its simplicity. A close-up of the curtains at the Shinano mountain lodge in a few conversations, however, looked very messy and amateurish but that's just me nitpicking.  (4/5) The   by accomplished voice actors. There are no English voices but the high quality of the Japanese voices more than makes up for it. The  ; it's a bit distracting when their mouths move even when they're not actually saying anything. Tracks used for the background music are generally soft and tranquil but slightly repetitive. I can listen to the opening song all day though and to a lesser extent, the ending song as well. A must try for   of the genre. I can't say if it's worth it for $30 since I bought it on sale. But for $3, I would definitely recommend buying it.

text_translate: This game is awesome. It's like Harvest Moon with basically everything improved, made more user-friendly, more fun, and with tons of expanded options. Normally I'd write a long, detailed, review but I'm busy playing. Back to my game now. It's one of fewer than 5 games I've bought in the last decade on the day of release and paid full price for...and it was worth every dollar. Stop reading and buy it now. STOP READING. BUY IT. BUY IT NOW....ok, good. I'm glad you bought it. :) Update: Still playing it! Still love it!! :) Many hours in, many more to go! :o

Mafia 3 is not a mafia. The name of the game could be different, as well as the rating of this very game! 1) Cars. When I saw the chase for the first time, I don't remember at which exhibition, I was wildly upset. And when you are already playing, you have a sense of the new, but about the physics of these very machines, so to speak ... (+) 2) Shooting. Shooting is sometimes boring, but it is "sometimes" rare. (+) 3) Music. Oh, this music ... Unlike Fallout 4, it didn't get bored already before the release of the game. (+) 4) Racism. He is well described in this game. Everyone hates you, even the nigga from the restaurant, whose prototype was taken from the Tarantino film "Django Unchained" (+) 5) Plot. It is excellently done, special praise for the screensavers. But why make "towers" for chapters. plot? ah? (+) 6) Characters. All characters have charisma, but ... but not Lincoln Clay. (+) 7) Routine. Missions, character models, textures. Everything is the same! This is not a game, but a job. (-) 8) Graphics. The graphics are bad, but is it better? I'm talking about pixels, but not about lighting, sun glare. (-) 9) Police. They have no memory, do not remember numbers, clothes and especially HOW THE CHARACTER LOOKS. (-) 10) Bugs. When it was the fifth hour of the game, I was very surprised. "Where are the bugs?" I thought. But already at the twentieth hour of the game I had a wild anger, so many bugs, even after half a year! (-) You let the family down, C grade, let down ... You CAN'T buy at full price! The game is ambiguous, I hate it, but whoever thinks about buying "Mafia 3", I will strongly advise. If you cut out all the stupid routine from the game, carefully stitch all the plot episodes and expand them a little with staged events, you get an excellent shooter in the spirit of The Order: 1886. 6/10

text: The good sides: -Space battles are great if you want to have good gameplay, and if you hate them you have 2 options: Either skip the battles or do not focus on war and militairy whatsoever. -Great variety between factions you can choose that match your play style. -Sci-fi setting is good and not over the top. -Playing as a diplomat,militairy,explorer and an sciencetist is all very cool and refreshing. -Graphics and audio are stunning. -Optoins are very in-dept to match your play style. -Variety is in everything, such as: Victory type,play style,empires,exploration,systems,planets in general,random events and maps. -Polished The bad sides: -Not many mods, at least I cannot really find any. -The beginning of the game can be repetitive. -Tutorial is not very helpfull, so you need to figure everything by yourself. text: Excellent platformer that should be raised to "Classic" status. It has some very difficult bosses and sections, but that's added value in my perspective. You just have to overcome the frustation of dying repeateadly at the same place. There are several powerups/abilities to make it easier, if the player is willing to look for them. Those will add even more content, allowing you to reach new places, discover secrets, and play differently - especially on boss fights. Graphics are dark, simple, on a bug/insect theme, but still quite cute. Music and atmosphere are also very well achieved. This game has a lot of content and multiple endings, and will keep the player busy for a long time is one decides to really explore everything.  At its current price, it's well worth it - it's probably one of the best valued games at 15 euros. I would recommended to everyone (willing to take up a challenging game).

text: I have bene enjoying the game so far.  The workshop was just implemented which will bring some new quests and eventually classes, which will mean more varied game play.  The game did suffer during it's early days, but the devs are constantly improving thte game and taking our suggestions.   This is a complete game, the UI is rough some times and hotkeys will be a welcome addition, but it's not a big deal to me.  If you need hot keys and a more streamlined UI in order to try a game, I'd recommend waiting another month or so.  If that doesn't bother you and you want a strategy game that is part RNG and part really knowing the system and learning from your failures, than this is the game for you.

text: An absolute masterpiece of sound design. I haven‚Äôt played since   a game so acoustically developed! Hunting shadows in the forest with little else to go on but your bow and your ears is an extremely rewarding experience. They kinda crippled you visually with the black & white colour scheme (in which they occasionally use hints of red to nudge you along the way and which can be adapted to full colour if you so wish), but then they built a whole acoustic world for you to compensate for it. The game‚Äôs story is based loosely on the mystery of the Roanoke colony, so I believe the colour palette is supposed to be reminiscent of the engravings we have from that early period of colonisation, but I think the way it looks is also aimed at enhancing the acoustic experience the game set itself to provide. A fully coloured world would have distracted you from the acoustic design, as it would have given you more visual means to deal with its dangers, but with the world painted this way you must rely mainly on what you hear in order to survive in it. They striped the colour from the world only to give you the sounds to colour it with! And, believe me, your brain will gradually learn to detach itself from the scant visuals and pay more and more attention to the richer palette of what can be heard around you, with the world ultimately starting to make more sense as a body of sounds rather than colours. And that makes for a highly original and properly immersive experience. Sadly, though, even on the highest difficulty setting, the 'unseen' enemies don't quite do enough damage to really make the slow-paced stealth, 'based on hearing', approach a necessity. Also, relying mainly on what you hear, the game is kind of an ethereal, disembodied experience, and was criticised at the time for not having enough flesh on its long (black and) white bones. I think this suits the game just fine, though, because it is basically a "ghost story" and, since dealing with ghosts is mainly an 'auditory' kind of endeavour, using an unsubstantial, de-realised setting is a proper way of 'telling‚Äô it. Fleshing it more would have shifted the game‚Äôs focus, I think, and would ultimately have turned it into a different kind of experience than what the developers had in mind.

text_translate: There are few good space strategies. Above all are Stellaris and Endless Space 2, and Galactic Civilizations III is in third place. This game has a long history and is a proven path, modernizing Galactic Civilizations II. Successful decisions have become even more successful, but the disadvantages ... First of all, GalCiv III looks good. The cut scenes are generally flawless, and the space on the map is nice to see. Planets, ships, artifacts - everything has many details and moves in a measured way without excessive flicker and acidic textures. Definitely a big step up from the GalCiv II, which is more like a board game. The development of the planets is much better than that of competitors. Here are the continents, here are the sources of resources - it is clear that the planet, albeit schematic, is unique. At the same time, the invasion of the planets is just a window with a message. Space battles are also underdeveloped, no battles of hundreds of ships from Stellaris, no cinematic maneuvers from Endless Space, only again a schematic "pee-pee". As with rival games, GalCiv III has random events that can be answered in three ways. They are few, but they do not happen so often that they are tiring. Over time, "morality" points accumulate, giving significant bonuses - really significant, which can immediately change the course of the game. However, they are sometimes contrary to common sense. For example, in your home system (where your civilization supposedly lives for thousands of years) you can suddenly find another planet for colonization. Or you become both a supporter and an opponent of slavery. Diplomacy is quite simple and comes down to you to us - we to you. Sometimes a computer opponent declares war menacingly and ... does nothing. And in a few moves the war ends without a single shot. As for campaigns, they are a mocking corner. The introductory video literally retells the plot of all three! Of course, there are additional additions, but they all together and did not stand near the campaign Galactic Civilizations II with the scope of "Babylon-5". Galactic Civilizations III has one huge advantage. It's simple, a bit "toy", so a little practice - and it becomes quite friendly. And when everything is studied, there is a wonderful ship designer, which will take another couple of hours.

text: Aside from the glorious 60fps cap and broken resolution menu, this game is absolutely perfect.  The dialogue is hilarious while touching on interesting political ideologies. Combat is fun, engaging and makes you feel like spiderman with a sword that has a spiderdog with a chainsaw. The soundtrack makes the drive to church feel like a fun family romp through vietnam in 1965. The story feels like it's written by a 10 year old that just watched the american 2020 electoral debates in the best possible way.  Strange technical garbo aside, I love everything about this anime.

text: I have been playing this game on and off for a few years now, and it's a surprise to see they are still actively supporting and updating it. This game has never been better, in my opinion. Sure, it has its share of problems, but as a casual player (I might be in the minority), I really enjoy this game. The weapon mechanics are great, the default maps offer some great variety in visuals and gameplay. It is one of the ever dwindling amount of FPS games right now that don't force you to buy DLC or lock gameplay contents behind a paywall. It's also ridiculously cheap and even more so during sales. And the last part is problem for a lot of competitive players at the moment. You might come across a lot of cheaters and this ruins the competitive aspect of the game. Personally I've only encountered around 3-4 cheaters, but it's a problem that's proving hard to solve, and ruining the game for its most serious players.  This is a great game overall, though. It's super fun to play with friends. The workshop content is absolutely massive. CS:GO has one of the biggest modding communities on Steam and there are tons of maps that offer a wide variety of content. All of them for free. Definitely recommend this game.

text_translate: Review for Fritz Chess 17 Steam Edition (english and french) 1. English With Fritz 17, in addition to the Fritz 17 engine, you get a completely new chess engine that was created with the help of a neural network based on the AlphaZero approach. There are also new exciting functions for creating and practicing opening repertoire. Based on LCZero technology, a neural network was trained with Grand Master games for over a year. The developers named the result Fat Fritz, which, however, needs a very powerful NVidea graphics card to achieve the full game strength. The engine also works on a processor of a commercially available personal computer, delivers very interesting results thanks to the neural network, but is actually up to two thousand times faster on the fast graphics card. Fritz 17 introduces repertoire management that is not based on entire variants but on trains. The Fat Fritz Engine refers to the community project Leela Zero (Lc0). Fat Fritz definitely focuses on analysis. With Fritz 17 and Fat Fritz, Chessbase offers every chess player the opportunity to participate in the new analysis techniques with little effort. Since the Fat Fritz program is based on a self-learning neural network, it is free of all templates. What promises success is preferred, regardless of what the theory thinks of it. On the Computer Chess Ratings List of November 23, 2019, Fat Fritz took first place with the impressive Elo score of 3617 points. High performance is already achieved with an RTX 2080 GPU. An RTX 2080 ti graphics card achieves an NPS performance of 37000. There are three Fat Fritz engine versions available: the one controlled by the main processor ("CPU") and an "Open CL" and a "CUDA" version. The latter two require an extra graphics processor in the computer, and only with one of these is the Fat Fritz engine interesting (a largely undocumented tip is that many AMD graphics cards and even the graphics cores built into modern Intel processors support "Open CL", the performance of the integrated graphics cores is low but still much higher than that of the CPU): Fritz 17 is in any case the first commercial program to contain a modified version of the "Leela Zero" Chess Engine. The GPU is not used to actually calculate. While the search is carried out on the CPU like any other engine, the GPU provides the assessments. But even with the best GPU, the search on the CPU only runs with two cores. Using more cores can even be counterproductive, because what is important is not how fast the CPU calculates, but how quickly the GPU can read the results of the neural networks. The classic engines can use two, four, 32 or 128 cores. And each additional core leads to higher computing power. Fat Fritz and Leela do not use additional CPU cores. The Engine Fat Fritz from the Fritz 17 program is the front runner in the CCRL Elo list and has a positive record against all tested programs. Fat Fritz against Leelenstein 11.1: +16 -11 =164 against Lc0 0.23.1 w42850: +17 -8 =167 against Stockfish 11 64-bit 4CPU: +19 -9 =72 against Allie 0.5 nn49921: +58 -3 =131 against Stoofvlees II a14: +51 -8 =121 2. Les d√©veloppeurs ont nomm√© le r√©sultat Fat Fritz, qui, cependant, a besoin d'une carte graphique NVidea tr√®s puissante pour atteindre toute la puissance du jeu. Le moteur fonctionne √©galement sur un processeur d'un ordinateur personnel disponible dans le commerce, fournit des r√©sultats tr√®s int√©ressants gr√¢ce au r√©seau neuronal, mais est en fait jusqu'√† deux mille fois plus rapide sur la carte graphique rapide.  Fritz 17 introduit une gestion de r√©pertoire qui n'est pas bas√©e sur des variantes enti√®res mais sur des trains. Le Fat Fritz Engine fait r√©f√©rence au projet communautaire Leela Zero (Lc0). Fat Fritz se concentre d√©finitivement sur l'analyse. Avec Fritz 17 et Fat Fritz, Chessbase offre √† chaque joueur d'√©checs la possibilit√© de participer aux nouvelles techniques d'analyse avec peu d'effort. Le programme Fat Fritz √©tant bas√© sur un r√©seau neuronal auto-apprenant, il est libre de tous les mod√®les. Ce qui promet le succ√®s est pr√©f√©r√©, ind√©pendamment de ce que la th√©orie en pense. Sur la liste des classements des √©checs informatiques du 23 novembre 2019, Fat Fritz a pris la premi√®re place avec l'impressionnant score Elo de 3617 points.Des performances √©lev√©es sont d√©j√† atteintes avec un unit√© de traitement graphique RTX 2080. Les deux derniers n√©cessitent un processeur graphique suppl√©mentaire dans l'ordinateur, et le moteur Fat Fritz n'est int√©ressant qu'avec l'un d'entre eux (un conseil largement non document√© est que de nombreuses cartes graphiques AMD et m√™me les c≈ìurs graphiques int√©gr√©s dans les processeurs Intel modernes prennent en charge "Open CL", les performances des c≈ìurs graphiques int√©gr√©s sont faibles mais toujours bien sup√©rieures √† celles du unit√© centrale de traitement): Fritz 17 est en tout cas le premier programme commercial qui contient une version modifi√©e du "Leela Zero" Chess Engine. text: Death is a great teacher. Failure in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is, as it always has been for this series, the greatest way to learn where you should have gone, what you shouldn't have done, and how you could have done better. Counter-Strike players spend a lot of time learning -- consequently, they are always getting better. Growth is an important factor in Global Offensive, especially if you're coming into Counter-Strike fresh or after a sabbatical. This is an extremely hardcore, skill-based first-person shooter, and it forces you to think differently than other modern shooters. If you‚Äôre a Call of Duty player, you‚Äôre going to need to change your play style to succeed here. Counter-Strike also tries developing into something new here as well, despite doing little to push itself beyond what it‚Äôs always done best. Global Offensive modifies old maps to keep veterans on their toes, and introduces official new modes that encourage different play styles for the first time in almost 15 years. For the uninitiated, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is a small-scale, team-based first-person shooter with permanent death. When a counter-terrorist kills a terrorist planting explosives in a classic Defusal match, or a CT escort swallows a sniper round in Hostage Rescue, the victim is dead for good and doesn't respawn until the next round. As such, players on both sides must exercise skill and care. The bomb objective, meanwhile, gives everyone a purpose. Of course matches end when everyone on a team is dead, but a clever and coordinated terrorist team will give the CTs the slip, plant their bomb, and protect the bomb site. Between rounds, everyone spends earned cash on better gear and guns, and the cycle continues. Pieces of the Counter-Strike formula are dated at this point, but the superb heart and soul of Global Offensive is timeless. Teams are small, guns are lethal, and rounds are short. There's an addictive just-one-more-round quality to it, because there's a constant desire to do better than last time, to earn a satisfying kill, or to win in a new way. Call of Duty and Battlefield vets will wonder why they can't sprint to escape enemy fire or look down the iron sights to improve aim; Counter-Strike players will feel like they walked into their redecorated home. Certain map redesigns will catch hardcore fans off guard, but the changes are for the best -- the underpass choke point in de_dust, for instance, has a new escape route. Even in the face of genre evolution, Global Offensive doesn‚Äôt care to adapt. CSGO is so dedicated to Counter-Strike's aging ideals despite market and trend changes that it brute-forces its way to success. Part of what makes it such an engaging competitive game is that killing in Global Offensive requires a wholly different skill set than other shooters. Everyone is limited to what they have and can see, with little room for character modification or on-the-fly advantages. Running and gunning is a useless play style, even if you've bought a helmet and kevlar that round, to the point that someone standing still is more likely to score the kill. Walking, crouching, or standing are your best bets to reduce the inaccurate spray of machine-gun fire. Consequently, killing in Global Offensive feels good. There's a sickening sensation to dropping someone dead because you know they're not coming back. It's also satisfying knowing you used limited resources to play smarter than your victim. If players aren't watching corners, providing covering fire, or using smoke grenades and flashbangs, they're more likely to take a headshot from a more delicate and patient triggerman. The desire to experience that distinct feeling is a strong motivator to keep playing, even when you're getting steamrolled by an obviously better team. If you've played Counter-Strike before, Global Offensive probably sounds a whole lot like Counter-Strike. Like Counter-Strike: Source before it, Global Offensive exists simply to modernize the look of the classic competitive shooter, while doing little to disrupt the core form and function. At the same time, it does enough to color outside the lines of tradition to justify your time and effort. Fire is one of the most interesting new combat variables. Molotov cocktails and incendiary grenades either roast groups of guys or force them in another direction. Flames are a useful distraction or scare tactic, too. They're particularly useful during Demolition matches, which focus the fight at a single bomb site rather than giving terrorists two to pick between. The new and modified maps in this mode aren't as big as classic Counter-Strike arenas ‚Äì entire sections have been cut off to direct teams toward a central location ‚Äì but their thoughtful design is as intricate as ever. The Lake map is a standout -- there's a wide open yet densely populated yard around the bomb site, which is inside a sizable lakeside home with plenty of vantage points and hiding spots. To separate Demolition from Defusal, players can't buy between rounds. Instead, it takes a cue from the other new mode, Arms Race, in which each kill unlocks another weapon instantly. The better you do, the more you have to switch up the way you play, and because Demolition is so fast you'll need to be quick on your feet. Unlike other game types, Arms Race allows for respawns. It's the most chaotic and care-free mode in Global Offensive, with players throwing caution to the wind for the sake of climbing the kill ladder as quickly as possible. It's a shame there are only two maps in Arms Race -- a problem that will more likely persist on consoles than PC. If you have the option, playing the PC version is unquestionably the best way to experience Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. Mods, mouse and keyboard, and the usual PC-only options are better than the ports. Plus, Valve is much better about long-term PC support -- it abandoned Team Fortress 2 on consoles, and Portal 2's level editor was PC exclusive. If you prefer to play on consoles, Global Offensive is the same great game

text_translate: We survived. When the sun reappeared above the canyon, the seven hunter's airboats lifted off again, looking for fresh food for the citizens. The energy tower that entered the cooling state was roaring low, and the snow covering the building slowly melted as the temperature rose. The tall robots continue to charge the steam node with energy, and it is their 24-hour continuous operation to ensure the supply of urban resources. Initially, only 80 survivors came from London to this poor city except for a broken tower. In order to obtain more resources and manpower, the child labor bill was passed, and children will work in relatively safe positions. Later, in order to be able to feed more people with limited food, we decided to eat meat with broth. We did not choose to bury the dead. Their bodies are kept in snow pits, and their organs will be used to treat more people who are still saved. For some severely ill people, we chose to amputate their limbs, which saved their lives and gave beds to those in need. We raised a lighthouse in the city and began to look for our lost compatriots. More and more people came to this city, but it also brought bad news: a nearby city, the Winter House has been destroyed. This has caused many people to doubt the reliability of our city. An organization called the London Gang was established. They gathered crowds to make trouble, trying to persuade people to give up what they had built and return to London. In their hearts, London is not. May fall. Our people are facing division. For the benefit of the majority, we choose to protect ourselves by order. The citizens spontaneously take to the streets and set up patrols. With the continuous production of robots and the steady supply of core steam from Tesla City, the city's economy has begun to improve. Dueling arenas and bars were erected in the city, and the supply of standard food was restored to the houses, and people began to regain confidence in the future. The atrocities of the London Gang were also curbed. The perpetrators were thrown into prison, and the guardhouse guarded the streets of the city. People began to slowly leave the London Gang and chose to stay here. Someone suggested that I use whistleblowers or simply establish a new regime like Nazism. I looked at the countless warehouses of food and coal in the east of the city, and told him with a smile that we had not yet reached the point where we had to rely on fanaticism and blind faith to survive. To the point, we now have the capital to live with more dignity. When the severe winter comes, all of my factories are operated by robots, and the citizens basically shelter from the cold at home, and only a few engineers guard their posts in the medical clinic. In the most difficult time, we rely on discipline to keep those mentally broken people sticking to their posts to ensure the integrity of the city's functions. At the end of the game, the developer reviewed the development process of the city, and then asked me, we gave up a lot of things, we crossed the line, the city survived, but is it worth it? This is 1887. I am the mayor of New London. I have 550 citizens living here. We have indeed abandoned some of the fruits of civilization. We have abandoned some beautiful ideals, but it is almost impossible for us to survive. The severe cold of China has the opportunity to rebuild a prosperous human civilization in a warm future. Humans have survived, and I think it's worth it.

text_translate: Inspired by the cartoons of the 30s, the graphics, music and the setting have a style that stands out for how careful and detailed they are, really excellent. As for playability, it has a high difficulty but without losing the entertainment caused by the game; Even losing your life countless times on the same level, you still want to keep trying until you complete that difficult phase. And it's something you see from the beginning to the end of the game. Very well polished gameplay, again highlighting its difficulty. A highly recommended game for those who like challenges, but also for those who enjoy a good environment, atmosphere and sound. I give it an 8.5 / 10

text: Raiders! is a traditional CRPG or perhaps a Major strategical game with RPG mechanics, it takes place in the future in a land resembling a traditional Wasteland. It basically gives of Mad Max vibes and the gameplay reminds me of Stronghold Kingdoms but that‚Äôs just me. The game was developed by Creative Storm Entertainment and published by   . Release Date: 10th November 2020 Last known update: 22nd November 2020 I am very pessimistic about games of this genre as I usually do not want to sink hours into a game in order to just learn the thousands of ‚Äúbasic‚Äù controls. Raiders! on the other hand, feels like a breath of fresh air. I was able to enjoy the game almost instantly and feeling as if I was actually making progress which shows that even the pacing is much better. This is a game that I could sink some decent hours into. As mentioned above the game plays out like a traditional tactical RPG. Now how does that play out in a setting like Raiders? You do have a leader with specific attributes that you choose from at the beginning. These stats will help you or break you in the future so you should be wise with your initial decisions. Throughout the playthrough, you will have to make multiple decisions on random encounters, some examples are to hire a wastelander that will sabotage various areas or an ex-soldier trying to join your team, you do have the classic options and these are to either kill or hire him or her. In addition to these random encounters, you will have to choose whom to fight and whom to avoid as you may lose all of your soldiers. After completing a raid or a fight you might get the chance to capture a hostage. Hostages are high-value people that will give you quite a lot of power if you‚Äôre using them correctly. Usually, I prefer to sell them as that gives me the ability to earn over 5000 chips ( game currency ). The other options are to execute them which will give you fear points and these are useful when it comes to either scare troops away or perhaps demand various resources. Lastly, you can simply eat them which is probably the worst option. The RPG elements aren‚Äôt the only attractive ones, this game is a blast to play as a tactical game as well. I found myself sinking hours in the game just to create the most balanced and efficient squad, let alone all of the traps and fortifications you can build for your hideout. Outside of battle formations and hideout fortifications, you can level up each of your soldiers after completing a successful battle. At first, you can choose the class they will represent, one is basically a tank another one is an offensive-minded soldier and lastly you got the support guy. There is an option if you would like to manually upgrade each stat of your soldier or to let the game handle that. Outside of upgrading attributes you will have to choose from various unlockable perks that can give each soldier the edge in a fight. While in a fight you have the option to either fight them yourself or once again let the game handle the fight which works well enough in my opinion. An 8 man squad is presented when fighting but you can obviously have more soldiers waiting to get substituted. Lastly, the best formation would be to have 4 gunmen and 4 melee men as this would give you the most balanced attacking and defending.  Be aware, spoilers ahead!   There isn‚Äôt much of a story here. As you create your ‚Äúleader‚Äù your goal is to be the strongest you can be. Time will tell if you‚Äôre good enough to capture cities and many businesses or perhaps maintain a very diplomatic relationship with the rest of the cities. It‚Äôs a basic story but let‚Äôs be honest this isn‚Äôt the reason this game exists. The visuals look hand-drawn or let‚Äôs say pretty unique. It is nothing amazing but it surely matches the Wasteland setting the developers tried to follow.                      The Benchmark tool used was MSI Afterburner. Raiders benchmark completed, 10790 frames rendered in 185.906 s                      Average framerate  :   58.0 FPS                      Minimum framerate  :   36.4 FPS                      Maximum framerate  :   60.9 FPS                      1% low framerate   :   10.2 FPS                      0.1% low framerate :    6.4 FPS Raiders! is a game that gave me a lot of quality hours, it does have some flaws but I could easily ignore them which resulted in an excellent experience. Truly a game I would recommend!

text: This game is great! But i seriously recommend torrenting it, prices and DLC is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• redicules.
text_translate: Where to start ? By the fact that to have developed such a game alone is a superhuman feat, already. To sum up the principle: you inherit your grandfather's farm, in a small hamlet in a peaceful and isolated region. You will have to start a new life and take care of your home while earning money to improve your daily life. There are so many aspects to this game that it would be difficult to mention them all! In bulk: - Management game first of all, because you will have to manage your finances, your crops, properly configure your fields, know which recipes work (plantation, craft, cooking, etc.). - RPG aspect then, because you will have to select skills to specialize in certain tasks (better quality of your products / greater quantity of products at each harvest, for example). Also because during your walks in the village, you will get to know the different inhabitants, who all have their own house and personality, and worked! You can get to know them, talk to them a bit, and make yourself appreciated by rendering services or offering gifts. You can even go so far as to get married and have children! Or limit yourself to having friends everywhere, if solitude is right for you. Friends will pay you back. - Arcade game, because you will sometimes have to fight during your adventures in the undergrounds, for example. Or also to show dexterity in certain minigames, such as fishing. - Exploration game, because the village is full of small details, hidden places, references and things to discover. And all of these aspects, Stardew Valley treats them wonderfully. Every day that ends in the game, we want to say to ourselves "Come on, one last and then I'll quit", except that it is quickly 5am and we are still working on projects and run everywhere. The music is very good, sometimes dynamic, sometimes cute, sometimes even sad, but it always hits the mark. The graphics are retro, but have a very special charm. The characters are endearing, and the story (yes, there is!) Has some touching moments in store for you. Stardew Valley is a beautiful universe in which to immerse yourself, settle down and dream. Whatever your state of mind, the game will help you escape timelessness. Usually I always cite faults, but here I did not find any notable that deserves to be mentioned. In addition, the developer continues to work on it and add free content. To discover absolutely!
Another masterpiece from 2K Games, everything is as always, post-shoots, madness and funny humor)

text: You haven't known pain until you serve steak with fries. Steak with fries requires you to cut two potatoes, 150g each, into 15g slices. That's 10 slices each, for a total of 20 slices. You are required to cut 20 slices of potatoes within a very tight margin of error. You will understand that very tight margin of error, because apparently every customer you serve steak with fries to brings a little scale to your restaurant. When they receive their order, they will weigh each and every single fry to ensure they are all roughly 15g. If you mess up a single fry, even if your steak is perfect, consider your dish wasted.
text_translate: Hello everyone! The essence of the game is not difficult. You need to destroy the enemy base to complete the level. The graphics are very good, I was amazed. Do not pass by!

text: Simple to learn, difficult to win. Its like a simcity game but with monsters thrashing down your village, the challenge is not the village building or monsters but the winter season that doesn't seems to end, it somehow stops your supply of income making you unable to recruit soldiers to defend your village. (Do not buy this product if you want many content, many village building options, multiplayer, less hands on/ automatic gaming. )

text_translate: Well, When I bought this game, I was looking for a fps, different of CS GO, and I found R6.  But, I was not hoping it would be a good match. Really, the game is not good. It's excellent, it's fun, and although I still have a lot of difficulty within the matches, I like to play a lot. The negative point is the pairing between players, should prioritize by lvl. I'm lvl 20 still, and I end up playing with lvl players 100+ which makes it very difficult for me to develop in-game. Other than that, the game is great! And, now I can say, Praise for the Lord! XD

These are just a few features that can be boldly attributed to the heroine of the adventures of one of the most associated game-ing series in the world. The next chapter will be marked by the end of the world according to the Mayan culture, exploring the ruins of the state of Peru and admiring the beauty of the virginity of Mexican nature. Lara finds another lead on a legendary item with world-changing powers. Our adventure begins with an atmospheric journey around a Mexican town during the celebration of a significant holiday for a given world culture - the Day of the Dead. The journey culminates in a series of unfortunate events in cataclysms that indicate the end of the world we know. The creators again focused on exploration, for this purpose, a lot of all kinds of items hidden in the game world of the latest Tomb Raider have been added. Was it a good play? Ask this question yourself. At some point, it started to bore me and I started doing the main plot. If you expect a revealing story, full of exciting twists, you may be slightly disappointed. It is a correctly created story, but as it happens in life, sometimes too much correctness leads to boredom and the statement that you would like something else more innovative. However, taking into account the diligence of execution. Tomb Raider is a good game, and the upcoming add-ons (planned for the whole year) can only positively affect the received whole. Best regards, Sebastian "Guma" Guminiczak

text: Me: "AAAAAAA" Mister X: "Why are you RUNNING?!?"
text_translate: (This review is a 'companion' piece to    I suggest you read his first.) Counterpoint The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim With about 300 hours invested in the game, yet only 23 (of 75) achievements under my belt, I think it's pretty obvious just how irrelevant Skyrim's social and civil problems were to my happiness there. In fact, most of the quests that I actually did complete, were done so, coincidentally. Honestly, it didn't take long for me to realize there were little, or no, rules, in Skyrim, and after 2 or 3 hours I had my own thing going on. I had a nice, cozy house, several loyal  , and I made a comfortable living by treasure hunting, and burgling. I seldom took on odd jobs, and stopped, altogether, doing other people's dirty work. When the war finally broke out, I joined both factions, received various missions and supplies, then, promptly marched off to spend the next 160+ hours just vagabonding. Through gold leafed woods, over frigid white mountain tops (often in my skivvies) I wandered through the wonder, of Skyrim, doing pretty much whatever I pleased. I invented my own challenges and achievements... I ran into a Stormcloak encampment, stripped off my uniform, and shouted "‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• the army!" while mounting the captain's steed. They totally killed me the first 2 tries, but I did get away with it, on the third. Imaginary Achievement Unlocked: Section 8 (Perform and survive 3 consecutive insane actions against the military.) Yes! I wanted to find ways to see beyond Skyrim's  , and explore all her other aesthetic qualities, like art, music, literature, and such. For instance, Skyrim is littered with books and letters, and so, it made sense that we form a Traveling Book Club. During our journeys, if a book caught our eye, we'd stick it in our inventory. Then, after our evening meal, one of us would read their  , aloud. Aranea was partial to books on history, Erandur indulged his voyeurism with journals and diaries, and Lydia.. well, Lydia always chose cook books. Though she took no real interest in the art of cooking, there was something about recipes that she considered profound, and she would read them as if she were reciting a beautiful poem. And so, we traipsed through Skyrim. Minutes to hours, hours to days, days to...   Then, one evening, somewhere around hour 290, I looked at my map and realized that I had been everywhere, and had seen, pretty much, everything. I had promised my allegiance to many, but had given it to none.  I had looted the dead, and robbed the living. I had read every   ever printed. I had done Skyrim to death. The war was still raging, the   still owned the skies, nothing much had changed in that respect. But, that was mainly because the people of Skyrim had been just standing around, waiting for me to make it all better. Instead, I had decided to teach them a valuable lesson about depending, too much, upon others.  As Erandur might've said. "Mara helps those who help themselves." To which, I would've added. "Hey, I never asked to be Dragonborn." I filled my companions inventories with jewels, food, and clothes, then sent them on their separate ways.  Then, I walked to the nearest, highest, snow peaked mountain, and shouted. "Game over!" It was an alternative ending. That was months ago, and looking back, now, I'd still say I had a good, long life, in Skyrim. I may not have much to show for it, stat wise, but a 900+ screenshot legacy, is nothing to sneeze at, either. And, yes, it's true that Skyrim is no better off, now, for my having lived there.  But then, after all is said and done, I kinda doubt that the real world will be either. Such is the life of an underachiever.   Footnote: I actually went back into Skyrim, while I was writing this review. Partially for some reference info, but mostly, just to sneak a visit to my old Whiterun homestead. I guess, it's supposed to be a comfort knowing that  , without us?

text_translate: Breach & Clear Deadline is a topdown shooter, with some tactical strategy involved.  *Early Access Review* (if you would like to watch actual gameplay the link is below) Early Access Gameplay: 1080p 60fps *spoilers*  Things that I have noticed that will most likely be tweaked later. (as of Jan 22) - occasional frame drops in random locations where nothing is happening - menus look pixelated  - the skill tree isn't helpful, most of the things on there are pointless and cost too much. (you would think the first skill to unlock costs 1 as you only get 1 per level right? nope its 3) - confusing map... very confusing - keyboard has multiple actions on certain keys set as default. (real example in game: "Q" switches weapons and opens doors) which should be seperated.  Needs a fixed key rebinding system. - Has seperated Xbox One, Xbox 360 and Playstation controller support which is always nice, though you only use a few buttons. - not much of a variety of enemies - graphics are ok at most, I don't think it'll get much better at full release but that isn't much of a big deal in this style of game. - the objective marker is pointless with the map, it will tell you to go in a direction but tell you to turn backwards 2 feet later? (fixable) Overall, this "review" was written Jan 22, so if you are reading this months later, it is probably inaccurate.  I would hold off on buying this game until a later date. however I do plan on covering the game on my Youtube channel eventually when the game is complete, so if you are interested, be sure to check it out. - Added Jan 25 Extra Notes upon reading other reviews: - People mentioned there is no tutorial, while this is true, the game is more than self explanitory, so for the most part it guides you on the way. (would be cool to have, but not necessary to be added) - Crashes? I have not experienced any. (want to see my PC specs? check my profile)

text_translate: Just to put it bluntly, a huge stepup from the first Injustice game and a beautiful design. Pros: -Graphics are incredible.  -Character design is fantastic and well done. You can also see some amount of design connecting to the first Injustice game. -Combat is challenging and fun. Environmental uses and stage transitions are great. -Great choice of DLC characters with their own unique looks and movesets. -Gear is phenomenal and addicting to customize -Leagues to join and lootboxes to grab. Don't pay for these. You get a lot of loot in multiverse missions anyways. Cons: -A little bit of a grindfest especially for higher gears and levels. -There is a bug that happens sometimes when you uninstall the game and when trying to play it again later on, it locks out multiverse and other modes until you play for AT LEAST 30 min for them to unlock again. Real dumb. Kinda gives me a flashback on Injustice 1 not saving progress in story modes at all. That sucked.

text_translate: Description: Quell is an addictive puzzle game with logic and relaxation. Quell is a representative of the genre of puzzle games (as I often call such games, "logic with space"), which is in no way inferior to, for example, 6180 the moon or micron. I came across it quite by accident, but the more pleasant was my surprise when, in addition to the visual, well-designed style and unobtrusive composition, I was drawn into the gameplay, the essence of which is to collect all the pearls at the level in conditions of limited space, movements and obstacles. Levels: The levels are passed quite easily and naturally, since the game does not have any strict restrictions on time or moves, but there is a so-called perfect (it implies the minimum number of movements to the fastest possible completion of the level). There are three different Quells currently on Steam. With these games, you can safely begin acquaintance with the genre of puzzles in general and then move on to more complex representatives in particular, so I highly recommend watching at least the first part, maybe you will be drawn into an evening or two, like me. Gameplay: Slide a little water droplet around the window pane, avoid thorns and collect pearls. Easy, right? Beauty of the Game: Absolutely, but the beauty of Quell lies in the perfect difficulty curve - it's just cumbersome to test your logic skills, but not so much that it stops being fun. Music: Gentle music (by acclaimed composer Stephen Kravis) and atmosphere create the perfect setting for your brain to be completely immersed in these ingenious puzzles. If you're ready to dig deeper, there is a side story that tells a touching tale of love, loss, and nostalgia. Either way, Quell is a haunting experience that will stay with you long after you finish it. Bottom line: A pleasant and relaxing game with unobtrusive and relatively easy levels of passing. The game is simple, but addictive very quickly. I recommend it, especially with an 80% discount. My rating: 7/10

text: Wow, what a wonderful little idea for a game. It's like a little window into people's heads where you get to read what people struggle with on a daily basis. It's very interesting how some people talk about big serious issues, while others talk about tiny irrelevant problems and yet they still perceive them as big ones. I was curious about the gameplay concept of it but I certainly wasn't expecting to spend 2 hours sending out all sorts of positive vibes and messages to all sorts of genuine people. This wholesome game is the very definition of the "feels good man" meme. Well done to whoever made it, it's almost Nobel Prize worthy.
text_translate: + Fascinating story and universe looked well built + Every character is different and has a personality, each stand out from the others + Very emotional ride, main protagonist are also great! + Choices are though and they DO impact the story!
