text: Chivalry Medieval Warfare ist ein reines Multiplayerspiel, es gibt keinen Singleplayer oder eine Story. Am Anfang eines Gefechtes w√§hlt man zwischen denn 4 verschiedenen Klassen. Es gibt den   der mit einem Bogen oder Armbrust ausgestattet ist. Der   hat gro√üe und schwere Waffen die viel Schaden verursachen wie zb. eine Zwei-Klingen-Axt. Dann gibt es noch den   der leichte Waffen hat. Zuletzt gibt es den Lanzentr√§ger. Der hat lange Schwerter aber auch Lanzen. Au√üerdem haben alle Klassen ihre eigenen "Skills". Gek√§mpft wird in verschiedenen Modi die gr√∂√ütenteils bekannt sind.  ,   ,  , Teamobjects,   und dem  . In Deathmatch k√§mpfen wie gewohnt alle gegen alle. In Team Deathmatch sucht man sich einer der 2 Fraktionen aus ,Mason oder Agatha. Das ist generell in jedem Modi so au√üer in Horde , Duell und Deathmatch. Dann wird in Teams gegeneinander gek√§mpft. In Capture the Flag muss die gegnerische Flagge zur eigenen gebracht werden. Teamobjects sind die Teammissionen in dem das Team verschiedene Aufgaben erf√ºllen muss um zu siegen. Das eine Team soll die Aufgaben erf√ºllen das andere soll das verhindern. Im Duell Mode duellieren 2 Spieler gegeneinander. Der Horde Mode ist kein richtiger Spielmodi, denn Spieler k√§mpfen gegen KI Gegnern die immer besser und immer mehr werden. !Chivalry braucht viel Eingew√∂hnungszeit! Die Maps sind detailverliebt und die Umgebung ist h√ºbsch. H√ºbsche Effekte sind auch vorhanden verleihen dem Spiel eine tolle Atmosph√§re, dazu tr√§gt auch die Mittelalterliche Musik bei.	                                                           Der Sound der Waffen klingt ebenfalls gut.    							 Das Kampfsystem ist auf einer Guten Ebene. Es gibt unz√§hlige Techniken die man im Laufe der Zeit erlernen kann, das ist nichts zum erforschen, sondern einfach nur seine eigene Kampftechnik.         Die Schlachten sind belebt und Dynamisch. Im Hintergrund vom Spielgeschehen finden auch viele Aktionen statt wie zb. das auftreffen von Steinen auf eine Burg.                                                               Die Bedienung ist Simpel und einfach. Am Anfang kann man ein Training starten das die Grundlagen erkl√§rt. Es gibt eine gro√üe Anzahl an an Maps das an den Updates liegt. Dank Steam - Workshop kann man eigene Maps erstellen und seine eigenen Maps und die der anderen auch spielen , aber auch Skins und anderen kram erstellen.  Am Anfang Gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig aber nach einigen Stunden macht das Spiel einfach Laune. Ich Hoffe das Review hat euch geholfen und bei Fragen schreibt es unten rein.

text_translate: Grand Theft Auto 5 is the current latest game from the GTA franchise, after the monumental success of Grand Theft Auto. Rockstar Games decided to make a sequel to the HD universe in sunny Los Santos(inspired by Los Angeles). The game was released on September 17th, 2013 and is to date, the most successful piece of entertainment media. Just to mention in this review I won't mention GTA 5: Online because that it a game on it's own. The gameplay for GTA 5 is a great example of perfection. Everything is brilliantly paced, nothing feels that it was shallow or rushed. Missions end with you finding new things out about the game and its lore. Gunplay is very satisfying, aiming to feel so fluid and responsive. The variety of weapons and their addons is massive, there are 30 weapons all with customizability. Shotguns have a loud and powerful punch, pistols having that firm grip and the snipers having that shrouded effect. The GTA 5 graphics were in 2013 groundbreaking almost 7 years later, that claim still stands. The graphics are absolutely stunning! Rockstar Games really are known for their level of detail. Every piece of shrubbery is unique in its own way. It's amazing how they managed to stuff a world that big in a game.  Before i start  . In GTA 5, you play as 3 main protagonists;  Franklin Clinton - a 25-year-old guy trying to escape gang life and trying to actually do something influential in his life, a newcomer to the criminal life. He is also a talent for driving. Michael DeSanta (Townley) - a 48-year-old trying to live a good life after being a full-time criminal in the late 90s and early 2000s. During a heist in Ludendorff, the United States Michael and one of his partners in crime 'Brad Snider' both were shot after fleeing the police, Brad didn't survive the shot but Michael did. Michael made a deal with the FIB to fake his own death. During that time he tried to cut contacts with his other partner in crime 'Trevor Phillips', which is are next character. Trevor Phillips - a close contact of Michael DeSanta, who in 9 years met new people in the outskirts of San Andreas and founded his own company with Ron Jakowski called Trevor Philips Enterprises. An uprising drug smuggling company trying to get a bigger sponsor to make his company larger. He is also a psychopath and he's talented in aiming and killing. The story feels very good, it all fits together nicely and in the singleplayer campaign, you meet a lot of unique characteristics, which you would never probably meet in real life. The idea of having 3 protagonists is genius in my opinion, mainly because you are able to see certain aspects in the game from different perspectives. GTA 5's level design is of most Rockstar's games, linear and innovative. In every mission, you're given tasks which reap the main goal.  The recreation of Los Angeles is spot on. Having been in LA, I knew exactly where I was going most of the time. Some parts are of course fictional and don't exist in real life, but it's executed so well that it might as well be in real life. Grand Theft Auto 5 is a big game, period. It features over 60 innovative and diverse missions. Besides that, there are a lot of little small quests that don't affect the main story. The game took me over 40 hours to beat the first time, and I enjoyed every single moment of it. I've even become fond of the mission fails. The controls are fluid, responsive and free. Movement by foot is a bit sluggish, but that's to be expected because you have so many vehicles to chose from and walking is only used when necessary. Fun fact, there are currently 464 vehicles in GTA 5 (including GTA 5: Online). The difficulty of GTA 5 missions isn't hard. Most missions are easy and are fun. Although saying that, I can say I've failed a mission more than 1000 times. The music in GTA 5 is amazing, for me it is up there with GTA San Andreas' soundtrack. The diversity of the radio stations is nice and it adds a bit of depth. The main theme song for GTA 5 is iconic, it recreates LA so well I can't describe it in words, it's popularity shows that. The trailer for GTA 5 is great, it tells you all you need to know what's going to happen in-game and it showed the graphics 2 years before the official release of the game. You also get introduced with one of the protagonists; Michael DeSanta.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto 5 is the best games Rockstar Games have ever made and it will always be like that, it has become a phenomenon and it's community comes from all over the world. The game features an insane level of detail and it's the definition of perfect execution. If I had to rate Grand Theft Auto 5 from 0 to 10. I would rate the game an undisputed 10/10, probably goes into the history books as an instance of a perfect game.

text_translate: Help succubus Lucy find and unravel the mysteries of the Orb of Destiny. ‚Ä¢ The story, although short, is fun. There are some really cool plots, some ecchi anime clich√©s, good and fun dialogues (which includes great references to be drawn). ‚Ä¢ The scenarios and traits of the characters were very well done. And the game gives you the option to take out the HUD to get a better look at the scene. ‚Ä¢ The stock choice system was well done, because sometimes the game induces you to do something that may seem obvious, but you soon discover that it is not, and you end up dying. So, use your head and make your choices. ‚Ä¢ The songs are very well matched according to the scenario and the situation. It is even a pleasure to listen. ‚Ä¢ Has fan service. Visual Novel with succubi and elves, so you can already imagine that you will have it. ‚Ä¢ Can be played entirely in PT-BR. I have some errors, but nothing that gets in the way of reading. ‚Ä¢ As soon as I finished the game, I realized, looking at the achievements, that there are some that are conquered in specific choices, that is, the game can have different paths (and I believe that with the same ending). It is a game (Visual Novel) made with great care, fun and worth playing. In addition, at first glance, it can be seen as a standard yuri. And it's true, it can be like that, but you can still see a simple and subtle (and possibly clich√©) message in the game. Lucy has something to say to you:

text_translate: I met this game years ago watching PewDiePie playing, and I saw that scene from the beginning that she is doing a scientific experiment in that room, having a candidate in another room. I remember that the pewdiepie terrified that woman and I thought "wow, psycho, I was just going to move something here and there only". Then I played that scene today and rolled up that room with loud laughs reminiscent of the Joker poha, maybe I should be stuck in a lab ... This is the second game I most wanted to play on ps4, the first is The Last Of Us. And man, it is sensational, very immersive story .. you feel in her skin, feel her pain and sympathize totally with Jodie. I had some problems with the controller and needed to play on the keyboard and mouse (original xbox 360 controller, maybe because the game was not on ps4 ...), but other than that I recommend it too much.

text: Dragon rage is a game similar to the classic Rampage series. You‚Äôre a dragon and all you have to do is cause chaos. The game has very cure art-style and some nice music. The game however is way too short, and I am talking like 20 minutes to complete the game short. It is fun though but I think the developer could‚Äôve added a few more levels.  The graphics looks pretty awesome with a cartoony art-style. The screen looks sharp and crisp. The dragon and people are super cute as well.  In the sound department there isn‚Äôt much, the background track is okay, nothing too fancy. When you go in rage mode the track changes into metal-type music. The sound effects are pretty nice too. Basically you‚Äôre a dragon who is on rampage mode. You have to destroy a certain number of buildings and kill anyone who gets in the way, including knights, archers even the royal family itself. You can do certain types of moves including dashing, which will knock anyone in your way like a bowling ball. You can jump, stomp or breath fire down on the people. You also get many bonuses spawning and collecting them will give you food, points etc. You have a health/hunger meter, whenever the dragon breath fire on people or stomp them it takes this bar down and to fill it up again you have to eat people. Throughout the game you have to manage your eating and destroying at the same time. When your health bar gets full you go into rage mode. In this mode the background gets all red and you can only see your dragon‚Äôs silhouette. You can dash infinitely in this mode and jump really high and breath fire faster too. Basically you can cause much more mayhem with this rage mode. Once in this mode the health bar starts depleting again and once the bar is empty you go back to the regular mode. There‚Äôs also an egg meter which when it fills up the dragon will lay an egg. You must protect the egg for a certain time and dragon babies will hatch from the eggs. These little monsters will aid you in destroying everything that exists. When you start off no one is attacking you. Once you start causing chaos the king will send knights to kill you and if they can‚Äôt stop you, archers will arrive. Later the king sends catapults, magicians, horse riding knights and many other types of warriors try to stop you. They even build walls so the dragon cannot move freely. the princess and queen come at a certain point in the game. They give defense bonuses to their armies. Once you destroy the king and 100 buildings, the game is over and you have won. A short gameplay clip can be found below: The game itself if pretty fun. Think of it as a stress reliever. If you‚Äôre angry with some work stuff or real life, you can sit down and take your frustration down on the poor people of the kingdom. $7 is kind of steep though for this short of a game so you can always wait for a bigger sale.

text: Alright here goes So I was actually "kinda forced" by a junior brother from my team. So I bought it during the summer sale. I've been playing NFS games since my childhood, starting with NFS 2. Then I played pretty much all of the games in the series. Yes some versions did slip through the cracks but after NFS Rivals, I was solely disappointed on the whole series as it took a completely different turn. I mean, come on guys you just can't argue that Need For Speed Most Wanted 2005 was the best NFS if not the best story driven racing game. And at the same time, if you're a OG NFS fan you still love the soundtracks from NFS underground 2. So about heat, they kinda brought back some vibes from NFS MW and UG. Although it's not comparable to what it was like back in MW or UG. About the game, finally I can say EA did break the ground this time, even though the impact wasn't THAT GREAT, but it's a good comeback (if they can hold it.. that is). In this game, you'll get the vibes of a good story, you'll get the vibes of your old days of NFS MW (if you played NFS MW) when you had a big hate for Razor (blacklist no 1) and Sgt. Cross (the antagonist police). Also you'll get some epic driving mechanics and a good amount of cars to choose from. About the story, it's kinda short but then again this is NFS guys, driving matters more than the story (right?) ! It's story makes a lot of sense when it is compared with NFS Carbon, where you can explore a lot but your story is extremely short. But for Heat, the story is one of the best in the series if not THE best. Downsides of the game, it makes you grind a lot but grinding is fairly easy but you may get bored if you keep racing again and again. You can surely can add some spice on the board by shifting to the night (they got a very cool transition when you shift it to night btw) and fight against the cops. And I must admit, the cops are the elephant of the room when it comes to Heat. Just in case, if you guys played dying light (a survival zombie game) you know in the night time, the volatile zombies come out whom are VERY DANGEROUS TO DEAL WITH IF YOU ARE HAVING A LOW LEVEL. But in that game, during night times you get the best loots and XP. Just like that, in NFS heat during the night time, your rewards will be high (but you'll get XP mainly to level up). But if you're really dedicated, try the high heat races in the night and they will drop you some cool upgrades for your ride. End of the day, The cops are literally zombies in this game. During day time, speed pass the cops, do a drift, break objects and the cops will not care. BUT TOUCH THEIR CAR AND THEY WILL START TO PURSUE YOU (reminds me of old GTA days). More or less, in the day time cops love to enjoy their donuts. But in the night, be a good guy, park your car in a parking lot turning the engine off :D but if the cops spot you, they'll start chasing you (lol :3). FInally, multiplayer. Yeah multiplayer is great and it's a game you'll really enjoy playing if you have friends. The interfaces are really cool and I find them user friendly too. So yeah for me it's bang for the buck Overall ratings Gameplay : 9/10. It's great but I really wanna see more improvements here Story : 10/10. I don't know if a NFS story can be any better than this Enviroment : 9/10. I see room for improvement and I wanna see it in the next game Experiences : 8/10. This game kinda feels repetitive to be honest. Can be upgraded in the future.. I hope Recommended? YES GO FOR IT. Thank me later.

text_translate: Rogue Continuum is space top-down shooter, imagine Serious Sam, now imagine Serious Sam as a top-down shooter, voila, you have Rogue Continuum. This game is a lot of fun, especially later when your hero gets stronger and your weapons gets upgraded, but in the same time game will punish you. Once you die in the game you will always get back to the start, no matter how far you got in the game, but don‚Äôt worry, because your stats will not reset. Everytime you start again, your hero will be stronger and it will be easier and faster for you to progress. Don‚Äôt expect to finish the game in you first attempt. Be patient and you will be rewarded. Read full preview here:

text_translate: The Sims ‚Ñ¢ 3 Advantages: + Another part of the Life Simulator from Maxis + Erpeg aspects - quests have appeared (e.g. someone will ask us to repair the oven, or we will have to replace the guitarist at a concert) and the characteristics that define sims (e.g. one can be Sleepy and another not, one can be an introvert, another kleptomaniac, etc.) + Finally, Sims from other families age with ours (i.e. that there are no such bizarre situations that, for example, we are a teenager, we meet a baby, we grow old until retired , and although our Sim has grown old, the other Sim from another house is still a baby). + Even good graphics and music (although after several dozen minutes of listening to music from the Build Menu, your ears bleed) + You can build ready-made rooms. We choose them from the catalog, set them up and it's ready - we already have a furnished room with wallpaper and flooring. + Furniture and clothes can be dyed in any color (using the color wheel). We also have ready-made patterns such as green palm trees, dark wood, etc. + Simkom's breasts can be enlarged (Õ° ¬∞ Õú ñ Õ° ¬∞) Disadvantages -Still takes a long time to load (although it used to be worse, but it still loads longer than most games) - Lots of stuff was cut for ridiculously expensive DLC (most of them cost as much as the game itself, and these adding animals cost ‚Ç¨ 70 ... I recommend it, but only with a discount of at least 20 euros (which rarely happens). Otherwise you will not pays off.

text: SZYBKO USUWA SIƒò Z DYSKU
text_translate: Overall this game is positive but it massively needs amending / fixing. I do feel with regular updates game could easily be a 9/10 however atm it's a 7.5/10 for me. This game to put it in perspective is like PUBG & Rust having a baby together. So you land, you've got ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• all and you must search literally everywhere for supples, food / water / weapons and a lot of materials for crafting and what's good is that you needa venture off far and search acers of land and houses. Took me almost 25 mins to find my first rifle and it had no godamn bullets so they're always seperate. It's a lot more fun when you play with friends as you can set up camp and cook food and chill and go off hunting in the wildlife and killing other players in the process and stealing their supplies & loot. The realism of the game however is definitely 10/10 as you really needa graft in order to survive, you gotta watch for your calories, heart monitoring and much more. I have yet to see a single zombie as apparently they don't often spawn in, and they're only in certain locations. This game has also yet to have an anti-cheat so you may bump into 1-2 hackers but I wouldn't let that stop you from purchasing this as an Anti-Cheat is on the priority list for the next update including a lot of bug fixes. Games actually worth ¬£15 imo it's a good price for something which does have bugs here n there. The game is fun on your own but 10x better with friends as you have an advantage when there's a group of you. This game really does test your knowledge on how to survive in an open world all a lone also with this game you do need a lot of patience and willingless to travel far distances in search of the very basic things you need to survive. To some extent it's like being in the Walking Dead ( only with less zombies ) instead you'll find most of your gameplay does consist of you trying to survive, and a small proportion is actually PVP. So yeah overall a solid game but in need of improvements. Worth picking up and giving it a go and just keepinng up to date on the game patches.

text_translate: In Goat Simulator, you play as a... Goat.     It is sort of a sandbox game because you choose what to do and there's no real story. I took it for it's full price, which is totally worth it, and started playing. First of all, you have more than one game mode : you have the sandbox  , which are both really fun and contain a few quests and achievements.       - Graphics : entire city models and a huge village in MMO ;  - Easy to understand and awesome gameplay : for starters, you can learn how to play in less than a minute ;  - Listening community : making the game great again (and again, and again...) ;  - Gravity enhanced simulator : the game is realistic ;  - Small memory hunger : it's not a fatty ;  - Crazy stunts : "you gotta lick it all !" ;  - A few crashes with less than 8 GB of RAM allowed on your computer ;  - ****ed up houses and demon communities.

My specs are beyond what is required and I still get like 15-40 fps on planets, 60+ fps in space, and the ocasional stutter. From what little time I had with the game it was actually pretty good, wish I could have experienced a better with it tho.

text_translate: PUBG: Clash of the Titans PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds: Clash of the Titans

PES 2017 has already been announced, and I just now decided to write a review on the 16th part of fotsim from Konami. To begin with, in general I liked the game, but at a stretch you can put the game 7, I think. Why is it so? I will try to answer this question below. I'll start with the pros. Pros: - Atmosphere. The scenes before the start of a football match look very beautiful, I certainly understand that in the same fifa it can be done even better, but PES is also not far behind in this. - Sophisticated players. The players in the game look very realistic, some are designed so well that they are indistinguishable from real footballers, Konami really did their best in this. - The pace of the game. The pace of the game is slower than in FIFA and this is only a plus, as it is more realistic. - Musical arrangement. After the 14th part of the PES, in which the musical background was to say the least bad, the 15th and 16th parts of the game were rehabilitated and gained a good library of music that is pleasant to listen to. You can, I think, still find a few merits of the game, but I indicated the main ones, now I think it's worth moving on to the disadvantages of the game. Cons: - Graphics. The most significant disadvantage for owners of the PC version of the game. I don‚Äôt know why Konami is underestimating the graphics for the PC, since the PS4 version looks much better. Perhaps the developers do not want to raise the system requirements by this, since now the system. the requirements are several times less than those of FIFA. - Animation. Konami in the 16th version of the PES added a lot of new animations for football players, thanks to which the realism of what was happening was increased, but along with this some problems came, for example, I had many moments when an attacker ran to the opponent's goal alone and fell from a light touch and instead of running after the ball, he raised his hands signaling that there was a violation, and during this time the opponents were already taking the ball away from their goal. In general, as I said above, I liked the game. For me, this is the best football simulator at the moment, which requires improvements.

text: Stories Untold developer! In Observation you have control over the AI of a space station. Sounds boring? Not at all! You control the game via cameras and drones, which allows you to explore the station and interact with objects like notes or computer systems. The game also throws you right into the middle of the story. After an unknown incident, you will meet Emma, who may (?) be the only survivor. The space station is heavily damaged, the status of the crew is unknown. Help her to repair systems, prevent catastrophes and find out what happened. Graphics and sound are very good and harmonic, partly creepy. The puzzles range from easy to challenging and are very various.  The game does not take you by the hand, you must show initiative. There is a certain help but mostly you have to find out yourself how things works.

text: Wuppe hier einfach mal ein Mafia-2-Review online, das ich kurz nach Release anno 2011 basierend auf der PS3-Fassung getippt hab: ‚ÄûWelcome to Empire Bay!‚Äú ‚Äì So wird Vito Scaletta in seiner neuen, amerikanischen Heimat zu Beginn des Spieles von einem schlichten Banner an einer Br√ºcke begr√º√üt. Gerade eben ist er mit seiner Familie aus Sizilien ausgewandert, um der Armut in der alten Heimat zu entfliehen und den amerikanischen Traum am eigenen Leib zu erfahren. Allerdings l√§sst der erwartete Wohlstand erst einmal auf sich warten. Deshalb versuchen Vito und sein neuer, bester Kumpel Joe Barbaro, ihren finanziellen Durst mit kleineren Raubz√ºgen, vorzugsweise in den Juweliermeilen der Stadt, etwas zu stillen. Dass das nicht lange gut gehen kann, war abzusehen und so wird Vito von den Gesetzesh√ºtern geschnappt und vor eine schwerwiegende Wahl gestellt: entweder wandert er f√ºr ein paar Jahre ins Kittchen oder er meldet sich freiwillig als Rekrut f√ºr die Truppen der US-Army im Zweiten Weltkrieg, in dessen Zeit die Handlung spielt. Er entscheidet sich f√ºr das Milit√§r, bringt den Dienst an vorderster Front hinter sich und kommt nach dem Krieg wieder nach Empire Bay zur√ºck. Dort muss er feststellen, dass sich die Stadt w√§hrend seiner mehrj√§hrigen Absenz sehr ver√§ndert hat. Doch sein Kumpel Joe, der inzwischen einige Kontakte zur √∂rtlichen Mafia kn√ºpfen konnte, hilft ihm, wieder Fu√ü zu fassen und au√üerdem die Schulden seines Vaters zu begleichen. Er besorgt Vito kleinere Jobs, bestehend aus √úberf√§llen oder Erpressungen, um schnell das n√∂tige Kleingeld zu verdienen. Immer mehr findet Vito Gefallen an schnellem Geld, hei√üen Schlitten und nicht minder hei√üen Damen, die sich in Nachtclubs oder Lokalen nur zu gerne mit reichlich Champagner bezirzen lassen. Und so beginnt die ereignisreiche Mafiakarriere des Vito Scaletta‚Ä¶ Damit w√§re die storytechnische Grundlage des Action-Knallers Mafia 2 gelegt. H√∂rt sich nach einer typischen Gangstergeschichte an ‚Äì und ist es im Prinzip auch. Allerdings leidet der Spielspa√ü keinesfalls an der zwar relativ vorhersehbaren, aber dennoch gut und spannend erz√§hlten Handlung. Einen gro√üen Teil des Spa√ües stellt nicht nur die Beinahe-Open-World, sondern auch die fantastische Aufmachung der fiktiven Gro√üstadt Empire Bay dar. W√§hrend der einzelnen Storykapitel ist die Stadt frei befahr- und erkundbar. Nach dem Abspann l√§sst der erwartete und f√ºr Spiele solcher Art eigentlich auch typische ‚ÄûFreies-Herumfahren-und-Quatsch-machen‚Äú-Modus allerdings auf sich warten, was ziemlich schade ist. Gern w√§re man noch weiter in der Stadt herumgeheizt und h√§tte sich kleinen Nebenmissionen hingegeben. Viel mehr als Verfolgungsjagden mit der Polizei und Sammelgegenst√§nde findet man sowohl w√§hrend als auch nach der Hauptgeschichte kaum, denn  Nebenmissionen √† la ‚ÄûGTA‚Äú oder ‚ÄûRed Dead Redemption‚Äú sucht man vergebens. Schade, denn so h√§lt sich der Drang in Grenzen, in seiner schicken Limousine weiter durch die wunderbar designten Stra√üen von Empire Bay zu heizen. In diesem Punkt verschenkt Mafia 2 einiges an Potential. Technisch gibt es hingegen fast nichts auszusetzen. Das fiktive Empire Bay strotzt an jeder Stra√üenecke nur so vor Details: Oft strahlen Leuchtreklamen an den H√§userfassaden ihr halogenes Licht in die Stra√üenschluchten der Gro√üstadt. Vereinzelt kommen Passanten bei schneebedeckten Gehwegen ins Rutschen und k√∂nnen sich gerade noch so an einem zugeschneiten Wagen vor dem schmerzhaften Sturz auf den Aspahlt retten. Auf den Stra√üen fahren originalgetreu nachgebildete 50er Jahre Karossen, aus denen amerikanische Blues und Jazz-Klassiker t√∂nen. Sollte schlechtes Wetter die Sicht durch die Windschutzscheibe tr√ºben, bewirkt ein Abstecher bei einer der Waschstra√üen wahre Wunder und das Gef√§hrt gl√§nzt danach wie frisch ausgeliefert in der Sonne. Man k√∂nnte dutzende solcher Feinheiten aufz√§hlen, denn der Detailgrad ist enorm und man kommt bei seiner Spritztour durch Empire Bay regelm√§√üig ins Staunen. Allerdings leidet, auf Konsolen kaum vermeidbar, die Framerate unter der Detailverliebtheit. St√§ndig wird der √ºberaus positive Gesamteindruck von unsch√∂nen Rucklern und Tearing getr√ºbt. Das ist, besonders zu Beginn des Spiels, noch sehr √§rgerlich, allerdings wird man im Laufe der Zeit so in das 50er Jahre Feeling und die knallharte Mafiawelt gesogen, dass die wenigen technischen Unzul√§nglichkeiten zunehmend in den Hintergrund r√ºcken.  Und f√ºr alle Liebhaber klassischer Musik gibt es, wie bereits angerissen, auch ordentlich was auf die Ohren: Mafia 2 wartet mit √ºber 100 Songs aus den 40er und 50er Jahren auf. Gepaart mit den realistischen Waffensounds, dem melodischen Dr√∂hnen von mehrzylindrigen Motoren und den wunderbar authentischen Umgebungsger√§uschen, wie aufs Autodach prasselnder Regen oder quietschende Reifen, erlebt jeder Gamer ein spielbares Klangerlebnis der Extraklasse. Fazit: Mafia 2 f√§ngt das Flair einer amerikanischen Gro√üstadt in der Mitte des 20. Jahrhunderts perfekt ein. Die knapp 10 st√ºndige Story wird interessant erz√§hlt, auch wenn sie stellenweise sehr vorhersehbar abl√§uft. Technisch √ºberzeugt das Spiel auf voller Linie, abgesehen von Rucklern und Kleinigkeiten wie Tearing oder stellenweise matschigen Texturen. Auf eine, auch nach Spielende, frei erkundbare Open-World mit etwaigen Nebenmissionen muss man aber leider verzichten. Wer allerdings auf Mafia-Action in einer wunderbar designten amerikanischen Fiktiv-Metropole steht, wird mit dem, mittlerweile f√ºr einen relativ schmalen Taler zu habenden Spiel seine helle Freude haben.

text: good
text_translate: This game is no masterpiece, but it sure as hell is fun. The game itself feels somewhat like a Grand Theaft Auto/Assassin's Creed clone since the protagonist, Alex Mercer, does a lot of hijacking, and stealth is involved in a lot of missions. However, it is still fun and takes a different approach by making the main character a shapeshifter with a motive that seems more anti-hero than heroic. Pros: -Fun mechanics -Awesome upgrades/powers (my personal favorite is the Claw power) -Has the unique ability to allow you to shapeshift into anyone -Decent story -Doesn't hold back on the gore -Some missions are challenging but not impossible Cons: -Missions can be repetitive -Voice acting is a bit stale -Graphics are dated (it's not unplayable but if your looking for graphics as good as The Witcher 3, Rise of the Tomb Raider, or recent GTA games, you may want to lower your expectations) -A lot of escort missions involving tanks... need I say more? -Achievements would have been a nice add since collecting the landmarks/hints and doing the challenges don't really feel satisfying enough (just a personal prefrence). All in all, this game has it's flaws but if you're having a rough day and want to kick back and beat the crap out of some zombie-like creatures, or if you just enjoy parkour and stealth games in general, this game is for you. I would just like to add that I recommend buying the game during a sale, as $20 is a lot to spend on this game. I bought it on sale for $4 and it was totally worth it.

text_translate: Great game. Although short, fun up to 3 hours, you can focus a lot and strain your eyes when looking for items. I did it 3 times because of the achievements, because I wanted to have 100%, but I didn't get bored of this game and I would love to pass it again. Even if you go through the main story, there is also an additional adventure in the additions, which I am very happy with. Although this adventure is short (max. 30 minutes), I was not bored with it. The plot is very polished and the game differs from the real world. The music is in great contrast to the game. And this is the first game based on the so-called Escape The Room which I went through and it is a pleasure. The game doesn't take much and the costs aren't that huge. So if you like pirate and sea games and you don't have a lot of disk space, or you have a weak PC for a game like ACIVBF, Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart is just for YOU! Of course, it is an honor for Poles that they created a game that has been Greenlighted, and foreigners can hide; D

text_translate: For those who are not in the subject, a top-end remake, I recommend it for purchase. For everyone else who went through the original - spoilers ... And so what we have. And we have a cool rethinking of the second part of the cult horror series Biohazard / Resident Evil. Briefly about the plot - it hasn't changed much, so as not to violate the canon. The difference is in the small details. In 1998 the company "UMBRELLA", and specifically Vasily and Anna Probirkin, cooked all sorts of vile things, viruses, borsch, meth, etc. in the underground laboratory. And suddenly, bam, Vasya banged the G virus, Anka said to him - "what kind of G did you cook?", But let's not be distracted! In short, the information that G is ready has leaked outside the laboratory and, of course, "polite people" have come for him. Such people burst into a "white coat" and say - "bro, give a virus", he is not of this type. They threatened with guns, tried to snatch from Probirkin's hands to snatch a suitcase with test tubes. They say - "Chumodan ways", but he is - "not on the way." They are his bang bang, and he is like - "ah sick", well, in general, the doctor is depressed (. But then this turn happened and our doctor is such a hob, and injects himself with a zanykanny dose of the virus G. Then Anka, his wife runs up. Are you a drug addict? I always knew !!! ", and he writhes like that all over, mutates a dofiga, and figures out to break completely evil commandos. Having overtaken the kids in the dirty sewer, he breaks them, a suitcase, test tubes, common sense, and as it turned out, the fate of the city residents is upstairs RATS. Yes, yes, they are the very ones, these small rodents carried the virus all over the city. And then the fun began. Panic, everyone is eating each other, zombies, gay parades, strikes and other things. Now we turn to our heroes. Leonid Sergeevich Kennedy and Clara Krasnopolskaya meet at a gas station, not far from the city. We chose a good time to arrive in Enotograd, damn it. In short, at the gas station, it's clear zombari, firing. Are they such WTF? And they drove into the city, well, normal in general? Well, according to the plot, they have business in the city , so the story is spinning, achievements turbid. Then a sudden fuel truck separates our heroes, and they each go their own way. As we can see, everything is the same as before. The difference is, as the details say. The changes affected game mechanics and some locations, their sequence, etc. And so everything is recognizable, the police station, the library, the garage, the STAAAAAARS office ... ahem ... ahem ... Sorry, Nemesis has moved in. We run around the police station, shoot off the arms, legs, heads of former homosapiens and other representatives of the fauna. We are looking for all sorts of things in order to go further, everything is the old fashioned way. The remake is awesome, the locations are recognizable at first sight, but have been changed to match the new mechanics. Obsolete parts, such as giant spiders, have been cut, but that's okay, the game hasn't suffered. Mr. X is in place, Ada Vongovna in a red dress is in place. Personally, my opinion - this was supposed to be Resident Evil 6. And not that shooter for the evening (well, or several evenings). There is everything you need, puzzles, scarecrows, a shortage of cartridges (if you are crooked), well, I'm telling you all this is clear for a long time. We are waiting for a remake of the third part. And instead of an assessment, here's a song for you: And now the battle is repeated, And the heart is disturbed in the chest! And Lyonka is so young, And young Nemesis is ahead! And I'll go chase the fourth survivor ...

text_translate: This is a very short but sweet mod. It's only 2 maps long, but it really feels like something valve could have made. The combat scenarios are very well done, and showcase the combine AI better than a lot of actual HL2 maps do. The path you have to take is always clear, but at the same time, the puzzles do make you think a bit. It's also a very good looking mod. The lighting makes it very atmospheric, whether it's a lush summer day, or an underground facility.  The difficulty is perfectly tuned, i played through the entire thing on hard mode and felt challenged without it ever becoming too hard.  Not much about this mod stands out that much, but my impression as a whole, was very good.  If you like HL2 and the episodes and want more, this is for you. Papa bless whoever made this

text_translate: If I would use one word to explain "Always sometimes monsters" it would be intresting. You start in the beginning of the game choosing (not creating) your hero and your special someone, and the first thing that supprised me in this game was that you can choose gender and if the relation is beetween two girls or guys or one of each and still not affect the story (except some spelling errors). You then start the game after one year (after you selected your hero) just to find out that your significant other has left you and she will get married in the end of the month (and you are invited). But you are broke and it is a long way to the wedding, which means that you need to get money and it is here the game becomes intresting. During your journey through the land (well a part of the land) you will meet many choices that can challange your ethics but you will gain money becouse of it and you will note everything in a journal (to be honest it's up to you if you want to write in it or not at the end of the day in the game). Which even if you think that what you do is not so bad it might be so much worse than you thinked.  The story has multiply endings and how it ends depends on you. The music in this game is good but not great and there are some systems in the game I think could be better like the boxing system that can feel quite randomly or at least thats how it felt for me. The music in the game is good but can be a little repetativ. if there was something I wish was in this game it would be a run function becouse I wanted to go faster sometimes. some tips when playing the game is that when you choose a hero and a speciall someone, pick gender and names like the real life version of you and your significant other (girlfriend/boyfriend, crush or Husband or wife). Personally I think that will help you get into the game and a better understanding for what you would do for her or him. But thats just something I think would help the game experience. With all that said I give "Always sometimes monsters" an 8/10 = great game. I could not stop playing before I was done but I only recomend this game to people who have patience doing chores sometimes (becouse the events in each town has a limit) so with that said I have one final question before I end this.                                          How far are you willing to go for your significant other?

text_translate: I think this game is a very carefully crafted game and definitely a masterpiece RPG. The graphics, world view, atmosphere and music are outstandingly good. The battle is a turn-based system, and it is worth mentioning that the enemy AI is smart. If you play on Classic difficulty or higher, it will be wiped out if you are not careful. If you can't win the battle because the difficulty explorer is prepared in the beginner rescue mode, you may want to try it. There is a concept of skill and it will be difficult to win the battle unless you fight by making full use of it. There are also elements such as crafting and blacksmithing, and various items can be created. Items dropped from enemies and treasure chests will randomly drop items with damage bonuses of various attributes (fire, wind, earth, water) and items with additional stats. It is a game with charm that you can play all at once to the end with perfect quantity and quality of quests. Unfortunately, it is difficult to solve some mysteries, and there are some parts that cannot be understood without looking at the capture site. Even considering this point, it is still an excellent RPG, and it is a game that I want many people to play.
A really cool game for you to play with your friend and make fun of; -;

It is a harder version, and more fun one too.

A puzzle-game where you control a line of light and have to guide other lines of light or evade them. On your way to the end of each level you meet lots of friends and foes, have a happy time together and a sad farewell. Yes, I'm still talking about the same game. Linelight slowly introduces the player to every new mechanic you need to solve the puzzles and reuses some of them now and then, but not to a point where it would get repetetive. Some of them are simple switches you have to activate, others are quite complicated and include magnets and good timing. It is quite challenging at times, especially when you have to get the timing just right, but not too hard to make someone ragequit; the awesome and calming soundtrack will keep everyone in a good mood anyway. As mentioned above, at the end of each world you will meet other lines of light that will accompany you on your journey and help you to solve some of the puzzles. And that's where it gets kind of emotional. Yes, emotions in a puzzle game without an actual story or any written text! And that's what I think is kind of fascinating about this. Conclusion: This is a very cute, challenging puzzle game. It took me about 8 hours to get 100% completion, which is a good amount of playtime. If you're into puzzle-games that at some occasions not only need a bit of thinking, but also quite some skill and right timing, you will like Linelight. And if you're able to feel empathy for some pixels, you're going to love it.

text: If Douglas Adams and Terry Pratchett had teamed up to make Skyrim for the Super Nintendo waaay back in the 1990s, the end result would have been... well, probably terrible, as neither of them were game developers.  Luckily they never tried, so the developers of Mad Nords were free to unleash their own silly version of this nifty mashup on the world. Mad Nords:  Probably an Epic Quest is a retro-styled RPG that features weird, quirky humor along with the open world and quest-branching system of an Elder Scrolls or Fallout game.  The player starts out as a level 1 cannibal/bureaucrat/(insert unusual class of choice) looking for a cucumber for his wife in the next town over. Of course, this simple fetch quest won't be as easy as it should be, and so begins the main questline. As you are continually redirected to new locations to continue with your main, cucumber-seeking quest, the overwhelming temptation to fall into the usual RPG standard of speaking to every person and breaking into every house will eventually get the better of you.  A few hours later, you'll realize that you've explored several towns and dungeons, completed a dozen sidequests, and geared yourself up with a stupendous bladed fork of +3 strength and 15% critical chance - but never really got any closer to finding that cucumber.  Which is just as it should be, as any player who has spent hundreds of hours on an Elder Scrolls game without actually beating the main quest can tell you. Mad Nords' retro graphics and strange sense of humor are pleasantly enjoyable, making this game a fun way to while away a Saturday morning.  The game offers an abundance of fairly amusing quests, plenty of magical loot, and quite a few useful skills to invest in as you level to offer some RPG-progression.  Each starting class also features a few unique skills, which adds variety and even replayability if you want to try a different character.  I do not know how much content the end product will have (this is an Early Access title), but I do know that I came nowhere close to finding my cucumber after several hours of playtime.    Mad Nords is an entertaining parody of open-world questing with a very reasonable pricetag.  I would definitely recommend trying out this quirky game if you get a chance.

text: This is the first time I've played through Dark Messiah, and for a game that came out in 2006, this game holds up incredibly well. The combat system is fluid and makes you feel like you're actually in control of the weapon in your hand. Plenty of times I found myself patting myself on the back for how badass I just looked in-game. The story is fun and interesting, albeit a bit cliche (which is honestly kind of expected with this type of genre.) It is a bit buggy, though. The game probably crashed 5 or 6 times throughout my playthrough, 2 of which were during the final boss battle. So make sure to save often. Overall, great game. I had a blast with this one, about 10 hours of playtime in one run. Definite replay value to try different builds, weapons, and skills.

text: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare is a first-person shooter like any Call of Duty game but with a Cyberpunk theme. -- Jonathan Irons (Kevin Spacey) The game is set in 2054, with chaos and war slowly coming to an end. It's filled with advancements in technology such are warfare technology and even domestic technology. The game takes you around the world including locations such as the United States of America, Iraq, Nigeria and Greece. -- Mitchell The game features many gameplay mechanics and tools such as wall climbing, grapples, and Exo suits. There's 2 standard Exo suits, the Assault suit and Specialist suit; a 3rd version, used once is the A.S.T. suit, basically a mech/tank suit. There are other tools like mute mines that mute all sound near it. The various tools and mechanics used throughout the game are used at certain points and part of the missions. -- Jonathan irons -- Jonathan Irons Graphically, the game looks amazing at max settings and 1440p. It could be much better, yet it can be overlooked due to the game not intending to be a graphical masterpiece, it's about the gameplay. The best parts are the design rather than graphical quality. The technology looks awesome, with great designs of armor, vehicles and machines. Character models look good and the style of the Atlas corporation is slick, professional, organised and powerful. The audio of the game is pretty good. Music comes is well at key moments  yet I felt it tried to push the sad music during sad scenes a bit much. The lack of character development for some didn't help either. Where the audio really shines is the sound effects. Buullet impacts and explosions sound phenominal and make you seem tactical yet powerful. Subtly things such as walking in the A.S.T. suit is implimented well too.

text_translate: Scribblenauts Unlimited is one of the best games I have played. Why? Because you can do anything in this game. All you have to do is type in the name of something in English, e.g. "apple" (translation - apple) and you have a beautiful red apple in the game. You can write the adjectives "big" and "purple" and you have a big purple apple. You can do just about anything, and if something is not there, you can either do it yourself (there is a function in the game, thanks to it we can modify objects) or download steam from the workshop. The plot of this game is very, very unusual. We play as Maxwell, he has a mother (Julie), a father (Edgar), 40 brothers and one sister (Lily). Lily gets a magic globe thanks to which she can travel around the world, and Maxwell gets a magic notebook. If he writes the name of an object in it, that object will appear next to him. For some reason, Lily begins to turn to stone. To disenchant it, we must collect Stars and their shards. (Of course, this is only a short and incomplete description of the plot. If you are interested and curious why Lily turns into stone, and why we have to collect Stars, I recommend you buy it and see for yourself.) +: -Very pretty and pleasing to the eye graphics -interesting heroes (the ability to change Maxwell's features, etc.) -Very pleasant game -Playful with useful, i.e. you can learn English vocabulary (use a dictionary or google translator during the game) -Steam Workshop-Wonderful Music (Edwin's Farm) -In some we have to show off our skills -: -No Polish language -We have to show dexterity in some tasks (I gave it as a plus and minus because some levels in the tasks may be too difficult for children) Summary: The game is great, it stimulates the imagination, teaches English which is why we can count it as an ideal game for children. We only have to teach them first, e.g. to use a google dictionary or translator. But it is also good to play for older people, for example I am an example.

text: version of  Very low requirements, could even say none. :D Supported on Windows, Mac and Linux. It's easy to undo and restart in case you mess up.  8 ambient relaxing soundtracks. Thumbs up for those! Also, connect more dots to hear a nicer sound. ;) Game was pretty nice and relaxing. Also, a tiny brainteaser, haha. Features a lot of achievements with nice texts on them. Great for achievement showcasing! ;) Also, a great game for 100% achievements. You'll have all right as you finish the whole game.  Give it a try, it's free! ^-^

text: Counter-Strike Global Offensive contrary to popular belief is not actually an fps shooter... Because it is much more than that, Counter-Strike Global Offensive otherwise known as "CSGO" is a psychological thriller, It's actually quite enthralling that at a surface level this 2012 arcade fps shooter (based on the original Counter-Strike originally launched back in November 9th of 2000) seems quite innocent and simple almost as if it were comparable to its competitors (ex. Call of Duty, Rainbow Six Siege, Etc) but after more than 2800 hours i can confirm that it surely is not as simple as it may seem. There are so many numerous factors to compute and process each and every second you are playing this game from every corner, angle, box, wall, half wall, barrel, plant (yes plant), doorway, door, pillar, and even possible boosting spots there may be someone hiding away preying on innocent new or inexperienced players. And if that's not enough good luck or fortuna when trying to learn the game because you have to learn communication, aim, map awareness, crosshair placement, economy management, pistol aim, AWP flicks, grenade spots, smoke spots, pop flashes, positioning, bomb plant positions, retake ability, bunny hopping, spray control and most importantly how to get kills. This game is an incredible exercise for your brain because every second every neuron in your body will be firing on all cylinders as the excitement of jump peaks, rushes, and angle holders will surely fill your brain up every time you get into a game. If it wasn't obvious so far i am very passionate about this game something i cannot express for many others of its kind, it is truly amazing that every year since late 2015 i have put in as many hours into CSGO as i have any other game in my library combined. I highly recommend you check out the 20 year old franchises arguably best game yet.
text_translate: Probaly one of the best game's I've played for a few years!  Also metro 2033 redux! <3

text: Obra maestra de Red Barrels, chap√≥ de nuevo para el estudio franc√©s creado por Philippe Morin (Prince of Persia: Sands of Time, Assassin‚Äôs Creed & Uncharted: Drake‚Äôs Fortune), David Chateauneuf (Dise√±ador: Prince of Persia: Sands of Time, Assassin‚Äôs Creed y Splinter Cell: Conviction) y Hugo Dallaire (Director Art√≠stico: Splinter Cell y Army of Two). Este juego te pondr√° la piel de gallina, te sentir√°s perseguido, te llevar√°s alg√∫n susto, pero la sensaci√≥n de agobio es impresionante, el ambiente que se crea con la m√∫sica y los sonidos te llevar√° a amarlo o odiarlo. NO LEAS ESTO SI NO HAS JUGADO AL JUEGO / NO LEAS ESTO SI NO HAS JUGADO AL JUEGO WARNING SPOILER WARNING  SPOILER WARNING  SPOILER WARNING  SPOILER WARNING  SPOILER  WARNING En esta segunda entrega (bajo mi punto de vista, claramente influenciada por obras maestras del terror como "El Resplandor", "La Profec√≠a" o "La semilla del Diablo") nos meteremos el la piel de Blake Langermann, un periodista que trabaja con su mujer Lynn (Iker Jim√©nez y Carmen Porter), vamos tras la pista de de una mujer llamada Jane Doe, que apareci√≥ embarazada de 8 meses en una carretera del extenso desierto americano, y termin√≥ suicidandose en un hospital. Con la teor√≠a del asesinato y una buena hist√≥ria para esta pareja de periodistas vuelan en helic√≥ptero hacia el lugar, pero poco antes de llegar al pueblo de Temple Gate, los motores fallan y el helic√≥tero se estrella. Malheridos vamos a buscar a Lynn y al piloto, pero no hay nada m√°s que el el helic√≥ptero en llamas, desde ahora nustra misi√≥n es encontrar a Lynn y salir de all√≠. Nuestro primer encuentro ser√° con la secta de Sullivan Knoth "El testamento del nuevo Ezequiel" o "El culto", ellos piensan que la llegada del fin del mundo est√° cerca con el nacimiento de un ni√±o, que ser√° el anticristo. Tendremos que huir de estos fan√°ticos hasta llegar a una iglesia donde encontraremos a una Lyn claramente afectada y embarazada, como es eso posible? si no hace ni 3 horas que estabais juntos... . Mientras tratamos de huir entre el profundo bosque de la mano de Lynn "el culto" nos da caza, y cuando creemos que vamos a morir aparece en escena una nueva secta "Los herejes"(son una rama m√°s radical de la secta y adoradores de sat√°n, que cree que el anticristo nacer√° del vientre de nuestra Lynn), ellos matar√°n a nuestros captores y nos dejar√°n con vida, pero se llevan Lynn. Tras recuperarnos y avanzar descubrimos una parte de la secta "El Culto" que son repudiados y viven aislados y enfermos de S√≠filis y Gonorrea, en condiciones infrahumanas, pero siguen siendo fieles a "EL Culto" as√≠ que est√°n enfrentados a "Los herejes". SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER SUPER SPOILER En mitad de todo esto tendremos unas visiones en las que apareceremos en una escuela cat√≥lica, o bien siendo adultos, o bien siendo ni√±os, y se nos cruza la hist√≥ria de Jessica Gray, pero por qu√©? quien √©s?.  Ese es nuestro colegio, y esos s√≥n nuestros recuerdos, ah√≠ conocimos a la que es nuestra mujer a d√≠a de hoy, pero adem√°s, los remordimientos de conciencia de lo que ocultamos en aquel momento de nuestra infancia con la muerte de Jessica nos perseguir√°n. El Padre Loutermilch, un profesor, nos hizo su colaboradore y encubridor en el  asesinato de Jessica, coaccionandonos para decir que se ahorc√≥ porque quer√≠a suicidarse. Pero los recuerdos nos persiguen, ella era nuestra amiga. Debemos ir desvelando que no se sucid√≥ como hizo creer el Padre Loutermich, sin√≥ que era violada repetidamente por ese cura y √©l la mat√≥ en un arrebato rompiendole el cuello y arrojandola escaleras abajo. Nos perseguira Loutermilch en su forma demon√≠aca por el colegio mientras encontramos todas las anotaciones para ver el final alternativo del juego. Hay dos finales con s√≥lo una ligera diferencia, en uno no se descubre la trama del cura y Jessica aparece pidiendonos que recemos con moratones y el cuello roto, yel final alternativo donde aparece sin ninguna herida y esque hemos descubierto toda la verdad. TOMA SPOILER TOMA SPOILER TOMA SPOILER TOMA SPOILER TOMA SPOILER TOMA SPOILER TOMA SPOILER Por qu√© las visiones? como que embarazada?que tiene que ver con Outlast 1?se les ha ido la pinza? colacao o nesquik?  La corporaci√≥n Murkoff, mucho antes de los sucesos de Outlast 1, hab√≠a realizado experimentos en esa poblaci√≥n de los ca√±ones de Arizona con algo a√∫n m√°s experimental que en Mount Massive, que fu√© adquirido por la corporaci√≥n Murkoff a√±os despu√©s de pasar por aqu√≠. Debido a esos experimentos tendremos las visiones al tener contacto con los personajes, los cuales tienen visiones igual que nosostros, en su caso con la llegada del fin del mundo y el anticristo, y nosotros tendremos que lidiar con eso y adem√°s con los remordimientos del pasado) El embarazo de Lynn no es un embarazo corriente, al parecer es un embarazo psicosom√°tico, resultado de exponerse a los experimentos de Murkoff, o eso parece indicar cuando Lynn dice al dar a luz "ahi no hay nada" tambi√©n Outlast 1 se repite en varios documentos el embarazo psicosm√°tico como s√≠ntoma habitual entre las mujeres despu√©s del tratamiento y enla sombra que se ve cogiendo el beb√© no hay beb√©. (Pura suposici√≥n) espero tener un DLC desde el lado de Lynn o que aclare la hist√≥ria m√°s. A consecuencia del nacimiento la secta decide que ha fallado en su misi√≥n y hacen un suicido colectivo, que √©s lo que se ve al final cuando salimos con el beb√© en brazos y vemos a todos los habitantes muertos antes de tener la √∫ltima visi√≥n. Para m√≠ √©s una obra maestra del terror llena de t√≥picos muy bien encajados y que dan miedo y angustia. Personalmente me gustar√≠a tener m√°s iluminaci√≥n y claridad en el juego para poder ver y disfrutar los peque√±os detalles que son muchos y muy buenos. Puntuaci√≥n 10 de 10

I would recommend it to every player who played free to play MMO's, just to see how the cash shop can be made right. 10/10

text: Jesus Christ $23.99?  TL;DR  buy it, you won't see it again at this price or even half
text_translate: If anybody ever liked playing CoD or Battlefield multiplayer games on Hardcore mode where the bullet damage is increased and there's no map then this game is for you. At first, I was dying alot and I mean ALOT. Then I started to get the flow of this game. If a player rushes, better know what you're doing because 1-5 shots from any gun then BAM you're dead. Not for the easily frustrated I must say. The matches can be quite intense because the players usually has to depend on their teammates to change the course of the game. There are smoke grenades and bullets flying everywhere so thinking tactical is helpful. Yes there are camping "chameleon" snipers like in Battlefield but for the most part they are good at helping out the team. Cant say much about about the co-op. Best advise I can give for noobs is take your time, kill when needed, and play the funking objective (ptfo). Allahu Akbar!!!!!

text: When this first got announced i instantly fell in love with it as i really loved factorio and thought this looked exactly like it but with far better graphics. There is something about starting with nothing and slowly gathering things up to making a giant factory and watching your hardwork make thousands of things each second, its just so satisfying.  So when this first came out on the epic store i did download and buy it on there and i was not disappointed in the slightest, It was everything the gameplay trailers showed and more. Fast forward to today and its on update 3 with tons more content and released on steam, Now i know you're probably thinking why buy this twice and steam this and epic that, But I wanted to show coffee stain some more support for making a fantastic game and yes i did want/hope for some steam features like a potential workshop support for modding (Please Coffee Stain make it happen) But apart from all that this game is definitely worth the current asking price. I can't wait to see where coffee stain takes this game and very much look forward to it.
text_translate: Opinion: It was super worth every penny spent on this deluxe version, not counting 3 more guaranteed passes and exclusive items from both the pass and Shadowkeep. I recommend.

text: A simple, yet beautiful heartfelt game. A tale about a boy going through his journey by delving into the rituals of passage. By establishing and building healthy relationships with a plethora of the interesting and engaging NPC's we meet in the esoteric story, we see the foolproof tale of ascension towards manhood. I will not lie, there were quite some tear jerking scenes where the emotional turmoil was a bit tad much to handle. Regardless, I will have to give this game a two thumbs up. Perfect for family gatherings, or just playing with friends.

text: It's extremely good! And the quality is stunning! Even if the game is 6-7 years old you can't stop playing it! The combat system might not be flawless and there are buggs that happens, but compared to other games that old it's still on the top list of yesturday and today! You really feel like a part of the game and it's characters. And the game can be run on almost any computer since the computer i have right now is crap but even with fraps it runns in amazing 40 FPS! This game is worth every single cent if not more then it's labeled, buy it and you will have a blast with a die-hard community that never dies over 7 years ;)
text_translate: Well what to say about Fable Anniversary, already for the connoisseurs of the Saga this installment is a Remaster of The Lost Chapters, an incredible game from the Adventure / Action era. Fable Anniversary gives some improvements to its old delivery improving the setting, modeling, landscape and other objects that leaves it more alive for this time even. In addition to bringing a good arsenal of skills, armor, weapons and a variety of objects to use. Along with its magnificent soundtrack that will accompany us on our adventure. If you have already played the old title, this installment is highly recommended for its improvements in addition to remembering old times, much better if you see it in an offer. If you are new to this and want to play this title for the first time, I will leave you a small summary of its history. - In Fable we put ourselves in the shoes of a child who throughout our journey we will decide to be a Hero or Villain, that will depend on your decisions that you are making throughout the adventure in the world of Albion, as we become our adults Acts of goodness or badness will change our appearance, it should also be noted that throughout our age we will get older, where our face and body hair will be affected. Also in Fable we can modify our appearance, armor, our haircut and beard. Our character will have the duty to save and fight a battle with his fearsome rival Jack of Blades to save his family and the land of Albion. Some negative points of the title are its targeting system and controls, but if you usually play with a controller this is easily solved since the game is made to play more comfortable this way and last but not least its scarce content in Mods, They promised a lot but the tools were very limited. With nothing more to say, thanks for reading my little analysis. A big greeting from Chile

text_translate: Remakes are often poorly implemented and keep annoying me. I gambled all parts of Resi (except RE3), and unfortunately I have to say that everything got worse and worse after Resi 4. Therefore skepticism towards this remake. But luckily unfounded! Graphics, atmosphere, soundtrack are terrific! When was the last time I was so scared? The trip through the police station is great fun, and lots of details complete the picture perfectly. When the Tyrant (MrX) appears for the first time, however, the leisurely exploring is over;) In my opinion, Capcom has done everything right here and that's exactly what Resi fans want. - Fear - a small selection (but not at the beginning) of weapons - little ammunition - little medicinal herbs -The zombies (lovingly called customers by me) are now opening the door and are also sometimes on the move, I think that's great. - There is also a Mr. X Tyrant here who is always on the heels, sometimes he is so persistent that you can solve the puzzle before Mr. X gives you an ankle swing. The only negative point would be the German syncro but you can just play it in English, so that's half the game. Thank you very much Capcom 10/10

text: Bonjour √† tous, Pour ma premi√®re √©valuation je vais vous parler de dayz le standalone. pour commencer parlons du type de jeu c'est un Zombiesurvival/FPS*/TPS** en clair vous incarn√© une personne qui √©volue dans un monde infest√© par de zombies mais ceux-ci ne sont pas le plus grand danger qui rode autour de vous. Et oui bien d'autres attendent le moment opportunt pour vous oter la vie. Comme vous avez pu le lire ce jeu est un Zombie survival mais la r√©alit√© va plus loin que √ß√†. Donc comme dans tous survival qui se respectent vous allez devoir vous nourrir, vous garder au chaud, vous √©quiper pour vous garder sain et sauf et ainsi affronter les zombies dans de bonne conditions, mais pas que. En effet votre plus grand alli√© se r√©velera √™tre votre plus grand ennemie. Tout depend des gens qui composent le serveur. Le libre arbitre, l'instinct de survie, l'√©tat mental et les envies de chacuns y r√™gnent en maitre. Les autres joueurs seront pour vous une main salvatrice ou le doigt qui appuie sur la gachette. Maintenant venons en aux points positif et n√©gatif. Les plus :  + de tr√®s beau graphisme si vous avez la b√©cane qui suit.  + le temps qui s'√©coule comme dans la vrai vie. + les lev√©/couch√© de soleil,la nuit, la pluie et le froid. + Le cannibalisme et la folie qui vient avec ! + La diversit√© des armes et objets que l'ont peux utilis√©. Les moins : - Les hackers bah oui comme dans tout jeux de FPS/TPS. - Les bug encore tr√®s pr√©sent mais il sagit d'une version Alpha*** donc on peux pr√©tendre qu'ils seront r√©gl√©s pour la sortie officiel En conclusion Bohemia nous offre un bon titre malgr√® les probl√™mes de developpement auquel ils ont du faire face. La seule peur que j'ai c'est celle qu'Arma 3 √©tant fini sorte un mod zombie et vole la vedette √† notre cher DayZ qui lui est bas√© sur la technologie d'Arma 2. *FPS : First Personnal Shooter ou jeu de tir en vue √† la premi√®re personne **TPS : Third Person Shooter ou jeu de tir en vue objective ou troisi√®me personne *** Version Alpha : Version de jeu encore en developpement.
text_translate: I do not wish to sound like an advertisement, but according to a certain interpretation of the symbolism behind the Silent Hill series, Pyramidhead plays the role of a personification of the emotion of guilt. Now... tell me how can you possibly not be hyped about playing as a magnificently-colossal, enormously brutal personification of excruciating guilt?? Perhaps you are not that evil? - then you should play the survivor instead :p *Edit: -The DLC also includes a charm for both killers and survivors straight from the lore of Silent Hill based on The Seal of Metatron. -Lisa Garland and Alessa Gillespie skins are available for purchase from the in-game store(prepare your wallets).

text_translate: a

text: -There are a total of 6 chapters, with a boss encounter for each. Early stages can be pretty easy, but it can get difficult later on, especially on higher difficulty. It can take you a few attempts during later boss encounters before you figure out their attack pattern and take them down! -The visuals are fantastic for a SHMUP ‚Äì everything is crisp and fluid. I really love the excellent art aesthetics and the look for the mechas. -Also, there are full Japanese voice overs for all of the characters (it's actually pretty good!) Subtitles are available, but you won't be reading much of it during intense fights! -3 attacks are available to you (4 if you count the EX special which has 3 variants) and each attack has a secondary function. Scatter shots can lock on enemies around you, focus shots lock on enemies in a targeted direction and blade attacks can be used to dash across the screen. Destroying enemy shots with the blade will charge the EX meter faster. -You‚Äôll become real familiar with your arsenal ‚Äì you won‚Äôt just spam one attack, especially if you‚Äôre a score chaser. You'll use blade attacks to rack up points, switch between shots depending on your position, cancel enemy projectiles with your blade, line up foes and dash across the screen with the blade dash to destroy enemies or avoid danger, and find the perfect moment to unleash your EX special to annihilate your foes. -You can take some punishment before you die. Your "health" is your shields which recharges over time to a certain degree. -The camera perspective will change during combat keeping each encounter fresh. It switches between side-scrolling, top-down, and 3D perspectives. -Astebreed definitely has replayability. Hard mode is extremely challenging. You also have the option to turn on scoring to test your skills and compete against other players‚Äô scores on the online leaderboards. -There are unlockables! Hard mode, art, model viewer, and the ability to start with a different mecha becomes available after beating the game.

text: 4/5. One of the best otome game I've played so far. I highly recommend it!  ---  This review may contain  In Amnesia: Memories, you first open your eyes to a vast empty space which - you soon learn - is the gateway to many parallel realities. You then meet a spirit (Orion) who basically tells you that he's stuck inside your consciousness; his collision being the cause of your memory loss. The first major choice you make in the game is to pick which reality/world you came from: Heart, Spade, Clover or Diamond, i.e. according to the motifs associated with each of your love interests. There's also an unlockable world (Joker) you can only get after achieving good endings in the other realities.  (5/5) Unlike many other visual novels in which you gradually form a relationship with your chosen love interest, I find it refreshing that in Amnesia: Memories you're already in one at the very start. The five routes (worlds) have a similar theme of you having some sort of relationship issues (plus the memory loss), but the plot in each is very different - giving the game a   Some of the minor characters even have completely different personalities: most notably, Waka, the manager of caf√© you work at. Each route took me about 5-7 hours to complete and the game, around 30 hours. While there are some internal monologues at the end of each route, you are entirely silent unless making a choice. Because of this, I feel that it is   in the story. It's like you're holding a conversation (although one-sided) with Orion throughout the game. Don't worry though, he knows when to make himself scarce during the more romantic scenes. The story itself is lighthearted at the beginning, but around the halfway mark it becomes more suspenseful, tragic and even creepy in some storylines;   Other than that, I truly enjoyed the other routes with Kent's (Clover) and Ukyo's (Joker) being the stand out. At least Kent's route provides some reprieve from the craziness of   And Ukyo...I can probably write an essay on how I feel about his story but I'll just say it's worth experiencing for yourself. There are also a few things I feel that aren't as clearly explained   but overall it's   with only a few, minor typos. I also want to mention the various instances where characters tease you with obscure(?) hints (spoilers really) of what can happen to you in the other routes. I find these very amusing especially if you only realize it after playing a few times.  (3/5) The game   with dialogue branches and unlockable CGs. There are unfortunately   in the game. I would've much preferred to keep all my saves instead of having to overwrite each time I start on a new route. If there is a way to watch the complete ending scenes again, I wouldn't mind as much. But since there's not, I think the game could do with unlimited save slots. The game provides you with a   (shown on the 3rd screenshot) to check the status of your relationship and maybe which ending you get in the end(?), but I think it   The 'Suspicion' meter, in particular, maxes out at some point in the story no matter what you do anyway. The 2 mini games available are simple, short and somewhat enjoyable. What I do appreciate about the Rock-Paper-Scissors mini game is the Hit 'N' Guard mechanic that ensures it relies less on luck and more on your reflexes. It does make the mini game way easier however. There are also a few extra content unlocked after finishing the game including short stories told from the perspective of the love interests that I find interesting. I recommend reading at least Ukyo's.  (3/5) I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the keyboard (and gamepad?)   Although I don't think I would ever need to re-bind anything for this particular game, I do appreciate the devs putting that feature in regardless.   but other than that, I have nothing bad to say about the options menu.  (5/5) Practically   and every voiced dialogue is accompanied by effective use of expressions and eye blinking. The   with little tints of color suit the game in my opinion and   in its simplicity. A close-up of the curtains at the Shinano mountain lodge in a few conversations, however, looked very messy and amateurish but that's just me nitpicking.  (4/5) The   by accomplished voice actors. There are no English voices but the high quality of the Japanese voices more than makes up for it. The  ; it's a bit distracting when their mouths move even when they're not actually saying anything. Tracks used for the background music are generally soft and tranquil but slightly repetitive. I can listen to the opening song all day though and to a lesser extent, the ending song as well. A must try for   of the genre. I can't say if it's worth it for $30 since I bought it on sale. But for $3, I would definitely recommend buying it.

BUY IT NOW....ok, good. I'm glad you bought it. :) Update: Still playing it! Still love it!! :) Many hours in, many more to go! :o

text_translate: I've been a fan of the BattleTech universe for a long time, and this is the first quality strategy game in the last few years. This game has the entire spectrum of the simulator of a commander of a mercenary lance: both battles and the entire spectrum of economic components, such as staff salaries, repair and modification of mechs, transport ... For me, this is the first strategy in which you can lose a battle, lose several units of equipment , but under no circumstances should the payment of bills be deferred. The only drawback is the limitation on landing in one lance, i.e. 4 furs. The plot is rather prosaic: you, a former officer of the Imperial Guard, are helping to restore the deposed empress to rights, at the same time earning money on leftist missions

Buy, buy, I have nothing against it.

text: Good
text_translate: I have been a RE fan since the beginning and while this game does return to survival horror it doesn't do enough to warrant a full 60 dollars. As many RE fans during the years I have been pining for the series to return to its roots with limited resourses, item management, limited mobility, and a decent story.  This game has all that but is it enough? Story: Ok this game has a decent story especially in the beginning. However, the ending areas just fall flat almost like the devs were just ready to finish the game. Extremely linear through the last few areas which is a bit of a let down. The characters were great especially the Baker family and your encounters with each of them. The ending just felt a bit anti climatic they really could have done better. The voice acting is good and I did think the video tapes added a nice touch to the game.  Controls: Controls are solid but the game just feels sluggish. You can block, run,shoot,quick turn,and crouch thats about it. No jumping. Your character has the slowest run in a game ever. Thats not a bad thing though this creates tension. Think Outlast. You will be defenseless a few times and have to hide ala Outlast/Alien Isolation. Graphics: This game despite what most people have said looks great the mansion is highly detailed and a joy to explore, Unless you have a beast of a rig though don't touch internal resolution scaling leave that at 1 or 1.5.  Performance: I had to put some settings down as this game had frame rate drops terribly at times especially when turning a corner. I found if the frames dipped that if I quit the game and came back it would go back to 60. You might have to tweak your settings a bit. Replay value: Ha, now this is a funny one. There is next to zero replay value in this game, no horde mode of any description, no coop modes, no raid,ect. However, Capcom is selling you a 30 dollar season pass for some additional content. There is some free content coming soon though. There are 2 different endings depending on a choice you make over halfway through the game.  Verdict: Ok, I give the devs credit for trying to return to their roots they did a good job overall. However, the game holds your hand a little too much for my liking, the puzzles were an obsolute joke minus one (and everyone knows which one that is) that had me stuck for 20 mins tops. Their were a total of 4 enemy types one of which you see maybe 3 times. The game has good pacing and kept me engaged all the way through but for 60 dollars I wouldn't pull the trigger. If you can try to rent this one or play it on steam share. I do recommend this game but not at full price. The game will take you about 10 hours tops.

text: i guess its ok
text_translate: The Room is divided in 5 chapters and each one offers a different box to solve. Presentation is done from a 3D perspective with a camera that rotates around the boxes so it can be played only using the mouse. You have to manual zoom on zones of interest and find hidden compartments with pieces that will help you progress to the next puzzle. Sometimes you have to use your special lens to find symbols that are not visible to the human eye. I was really impressed with the detail of some boxes, the quality of mechanical animations and the overall environment. There is also a hint system in the game, but I advice to turn it off from the Settings menu. A short game that takes 2 to 3 hours if you don't get stuck for too long on some puzzles. The next game in the series, The Room Two, already has a PC Edition. Can't wait to play it and also to see The Room Three ported from mobiles to a proper PC Edition.
