text: so good
text_translate: Hidden Through Time presents a dynamic point-and-click of hidden objects, that is, the main objective of the title is to find pieces hidden by certain parts of the maps, which can be animals, people or objects. The game has several levels that were based on the periodization of history, which starts in prehistory with men of the stone age, in the age of metals with Egyptian civilization, in the Middle Ages and later in the West in the United States ( XIX century). The scenarios are formed by simple backgrounds of solid colors, together with the characteristics that represent their respective time. In each level a list of hidden objects is given with some mysterious hints to facilitate the searches. In addition, the learning curve is quite satisfactory, according to the progression of the more difficult levels they get. The online mode is the first highlight of this game, because through it you can experience the stages created by other players and leave feedback. The second highlight, on the other hand, goes to the editor mode, which makes it possible to create several levels with a huge variety of items to later publish them. The 2D graphics of the title are well-made, cute, colorful and have a more cartoon-oriented style. Unfortunately in the game there is only one instrumental song, which makes it very repetitive after a certain time, since the sound effects are activated when interacting with something on the map, this allows the game to become more intuitive and dynamic. However, this HOG (hidden objects games) can be recommended for any audience, but mainly for children, because it is a type of game that contributes a lot in the formation of the child's cognitive. Other than that, the game can serve as a great pass of time, being able to yield on average between 3 to 5 hours of gameplay to complete all levels, in addition to the map creation mode. It is worth remembering that the title requires good concentration and great vision, for players who have vision problems, Hidden Through can be very tiring. ‚Ä¢ Well-optimized graphics; ‚Ä¢ In total 19 achievements; ‚Ä¢ Provides 14 languages, including PT / BR ‚Ä¢ Offers level editor; ‚Ä¢ Save in the cloud and compatible with the control. ‚Ä¢ Add more songs to the repertoire; ‚Ä¢ In the Western Town map created by the community, it contains a ‚Ä¢ Correct the sound of the frog that sounds like a bird; ‚Ä¢ Add sounds for animals that do not own, such as the bear, American bison, vulture, ox, cow and raccoon. Fruit of Xbox Live Arcade Castle Crashers arrived shy on PCs winning a remastered version exclusively for Steam, with its diverse arrival players acquired it due to its very affordable price and these players were presented with one of the best beat 'n up ever made, fun playing alone or with friends, Castle Crashers undoubtedly brought people together and entertained a lot of people for a long time. A beat ‚Äòn up game as in the classics of old consoles, your character must advance the levels by hitting enemies and collecting items. The simple storyline tells the story of a kingdom that had its princesses and a powerful kidnapped crystal, you choose one of the four playable characters (during the game other characters will be unlocked), where each character has different abilities and powers, in addition to the faithful squires pets of players who also have different skills. Castle Crashers has an unusual narrative format for today. It is not possible to find a single line of dialogue throughout the game. Not even texts that give details of what is happening or explain the premise of the game are present. In this type of format, the player must interpret the plot as he sees fit. The difference is that, in Castle Crashers, the story is quite evident, mainly thanks to the way all characters, including NPCs, behave on the screen. This is all the result of impeccable art direction. The backgrounds are extremely captivating and the expressions made by the characters while they are being beaten are sensational and very humorous. Combined with nonstop action and a lot of agility, the title becomes absurdly fun, especially when playing locally with others. It is not difficult to spend an entire stage laughing while chopping up the most varied types of opponents through scenarios that are full of diversities. This is something that was very well thought out. The game unfolds through a map that represents the game world, where there are several different stages that the player can access as many times as he wants and whenever he wants. There are also aspects of RPG (very basic, but essential), being quite rewarding and at the same time accessible. As you pass the level, you'll gain new combinations of blows to use against different types of opponents. And, unlike many titles, the old blows do not become obsolete, since the ideal is to have a harmony and intelligence to know when to use a movement against an enemy. The spells, in turn, are quite varied and can serve as a way to take enemies out of combat or cause greater damage. All attacks are upgraded according to points of dexterity spent on attributes of the player's choice: strength, which improves damage; magic, which improves magic attacks and their regeneration; defense, which improves defensive capabilities and the amount of hit points; and agility, which improves speed and long-range attacks. To increase the life of the game, Behemoth has created an Insane mode, which is unlocked after the game is finished for the first time. In this mode, the adventure is much more difficult than usual, something interesting for lovers of challenges. Castle Crashers also has two extra modes, the Arena where the character must face hordes of enemies and All You Can Quaff, a mini-game in which the goal is to eat faster than opponents, a type of modern button crunch, it is worth remembering which are not adjacent to campaign mode and are hobbies. In addition, Castle Crashers brings an excellent online mode, games without falls and very functional, in addition to being multiplayer between platforms, that is, PC players can play together with players from Xbox 360 and PS3. Castle Crashers doesn‚Äôt have any glaring defects, some more caveats deserve to be commented on, the online mode doesn‚Äôt have a well-defined criterion, several times I‚Äôve started games with my character at level 1 and the other players at levels 40, 50 or more, this is complicated, because these higher level players dominate the games and it ends up getting boring, because you become a supporting player in gambling, another little problem is that in some stages there are so many elements on the screen that it is quite confusing to situate yourself and ends up generating some deaths of the characters that could be avoided. Finally, the game's strong point is the quality of all the elements itself, with the small exception of the problems mentioned a few lines earlier, each part was thoroughly produced, resulting in a satisfying, fun and excellent final product. EDIT: When mentioning the other game modes I put the All You Can Quaff mode, but that mode was replaced by the Back Off Barbarian mode, which consists of moving around the scene to the sound of a good soundtrack, without letting the enemy reach.

text: Wow! Just started this game and loving every bit of it! Its one of those games where you can feel the exitement, the rush inside of you!
text_translate: I had the 45% download issue. Solved for me just by easily restarting the game. I personally have been really big fan of Runescape for many years and enjoy playing Rs3, OSRS and even the Classic tho i wasn't playing it when it was released. Anyway, this game is mostly based on things that happens on Runescape 3. The graphical look seems also to be kind of rs3 style -ish. But the general gameplay is based on "basic knowledge" on how to play runescape, which are easily realisable for non familiar with Runescape. It took me awhile to realise how the game ACTUALLY works, since I'm not really into this kind of games usually, but since it was...well...Runescape. I had to give it a chance.  The goal is of course, to get them 99's. Duh. I recommend this game because its very chill, if you don't have anything to do/you're very stressed. Turn your music on and open this game and have fun. Can't wait this to become available on phones soon :)
Darksiders

text: Review for Fritz Chess 17 Steam Edition (english and french) 1. English With Fritz 17, in addition to the Fritz 17 engine, you get a completely new chess engine that was created with the help of a neural network based on the AlphaZero approach. There are also new exciting functions for creating and practicing opening repertoire. Based on LCZero technology, a neural network was trained with Grand Master games for over a year. The developers named the result Fat Fritz, which, however, needs a very powerful NVidea graphics card to achieve the full game strength. The engine also works on a processor of a commercially available personal computer, delivers very interesting results thanks to the neural network, but is actually up to two thousand times faster on the fast graphics card. Fritz 17 introduces repertoire management that is not based on entire variants but on trains. The Fat Fritz Engine refers to the community project Leela Zero (Lc0). Fat Fritz definitely focuses on analysis. With Fritz 17 and Fat Fritz, Chessbase offers every chess player the opportunity to participate in the new analysis techniques with little effort. Since the Fat Fritz program is based on a self-learning neural network, it is free of all templates. What promises success is preferred, regardless of what the theory thinks of it. On the Computer Chess Ratings List of November 23, 2019, Fat Fritz took first place with the impressive Elo score of 3617 points. High performance is already achieved with an RTX 2080 GPU. An RTX 2080 ti graphics card achieves an NPS performance of 37000. There are three Fat Fritz engine versions available: the one controlled by the main processor ("CPU") and an "Open CL" and a "CUDA" version. The latter two require an extra graphics processor in the computer, and only with one of these is the Fat Fritz engine interesting (a largely undocumented tip is that many AMD graphics cards and even the graphics cores built into modern Intel processors support "Open CL", the performance of the integrated graphics cores is low but still much higher than that of the CPU): Fritz 17 is in any case the first commercial program to contain a modified version of the "Leela Zero" Chess Engine. The GPU is not used to actually calculate. While the search is carried out on the CPU like any other engine, the GPU provides the assessments. But even with the best GPU, the search on the CPU only runs with two cores. Using more cores can even be counterproductive, because what is important is not how fast the CPU calculates, but how quickly the GPU can read the results of the neural networks. The classic engines can use two, four, 32 or 128 cores. And each additional core leads to higher computing power. Fat Fritz and Leela do not use additional CPU cores. The Engine Fat Fritz from the Fritz 17 program is the front runner in the CCRL Elo list and has a positive record against all tested programs. Fat Fritz against Leelenstein 11.1: +16 -11 =164 against Lc0 0.23.1 w42850: +17 -8 =167 against Stockfish 11 64-bit 4CPU: +19 -9 =72 against Allie 0.5 nn49921: +58 -3 =131 against Stoofvlees II a14: +51 -8 =121 2. ÂΩì‰∏•ÂÜ¨Êù•‰∏¥Êó∂ÔºåÊàëÊâÄÊúâÁöÑÂ∑•ÂéÇÈÉΩÊòØÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫Âú®Ëøê‰ΩúÔºåÂ∏ÇÊ∞ë‰ª¨Âü∫Êú¨ÈÉΩÂú®ÂÆ∂‰∏≠ÈÅøÂØíÔºåÂè™ÊúâÂ∞ëÊï∞Â∑•Á®ãÂ∏àÂÆàÁùÄÂåªÊä§ÊâÄÁöÑÂ≤ó‰Ωç„ÄÇ text: Par o√π commencer ? Par le fait qu'avoir d√©velopp√© un tel jeu seul rel√®ve de l'exploit surhumain, d√©j√†. Pour r√©sumer le principe : vous h√©ritez de la ferme de votre grand-p√®re, dans un petit hameau d'une r√©gion paisible et isol√©e. Vous devrez commencer une nouvelle vie et prendre soin de votre maison tout en gagnant de l'argent pour am√©liorer votre quotidien. Ce jeu aborde tellement d'aspects qu'il serait difficile de tout mentionner ! En vrac : - Jeu de gestion tout d'abord, car vous devrez g√©rer vos finances, vos r√©coltes, bien configurer vos champs, savoir quelles recettes fonctionnent (plantation, craft, cuisine, etc). - Aspect RPG ensuite, car vous devrez s√©lectionner des comp√©tences pour vous sp√©cialiser dans certaines t√¢ches (meilleure qualit√© de vos produits / plus grande quantit√© de produits √† chaque r√©colte, par exemple). Aussi parce que lors de vos balades dans le village, vous serez amen√© √† faire connaissance avec les diff√©rents habitants, qui ont tous une maison et une personnalit√© propre, et travaill√©e ! Vous pourrez apprendre √† les conna√Ætre, dialoguer un peu avec eux, et vous faire appr√©cier en rendant des services ou en offrant des cadeaux. Vous pouvez m√™me aller jusqu'√† vous marier et avoir des enfants ! Ou alors vous limiter √† avoir des amis partout, si la solitude vous convient. Les amis vous le rendront bien. - Jeu d'arcade, car vous serez amen√© √† parfois vous battre lors de vos aventures dans les souterrains, par exemple. Ou aussi √† faire preuve de dext√©rit√© lors de certains minijeux, comme la p√™che. - Jeu d'exploration, car le village fourmille de petits d√©tails, de lieux cach√©s, de r√©f√©rences et de choses √† d√©couvrir. Et tous ces aspects, Stardew Valley les traite merveilleusement bien. A chaque journ√©e termin√©e dans le jeu, on a envie de se dire "Allez, une derni√®re et apr√®s j'arr√™te", sauf qu'il est rapidement 5h du matin et qu'on est toujours en train d'√©laborer des projets et de courir partout. Les musiques sont tr√®s bonnes, tant√¥t dynamiques, tant√¥t mignonnes, parfois m√™me tristes, mais elles font toujours mouche. Les graphismes sont r√©tro, mais ont un charme tr√®s particulier. Les personnages sont attachants, et l'histoire (oui, il y en a une !) vous r√©serve quelques moments touchants.  Stardew Valley, c'est un bel univers dans lequel se plonger, se poser et r√™ver. Quel que soit votre √©tat d'esprit, le jeu vous aidera √† vous √©vader hors du temps. D'habitude je cite toujours des d√©fauts, mais l√† je n'en ai pas trouv√© de notable qui m√©rite d'√™tre mentionn√©. En plus, le d√©veloppeur continue de travailler dessus et d'ajouter du contenu gratuit. A d√©couvrir absolument !

Great game for me. It has a lot of game modes, from defusing a bomb to killing each other, so I think everyone gets crazy there. This game is especially great when you play it with friends. The game is not demanding at all, I will drive it at rest at 70 fps at FULLHD resolution for the best details. I have played 2.6 hours on this game and in the meantime I managed to play 6 game modes, of which there are 24. The game, as I wrote, can be played in multiplayer mode, but you can play solo there using the singleplayer column. In the game you can embellish the character of your choice, you can change there if you want to have a woman or a man, you can change your hair style, you can change your shirt, shoes, etc .. There is a second version of the game, a hand simulator: survival , which takes place on a deserted island, where your task is to survive, but about another time. For me, the game is very successful and a lot of fun. + sophisticated hand control + you start the game on a medium-power computer over 60 fps at FULLHD + a bunch of game modes + to try all kinds of modes you would have to spend many hours in the game + the game is not expensive, so even those who have it low income - the hand sometimes behaves retarded, it cannot even be controlled I would give the game 9/10 and I recommend it to you if you want to laugh properly.

text: (This review is a 'companion' piece to    I suggest you read his first.) Counterpoint The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim With about 300 hours invested in the game, yet only 23 (of 75) achievements under my belt, I think it's pretty obvious just how irrelevant Skyrim's social and civil problems were to my happiness there. In fact, most of the quests that I actually did complete, were done so, coincidentally. Honestly, it didn't take long for me to realize there were little, or no, rules, in Skyrim, and after 2 or 3 hours I had my own thing going on. I had a nice, cozy house, several loyal  , and I made a comfortable living by treasure hunting, and burgling. I seldom took on odd jobs, and stopped, altogether, doing other people's dirty work. When the war finally broke out, I joined both factions, received various missions and supplies, then, promptly marched off to spend the next 160+ hours just vagabonding. Through gold leafed woods, over frigid white mountain tops (often in my skivvies) I wandered through the wonder, of Skyrim, doing pretty much whatever I pleased. I invented my own challenges and achievements... I ran into a Stormcloak encampment, stripped off my uniform, and shouted "‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• the army!" while mounting the captain's steed. They totally killed me the first 2 tries, but I did get away with it, on the third. Imaginary Achievement Unlocked: Section 8 (Perform and survive 3 consecutive insane actions against the military.) Yes! I wanted to find ways to see beyond Skyrim's  , and explore all her other aesthetic qualities, like art, music, literature, and such. For instance, Skyrim is littered with books and letters, and so, it made sense that we form a Traveling Book Club. During our journeys, if a book caught our eye, we'd stick it in our inventory. Then, after our evening meal, one of us would read their  , aloud. Aranea was partial to books on history, Erandur indulged his voyeurism with journals and diaries, and Lydia.. well, Lydia always chose cook books. Though she took no real interest in the art of cooking, there was something about recipes that she considered profound, and she would read them as if she were reciting a beautiful poem. And so, we traipsed through Skyrim. Minutes to hours, hours to days, days to...   Then, one evening, somewhere around hour 290, I looked at my map and realized that I had been everywhere, and had seen, pretty much, everything. I had promised my allegiance to many, but had given it to none.  I had looted the dead, and robbed the living. I had read every   ever printed. I had done Skyrim to death. The war was still raging, the   still owned the skies, nothing much had changed in that respect. But, that was mainly because the people of Skyrim had been just standing around, waiting for me to make it all better. Instead, I had decided to teach them a valuable lesson about depending, too much, upon others.  As Erandur might've said. "Mara helps those who help themselves." To which, I would've added. "Hey, I never asked to be Dragonborn." I filled my companions inventories with jewels, food, and clothes, then sent them on their separate ways.  Then, I walked to the nearest, highest, snow peaked mountain, and shouted. "Game over!" It was an alternative ending. That was months ago, and looking back, now, I'd still say I had a good, long life, in Skyrim. I may not have much to show for it, stat wise, but a 900+ screenshot legacy, is nothing to sneeze at, either. And, yes, it's true that Skyrim is no better off, now, for my having lived there.  But then, after all is said and done, I kinda doubt that the real world will be either. Such is the life of an underachiever.   Footnote: I actually went back into Skyrim, while I was writing this review. Partially for some reference info, but mostly, just to sneak a visit to my old Whiterun homestead. I guess, it's supposed to be a comfort knowing that  , without us?

text: Breach & Clear Deadline is a topdown shooter, with some tactical strategy involved.  *Early Access Review* (if you would like to watch actual gameplay the link is below) Early Access Gameplay: 1080p 60fps *spoilers*  Things that I have noticed that will most likely be tweaked later. (as of Jan 22) - occasional frame drops in random locations where nothing is happening - menus look pixelated  - the skill tree isn't helpful, most of the things on there are pointless and cost too much. (you would think the first skill to unlock costs 1 as you only get 1 per level right? nope its 3) - confusing map... very confusing - keyboard has multiple actions on certain keys set as default. (real example in game: "Q" switches weapons and opens doors) which should be seperated.  Needs a fixed key rebinding system. - Has seperated Xbox One, Xbox 360 and Playstation controller support which is always nice, though you only use a few buttons. - not much of a variety of enemies - graphics are ok at most, I don't think it'll get much better at full release but that isn't much of a big deal in this style of game. - the objective marker is pointless with the map, it will tell you to go in a direction but tell you to turn backwards 2 feet later? (fixable) Overall, this "review" was written Jan 22, so if you are reading this months later, it is probably inaccurate.  I would hold off on buying this game until a later date. however I do plan on covering the game on my Youtube channel eventually when the game is complete, so if you are interested, be sure to check it out. - Added Jan 25 Extra Notes upon reading other reviews: - People mentioned there is no tutorial, while this is true, the game is more than self explanitory, so for the most part it guides you on the way. (would be cool to have, but not necessary to be added) - Crashes? I have not experienced any. (want to see my PC specs? check my profile)

Cons: -A little bit of a grindfest especially for higher gears and levels. -There is a bug that happens sometimes when you uninstall the game and when trying to play it again later on, it locks out multiverse and other modes until you play for AT LEAST 30 min for them to unlock again. text_translate: Everywhere in the world there is noise, din, vanity, But here there is only snow, emptiness; On the vast expanses there is only a blizzard, Desolation and silence ... It slowly drives you crazy; It's getting harder and harder to keep your sanity; Howl comes from afar, It wakes up animal instincts ... How many days have passed since then, How did you end up here, among the snow and mountains? Days, nights, months, years or centuries ... What, you don't remember, huh? Crazy Yeti ... Say it wrong? Well, take a look at yourself ... Well, bolder, don't be afraid ... Shrouded in furs ... Like a beast, no, not like that; outwardly you are a man, But your gaze has changed, changed, faded ... You are no longer a pilot that you were before, believe me, You are an animal, a wild, merciless beast, That you are ready to kill, not counting losses. Death is close, be careful, calm down your ardor ... Survival is a difficult, very painstaking process, But only where is the line, are you a beast or a man? Survival, life ... Everything is the same in this century, We are all driven through life only by fear or stress ... (c) LoNeSwAnTaN 01/12/2018 1:30 p.m.

text_translate: An appealing puzzle game that invites you to think and puzzle. Genre: Puzzle, Hidden Object and Room Escape Game / Casual Game Pro: + different puzzles (variety); good mix of simple and somewhat "more demanding" puzzles + graphically nicely designed; loving design + trading cards and achievements available + background music and sounds very appropriate (sound can also be muted) + reasonable price-performance ratio (also worth buying outside of a sale) Cons: -from and occurring image flickering when clicking (does not necessarily have to be play) -too short playing time; a puzzle room is a little too little - "story" is too flat; more depth would be desirable. Conclusion: Nice game for in between for those who like to puzzle, puzzle and just want to try something new. For 1.99 ‚Ç¨ you get a small, carefully designed game that can score points just because of its design and the individual puzzles. For this reason, I would like to make a PURCHASE RECOMMENDATION at this point. Tip: There is another Greenlight project in progress that is certainly worth seeing.

text_translate: When we talk about 'FPS' we are directly talking about 'CSGO'. for me the best fps game there is, it has its negative points like the toxic community, hackers, and etc ... but it is really impossible not to put the cs among one of the games that revolutionized the gamer community in the world! Positives: Easy to play casually / professionally Extremely light, you will be able to play csgo even with an i3 without an off board, with the graphics in the low. Negative points: Extremely toxic community, that is, 1 in 3 matches that you enter competitive mode, most likely you will have a 5/10 child cursing the whole team. Long waiting periods in the creation of competitive matches, it can take 5 seconds or 5 minutes to find a match. The menu crashes: the cs menu has a spell because every time you try to change some graphics the game simply stops working for about 10 seconds, so here's the tip, never change graphics in competitive matches. Imbalance: I may be crazy, but there is a lot of imbalance within the game, even though I am in the same rank, because I realize that some people play a lot, and others play little, this being for example in gold 1, the famous smurfs. valve should create a system where it detects smurfs and puts them in their true link ...

text_translate: After having completed the game 3 times and obtained all the achievements I feel that I am worthy of giving a review. Pros. * Blasphemous has a certain linearity but it does not force you to follow a specific path, according to this we can divide the game into 2 parts: the Town of Albero and surroundings up to Esdras, the High Cathedral and surroundings up to Escribar. Of course, you can't skip any boss. * With enough practice you can beat each of the bosses without needing to become a machine, anyway once you get the 5th upgrade for Mea Culpa the game becomes a breeze. * The game rewards calm and analysis of the combats, there are many scenarios in which if you are confident and moving too fast, the game will punish you with a bad jump or a blow that will lead you or to fall into the void or to the thorns. The same happens with combat in general, you must learn how your enemies move to be able to execute or dodge them in an optimal way. * The voice actors are a gem, except perhaps Crisanta who is not bad but does not compare to the rest, for example, when fighting with Escribar and her presentation gives you that feeling that you are fighting a magnanimous being, Crisanta is not . Cons * The fucking thorns, they are far the final boss of the game, it happens a lot with platform games in any case but those of this game were particularly hateful. * The duration of the game is not sooo long, we are not talking about a Castlevania and we must also consider that this started from a kickstarter, but a little more duration would have been appreciated. With 15 hours you already have the game mastered. * As every opinion is subjective and depends on the person, in my case I was not a fan of the music, I am not saying that it is bad, it complies with the immersion of the player to the environment, but on my side it made me a bit uncomfortable in certain sections ( ex. Exposito) In summary, Blasphemous is a good game, and the creators deserve all the support to continue creating similar content and I hope for a longer duration. I had a good time, I suffered a couple of days from quarantine and now I'm waiting for the DLC or sequel. Stay home and take care of a lot of people.

text: Grand Theft Auto 5 is the current latest game from the GTA franchise, after the monumental success of Grand Theft Auto. Rockstar Games decided to make a sequel to the HD universe in sunny Los Santos(inspired by Los Angeles). The game was released on September 17th, 2013 and is to date, the most successful piece of entertainment media. Just to mention in this review I won't mention GTA 5: Online because that it a game on it's own. The gameplay for GTA 5 is a great example of perfection. Everything is brilliantly paced, nothing feels that it was shallow or rushed. Missions end with you finding new things out about the game and its lore. Gunplay is very satisfying, aiming to feel so fluid and responsive. The variety of weapons and their addons is massive, there are 30 weapons all with customizability. Shotguns have a loud and powerful punch, pistols having that firm grip and the snipers having that shrouded effect. The GTA 5 graphics were in 2013 groundbreaking almost 7 years later, that claim still stands. The graphics are absolutely stunning! Rockstar Games really are known for their level of detail. Every piece of shrubbery is unique in its own way. It's amazing how they managed to stuff a world that big in a game.  Before i start  . In GTA 5, you play as 3 main protagonists;  Franklin Clinton - a 25-year-old guy trying to escape gang life and trying to actually do something influential in his life, a newcomer to the criminal life. He is also a talent for driving. Michael DeSanta (Townley) - a 48-year-old trying to live a good life after being a full-time criminal in the late 90s and early 2000s. During a heist in Ludendorff, the United States Michael and one of his partners in crime 'Brad Snider' both were shot after fleeing the police, Brad didn't survive the shot but Michael did. Michael made a deal with the FIB to fake his own death. During that time he tried to cut contacts with his other partner in crime 'Trevor Phillips', which is are next character. Trevor Phillips - a close contact of Michael DeSanta, who in 9 years met new people in the outskirts of San Andreas and founded his own company with Ron Jakowski called Trevor Philips Enterprises. An uprising drug smuggling company trying to get a bigger sponsor to make his company larger. He is also a psychopath and he's talented in aiming and killing. The story feels very good, it all fits together nicely and in the singleplayer campaign, you meet a lot of unique characteristics, which you would never probably meet in real life. The idea of having 3 protagonists is genius in my opinion, mainly because you are able to see certain aspects in the game from different perspectives. GTA 5's level design is of most Rockstar's games, linear and innovative. In every mission, you're given tasks which reap the main goal.  The recreation of Los Angeles is spot on. Having been in LA, I knew exactly where I was going most of the time. Some parts are of course fictional and don't exist in real life, but it's executed so well that it might as well be in real life. Grand Theft Auto 5 is a big game, period. It features over 60 innovative and diverse missions. Besides that, there are a lot of little small quests that don't affect the main story. The game took me over 40 hours to beat the first time, and I enjoyed every single moment of it. I've even become fond of the mission fails. The controls are fluid, responsive and free. Movement by foot is a bit sluggish, but that's to be expected because you have so many vehicles to chose from and walking is only used when necessary. Fun fact, there are currently 464 vehicles in GTA 5 (including GTA 5: Online). The difficulty of GTA 5 missions isn't hard. Most missions are easy and are fun. Although saying that, I can say I've failed a mission more than 1000 times. The music in GTA 5 is amazing, for me it is up there with GTA San Andreas' soundtrack. The diversity of the radio stations is nice and it adds a bit of depth. The main theme song for GTA 5 is iconic, it recreates LA so well I can't describe it in words, it's popularity shows that. The trailer for GTA 5 is great, it tells you all you need to know what's going to happen in-game and it showed the graphics 2 years before the official release of the game. You also get introduced with one of the protagonists; Michael DeSanta.  In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto 5 is the best games Rockstar Games have ever made and it will always be like that, it has become a phenomenon and it's community comes from all over the world. The game features an insane level of detail and it's the definition of perfect execution. If I had to rate Grand Theft Auto 5 from 0 to 10. I would rate the game an undisputed 10/10, probably goes into the history books as an instance of a perfect game.

I don't think I've ever experienced a game where there was such a large gap in quality between the story and the gameplay elements. The audiovisuals set a really cool atmosphere and the story is good (with some moments that had me laughing out loud, even). Unfortunately the moving, shooting and interacting really gets in the way of my enjoyment of these things. The item-combination system feels very clunky when you are using a controller, and the fact that examine-only items have an interaction-button on them, means when you get stuck (happened a few times because of some impenetrable 90's-level puzzle logic), you'll end up frustratingly trying to combine everything in your inventory with every little piece of everything in the environment until something happens. The game is only about 3 hours long, but that's fine considering there's so much stuff happening all the time. Yet some of that time may stretch out in frustration in trying to solve some of these strange puzzles. Some people are fine with that, especially the older crowd who grew up with that as a norm in the point'n'click era, but if you're not one of those people, don't be afraid of looking for a walkthrough on Steam that you can glance at when you get stuck.  Despite the flaws I've mentioned, I still think this is a cool little game and I'm interested in seeing what they do with the sequel. I just hope they look at the game's puzzle mechanics and try to smoothen out the experience a little more by then.

text_translate: I got this game from humble bundle. Pros:   Gave me those dying light vibes, but theres not as much parkour as in dying light.   The optimization is alright. The game is too short for full price so I recommend buying it on sale.   The game crashed about 10 times before I completed the singleplayer campaign.   I glitched few times where I couldnt move and had to load last checkpoint.   There's no manual save.   No free roam after you finish the game unless you load up few saves back.   Some achievments are bugged.   The multiplayer is dead. I give this game 6/10 could be better.

text_translate: Spin Rush is a game where you rotate a square (or hexagon) to match the color of the ball that is dropping. The concept is simple, but it is pretty entertaining. As you score more points and level up, you unlock more modes as well, such as a mode where it starts dropping faster and faster, a hexagon mode, a reverse mode, etc. I wouldn't say to play this game forever, but it is definitely entertaining for a couple of hours. Getting 100% achievements is also relatively easy (although getting to lvl 30 is a bit grindy). The drawbacks of this game is that sometimes it just blasts you with colors, making it a bit difficult. The start of a new game as well sometimes will blast you with colors to the point where I can't even see anything and lose right away. In summary, fun game with fun mechanics that has a few drawbacks. A bit pricey, but good on a discount Rating: 7.5/10 Recommend Price: $4.99

text_translate: Great Marble Madness similar game. Very nice graphics, sound a bit repetitive but not bad. You control a ball, use WASD to move it and SPACE (or other command) to make it jump. The main objective is to bring the ball from the beginning to the end of the map without falling. Physics do a nice job, the ball rolls and behave like a real ball without issues. At the beginning you should get familiar with the sensitivity of the controls, but after some minutes it all begins to be easier. It's short but the achievements makes it harder. "The impossible" achievements is very challenging and takes some hours to complete it, but it's worth it. Pros: + Nice graphics + Physics do a nice job + Challenging but not hard + Right price for a "puzzle" game + Well optimized for Linux Cons: - Sound is a bit repetitive - Short

text: EPIC GAME BRO
text_translate: 123 Slaughter Me Street 2 is, in general, an improvement from the previous game in most areas although it seems it is a bit easier to play than the first title. Gameplay: Gameplay has certainly evolved from the first game in which you were navigating what seemed like the same corridor again and again. This time you can free-roam inside a house. Huge improvement right there on its own. Now the game is played in 3 stages. Hide, Seek and Exit. All three are exactly what they suggest. You have to use hiding spots in the first phase until you get your green bar up. Then you have to follow the purple trail fast in order to seek and lastly you have to exit the house via the door. Jump-scares are much better than the previous game as well both in presentation and execution. I did manage to notice a very annoying bug though, in the "Pre-Game" phase (which is right before the game starts), hitting escape does not open the game menu but instead I see a mouse pointer. This is rather annoying as you have to wait for the Hide phase to start before you can quit. Graphics: In this department the game has stepped up, by a lot. Resolution has gone up and so did the quality of the monster models who are much more scary now. Music/Sound Design: Like the first title, there's still not any real music in the game while the sound effects/design are good and fitting the theme. Pros: -Step up from the first title in the series, in almost every aspect. -Better graphics and monster aesthetics. -Jump scares are MUCH better. -Stage area is now a house instead of a corridor. Although it could be bigger. -Flashlight is no longer annoying like the first game. Neutral: -Difficulty is decreased. But considering some of the aspects that made the first game more difficult (eg the flashlight being randomly wonky), this goes in neutral. Cons: -Controls feels clunkier than the previous title at times. -The house is rather small. -Exit door in the house is always at the same location. Conclusion: If you liked the first game, you will almost definitely like this one as well. It is certainly an improvement at an already interesting game. As per my review of the first title as well, recommended to fans of horror and jump-scare based games. Score: Gameplay:		7/10 Graphics:		        8/10 Music/Sound:	        8/10 Concept/Story:	7/10 More game reviews @

text: Overall this game is positive but it massively needs amending / fixing. I do feel with regular updates game could easily be a 9/10 however atm it's a 7.5/10 for me. This game to put it in perspective is like PUBG & Rust having a baby together. So you land, you've got ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• all and you must search literally everywhere for supples, food / water / weapons and a lot of materials for crafting and what's good is that you needa venture off far and search acers of land and houses. Took me almost 25 mins to find my first rifle and it had no godamn bullets so they're always seperate. It's a lot more fun when you play with friends as you can set up camp and cook food and chill and go off hunting in the wildlife and killing other players in the process and stealing their supplies & loot. The realism of the game however is definitely 10/10 as you really needa graft in order to survive, you gotta watch for your calories, heart monitoring and much more. I have yet to see a single zombie as apparently they don't often spawn in, and they're only in certain locations. This game has also yet to have an anti-cheat so you may bump into 1-2 hackers but I wouldn't let that stop you from purchasing this as an Anti-Cheat is on the priority list for the next update including a lot of bug fixes. Games actually worth ¬£15 imo it's a good price for something which does have bugs here n there. The game is fun on your own but 10x better with friends as you have an advantage when there's a group of you. This game really does test your knowledge on how to survive in an open world all a lone also with this game you do need a lot of patience and willingless to travel far distances in search of the very basic things you need to survive. To some extent it's like being in the Walking Dead ( only with less zombies ) instead you'll find most of your gameplay does consist of you trying to survive, and a small proportion is actually PVP. So yeah overall a solid game but in need of improvements. Worth picking up and giving it a go and just keepinng up to date on the game patches.

text: In Goat Simulator, you play as a... Goat.     It is sort of a sandbox game because you choose what to do and there's no real story. text_translate: To start this is beyond a doubt one of the best games I've ever played. It easily goes into my top five game of all time. Playing as Alexios (you can also choose Kassandra), right from the start I was sucked into the tragic and heart-wrenching story and blown away by the gorgeous and historically accurate environments. I'm only 70 + hours in and have a lot of exploring and story left but i know this is one of those games I wish would never end. Quick summary: + Gorgeous environments, one of the best worlds I've seen. + Well written and engrossing stories. + One of the better combat systems I've experienced. + Has numerous skills to level up, which can suit your play-style. + Offers a breathtaking journey through the ancient Mediterranean. +++ You can spartan kick enemies.. I can say for sure this is an outright fantastic piece of work from Ubisoft and weather your a fan of the series or not, you should give this game a go.

text: This game is no masterpiece, but it sure as hell is fun. The game itself feels somewhat like a Grand Theaft Auto/Assassin's Creed clone since the protagonist, Alex Mercer, does a lot of hijacking, and stealth is involved in a lot of missions. However, it is still fun and takes a different approach by making the main character a shapeshifter with a motive that seems more anti-hero than heroic. Pros: -Fun mechanics -Awesome upgrades/powers (my personal favorite is the Claw power) -Has the unique ability to allow you to shapeshift into anyone -Decent story -Doesn't hold back on the gore -Some missions are challenging but not impossible Cons: -Missions can be repetitive -Voice acting is a bit stale -Graphics are dated (it's not unplayable but if your looking for graphics as good as The Witcher 3, Rise of the Tomb Raider, or recent GTA games, you may want to lower your expectations) -A lot of escort missions involving tanks... need I say more? -Achievements would have been a nice add since collecting the landmarks/hints and doing the challenges don't really feel satisfying enough (just a personal prefrence). All in all, this game has it's flaws but if you're having a rough day and want to kick back and beat the crap out of some zombie-like creatures, or if you just enjoy parkour and stealth games in general, this game is for you. I would just like to add that I recommend buying the game during a sale, as $20 is a lot to spend on this game. I bought it on sale for $4 and it was totally worth it.

text_translate: Assassin's Creed: Origins is another part of a series of historical action games from Ubisoft, which takes place in Ancient Egypt. The game tells the story of the beginning of the war of the Knights Templar and Assassins, thus being the prequel to the entire series. The protagonist of the game is a mejai named Bayek, who witnesses a number of historical events and is involved in confrontations with people who later organize the Order of the Templars. The gameplay of AC: Origins is seriously different from previous parts of the series. Part of the combat system is more like Skyrim or Dark Souls than previous Assassin's Creed. It is also worth noting that the game has many role-playing elements, such as a large selection of different weapons, a branched skill tree and more. The world in Origins is the largest in the games series, and offers players a look at Ancient Egypt from the time of Cleopatra and Caesar. Occupy the sea here: and branded towers, and checkpoints, and battles in gladiatorial arenas, and hunting, and chariot races, as well as the study of tombs. Very atmospheric and exciting game. Especially suitable for fans of ancient Egypt and that era. Gameplay, graphics, characters, all at a high level. "Sources" - a great game. One of the best in the series. She drags on for long hours, knows how to take the soul of the plot.

text_translate: Borderlands is the first part in the BL franchise, and if those who got acquainted with the series only in the second part (like me) enter it, then you probably won't believe that this is the first part of Borderlands. The HUD is not familiar, the world is dull and made in the same colors (except for the last locations, they are beautiful there), the enemies are the same type, and the tasks are terribly primitive. The plot of the game does not shine, so go through strictly with someone in a cooperative so as not to die of boredom faster than you reach the final boss, which, if you wish, can be reached in a whole day. Bosses are not memorized from the word at all. Side quests are dull and boring ......... until you get to the DLC, which is an order of magnitude better than the game itself. The introduction of new characters, a wonderful plot in them, interesting side quests - you will find all this there. Hell, even the arena will be better than the whole game. Bottom line - if you are going to go through it, then purely for familiarization, and then for fans. For those new to the Borderlands world, the game may seem boring. The first part is more like a test of mixing RPG with shooters and the formula turned out to be good, but not perfect.
Game almost dead: yes, but fun

WOW. Being 33 years old and a bit grumpy, I didn't expect this to make me feel so good. I had it for like 5 months in my wishlist but never gave it a chance, not sure why maybe because it seemed like a 3D clone of something else I didn't enjoy that much. And boy, how I regret now to not try it before. What I love about it: - Relaxing but an addictive experience. - So much FUN! There's always something rewarding and new to do. - Not too grindy! The sense of accomplishment is always there at the of each day. - The sense of scale in the items and terrain is great. - The map is beautifully done. - Day/weather changes are really good (love the rain). - Music is soothing and although repetitive it doesn't annoy (so far). - Your actions seem to have an impact everywhere. People talk about your deeds etc. - The building, crafting, fighting, hunting, fishing, and mining mechanics are intuitive and easy to learn. - Events make the game NEVER boring. Martial arts, fishing, horse riding, hunting, farming events... - Skill trees for fighting, gathering and social aspects. - A very good amount of characters. - Good inventory management (sort all option is very handy) - Everything looks polished and balanced. What could be improved: - Easy access to recipes of parts of what you are building. - More options for equipment and clothing, for example. - Dungeons inside ruins could be more rewarding. Definitely recommended for everyone. Take a head dive. You will love it. <3
"It's ok" 10/10 -IGN

text: CYKA BLYAT RUSH B
text_translate: The portal is open ... You find yourself in a living, intelligent, biotech house in a deeply depressed state. The house is in ruin, various devices do not work, the druid-mistress of the house has disappeared somewhere and the carpet is torn in the living room! Well, you have to help ... An incredible adventure awaits you in an amazing, surreal world with colorful, memorable characters. Pay no attention to the simple, childish and lurid graphics, although I liked it. Everything is so bright and colorful. The most important thing here is the plot and serious adult topics about politics and philosophy. There is a lot of text here, it's like a good thick book that sets you up for a leisurely, thoughtful reading. Dialogues with characters who have their own opinion on any issue are very interesting and intricate. It's nice to go into some tavern and chat with visitors about some found item, event, place, or other character. The world is small, but all locations are very detailed and interesting to explore. Almost all objects in the game are clickable and have a description, each book, bottle, box, flower is unique. What can I say. Here, every nail driven into the wall is an object of a universal scale! And the mushrooms (oh, mushrooms !!!!), of which there are probably several hundred in the game, are generally some kind of socialist-anarchists! The game has a lot of humor, clever jokes, puns, which, unfortunately, I did not understand everything. For such a leisurely game there is very pleasant and calm music here. The game has a classic interface of old adventure games. Move between screens using arrows, a map, a list of quests, a funny backpack with inventory, items in which you can touch, smell, taste, and even give the backpack mouse. Puzzles are interesting, they are not complicated, understandable. Quests are all logically understandable, they are easy to go through, you do not have to rush in all directions to find some object or do something. It is enough just to talk to the surrounding inhabitants. There are several mini-games. The only problems I have with hidden achievements, but you can learn about them with a good knowledge of English. I really liked the game. Behind all this surrealism of current events, politics, chatter and jokes, there are ideas of humanism and just love of life. At the end of the game, I drank a bottle to the developer's health and said goodbye to every character in the game. It was an incredible adventure that I will remember. The portal is closed ...

text: This is a very short but sweet mod. It's only 2 maps long, but it really feels like something valve could have made. The combat scenarios are very well done, and showcase the combine AI better than a lot of actual HL2 maps do. The path you have to take is always clear, but at the same time, the puzzles do make you think a bit. It's also a very good looking mod. The lighting makes it very atmospheric, whether it's a lush summer day, or an underground facility.  The difficulty is perfectly tuned, i played through the entire thing on hard mode and felt challenged without it ever becoming too hard.  Not much about this mod stands out that much, but my impression as a whole, was very good.  If you like HL2 and the episodes and want more, this is for you. Papa bless whoever made this

Construction-Simulator 2015 is a simulator made by Astragon, which is already known for its bad simulators, but what cannot be said about this one. Pros: - Graphics are ok and contemporary - Good sound - Good gameplay - Detailed vehicles - 15 true-to-the-original vehicles from MAN, Liebherr and STILL - Over 250 tasks on over 150 different construction sites - Workshop - Achievements - Controller and gamepad support - Large, freely accessible Game world - Multiplayer Cons: - A lot of bugs, which can reduce the fun in some places - Performance All in all it is a successful construction simulator, albeit with a few bugs. The price is reasonable in my opinion and the game offers a lot of content for a fairly low price. Definitely recommended for people who like building, otherwise it is not for everyone. I give the game 8/10 points. ENGLISH ------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------- Construction Simulator 2015 is a Simulator from Astragon, who are already known for bad simulators, but this one is a great one. Positive: - Graphics is ok and contemporary - Good sound - Good gameplay - Detailed vehicles - 15 authentic vehicles from MAN, Liebherr and STILL - Over 250 mission at over 150 different building sites - Workshop - Achievements - Controller and gamepad support - Large, freely passable Gameworld - Multiplayer Negative: - Many bugs that can push the gameplay into a badly direction - Performance At all it is a successful Construction Simulator, even still with some bugs. The price I think is reasonable and the game offers a lot of content for quite low price. In any event, recommended for people who love the construction sites, otherwise it's not something for everybody. I give the Game a Rating of 8/10.

text: If I would use one word to explain "Always sometimes monsters" it would be intresting. You start in the beginning of the game choosing (not creating) your hero and your special someone, and the first thing that supprised me in this game was that you can choose gender and if the relation is beetween two girls or guys or one of each and still not affect the story (except some spelling errors). You then start the game after one year (after you selected your hero) just to find out that your significant other has left you and she will get married in the end of the month (and you are invited). But you are broke and it is a long way to the wedding, which means that you need to get money and it is here the game becomes intresting. During your journey through the land (well a part of the land) you will meet many choices that can challange your ethics but you will gain money becouse of it and you will note everything in a journal (to be honest it's up to you if you want to write in it or not at the end of the day in the game). Which even if you think that what you do is not so bad it might be so much worse than you thinked.  The story has multiply endings and how it ends depends on you. The music in this game is good but not great and there are some systems in the game I think could be better like the boxing system that can feel quite randomly or at least thats how it felt for me. The music in the game is good but can be a little repetativ. if there was something I wish was in this game it would be a run function becouse I wanted to go faster sometimes. some tips when playing the game is that when you choose a hero and a speciall someone, pick gender and names like the real life version of you and your significant other (girlfriend/boyfriend, crush or Husband or wife). Personally I think that will help you get into the game and a better understanding for what you would do for her or him. But thats just something I think would help the game experience. With all that said I give "Always sometimes monsters" an 8/10 = great game. I could not stop playing before I was done but I only recomend this game to people who have patience doing chores sometimes (becouse the events in each town has a limit) so with that said I have one final question before I end this.                                          How far are you willing to go for your significant other?

text: A puzzle-game where you control a line of light and have to guide other lines of light or evade them. On your way to the end of each level you meet lots of friends and foes, have a happy time together and a sad farewell. Yes, I'm still talking about the same game. Linelight slowly introduces the player to every new mechanic you need to solve the puzzles and reuses some of them now and then, but not to a point where it would get repetetive. Some of them are simple switches you have to activate, others are quite complicated and include magnets and good timing. It is quite challenging at times, especially when you have to get the timing just right, but not too hard to make someone ragequit; the awesome and calming soundtrack will keep everyone in a good mood anyway. As mentioned above, at the end of each world you will meet other lines of light that will accompany you on your journey and help you to solve some of the puzzles. And that's where it gets kind of emotional. Yes, emotions in a puzzle game without an actual story or any written text! And that's what I think is kind of fascinating about this. Conclusion: This is a very cute, challenging puzzle game. It took me about 8 hours to get 100% completion, which is a good amount of playtime. If you're into puzzle-games that at some occasions not only need a bit of thinking, but also quite some skill and right timing, you will like Linelight. And if you're able to feel empathy for some pixels, you're going to love it.
text_translate: It's a great game to play with your friends! Fun and not too serious.

text_translate: Crysis is a shooter that combines stealth and strategy during the first half of the story and then ends with a sci-fi addition that totally changes the game style. The protagonist possesses a high-tech nano-suit that allows him to increase his abilities in real time on the battlefield. He can choose to improve speed, strength, armor, and cloaking skills to deal with situations in creative tactical ways. He also has an arsenal of weapons that can be modified according to your play style. But no matter how strong the character is, you can't go crazy, since the AI ‚Äã‚Äãis well programmed and enemies can easily kill you if you are careless. The story is a bit clich√© but it works very well. What I did not like was that the game installs an anticheat that is useless, since the multiplayer mode has been dead since 2014. The question is whether it is still productive to play a game that came out in 2007, and the answer is YES; the game complies with providing you good moments of action. I have high expectations for the Crysis Warhead.

text: best game ever
text_translate: Payday 2, a very good game. A team game for up to 4 where you will rob banks, get Hoxton out of jail, and many other things. You have skills, 5 trees in total that you can increase with skill points by leveling up, many guides are available on the net to build a build even without too much knowledge. You also have a ton of weapon, grenades, a melee, even a mask that you can customize. Only here, it is true that Payday has a ton of dlc, but only 2-3 are necessary to really advance in the game. So for dlc here is what I think: - 6 ‚Ç¨ for some, it is can be a little abused it's true, - For the successes, a lot can be obtained by playing on the map that a friend will not need to buy the dlc, - In promotion the price drops enormously (-75%) in general, - A lot of dlc are not required for a good gaming experience, - Finally there are a lot of giveaways on the net. So much for the dlc, but why so much hatred in the other evaluations? Because of the microtransactions which seem to bother a lot of people, while they are still minor in the game. So you can buy skins for your weapons, good .. But some skins will give you bonuses, +4 stability , wow .. And that's what people get upset about .. Namely, the community has been so toxic and dumb with Overkill that they really felt bad and apologized. Then skins are offered for free with success, after possibility of dropping safes or even drills (so yes, possibility of drop 2 ‚Ç¨) and finally, recently, a Shift has added boosts that have little to drop and put on our weapons, like +4 stability for example! The game has a long lifespan with all the achivements and the maximum level, infamy 25-100 or for those who do not understand, level 2600. Finally Overkill makes a lot of efforts, also for modding and interacts with the community. So yes, Overkill does need some "income" to keep improving the game and yes I finished the game myself, but will continue to play it with friends for more fun! (My update is a bit dated and the game has changed a lot since then, there will be an update for my review, but not immediately.)

text_translate: MOBA, which is clearly not for everybody. Although it is inappropriate to compare with Dota, the Game looks much more noble. 80s style, a bunch of characters with varying degrees of interest. Each character has his own musical theme to match his character. It can be enjoyed during a match with a kill streak. That is, not often) Nice animation, general sustained style. Unfortunately, there are not many cards, there is only one game mode - taking out the enemy base. Recently we saw the second, desmatch. In view of this monotony, the game gets boring pretty quickly. Wild prices for fake whistles. Commensurate with the cost of the game itself. True, the only one that offers anything other than the look of DLS is Starstorm. Adds several new units, at least one of which is clearly knocked out in balance, which is really annoying. If you are on different teams). Pros: Cons: Let's summarize. The game is not bad, even interesting, but for the time being. And the time comes pretty quickly. Of course, all of the above is purely my personal opinion and someone does not agree with this (scolopendra-destroyer, I know what you are reading!). In any case, the game is worth its money (although against the background of donation, you can call the purchase of the game "first installment") and you will definitely spend at least a couple of fun evenings with it.

Lily dostaje magiczny globus dziƒôki kt√≥remu mo≈ºe podr√≥≈ºowaƒá po ca≈Çym ≈õwiecie, a Maxwell magiczny notes. Je≈õli napisze w nim nazwƒô jakiego≈õ objektu to ten objekt pojawi siƒô ko≈Ço niego. Z pewnego powodu Lily zaczyna siƒô zmieniaƒá siƒô w kamie≈Ñ. By jƒÖ odczarowaƒá musimy zbieraƒá Gwiazdy i ich od≈Çamki. (Oczywi≈õcie jest to tylko kr√≥tki i niepe≈Çny opis fabu≈Çy. Je≈õli ciƒô zainteresowa≈Ço i jeste≈õ ciekawy/ciekawa dlaczego Lily zmienia siƒô w kamie≈Ñ, i dla czego musimy zbieraƒá Gwiazdy to polecam kupiƒá i samemu siƒô przekonaƒá.) +: -Bardzo ≈Çadna i przyjemna dla oka grafika -Ciekawi bohaterowie (mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá zmieniania cech Maxwella itd.) -Bardzo przyjemnie siƒô gra -Przyjemne z po≈ºytecznym czyli mo≈ºna nauczyƒá siƒô s≈Çownictwa po angielsku (podczas gry u≈ºywaj s≈Çownika albo t≈Çumacza google) -Warsztat Steam -Cudowna muzyka (Farma Edwina) -W niekt√≥rych zadaniach musimy popisaƒá siƒô zrƒôczno≈õciƒÖ -: -Brak jƒôzyka polskiego -W niekt√≥rych zadaniach musimy popisaƒá siƒô zrƒôczno≈õciƒÖ (da≈Çem to jako plus i minus poniewa≈º niekt√≥re poziomy w zadaniach mogƒÖ byƒá za trudne dla dzieci) Podsumowanie: Gra jest ≈õwietna, pobudza wyobra≈∫niƒô, uczy jƒôzyka angielskiego przez co mo≈ºemy jƒÖ zaliczaƒá jako grƒô idealnƒÖ dla dzieci. text_translate: I was actually really surprised by this game, as I had bought it to play with my brother but ended up enjoying by myself way more (oops :P). It was the first licensed LEGO game to get a chuckle out of me (sorry Complete Saga and Batman), and I feel like almost all of the jokes were very well executed. Seriously, this is one of the only things that bothered me about the Complete Saga and the differences in the Colloseum levels from both games are crazy. Not to mention how much better the game looks when compared to the Complete Saga. It's funny saying this about a LEGO game of all things but I was really blown away by the graphics. But the best thing in my opinion are the levels. They really nailed the Clone Wars episodes and for the first time in a LEGO game I felt that each level was well executed and fun. You get the multi-character levels where you can switch between completely different action scenes, the ship combat scenes where you can also land on the giant Star Destroyers and kick droid ass. In fact, I felt like the game had very good big battle scenes, and you always felt like you were part of a massive battle so definitley points for that.  However, there are RTS-type levels in the game where you get to command divisions of clone troopers and Republic vehicles in big battles on the ground. While this sounds very fun (and it is for the first 2 times), these RTS sections drag on for surprisingly long periods of time and the game likes to use them way too much. I found myself saying "ANOTHER one of these sections?" way too many times. Overall, this is one of the most refreshing LEGO games I've played in a while and is a definite recommendation if you enjoyed the first 2 seasons of Clone Wars or if you enjoyed the Complete Saga. 8/10

text_translate: We examine bohemia interactive‚Äôs newest war simulation, Arma 3, in detail. Everyone who likes simulation knows and played rigging series. The series has been continuously developing since the first game and continues on its way by adding innovations in all aspects. last month, arma 3 met with game lovers. We purchased the game, which is available for sale on the famous digital game platform steam, without delay and examined all aspects of this production for you. The new game takes place on 2 Mediterranean islands, large and small, in the real world called altis & stratis. these islands are designed in the most realistic way. Altis Island is 270 km2, Stratis is 20 km2 real area. We are experiencing a real virtual warfare and military game experience on this island. A really good job has been achieved with an authentic world and a diverse open world map. There are 50 different villages and towns on this big map. The event we are in is not actually a war and takes place in the middle of 2030. A possible war awaits us in the near future. A pro-Iranian force is emerging in the Middle East, as Iran is constantly challenging the US and Europe. Nato, unable to remain indifferent to this situation, puts its forces on the islands of altis & stratis. The aim of the nato military forces deployed on the island is to protect the aegean sea airspace for us bases and european countries. in short, Iran's missile and military operations are feared. In the scenario mode of the game, the enemy forces launch and renew the attack first. then the nato operation is started. In the game, we will sometimes play an ordinary soldier, sometimes a commander, sometimes the captain of our own military group and fulfill the duties given to us. Infiltration missions and single-player special missions will also be included in the game. We take part in the limited scenario task in the alpha version in which we tried the game and we do not know what development will be experienced in this regard. We will use nearly 30 special military vehicles as well as many known weapons. Vehicle innovations that we will see in this game stand out as unmanned aerial vehicles, artillery and air support. There were also rumors that there would be a wide range of weapons. Between 50 and 100 infantry, operation, special purpose weapons will be in the game. In addition, we will be able to strive for a better result on the battlefield by attaching attachments to these weapons. These add-ons are tactical binoculars, laser, grenade launchers, etc. It may appear in such ways. As soon as we tried the game, we saw these add-ons on the gun. The multiplayer portion of the game will be more detailed in this regard. The graphics of the game have changed and improved considerably compared to Arma 2. now bohemia interactive, which is behind the developing technology, seems to have created a game like a bomb. I have to say that we admire the lighting effects. In addition, thanks to the game day and night cycle, we will complete an operation that we started in the morning hours in the evening hours. In this way, it seems that the realism has increased many times. It is possible to see this balance in the alpha part of the game. There are day and night operations in scenario mode. Let's come to the end of our review by sharing other advantages that the game engine will provide us. Supporting directx 10 and directx 11, the game has a 20 km view range. The game uses the ragdoll physics engine. Environment objects and vehicle usage details have been enhanced by physx 3. Underwater environments, underwater vehicles and diving options have been added to the game thanks to the developing technology and it appears as a beautiful detail. volumetric clouds affect realism as always. As we mentioned before, the weather will change instantly and will be in the form of a loop. textures are literally designed to be realistic. The characters we manage will be able to make many human movements (animations). and the realism of the use of aircraft, which is the most curious subject, is also integrated into the game from bohemia interactive's popular flight simulation take on helicopters. In short, the arma 3 looks very nice. You can buy the game with many innovations compared to the previous games at an affordable price. The game is currently sold over the steam and bohemia interactive store with a price tag of $ 32.99. Let us remind you that this price will increase when the production we have given full marks is released as a full version. For this reason, it is useful to keep your hand fast. GOOD BRIEF;)

As soon as the campaign ended, I wanted to say a few words about this DLC. It is not a DLC for everyone, that is, if you like the subject matter or are an ArmA enthusiast and want all the DLCs it can be a great buy. Everything revolves around an alleged contact with "alien Entities" but it will not be the usual gray man who runs in the forests in "Mystery" style, but something outside the box of our concept of alien sighting or at least it was for me , in addition to extraterrestrial contact, the campaign largely exploits radio communications, which will be used both to get in touch with entities and to deter possible enemy forces, both human and machine. As always, the map and the added objects are a strong point for the DLC, but I feel I can say that talking about "new weapons" when many are simple reskin of existing weapons is boring. The end is "atypical" but at the same time understandable from a human point of view. Making a report of the pros and cons Pros - Addition of new map, factions, units, weapons, vehicles and various objects - Intriguing campaign and without too many holes or differences - Cost not prohibitive if at a discount - Fair campaign longevity - All new mechanics in the campaign they are very user friendly - Campaign dialogues often sketchy and modern, they lose a little with the translation Cons - Many weapons introduced are simple reskin of weapons already present - Repetitiveness of some actions in the campaign - Navigation system made too simple, perhaps to attract the new entry of ArmA - Limited selection of "Extraterrestrial" units - Map borders too clear and broken In conclusion, it is not the great DLC that I have been waiting for for a long time, but at a cost of 16 euros at a discount the material is more than satisfactory within the expansion. If I had to rate it - 7.4

text: If anybody ever liked playing CoD or Battlefield multiplayer games on Hardcore mode where the bullet damage is increased and there's no map then this game is for you. At first, I was dying alot and I mean ALOT. Then I started to get the flow of this game. If a player rushes, better know what you're doing because 1-5 shots from any gun then BAM you're dead. Not for the easily frustrated I must say. The matches can be quite intense because the players usually has to depend on their teammates to change the course of the game. There are smoke grenades and bullets flying everywhere so thinking tactical is helpful. Yes there are camping "chameleon" snipers like in Battlefield but for the most part they are good at helping out the team. Cant say much about about the co-op. Best advise I can give for noobs is take your time, kill when needed, and play the funking objective (ptfo). Allahu Akbar!!!!!

text_translate: Old review is below the # It's November 11th of 2015 and I've been using CPUCores a lot more recently for ARK. The game is terribly optimized and I've got an i5 4670k and a GTX 760 I can only play the game on medium with 30-45ish fps. When I ran ARK using both Dimmdrive AND CPUCores that jumped to 38 min, and what i noticed was 40-60 average with a max of 64. That is incredible. Way to go Tim. ####################################### I just wanted to say hello again Tim. I'm watching your stream as I'm writing this. I have an i5 4670k 3.5ghz quad core Gtx 760 2GB I noticed something that you said in the stream and it help true! You may not notice a MAX FPS increase, BUT you will see a MIN FPS increase. What this means(just like you said in the stream) is less stuttering. Your cpu isn't jumping back and forth between cores to to le maths haha. I recommend this for people with medium to high end computers.

This is my first game of a similar style and I must say that I was pleasantly surprised overall. It's basically like a book that you can even watch and you don't just have to imagine what's going on in it. It works great! I liked a lot of characters, they have good and bad qualities, just like in real life. Surely you all know the American Pie movie series ... well, this is something very similar, you choose whether you want to be the biggest guy in school or a "decent man". It can be completed quite quickly, but if you are an achievement hunter like me, you will spend 20 hours in the game, because you have to go through it several times. + Great characters and their characters + Derek character = you just want such a guy as a friend: D + Emotions + Excellent soundtrack, dozens of songs! + Lots of ways to behave + Minigames are quite nice (they can be turned off) + Graphically absolutely great _______________________________________ - Maximum that if you want to collect achievements, you have to play again several times what you played a long time ago ... Total 9/10. .. Perhaps the sequel will soon be out on Steam, I'm very curious how the whole situation will develop!

text: Bueno que de decir sobre Fable Anniversary, ya para los conocedores de la Saga esta entrega es un Remaster de The Lost Chapters, un incre√≠ble juego de la √©poca de Aventura/Acci√≥n.  Fable Anniversary da unas mejoras a su antigua entrega mejorando la ambientaci√≥n, modelados, paisaje y dem√°s objetos que lo deja mas vivo para esta √©poca aun.  Ademas de traer un buen arsenal de habilidades, armaduras, armas y variedad de objetos para su uso. Junto a su magnifica banda sonora que nos acompa√±ara en nuestra aventura.  Si ya haz jugado el antiguo titulo es altamente recomendable esta entrega por sus mejoras ademas de recordar viejos tiempos, mucho mejor si lo vez en alguna oferta.  Ya si eres nuevo en esto y quieres jugar por primera vez este titulo te dejo un peque√±o resumen de su historia.  - En Fable nos ponemos en la piel de un ni√±o que a lo largo de nuestro viaje disidiremos ser un H√©roe o Villano, eso depender√° de tus decisiones que vallas tomando a lo largo de la aventura en el mundo de Albi√≥n, seg√∫n vay√°monos haciendo adulto nuestros actos de bondad o maldad cambiaran nuestra apariencia, tambi√©n cabe destacar que a lo largo en nuestro vieje nos iremos haciendo mas viejos, donde se vera afectado nuestro rostro y vello corporal. Ademas en Fable podremos modificar nuestro apariencia, armadura, nuestro corte de pelo y barba. Nuestro personaje tendr√° el deber de salvar y librar una batalla con su temible rival Jack of Blades para salvar a su familia y la tierra de Albi√≥n.  Algunos puntos negativos del titulo son su sistema de apuntado y controles, pero si sueles jugar con un mando esto se soluciona f√°cilmente ya que el juego esta hecho para jugar mas c√≥modo as√≠ y por ultimo pero no por eso menos importante su escaso contenido en Mods, prometieron mucho pero las herramientas fueron muy limitados. Ya sin nada mas que decir, gracias por leer mi peque√±o an√°lisis. Un gran saludo desde Chile

text_translate: Table Top Soccer is a tactical, round-based, online multiplayer / single player, cross-platform strategy game, with a strong focus on strategy and tactics. You can play solo games, challenge friends, or players around the world. In each turn, you can move each player to a certain limited spot of the field, and if one of them has the ball you can make him shoot anywhere. When you are near the enemies goal, you can try to shoot into left, right or center to score a point. From time to time the AI gets harder and makes the game more challenging.  Pro: - The idea of turn based football matches is nice - Achievements - Price is well set - Multiplayer *  - Trading Cards Contra: - * No players online to play with - Graphics are poor - Soundtrack is very bad - No replayability : no players online to play with At all, i give this game a positive review, because the pro facts are stronger. Its fun to play if you find a online player to play with, but in solo it gets boring very fast. The price of 1,99‚Ç¨ is quite fair for the content it offers. I personally give this game a 6/10. Received a free copy for testing/reviewing purposes. This review is part of the Steamified Community Review program. For similar reviews and fantastic giveaways please visit  .
