text: (Review text hidden)
text_translate: A fun little visual novel about working in a cat cafe.  I like the little touch of letting you choose your character's gender and pronoun.  While I did enjoy the story and completed all routes, unless you want to 100% the game, I would only do the routes for the characters that you like.  Its really only the last 30-40% of the game that changes between routes, so you'll be using that Skip read text feature quite a lot (and because it has to do each of the scene transitions even while you're skipping, it might be awhile). I'm a little disappointed that after completing all routes, some plot points were still too ambiguous to completely figure out without looking at sources outside of the game. Overall a good game, though not at full price.

I'm kind of suspicious to talk about HLD because I follow the game since Kickstarter. Even though I didn't contribute for a personal reason (lack of money: D) I followed all the game updates, and fortunately, in the end Heart Machine didn't disappoint me nor the thousands that made the game come true. I recently played Dark Souls for the first time after a long time disowning the game (one of the best ever, mandatory) and HLD is one of the ones that most reminded me of it. Not because of the difficulty, that whoever played DS knows that the game is not difficult, he is only fair with his gameplay and our lack of knowledge about the mechanics of the game. Just as an impatient player has no time in DS, here you will also have difficulty, because the mechanics, although simple, requires you to think when moving, attacking, deflecting, etc. There are games that you don't need to respect the game, you can go on distributing the sequence of A + A + A that ends normally, but here it doesn't happen. For you to see how good the game is, I started talking about the gameplay, but anyone who saw a small screen knows that one of the things that most calls attention to it is the visual. What a beautiful pixel art job! Grandiose scenarios (and that give the impression of a cohesive universe), impeccable animations. Dashing around isn't so cool since Megaman X! The sound is also great. Do not expect pop ballads, with techno sounds, it is a somber track and with higher tones in certain parts (those who watched Nolan's films know how it is) that goes on growing until it hits us with its grandeur. Finally, I can only leave a message for you to buy Hyperlight Drifter as soon as possible and try to discover the story without any dialogue of this magnificent game!

text: Remakes sind oft schlecht umgesetzt und ver√§rgern mich immer wieder. Habe alle Teile von Resi gezockt(au√üer RE3), und muss leider sagen, dass alles nach Resi 4 immer schlechter wurde. Deshalb Skepsis gegen√ºber diesem Remake. Doch zum Gl√ºck unbegr√ºndet! Grafik, Atmosph√§re, Soundtrack sind grandios! Wann habe ich mich das letzte mal so gegruselt? Die Reise durch die Polizeistation macht viel Spa√ü, und viele Details runden das Bild perfekt ab. Als dann das erste mal der Tyrant (MrX) auftaucht, ist es allerdings vorbei mit dem gem√ºtlichen erkunden ;) Meiner Meinung nach hat hier Capcom alles richtig gemacht und das ist genau das was Resi Fans haben m√∂chten. - Angst - eine kleine Auswahl ( aber nicht zu Anfang) an Waffen - wenig Munition - wenig Heilkr√§uter -Die Zombies ( von mir liebevoll Kunden genannt) machen sich mittlerweile auch die T√ºr auf sind auch teilweise fix unterwegs, find ich toll. -Au√üerdem gibts hier auch einen Mr. X Tyrant der immer auf den Fersen ist, manchmal ist er so hartn√§ckig, das Ihr R√§tsel so eben gel√∂st bekommt, bevor Euch Mr. X einen Kn√∂chelschwinger verpasst. Einziger Negativpunkt w√§re die Deutsche syncro aber man kann¬¥s ja einfach auf Englisch spielen, also halb so wild. Danke vielmals Capcom 10/10

text: I do not wish to sound like an advertisement, but according to a certain interpretation of the symbolism behind the Silent Hill series, Pyramidhead plays the role of a personification of the emotion of guilt. Now... tell me how can you possibly not be hyped about playing as a magnificently-colossal, enormously brutal personification of excruciating guilt?? Perhaps you are not that evil? - then you should play the survivor instead :p *Edit: -The DLC also includes a charm for both killers and survivors straight from the lore of Silent Hill based on The Seal of Metatron. -Lisa Garland and Alessa Gillespie skins are available for purchase from the in-game store(prepare your wallets).

this might be the best dlc ive ever played

After playing the campaign almost 2 times [in the last 2 difficulties] I feel ready to analyze this great game. It is a war FPS game, but it is not just any war FPS, it is a simulator, that although the game is already somewhat old it has great gameplay and many touches of realism. , any player can adapt to it [it even has console control support], so there is no pretext to say that the controls or the manipulation of the character is complicated. In fact, it is something basic. The only point that can be complicated a bit is the minpulation of the sphere or interface of quick orders, this point is very minor but it is worth mentioning it (if you buy it for all the positive things that the game has, you will understand what I mean). The graphics and audio are quality, they may not be 2015 graphics, but the shaders, shadows and motion effects are very well done. Now something important to consider:. The details that the game has regarding this section have left me more than satisfied, from the movements like throwing yourself to the ground to the animations when you draw the weapons [or put them away]. The game plays this role more than well, then. If you have experience in the genre, it will not be difficult for you to adapt, but otherwise, if you do not have experience, you do not like to die every moment and you despair easily, from now on I tell you that this is not your game. The realism in this game is such that you can die with 2 to 3 bullets that you receive well, so covering yourself and looking for tactical shortcuts becomes essential. If you were shot and luckily you are still alive, you have to bandage yourself, otherwise you will bleed and die. If they hit you in the arm you will not shoot accurately, if they do it in the leg you will not be able to run, if they do it in the head then you will already know what 7w7r happens, in addition to the fact that the wind and gravity are factors that affect the trajectory of the projectiles, now that I have told you about these aspects, you will say if the simulation is not successful. Positive points: + Good gameplay + Good graphics + Excellent simulation + Good audio + Good plot + Difficulty [for many] Negative points: -Interface of fast orders. -The difficulty [for many] The game is an excellent war simulator according to the date it was released, it is well achieved in almost all the aspects discussed above. If you don't like the difficulty, this game is not for you, if you like challenges, I recommend you buy it, it won't let you down, it's a great game of its kind. A greeting.

text_translate: Can't believe I haven't wrote a review for this game yet. Ummm where to start? The game is fun, can be addictive at times. Being able to level up different classes (Gunslinger, Commando, etc..) and the perks that come with are really fun. Shooting head off and exploding zeds into a bunch of pieces in zed time (Slo-Mo) is pretty awesome. There is a "gibs and fluids" option in the graphics options I recommend if your pc can handle it. I play the game on ultra with the gibs and fluids on and the gore is even more intensified. You shoot chunks out of body parts, you can actually see intestines flying around and the blood flows out and pools on the floor. It can be pretty intensive on your PC but if it can handle it I highly recommend to have an even better experience on this game.  TLDR; Game is fun as hell 11/10

text_translate: After playing Dota for 4 years, I would like to write a general impression of the game and talk about the pros and cons on behalf of the girl. I did not play the first Dota, and in general, before this game, I was not familiar with such a genre of games as MOBA. She started playing Dota 2 at the end of 2013. As I remember now: I entered the game and played against bots for bx. At that time, I did not understand at all what to do on the map. The game seemed to me very difficult, but at the same time very interesting. At first, I spent a small amount of time playing, and over time, my interest in it only increased. The developers constantly improved the game, there were frequent updates / fixes. I remember with what awe I followed the tournaments from Valve, namely International. Then they added mmr and, of course, we need to calibrate, not really knowing how to play on 2k: D With today's update, we changed the rating system, I don't think that something has changed fundamentally, but it will be interesting to know how I will calibrate with 4 years of playing experience) From Advantages of the game I can highlight the development of esports, the ease of accessibility of this game, donation does not affect the gameplay, a huge selection of heroes, their implementation, interest, excitement, competitive struggle, many modes and customizations. text_translate: First of all i would like to say "wow"    10/10 This game is something i think that we have all wanted for a long time. something new and not recycled material.  A completely fresh idea that was done very well. it is not overdone and it really gives you that pirate feeling. This is perfect for the people who just want a game they can play with some friends every once in a while or for the hardcore fans who make this game there go to game. My favorite part of the whole game is the effort that was put into it!! lets take a look at a game like h1z1. They make millions of dollars and the game is still very broken and they claim it is "early access" but black wake did the perfect example of a "early access" of course some things need to be worked on but the game has only been out for one week! They could drop the game right now and leave it as is and it would be perfectly fine with most users but i already know there will be a ton of new content to come in the game! (thank you guys for taking the time to actually make a playable game!) Pros -The game has a great feeling it makes you feel like you are actually in the era the game is mimicking -The amount of work they actually put into making a good game -The graphics are very realistic -The community so far is great! you get some teams who play seriously/tactically and some who just like playing for fun! -In the first week a update was already released to fix a few bugs! -Price the game is about 17$ for the amount of fun i have had on the game i would have paid double. -The game came out at the perfect time we are currently in a game drought not many to play that were not tired of -I could make this list 10x as long overall great game! Cons -Obviously the game will have some bugs it is a week old but i can promise you there are very few bugs so few it could most likely be fixed in one update -Biggest con is i dont have any more cons to list In the end this game is a must buy! 10/10 i really hope this game gets the exposure it deserves thank you so much for putting the time and effort into making this game! everyone who was part of making this game deserves a raise!!!

text: I have been a RE fan since the beginning and while this game does return to survival horror it doesn't do enough to warrant a full 60 dollars. As many RE fans during the years I have been pining for the series to return to its roots with limited resourses, item management, limited mobility, and a decent story.  This game has all that but is it enough? Story: Ok this game has a decent story especially in the beginning. However, the ending areas just fall flat almost like the devs were just ready to finish the game. Extremely linear through the last few areas which is a bit of a let down. The characters were great especially the Baker family and your encounters with each of them. The ending just felt a bit anti climatic they really could have done better. The voice acting is good and I did think the video tapes added a nice touch to the game.  Controls: Controls are solid but the game just feels sluggish. You can block, run,shoot,quick turn,and crouch thats about it. No jumping. Your character has the slowest run in a game ever. Thats not a bad thing though this creates tension. Think Outlast. You will be defenseless a few times and have to hide ala Outlast/Alien Isolation. Graphics: This game despite what most people have said looks great the mansion is highly detailed and a joy to explore, Unless you have a beast of a rig though don't touch internal resolution scaling leave that at 1 or 1.5.  Performance: I had to put some settings down as this game had frame rate drops terribly at times especially when turning a corner. I found if the frames dipped that if I quit the game and came back it would go back to 60. You might have to tweak your settings a bit. Replay value: Ha, now this is a funny one. There is next to zero replay value in this game, no horde mode of any description, no coop modes, no raid,ect. However, Capcom is selling you a 30 dollar season pass for some additional content. There is some free content coming soon though. There are 2 different endings depending on a choice you make over halfway through the game.  Verdict: Ok, I give the devs credit for trying to return to their roots they did a good job overall. However, the game holds your hand a little too much for my liking, the puzzles were an obsolute joke minus one (and everyone knows which one that is) that had me stuck for 20 mins tops. Their were a total of 4 enemy types one of which you see maybe 3 times. The game has good pacing and kept me engaged all the way through but for 60 dollars I wouldn't pull the trigger. If you can try to rent this one or play it on steam share. I do recommend this game but not at full price. The game will take you about 10 hours tops.
text_translate: Definitely a degwcem game for your money.

text: The Room is divided in 5 chapters and each one offers a different box to solve. Presentation is done from a 3D perspective with a camera that rotates around the boxes so it can be played only using the mouse. You have to manual zoom on zones of interest and find hidden compartments with pieces that will help you progress to the next puzzle. Sometimes you have to use your special lens to find symbols that are not visible to the human eye. I was really impressed with the detail of some boxes, the quality of mechanical animations and the overall environment. There is also a hint system in the game, but I advice to turn it off from the Settings menu. A short game that takes 2 to 3 hours if you don't get stuck for too long on some puzzles. The next game in the series, The Room Two, already has a PC Edition. Can't wait to play it and also to see The Room Three ported from mobiles to a proper PC Edition.
text_translate: Status: Passed. Time of passage: 3 hours. It seems that everything has calmed down, but suddenly DeLorean flies out, from which he comes out ... Marty is from the future and asks Doc to go with him, capturing Marty from the present in order to fix the future. At this moment, another DeLorean appears in the sky. Blue. Another Marty comes out of him and asks to go to his future. Finally, the third DeLorean appears, black, the third Marty, and is also indignant at something. Doc and the real Marty are confused. They sit in their DeLorean and are transported into the future. At the end of the game, the post "To be continued" is shown, but there has been no continuation for 7 years already, and this is very sad. SCREENSHOTS: PROS: 1. Beautiful graphics became. 2. The plot. 1. A game based on the movie. 2.Gameplay. 3. The plot. 4. Beautiful DeLorean. 5. Soundtrack. 6. Hints. CONS: 1. Themes about the past. (Of course, I wanted to return to the distant past to see the ancestors or something else. But I don't like the future much.)

having put 300 hours into the game, it's time for a review. after putting in so much time with crusader kings II, I eagerly awaited the release of this game, like many others. I'd say the first 100-150 hours was a pure joy after crusader kings II, the new looks and the new bells & whistles are sensational for sure. there are admittedly many of the same problems in this game as there were in the previous one. historical errors abound.  there's nothing particularly special about increasing your rank and gaining titles. becoming king or emperor is easily done and basically all that happens is you can do a few more things and have higher rank vassals. I thought it was great that towards the end of ckII they added the "coronation ceremony" and I hoped it would be expanded upon but it seems to have just been done away with. you don't really get any additional respect or boons or benefits to becoming king or emperor, there's nothing mystical or majestic about it in terms of events or mechanics even though sovereigns as such would have been seen to have been imbued with these things historically. at each new accession I've experienced immediate factions for liberty, independence, putting someone else on the throne. this just didn't happen that much, especially towards a dynasty that had possessed the title(s) for hundreds of years. I suppose I'm not quite sure how to put it, but there's just no "oomph" to becoming king or emperor. it would be great if there was more options, for example, starting as just a baron or a mayor, even a bishop, and having the ability to become king or emperor from such a start. even an option to start as just a courtier with no land but the ability to get on a lord's council and 1 day purchase (or get a "hook" for) a lordship from him would add more depth. I love how they have evolved the character portraits. they look great for the most part, though some still do look kind of troll-like even if they have 1 of the traits that grants attraction. I'd also love to see more accessory and head-wear options, along with being able to change a character's color pattern, if, for example, you don't want your character stuck with green garment patterns their entire life. the byzantine emperor should also have access to imperial purple garments. the byzantine emperors were famous for their imperial purple robes, where are they? primogeniture succession is time locked to the year 1200, and even then still takes time to "research," despite primogeniture succession being a "thing" long, long before that.  the house and dynasty mechanics leave a lot to be desired. dynasty legacies are too expensive. you should be able to change/customize the coat of arms. also dynasty members creating cadet houses needs to be toned down. pretty much as soon as they get a title they create a cadet house.  your infant children/grandchildren will at times go on trans-continental adventures. (????) tyranny penalties from revoking all titles from a heretic/rebel. (????) warfare is still the same siege & whack-a-mole. you're basically cheating yourself out of more customers at this point, since many players who enjoy total war-style games would love to play crusader kings but are turned off by the fact that you don't actually see your armies or control movements or see the battle. it's called crusader kings, where's the blood and gore and glory? for some odd reason the ability to choose many different start dates was taken away, and although it was said you could play on beyond 1453 this time around, you cannot do so if you want to get achievements. so... there is a major lack of achievements as of the writing of this review, only 56 and some of them do not make sense/are not fun to get/have terrible imagery. the "kings to the seventh generation" artwork doesn't even show a king but a queen, and the starting character for this achievement (count eudes/aka odo of france) is not even the ancestor of the king who this prophecy was for, which was hugh capet. hugh capet's grandfather was odo's brother robert. I can't help but wonder if paradox even utilizes historians or even takes the time to read historical texts.  it is absolutely ridiculous that to get the (terrible artwork) achievement "norman yoke," you are required to convert all of england to "english" culture. who at paradox believes that the norman conquest promptly resulted in a native population of millions of anglo-saxons and scandinavians suddenly coming together in common culture with their foreign rulers? and within william the conqueror's lifetime no less? vassal titles get inherited out of the realm despite crown authority laws and despite the fact that this did not happen historically. heresies are excessive and pretty annoying. the player is penalized for holding "too many" duchy titles and counties, despite kings and emperors personally holding many such titles in history. I'm glad that they did fix the disputed heritage event, which is incredibly frustrating, although I do find my soulmate wife of 20+ years at times having the "strumpet" modifier or becoming adulterous, so perhaps this still needs some looking into. going on crusade and creating a crusader kingdom is essentially pointless outside of the gold and prestige rewards, since the AI usually loses the crusader state within 15 years or so. unless you, the player, constantly babysit the crusader kingdom and feed them an endless stream of gold, they're gonna go under. doing this or even sending gifts in general becomes tedious since you can have 150,000 gold and only be able to send 153 in gifts at a time. I've also come to find that in the last 150, even 200 years or so of a game, it becomes very empty and boring. there's not really any point to warfare by then unless you're just interested in adding on more territory to your realm. you make more gold than you'll ever spend, and at least for me I end up just funding other character's wars while waiting to go on a hunt or take a mystical communion every 5 years. you run out of buildings that you can build, which doesn't make sense. you're basically just sending gifts to vassals to get them to leave you alone and educating kids. there aren't any late game events or mechanics going on, at least not any that I actually noticed or that posed any sort of threat or challenge. that being said, and to keep this somewhat short, basically, if you've never played a crusader kings game before, then this game will be an absolute blast, especially the 1st 100 hours or so you put into it. if you have played crusader kings before, don't come into this expecting a lot. it is a somewhat different game from ckII and there's going to be pleasant surprises and fairly bitter disappointments. it has only been a month & a half since release, but the game is in desperate need of some DLC to add more content throughout the game, especially mid-to-late game.  the game is also in desperate need of a historical mode. it quickly becomes bizarro world and at least for me its very hollow like that after 100 or 200 years. I can't speak for everyone but I have no doubt that there are others like myself who would like to play out their game in a more historically accurate setting. in my original review for crusader kings II I said there were a thousand thrills to be had. there aren't that many this time around but it's a great start and I'll probably come back to the game after some DLC comes out. as an aside, I do have to say that 1 of the paradox moderators here on steam acted arbitrarily and unfairly towards me and this individual has not only tainted the game for me but has also made an enemy for life. I will never forgive nor forget how that moderator has treated me.

text_translate: Hunted: The Demon‚Äôs Forge, what can you say about her? Well, perhaps this is a vigorous action game with crowds of enemies, a dark setting, a narrow-minded plot, rounded elf shapes and "lively dialogues". The graphics in the game are all right, the game is well optimized and produces a stable, beautiful picture. Many picturesque landscapes, dark dungeons with magical guards in the form of heads, interesting multi-level locations (The destroyed Llyr alone is worth something), and for such a good portrayal of female characters in general I want to say a special thank you. The music is on the spot, when you need vigorous, when you need quiet and calm. In the game, the leveling branch brought up, which is made up of 6 abilities, more than half of which I have not used, because 2 abilities are really needed, almost everything can be pumped for the game, for magic crystals, which are in abundance. The costume system was also disappointed. , well .. if you can call her that at all, all that can be worn is a shoulder pad. I think if there was a possibility of full costumeization, from heels to head, it would not harm the game a bit. The plot is simple, go kill, for what? For whom? Why? Oh, just shut your mouth and go kill (well, they will give you money, which by the way simply has nowhere to spend, there are no merchants in the game), a couple of simple bosses (they did not let Ogre get killed ), but everything is not easy with the endings, I will not give spoilers, I will just say that there are several of them in the game (sobsna is good and not very good). Separately I would like to say about the communication between the characters, not the most boring couple, constant jokes, competitions who will kill more , a couple of jokes, once my partner for fun almost fried me over low heat. The game keeps me in suspense - the battle is constantly going on, they just don't let you relax, only you dealt with the crowd, replenished the potions, if you wanted to change the character, so you are back in battle , keep the pace! And by the end it gets a little boring. By the way, the coop does not work here (.) So what is the result? Despite all the disadvantages, the game still wants to go through, smashing and chopping everything on the go, Explore dark dungeons, listen to story 2 kingdoms and shoot at f *** elves) .7/10.

text: -Se o jogo tem Hist√≥ria ? - Uma das melhores que j√° presenciei em todos os jogos que j√° joguei. Aqui cada a√ß√£o gerar√° um peso enorme num futuro √† frente, ou no passado. Sim, voc√™ n√£o s√≥ muda o futuro como tamb√©m presente e passado, √© uma coisa bem complexa no come√ßo, mas voc√™ vai entendendo melhor as coisas mais a frente no jogo.

text: Hidden Through Time apresenta um din√¢mico point-and-click de objetos ocultos, ou seja, o objetivo central do t√≠tulo consiste em encontrar pe√ßas escondidas por certos trechos dos mapas, podendo ser eles animais, pessoas ou objetos. O game possui diversos n√≠veis que foram baseados pela periodiza√ß√£o da hist√≥ria, no qual inicia-se na pr√©-hist√≥ria com os homens da idade da pedra, na idade dos metais com a civiliza√ß√£o eg√≠pcia, na idade m√©dia e depois no ocidente nos Estados Unidos (s√©culo XIX). Os cen√°rios s√£o formados por fundos simples de cores s√≥lidas, juntamente com as caracter√≠sticas que representam a sua respectiva √©poca. Em cada n√≠vel √© dado uma lista dos objetos que est√£o ocultos com algumas dicas misteriosas para poder facilitar as buscas. Al√©m disso, a curva de aprendizagem √© bem satisfat√≥ria, de acordo com o avan√ßar dos n√≠veis mais dif√≠cil eles v√£o ficando. O modo on-line √© o primeiro destaque deste jogo, pois atrav√©s dele √© poss√≠vel experimentar as fases criadas por outros jogadores e deixar um feedback. J√° o segundo destaque vai para o modo editor que possibilita criar diversos n√≠veis com uma enorme variedade de itens para posteriormente public√°-los. Os gr√°ficos em 2D do t√≠tulo s√£o bem-feitos, fofos, coloridos e possuem um estilo voltado mais para o cartoon. Infelizmente no jogo s√≥ h√° uma m√∫sica instrumental, o que torna ela bem repetitiva ap√≥s um certo tempo, j√° a parte dos efeitos sonoros s√£o ativados ao interagir com algo do mapa, isso permite que o game se torne mais intuitivo e din√¢mico. Contudo, este HOG (hidden objects games) pode ser recomendado para qualquer p√∫blico, mas principalmente ao infantil, em raz√£o de ser um tipo de jogo que contribui bastante na forma√ß√£o do cognitivo da crian√ßa. Fora isso, o jogo pode servir como um √≥timo passa tempo, podendo render em m√©dia entre 3 a 5 horas de gameplay para completar todos os levels, al√©m do modo de cria√ß√£o de mapas. Vale relembrar que o t√≠tulo exige de uma boa concentra√ß√£o e de uma √≥tima vis√£o, para os jogadores que possuem problemas de vistas, Hidden Through poder√° ser muito cansativo. ‚Ä¢ Gr√°ficos bem otimizados; ‚Ä¢ No total de 19 conquistas; ‚Ä¢ Disp√µe 14 idiomas, incluindo o PT/BR ‚Ä¢ Oferece editor de level; ‚Ä¢ Save em nuvem e compat√≠vel com o controle. ‚Ä¢ Adicionar mais m√∫sicas no repert√≥rio; ‚Ä¢ No mapa Western Town criado pela comunidade, cont√©m um  ‚Ä¢ Corrigir o som do sapo que est√° com som de uma ave; ‚Ä¢ Adicionar sons para os animais que n√£o possuem, como o urso, bis√£o-americano, abutre, boi, vaca e o guaxinim. An√°lise para a curadoria   |   |

text: Fruto da Xbox Live Arcade Castle Crashers chegou t√≠mido aos PCs ganhando uma vers√£o remasterizada exclusiva para Steam, logo com sua chegada diversa jogadores o adquiriram devido ao seu pre√ßo bastante acess√≠vel e esses jogadores foram presenteados com um dos melhores beat ‚Äòn up j√° feitos, divertido de jogar sozinho ou com amigos, Castle Crashers sem d√∫vida aproximou pessoas e divertiu muita gente por muito tempo. Um jogo beat ‚Äòn up como nos cl√°ssicos dos consoles antigos, o seu personagem deve avan√ßar as fases batendo nos inimigos e coletando itens. O enredo simples conta a hist√≥ria de um reino que teve suas princesas e um poderoso cristal sequestrado, voc√™ escolhe um dos quatro personagens jog√°veis (durante o game outros personagens ser√£o desbloqueados), onde cada personagem possui habilidades e poderes diferentes, al√©m dos pets fi√©is escudeiros dos jogadores que tamb√©m possuem habilidades distintas. Castle Crashers conta com um formato de narrativa inusitado para os dias atuais. N√£o √© poss√≠vel encontrar, em todo o jogo, uma √∫nica linha de di√°logo sequer. Nem mesmo textos que deem detalhes do que est√° ocorrendo ou expliquem a premissa do jogo se fazem presentes. Nesse tipo de formato, o jogador deve interpretar o enredo da forma como bem entender. A diferen√ßa √© que, em Castle Crashers, a hist√≥ria √© bem evidente, principalmente gra√ßas √† forma como todos os personagens, incluindo os NPC, se comportam na tela. Isso tudo √© resultado de uma dire√ß√£o de arte impec√°vel. Os cen√°rios de fundo s√£o extremamente cativantes e as express√µes feitas pelos personagens enquanto eles apanham s√£o sensacionais e muito bem humoradas. Combinado com a a√ß√£o ininterrupta e muito agilidade, o t√≠tulo se torna absurdamente divertido, especialmente quando se est√° jogando localmente com outras pessoas. N√£o √© dif√≠cil passar uma fase inteira rindo enquanto retalha os mais variados tipos de oponentes atrav√©s de cen√°rios que repletos de diversidades. Isso √© algo que foi muito bem pensado. O game se desenrola atrav√©s de um mapa que representa o mundo de jogo, onde existem v√°rias fases diferentes que o jogador pode acessar quantas vezes quiser e quando quiser. Existem tamb√©m aspectos de RPG (bem b√°sico, mas essencial), sendo bastante gratificantes e ao mesmo tempo acess√≠veis. Conforme voc√™ passa de n√≠vel, vai ganhando novas combina√ß√µes de golpes para utilizar contra os diferentes tipos de advers√°rios. E, ao contr√°rio de muitos t√≠tulos, os golpes antigos n√£o se tornam obsoletos, pois o ideal √© que se tenha uma harmonia e intelig√™ncia para saber quando usar um movimento contra um inimigo. As magias, por sua vez s√£o bastante variadas e podem servir como forma de tirar os inimigos de combate ou ocasionar um dano maior. Todos os ataques s√£o aprimorados de acordo com pontos de destreza gastos em atributos √† escolha do jogador: for√ßa, que aprimora o dano; magia, que melhora os ataques m√°gicos e sua regenera√ß√£o; defesa, que melhora as capacidades defensivas e a quantidade de pontos de vida; e agilidade, que melhora a velocidade e os ataques de longa dist√¢ncia. Para aumentar a vida √∫til do jogo, a Behemoth criou um modo Insano, que √© desbloqueado depois que o jogo √© terminado pela primeira vez. Nesse modo, a aventura est√° bem mais dif√≠cil que o normal, algo interessante para os amantes de desafios. Castle Crashers conta ainda com duas modalidades extras, a Arena onde o personagem deve enfrentar hordas de inimigos e All You Can Quaff, um mini-game em que o objetivo √© comer mais r√°pido que os advers√°rios, um tipo de esmaga bot√µes moderno, vale lembrar que n√£o s√£o adjacentes do modo campanha e trata-se de passatempos. Al√©m disso, Castle Crashers traz um excelente modo online, partidas sem quedas e muito funcionais, al√©m de ser multiplayer entre plataformas, ou seja, jogadores do PC podem jogar junto com jogadores do Xbox 360 e PS3. Castle Crashers n√£o possui nenhum defeito gritante, mais algumas ressalvas merecem ser comentada, o modo online n√£o possui um crit√©rio bem definido, por v√°rias vezes j√° entrei em partidas com meu personagem no n√≠vel 1 e os outros jogadores em n√≠veis 40, 50 ou mais, isso √© complicado, pois esses jogadores de n√≠vel mais alto dominam as partidas e acaba por ficar chato, pois voc√™ se torna um coadjuvante na jogatina, outro probleminha √© que em algumas fases tem tantos elementos na tela que fica bastante confuso de situar-se e acaba gerando algumas mortes do personagens que poderiam ser evitadas. Por fim, o ponto forte do game √© a qualidade de todos os elementos em si, com a pequena exce√ß√£o dos problemas citados algumas linhas antes, cada parte foram minuciosamente produzidas, resultando em um produto final satisfat√≥rio, divertido e excelente. EDIT: Ao citar os outros modos de jogo eu coloquei o modo All You Can Quaff, por√©m esse modo foi substitu√≠do pelo modo Back Off Barbarian, que consiste em se movimentar pelo cen√°rio ao som de uma boa trilha sonora, sem deixar que o inimigo lhe alcance.

text_translate: I picked this up when it was on sale (90% off), so it was cheaper than a BigMac. If you can grab it on sale like me and you like shooter games, just go for it. There's really not much to complain here. It's a solid shooter in the spirit of its predecessor from 1997. This means, that there are hordes of demons thrown at you and you simply shoot your way through them, occasionally searching for keys to unlock doors and proceed and having a boss fight every few levels. It's very (and I mean  ) linear with lots of very obvious artificial walls (road blocks etc.) but that's probably a mixture of dev-lazyness and pure intention design-wise in order to stick to the original. Back then no one cared about that, but I can see that maybe today some people don't like to see that. There's also been a major change regarding the main protagonist, Lo Wang. He's not that totally exaggerated stereotypical bald-headed, long-bearded kung-fu master anymore, instead he's a modernized, generic character, looking like a young triad thug. I'm not really happy with that change, since he lost his soul somehow, but it's not much of a problem either, since you don't get to see him that often anyway, besides cutscenes and the character screen. Speaking of which - there are some of the typical pseudo-roleplaying-elements in this game, like in so many shooters today, where you can unlock special skills and upgrade your weapons. That's pretty neat. Technically the game isn't a trailblazer, but the graphics are adequate, considering it's from 2013. It seems to be well optimized, I never had a bug or crash yet and my fps are way above 120 under pretty much all circumstances (GTX 770, ultra settings, 1080p). I'm halfway through the game now and I must say, I'm really enjoying it. It's good and considering how dirt cheap it was, I'm really getting my money's worth. If it's on sale: I fully recommend it.

The game is very good, has nice graphics and has the Portuguese language, the story holds you and the gameplay is beautiful, fluid, responds well and is relaxing and challenging at the same time. There is a hint of humor in the dialogues, but nothing much in the face. it's a great game

text_translate: DMC 4 has the best gameplay after the 5th of the legendary series, we have 5 characters in the game, 3 of which are from the special edition, and all of them are really different wonderful characters (especially dante and tax). To tell the characters, Nero: Although the damage of his normal attacks and his gun is lower than the other characters, he makes up for this with the grab movement he makes with the round / B key, he can do heavy damage to the bosses with this skill, Trish: a mixture of other characters and a very nice character, Lady : Firearm focused character that deals heavy damage from a distance and is, in my opinion, the least enjoyable to play (quite good for a normal game but pale in comparison to the great characters in this game). Our last 2 characters, Dante and Vergil, are incredibly enjoyable, crazy characters who have no boundaries, who do wonders in the right hands. If we write the pros and cons in short + 5 great characters, two of which are really incredible + Extremely robust and fast combat mechanics that will keep you back even after you finish the game + That feeling of satisfaction when the combo is made at the FAQ level + Unlike the scenario, good characters, especially Dante One of the most robust main characters of the game world + Robust graphics for his period + Good vocalization and pleasant intermediate scenes to watch thanks to Dante + Various difficulties and high replayability thanks to the game mode called bloody palace + ROYAL GUARD -The game was released early and this is evident in every form. - Nearly disgraceful episode design and bullshit puzzles - Complicated to give the illusion of an open world, unnecessary missions that you cannot find without watching a walkthrough - After you reach all over the place with the scenario in the game, play the same places back and forth with the other character and fight the same bosses again (game finale If we count each boss, we fight 3 times) - Meaningless scenario - Boring boss battles except for a few (and we fight 3 times) - Although Vergil is a great character, he throws only one bosses and our combos are limited. In short, the game has many disadvantages but neutrals its pros not just for getting in and doing combo with dante my rating is 8.5 / 10.

Na t√©to h≈ôe m√°m odehran√© 2.6 hodin a mezi t√≠m jsem stihl odehr√°t tak 6 hern√≠ch m√≥d≈Ø, kter√Ωch tam je 24. text_translate: Wow, what can I say, this game really hit home for me. The way the story is laid out and the exclusion of dialog I find allows you to experience it in your own way and allows you to relate it to your own personal experiences, making it feel like that much more of a connection if you do so. This also means everyones experience can be absolutely different. The game is short, but nonetheless extremely well done. The music seems to be a perfect fit for each and every part of the game. They also seem to mix up the different types of emotions within the game and transition between them almost flawlessly. This game is a bit hard to review without giving anything away about it.  If you enjoy interative story style games then I most definitely recommend grabbing this title, and extremely looking forward to Finding Paradise.

text_translate: The review was written for the curated Racoon Reviews page. For more recommendations, head over to Marenian Tavern Story: Patty and the Hungry God - an interesting mix of classic JRPG and ... tavern management? This is something new ... Suggest to jump straight to the pros and cons ~ Pros - Gameplay. As I mentioned at the very beginning, the game is a mixture of an RPG and a tavern management simulator, and we not only have to collect ingredients and prepare food from them, but also fight different monsters to get the same desired ingredients. The battles, by the way, are made in all traditions of the genre, so you will not find something extraordinary. In general, the gameplay is quite simple, but exciting - Visual style. I personally really liked the picture in the game. This also applies to drawing and design in general. The soft color palette goes well with the relaxing gameplay - Story. The plot in the game is very commonplace, but not bad. The main character, along with her family, are in a deplorable situation, head over heels in debt, and have lost their family home. Therefore, it was decided to open a tavern. All the characters are quite elaborate, even * alive *, and it is interesting to watch the dialogues - Music. Like the picture, the nice soundtrack goes well with the gameplay and makes it even better. There is no voice acting, but this does not spoil the overall impression. Cons - Perhaps the only drawback is the price, which clearly does not fit the scale of this creation. If the game cost + -500 rubles, I would not say a word, but 1400 is an overkill In conclusion, I would like to say that this game is ideal for relaxing after a hard day's work, and will definitely be able to cheer you up. Recommend, 8 out of 10 ~

text_translate: Really good RPG, fun and challenging with tons of replayability. The graphic style and animations might lead you to suspect this is a light, casual game, but it's much deeper and more rewarding that it appears at first glance. It has everything I'm looking for in a party-based RPG - entertaining gameplay, a variety of viable strategies and playstyles, a solid story (which varies based on game mode, of which there are several), solid variety of characters, tons of gear and enemies. It also grows as you play it, both because the devs have released several new game modes and updates for free and because the shop mechanic lets you unlock new content as you work through each playthrough. Refreshingly, the shop doesn't ask for money but instead is based on "lore" that you receive as rewards for in-game success. Both single player and co-op games are highly enjoyable, which is often lacking in games that try to do both. Definitely add this one if you're at all into fantasy RPGs or table games

text_translate: In a time where cryptocurrency mining is making modern gpus unaffordable for the average consumer, enter Kung Fury Street Rage,  the game that would have been considered "retro" even in the "retro days". Based on the movie which everyone loved and not just because it's free, Kung Fury is the game where you play as the man who got bit by a cobra and struck by lightning at the same time.  The game itself is simple but entertaining. You have only two buttons, A and D or the left and right arrow, which translates into punching, kicking and killing left and right the waves of enemies that are coming at you. Five enemy types and a leader-board which stars the fictional characters, your steam friends and your possible biggest adversary a.k.a. yourself usually makes it the kind of game that from a couple of minutes can go to endless hours of playtime for most people. It's the kind of game where you don't need to be in the mood to play through and enjoy it. Both in endless mode and story mode you'll play as four characters, each of them playing differently and while that is great the truth is you'll still be most comfortable as playing Kung Fury, since he's the most accessible and fluid in game-play. The others handle different and while you'll master one, the others will still give you pause.  The story is just as ridiculous as the movie and that's in a good way. It should take you half and hour to play through it, but if you grew up with cinematic games the two-button game-play might feel like "clunky controls" which will cause you troubles from the second stage. For everyone though, the last boss will be a challenge and much like in the games of old or the Dark Souls of nowadays, you'll learn from failure. Luckily, the game has checkpoints, but only when you start a new game and an automated save system, with five different slots which can be overwritten. The game's visuals will look well since it already looks ancient, but that's your guarantee that you'll run it on everything, every resolution with no performance cost at a 60 fps cap. The background is the same and the soundtrack is limited in then number of tracks but engaging for the fight and ambiental in the way that you won't mind hearing it over and over gain. Besides, the player's focus will be on dealing with the increasing number of nazis which come from each side.  Fun game and so cheap that you don't have to wait for a sale to buy it. An easy game to recommend I'd say!  You can watch the movie here:   or look for it on Steam(still free)

Complessivamente il titolo √® ottimo ma non ai livelli dei capitoli precedenti. Qui le scelte sembrano essere poco importanti al fine della storia, poich√© essa √® troppo breve (ma √® pur sempre, purtroppo, uno spinoff) e non ci permette di approfondire il rapporto con i vari personaggi che andremo a conoscere lungo la storia. Una storia piena di flashback della nostra protagonista, alle prese con visioni tremende delle sue due piccole figliolette. Il ritmo di tutto il gioco √® incalzante (qui la lunghezza esigua del titolo aiuta questo fattore) e ti spinge a finirlo praticamente in una giornata, tenendoti incollato allo schermo con la voglia di sapere cosa succeder√† da l√¨ a poco. Molto belle le fasi action, pi√π veloci ed adrenaliniche. Per quanto riguarda la trama, l'ho apprezzata molto, ma non vi svelo nulla, giocatelo! Avrebbe meritato pi√π approfondimento per me, peccato. "Only the truth will lead you out of here. Reveal the real truth, and all doors will open for you." ¬© In search of a sensation, a professional journalist will do anything. So Miles Upsher decides to visit Mount Massive Psychiatric Hospital. About which all kinds of rumors have been circulating for a long time. The anonymous letter that our hero received says that what is happening in this mental hospital is beyond human understanding. And you have to personally verify this. ‚úì Pros: terrifying atmosphere, great sound effects, visuals of light and shadow, intense chases, beautiful camcorder simulation. ‚úó Cons: monotonous game mechanics, poor plot development, the game is essentially very short. ‚ò∫ On my own: Outlast is really scary to play. No one will help you here, because even the semblance of self-defense is completely absent here. If you saw the enemy - run! Heard some rustle - run! I heard the creak of the opening door - run! Your only ally is darkness. Hiding under beds or in closets, watching another psychopath looking for you with a knife in hand, delivers an unforgettable experience. ‚ô• Dignity of the game: Personal house made of bricks! ‚úàGameplay: 6 ‚úéPlot: 6 ‚òØGraphics: 8 ‚ô´ Sound and Music: 9 ‚òûControl: 9 ‚óòAchievement of the game: [Report from the other world] ‚òÖ RATING: 7.9 vs 10 "Now you are the master here!" ¬©

text: Luego de haber completado el juego 3 veces y obtenido todos los logros siento que soy digno de dar una rese√±a. Pros. * Blasphemous tiene cierta linealidad pero no te obliga a seguir un camino espec√≠fico, seg√∫n esto podemos dividir el juego en 2 partes: el Pueblo de Albero y alrededores hasta Esdras, la Alta Catedral y alrededores hasta Escribar. Eso si, no puedes saltarte ning√∫n jefe. * Con la suficiente pr√°ctica puedes vencer a cada uno de los jefes sin necesitar volverse un m√°quina, de todos modos una vez que consigues ya la  5ta mejora para Mea Culpa el juego se vuelve facil√≠simo. * El juego premia a la calma y al an√°lisis de los combates, hay muchos escenarios en que si vas confiado y movi√©ndote demasiado r√°pido el juego te castigar√° con alg√∫n mal salto o alg√∫n golpe que te llevar√° o a caer al vacio o a las espinas. Lo mismo ocurre con los combates en general, debes aprender como se mueven tus enemigos para poder ejecutarlos o esquivarlos de una manera √≥ptima. * Los actores de voz son una joya, excepto quiz√°s Crisanta que no es mala pero no se compara al resto, por ejemplo, al pelear con Escribar y su presentaci√≥n te da esa sensaci√≥n de que est√°s combatiendo a un ser magn√°nimo, Crisanta no. Contras * Las putas espinas, lejos son el boss final del juego, sucede mucho con los juegos de plataformas en todo caso pero las de este juego fueron particularmente m√°s odiables. * La duraci√≥n del juego no es taaan larga, tampoco estamos hablando de un Castlevania y tambien hay que considerar que esto comenz√≥ de un kickstarter, pero se hubiese agradecido un poco m√°s de duraci√≥n. Con 15 horas ya tienes el juego dominado.  * Como toda opini√≥n es subjetiva y depende de la persona, en mi caso no fu√≠ muy fan de la m√∫sica, no digo que sea mala, cumple con la inmersi√≥n del jugador al ambiente, pero por mi lado me incomodaba un poco en ciertas secciones (ej. Exp√≥sito) En res√∫men, Blasphemous es un buen juego, y los creadores merecen todo el apoyo para seguir creando contenido similar y espero con mayor duraci√≥n. Lo pas√© bien, me vici√≥ un par de d√≠as de cuarentena y ahora estoy esperando el DLC o secuela. Quedense en casa y cuidense harto gente.
text_translate: What to say about this game? Simple: strategic, moderate level of difficulty, good options for character customization, MODs made by the community, reasonable story quality, nice graphics. XCom 2 looks like it was made from fan to fan. We have in it the good aspects of its predecessor, but improved. The strategy remains the main point. Whether in combat or in the choice of buildings on your base ship. Yes, you will now have a ship that will serve as a base !!!! And you can fly and fight on all continents. In fact, in this new version, you have more options for personalizing your "operatives". Going to a tattoo of the hour to an exo-armor that you can even paint in pink and put drawings of cute teddy bears if you like, hahaha; well, seriously now. You can also place MODs on it and you can even make your own MODs if it suits you. But remember to make a backup of the game and your save, otherwise you will have complications in the future if you no longer want that MOD and you have already made a lot of progress in the campaign. The story was reshaped, contrary to what happened in the first, where you were part of the global effort to fight aliens, in which you will be in charge of the resistance. Yes, the Aliens managed to defeat humanity in the first game. And then, when I thought I had sent a message to the naked heads with a booming BOOM on XCom 1 ... but that's okay, that's what we have for today, or better in the second chapter of that story. I will not delay but nothing about it because you will have to find out for yourself. So, if you want to be very angry (how can he miss a shot with a 95% chance of getting it right ...), he likes to kill headshot aliens, "cool" robots and mutants of the most diverse species ... this is the game ! Oh, and about the graphics, needless to say they improved, otherwise they shouldn't even have placed the 2 after the franchise name. Otherwise it would be XCOM 1.5, anyway, have fun!

text: I don't think I've ever experienced a game where there was such a large gap in quality between the story and the gameplay elements. The audiovisuals set a really cool atmosphere and the story is good (with some moments that had me laughing out loud, even). Unfortunately the moving, shooting and interacting really gets in the way of my enjoyment of these things. The item-combination system feels very clunky when you are using a controller, and the fact that examine-only items have an interaction-button on them, means when you get stuck (happened a few times because of some impenetrable 90's-level puzzle logic), you'll end up frustratingly trying to combine everything in your inventory with every little piece of everything in the environment until something happens. The game is only about 3 hours long, but that's fine considering there's so much stuff happening all the time. Yet some of that time may stretch out in frustration in trying to solve some of these strange puzzles. Some people are fine with that, especially the older crowd who grew up with that as a norm in the point'n'click era, but if you're not one of those people, don't be afraid of looking for a walkthrough on Steam that you can glance at when you get stuck.  Despite the flaws I've mentioned, I still think this is a cool little game and I'm interested in seeing what they do with the sequel. I just hope they look at the game's puzzle mechanics and try to smoothen out the experience a little more by then.

text_translate: The game is really good, for me it's the best total war game I have played. Reasons why: The character menu, theres diffrent armour and weapons and just things to equip to your generals. Which I find really fun. The city buildings, it's just really enjoyable for me to keep expanding my cities and making them grow and seeing what options I have for my cities and towns and so on. It tells you if it will benefit you or not. There is alot of information in the game, so you don't get too confused. The main characters, for me all of the factions and their "main" guys are really well done to me. Their armour, their backround, the voice acting is very good aswell. You will fall in love with the faction, just need to find the one you really enjoy, theres one for all of us. The way they made this game, is alot like shogun but much better. And it gets very addicting, because you want to become that emperor. And there is alot of land to take, and it's not super easy, but it's enjoyable af.  If you love Total War games, this one is for you TRUST ME.  The game can only get better with future updates, workshop and a few more dlcs. And one of my last words is, if they would make a medieval total war with this kind of style it would be the best (in my opinion). The game is really REALLY good, it will not disappoint you. And as mentioned, it can only get better.

text: Spin Rush is a game where you rotate a square (or hexagon) to match the color of the ball that is dropping. The concept is simple, but it is pretty entertaining. As you score more points and level up, you unlock more modes as well, such as a mode where it starts dropping faster and faster, a hexagon mode, a reverse mode, etc. I wouldn't say to play this game forever, but it is definitely entertaining for a couple of hours. Getting 100% achievements is also relatively easy (although getting to lvl 30 is a bit grindy). The drawbacks of this game is that sometimes it just blasts you with colors, making it a bit difficult. The start of a new game as well sometimes will blast you with colors to the point where I can't even see anything and lose right away. In summary, fun game with fun mechanics that has a few drawbacks. A bit pricey, but good on a discount Rating: 7.5/10 Recommend Price: $4.99

text_translate: Just a cult classic. A full-fledged RPG (and not some kind of action with elements) about vampires in "our time" (well, in 2004, okay). I will not talk about the merits of the game - seriously, if you do not know what kind of game it is, then you should correct this omission. I will tell you only about one plus of the game, which I have always enjoyed in it. It's interesting to replay it. The game itself is fairly linear. Yes, each quest can be completed in different ways, but in general the game is more or less linear, except for the very end of the game, where you choose the ending. Those. if you play a second time, then you already know what awaits you ... But damn it, it is interesting to play it the second time, and the third, etc. Even now, in the last playthrough, I played for the Malkavian and thought about how cool it would be to replay the game again for, for example, Tremere (I will definitely do it somehow). I think that this is the main compliment that can be given to the game - it is interesting to play and I want to come back, even when you already know what awaits you. If anyone is interested, here is a recording of the stream on which I played this game (for the Malkavian, which added madness to the dialogues):

text: Great Marble Madness similar game. Very nice graphics, sound a bit repetitive but not bad. You control a ball, use WASD to move it and SPACE (or other command) to make it jump. The main objective is to bring the ball from the beginning to the end of the map without falling. Physics do a nice job, the ball rolls and behave like a real ball without issues. At the beginning you should get familiar with the sensitivity of the controls, but after some minutes it all begins to be easier. It's short but the achievements makes it harder. "The impossible" achievements is very challenging and takes some hours to complete it, but it's worth it. Pros: + Nice graphics + Physics do a nice job + Challenging but not hard + Right price for a "puzzle" game + Well optimized for Linux Cons: - Sound is a bit repetitive - Short

text_translate: For those who were worried about how Hitman 2016 was run with that awful episodic formula, fear not. Squenix/Edios sold the right's to Hitman back to the original developers and they've taken the game to a new amazing level. Easily one of the best Hitman games yet, Hitman 2 takes place a couple of weeks after Hitman 2016 stops.  While the plot is a bit contrived and feels like good guys vs bad guys, the locations and ways to kill is where this game really shines. The amount of things to do and learn in this game will keep you going for hundreds of hours, with intricately designed levels that loop back in and connect in ways you never would have imagined. Easily one of the best games released in 2018, and a worthy contender to one of the best Hitman games since Blood Money. Well worth your time to at least try out the game and see if it's your type of game.  My only complaint is that this entry to the Hitman series really makes me question wtf they are thinking on target design, because all of the targets are sterotypical bad guys and do not make me feel bad at all for killing them. I hope we end up with targets where you hate yourself for killing, I.E. the amusement park mission in Blood Money.

text: Been playing this game since S1, haven't played too much because it was pretty boring at first and the UI was ugly af (so I went to play other games) Now they have changed a lot of stuffs, the loadout system is way faster than before (where you needed to pick each round different attributes) and the UI is pretty If you like Arena Brawlers (a MOBA without objectives other than killing each other) or you enjoyed Bloodline, then go for it, you wont regret it
text_translate: Game used to be pretty bad but now it's been updated to improve it a lot. The Bungie acquisition has given freedom to the developers which should help it improve even more. Overall the first was better but this is still a decent game with good innovation.

text: 123 Slaughter Me Street 2 is, in general, an improvement from the previous game in most areas although it seems it is a bit easier to play than the first title. Gameplay: Gameplay has certainly evolved from the first game in which you were navigating what seemed like the same corridor again and again. This time you can free-roam inside a house. Huge improvement right there on its own. Now the game is played in 3 stages. Hide, Seek and Exit. All three are exactly what they suggest. You have to use hiding spots in the first phase until you get your green bar up. Then you have to follow the purple trail fast in order to seek and lastly you have to exit the house via the door. Jump-scares are much better than the previous game as well both in presentation and execution. I did manage to notice a very annoying bug though, in the "Pre-Game" phase (which is right before the game starts), hitting escape does not open the game menu but instead I see a mouse pointer. This is rather annoying as you have to wait for the Hide phase to start before you can quit. Graphics: In this department the game has stepped up, by a lot. Resolution has gone up and so did the quality of the monster models who are much more scary now. Music/Sound Design: Like the first title, there's still not any real music in the game while the sound effects/design are good and fitting the theme. Pros: -Step up from the first title in the series, in almost every aspect. -Better graphics and monster aesthetics. -Jump scares are MUCH better. -Stage area is now a house instead of a corridor. Although it could be bigger. -Flashlight is no longer annoying like the first game. Neutral: -Difficulty is decreased. But considering some of the aspects that made the first game more difficult (eg the flashlight being randomly wonky), this goes in neutral. Cons: -Controls feels clunkier than the previous title at times. -The house is rather small. -Exit door in the house is always at the same location. Conclusion: If you liked the first game, you will almost definitely like this one as well. It is certainly an improvement at an already interesting game. As per my review of the first title as well, recommended to fans of horror and jump-scare based games. Score: Gameplay:		7/10 Graphics:		        8/10 Music/Sound:	        8/10 Concept/Story:	7/10 More game reviews @

text_translate: I have genuinely enjoyed GUNPOINT! I loved the game, its mechanics, its story, its jokes and plot twists. There is so much humour in it and you can vent off and use the game as a stress relief. I finished the game in 2015. Replaying the whole game in 2019 to get the achievements was not at all tedious and maybe I have enjoyed some aspects even more. You can get all achievements easily if you take your time. Relatively short, at around 6 hours for 1 playthrough, I'd say it is definitely worth the money, although I got it on sale. This is one of those gems that you would want to replay just for the cool gameplay and the abilities you can do. Once you pick up gadgets, you can do some upgrades and tweaks. You can choose to finish each level differently or do the whole game in stealth, with no killing or just brute force your way through the levels - reminds me of Splinter Cell, Hitman and Mark of the Ninja. I fully recommend this game, and if you are reading its reviews to reassure yourself in getting it, your doubts should have by now evaporated! Buy and enjoy it - you don't want to miss this adventure! P.S.: It has a Steam workshop - you can make levels, play levels by others and tweak stuff - which can add more hours of fun!

text: (Review text hidden)

text_translate: I have not played long yet, and I will update this as I put more time into it.  First I love the idea described, but I don't feel it is delivered on correctly.  I was hoping to really have an opportunity to try to find my way to a destination with minimal information, but mostly they give you no chance to get lost, so I spent my time trying to find the least hazardous route.  I can say the camera is awful and they could stand to add more variety to the road conditions, it seems like they decided Russia is all made of mud.  And really I find it hard to imagine a game like this releasing with basically no support for steering wheels, though it is less needed in this game then racing games, but still I bought the stupid wheel because it's the only thing that make driving games less likely to make me want to throw my controller. So the fun parts, I really do think ultimately I like this game, but I do wish there was more of a "game" there, but maybe I just am not far enough yet.  I found the physics and the intense feeling as my big ugly truck hurtled down a hill I had no idea was there, to be pretty cool.  I think this game has a lot of potential and my hope is that they will continue to add content.  I don't like that this feels obviously like a game still in development, but was not indicated as such clearly, but that is the way of PC gaming now and I can't say there is any reason to wait any longer if you have been eyeing this, other then the price :)

text_translate: And here's why ... First of all, I would like to recommend the game to all roglike fans who are looking for the very same game for co-op. Do you like The Binding of Isaac, but feel sad that there is no one to share with all the pain and bloody tears of a single passage? Then feel free to buy Full Mojo Rampage, you will not go wrong. Here you will rejoice together at the next deposed boss, lament over the very ball that came out of nowhere and took away the ill-fated 3% of health, squabble on the basis of who is more worthy to take this or that artifact. If you are an anti-social introvert, the company does not tempt you, but you want to play, then this is still your option. While Full Mojo Rampage is more of a co-op game, all is not lost. No one is going to take away the wonderful visual style and spirit of adventure. In stock: I would also like to mention that the replay value is certainly not infinite, but very high, especially if you are a fan of collecting achievements or are playing in a team. The only significant disadvantage that I was able to identify during the entire passage is balance. Once you decide on the style of play, reach the maximum level, focus on certain aspects of your character, the gameplay definitely becomes less hardcore, but even so, the difficulty levels "What the hell is this?" and "This is VOODOO!" still do not let you get bored. I would also like to add a very clumsy control from the controller to the piggy bank. But if you look closely, these are only minor drawbacks, which in no way spoil the overall impression and pleasure obtained from the game. Do you like roglike? Want to play with your friends? Do you have 300 rubles in stock? Then why not give Full Mojo Rampage a chance?

text: To start this is beyond a doubt one of the best games I've ever played. It easily goes into my top five game of all time. Playing as Alexios (you can also choose Kassandra), right from the start I was sucked into the tragic and heart-wrenching story and blown away by the gorgeous and historically accurate environments. I'm only 70 + hours in and have a lot of exploring and story left but i know this is one of those games I wish would never end. Quick summary: + Gorgeous environments, one of the best worlds I've seen. + Well written and engrossing stories. + One of the better combat systems I've experienced. + Has numerous skills to level up, which can suit your play-style. + Offers a breathtaking journey through the ancient Mediterranean. +++ You can spartan kick enemies.. I can say for sure this is an outright fantastic piece of work from Ubisoft and weather your a fan of the series or not, you should give this game a go.
text_translate: Hangar 13 should be praised for developing such an impressively faithful remake. Every cutscene has been painstakingly recreated for the modern era to make the narrative shine while supporting characters, such as Tommy's love interest, have been expanded upon to provide more depth. The iconic race is back and better than ever, and yes, the traditionally frustrating mission just before it is much more manageable this time around. That along with a whole host of other memorable sequences will make series fanatics feel right at home. This is absolutely the Mafia you remember The remake made some small changes to Lost Heaven, but they're purely an option that can be selected at the beginning of a 15-hour playthrough. The police force isn't nearly as aggressive once they give chase, a number of different collectibles can be found in each and every corner to flesh out the world, and new difficulty modes let you fine-tune the experience. Again, though, they're simply offered as a choice rather than the new way to play the game. And as for the visuals, they can be both impressive and inadequate at the same time. Character models, particularly in cutscenes, look outstanding and so too do some environments, but introduce some greenery on the outskirts of the city and texture pop-in can be replicated on demand. Although, considering we‚Äôre working with a city layout nearly two decades old, it can be forgiven to a point. Bugs and glitches can‚Äôt be though as cars find themselves suspended in mid-air the moment you turn your back while the frame rate drops dramatically during intense combat sections. It pays a great deal of respect to the source text with excellent cutscene direction, voice acting, and a cast of characters you can't help but fall in love with. The game definitely shows its age with frustrating controls and vehicle handling, but the next story beat is enough of an excuse to continue pressing forward. Mafia: Definitive Edition's narrative and everything that comes with it holds up to this day, and it's one worth revisiting even if you know it like the back of your hand. Verdict Pros :- 1- A very faithful remake 2- Good story that holds up 3- Terrific cast of characters 4- Great cutscene direction and voice acting 5- Iconic missions get a new lease of life Cons:- 1- Clunky controls 2- Awful vehicle handling 3- Minor bugs Story - 9 Presentation - 9 Visuals - 9 Gameplay - 7.5 Overall - 8.6/10

text_translate: This game belongs to the games of my childhood (I am now 14 years old in 2019) and I replayed it again with great pleasure. Since my computer is ancient, it did not pull the Warmaster. Better buy Warmastered. About the game: If you do not like puzzles, then do not buy the game. There are a lot of puzzles in the game, and some are too difficult. For example, it took me 5-6 hours to go through one location "Black Throne" or whatever. Who passed, he will understand what a hellish thing there is with portals. The game is atmospheric and even chopping enemies in batches does not get bored. One of the features of this game is that you cut enemies for half an hour, then you solve a puzzle with a SO VERY PLEASANT SOUND for an hour (after each solved puzzle a melody sounds) and in this situation, chopping enemies does not get bored, and you yourself do not notice what path you are doing and the locations change , each location has different enemies. Enemies can be of several varieties, and moreover, the further you advanced in the plot (consequently, and pumped your equipment), the more these enemies become stronger, acquire their own characteristics and look a little different, for example, there was a red dog, rushed and bite, and by the end of the game the dogs will be black, they will have a lot of HP and they will have blades on their backs, they will rotate and cut the War. By the way about the War. The character is very interesting and looks cool, does the right thing and is pleasant for the character you play as. My personal assessments of the game: Plot - 8.5/10 Gameplay - 8/10 Atmosphere - 9/10 Locations - 9.5/10 My overall rating - 9/10 It's worth my money, I'm very happy with the game.

text: WOW. Being 33 years old and a bit grumpy, I didn't expect this to make me feel so good. I had it for like 5 months in my wishlist but never gave it a chance, not sure why maybe because it seemed like a 3D clone of something else I didn't enjoy that much. And boy, how I regret now to not try it before. What I love about it: - Relaxing but an addictive experience. - So much FUN! There's always something rewarding and new to do. - Not too grindy! The sense of accomplishment is always there at the of each day. - The sense of scale in the items and terrain is great. - The map is beautifully done. - Day/weather changes are really good (love the rain). - Music is soothing and although repetitive it doesn't annoy (so far). - Your actions seem to have an impact everywhere. People talk about your deeds etc. - The building, crafting, fighting, hunting, fishing, and mining mechanics are intuitive and easy to learn. - Events make the game NEVER boring. Martial arts, fishing, horse riding, hunting, farming events... - Skill trees for fighting, gathering and social aspects. - A very good amount of characters. - Good inventory management (sort all option is very handy) - Everything looks polished and balanced. What could be improved: - Easy access to recipes of parts of what you are building. - More options for equipment and clothing, for example. - Dungeons inside ruins could be more rewarding. Definitely recommended for everyone. Take a head dive. You will love it. <3

text: Construction-Simulator 2015 ist ein Simulator aus dem Hause Astragon, die auch schon f√ºr schlechte Simulatoren bekannt sind, was man aber von diesem hier nicht behaupten kann. Pro: - Grafik ist ok und Zeitgem√§√ü - Guter Sound - Gutes Gameplay - Detaillierte Fahrzeuge - 15 originalgetreue Fahrzeuge von MAN, Liebherr und STILL - √úber 250 Aufgaben auf √ºber 150 verschiedenen Baupl√§tzen - Workshop - Achievements - Controller und Gamepad Unterst√ºtzung - Gro√üe, frei befahrbare Spielwelt - Multiplayer Contra: - Sehr viele Bugs, die an manchen Stellen den Spielspa√ü m√§chtig dr√ºcken k√∂nnen - Performance Alles in allem ist es ein gelungener Bau-Simulator, wenn auch noch mit einigen Bugs. Der Preis ist meiner Meinung nach angemessen und das Spiel bietet viel Content zum recht niedrigen Preis. Aufjeden Fall empfehlenswert f√ºr Leute die den Bau m√∂gen, ansonsten ist es nicht f√ºr jedermann was. Ich gebe dem Spiel 8/10 Punkten. ENGLISH----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Construction Simulator 2015 is a Simulator from Astragon, who are already known for bad Simulators, but this one is a great one. Positive: - Graphics is ok and contemporary - Good sound - Good gameplay - Detailed vehicles - 15 authentic vehicles from MAN, Liebherr and STILL - Over 250 mission at over 150 different building sites - Workshop - Achievements - Controller and gamepad support - Large, freely passable Gameworld - Multiplayer Negative: - Many bugs that can push the gameplay into a badly direction - Performance At all it is a successful Construction Simulator, even still with some Bugs. The Price I think is reasonable and the Game offers a lot of Content for quite low Price. In any event, recommended for People who love the Construction sites, otherwise it's not something for everybody. I give the Game a Rating of 8/10.

text: Clearly Starbound owes a lot to Terraria, and it's probably safe to say if you like one you will like the other. text_translate: Dota 2 is a multiplayer real-time strategy game with RPG elements. It is a continuation of the world famous mod DotA ("Defense of the Ancients" - defense of the Ancients) for the game Warcraft III. The mod is so popular that a new genre has appeared in the gaming industry - Action-RTS, with a large number of "clones", both successful and not. The gameplay is a competition between two teams of five people. One team is the Light Side, the other is the Dark Side. Each side has its own set of heroes. Each player can control only one unit or, in other words, his own hero. As the game progresses, the hero gains experience, thereby increasing his level. He can also earn gold. Besides the fact that he regularly receives in small quantities from his base, he can mine gold by killing opponents. Killing heroes is worth significantly more gold than killing an enemy creep. In addition, the hero can collect and buy various items that affect his strength and development, as well as provide additional benefits. In the course of the game, you have to fight not only with the opposing side, but also repel the regular attacks of creeps controlled by the computer. The main task is to keep the defense of your own base, to destroy the throne of the enemy side. In addition, heroes can disperse throughout the territory and fight neutral monsters.

text: Crysis es un shooter que combina sigilo y estrategia durante la primera mitad de la historia para luego finalizar con una adici√≥n de ciencia ficci√≥n que cambia totalmente el estilo de juego. El protagonista posee un nanotraje de alta tecnolog√≠a que le permite aumentar sus habilidades en tiempo real en el campo de batalla. Se puede elegir entre mejorar la velocidad, fuerza, armadura y habilidades de camuflaje para de esa manera enfrentarte a las situaciones de formas t√°cticas creativas. Adem√°s posee un arsenal de armas que pueden modificarse seg√∫n tu estilo de juego. Pero por m√°s fuerte que sea el personaje no puedes ir a lo loco, puesto que la IA est√° bien programada y los enemigos podr√°n acabar contigo f√°cilmente si te descuidas. La historia es un poco clich√© pero funciona muy bien,  Lo que no me gust√≥ fue que el juego te instala un anticheat que no te sirve para nada, puesto que el modo multijugador est√° muerto desde el 2014. La inc√≥gnita es si todav√≠a es productivo jugar un juego que sali√≥ en el 2007, ya respuesta es SI; el juego cumple con proporcionarte buenos momentos de acci√≥n. Tengo altas espectativas para el Crysis Warhead.

What an interesting game! Let me start by classifying this gem as an 'Adventure 3D platformer' :) For the most part of the game you would be looking for and following clues to progress the story and you'll be doing quite a bit of 3D jumping and jet packing to traverse the incredible landscapes (more and more as you progress). i really love the environment depicted in this game; the way they portray the hero in proportion to the landscape, how he move around, tight control, it's truly immersive for me. The screen is completely devoid of 2d overlay (no health bar\no maps\no nothing) and all the clues are embedded to the landscape themselves. Even without the gripping story, i would enjoy traversing thruogh the planet :) it's not perfect though, there are a few detractions that i think may be addressed in the future; - During scene change, your character may move\change position. It can be disorienting. - During night scene, you can easily lose your way because of somewhat repetitive environment. - Some puzzles can get 'stuck', you need to quit and restart the game to overcome this. (i 'ran out' of explosives on one). considering the whole, these are really minor gripes though. i'd give it 7.5/10
