text: Payday 2, un tr√®s bon jeu. Un jeu d'√©quipe √† 4 maximum o√π vous allez braquer des banques, sortir Hoxton de prison, et plein d'autres choses. Vous disposez de comp√©tences, 5 arbres au total que vous pourrez augmenter avec les points de comp√©tences en gagnent des niveau, beaucoup de guides sont pr√©sents sur le net pour se faire un build m√™me sans trop de connaissances. Vous avez √©galement une tonne d'arme, des grenades, une melee, m√™me un masque que vous pourrez personnaliser. Seulement voil√†,  il est vrai que Payday poss√®de une tonne de dlc, mais seulement 2-3 sont n√©cessaires pour vraiment bien avancer dans le jeu. Donc pour les dlc voil√† ce que j'en pense : - 6‚Ç¨ pour certains, c'est peut √™tre un peu abus√© c'est vrai,  - Pour les succ√®s, beaucoup peuvent √™tre obtenus en jouant sur la map qu'un ami aura donc pas besoin d'acheter le dlc, - En promo le prix baisse √©norm√©ment (-75%) en g√©n√©ral, - Beaucoup de dlc ne sont pas obligatoires pour une bonne exp√©rience de jeu, - Enfin il existe beaucoup de giveaway sur le net. Voil√† pour les dlc, mais pourquoi tant de haines dans les autres √©valuation?  √Ä cause des microtransaction qui ont l'air de g√™ner beaucoup de personnes, alors qu'elles reste mineur dans le jeu. Vous pouvez donc acheter des skins pour vos armes, bon.. Mais certains skin vous donnerons des bonus, +4 de stabilit√©,  wahou.. Et c'est pour cela que les gens s'√©nervent.. √Ä savoir que, la communaut√© a tellement √©t√© toxique et idiote avec Overkill qu'ils se sont vraiment sentis mal et ont pr√©senter des excuses. Ensuite des skin sont offerts gratuitement avec des succ√®s,  apr√®s possibilit√© de drop les safes ou m√™mes les drills (donc oui, possibilit√© de drop 2‚Ç¨) et enfin, depuis peu, une Maj a rajout√© des boosts que l'ont peu drop et mettre sur nos armes, comme +4 de stabilit√© par exemple ! Le jeu a une dur√©e de vie longue avec tout les achivements et le niveau maximum, infamie 25-100 ou pour ceux qui ne comprendraient pas, niveau 2600. Enfin Overkill fait beaucoup d'efforts,  pour le modding √©galement   et interagit avec la communaut√©. Donc oui, Overkill a bien besoin de "revenus" pour continuer √† am√©liorer le jeu et oui j'ai moi m√™me termin√© le jeu, mais continuerai d'y jouer avec des amis pour plus de fun ! (Mon update date un peu et le jeu a beaucoup chang√© depuis, il y aura une mise √† jour de ma review, mais pas pour tout de suite.)

text: Arkada≈ülarla ile oynanabilecek nacizane oyunlar arasƒ±nda kesinlikle isminden bahsettirir. Tek sorunu d√ºnya yaratƒ±rken olan yava≈ülƒ±k.
text_translate: The Templar side. - In this story we will once again be an anonymous Abstergo Entertainment worker who, through the Animus, must enter the skin of Shay Cormac, a young murderer. It turns out that Shay's memory files unleashed a virus that affects the Abstergo building, and therefore our character will have to fix it as he discovers the murderer's memories; that after a terrible event he would end up transforming himself into the hunter of his brothers. - For the most part the game takes place during the Seven Years' War when the French and British faced each other, before the American Revolution, so we will find characters from Assassin's Creed III such as Benjamin Franklin or Connor's father (the protagonist of III), Haytham, even with Achilles 20 years younger, who was Connor's mentor. We will even meet Adewale who was the deck officer of the protagonist of the IV. These encounters and what happens are interesting since it allows us to know how everything was before the events of the third game. - There are three major areas to visit, each with its points of interest: New York, is the largest city. The best thing is that this version is bigger and alive than the one we saw in Assassin's Creed III since it takes place before the great fire of 1776. In III we saw quite a few destroyed areas of the city and you couldn't enjoy much, but in this version we will see the city in its maximum splendor. North Atlantic, a cold region. If we jump into the water we will begin to receive cold damage. River Valley, a warmer area. - Gang barracks can be taken to transform them into Templar barracks, this causes collectibles in the area of ‚Äã‚Äãinfluence of the barracks to be unlocked and fast travel is enabled. - Naval battles are back! Now hunter ships can board our ship, we can help our allies in naval battles or just act as pirates and start boarding ships to get their resources. - We have our precious ship, the Morrigan, to which we can improve different things such as the strength of the cannonballs, the resistance of the hull, etc. Keep in mind that upgrading the Morrigan consumes resources, especially metal. - If we improve the Morrigan enough we can go to the legendary battles. These are naval battles against super ships, of which there are four battles of this type. If we win a battle we will get a lot of money, too bad we can't get on the super ships. - Added the use of the ice spur to break through the ice sheets. - In the North Atlantic, destroying icebergs forms waves that can destroy smaller boats. - There is a mini-game similar to Kenway's fleet from the fourth game. It is called the Cormac fleet and in this case there are 33 missions that must be completed in order. Each mission has its dangers, so it is best to send our ships to clear the route before starting the mission. - In the mini-game we can now skip turn-based combat and go straight to the end. - One way to earn money is by reforming buildings using resources and the more we reform the more money they will give us. - The resources to improve the ship and to reform the buildings can be obtained in different ways: Boarding enemy ships which in the end is still the best way. Looting outposts, too bad it gives us so little metal. Capturing settlements is not a big deal, but something is something. Getting it from boxes, don't bother, they give almost nothing. - Added the grenade launcher capable of firing maddening, narcotic or shrapnel grenades. - As in the Black Flag, you can tour the Abstergo Entertainment offices and repair computers or get tablets to view notes or audio files. - The most outstanding collectibles are: Search for salomas for our sailors to sing. Find the Templar maps to obtain Templar artifacts to in turn obtain the Templar armor. Find all the Viking shards to get a Viking sword and armor. Find all the Indian totems to get an Indian armor. - Now we have to take care of the stalkers, they are murderers who will be waiting for us in hiding to stab us when we least expect it. Whispering sounds and eagle sight will help us locate them. - Instead of assassin contracts we now have assassin interception. It is an event where we have to capture a pigeon to receive a mission, and then locate the target and protect it from the murderers before time runs out. If time is up, the assassins will attack the target directly and it will be more difficult for us to protect it. - You can buy hunting products to improve our protagonist if we have enough money, which saves us from having to go hunting. - The Rogue repeats many things from the Black Flag including naval battles, improvements to the ship, moving the ship from one place to another, Cormac's fleet, the salomas, the Templar armor or the inclusion of another anonymous character at the Abstergo Entertainment offices. Although he contributes small varieties, it is nothing new. - Reforming buildings can only be done after passing a part of the story, so if we have explored all the maps before we will have enough money and reforming will not do much. - After completing a souvenir Ubi gives us the possibility to send our opinion. I love you Ubi. -The dialogues that Shay has with her deck officer can be repeated. For example, after they talk, I make a quick trip to go directly to the mission of the story and when they appear again at sea the two begin to talk back the same dialogue: O - Little bugs: Once the deck officer it remained floating in the air. Once he confronted me with a soldier who had half his body under the floor. Once I pushed a soldier and when he was falling to the ground suddenly he was frozen in the air like matrix. - Some hang up. text: Massa
text_translate: This game is alright. At some point I wanted to give it not recommended but by the time I finished it I realized it‚Äôs not that bad. But at the same time it does not deserve a proper recommendation either. The problem is that this game is rather hard than challenging. What they did was just throw more enemies into each area and called it a day. This made the game just tedious in some places. It feels like the game doesn't want you to have fun. As if it hates you. I surely hated some parts of it. And they even threw in a boss fight where there are two bosses and you need to kill them at pretty much the same time. I‚Äôm not saying that designing bosses is easy by any stretch but that‚Äôs just lazy. Some areas are just a chore to go through just clearing all of the one hundred enemies only to die to some BS. Fortunately they had the decency to limit the number of times the enemies respawn. Going back to bosses though. Almost all of them had the same set of moves and it‚Äôs easy to beat them (unless they spawn adds or there‚Äôs just multiple bosses at once). The reason I decided to finish it was to make sure I didn‚Äôt miss anything. And to give myself the right to write this review. Only buy it if you‚Äôre souls-like fan and you just want more of the same. And this is probably the only kind of person that would consider buying this game. But nothing would be lost if I listened to my friend and skipped it. Just played it for the sake for completion. I like the exploration of the first game and it was okay to clear an area to properly explore it. But in this I didn‚Äôt feel like it. It was not worth my time to kill all the enemies. There‚Äôs just too many of them. For some reason illusory walls are not working as before and was going around hitting walls like an idiot before a friend told me I was doing it wrong. DLC was pure suffering so I decided to skip it once I went through some part of flame tower. Not worth my time or effort. You character is drinking from the flask so slowly that I started to think that we were having tea with the Queen and not fighting a giant freaking boss. So yeah‚Ä¶ get some adaptability points. Also FU*K a hitbox. It‚Äôs so frustrating to die even when you dodge and the enemy‚Äôs sword is miles behind you.

text_translate: The Skyrim itself is a great game in every way (and so does the TES series)! Although it sometimes has some annoy glitches or bugs, but, hey, this is usually unavoidable in game development. Fortunately, it was supported by a large amount of mods and the community, so this is no longer a problem. You can find many kind of mods you like to shape your own world and enhance the comtents of the game (quests, items, NPCs, ...etc). BUT, if you want to do this, you would definitely need A LOT OF TIME (walking through the Riverwood would be the first challenge!!).

What this game really is Warframe is a third-person PvE loot shooter, where it comes to collecting resources and items to create new weapons and armor so that you can kill things in various ways. You play as a "Warframe", which are basically space ninjas. Each Warframe comes with a skill set to make them all special, and their mobility allows them to get through the stages with ease, and it will become second nature before you know it. What is the bloody goal of the game? Unlike most games, Warframe does not have a traditional progression system. All weapons and Warframes can only reach level 30, which you can easily obtain in an hour or two. However, your total rank (known as mastery rank) only ranks when you upgrade new equipment, and some items are blocked behind a mastery rank. This means that it doesn't take long for new players to reach the top level with their equipment, encouraging them to try new things while playing the game. So, personalization This is one of the strongest points of warframes. Virtually all weapons and Warframe can be modified however you want. Want to make your Warframe super aquarium? Or maybe give your skills a lot of power for better damage? That's it for you. This makes the game extremely easy to play, as you can try out different builds for your equipment. You can also change the appearance of your items for maximum fashion, even as a new person. It's free to play, which means it has microtransactions ... Luck, warframe is one of the best when it comes to that, almost all items can be purchased at the game store, but they cost a lot compared to how easy some of them are are. It's like the game says, "Look, I get it, you don't want to work to get that shotgun, but it will cost a little to buy it." The main thing you'll be buying is things like weapon slots, warframe slots , boosters, accessories and so on. There is also a trading system in the game, and it allows you to trade using the game's premium currency, giving the game its own economy.

text: Pens√© que iba a ser mas complicado, pero resulto ser bastante f√°cil y corto (menos de 3 horas). "Portal 2" lo supera en todos los aspectos, sin embargo vale totalmente la pena comprarlo con descuento.
text_translate: This is an atmospheric first-person survival horror game set in a remote hotel with a gory and macabre history from British folklore. Set in 1898 and inspired by the haunting Welsh tale of Elisabeth Williams, this is a story of a family empire driven by torture, slavery, piracy and a supernatural mystery that suffocates the grounds of the hotel. In this game you're pretty much defenseless against these blind enemies that lurk in the dark (and at least 75% of the game is in the dark). However, these enemies get attracted to sound and mostly towards the noises that you make (they don't get attracted towards environmental noises as much except in certain scripted areas) and at certain point of the game you get a device with limited charges (to be found in the world) that you can use to temporarily disable their hearing and run away. + Amazing sound design and atmosphere. + Good graphics. + Mostly smooth gameplay and good controls. + Supports controller. + Interesting enemy design  + I really REALLY loved the music in this game. + The game is priced just right for the content.  - Enemies sometimes are either really smart or really dumb which made the game feel inconsistent as in they can get attracted to your footsteps but not doors opening and closing. - Dying in the game can be really irritating near end game not due to the difficulty of the game but due to the fact that you have to backtrack from your last save   so that you don't attract enemies and get killed again. - I have been getting some random stutters throughout the game for no reason. - The story barley makes sense to me. - The only device you can use to temporarily defend yourself is useless against certain type of enemies   and there is no hint about that whatsoever so you're pretty much left out to find this out by yourself and possibly dying in the process. ~ The game can be finished within 4-6 hours only! I personally had no issue with the game being short as it DIDN'T feel short when I played it and I really couldn't see the game going any longer than this without being stretched but for some others, you may feel that the game is on the short side. With an average blind walkthrough I got 6.3 hours into the game..and that's with me trying to find all collectables by myself (no guides) and getting all endings  Overall I think this game is worth it if you're a survival horror fan specially for this price. However, If you're still skeptical due to the cons mentioned above, wait for a sale.

(En mi cuenta principal tengo 270 horas en este juego, por eso me vi capaz de realizar una rese√±a sobre el mismo).

text_translate: The first and perhaps biggest problem with this game,. It is not possible that there was no market research before, maybe they got too attached to the weight that "The Walking Dead" takes, risked, played high and lost! Then they launch a cheaper Starter Edtion version (that should be the price of the base game, that is). This only served to create more mess in the community, as this version is not clear to what part of the game you have access, which caused discomfort for those who paid more. Another negative point (among so many) is or was the update system for this game, how can a 38Mb att take more than 2hrs to be installed, this on an SSD. They had to launch an update to fix the update hahaha (laughing nervously). There are other negative points to question, I'll mix them all together remember ... Currently the game has a low number of players, I've seen days of 800, others of 1058 simultaneous players, this complicates a lot because playing solo creates an absurd difficulty (but not impossible), so it‚Äôs nice to always play with a friend, that makes it a lot easier. Several bugs, one of them is the lag of hell when someone joins your game, it gets stuck for you, but the walkers grab you. The game took too long to load, currently the delay is average, it depends more on your internet. Human (irrational) enemies are shooting without a silencer, shooting at the wall dust, that infinitely (hack these misfortunes), that makes the noise increase, bringing endless hordes of walkers, infinite even! Enough negativity, after all I will recommend sapoha! I hate myself for playing this game, but being angry should be good, or I just think it's fun! Amusing because even with bugs of not being able to damage the walkers, I start laughing, the desperation hits the team and they start laughing too ... that is, the community is not toxic, one tries to help the other. You have to repeat several missions if you want to level up your character or if you want to collect items from the story. There is no story like that, just a background roll, a little thing there, and follow the same map 10x, follow shooting, follow endless hordes. The game does not have bots to help you if you are playing solo, this is good but it is bad. It is at the discretion of each one. Each character has a different skill, this is very interesting, their style of play can fit one or all of the characters. Each character has their skill tree to be upgraded. People don't like it because there are 4 women and only two male characters ahahaha #GirlPower You also manage your camp, sending survivors on missions, collecting resources to improve their skills. You get better weapons when you level up, better modifications too. Currently the max level of the characters is lvl 30, I believe that the prestige system may come later. Anyway, buy if you can take a rabies, but hope to go on sale. The devs are fixing the game, I believe q between one patch and another, the game is less buggy. If you have friends to play with, even better. .... while writing this review, another disconnect at the end of the mission I suffered e.e

The coop experience is not exactly great at first since each player must see their cutscenes separately, but when there is no cutscene involved (after seeing them all or doing minor quests), it is great. I would personally recommend watching the weapon showcase series   and then watching a gameplay with those you liked -- if possible one where the player actually is good (just type "MHW + the name of the weapon + TA rules" on youtube).

text_translate: This game is amazing! It's fun and entertaining. If you like space, planes and rockets this game is for you. The physics are realistic so it's not so easy to succeed, but when you do...oooh boy is it a good feeling. When you actually get into your first orbit or you land on the Mun you feel that you have done succeed in life. You will fail a lot, but even the fails are interesting because of the explosions. It's so statisfying to watch how you crash into the different buildings and see them getting destroyed. There also is a campaign mode where you have to manage money, crew, and science points. After all it's very cool game with close to infinite replayability (also there is a huge modding community with hundreds of mods).  Go buy it, it's worth it!

text: NICE GAME
text_translate: HEUDEN RECENSISCE: Brutal Legend Beh che dire, sto gioco √® una piccola perla e posso giurarvi che differisce da qualsiasi cosa voi abbiate mai giocato.  Trama:  Sei letteralmente Jack Black, er Metal √® morto e sepolto nel nostro mondo. Durante un concerto di una band "Metal", di cui il nostro protagonista √® un roadie, egli riesce a risvegliare Ormag√∂den, una bestia metallica tamarrissima che trasformer√† tutta la realt√† di Eddie (Jack Black). Il mondo √® trasformato nelle copertine dei migliori album Metal, un reame da sogno i per veri Metalheads come noi. Si tutto figo, per√≤ l'umanit√† mica se la passa bene schiavizzata dai demoni e creature del nuovo mondo. √® compito nostro iniziare una vera e propria rivoluzione a suon der Roccherolle e der Medal. Gameplay:  Il gioco parte come Open World, con campagna principale e varie missioni secondarie. Dovremo farci strada combattendo con la nostra mastodontica ascia e la nostra fidata chitarra, contro file e file di Glam Metal fans, Blacksters e Demoni della peggior specie. Attenzione per√≤! Nel bel mezzo della nostra campagna, il gioco prender√† una piega inaspettata: Stavate giocando ad un RTS fin dall'inizio. ESATTO UNO STRATEGICO IN TEMPO REALE. E qui entrano in gioco le battaglie tra palchi, truppe, o per meglio dire, metallari e fans, che saranno la nostra risorsa principale. Guideremo le nostre truppe, combatteremo in prima fila e suonando la nostra chitarra, scateneremo sul nemico attacchi sorprendenti, in grado di cambiare le sorti della battaglia. Extra: Tutta sta roba verr√† accompagnata da un'OST coi contro cazzi, uno spettacolo da sentire in gioco: TI DEVI SPAVENTARE! TI DEVI SPAVENTAREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEH! I personaggi sono tutti dei cameo dalla scena Metal: Lemmy, Ozzy... Conclusioni: Un gioiello che non ha mai avuto il successo meritato, rimanendo una reliquia del divertimento videoludico per i veri appassionati del Metal. Una lettera di amore per un genere fin troppe volte ingiustament ncarcerat, ehm, volevo dire, discriminato dal pubblico. Consiglio vivamente a tutti, dal appassionato degli RTS, a chi vuole godersi la sua dose quotidiana di Metal, al casualone che si √® ritrovato col gioco in libreria...  Per questo, ho deciso di dare:‚Äé |0%  ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñí  85%|

text: I was actually really surprised by this game, as I had bought it to play with my brother but ended up enjoying by myself way more (oops :P). It was the first licensed LEGO game to get a chuckle out of me (sorry Complete Saga and Batman), and I feel like almost all of the jokes were very well executed. Seriously, this is one of the only things that bothered me about the Complete Saga and the differences in the Colloseum levels from both games are crazy. Not to mention how much better the game looks when compared to the Complete Saga. It's funny saying this about a LEGO game of all things but I was really blown away by the graphics. But the best thing in my opinion are the levels. They really nailed the Clone Wars episodes and for the first time in a LEGO game I felt that each level was well executed and fun. You get the multi-character levels where you can switch between completely different action scenes, the ship combat scenes where you can also land on the giant Star Destroyers and kick droid ass. In fact, I felt like the game had very good big battle scenes, and you always felt like you were part of a massive battle so definitley points for that.  However, there are RTS-type levels in the game where you get to command divisions of clone troopers and Republic vehicles in big battles on the ground. While this sounds very fun (and it is for the first 2 times), these RTS sections drag on for surprisingly long periods of time and the game likes to use them way too much. I found myself saying "ANOTHER one of these sections?" way too many times. Overall, this is one of the most refreshing LEGO games I've played in a while and is a definite recommendation if you enjoyed the first 2 seasons of Clone Wars or if you enjoyed the Complete Saga. 8/10

text: ez
text_translate: To be honest, Layers of Fear is my first game in this genre. Once in the house, I began to wander, open doors, cabinets, found an object that cannot be taken, but can be watched, twisted, found a note that can be read. And then the question arose: what am I doing here and ... After a little wandering around the house, I finally got into the studio of the main character and realized what to do - to create a picture. There is only one way out of the workshop, and at each exit, we will find ourselves in depressingly gloomy levels-the search for the ultimate goal - the ingredient of which our picture will consist. The game immerses you in some kind of hypnotic and detached state. The slightest rustle attracts attention, one has only to forget that this is a game, so a sharp and frightening sound or screamer is immediately created. I confess, the game made me tickle my nerves. At what I caught by surprise in those very places where I forgot that now something will happen and now! Frightening moments, perhaps, are what we play in this genre for. The schizophrenic nonsense through which we sneak through the plot are transmitted, I will not say that it is straightforward (since I did not have to be in these states), but I can say this - in some places it was disgusting, but still interesting. A huge plus for the developer for the fact that not only Windows users can immerse themselves in this work. You will also need to buy an add-on, without it you can't get all the achievements. - the cloud stores save for a specific platform, for example: you cannot start a game in macOS, but continue in Windows. MacOS has its own saves, and Windows has its own. - Several times there were double commas or colons behind the spaces in the texts of the notes - it was not very comfortable / pleasant to read. - The first launch of the game in macOS was in the window, at the time of choosing a slot for a new game - it was impossible to enter a name and go to a further menu It was decided - by restarting the game. A good game for exploring the horror horror genre! I like it! From which I recommend you to meet you! If it doesn't, then you probably shouldn't continue your acquaintance with this genre, although who knows, there are probably other more interesting representatives of the genre! Still to come!

text_translate: From my point of view, this game is highly recommended to people who like platforming. It's really fun and it depends a lot on the music. Its sandbox section (creation of levels) is very good and easy to use, also a very competitive game if you and your friends challenge each other to see who passes a level first :)

Firrrrst of all, i don't speak english so i'll try to be as explicit as i can...  You need to have on mind that this is a short game with a linear story, with this fact on yall minds, let's go. The history, it's simply, very ... predictable, but it's enjoyable at all, the dialogs are short and explicit, so you can't missunderstand.  It's has some audio files in the levels which explains a bit more of the problems and those kind of things. The graphics, again, simply, clean and nothing too flashy, they are perfect for a space game. And if you've Rtx, you know what to do.  Ambience, it's simply amazing, with or without music. If you wan't to go with the second option you will feel that you're completly f****ng alone, it's amazing. The music ( in the first case ) fits perfect in every moment and sometimes helps to solve some puzzles. Gameplay, nothing impresive, run,jump and move some objects to solve the small puzzles. That's all, yep, hope yall enjoy the game, if you can, get it, it's cheap and amazing, sadly it doesn't have photo mode and the Unreal Unlocker seem not to work :/  For me: 9-10  Potato, Out~

text: Appena finita la campagna, volevo spendere due parole su questo DLC. Non √® un DLC per tutti, ovvero, se ti piace il tema trattato o sei un appassionato di ArmA e desideri tutti i DLC pu√≤ essere un ottimo acquisto. Tutto ruota intorno a un presunto contatto con delle "Entit√† aliene" ma non si tratter√† del solito omino grigio che gira nelle foreste in stile "Mistero", bens√¨ qualcosa di fuori dagli schemi del nostro concetto di avvistamento alieno o almeno lo √® stato per me, oltre al contatto extraterrestre la campagna sfrutta largamente le comunicazioni radio, le quali verranno utilizzate sia per mettersi in contatto con le entit√† sia per dissuadere eventuali forze nemiche, sia umane che macchine. Come sempre la mappa e gli oggenti aggiunti sono un punto forte per il DLC, per√≤ mi sento di affermare che parlare di "nuove armi" quando molte sono delle semplici reskin di armi gi√† presenti risulta noioso. La fine √® "atipica" ma al tempo stesso comprensibile dal punto di vista umano. Facendo un resoconto dei pro e contro Pro - Aggiunta di nuova mappa, fazioni, unit√†, armi, veicoli e varia oggettistica - Campagna intrigante e senza troppi buchi o divergenze - Costo non proibitivo se a sconto - Discreta longevit√† di campagna - Tutte le nuove meccaniche nella campagna risultano molto user friendly - Dialoghi di campagna spesso sketchy e moderni, perdono un po' con la traduzione Contro - Molte armi introdotte sono semplici reskin di armi gi√† presenti - Ripetitivit√† di alcune azioni nella campagna - Sistema di navigazione reso troppo semplice, forse per attirare la new entry di ArmA - Limitata selezione di unit√† "Extraterrestri" - Confini di mappa troppo netti e spaccati In conclusione, non √® il grandissimo DLC che aspettavo da tempo, ma al costo di 16 euro a sconto √® pi√π che soddisfacente il materiale all'interno dell'espansione. Se dovessi dargli un voto - 7.4

text: Old review is below the # It's November 11th of 2015 and I've been using CPUCores a lot more recently for ARK. The game is terribly optimized and I've got an i5 4670k and a GTX 760 I can only play the game on medium with 30-45ish fps. When I ran ARK using both Dimmdrive AND CPUCores that jumped to 38 min, and what i noticed was 40-60 average with a max of 64. That is incredible. Way to go Tim. ####################################### I just wanted to say hello again Tim. I'm watching your stream as I'm writing this. I have an i5 4670k 3.5ghz quad core Gtx 760 2GB I noticed something that you said in the stream and it help true! You may not notice a MAX FPS increase, BUT you will see a MIN FPS increase. What this means(just like you said in the stream) is less stuttering. Your cpu isn't jumping back and forth between cores to to le maths haha. I recommend this for people with medium to high end computers.

text_translate: The Czech developer, Amanita Desing, creators of magnificent games such as Machinarium, Botanicula or Samorost whose artistic section leaves no one indifferent, return with a new adventure full of mysteries and puzzles where they lose some hallmarks and retain other views in their previous games like the narrative told without a dialogue through gestures and noises, brand of the house and an artistic section carefully cared for. In Creaks our adventure will begin in our room where we find our protagonist totally relaxed, until a series of strange events will not make us leave our stay and discover an underground city and its picturesque inhabitants. A simple but direct story that will keep us glued for the duration of our adventure. The most notable change with respect to its previous games will be found in the new character control system, where before we handled ourselves with the click of the mouse as in any graphic adventure, now we will have full control of the character, either through a command or from our keyboard. When we abandon the point and click system, we find ourselves in a linear 2D adventure but with touches of platforms where we must solve innumerable puzzles in order to advance. And this is where we find the main feature of the game, the puzzles. Through the control of our character we must overcome the problem that we find in each room, although they are not very demanding, they have an excellent difficulty curve, whenever they introduce us a new mechanic to solve the puzzle they will teach us to use it and then put to test our gray matter. As the main mechanic in each room we will find enemies with different patterns, but with a common weakness, light. As we advance in our adventure, we will find new problems, ranging from switches, new enemies or the power to turn on and off the light at our whim to block or transform our enemies into decorative elements that will help us reach a higher level or flip a switch. Being able to use the light to our benefit, either as a refuge or to transform the beings that we meet in each room to be able to move on to the next, is something constant that we find ourselves in the game and if we do not know how to use it well they will hunt us down they will end and with us forcing us to repeat the puzzle, which thanks to the autosave system on some occasion we should not start again. When completing each room, they will immediately force us to go to the next one since it is a linear development game and on some occasion we will find small cinematics that will tell us something more about the story, also and as a rest between puzzles, We will find interactive paintings that work as collectibles and some of them in which we can interact as if it were a minigame. A great success to give us a little break between puzzles so that it does not become so repetitive. On an audiovisual level, as in any Amanita Design game, it is a real delight. Artistically it is a remarkable game, with a staging with hand-painted graphics reminiscent of the one used in Machinarium. On the stages, the different rooms of the game and the tables are endowed with all kinds of details, a luxury that is reflected on our screen. Also note that the animations of the characters in a game of this caliber are excellent, since due to the absence of dialogues, they stand out for their great expressiveness that make us empathize with them. A great work again by Amanita Desing in which this time they offer us an art somewhat darker than what we are used to. Of course the soundtrack is not far behind, composed by Hidden Orchestra fits perfectly into the game and everything that happens, and that works in a special way in Creaks. In the absence of clues as in other Amanita games, here the soundtrack becomes even more important since thanks to the fact that it works dynamically every time we perform the correct steps in solving puzzles so that we stagnate and we can continue our adventure. Creaks, another great adventure by Amanita Desing in which they change course from their previous games, they offer us an adventure of between 6-8 hours in which we will have to squeeze our gray matter and with a brilliant audiovisual level

text: Table Top Soccer is a tactical, round-based, online multiplayer / single player, cross-platform strategy game, with a strong focus on strategy and tactics. You can play solo games, challenge friends, or players around the world. In each turn, you can move each player to a certain limited spot of the field, and if one of them has the ball you can make him shoot anywhere. When you are near the enemies goal, you can try to shoot into left, right or center to score a point. From time to time the AI gets harder and makes the game more challenging.  Pro: - The idea of turn based football matches is nice - Achievements - Price is well set - Multiplayer *  - Trading Cards Contra: - * No players online to play with - Graphics are poor - Soundtrack is very bad - No replayability : no players online to play with At all, i give this game a positive review, because the pro facts are stronger. Its fun to play if you find a online player to play with, but in solo it gets boring very fast. The price of 1,99‚Ç¨ is quite fair for the content it offers. I personally give this game a 6/10. Received a free copy for testing/reviewing purposes. This review is part of the Steamified Community Review program. For similar reviews and fantastic giveaways please visit  .

text: A fun little visual novel about working in a cat cafe.  I like the little touch of letting you choose your character's gender and pronoun.  While I did enjoy the story and completed all routes, unless you want to 100% the game, I would only do the routes for the characters that you like.  Its really only the last 30-40% of the game that changes between routes, so you'll be using that Skip read text feature quite a lot (and because it has to do each of the scene transitions even while you're skipping, it might be awhile). I'm a little disappointed that after completing all routes, some plot points were still too ambiguous to completely figure out without looking at sources outside of the game. Overall a good game, though not at full price.
text_translate: with more depth than expected. I've discovered everything, but something always comes along and you look more into the story and actual depth of the game. I will definitely keep playing it and am how it all turns out towards the story!

Incredible Role Playing Game, which mixes lead figures (our warriors), cards, strategy, tactical play and beautiful scenarios in the form of dioramas. I leave you a video with the First impressions, where you will see all the game options: You can also find me as a Steam mentor, I appreciate your support Thank you. In Wartile we play with Vikings and we will find a Nordic setting, with beautiful settings, divided into cells or squares, through which we will move our animated soldiers (which will remind us of "lead figures"). With an uninterrupted turn-based game system, in which we will not have to click a button to finish our action or movements. Well, each action, movement or attack is carried out automatically after the seconds that each one requires. The scenarios will remind us of the Rol models, with great detail and great graphic quality. Our warriors will be able to move a certain number of squares in each movement, and their attack ability can also be only 1 square or several squares away. We have warriors, spearmen, sorcerers ... In addition to their basic attacks, we can use a card system to place traps, sleep / silence enemies, heal us, also each character can choose 1 of their 3 skills or special attacks to use in combat and also gain experience with each game and level up. Each mission or scenario has 3 levels of difficulty, to unlock the higher level we must obtain a certain number of points. Each level of these scenarios will give us different rewards (new cards, new warriors, gold, coins that will improve our statistics, better weapons and armor. Before starting a mission or diorama (scenario) we can better equip our warriors, improve their statistics , and choose their special ability. We can spend our gold obtained by buying better weapons and armor in the merchant and sell those that we no longer want. Incredible game with many options to customize our warriors, card system that we can customize and choose which ones we will take with us. Overcome each scenario, incredible dioramas or scenarios with great detail, great graphic quality. All this accompanied by impeccable music that will accompany us on our adventures. Essential game for all game lovers the classic Role-playing games with Lead figures and also for all those looking for a tactical game, with customization options n and a fun and not boring dynamic movement and combat system. And above for only ‚Ç¨ 19.99 and to celebrate its launch they reduce it to ‚Ç¨ 14.99, if you find it with a discount, do not hesitate to buy it. If I had to make a fault, I would say that the lack of achievements and Steam cards is a shame, otherwise an essential purchase.

text_translate: I am a big fan of the Total War series and was shocked when playing Attila for the first time, because it changed so much. I have to say, I didn't play Rome 2, therefore I refer to everything up to Shogun 2.  The battles improved a little bit but are still very TW. The campaign on the other hand was too much of a change for me in the first couple of hours of game-play. A lot more aspects like complicated character and family-tree management where overwhelming. Also the provinces with three settlements each confused me. Now I have played lots of hours and have to say: I love it. If you are willing to take time to find your way through Attila, it will give you a lot of pleasure. Would be boring to have many TW games being all the same, now wouldn't it? Edit: some issues with cloud saving and loading (always double save locally as well!)

text: Do you love goats like a muslim in Iran and love open world? Good news, your prayers have been answered. Playing this game sober is hella lame, make sure to indulge BTW.
text_translate: Remember a scene from the movie "Tango and Cash" starring Stallon and Russel. The scene in which the first one stands in front of a speeding truck and with just a few shots forces the driver to stop the vehicle immediately, and literally a moment later throw handcuffs towards the captured antagonists, adding extremely calmly "handle yourself". And all this for the sake of goodness and without blinking an eye - this is the atmosphere in! We get the islands to free from the hands of the tyrant, who obviously needs to be overthrown. Again, the studio is modeled on the events of 1989, which involved the US invasion of Panama to overthrow the dictatorship of General Manuel Noriega. This time, however, Rico Rodriguez returns to his hometown, the southern Italy-styled Medici Republic, where General Di Ravello keeps everyone in his grip, spreading propaganda and terror. He only succeeds in having access to deposits of an extremely valuable mineral - Bavaria - which may serve to annihilate the whole world. The crazy general builds weapons and military vehicles based on this mineral, being a real opponent to the shrinking rebellion forces. Fortunately, Rico has arrived, who ... has no plan, but the will and strength to take down wherever he falls. The plot shows the story in black and white, showing good and bad characters - nothing in between. All the fun boils down to Rico's cooperation with the rebels, for whom the hero really becomes an errand boy, ready to take on any task - even the impossible. The story is not captivating either at the beginning or at the end and is at best worthy of the B-class cinema, which is the quintessence of American action cinema, which turned its heroes into all-powerful warriors, stubbornly pursuing their goals. However, the weak story is saved by interesting, often funny supporting characters, often overdrawn in a rather funny way, bringing to mind the series "Saints Row". However, the series was always about pure fun from the game, so the boring and predictable storyline does not prevent you from enjoying the game. Rodriguez in the form of a one-man army must overthrow an insidious dictator, destroying everything that belongs to him before the final confrontation. When I say "everything", I mean elements for which we get chaos points when destroyed, and the appropriate accumulation of which pushes the plot forward. The basic version of the game consists of two smaller archipelagos of islands and one giant structure, resembling a merging of the maps from the first two parts of the series with a large allowance. Each of them is divided into specific states, and in each there are several police stations, occupied cities, or military bases to seize - from the easiest to the most difficult. "Conquest" in this case has to be interpreted a bit differently, because the rebels will take over the area only after Rico destroys blood-red elements, such as fuel tanks, generators, antennas, or even Bavarian digging machines. In addition to the typical rather diverse arsenal of primary weapons, rifles and special weapons - which we can change at any time by asking the rebels to drop from the air - Rico has a long-known hook with a lanyard, thanks to which he can pull himself to items, connect them together and yes further. A parachute is also useful, it can be unfolded and folded at any time, which, combined with the above-mentioned rope, creates a quite useful solution for locomotion. A novelty and a bonus to the previous gadgets is the wingsuit, which allows you to glide through the air at great speed. The combination of these three inventions makes moving around this gigantic world more enjoyable than using various land, water and air vehicles. Even in regular combat, each of them is useful! All these gadgets are really a lot of strength, because thanks to them you can really do a lot, and we are only limited by our imagination. The game does not tell you how to do something - it gives you a simple goal and it's up to you to take the easy way by punching everything with lead bullets, attach the truck to the helicopter and use it as a demolition ball, or to charge the element with explosives to construct a makeshift slingshot. Thanks to a rather interesting tree of improvements, we come up with better and bolder, although not always effective, ideas with each subsequent hour of the game. We get upgrade points, called gears here, for completing various challenges - such as water, air and land races, such as a wingsuit flight or ordinary battle. In addition, the game contains a lot of different types of secrets, which will result in the acquisition of useful and valuable prizes. The really good graphics, as well as the designs of individual locations, which are not as repetitive and boring as in the previous parts, encourage fun and constant destruction. The terrain shows gigantic differences in altitude between sea level and the highest peak, which looks very beautiful even from a distance. The textures have been made in a dozen or so resolutions and care has been taken with each of them, thanks to which an object located far away looks as good as an object located nearby. All textures are expressive, and plants blowing in the wind, azure water, colorful flowers or brilliant effects of light and shadows make an amazing impression. Optimization did not suffer from this, because even with the procedural generated destruction, even the largest objects did not see a drop in frames. There are a few errors, which is inevitable in such large productions. The vast majority of them, however, have already been caught by the creators, but we will also come across disappearing cars, "dancing" chimneys, or invisible hills on a straight stretch of asphalt. The worst, however, are the loading screens that are absolutely bent over their length, which take a long time. I would like to write something about music, but honestly - I have no idea if it is. I mean, something is playing there during the game, but it is so delicate that the omnipresent sound of rifles and explosions drowns out everything, which is not a disadvantage! But all sound effects, such as those resulting from destruction, are honey to the ears. Complete refinement, which I cannot say about dubbing. Kevin Collins as Rico, Jon Avner as the main antagonist have beautiful voices that match the characters, but someone has incorporated it all so much that it sounds artificial. And it's not just these gentlemen! The entire cast suffers from this disease. There are many productions on the gaming market that do not know what they are. Even the two previous parts of the series were like that, but there is no problem with the identity. We know from the first minutes that we have bad dialogues, hackneyed texts, a weak plot, but japa is honest at the mere thought of explosions and madness. The problems of the previous parts were completely eliminated and after several dozen hours of maxing everything out, I couldn't get enough of everything! Sure, the aforementioned "Tango and Cash" are not a cinematic masterpiece and hide with today's movies, but the truth is, it's still a fantastic action movie - and it is.

text: Despu√©s de jugar la campa√±a pr√°cticamente 2 veces [en las 2 √∫ltimas dificultades] me siento preparado para analizar este grandioso juego. Es un juego FPS de guerra, pero no es cualquier FPS de guerra, es un simulador, que aunque el juego ya es algo viejo tiene una gran jugabilidad y muchos toques de realismo. , cualquier jugador se puede adaptar a ella [incluso tiene compatibilidad con control de consola], por lo que no hay pretexto para decir que los controles o la manipulaci√≥n del personaje es complicada. A decir verdad es algo b√°sica. El √∫nico punto que se puede complicar un poco es la minpulaci√≥n de la esfera o interfaz de √≥rdenes r√°pidas, este punto es muy poco trascendental pero no est√° dem√°s mencionarlo (si lo compran por todo lo positivo que tiene el juego, me entender√°n a lo que me refiero). Los gr√°ficos y el audio son de calidad, pueda que no sean gr√°ficos del 2015, pero los shaders, sombras y los efectos de movimiento est√°n muy bien logrados. Ahora algo importante a considerar:  . Los detalles que tiene el juego respecto a este apartado me han dejado m√°s que satisfecho, desde los movimientos como tirarse al suelo hasta las animaciones cuando desenfundas las armas [o las guardas]. El juego desempe√±a este papel m√°s que bien, pues  .  , que si tienes experiencia en el g√©nero no te costar√° trabajo adaptarte, pero de lo contrario, si no tienes experiencia, no te gusta morir a cada instante y te desesperas con facilidad, desde ya te digo que este no es tu juego. El realismo en este juego es tal, que puedes morir con 2 a 3 balazos que recibas bien dados, por lo que cubrirte y buscar atajos t√°cticos se convierte en algo indispensable. Si te hirieron de bala y por suerte sigues vivo, tienes que vendarte, pues si no te desangrar√°s y morir√°s. Si te hieren en un brazo no disparar√°s con presici√≥n, si lo hacen en una pierna no podr√°s correr, si lo hacen en la cabeza pues ya sabr√°s que pasa 7w7r, adem√°s de que el viento y la gravedad son factores que afectan la trayectoria de los proyectiles, ahora que te cont√© estos aspectos ya dir√°s si no tiene bien lograda la simulaci√≥n. Puntos positivos: +Buena jugabilidad +Buenos gr√°ficos +Excelente simulaci√≥n +Buen audio +Buena trama +La dificultad [para muchos] Puntos negativos: -Interfaz de √≥rdenes r√°pidas. -La dificultad [para muchos] El juego es un excelente simulador de guerra seg√∫n la fecha en la que se lanz√≥, est√° bien logrado en casi todos los aspectos tratados arriba. Si no te gusta la dificultad este juego no es para t√≠, si te gustan los retos, te recomiendo comprarlo, no te fallar√°, es un gran juego en su g√©nero. Un saludo.

text_translate: Nibiru: Prologue, which is translated from English Nibiru: prologue. This version is a demo in which we can get acquainted with the elements of the game, with the characters and other details with which the developers decided to acquaint users. The game has several characters represented by such countries: USA, Russia, Germany, France, China. Each of them has its own characteristics that should help you in the game. The gameplay in the game is interesting, it draws on the study of its world and the knowledge of its history. The soundtrack is also on a level with regard to graphics, the game is somewhat similar to projects such as Satisfactory, Mass Effect, The Cycle and a number of other projects, but with their own not only graphic differences, but also differences in mechanics and presentation of the world and atmosphere of the game. To summarize, the developers are heading in the right direction. I am glad that in addition to English, there is also Russian in the game!

text_translate: A rare work in recent years that allowed me to pass the level at once (actually, I played it for two weeks, but I can‚Äôt remember it). As an indie game like Metroid Castlevania, the biggest advantage of this game in my opinion is its completion. Very high, all aspects of the game are very solid. This is very valuable for low-cost indie games. Many indie games make me feel amazing and interesting in the first tens of minutes, but few can continue to bring excellent experiences for more than 30 hours. Few solid attacking feel, simple skill settings, rich and interesting map and level design, and careful boss battle design are all indispensable parts of an excellent Metroidvania. Fortunately, Hollow Knight has done a lot on these points. Not bad. In addition to the excellent traditional Metroidvania game experience, this game also brings players a colorful world of bugs: cute or terrifying bugs, dark nests, gorgeous city of tears, individual npc and the protagonist this anti- The image of hero is the icing on the cake for this adventure of narrative in fragmented form. Until the final open ending, players are worthy of recollection and thinking.

text_translate: It's a little free game made by the creator of The Stanley Parable. As in this last game, we embody in first-person view a hero who does not speak but who moves on the narrative rails. The story is very short and does not present any scenario branching whereas The Stanley Parable offers a rather wide variety. The duration of a run is short and one is trapped in the narrative. The latter has a good translation with French subtitles but the recording in English is not great, you have to listen. There is a second narrative frame if you grab the tape recorder in the first room and read the cassettes that you find throughout the adventure. The only challenge of the game is to find all the coins and pretzels hidden during the progression. tl; dr: good little free game despite overly directive narration.

text: Can't believe I haven't wrote a review for this game yet. Ummm where to start? The game is fun, can be addictive at times. Being able to level up different classes (Gunslinger, Commando, etc..) and the perks that come with are really fun. Shooting head off and exploding zeds into a bunch of pieces in zed time (Slo-Mo) is pretty awesome. There is a "gibs and fluids" option in the graphics options I recommend if your pc can handle it. I play the game on ultra with the gibs and fluids on and the gore is even more intensified. You shoot chunks out of body parts, you can actually see intestines flying around and the blood flows out and pools on the floor. It can be pretty intensive on your PC but if it can handle it I highly recommend to have an even better experience on this game.  TLDR; Game is fun as hell 11/10

text: First of all i would like to say "wow"    10/10 This game is something i think that we have all wanted for a long time. something new and not recycled material.  A completely fresh idea that was done very well. it is not overdone and it really gives you that pirate feeling. This is perfect for the people who just want a game they can play with some friends every once in a while or for the hardcore fans who make this game there go to game. My favorite part of the whole game is the effort that was put into it!! lets take a look at a game like h1z1. They make millions of dollars and the game is still very broken and they claim it is "early access" but black wake did the perfect example of a "early access" of course some things need to be worked on but the game has only been out for one week! They could drop the game right now and leave it as is and it would be perfectly fine with most users but i already know there will be a ton of new content to come in the game! (thank you guys for taking the time to actually make a playable game!) Pros -The game has a great feeling it makes you feel like you are actually in the era the game is mimicking -The amount of work they actually put into making a good game -The graphics are very realistic -The community so far is great! you get some teams who play seriously/tactically and some who just like playing for fun! -In the first week a update was already released to fix a few bugs! -Price the game is about 17$ for the amount of fun i have had on the game i would have paid double. -The game came out at the perfect time we are currently in a game drought not many to play that were not tired of -I could make this list 10x as long overall great game! Cons -Obviously the game will have some bugs it is a week old but i can promise you there are very few bugs so few it could most likely be fixed in one update -Biggest con is i dont have any more cons to list In the end this game is a must buy! 10/10 i really hope this game gets the exposure it deserves thank you so much for putting the time and effort into making this game! everyone who was part of making this game deserves a raise!!!

It has been a successful production for those who love this genre, where they can spend a long time.

text_translate: It's a great game that I got to know thanks to a streamer I've been following for a long time. It got my full attention from the first game because of the strategy aspect at the same time that I started to hate it a bit because luck also plays a part. It is strategic because victory is only achieved based on careful plans that take into account each movement, your own and others. It is a continuous analysis of the ever-changing circumstances of his long games. Luck intervenes (especially when fighting against low ranks) because there is the possibility that a rival lives only to ruin your plans, to kill you troops, in short, to see you lose the game. I clarify that the above happens more than anything in the lower ranks, because good players avoid wearing themselves out in attacking senseless and seek, logically, victory. In that sense, once you reach a certain level of play, you really enjoy Risk, all the virtues it has and will surely have in the future. Highly recommended!

text: having put 300 hours into the game, it's time for a review. after putting in so much time with crusader kings II, I eagerly awaited the release of this game, like many others. I'd say the first 100-150 hours was a pure joy after crusader kings II, the new looks and the new bells & whistles are sensational for sure. there are admittedly many of the same problems in this game as there were in the previous one. historical errors abound.  there's nothing particularly special about increasing your rank and gaining titles. becoming king or emperor is easily done and basically all that happens is you can do a few more things and have higher rank vassals. I thought it was great that towards the end of ckII they added the "coronation ceremony" and I hoped it would be expanded upon but it seems to have just been done away with. you don't really get any additional respect or boons or benefits to becoming king or emperor, there's nothing mystical or majestic about it in terms of events or mechanics even though sovereigns as such would have been seen to have been imbued with these things historically. at each new accession I've experienced immediate factions for liberty, independence, putting someone else on the throne. this just didn't happen that much, especially towards a dynasty that had possessed the title(s) for hundreds of years. I suppose I'm not quite sure how to put it, but there's just no "oomph" to becoming king or emperor. it would be great if there was more options, for example, starting as just a baron or a mayor, even a bishop, and having the ability to become king or emperor from such a start. even an option to start as just a courtier with no land but the ability to get on a lord's council and 1 day purchase (or get a "hook" for) a lordship from him would add more depth. I love how they have evolved the character portraits. they look great for the most part, though some still do look kind of troll-like even if they have 1 of the traits that grants attraction. I'd also love to see more accessory and head-wear options, along with being able to change a character's color pattern, if, for example, you don't want your character stuck with green garment patterns their entire life. the byzantine emperor should also have access to imperial purple garments. the byzantine emperors were famous for their imperial purple robes, where are they? primogeniture succession is time locked to the year 1200, and even then still takes time to "research," despite primogeniture succession being a "thing" long, long before that.  the house and dynasty mechanics leave a lot to be desired. dynasty legacies are too expensive. you should be able to change/customize the coat of arms. also dynasty members creating cadet houses needs to be toned down. pretty much as soon as they get a title they create a cadet house.  your infant children/grandchildren will at times go on trans-continental adventures. (????) tyranny penalties from revoking all titles from a heretic/rebel. (????) warfare is still the same siege & whack-a-mole. you're basically cheating yourself out of more customers at this point, since many players who enjoy total war-style games would love to play crusader kings but are turned off by the fact that you don't actually see your armies or control movements or see the battle. it's called crusader kings, where's the blood and gore and glory? for some odd reason the ability to choose many different start dates was taken away, and although it was said you could play on beyond 1453 this time around, you cannot do so if you want to get achievements. so... there is a major lack of achievements as of the writing of this review, only 56 and some of them do not make sense/are not fun to get/have terrible imagery. the "kings to the seventh generation" artwork doesn't even show a king but a queen, and the starting character for this achievement (count eudes/aka odo of france) is not even the ancestor of the king who this prophecy was for, which was hugh capet. hugh capet's grandfather was odo's brother robert. I can't help but wonder if paradox even utilizes historians or even takes the time to read historical texts.  it is absolutely ridiculous that to get the (terrible artwork) achievement "norman yoke," you are required to convert all of england to "english" culture. who at paradox believes that the norman conquest promptly resulted in a native population of millions of anglo-saxons and scandinavians suddenly coming together in common culture with their foreign rulers? and within william the conqueror's lifetime no less? vassal titles get inherited out of the realm despite crown authority laws and despite the fact that this did not happen historically. heresies are excessive and pretty annoying. the player is penalized for holding "too many" duchy titles and counties, despite kings and emperors personally holding many such titles in history. I'm glad that they did fix the disputed heritage event, which is incredibly frustrating, although I do find my soulmate wife of 20+ years at times having the "strumpet" modifier or becoming adulterous, so perhaps this still needs some looking into. going on crusade and creating a crusader kingdom is essentially pointless outside of the gold and prestige rewards, since the AI usually loses the crusader state within 15 years or so. unless you, the player, constantly babysit the crusader kingdom and feed them an endless stream of gold, they're gonna go under. doing this or even sending gifts in general becomes tedious since you can have 150,000 gold and only be able to send 153 in gifts at a time. I've also come to find that in the last 150, even 200 years or so of a game, it becomes very empty and boring. there's not really any point to warfare by then unless you're just interested in adding on more territory to your realm. you make more gold than you'll ever spend, and at least for me I end up just funding other character's wars while waiting to go on a hunt or take a mystical communion every 5 years. you run out of buildings that you can build, which doesn't make sense. you're basically just sending gifts to vassals to get them to leave you alone and educating kids. there aren't any late game events or mechanics going on, at least not any that I actually noticed or that posed any sort of threat or challenge. that being said, and to keep this somewhat short, basically, if you've never played a crusader kings game before, then this game will be an absolute blast, especially the 1st 100 hours or so you put into it. if you have played crusader kings before, don't come into this expecting a lot. it is a somewhat different game from ckII and there's going to be pleasant surprises and fairly bitter disappointments. it has only been a month & a half since release, but the game is in desperate need of some DLC to add more content throughout the game, especially mid-to-late game.  the game is also in desperate need of a historical mode. it quickly becomes bizarro world and at least for me its very hollow like that after 100 or 200 years. I can't speak for everyone but I have no doubt that there are others like myself who would like to play out their game in a more historically accurate setting. in my original review for crusader kings II I said there were a thousand thrills to be had. there aren't that many this time around but it's a great start and I'll probably come back to the game after some DLC comes out. as an aside, I do have to say that 1 of the paradox moderators here on steam acted arbitrarily and unfairly towards me and this individual has not only tainted the game for me but has also made an enemy for life. I will never forgive nor forget how that moderator has treated me.

text: Trucks, Mud, Fun, Realism. All words that very well resemble Spintires. But this game is really fun.
text_translate: DOTA 2 is my favorite way. The program lets me assume the role of another creature, helping me experience our oneness with the universe. I like to assume the position of the dinosaur-riding, lightning-wielding, half-lizard half-man. I like to join servers with up to nine other disciples, be ‚ÄúDisruptor‚Äù (as he is called), and go to the jungle, closing my eyes; there I concentrate on my breathing.  The other disciples (woefully) always curse at me. I usually have to mute them. I do so to concentrate on being one with the virtual nature. (I can‚Äôt afford to go to national parks, so this is the best thing). Sometimes I see lots of colorful exclamations points and these ‚ÄúPING PING PING PING PING‚Äù sounds occur around my character. They are beautiful. One time someone said, ‚ÄúTHE ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•?! LEVEL 1 DISRUPTOR, BUY COURIER YOU ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ING ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•!‚Äù And the truth is there are many players like him. They aren‚Äôt at peace with themselves. Perhaps if he came into the forest and hummed koans with me, and he had done so as the giant, walking tree, then he would see his greater consciousness. All the negative energy would leave his body, and we‚Äôd share a moment of experiencing our Buddha nature.  In my experience, sessions last about 10-20 minutes. And initially it did not take long to find a server; apparently I‚Äôve been moved to ‚Äúlow-priority matchmaking.‚Äù But that‚Äôs okay. I just assume the lotus position in my chair and wait patiently. The only downside to this is that sometimes I forget to click the "accept" button.

text_translate: With over 20 hi-standard awards achieved already, Papers, Please is seriously ONE OF THE GREATEST GAMES  published in 2013. It's old-school, it's innovative, also imo beautiful in a classic way in its brutally simple appeareance and it made me laugh out loud few times (can't remember when single-player made me actually laugh :D). The concept itself is let alone just brilliant but when laced with a great storytelling in which player can impact and with a gameplay that enhances the back-to-the-childhood feeling you get, Papers, Please is one to remeber. Just the ancient-sounding theme music brings an amused grin to your face - a reminder of the good old times. This is not easy game by any means, requires some brains and sharp eye but not in an annoying way. I found the difficulty very fitting and enjoyable.  Papers, Please may not offer something to play for a very long time right away (depends on person), that said it will surely exceed its value by far anyway in the hands of an average gamer. On the other hand I can see myself returning to this game in future, similarly as with e.g. Max Payne, DOOM, etc. I do not want to give spoilers - one's has to experience this game like it happens in it's story - out of the blue. As I fancy 2013 not a great year regarding to game releases I am glad I have now something to remember and to recommend to fellow gamers.  Glory to Arstotzka!

text_translate: Fugue in Void is a VERY short (under an hour), atmospheric, abstract / minimalistic First Person Walking Simulator game with an obnoxiously long opening sequence that has no player interaction for the first roughly ten minutes or so and no checkpoints throughout its duration.  If you're going to give this game a go know that it's a brief (albeit immersive and nice-looking) minimalist approach that you may want to have a cup of coffee or other drink by your side to keep you tided over as you finish its short journey. Had I known this game has no checkpoints, I wouldn't have bothered to exit it the first time I had booted it up about 20 minutes in, wherein I got to one of its early (and sparse) puzzle sequences (which involve nothing more than walking onto switches on the floor to open the path to the next area...) grew impatient trying to find the next switch, and exited. I had assumed it saved but unfortunately that isn't the case, so I had to view the game's long ass opening again. Keep that in mind, as my total playtime is 1.1 hours, so the game itself minus my having restarted should only take about 45 minutes to complete while amply exploring its mostly linear environments. I had to keep questioning if I had even bought a "game" or was instead observing an art piece during the game's very long, passive opening. Fugue in Void opens with a sequence of abstract shapes in the distance as white noise / distorted ambient sound warbles along accordingly. As a purveyor of abstract, minimalistic games and wanting to see a game's full intention rather than skip over its initial introduction, even I found the opening a bit long and overdone.  That being said, when you do get to the player-controlled segments of the game I found myself wanting to see what was next, and would often stop to admire its design and well-done lighting. The game has a brooding atmosphere despite its empty areas that is interesting and unsettling at times.   Fugue in Void's gameplay during the first half primarily consists of just wandering the abstract environments until you find a switch on the ground to step on to open a pathway to the next area. When you have reached the end of a sequence is very vague, as you just walk into an area and the game fades to black before popping you into its next random area. This can be a little jarring early on, but I started to appreciate the game's pacing and overall ethereal nature the more I played.  Fugue in Void recalls influences such as Mondrian and Escher in some of its design choices, including stark areas of black and white and geometric shapes used to create immersive space for the player.  While I wouldn't say I "loved" Fugue in Void I am glad I finished what it was offering. Its lack of any checkpoints whatsoever is kind of bunk (perhaps an 'Intermission' halfway through to pick up on would keep other players coming back?? or the option to skip its very long opening?) but I did enjoy the overall experience. The game's use of   about halfway through is nicely timed, and gives the game a refreshing sheen to the earlier, drearier environments. I grew a little impatient with some of its very abstract, passive sequences (including a few near the end that felt a bit "lazy" where you're simply watching geometric arrays spin overhead before the view fades to black and you're introduced to yet another) but all-in-all I found Fugue in Void to be an immersive, interesting experience.

text: I picked this up when it was on sale (90% off), so it was cheaper than a BigMac. If you can grab it on sale like me and you like shooter games, just go for it. There's really not much to complain here. It's a solid shooter in the spirit of its predecessor from 1997. This means, that there are hordes of demons thrown at you and you simply shoot your way through them, occasionally searching for keys to unlock doors and proceed and having a boss fight every few levels. It's very (and I mean  ) linear with lots of very obvious artificial walls (road blocks etc.) but that's probably a mixture of dev-lazyness and pure intention design-wise in order to stick to the original. Back then no one cared about that, but I can see that maybe today some people don't like to see that. There's also been a major change regarding the main protagonist, Lo Wang. He's not that totally exaggerated stereotypical bald-headed, long-bearded kung-fu master anymore, instead he's a modernized, generic character, looking like a young triad thug. I'm not really happy with that change, since he lost his soul somehow, but it's not much of a problem either, since you don't get to see him that often anyway, besides cutscenes and the character screen. Speaking of which - there are some of the typical pseudo-roleplaying-elements in this game, like in so many shooters today, where you can unlock special skills and upgrade your weapons. That's pretty neat. Technically the game isn't a trailblazer, but the graphics are adequate, considering it's from 2013. It seems to be well optimized, I never had a bug or crash yet and my fps are way above 120 under pretty much all circumstances (GTX 770, ultra settings, 1080p). I'm halfway through the game now and I must say, I'm really enjoying it. It's good and considering how dirt cheap it was, I'm really getting my money's worth. If it's on sale: I fully recommend it.

text: A Very Simple Game
text_translate: I can't explain what this game did to me. I've always been a person that was really competitive and "tryhard" at games. From my games always branching in the competitive type. When i first played this game i was clueless of what to do.. THen i raised my headphones volume late at night and dwelve in. I was so interested in this game i couldn't track anything else in my life. The music, the ambience, everything. When i fell in the water in the first time i didn't get mad or ragequit, i got curious because i wanted to see what would happen next. I didn't care for goals or an objetive i was just enjoying this game- no, this experience. I absolutly you play this at least once. But don't take it as a game to complete, just enjoy the ride.

text_translate: Before buying this game, I was most afraid that the main rate would be on the topic of the zombie apocalypse, which is extremely hackneyed in my opinion. But I would be pleasantly surprised when my fears were refuted. The game turned out to be not at all about how to kill zombies correctly, but about how to survive, build a new civilization, while remaining human. The game is striking not only with an exciting plot, it makes you think, like any good book. And the main topic, in my opinion, is how inhuman a person can be and how to preserve this humanity in critical conditions. We can save our own skin, or we can help a stranger without betraying our principles. After all, one's own survival is not in the foreground. This is a great movie book game! Graphics 10/10 Plot 10/10 Gameplay 9/10 Sound \ Voice acting 10/10 Final score: 10 Telltale Games developers out of 10 This game is worth the money, I will definitely buy DLC "400" days if you want to play a normal zombie game , buy, do not hesitate, it will pay off your money.

text: Wow, what can I say, this game really hit home for me. The way the story is laid out and the exclusion of dialog I find allows you to experience it in your own way and allows you to relate it to your own personal experiences, making it feel like that much more of a connection if you do so. This also means everyones experience can be absolutely different. The game is short, but nonetheless extremely well done. The music seems to be a perfect fit for each and every part of the game. They also seem to mix up the different types of emotions within the game and transition between them almost flawlessly. This game is a bit hard to review without giving anything away about it.  If you enjoy interative story style games then I most definitely recommend grabbing this title, and extremely looking forward to Finding Paradise.

text: Really good RPG, fun and challenging with tons of replayability. The graphic style and animations might lead you to suspect this is a light, casual game, but it's much deeper and more rewarding that it appears at first glance. It has everything I'm looking for in a party-based RPG - entertaining gameplay, a variety of viable strategies and playstyles, a solid story (which varies based on game mode, of which there are several), solid variety of characters, tons of gear and enemies. It also grows as you play it, both because the devs have released several new game modes and updates for free and because the shop mechanic lets you unlock new content as you work through each playthrough. Refreshingly, the shop doesn't ask for money but instead is based on "lore" that you receive as rewards for in-game success. Both single player and co-op games are highly enjoyable, which is often lacking in games that try to do both. Definitely add this one if you're at all into fantasy RPGs or table games
