In a time where cryptocurrency mining is making modern gpus unaffordable for the average consumer, enter Kung Fury Street Rage,  the game that would have been considered "retro" even in the "retro days". Based on the movie which everyone loved and not just because it's free, Kung Fury is the game where you play as the man who got bit by a cobra and struck by lightning at the same time.  The game itself is simple but entertaining. You have only two buttons, A and D or the left and right arrow, which translates into punching, kicking and killing left and right the waves of enemies that are coming at you. Five enemy types and a leader-board which stars the fictional characters, your steam friends and your possible biggest adversary a.k.a. yourself usually makes it the kind of game that from a couple of minutes can go to endless hours of playtime for most people. It's the kind of game where you don't need to be in the mood to play through and enjoy it. Both in endless mode and story mode you'll play as four characters, each of them playing differently and while that is great the truth is you'll still be most comfortable as playing Kung Fury, since he's the most accessible and fluid in game-play. The others handle different and while you'll master one, the others will still give you pause.  The story is just as ridiculous as the movie and that's in a good way. It should take you half and hour to play through it, but if you grew up with cinematic games the two-button game-play might feel like "clunky controls" which will cause you troubles from the second stage. For everyone though, the last boss will be a challenge and much like in the games of old or the Dark Souls of nowadays, you'll learn from failure. Luckily, the game has checkpoints, but only when you start a new game and an automated save system, with five different slots which can be overwritten. The game's visuals will look well since it already looks ancient, but that's your guarantee that you'll run it on everything, every resolution with no performance cost at a 60 fps cap. The background is the same and the soundtrack is limited in then number of tracks but engaging for the fight and ambiental in the way that you won't mind hearing it over and over gain. Besides, the player's focus will be on dealing with the increasing number of nazis which come from each side.  Fun game and so cheap that you don't have to wait for a sale to buy it. An easy game to recommend I'd say!  You can watch the movie here:   or look for it on Steam(still free)

text_translate: The Park is a beautifully done psychological horror game about a mother trying to find her son, who is lost in an old amusement park after closing.  Its creepily entertaining and the story comes in bits and pieces as Lorraine explores the park chasing after her son. Pros:  Builds a creepy mood  Has a complex female protagonist  Interesting story The amusement park is like a character itself Cons: Very short at about two hours, probably less for faster players. A friend told me she finished it in 90 minutes! Some rooms are repeated No real puzzles Kinda expensive for what you get I really enjoyed this and I feel that others interested in horror games might really like this, especially if it goes on sale. :)

text: The Walking Dead: Michonne, come si pu√≤ intuire dal titolo, √® uno spinoff che si concentra su uno dei personaggi pi√π enigmatici e interessanti di tutto il mondo The Walking Dead, Michonne.  Complessivamente il titolo √® ottimo ma non ai livelli dei capitoli precedenti. Qui le scelte sembrano essere poco importanti al fine della storia, poich√© essa √® troppo breve (ma √® pur sempre, purtroppo, uno spinoff) e non ci permette di approfondire il rapporto con i vari personaggi che andremo a conoscere lungo la storia. Una storia piena di flashback della nostra protagonista, alle prese con visioni tremende delle sue due piccole figliolette. Il ritmo di tutto il gioco √® incalzante (qui la lunghezza esigua del titolo aiuta questo fattore) e ti spinge a finirlo praticamente in una giornata, tenendoti incollato allo schermo con la voglia di sapere cosa succeder√† da l√¨ a poco. Molto belle le fasi action, pi√π veloci ed adrenaliniche. Per quanto riguarda la trama, l'ho apprezzata molto, ma non vi svelo nulla, giocatelo! Avrebbe meritato pi√π approfondimento per me, peccato. Le pretese per sfornare l'ennesimo capolavoro c'erano. Rimane comunque un titolo consigliabile a chi ama questa serie, solamente da acquistare con un buono sconto.

text_translate: The game deserves the title rightly! It's easy  ! Well for me definitely, of course only in connection with some mods, why? Without mods you will tear your hair off your head in the traffic chaos! You will cry, you will freak out, you will see that your girlfriend's bitching is a shit against the frustration that can arise here, you will build the city of your dreams and gradually watch the slow traffic with tears in your eyes like a traffic jam after the other arises, nothing works anymore! STOP! This need not be! because ... with different tools e.g. mods like '' Traffic Manager '' and various '' Extended Road '' mods you show the traffic jam yours. These mods are a must for everyone, clear traffic light control with time information and lane assistant gives you full control over all traffic. The game is totally and completely worth the money, building cities has never been so much fun, here one or the other developer can get a slice of performance in terms of simulation, strategy and building games, well or better not, because they get it it won't work anyway, oh, if you read that, don't be sad. That shouldn't come across as negative, it should only be for our best. + Damn big maps + Graphics + Very few bugs (constant bug fixes and expansions) + Steam Workshop + Damn long game fun + Editor + Controls + Yes, lick the A ****, even the Sims are simulated here that don't work twice no longer exist or teleport like in Sim City. - The loading times for too many mods (approx 46) and assets (approx 3k) are up to 10-15 minutes. but it's still okay for me, start the game> go to the kitchen> make coffee> sit down> gamble. - No multiplayer or co-op. 10/10

text_translate: Fading Visage looked promising before I bought it, It looked promising when I just started it and became terrible after the first bit of the game. It's nothing else then repeating yourself, follow a spirit, grab something, run back to the house, don't get caught by the shadows and repeat. When you did this enough times and got all the items you will get an abrupt ending (which did not work properly for me).  The game at first looks really big but it's actually a very small map and I believe in this kind of game, game physics are key. as example you run from the shadows and come to a branche on eye height, I would say you should get stopped by the branch. In this game you will just walk right through a lot of obstacles making the game extremly easy. This could be a game that makes your adrenaline rush when you are running from the shadows, but this game has no running in it and you hardly notice that you are being chased by something. It does have some achievements that adds a little to the time you can spent on this game but if you go through this game in one go it can be easily finished within 30-45 minutes. Pros: - The idea is nice - Very simple controls - It has a few achievements Cons: - Graphics are not that great - Loading times can be long - Bad physics - Very short playing time - No trading cards This game can be played by everyone although it can be scary for little kids and is just to boring for real gamers.

And a hummer with a turret easily makes a motorcycle) Oh yes, passing the game you will enjoy the phrase 30 times: "So! We act quickly, cleanly and without corpses" (even if you need to eliminate the target in the task) Some horseradish will call about 20 times and tell you that he is in position Almost at every collision, if you please hear: "S-ka, your mother" The most uninteresting thing in this game is the end (there are no spoilers, and there is nothing to spoil)! What he really is? Pfft, ABSOLUTELY THE SAME that you did during all + -15 hours. They added absolutely nothing to the denouement. text: The game is really good, for me it's the best total war game I have played. Reasons why: The character menu, theres diffrent armour and weapons and just things to equip to your generals. Which I find really fun. The city buildings, it's just really enjoyable for me to keep expanding my cities and making them grow and seeing what options I have for my cities and towns and so on. It tells you if it will benefit you or not. There is alot of information in the game, so you don't get too confused. The main characters, for me all of the factions and their "main" guys are really well done to me. Their armour, their backround, the voice acting is very good aswell. You will fall in love with the faction, just need to find the one you really enjoy, theres one for all of us. The way they made this game, is alot like shogun but much better. And it gets very addicting, because you want to become that emperor. And there is alot of land to take, and it's not super easy, but it's enjoyable af.  If you love Total War games, this one is for you TRUST ME.  The game can only get better with future updates, workshop and a few more dlcs. And one of my last words is, if they would make a medieval total war with this kind of style it would be the best (in my opinion). The game is really REALLY good, it will not disappoint you. And as mentioned, it can only get better.
text_translate: In general, the game as a horror game may have been a success - after the game there remains an eerie residue in the head, but rather from the chosen horror theme. In the horror, you can play many themes, for some reason the author of this game chose the theme "the murder by the grandson of his old grandmother who suffered from old age and related problems in connection with a family tragedy", a creepy topic in which the moment of murder is described in more detail - which raises doubts about the psychological state of the author himself. At the end of the game, the author thanks for completing his product. And he suggests that he might release a new project and the player will play. No thanks, author, please don't release any more games. The game takes an average of 2 hours. I took it for 72r (discount) - I do not recommend it for the full price.

Nope at this stage I  would not recommend this game. I haven't played single mode for more than two hours and I'm fed up. There are games with a good storyline and atmosphere that compensate for their shortcomings even when they are painfully average. On the other hand, Homefront, despite its bold presentation of the presented world, does not make up for many of its shortcomings. This is the only game so far where I have seen Extermination Camps, ruthless soldiers, ordinary citizens dying in front of our eyes from disease and hunger, this is a vision of a real dystopia under the tyranny of monsters engulfed in propaganda, not people. Overall, the creators set themselves the goal of showing a brave and brutal vision of the USA under communist occupation. It is certainly exaggerated, but it is interesting nonetheless. The story where the DPRK attacks the US seems naive, but I do not rule out that I would change my mind if I were looking for newspaper snippets from which we can dig into how this catastrophe of the American dream happened, but I had no desire to do so. The characters we meet are not convincing and are only there to guide us further. They say something and have their moments in which they try to show that they are also supposed to be alive, but we still do not pay attention to them and we go on whenever possible. The entire campaign is scripted. It is true that the Call of Duty series is famous for this and is one of my favorite series, but it is done really well there. In this game, the scenes felt artificial in places. This feeling was magnified by a really large number of mistakes. It's been a long time since I met so many in an hour of play! Korean soldiers are stupid and killing more usurpers is not fun, despite the worst shooting pattern. As for a short game, there are even a lot of weapons, but during the campaign we will often change weapons, because ammunition is like a medicine for each separately, which is sometimes annoying. Not a single piece fell into my ear, and the music on the menu gives me the feeling that this is a budget game. The graphics for 2011 are ugly. The textures do not please the eye, the animations are average and sometimes there are errors in the visual setting, such as a glowing figure as if it were after a solid dose of radiation. Homefront is a bad game. Guerrilla fights and terrorized USA are an interesting idea for a plot. Unfortunately, in this case it was lost. If bugs were fixed and a few things were tweaked then it would even be quite a title in a single player campaign. But I was positively surprised by the multiplayer mode, which is quite good compared to what the story mode presents. Unfortunately, it is on the verge of natural death due to the fact that there is usually only one server where 10 to 30 people play. I did not have high expectations, but Homefront gives the impression of a budget game, like in games from a kiosk. I will not say, because I had fun with some of them, but that was many years ago, and the requirements increased. I do not recommend buying it, but if the game is already in the library, you can check it.

text: Played it a little bit, Its good.
text_translate: Eh, anime boobs are fun... Sometimes.

Somehow the game didn't catch me, you just connect to the server and play, no explanations anywhere about how the game is controlled or just something ... I was confused from the beginning, I didn't know what to do ... From controlling the game and the inventory itself and making things I was quite confused and somewhat surprised with how sloppy it is

It's sad that it took me so long to realize that the mathematics in this game are broken. Purchasing a 100% increase in generation, should result in your production of that resource doubling. It's basic percentages. However, instead of going from 2 to 4 my resource went from 2 to 3. This is a 50% increase. This makes me question the other mathematics that are used within the game. This game is dependent upon its maths is correct. Therefore, from a fundamental perspective, the game is broken. Secondly, there is   taking place in the game making it not worthwhile in putting in the time and effort to succeed in their special events. This is because there are reward tiers. Why put in tens of hours when someone can jump on and beat your work without having earned it? A further failure of the developers here is their technical support. It's extremely hit or miss. For example, I am still waiting to receive my rewards from one of their Christmas events. This would have given me quite a few upgrades to my characters. Additionally, the developers do not communicate - or if they do it is extremely minimally - with their player base through the discussion forums here. Frankly, it's not good enough. Finally, the micro-transactions are hugely overpriced for the value that you receive. Therefore, they feel much more like donations to the developers than they do upgrades to your account. Putting so many hours into a game that is clearly broken is disappointing. A waste of what could be a very good game.

text: For those who were worried about how Hitman 2016 was run with that awful episodic formula, fear not. Squenix/Edios sold the right's to Hitman back to the original developers and they've taken the game to a new amazing level. Easily one of the best Hitman games yet, Hitman 2 takes place a couple of weeks after Hitman 2016 stops.  While the plot is a bit contrived and feels like good guys vs bad guys, the locations and ways to kill is where this game really shines. The amount of things to do and learn in this game will keep you going for hundreds of hours, with intricately designed levels that loop back in and connect in ways you never would have imagined. Easily one of the best games released in 2018, and a worthy contender to one of the best Hitman games since Blood Money. Well worth your time to at least try out the game and see if it's your type of game.  My only complaint is that this entry to the Hitman series really makes me question wtf they are thinking on target design, because all of the targets are sterotypical bad guys and do not make me feel bad at all for killing them. I hope we end up with targets where you hate yourself for killing, I.E. the amusement park mission in Blood Money.

I mean cmon valve, this game has so much potential, but it doesn't seem like you care about the anticheat part. Step your game up valve!

text: I like this product
text_translate: The second part of the saga is largely the same as the first. It's good! I agree. The game mechanics are well known and have hardly changed. Except for a few skills. The video sequences are breathtaking and very well synchronized (German)! The speakers deserve great praise! The graphic is m.M.n. stayed the same. You don't have to say more! But what is really frustrating is this: after a certain time the tide turns and the conquered fortresses are gradually besieged. Not that bad in itself. A colleague wrote to me yesterday that I now have to defend fortresses 20 times. I thought okay ... it can't be that bad. But it is! Because in order to have to defend your fortress successfully, your captains or chiefs must be trained or rise in rank. This goes through battle pits or the "recruiting" of new orc warriors. Or through real money purchases in the shop. (Won't spend half a cent on something like that). If you don't do that, from stage 3 onwards you will be stupid if your fortress is attacked by captains of level 45+. That's exactly where I'm at right now. Top fortified fortress lost to the last attacking captain with level 54. My captains (40+) are falling like flies, I'm dying - fortress lost. The really fucked up thing is that this one dirt captain is regenerating his health! But at what a stupid pace! I don't know what the developers were thinking, but apparently there are people who believe that if you delay something long enough, it will get better !? As far as I've read, there is after the 20 !!! TWENTY fortress defenses only ne meager video sequence at the end. Conclusion: gameplay = as usual - (very good) graphics = as usual - (good) sound = as usual - (okay) story = as usual - (very good) implementation = disgraceful (poop) Until the end of the story nice, then just agonizing. Too bad. Too bad! I played through part one 5 times.

Detective, atmospheric horror and deep plot - sounds almost like a perfect game, but in reality it is just a bad shooter, the main game time you will be fighting drug addicts in buildings. I have nothing against killing enemies in horror games, but not in such numbers and during normal combat. Immediately, the FBI agent does not know how to aim and cannot carry with him more than one weapon and one clip for him, utter nonsense. The story seems to be interesting, so if you are ready to suffer for the sake of a good story, then you can risk passing the game, I personally did not.

text: I have genuinely enjoyed GUNPOINT! I loved the game, its mechanics, its story, its jokes and plot twists. There is so much humour in it and you can vent off and use the game as a stress relief. I finished the game in 2015. Replaying the whole game in 2019 to get the achievements was not at all tedious and maybe I have enjoyed some aspects even more. You can get all achievements easily if you take your time. Relatively short, at around 6 hours for 1 playthrough, I'd say it is definitely worth the money, although I got it on sale. This is one of those gems that you would want to replay just for the cool gameplay and the abilities you can do. Once you pick up gadgets, you can do some upgrades and tweaks. You can choose to finish each level differently or do the whole game in stealth, with no killing or just brute force your way through the levels - reminds me of Splinter Cell, Hitman and Mark of the Ninja. I fully recommend this game, and if you are reading its reviews to reassure yourself in getting it, your doubts should have by now evaporated! Buy and enjoy it - you don't want to miss this adventure! P.S.: It has a Steam workshop - you can make levels, play levels by others and tweak stuff - which can add more hours of fun!

text: I have not played long yet, and I will update this as I put more time into it.  First I love the idea described, but I don't feel it is delivered on correctly.  I was hoping to really have an opportunity to try to find my way to a destination with minimal information, but mostly they give you no chance to get lost, so I spent my time trying to find the least hazardous route.  I can say the camera is awful and they could stand to add more variety to the road conditions, it seems like they decided Russia is all made of mud.  And really I find it hard to imagine a game like this releasing with basically no support for steering wheels, though it is less needed in this game then racing games, but still I bought the stupid wheel because it's the only thing that make driving games less likely to make me want to throw my controller. So the fun parts, I really do think ultimately I like this game, but I do wish there was more of a "game" there, but maybe I just am not far enough yet.  I found the physics and the intense feeling as my big ugly truck hurtled down a hill I had no idea was there, to be pretty cool.  I think this game has a lot of potential and my hope is that they will continue to add content.  I don't like that this feels obviously like a game still in development, but was not indicated as such clearly, but that is the way of PC gaming now and I can't say there is any reason to wait any longer if you have been eyeing this, other then the price :)

text_translate: The gameplay on it's own is actually quite alright, good even. You have several options of engagement right off the bat and your options only get more numerous, with a dodge as a basic ability, rather than as a skill to actually implement skillful play beyond placement and building your character, and no conventional mana meter. There's no traditional stat placement, most of it governed by gear, such as Cards, giving passive bonuses as long as they are equipped, and your choice of clothing at the start of the game, reminding me of Monster Hunter in a sense. The game is surprisingly good looking for a small, rather unheard of release, too. The voice acting is also fairly high quality in comparison to some other unknown releases. My biggest gripe is the fact it's a literal ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• meme game. Gangnam style skeletons, the voice in your head making Stanley Parable references, the same voice also saying Keep Calm and Carry On, Christ this is a cringefest and I've only just got past the first boss at the time of writing this.

The story in this game is based on true events that happened in Tehran in the 1970's and i'll say this, they did a good job with keeping me interested in the story but after finishing the game, i can't recommend it. Diving into this game, you can choose to choose the violent, peaceful or neatrual approach but the gameplay doesn't change much based on your choices. The only thing it changes is if some characters like you or not. This game is fairly short (1 - 2 hrs) and after finishing the game, it just felt like this game was half done for some reason, but that can maybe come from the fact that i finished the game fairly quick and that the game ended on a cliffhanger which makes no sense unless they are making a sequel or adding more chapters to the game (which i think is highly unlikely). Unless you are interested in the subject matter, i wouldn't recommend this game.

Short Summary: The bad: Horribad game - Cannot change shoulders that you aim from, therefore favors aiming and shooting to the right of cover. Cannot aim over left should unless stuck to a wall. Awful controls - shift/double tap W is either roll or sprint, you cannot bind another key and you cannot disable this option, you cannot have split these options up. No secondary weapon (pistol) - you have a primary weapon (AR, smg, sniper shotty) and a melee weapon. No secondary firearm meaning if you get rushed while using a sniper, you have 2 options, go crazy with an axe and hope you dont get shot in the face or use a grenade to try and take them out along with yourself. Extremly laggy, (although ping is not displayed), but is evident by the fact that you can shoot someone, go back into cover, start reloading and then either you or the enemy drop dead mid reload. Shallow game modes, standard run-of-the-mill lobby shooter with no innovative or defining features. Uses third party account to sign up with - does not display EULA, does not display privacy policy, may sell your email to third party companies. Sign up with a dump email account to be safe. The good: Has an uninstall option. Verdict - You'd be better off stepping on Lego, at least that would be more interesting and less painful.

text_translate: Agreed, it took me about 4 hours to get my windows, NVIDIA and game settings to a point where the game would work... but hot damn, it's no only a beautiful game, but therefore also a technological masterpiece. To get these vast amounts of visuals processed on my humble GTX 980 Ti... never would have thought. Granted, I get the occasional 1-2minutes of freezes before some larger portion of the map gets loaded in, so there's a lot of optimization to be done. I also believe this should be prioritized before release more, not only in this game.  TL;DR: It's a beautiful masterpiece once you get it to run. But a lot of optimization still needs to be done and the FPS is mostly smooth, but quite unstable at times. EDIT: I have been debating for over a week now, but I have reached the point where I can no longer leave this as a positive review. It's been one game breaking but after the other these last few patches. First the sensitivity settings were completely botched, making flying virtually impossible. Last patch fixed that, but now I have completely random crashes to desktop, sometimes while loading in, sometimes 30mins into the flight, but EVERY flight without fail. I just tried verifying the integrity of my game files, only to find there is a preexisting bug that simply leads to the game deleting all your game files when doing this. Now I'm stuck with having to download the 100gb over again for a game I cannot really play anyway. I am so disappointed, especially since the game is so beautiful and has so much potential.

text_translate: Some absolutely garbage design decisions get a "No" from me.   The majority of negative reviews echo my own thoughts on this game, but there is one major bad decision that is the nail in the coffin. At the end of the main world 1, there is an escape sequence, where you have to escape a giant tree verticially which is filling up with water.  Which is about 4 minutes of extremely precise and difficult platforming, with no checkpoints.  You die and you have to do the entire thing over. What makes this particularly frustrating is that the "platforming" involves jumping "off" of moving projectiles.  Which move at a fairly speedy pace.  Miss once, start the whole section again. Apparently, there's two more of these such moronic sequences for each of the two later worlds.  Frustrating and unfun.  I did actually beat this section that I'm complaining about, but it's unforgivably terrible.  Not recommended. EDIT:  I just beat the game.  Yes, these annoying chase sequences still happen.  On the whole, the game was frustrating and not fun.  I persisted because the overall vibe of the game was good in terms of design and music, but overall I can't say my playthrough was a positive one.

text: Hangar 13 should be praised for developing such an impressively faithful remake. Every cutscene has been painstakingly recreated for the modern era to make the narrative shine while supporting characters, such as Tommy's love interest, have been expanded upon to provide more depth. The iconic race is back and better than ever, and yes, the traditionally frustrating mission just before it is much more manageable this time around. That along with a whole host of other memorable sequences will make series fanatics feel right at home. This is absolutely the Mafia you remember The remake made some small changes to Lost Heaven, but they're purely an option that can be selected at the beginning of a 15-hour playthrough. The police force isn't nearly as aggressive once they give chase, a number of different collectibles can be found in each and every corner to flesh out the world, and new difficulty modes let you fine-tune the experience. Again, though, they're simply offered as a choice rather than the new way to play the game. And as for the visuals, they can be both impressive and inadequate at the same time. Character models, particularly in cutscenes, look outstanding and so too do some environments, but introduce some greenery on the outskirts of the city and texture pop-in can be replicated on demand. Although, considering we‚Äôre working with a city layout nearly two decades old, it can be forgiven to a point. Bugs and glitches can‚Äôt be though as cars find themselves suspended in mid-air the moment you turn your back while the frame rate drops dramatically during intense combat sections. It pays a great deal of respect to the source text with excellent cutscene direction, voice acting, and a cast of characters you can't help but fall in love with. The game definitely shows its age with frustrating controls and vehicle handling, but the next story beat is enough of an excuse to continue pressing forward. Mafia: Definitive Edition's narrative and everything that comes with it holds up to this day, and it's one worth revisiting even if you know it like the back of your hand. Verdict Pros :- 1- A very faithful remake 2- Good story that holds up 3- Terrific cast of characters 4- Great cutscene direction and voice acting 5- Iconic missions get a new lease of life Cons:- 1- Clunky controls 2- Awful vehicle handling 3- Minor bugs Story - 9 Presentation - 9 Visuals - 9 Gameplay - 7.5 Overall - 8.6/10

text: This game make me sick ‚ô• ƒ± love this game
text_translate: It's a bit hard to describe how I feel about this game. I think that it is a good game, though as the years have gone on it's confused itself, and there are glaring issues about the game that need to be resolved for me to be able to recommend it to others. First off, the engine. It's no secret that this game is terribly unoptimized and full of hackers. This is largely due to the fact that it is running on adobe flash of all things, and it's really quite impressive how much they've done on such a bad engine for games of this scale. Though the game is being ported over to Unity with countless improvements as I'm writing this, it's currently still on flash and thus suffers because of it. The game will likely become so much better just from this port alone and I'll probably update this review after the unity port is completely done. Second, it's revenue model. This game makes its money off of dungeon keys, pets, and quality of life buffs like vault chests and character slots (I wouldn't really call these quality of life as a certain number of them are essentially required to be able to fully enjoy the game, but I didn't know how else to describe them.) While some of each of these are given out for free every once in a while, there are still some that you are probably going to have to drop some cash on to get full enjoyment out of the game. You start off with one character slot and one vault chest. Character slots are self explanatory, and vault chests are places where you can store items between characters so that you don't lose them when you die. It is extremely difficult to enjoy this game when you can only use one character at a time and can only store up to 8 items at a time. In order to try any other characters or other classes, you have to kill your character. This is why it is basically essential that you drop some money on character slots to enjoy the game. Additionally, once you get further into the game, there are a lot of good items that you are going to want to store in your vault, yet you are only given 8 vault slots to do so. Lastly, dungeon keys. A lot of in-game events rely on the sale of dungeon keys. Basically, people sit in the Nexus, the game's safe haven or lobby area, and wait for people to open dungeons using these dungeon keys. It completely skips the step of having to go out into the realm and fight enemies in order to have a chance of the dungeon spawning, and makes it much easier to get good loot when participating in these events. Unfortunately, this results in much of the gameplay these days being you sitting in the Nexus waiting for dungeons to be popped due to how common these events are. Next, on to pets. Pets give you buffs such as healing you insane amounts every couple second and restoring your mana points insanely fast. Pets are able to be levelled up without paying a dime, but the grind is an insane amount and these days, it's very hard to enjoy the game as a new player without a pet because most of the new content in the game revolves around the idea of you having a high level pet to keep your health up. Though pets are what saved the game from shutting down in 2014 by the revenue they generated, they ultimately hurt the game by making most of the game's content redundant and extremely easy. DECA took over the game in 2016 and have been good, for the most part. I believe that there has been some mishandling of the game here and there, but it is clear that their intentions are good and they're doing as much as can be realistically expected with their resources to allow the game to continue thriving. In order for the game to be successful in the future, it all depends on how they continue going forward from now. The unity port will be the largest determining factor for the future of this game, and it should be a clear sign of how they are going to handle it going forward. Final Verdict: Keep an eye on the game, wait til the unity port to get yourself invested. Expect to have to drop some cash here and there to have a fun experience.

Welcome to Cloudpunk in Nivalis, a corrupt, bright and noisy city, a time beyond ours with the same social problems that we currently experience. With a purely story-driven experience, explore a world built on voxel whether flying or walking, during an intense and endless rainy night similar to. Delivering deliveries in style in an authentic cyberpunk environment that provides through the various dialogues with androids, AI, automaton and humans to discover the complexity of each character developed by. Trying to survive his first night at work for Cloudpunk, a ‚Äúlegal‚Äù corporation that transports any type of merchandise as long as the customer can pay for the service. With very clear rules for their employers: Rania hates big cities, but due to financial needs, she even sold her dog's body to leave the East Peninsula, where life is more natural and less busy. Camus is not an ordinary dog, he is an automaton or if you prefer a virtual assistant, software with a dog personality installed in your Cloudpunk flying car. Working under the supervision of Control, an elderly man with a formal tone who is responsible for guiding and informing about new contracted services, most of the time those services with an illegal origin, but our clients pay for the privacy of not being suspicious or monitored by CorpSeg, the military corporation whose priority is to ensure that business continues, defending its own interests. Along with our faithful companion Camus, we will explore the vast social complexity that allows us to meet some funny personalities, such as: Due to the wide variety of dialogues it is easy to get lost and not remember each character and reference mentioned, making the player lose the immersion in the plot involving the secondary character and specific dialogue. It would be very interesting if Rania carried a kind of diary, writing down a biography of the personalities known during her journey. Dialogues do not offer any choice when talking to respond to different situations, since the choices presented in the game do not have as much impact as promised. Getting around with your HOVA allows exploration in the city, so keep the tank full of gasoline and avoid damage by hitting HOVAs in chaotic traffic between Nivalis skyscrapers. It is possible to buy cosmetics and upgrades for your vehicle, be it a turbo that helps you get to your destination faster or reinforcement in the hull that provides damage resistance, avoiding spending the profits earned on the night of work with the mechanic to repair your car, although the game does not seriously punish dangerous driving. The various stores around the city allow you to buy or sell items to gain access to prohibited places or generate extra cash, but unfortunately after a few hours of gameplay you realize that it is worth little effort to collect each icon found on the map to release side missions and dialogues that are more of the same provided in the main missions. With a few hours the gameplay mechanics involving HOVA is only on the autopilot of our brain, performing delevery services and even a private driver between point A to point B and vice versa. With the ability to transmit depth when observing busy streets, alleys or dark alleys and puddles of water reflecting neon lights. You will always have something to admire when you get closer to this city that had an atmosphere and atmosphere inspired by the film; and real places like. Collecting an item scattered across the map will really add little to your journey, but in compensation it provides a camera game by capturing CorpSeg's high-speed action chasing an HOVA, who may be another member of Cloudpunk. The synthesizer aligning them manage to convey the feeling that the city never sleeps. We heard the sounds of the city, instructions on the loudspeakers for its inhabitants, the great crowd talking together at the same time indoors and the constant and endless noise of rain hitting the structures with flying cars tearing the sky at high speed. We will meet different ethnic groups, whether primary or secondary, they have a voice and accent, unfortunately sometimes they cannot convey in their tone the true importance and sense of urgency conveyed by the dialogue, although the variety of voices and accents involved is admirable. Cloudpunk is well, with support for Brazilian Portuguese subtitles, with only a small translation flaw, something that does not compromise the experience, being easy to understand reading on cyberpunk and technology themes for lay people in the subject, such as Rania's explanation to Camus, justifying the reason for his slow thinking due to the vehicle's hardware limitation. The gameplay via keyboard or console controls is simple and accessible that along the journey that lasted 10 hours ends up becoming natural in the middle of traffic. due to its great excess of bringing content with little purpose. Transforming the whole environment full of colors and lights to something black and white, with little real interactivity, besides having several secondary characters that are saved only a few stories that in fact added to the narrative. Probably the developers tried to stretch the project, I hope there will be new content that in fact adds to the narrative and more possibilities for interactivity in its setting. Having monotonous mechanics and very slow pace almost stopping, taking too long to bring the feeling of urgency and danger initially presented by the game. Summary of my impressions on a song: leave your opinion and. Criticism, praise or doubts are read and answered, by obeying the old habit of education.

text_translate: Bike of the Wild is a free roaming physics based mountain biking game which is challenging to complete. Honestly the game lacked something‚Ä¶. That something is a bland game with little to no character apart from the classical music. I do recommend to have a reasonably high spec pc for this game as I experienced frame dropping with my 960 and also a controller to play optimally (although note I couldn‚Äôt get pc controls working effectively).  Progression in this game doesn‚Äôt correlate to any sense of accomplishment, apart from earning a new colour bike and progression statistics nor any real naming. Say you reach the end of any given mountain, terrain or landscape‚Ä¶ good luck bragging to a friend! A game of this type NEEDS some kind of competitive elements whether it is ranking, multiplayer or friend leader boards but quite frankly there isn‚Äôt much entertainment value here anyway to showcase.  That aside the core gameplay mechanics have potential, with quirky controls that make this game challenging yet equally FUSTRATING to complete. Remember to read the tutorial on the side wall as you go through the first stage as it is required for you to successfully pass that section. After completing this area you are able to free roam through different terrains using your skill and game mechanics to pass them.  This game is aimed at a niche group who‚Äôd enjoy mountain biking with difficult controls, but honestly I cannot see myself replaying this game nor recommend it to anyone I know regardless of any price involved.  This game was provided to me by Yolo Army but that does not influence this review in any way.

text: What an interesting game! Let me start by classifying this gem as an 'Adventure 3D platformer' :) For the most part of the game you would be looking for and following clues to progress the story and you'll be doing quite a bit of 3D jumping and jet packing to traverse the incredible landscapes (more and more as you progress). i really love the environment depicted in this game; the way they portray the hero in proportion to the landscape, how he move around, tight control, it's truly immersive for me. The screen is completely devoid of 2d overlay (no health bar\no maps\no nothing) and all the clues are embedded to the landscape themselves. Even without the gripping story, i would enjoy traversing thruogh the planet :) it's not perfect though, there are a few detractions that i think may be addressed in the future; - During scene change, your character may move\change position. It can be disorienting. - During night scene, you can easily lose your way because of somewhat repetitive environment. - Some puzzles can get 'stuck', you need to quit and restart the game to overcome this. (i 'ran out' of explosives on one). considering the whole, these are really minor gripes though. i'd give it 7.5/10

text: Bardzo fajna gra
text_translate: TL;DR:  I liked this game a lot when it came out on the PS2 originally, but it doesn't hold up well today as it has been surpassed in every way by better shooters.   I still like this game for nostalgia, but in my opinion, RF1 is the better game.   Don't buy this at full price but if you get it in a bundle or super cheap, it's worth checking out just to see what the Red Faction series started out like before it's more modern iterations Guerrilla and Armageddon. Red Faction II takes place a few years after the events of Red Faction, but this time moves the story away from Mars to Earth, where the simply named Commonwealth is ruled by the iron fist of the dictator Sopot.   You start the game as Alias, a demolitions expert who is part of a squad of Sopot's elite guard.   You come into possession of nanotechnology which can be used to enhance soldiers.   You and your squadmates volunteer to be enhanced, but Sopot becomes afraid of your power so he marks you and your squadmates for death and abandons the project in favor of creating Processed, nanoenhanced zombies.   Your squad vows revenge and joins up with the Red Faction on earth to help bring down Sopot.   Good: +  GeoMod allowing for destructive environments was still ground breaking (pun intended) for the time, and it is cool to take a grenade launcher and blow apart buildings. + Ambiance of the game is one of the reasons I like this series, this one takes place in a dictatorial city.  The environments are more varied than the first game which is an improvement. + Weapon variety, lots of weapons to choose from in this game.  Since you begin the game as a demolitions expert, your first weapon is a grenade launcher which is a way better starter weapon than a lame old pistol.    This game introduces duel wield weapons, allowing you to use either a single or duel pistol or machine pistol.   + Playing through the game allows you to unlock bonus content, such as concept art, character models, etc.  The game also has a built-in cheat mode system if you're into that sort of thing,  which includes crazy cheats for over the top explosions, deaths, etc.   + Multiplayer mode even with bots was fun.  Lots of late nights playing this with my brothers huddled in front of the TV. + Unlike RF1 on PC, this game doesn't need much modding or tweaking to make it playable on modern systems.   I was able to play at full settings without needing to install anything extra. + Campaign is split into "levels" which allows for checkpoints, one of my major gripes from RF1 was if you died you had to go back to your last save point.   I often forget to save because playing modern games we are spoiled by the auto-save.   This allieviates that somewhat. Bad:  + Even at the highest settings, this game is over a decade old and it looks it.   It's not the most horrible game to look at but you definitely know you're playing an old game.   Character models especially suffer here in cutscenes. + I hate the characters in this game.  They're condescending ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• to the people trying to help them for no reason.   Your character, unlike RF1 where you play as Parker, is mute and has zero personality.    + Story is predictable, even the twists are predictable. + Enemy AI is trash, although they did improve the questionable strafing and bullet spongery from the first game. + Difficulty jumps can make the game frustrating and not rewarding to play.

text: juego a tener en cuenta
text_translate: After this last operation I hope everyone realizes how disgusting this game is. 100 levels of a battle pass format in which 42 of them you get a reward and 58 of them you get nothing. Full price, to buy 100 levels, is $100 CDN. So basically $1 dollar per level. $58 gets you absolutely nothing while $42 gets you an item often a spray worth $0.08 cents. Clearly whoever is left developing this game doesn't care about quality but rather money. What is funny though... They would have made a lot more if they, instead of coming out with yet another weapon skin case, came out with a player customization option. Have a basic editor to choose gender, facial hair and colour, scars and so on. Simple things and realistic. Then release a case that had clothing items. Allow customized bullet proof jackets, gas masks, pants, shirts and helmets for CT and bandana's specific to T's. Allow the player to craft their own unique character while maintaining the theme of the game, realism to the extent that is CSGO and retain the hit boxes by keeping sizes of customization the same.  Nope instead all we have is elitist gloves in a case worth often hundreds of dollars that most your base won't ever own. You can always gamble away $3 at a time to get another $0.10 cent item. Quality content is non-existent while the continuous cash cow that is this game thrives. People should stop buying into it and wake up. You can do whatever you want with your money but why not ask for more from it? Buy 100 levels and get nothing for half those levels? Are you all happy with that? Had they added a customization option it could have breathed new life into the game. Every basic level could have given a neat accessory item like a tie, watches, glasses while cases could have had the bigger items with rarity tiers. More stickers, more useless sprays no one uses, more weapon skins. Seriously? You missed an opportunity here big time.

text_translate: Tooooo manyyyy buggggsssss This game has no "save game" ... In other words, you play a lot today, tomorrow you have to start over, then you need to start over, then again and then again! Never in the history of games has an idiot managed to create a game without saving previously! The producer of this game did it!

Don't get me wrong. I think this could be a great game. The reason why I don't recomend it is because not only I think it should have achievements, but I think it should have like 200 of them... The mechanic of the game is to survive, you can't "beat" the game. And, in the end, is a game about "doing things". I think that the idea is great, but I also think that it would be nice to have some goals, and some way to know what you've managed to achieve... I know it has been asked many times, and developers said the reason why the game doesn't have achievements is mainly because they don't want to. I respect that, but they use to give some reasons that, to me, sounds more like excuses (I don't really know how hard is to add this to a game, programming and so...). But that is the reason I don't recomend this game. After a few hours, I'd rather be playing something else. If, unlike me, you don't care about that (Achievements, leaderboards...) then you might like the game. It is original, well designed and you can have fun playing it to kill some time.

text: El lado templario. - En esta historia volveremos a ser un trabajador an√≥nimo de Abstergo Entertainment que deber√° mediante el Animus introducirse en la piel de Shay Cormac, un joven asesino. Resulta que los archivos de memoria de Shay desataron un virus que afecta al edificio de Abstergo, y por lo tanto nuestro personaje deber√° arreglarlo a la vez que va descubriendo las memorias del asesino; que tras un terrible acontecimiento se terminara transformando en el cazador de sus hermanos. - En su mayor parte el juego tiene lugar durante la guerra de los Siete A√±os cuando se enfrentaban franceses y brit√°nicos, antes de la Revoluci√≥n Americana, por lo que nos encontraremos con personajes del Assassin's Creed III como Benjamin Franklin o el padre de Connor (el protagonista del III), Haytham, incluso con Aquiles con 20 a√±os menos, que fuera el mentor de Connor. Hasta nos encontraremos con Adewale que era el oficial de cubierta del protagonista del IV. Estos encuentros y lo que sucede son interesantes ya que nos permite saber c√≥mo fue todo antes de los acontecimientos del tercer juego. - Existen tres grandes zonas para visitar, cada una con sus puntos de inter√©s:  ¬†¬†¬†¬†Nueva York, es la ciudad m√°s grande. Lo mejor es que esta versi√≥n es m√°s grande y viva que la que vimos en el Assassin's Creed III ya que toma lugar antes del gran incendio de 1776. En el III ve√≠amos bastantes zonas destruidas de la ciudad y no se pod√≠a disfrutar mucho, pero en esta versi√≥n veremos la ciudad en su m√°ximo esplendor. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Atl√°ntico Norte, una regi√≥n fr√≠a. Si nos tiramos al agua comenzaremos a recibir da√±o por frio. ¬†¬†¬†¬†River Valley, una zona m√°s c√°lida. - Se pueden tomar cuarteles de las bandas para transformarlas en cuarteles templarios, esto hace que se desbloqueen los coleccionables de la zona de influencia del cuartel y se habilite el viaje r√°pido. - Vuelven las batallas navales! Ahora los barcos cazadores pueden abordar nuestro barco, podemos ayudar a nuestros aliados en batallas navales o simplemente actuar como piratas y empezar a abordar barcos para obtener sus recursos. - Contamos con nuestro preciado barco, el Morrigan, al que le podemos mejorar distintas cosas como la fuerza de las balas de ca√±√≥n, la resistencia del casco, etc. Hay que tener en cuenta que mejorar el Morrigan consume recursos, especialmente metal. - Si mejoramos bastante el Morrigan podemos ir a las batallas legendarias. Se trata de batallas navales contra superbarcos, del cual existen cuatro batallas de este tipo. Si ganamos una batalla obtendremos bastante dinero, una pena que no podamos abordar los superbarcos. - Se agrega el uso del espol√≥n de hielo para atravesar las capas de hielo. - En el Atl√°ntico Norte, al destruir los icebergs se forman olas que pueden destruir embarcaciones m√°s peque√±as. - Existe un mini-juego parecido a la flota de Kenway del cuarto juego. Se llama la flota de Cormac y en este caso son 33 misiones que se deben cumplir en orden. Cada misi√≥n tiene sus peligros, por lo que es mejor enviar a nuestros barcos a limpiar la ruta antes de comenzar la misi√≥n. - En el mini-juego ahora podemos saltearnos el combate por turnos e ir directo al final. - Una forma de ganar dinero es reformando edificios mediante recursos y cuantos m√°s reformemos m√°s dinero nos dar√°n.  - Los recursos para mejorar el barco y para reformar los edificios se pueden obtener de distintas formas: ¬†¬†¬†¬†Abordando barcos enemigos que al final sigue siendo la mejor manera. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Saqueando puestos de avanzada, una l√°stima que nos d√© tan poco metal. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Capturando asentamientos, no es la gran cosa, pero algo es algo. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Obteni√©ndolo de cajas, ni se molesten, no dan casi nada. - Se agrega el lanzagranadas capaz de disparar granadas enloquecedoras, narc√≥ticas o de metralla. - Al igual que en el Black Flag, se pueden recorrer las oficinas de Abstergo Entertainment y reparar computadoras u obtener tablets para ver notas o archivos de audio. - Los coleccionables m√°s destacados son: ¬†¬†¬†¬†B√∫squeda de salomas para que las canten nuestros marineros. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Encontrar los mapas templarios para obtener artefactos templarios para a su vez obtener la armadura templaria. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Encontrar todos los fragmentos vikingos para obtener una espada y armadura vikinga. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Encontrar todos los t√≥tems indios para obtener una armadura india. - Ahora tenemos que cuidarnos de los acechadores, se trata de asesinos que nos estar√°n esperando escondidos para clavarnos un pu√±al cuando menos lo esperemos. Sonidos de susurros y la vista de √°guila nos ayudar√°n a localizarlos. - En vez de los contratos de asesinos ahora tenemos la interceptaci√≥n de asesinos. Se trata de un evento donde tenemos que capturar a una paloma para recibir una misi√≥n, para luego localizar al blanco y protegerlo de los asesinos antes de que se termine el tiempo. Si el tiempo se acaba los asesinos van a atacar directo al blanco y nos ser√° m√°s dif√≠cil protegerlo. - Se pueden comprar productos de caza para mejorar a nuestro protagonista si tenemos el dinero suficiente lo que nos ahorra tener que ir a cazar.  - El Rogue repite muchas cosas del Black Flag que incluyen las batallas navales, las mejoras para el barco, el trasladarnos con el barco de un lugar a otro, la flota de Cormac, las salomas, la armadura templaria o la inclusi√≥n de otro personaje an√≥nimo en las oficinas de Abstergo Entertainment. Si bien aporta peque√±as variedades no es ninguna novedad. - Reformar edificios s√≥lo se puede hacer despu√©s de pasar una parte de la historia, por lo que si hemos explorado antes todos los mapas ya tendremos bastante dinero y reformar no servir√° de mucho. - Tras completar un recuerdo Ubi nos da la posibilidad de enviar nuestra opini√≥n. Te quiero Ubi. - Los di√°logos que mantiene Shay con su oficial de cubierta se pueden repetir. Por ejemplo, despu√©s de que dialoguen hago un viaje r√°pido para ir directo a la misi√≥n de la historia y al aparecer otra vez en el mar los dos empiezan a hablar de vuelta el mismo dialogo :O - Peque√±os bugs: ¬†¬†¬†¬†Una vez el oficial de cubierta se qued√≥ flotando en el aire. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Una vez me enfrente a un soldado que ten√≠a la mitad del cuerpo debajo del piso. ¬†¬†¬†¬†Una vez empuje a un soldado y cuando se estaba cayendo al piso de repente se qued√≥ congelado en el aire tipo matrix. - Algunos cuelgues. Uno o dos me hicieron reiniciar la m√°quina. - Me enfrento contra varios barcos enemigos al mismo tiempo, uno me aborda o bien yo abordo a uno, mato a los tripulantes y luego reparo el Morrigan como si nada para seguir enfrent√°ndome a los dem√°s. Un poco il√≥gico. Esto pasaba tambi√©n en el Black Flag. - Podemos crear granadas y dardos, pero no bombas de humo ¬øC√≥mo es eso Ubi? - La tal Violet da Costa que nos acompa√±a siempre le dice al trabajador de Abstergo "zoquete". ¬øQu√© clase de compa√±era de trabajo es esa? ¬øQui√©n se cree que es? Voy a llamar a Recursos Humanos!! - Se vuelve un poco molesto escuchar cada dos minutos los susurros que indican la presencia de acechadores. Especialmente en Nueva York. - El viaje r√°pido funciona cuando quiere, nadie me est√° atacando, tengo el cuartel o la atalaya desbloqueados y sin embargo no me deja viajar.

Disgusting remaster! In the early years, Bioshock-2 passed with pleasure, but this re-release was not enough nerves to go through to the end. And it‚Äôs unclear how the developers managed to screw up the game like that. Despite the slightly tightened textures, the graphics became dimmer, and all because of the cut-down lighting. There was an endless spam of enemies in certain locations. The balancing of the soundtrack, most often associated with shooting, has deteriorated. The most annoying thing is constant crashes that no one is going to fix. If you don't want to spoil your nerves, then I strongly recommend refraining from buying this reissue, and playing the original Bioshock 2.

text: This game is alright. At some point I wanted to give it not recommended but by the time I finished it I realized it‚Äôs not that bad. But at the same time it does not deserve a proper recommendation either. The problem is that this game is rather hard than challenging. What they did was just throw more enemies into each area and called it a day. This made the game just tedious in some places. It feels like the game doesn't want you to have fun. As if it hates you. I surely hated some parts of it. And they even threw in a boss fight where there are two bosses and you need to kill them at pretty much the same time. I‚Äôm not saying that designing bosses is easy by any stretch but that‚Äôs just lazy. Some areas are just a chore to go through just clearing all of the one hundred enemies only to die to some BS. Fortunately they had the decency to limit the number of times the enemies respawn. Going back to bosses though. Almost all of them had the same set of moves and it‚Äôs easy to beat them (unless they spawn adds or there‚Äôs just multiple bosses at once). The reason I decided to finish it was to make sure I didn‚Äôt miss anything. And to give myself the right to write this review. Only buy it if you‚Äôre souls-like fan and you just want more of the same. And this is probably the only kind of person that would consider buying this game. But nothing would be lost if I listened to my friend and skipped it. Just played it for the sake for completion. I like the exploration of the first game and it was okay to clear an area to properly explore it. But in this I didn‚Äôt feel like it. It was not worth my time to kill all the enemies. There‚Äôs just too many of them. For some reason illusory walls are not working as before and was going around hitting walls like an idiot before a friend told me I was doing it wrong. DLC was pure suffering so I decided to skip it once I went through some part of flame tower. Not worth my time or effort. You character is drinking from the flask so slowly that I started to think that we were having tea with the Queen and not fighting a giant freaking boss. So yeah‚Ä¶ get some adaptability points. Also FU*K a hitbox. It‚Äôs so frustrating to die even when you dodge and the enemy‚Äôs sword is miles behind you.

text_translate: Part 3 of this series. There wasn't much improvement in the second episode, and it seems that the background color and other elements were taken from the second episode. The 1st and 2nd episodes have a different picture, but the 3rd is virtually no difference from the 2nd, and it feels as if it was brought as it is, and the decisive problem is that when the game dies, loading fails and only a black screen occurs!! Perhaps this is the reason why many users deprecated. It seems that it only means to play for about 30 minutes and add only challenges. The way to achieve the challenge is to hit the jump or the shooting key for the first and second rounds, and the third, if you eat the gem, you will achieve each challenge. Since it is possible to achieve duplicates, it seems that the quick way to achieve the challenge is to play the 1st stage repeatedly and eat the gems quickly. In fact, it is a game that gives a feeling of regression rather than the first and second rounds;;; Rating 50/100

text_translate: Think Tombraider, you know that moment when your looking at where you need to go but just cant get there.... This game oozes those moments over n over. The gaming world has been done so layer upon layer is stacked upon one another, it can be irritating and confusing but also engrossing. The story was great imo, with nice twists towards the end. Combat is poor and boils down to tapping the attack button as fast as possible to come out on top, no blocking whatsoever. The graphics are good and have a nice cel shaded effect with a wonderful use of colours n shades. There is a deep crafting interface but with so many items and ingredients it becomes overwhelming and uninteresting, your inventory being full always, meaning your movement suffers and with the world being so big long intervals of travelling become common place. Overall its not a bad game, its just not a good one either 5/10

text: O que √© esse jogo mesmo Warframe √© um shooter de pilhagem PvE em terceira pessoa, onde se trata de coletar recursos e itens para criar novas armas e armaduras para que voc√™ possa matar as coisas de v√°rias maneiras. Voc√™ joga como um "Warframe", que s√£o basicamente ninjas espaciais. Cada Warframe vem com um conjunto de habilidades para torn√°-los todos especiais, e sua mobilidade lhes permite atravessar os est√°gios com facilidade, e se tornar√° uma segunda natureza antes que voc√™ perceba. Qual √© o objetivo sangrento do jogo Ao contr√°rio da maioria dos jogos, o Warframe n√£o possui um sistema de progress√£o tradicional. Todas as armas e Warframes s√≥ podem atingir o n√≠vel 30, o que voc√™ pode facilmente obter em uma ou duas horas. No entanto, seu rank total (conhecido como rank de maestria) apenas se classifica quando voc√™ sobe novos equipamentos, e alguns itens s√£o bloqueados atr√°s de um rank de maestria. Isso significa que n√£o demora muito para que novos jogadores alcancem o n√≠vel mais alto com seus equipamentos, incentivando-os a experimentar coisas novas enquanto jogam o jogo. Ent√£o, a personaliza√ß√£o Este √© um dos pontos mais fortes dos warframes. Praticamente todas as armas e Warframe podem ser modificados da maneira que voc√™ quiser. Quer fazer o seu super aqu√°rio do Warframe? Ou talvez d√™ suas habilidades um monte de poder para um melhor dano? Isso √© tudo para voc√™. Isso torna o jogo extremamente f√°cil de jogar, j√° que voc√™ pode experimentar diferentes builds para o seu equipamento. Voc√™ tamb√©m pode alterar a apar√™ncia de seus itens para a m√°xima moda, mesmo como um novo pessoal. √â gr√°tis para jogar, o que significa que tem microtransa√ß√µes ... Sorte, warframe √© um dos melhores quando se trata disso, quase todos os itens podem ser comprados na loja de jogos, mas eles custam muito em compara√ß√£o com o qu√£o f√°cil alguns deles s√£o. √â como se o jogo dissesse: "Olha, eu entendi, voc√™ n√£o quer trabalhar para pegar essa espingarda, mas vai custar um pouco para compr√°-la .." O principal que voc√™ estar√° comprando √© coisas como slots de armas, slots de warframe, boosters, acess√≥rios e assim por diante. H√° tamb√©m um sistema de negocia√ß√£o no jogo, e permite que voc√™ negocie usando a moeda premium do jogo, dando ao jogo sua pr√≥pria economia.

text_translate: Whispers of a Machine (v1.0.6) + Nordic-Noir-Setting + full dubbing (but only in English) + German texts + protagonist can develop three personality traits during the game: Sensitive (way of Balder), self-confident (way of Tyr), analytical (Way of the Frigg); which also affects the available cyberware + cyberware in the form of forensic scanners (e.g. to recognize blood groups, age, time of death), biometric analyzer (scans whether a target is e.g. relaxed or anxious), muscle boost and later three more augmentations + classic and intuitive point & click control + interactive objects can be displayed (space bar) + different solutions + automatic notebook that is also well integrated into the game + enlarged faces in conversations that also change their facial expressions + decisions cannot be reversed (since the game saves automatically) + you can die (that's how it used to be in Adventures) + double-click to shorten the way to the picture exit + three different ends - pixel graphics - visually unimaginative screen backgrounds - dubbing only in English - rather boring protagonist - not very interesting NPCs - unexciting story - Bug: figure can be very rare Cases get stuck and then cannot be moved away (solution: Shift + Alt + arrow key to free yourself) Whispers of a Machine from mid-2019 is a Scifi Nordic Noir Adventure that follows the so-called "collapse" in a post -KI-Zeit plays in which it is forbidden to create something that can think for itself. One embodies Vera Englund, a cybernetically improved special investigator for violent crimes, who unfortunately lacks charisma and personality. You can develop it in three directions, but somehow it still lacks that certain something. You could also say the protagonist is boring. The series of murders in which one investigates and which lasts for four days unfortunately does not make the breakthrough either. I still found days 1-2 interesting, but from day 3 the air was somehow out of breath and I was happy when I finally got through it. The transhumanist story about the fanatics of the connective (Pro KI) and the Christian-Orthodox EPOS Church (Contra KI) had a lot of potential, but unfortunately it was more of a yawn. Hardly anything exciting or captivating happens. I would have expected more under the noir term that the game adorns itself with. The puzzles were easy, which is not a bad point, but there were still a few places where I had to use the walkthrough to get further. Overall, the adventure isn't really bad, but it's not really good either. And in such cases I always devalue. If the last two days were just as interesting as the first two, I would have given a thumbs up, but unfortunately, after a lot of thought and inner struggle, I have an augmented thumb down. Nevertheless, thanks to the user Criz-White for this gift :-) If you are interested in further reviews from me, then follow mine.

text_translate: IT'S STUPID MUD

text: This is an atmospheric first-person survival horror game set in a remote hotel with a gory and macabre history from British folklore. Set in 1898 and inspired by the haunting Welsh tale of Elisabeth Williams, this is a story of a family empire driven by torture, slavery, piracy and a supernatural mystery that suffocates the grounds of the hotel. In this game you're pretty much defenseless against these blind enemies that lurk in the dark (and at least 75% of the game is in the dark). However, these enemies get attracted to sound and mostly towards the noises that you make (they don't get attracted towards environmental noises as much except in certain scripted areas) and at certain point of the game you get a device with limited charges (to be found in the world) that you can use to temporarily disable their hearing and run away. + Amazing sound design and atmosphere. + Good graphics. + Mostly smooth gameplay and good controls. + Supports controller. + Interesting enemy design  + I really REALLY loved the music in this game. + The game is priced just right for the content.  - Enemies sometimes are either really smart or really dumb which made the game feel inconsistent as in they can get attracted to your footsteps but not doors opening and closing. - Dying in the game can be really irritating near end game not due to the difficulty of the game but due to the fact that you have to backtrack from your last save   so that you don't attract enemies and get killed again. - I have been getting some random stutters throughout the game for no reason. - The story barley makes sense to me. - The only device you can use to temporarily defend yourself is useless against certain type of enemies   and there is no hint about that whatsoever so you're pretty much left out to find this out by yourself and possibly dying in the process. ~ The game can be finished within 4-6 hours only! I personally had no issue with the game being short as it DIDN'T feel short when I played it and I really couldn't see the game going any longer than this without being stretched but for some others, you may feel that the game is on the short side. With an average blind walkthrough I got 6.3 hours into the game..and that's with me trying to find all collectables by myself (no guides) and getting all endings  Overall I think this game is worth it if you're a survival horror fan specially for this price. However, If you're still skeptical due to the cons mentioned above, wait for a sale.
text_translate: dont get this game it has some fairly funny bits but that cant hide the bad gameplay filled with fetch quests and cliche zombie types i thought the crafting would be fun and random like minecraft but its just a boring thing of hoping you can make something good with the pipes and hardware pieces and pushing a button the dlc is TERRIBLE its just some suits that prevent fire damage making them a cash grab the xbox controls also feel akward to me as you push right bumper to attack and b to acces the menu do not get this game for the crazy price of 15 bucks its worth about 5 bucks

text: ¬øQue decir de este juego? Simple, un simulador de farmeo masivo Warframe te robara horas de tu vida, ya que vas a querer conseguirlo todo. Al principio la historia es algo confusa y las misiones del sistema solar pueden llegar a ser repetitivas en terminos de completar cada una, pero, es solo cuesti√≥n de investigar en internet o incluso el mismo juego tiene dentro una gu√≠a para que entiendas la historia de las diferentes razas, etc. ¬øTe lo recomiendo? Absolutamente Si sos alguien que esta al re pedo, jugalo Se, que te va a encantar, muchas gracias. (En mi cuenta principal tengo 270 horas en este juego, por eso me vi capaz de realizar una rese√±a sobre el mismo).
text_translate: Don't get me wrong, I love this game and it's one of my favorite games of all time, mind you, but this new news is too disappointing. I doubt many people may have heard the news, since it was pushed over by everything else at e3, but all mods (and the company that makes mods for singleplayer) got a cease and desist, and are being removed in the game just to get more people to play online, which is already rife with microntransactions. I mean, take a look at the hydra; it's already in multiplayer, not buggy at all, but Rockstar and 2K refuse to put it in single player, just so they can drag more people into their money-hungry multiplayer.  TL;DR: Great game, so much fun and I would reccomend the buy, however you should wait if you want to show support for the mods being taken away.

text: This game is amazing! It's fun and entertaining. If you like space, planes and rockets this game is for you. The physics are realistic so it's not so easy to succeed, but when you do...oooh boy is it a good feeling. When you actually get into your first orbit or you land on the Mun you feel that you have done succeed in life. You will fail a lot, but even the fails are interesting because of the explosions. It's so statisfying to watch how you crash into the different buildings and see them getting destroyed. There also is a campaign mode where you have to manage money, crew, and science points. After all it's very cool game with close to infinite replayability (also there is a huge modding community with hundreds of mods).  Go buy it, it's worth it!

text: HEUDEN RECENSISCE: Brutal Legend Beh che dire, sto gioco √® una piccola perla e posso giurarvi che differisce da qualsiasi cosa voi abbiate mai giocato.  Trama:  Sei letteralmente Jack Black, er Metal √® morto e sepolto nel nostro mondo. Durante un concerto di una band "Metal", di cui il nostro protagonista √® un roadie, egli riesce a risvegliare Ormag√∂den, una bestia metallica tamarrissima che trasformer√† tutta la realt√† di Eddie (Jack Black). Il mondo √® trasformato nelle copertine dei migliori album Metal, un reame da sogno i per veri Metalheads come noi. Si tutto figo, per√≤ l'umanit√† mica se la passa bene schiavizzata dai demoni e creature del nuovo mondo. √® compito nostro iniziare una vera e propria rivoluzione a suon der Roccherolle e der Medal. Gameplay:  Il gioco parte come Open World, con campagna principale e varie missioni secondarie. Dovremo farci strada combattendo con la nostra mastodontica ascia e la nostra fidata chitarra, contro file e file di Glam Metal fans, Blacksters e Demoni della peggior specie. Attenzione per√≤! Nel bel mezzo della nostra campagna, il gioco prender√† una piega inaspettata: Stavate giocando ad un RTS fin dall'inizio. ESATTO UNO STRATEGICO IN TEMPO REALE. E qui entrano in gioco le battaglie tra palchi, truppe, o per meglio dire, metallari e fans, che saranno la nostra risorsa principale. Guideremo le nostre truppe, combatteremo in prima fila e suonando la nostra chitarra, scateneremo sul nemico attacchi sorprendenti, in grado di cambiare le sorti della battaglia. Extra: Tutta sta roba verr√† accompagnata da un'OST coi contro cazzi, uno spettacolo da sentire in gioco: TI DEVI SPAVENTARE! TI DEVI SPAVENTAREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEH! I personaggi sono tutti dei cameo dalla scena Metal: Lemmy, Ozzy... Conclusioni: Un gioiello che non ha mai avuto il successo meritato, rimanendo una reliquia del divertimento videoludico per i veri appassionati del Metal. Una lettera di amore per un genere fin troppe volte ingiustament ncarcerat, ehm, volevo dire, discriminato dal pubblico. Consiglio vivamente a tutti, dal appassionato degli RTS, a chi vuole godersi la sua dose quotidiana di Metal, al casualone che si √® ritrovato col gioco in libreria...  Per questo, ho deciso di dare:‚Äé |0%  ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñà ‚ñí  85%|

TL:DR Game is nowhere near worth it's amount and has many problems that should be fixed. I rarely ever write reviews for the games I play whether I enjoy or hate them but given the circumstances for this game in particular, a review is a must. And from what I've played, this game is absolutely garbage. This game is a DEATHMATCH style moba, not a King of the Hill. You fight against 7 other opponents in a battle to the death. You have 4 lives. Last person left standing is the winner. Let's start with the classes. There are four classes in the game at the moment which consists of your generic Knight, Archer, Axeman and Mage. These classes are extremely unbalanced and the Knight class will win in a fight almost every single time. Playing a class such as Archer will only net you kills is if your enemy has noticeably health than you or you're not being directly targeted. You're also given no description of any of the classes, it's abilities, DPS, speed, or anything. All there is to see is the look and name of your character doing a certain animation. I'm not sure if I missed it during the loading times or anything but there seemed to have not been any proper place to select my character other than clicking on them in the profile screen then joining a queue, which forced me to play Archer the whole time whether I wanted to or not. Once you actually get yourself into a match, you'll find how dull the music is and how cheap and repetitive the sound effects are with the only thing keeping me playing is the cluster‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• of people going at it and getting some cheap kills at the knights before dying to one yourself. The majority of the content really is killing others until they run out lives, which isn't bad but isn't really good either. When the match is over, the back to main menu button is temporarily disabled.....HOW DOES THAT MANAGE TO OCCUR??!?  But for all I saw that is bad, there are a few pros being the controls feels really for how it plays although the buttons on the main menu is a bit iffy at times. The animations graphics are also pretty decent except the ones again in the main menu. And these are my opinions on the game I had created when I had started up and played for the first time. Given that I had played and created this review in early access, most of everything wrong here can be changed such as: These are all basic suggestions however and won't create a great game from hopefully fixing these alone. I leave the creativity part up to you guys.

text_translate: "Bloody Walls" is a pure time killer. It is needed first of all for achievement hunters, because they are all very light there, as well as for those who wish, ahem, to warm up their evening for a free 30 minutes. Maybe an hour, at least two. Any component named "Bloody Walls" is made cheap and cheerful, starting with its distribution model. So the most budget version offers 4-bit picture in the style of the first "Game Boy". In this case, splashes of blood bring brightness to the game very handily. The most royal version is replete with more saturated 16 bit. Clever, don't you think? The same can be said about the design of the levels, which has gone cold: boxes, corridors, other boxes, flasks with mutated embryos, one door associated with the ending of the game. All the salt of "Bloody Walls" in the destruction of zombies. Here is a typical seed about the unscheduled settlement of a mertvichinka in the n'th secret complex. You are given 6 floors of a scientific laboratory of the same width (3 more will open later). The first floor is the only safe place. There you meet a motley group of survivors: a busy general, a doctor, a head in a flask, a girl, a fat man, a scientist and a merchant. Five people will ask for a specific item on one of the floors that matches their type. Well, seriously, why should a doctor not need a first aid kit? To please everyone is useful for gameplay, because mini-economics is encrusted in it. Here is the maximum weight of 20 kilograms and some strange currency (looks like bubbles). "Bloody Walls" is very well drawn for any kind of plot. Unfortunately, the creators were too lazy to even finish it. The finale ends with a rude "to be continued" .., forcing you to regret the time spent irrevocably. The game isn't bad, it's just raw.
