text_translate: So it's an inferior version of the XCOM reboot: 1) the gameplay is more linear, the characters are less customizable, no option to sell items. But that's the minor issue. 2) The major one is the plot and dialogues. In the former we deal from downgrade of "we were soldiers and tried to prevent aliens from conquering us, but failed, sadly. Then we were guerilla warriors and fought against human-stealing, mutants-making Elders on our land and succeeded, at last" to SJW "well, those aliens are OK, we are cops now and want to live in peace together". The dialogues between missions are cringy and do not provide character development. The only white dude is a bullied assistant. It's kinda same route as it was with the Wolfenstein series reboot: the first one was gorgeous and fun, the second one kinda lived up to the first one and the youngblood ruined it.

text_translate: Pros:  It's a platformer exactly like the video shows. Cons:  The hit detection seems off, the controls are clumsy, the "high" jump rarely works, and the achievements are unnamed and don't make any sense. Sometimes levels unlock without beating the previous level; sometimes you can open later levels without unlocking the level before it (ie. played levels 1-12, then could access level 14 but not level 13) When you do finish the final level and "beat" the game, it starts again at level 1.  No credits, no congrats, nothing.
Why god?

text: git
text_translate: This game is a hot mess and the more I think about it, the less I like it. But let's focus on the main problem - this is a TellTale-style decision driven game. You're told at every opportunity that your decisions matter, that it's you who will dexide the outcome of this game. And for the most part, it does kind of feel like you have an effect on the world. Some decisions are stupid, some are not actually decisions at all and result in the same thing, but if the endings are great, what does it matter? And there's the kicker - none of it matters. No matter how you play the game, what decisions you make, who you befriend or save, who you insult or hate - it always ends the same. With one decision, after 12 hours of gameplay, one decision is the only one that will actually have an effect. And no matter what you choose, it will all de-value every single decision you've made in the entire game. Especially since the one you're supposed to choose - the "sadder" one - makes no sense even in this time travel story. The time travel mechanics are just... senseless. The fact you retain objects when you travel back in time is ignored on different occassions because plot demands it. Like when one choice is to take a photo of a girl being bullied (which you should retain) or help out, if you first take the photo, go back, and then help out instead, you lose the photo - because it was an important choice and it doesn't matter that the rules just change as the plot demants it. The fact you don't move when you travel back is also ignored when the mechanic is established in the first place. The whole setup is frustrating if you even attempt to think about it. I would not reccomend this game. It fails as a choice-driven experience, as it never actually gives a player a single choice until 12 hours into the game. And it fails as a time travel story, as it either never explains its mechanics, or just ignores whatever was established, just because the plot demands it. Any of my investment in the story or characters was undercut by the ending, I can't bring myself to care for the decisions I made for them when none of it actually mattered and the game was just as linear as a Call of Duty shooter. A far cry from "drive your story" experience.

text_translate: H1Z1: Just Survive I thought this game was worth playing as a survival fan, but unfortunately I was fooled the videos and screenshots looked very promising and indicated a lot of fun and lots of exploration possibilities but unfortunately this is not the case. The game starts quite well with no complications. You choose a server depending on what you want PvP or PvE. So I chose PvP because you think everything will be fine, but appearances are deceptive, as soon as you are in a bigger city you collect your supplies, weapons and ammunition, the game smears. Well and good, but hardly logging in again, you are surrounded by 4 or 5 men who kill one and everything is free. That's how it goes all the time with the game and especially with PvP. Well off to PvE, you are just setting up your base, it is 95% ready, you open your door and then someone stands inside and empties all your boxes and then teleports away. 1 day later Base had finished building everything and then the game got too boring for me, there was nothing more to do in that sense. And then bugs and crashes all the time, which cannot be due to my PC. Because I am not the only one who has this problem. Unfortunately, this game is not recommended unless you want to waste ‚Ç¨ 20. The game should theoretically be free to play because it cannot be played intelligently.

text: La desarrolladora Checa, Amanita Desing, creadores de magn√≠ficos juegos como Machinarium, Botanicula o Samorost cuyo apartado art√≠stico no deja indiferente a nadie, vuelven con un nueva aventura llena de misterios y puzzles donde pierde algunas se√±as de identidad y conserva otras vistas en sus anteriores juegos como la narrativa contada sin un dialogo a trav√©s de gestos y ruidos, marca de la casa y un apartado art√≠stico cuidado con mimo. En Creaks nuestra aventura comenzar√° en nuestra habitaci√≥n donde nos encontramos a nuestro protagonista totalmente relajado, hasta que una serie de extra√±os sucesos no har√°n abandonar nuestra estancia y descubrir una ciudad subterr√°nea y a sus pintorescos habitantes. Una historia sencilla pero directa que nos har√°n estar pegados mientras dure nuestra aventura. El cambio mas notable respecto a sus anteriores juegos nos lo encontraremos en el nuevo sistema de control del personaje, donde antes  nos manej√°bamos a golpe de rat√≥n como en cualquier aventura gr√°fica, ahora tendremos control total del personaje, ya bien sea a trav√©s de un mando o de nuestro teclado. Al abandonar el sistema point and click, nos encontramos de lleno con aventura lineal en 2D pero con toques plataformas donde debemos resolver innumerables rompecabezas para poder avanzar. Y aqu√≠ es donde nos encontramos a la principal caracter√≠stica del juego, los puzzles. A trav√©s del control de nuestro personaje debemos sortear el problema que nos encontramos en cada sala, si bien no son muy exigentes, tienen una curva de dificultad excelente, siempre que nos introducen una nueva mec√°nica para resolver el rompecabezas nos ense√±aran a utilizarla para despu√©s poner a prueba nuestra materia gris. Como mec√°nica principal en cada sala nos encontraremos enemigos con diferentes patrones, pero con una debilidad en com√∫n, la luz. A medida que avancemos en nuestra aventura, nos encontraremos nuevos problemas, que van desde interruptores, nuevos enemigos o el poder encender y apagar la luz a nuestro antojo para bloquear o transformar a nuestros enemigos en elementos decorativos que nos servir√°n para alcanzar un nivel superior o activar un interruptor . El poder utilizar la luz en nuestro beneficio, ya bien sea como refugio o transfomrar a los seres que nos encontramos en cada sala para poder pasar a la siguiente , es algo constante que nos encontramos en el juego y si no sabemos utilizarlo bien nos dar√°n caza acabar√°n y con nosotros oblig√°ndonos a repetir el rompecabezas, que gracias al sistema de autoguardado en alguna ocasi√≥n no debemos empezar de nuevo. Al completar cada sala, inmediatamente nos obligaran a ir hacia la siguiente ya que se trata de un juego de desarrollo lineal y en alguna ocasi√≥n nos encontraremos con peque√±as cinem√°ticas que nos contar√°n algo m√°s de sobre la historia, tambi√©n y a modo de descanso entre puzzles, nos encontraremos cuadros interactivos que funcionan a modo de coleccionables y algunos de ellos en los que podremos interactuar como si de un minijuego se tratase. Un gran acierto para darnos un peque√±o descanso entre puzzles para que no se haga tan repetitivo. A nivel audiovisual, como en cualquier juego de Amanita Design, es una autentica delicia. Art√≠sticamente es un juego notable, con una  puesta en escena con gr√°ficos pintados a mano que recuerda a la empleada en Machinarium. En los escenarios, las diferentes salas del juego y los cuadros est√°n dotados con todo tipo de detalles, todo un lujo que se plasma en nuestra pantalla. Destacar tambi√©n que las animaciones de los personajes en un juego de este calibre son excelentes, ya que debido a a la ausencia de di√°logos, destacan por su gran expresividad que logran que empaticemos con ellos. Un gran trabajo de nuevo de Amanita Desing en la que esta vez nos ofrecen un arte algo m√°s oscuro de lo que nos tienen acostumbrados. Por supuesto la banda sonora no se queda atr√°s, compuesta por Hidden Orchestra encaja a la perfecci√≥n en el juego y todo lo que sucede, y que funciona de manera especial en Creaks. Ante la ausencia de pistas como en otros juegos de Amanita, aqu√≠ la banda sonora cobra aun mas importancia ya que gracias a que funciona de forma din√°mica cada vez que realizamos los pasos correctos en la resoluci√≥n de puzzles para que nos nos estanquemos y podamos continuar nuestra aventura. Creaks, otra genial aventura de Amanita Desing en la que cambian de rumbo de sus anteriores juegos, nos ofrecen una aventura de entre unas 6-8 horas en las que tendremos que estrujar nuestra materia gris y con un nivel audiovisual brillante

text: Incre√≠ble Juego de Rol, que mezcla las figuras de plomo (nuestros guerreros), cartas, estrategia, juego t√°ctico y preciosos escenarios en forma de dioramas. Os dejo un v√≠deo con las Primeras impresiones, donde ver√©is todas las opciones del juego:  Tambi√©n me pod√©is encontrar como mentor de Steam, agradezco vuestro apoyo Gracias. En Wartile jugamos con vikingos y encontraremos una ambientaci√≥n n√≥rdica, con preciosos escenarios, divididos en celdas o casillas, por las que desplazaremos nuestros soldado animados (que nos recordaran a las "figuras de plomo"). Con un sistema ininterrumpido de juego por turnos, en el que no tendremos que clicar a un bot√≥n para acabar nuestra acci√≥n o movimientos. Pues cada acci√≥n, movimiento o ataque se realiza autom√°ticamente tras pasa los segundos que requiera cada una. Los escenarios nos recordaran a las maquetas de Rol, con todo lujo de detalle y gran calidad gr√°fica. Nuestros guerreros podr√°n desplazarse un n√∫mero determinado de casillas en cada movimiento, y su habilidad de ataque tambi√©n podr√° se solamente de 1 casilla o de varias casillas de distancia. Tenemos guerreros, lanceros, hechiceros... Ademas de sus ataques b√°sicos, podremos usar un sistema de cartas para colocar trampas, dormir/silenciar  a los enemigos, curarnos, ademas cada personaje podr√° elegir 1 de sus 3 habilidades o ataques especiales para usar en combate y ademas ganan experiencia con cada partida y suben de nivel. Cada misi√≥n o escenario tiene 3 niveles de dificultad, para desbloquear la de nivel superior deberemos de obtener un numero determinado de puntos. Cada nivel de estos escenarios nos dar√° diferentes recompensas (nuevas cartas, nuevos guerreros, oro, monedas que mejoraran nuestras estad√≠sticas, mejores armas y armaduras. Antes de empezar una misi√≥n o diorama (escenario) podremos mejor el equipo de nuestros guerreros, mejorar sus estad√≠sticas, y elegir su habilidad especial. Podremos gastar nuestro oro conseguido comprando mejores armas y armaduras en el mercader y vender aquellas que ya no queramos. Incre√≠ble juego con muchas opciones para personalizar nuestros guerreros, sistema de cartas que podemos personalizar y elegir cuales nos llevaremos para superar cada escenario, incre√≠bles dioramas o escenarios con todo lujo de detalle, gran calidad gr√°fica. Todo esto acompa√±ado con una m√∫sica impecable que nos acompa√±ara en nuestras aventuras. Juego indispensable para todos los amantes de los juegos los cl√°sicos juegos de Rol con figuras de Plomo y tambi√©n para todos aquellos que busquen un juego t√°cticos, con opciones de personalizaci√≥n y un sistema de combate y movimiento din√°mico divertido y para nada aburrido. Y encima por solamente 19,99‚Ç¨ y para celebrar su lanzamiento nos lo rebajan a 14,99‚Ç¨, si lo encuentras con descuento no lo dudes c√≥mpralo. Si tuviera que poner alguna pega, dir√≠a que es una lastima la falta de logros y cromos de Steam, por lo dem√°s una compra imprescindible.

text_translate: this game is aint good anymore, atleast never was... the dragging system ruined the whole fun in the game people abuse every possible animation glitch so you dont know when to block an attack and they do instant attacks which is basically moving your mouse with your swing to make it faster but they glitch it to another level, where you just show your back and look up and you can hit someone almost instantly after you see the animation so you cant block it... people drag their attacks to a level you cant know what the attack will be... this is maybe what the game was intended but it is overpowered and you can glitch draggin into instant attacks which make the game sucks, only veterans who played this game for years know how to drag like that and do it with no problems. while new players cant understand what is going on and suffer from it. i mean the 0-15 low rank server was fun because people weren't dragging and making the game look like lucky parry simulator. it is worth only to play on noob servers for fun... but duels??! is like just saying kill me faster with glitchy animations...

text: I am a big fan of the Total War series and was shocked when playing Attila for the first time, because it changed so much. I have to say, I didn't play Rome 2, therefore I refer to everything up to Shogun 2.  The battles improved a little bit but are still very TW. The campaign on the other hand was too much of a change for me in the first couple of hours of game-play. A lot more aspects like complicated character and family-tree management where overwhelming. Also the provinces with three settlements each confused me. Now I have played lots of hours and have to say: I love it. If you are willing to take time to find your way through Attila, it will give you a lot of pleasure. Would be boring to have many TW games being all the same, now wouldn't it? Edit: some issues with cloud saving and loading (always double save locally as well!)
text_translate: Apocalypse expansion brings very few to the Stellaris base game and even fewer is of any interest to most of the players in my opinion. Other stuff Apocalypse expansion brings to the game such as building Titan ‚Äì a capital ship, and neutral nomad / pirate factions are nice addition but really it is not worth the price.   Apocalypse also brought new ascension perks and civics which I sadly consider just sloppy and tacky. This part of the game could be made with much better care.

text: An interesting strategy.Many beautiful battles, especially if you play for the house Tokugawa It's hard to become a shogun, If you consider what kind of army in Kyoto  :)
text_translate: - Small variety of attacks, almost no combos - On many bosses you're supposed to just mash left click - Multi staged bosses where you have to kill them 3x and there's no checkpoint, so you always reset to start - Cheap boss attacks that deal 75% of your hp in one hit - Ranged attacks have aimbot, you have to perfect dodge - Special enemies, who can die 10x and still come back to life - You're stuck with a basic katana, that's it - Your unique prosthetic tools run OUT OF AMMO - Sad and depressing story, plus now if you die, you make NPCs suffer - Graphics are nothing impressive, 15 Gb download says all - You are the poorest samurai, one weapon, basic attacks - Auto targeting enemies based on who you look at, it takes time geting used to and turning it off doesn't work + Japanese voice acting with english subtitles + Stealth is a viable option and makes your life easier + Proper mouse and keyboard support This isn't quality game that people would expect by From Software, no character customization, locked gender, almost no RPG elements, no interesting weapons to use, boss fights don't feel fair. Even when you do beat crazy bosses, you don't get the feeling of accomplishment of anything, it's just Yay, boss is dead. There's so far not a single boss that I've liked to fight, unlike DS3. Open world bosses can have 1 life taken down by sneak attack, so you undermine the whole premise of epic boss fight. And you have to do this, otherwise you'll be facing them with ton of ads when you die to their unblockable combo. Especially samurai bosses show how lackluster is our character. You go through the game with basic left click attacks and block, there's parry but only for thrust attacks, sometimes it doesn't register and bosses randomly switch to the same telegraphed  whirl attack, which you can't block.  Bosses have interesting, complex combos, while you literally use basic left click attacks and try to time your blocks. It's honestly a disappointing samurai game, about sad life of a low life warrior, who's seen by all as traitor and literally drains life force out of those around him when he dies. There is no redeeming qualities about this game, that would make me recommend it to people. Buy Nioh and have some actual fun or go back to Dark Souls to enjoy your time.

text_translate: The game seemed interesting to me, a rhythm game is a genre in which I like to play it, I finished quite a bit. I run it, first fault: I am asked to set my screen to 60Hz manually from the Windows settings (I have a 165Hz screen), lots of games clamp to 60 that can be understood but have to do it ourselves? No thank you, I left it at 165 (and in addition the tutorial is screens on Windows 7, for a game from the end of 2016 it's incomprehensible ...). The game worked normally with freezes of 1 second every 5 minutes, nothing serious. The second fault: Impossible to configure the dead zone of the joystick of my controller, suddenly my character moves all alone to the left (my dead zone is slightly to the left) if I do not put the joystick back to its 0 position properly. end with the joystick, we cannot recombine the keys, by default to jump, it's the left trigger instead of the traditional A button ... It's not ergonomic at all, the ABXY buttons are used for the trick combo buttons OK but these keys are perfectly replaced by the right joystick, because there are diagonal combinations that you can not use with the traditional buttons, basically do not use these buttons for the combos and use only the right joystick in order to being able to use jump, slide and all on the buttons. I took no pleasure in playing this game, I quickly uninstalled it, too many flaws that prevent me from playing it comfortably, even the rhythm of the combos is poorly designed for my taste. I do not recommend this game, at least not at 15 ‚Ç¨ but maybe at 3 ‚Ç¨.

text_translate: Absolutely horrible. I don't know how you butcher such a simple concept so badly. This is pong, yet somehow the controls are confusing. The tutorial says hold down the shoot button to charge a shot, but after that my ship just starts charging and shooting random shots independent of my controller inputs. I'm assuming there are some kind of game mechanics that are at work but they don't explain anything so I have no idea what's happening. It could just be the lag because for some reason the game responds to controller input really slowly so maybe my shots are just so far behind the actual button presses that it's creating a complete disconnect between my inputs and the actual action. The only other player in the game has a firm grasp on it however so he keeps beating the ever loving crap out of me. This game concept was already perfected 50 years ago, all you had to do was put a coat of polish on it and market it with a basic level of competence. How you screw that up is beyond me.

text: good game
text_translate: This is not a game, this is pi # dec comrades, absolutely everything in it is AWESOME. The moronic blur is out of place, which blurs the entire screen, if, for example, you found a letter in the middle of a battle (like read, read, do not be distracted) or took away the damage (hello battle), but if it were fleeting, I would not notice anything bad. BUT! This shit smears your screen with lard so that you run for about a minute and do not understand what is happening. Next comes the combat system, which actually does not exist here. During the battle, it is generally not clear what is happening, the enemies die EXACTLY with two hits from a rifle (or headshot and the inscription "Brain" in Russian localization) and are divided into "meat" and "tanks", those same "tanks" are best killed with a grenade or a dynamite bundle, otherwise you will simply be beaten up from a machine gun, since there is actually no balance, in the game a bunch of enemies are regularly thrown at you, which you still somehow knead, and I generally keep quiet about the first boss, to defeat him most likely you need to use cheats, or be a god, (I'm not a noob and played at high difficulty) t. from the safest distance, the bullets simply do not reach and you have to shove with twenty cartridges in the rifle in order to demolish him a centimeter from its very long red strip on our interface, at the same time, crowds of enemies attack us, and at the end of the first wave, a dozen machine gunners throw at us , on which the grenade and dynamite will not be enough. Grafonium, problems with textures and screen resolution. The graphics in the game are surprisingly not disgusting and even a little close to such a game as Pain Killer H&D, but due to the regular blur, it starts to seem like nasty feces, because this darkness gets boring in the process, but still it seems that the entire budget for creating a game , went to the schedule. Texture lags. Sometimes I just didn't know where to go, because the screen was covered with a white veil and flickering, just obscuring the visibility. This was especially infuriating during post-fire, because as soon as you start aiming in order to kill the enemy in the "head", the textures fly away, somewhere far away, and the sight gets lost and you, like a fool, start running to "postpone" (occasionally helps) ... Screen resolution. Having set my screen settings, I expected that everything would be fine and I could play great, but of course the game worked out here too. My family accepted 1440 x 900, but the interface was still clipped and the radar floor was not visible in the printer. (And yes, I know that after setting the permission, you need to re-enter. This is not my blunt, but Polish.) A little about the plot, or about its inclinations. Yes, in the game we find pieces of paper, notes and other crap, there are even videos, but all this is nonsense, we are simply thrown into the war with the freaks-Fritz, and after twenty minutes we are already chopping up SPEAKING and UNDERSTANDING zombies, it is not clear where they came from, but the most it's funny that the main character somehow doesn't care and he behaves like a robot, they say: "oh, these are the rebellious dead, how is it, this is all because of the war, probably ..." But perhaps this is the problem of my russifier ... Bottom line: the game sucks, delete and forget. Score 2/10, for graphics, because you need to praise, at least for something.

text: Dark Souls 2 its a awesome game don't expect to finish the game before a good time, you will need courage and patience to get there !
text_translate: I love these games with the different concept that escape from the sameness of today's AAA games. I decided to get this game after watching several videos on youtube and at the same time being free on Humble. After that, with the game in the library, right away I already see a very difficult inventory to move, to craft certain items you constantly have to keep changing things in your backpack with the dog / raft (The raft will only work if you have it close) . After the tutorial comes the nightmare of controlling the raft that never goes in the direction you want (You only spend 2/3 of the game on that raft, so it's good for Jair to get used to it). Not to mention the difficulty in fighting enemies (I believe that half the crowd that got free died in the first boar because they didn't know what to do). Arriving at part 2/10 of the game, you already realize that he starts to repeat the same thing until the end. I don't even recommend this one for free, if you want a game in this style it is much better to choose '' This War Of Mine '' or '' Don't Starve ''.

text: WoW Oh-Whoops
text_translate: A little thought. This game is very, very unfriendly to novices. Rather, the main reason is that the interface and guidance of the game are very misleading for novices. Not to mention that there is no map, no knowledge of the road, and no idea what the mission requires us to do. Even the valuables mentioned in the mission guide are just a wad of money! Said to steal valuables, but there was almost no guidance/feedback after installation. It is strongly recommended that novices go online directly after completing the sneak/strike missions in the novice tutorial. No one takes it, and I don't know what this game requires us to do. This game is not for a single player to play at all. I've wasted hours researching what exactly this task is for us to run through the map to find the details and it's hard to understand. text: C'est un petit jeu gratuit r√©alis√© notamment par le cr√©ateur de The Stanley Parable.  Comme dans ce dernier jeu, nous incarnons en vue subjective un h√©ros qui ne parle pas mais qui se d√©place sur les rails narratifs. L'histoire est tr√®s courte et ne pr√©sente aucun embranchement sc√©naristique alors que The Stanley Parable en offre une assez large vari√©t√©. La dur√©e d'un run est courte et l'on est prisonnier de la narration. Cette derni√®re dispose d'une bonne traduction avec des sous-titres fran√ßais mais l'enregistrement en anglais n'est pas terrible, il faut tendre l'oreille. Il y a une seconde trame narrative si l'on s'empare du magn√©tophone dans la premi√®re pi√®ce et qu'on lit les cassettes que l'on trouve au fil de l'aventure.  Le seul d√©fi du jeu consiste √† retrouver toutes les pi√®ces de monnaie et les bretzels cach√©s au cours de la progression. tl;dr : bon petit jeu gratuit malgr√© une narration trop directive.

S.O.S, Ah S.O.S. In the beginning, Outpost Games, Inc. managed to bring you an incredible early access, a style let's say royale (but, nothing clich√© cof ... cof ...) was more of a reality show style that altogether you explored more trying to be highlighted being you than being first in a simple battleroyale and that was the magic of the game itself and made it unique. After several patch patches, I thought that SOS would be going the right way, until this battleroyale update arrived, where everything that was good and innovative became clich√© and within the trend what, in my opinion, was a fatal mistake, killing the game completely. My negative review comes precisely because of this battleroyale, which in my view was something that the company had the audacity to bring, at the beginning of this patch I thought to myself: ‚ÄúOkay, it's just something that they will test and the reality show will come back in a few months. ‚Äù; Apparently I was wrong, after many several months nothing in that magical and unique way yet, and for several more the game is free, practically Outpost Games made fun of us doing it, did not keep the word and did not stay strong with his unique and pretentious game. In short, my negative review is due to this.

Games lacks many reasons that dark souls is so beloved and plays like dark souls done badly. C- is about what this game truely is, good enough to be sold but overall not very impressive. Dark Souls has the difficulty level that is more rewarding and almost always make you feel you deserve the death.  So buy on sale or if you're really bored, otherwise two other games worth playing in Dead Space and Dark Souls.

text_translate: Do not buy this game anytime soon. Why? I'll tell you Pros: - Career mode is a big improvment. - Animations are good. - Academy  Cons: - Wrong Kits (White kits for ODI and T20s). - Wrong Stats (Displaying First Class, List A, T20 stats for Test, ODI & T20I respectively. - Can't get past the main loading screen. - Randomly crashes. - Have to choose the line up again and again  in career mode. - Stats for international cricket are not available in career mode. - A bug where game gets blurrier. - Umpiring errors. - Graphics are meh. - Commentary will make your ears bleed. - Game is poorly optimized and runs in borderless windowed mode. Game will stutter from time to time on my 1060 and i5 3550 with 8 gigs of RAM.  - Max resolution is 1920x1080.  Devs don't give two ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• if you are having any problem. I was having an online issue in DBC 14 and I contacted the devs and this is what I was told  . It's pretty much the same support for this game too. Right now I'm stuck on the main screen and can't get past it. I paid $50 for a game that I can't even play atm.

text_translate: I really wanted to like this game because it looks like an upgraded stronghold 2 but after playing it everything that should have been better is actually worse and everything that should have been the same is also worse. The graphics in general are ok but when you play the game the world just looks bland with little colour, the voice actors aren't anywhere near as fun as in 2, the UI is smaller and less inviting, placing buildings is more annoying to line up and manage space and some of the terrain doesn't look any different from the places you can place buildings but "Can't place that there me lord" in a less entertaining voice and when i did the first two levels of the economic campaign unlike stronghold 2 each level you start over rather than each level building off of the castle you built in the previous. also i had no idea what the story was so far because the audio for the comics is separate from game audio, i had even tried turning game audio off completely and the comic that explains everything was still too loud for me to understand let alone tolerate. All around i think you would be better off buying the stronghold collection for a cheaper price than this, you'll get stronghold 1, stronghold 2, stronghold crusader, crusader extreme, and legends for 29.99 full price rather than just one game that somehow isn't anywhere near as good as any one of those for 32.99 full price. Based on the reviews it might even be better to pay more money for stronghold crusader 2 for 44.99 but i haven't played that one yet so I might be wrong.

Very poorly optimised port, looks great but having massive strutter issues right from the beginning... Running it on 3900x 16gb and 2080 super and still have strutter problems on a 2k resolution. I'd recommend other people to wait for a couple of patches before buying this game, it's a shame really because the game itself looks beautiful.

First of all, i am a huge fan of the Baldurs Gate/Icewind Dale saga and i loved playing Pillars of Eternity. I supported and crowdfund the PoE II project, having high expectations. Unfortunately for me,PoE II did not deliver the goods.  Apart from the beautiful graphics,physics and sound effects, everything else felt rushed. Main storyline is too short and simple(in comparison with the original PoE),i found the game buggy at the beginning(it has improved with the patches) and glitchy(minilag and few glitches). Obsidian took a huge gamble with the pirates setting/naval combat/exploration and that was essentially a bad decision. It looks great for the first 20-30hours but then it gets repetitive and plain boring, for a game like this where you are gonna play ~200hrs it is a bad feeling after all. DLC policy, they should have included these levels in the main game or try and produce a decent expansion. PoE gets White March(at least 40hrs gametime and alot of new stuff) which is awesome and here we get three overpriced DLCs (very short,less than 20hrs combined).   PoE was the worthy spiritual successor to the CRPG era and people loved it. It has a story,it has a villain,it has a castle with a 15-level dungeon,it has a beautiful expansion. PoE II has no soul,has no true villain,has less content,less interesting quests,less everything.  P.S. Interesting facts,if you look at my playtime and you wonder, in PoE there is always something to do and i finished it 4-5 times with different characters, in PoE II almost half the time is travelling with your ship or walking ashore/inland and doing nothing. Plus my total body count/enemies defeated in PoE was around 4000 and in PoE II only 2500. Thanks for reading this and if i rate the original PoE(after patched and expansion) with a well deserved 90/100, i cannot give more 70/100 to PoE II

text: Es un gran juego que conoc√≠ gracias a un streamer que sigo hace tiempo. Capt√≥ mi completa atenci√≥n desde la primera partida por el aspecto de la estrategia a la vez que comenc√© a detestarlo un poco porque interviene tambi√©n la suerte. Es estrat√©gico porque la victoria solamente se consigue a base de cuidadosos planes que toman en cuenta cada movimiento, propio y ajeno. Es un continuo an√°lisis de las circunstancias, siempre cambiantes, de sus largas partidas. Interviene la suerte (sobre todo cuando se combate contra rangos bajos) porque existe la posibilidad de que un rival viva solamente para arruinar tus planes, para matarte tropas, en suma, para verte perder la partida. Aclaro que lo anterior pasa m√°s que nada en los rangos bajos, pues los buenos jugadores evitan desgastarse en atacar sin  sentido y buscan, l√≥gicamente, la victoria. En ese sentido, una vez que alcanzas cierto nivel de juego, disfrutas Risk realmente, de todas las virtudes que tiene y que tendr√° seguramente en el futuro. ¬°Recomendad√≠simo!

text_translate: The game has been completely abandoned. It was a pretty horrible game with clunky controls and a crudely drawn interface, but it had some potential to clean up and become a playable shooter. Sadly, this is no longer the case. The game was released into early access - well before it should have been - and had two or three updates before it was just given up on. It's pretty sad when the forum mods care more about the game and its players than the developers. In short: Do not buy. The game no longer works and it is extremely unlikely to ever come back.

text: DOTA 2 is my favorite way. The program lets me assume the role of another creature, helping me experience our oneness with the universe. I like to assume the position of the dinosaur-riding, lightning-wielding, half-lizard half-man. I like to join servers with up to nine other disciples, be ‚ÄúDisruptor‚Äù (as he is called), and go to the jungle, closing my eyes; there I concentrate on my breathing.  The other disciples (woefully) always curse at me. I usually have to mute them. I do so to concentrate on being one with the virtual nature. (I can‚Äôt afford to go to national parks, so this is the best thing). Sometimes I see lots of colorful exclamations points and these ‚ÄúPING PING PING PING PING‚Äù sounds occur around my character. They are beautiful. One time someone said, ‚ÄúTHE ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•?! LEVEL 1 DISRUPTOR, BUY COURIER YOU ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ING ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•!‚Äù And the truth is there are many players like him. They aren‚Äôt at peace with themselves. Perhaps if he came into the forest and hummed koans with me, and he had done so as the giant, walking tree, then he would see his greater consciousness. All the negative energy would leave his body, and we‚Äôd share a moment of experiencing our Buddha nature.  In my experience, sessions last about 10-20 minutes. And initially it did not take long to find a server; apparently I‚Äôve been moved to ‚Äúlow-priority matchmaking.‚Äù But that‚Äôs okay. I just assume the lotus position in my chair and wait patiently. The only downside to this is that sometimes I forget to click the "accept" button.

text: With over 20 hi-standard awards achieved already, Papers, Please is seriously ONE OF THE GREATEST GAMES  published in 2013. It's old-school, it's innovative, also imo beautiful in a classic way in its brutally simple appeareance and it made me laugh out loud few times (can't remember when single-player made me actually laugh :D). The concept itself is let alone just brilliant but when laced with a great storytelling in which player can impact and with a gameplay that enhances the back-to-the-childhood feeling you get, Papers, Please is one to remeber. Just the ancient-sounding theme music brings an amused grin to your face - a reminder of the good old times. This is not easy game by any means, requires some brains and sharp eye but not in an annoying way. I found the difficulty very fitting and enjoyable.  Papers, Please may not offer something to play for a very long time right away (depends on person), that said it will surely exceed its value by far anyway in the hands of an average gamer. On the other hand I can see myself returning to this game in future, similarly as with e.g. Max Payne, DOOM, etc. I do not want to give spoilers - one's has to experience this game like it happens in it's story - out of the blue. As I fancy 2013 not a great year regarding to game releases I am glad I have now something to remember and to recommend to fellow gamers.  Glory to Arstotzka!

text: Fugue in Void is a VERY short (under an hour), atmospheric, abstract / minimalistic First Person Walking Simulator game with an obnoxiously long opening sequence that has no player interaction for the first roughly ten minutes or so and no checkpoints throughout its duration.  If you're going to give this game a go know that it's a brief (albeit immersive and nice-looking) minimalist approach that you may want to have a cup of coffee or other drink by your side to keep you tided over as you finish its short journey. Had I known this game has no checkpoints, I wouldn't have bothered to exit it the first time I had booted it up about 20 minutes in, wherein I got to one of its early (and sparse) puzzle sequences (which involve nothing more than walking onto switches on the floor to open the path to the next area...) grew impatient trying to find the next switch, and exited. I had assumed it saved but unfortunately that isn't the case, so I had to view the game's long ass opening again. Keep that in mind, as my total playtime is 1.1 hours, so the game itself minus my having restarted should only take about 45 minutes to complete while amply exploring its mostly linear environments. I had to keep questioning if I had even bought a "game" or was instead observing an art piece during the game's very long, passive opening. Fugue in Void opens with a sequence of abstract shapes in the distance as white noise / distorted ambient sound warbles along accordingly. As a purveyor of abstract, minimalistic games and wanting to see a game's full intention rather than skip over its initial introduction, even I found the opening a bit long and overdone.  That being said, when you do get to the player-controlled segments of the game I found myself wanting to see what was next, and would often stop to admire its design and well-done lighting. The game has a brooding atmosphere despite its empty areas that is interesting and unsettling at times.   Fugue in Void's gameplay during the first half primarily consists of just wandering the abstract environments until you find a switch on the ground to step on to open a pathway to the next area. When you have reached the end of a sequence is very vague, as you just walk into an area and the game fades to black before popping you into its next random area. This can be a little jarring early on, but I started to appreciate the game's pacing and overall ethereal nature the more I played.  Fugue in Void recalls influences such as Mondrian and Escher in some of its design choices, including stark areas of black and white and geometric shapes used to create immersive space for the player.  While I wouldn't say I "loved" Fugue in Void I am glad I finished what it was offering. Its lack of any checkpoints whatsoever is kind of bunk (perhaps an 'Intermission' halfway through to pick up on would keep other players coming back?? or the option to skip its very long opening?) but I did enjoy the overall experience. The game's use of   about halfway through is nicely timed, and gives the game a refreshing sheen to the earlier, drearier environments. I grew a little impatient with some of its very abstract, passive sequences (including a few near the end that felt a bit "lazy" where you're simply watching geometric arrays spin overhead before the view fades to black and you're introduced to yet another) but all-in-all I found Fugue in Void to be an immersive, interesting experience.

I truly wanted to love this game - puzzles, cool artwork, an interesting storyline - but either my computer is lagging or the game is just set too hard for my old brain. I finally looked up a play-through to see what I was doing wrong (nothing) and I'm just too slow to get through the first level :-( The controls for walking, spying and getting through doors are unbearably slow. Sigh - another cool game that was generously gifted to me by a friend gets tossed over the wall. :-(

The game itself is not bad in terms of siba, but the Anti-cheat system is terrible, played in a competitive mode, every game came across 1-2 cheaters. At the moment I do not recommend buying this game!

text: one of the great thing about warhammer compare to other total war is the lord general... its much more useful and fun to play... most total war general you always use them for support and protect them... but warhammer... ur hero or general could change the outcome of the battle they had skills could easily destroy an army... very amazingly one of the most fantastic experience battle of total war... UPDATE REVIEW If u own wathammer 1, you be able to play Mortal Empire its a combine map of total warhammer 1 & 2, and its the BEST TOTAL WAR campaign my opinion... also has the best DLC most of them are worth to get except blood dlc, blood should be free...

text: Counter-Strike:Global Offensive „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ„ÄÄ „ÄÄ „ÄÄ Counter-Strike:HAACKS Offensive :(
text_translate: I dont really understand this. This game had and has many bugs... But it was just great to play it with friends. Now, after the update, there is only the tutorial map (we have the sialia ski pass). It was so cool to play on the big Sialia map and now... The tutorial map is just not interesting if you play the map 2 hrs. On Sialia there was always something new to find. And if you ask me, this game has way to many bugs to change the maps that you have to pay for them. You just cant do this if there are games like "STEEP" on the market. Now its for sale, and its even cheaper than buying all passes. You just ruined your game in one update.

text: Sugar Daddy simulator. Cure anime boys of being Furry by earning and spending millions of dollars on gifts, until they take off their costume and show their abs and toes. An autoclicker is a must - I use VoiceAttack. The adult DLC just dropped and does what you'd expect. There's no gameplay or story to speak of, the art is endearing. 69/69 would play on work computer again.
text_translate: Honestly I tested to see and I didn't like it for these reasons: - the sprint speed is so low that it is more or less equivalent to 7 km / h which is downright zero to try to escape a guy that shoots us. - the graphics are downright ugly. - the inventory is poor. An apple takes up the same space as a gasoline canister or an assault rifle. - certain objects on the ground that cannot be picked up for some reason. - obviously the biggest flaw in this kind of game is obviously the players who still haven't understood that survival doesn't mean killing everyone. - the 60 seconds to be disconnected from the server (where is the logic besides?) after being killed, then the loading which crashes, the game which crashes and to finish in style the impossibility of reconnecting me to the game because my gaming session is still active. In short, too many flaws for my taste. I prefer DayZ which is better done even if it is far from over.

>> Infos << Developer: TML-Studios Publisher: Aerosoft GmbH Available: August 25, 2016 I thought to myself "Finally a bus simulator that is not only tied to one city!" The result is broadly bad. Even the pictures on Steam are fake. After updates it looks like Battlefield 2. Pro's: ‚Ä¢ Many different cities ‚Ä¢ There are different scenarios (construction site, accident, police control) Negative: ‚Ä¢ Outdated graphics ‚Ä¢ Inaccurate controls ‚Ä¢ Jerks like a pig! ‚Ä¢ It is very spongy to drive ‚Ä¢ Incorrect information on Steam (see the pictures) ‚Ä¢ Boring ‚Ä¢ Stupid AI ‚Ä¢ Overpriced ‚Ä¢ Overpriced DLC's >> Conclusion << Keep your hands off it if possible. If it was given to you, that person doesn't like it! Please, let developers do it. SCS software. Please do it.

Here are my list of the Top 7 quotes of famous Psychopaths, that best describe this type of player who I dread and have encountered while playing this game with a "shoot first then ask later" kinda attitude (except for my friends ofcourse "I Love You Guys"): Top 1.  "What I liked most was the hunt, the challenge of what the thing was. The killing for me was secondary. I got no rise as such out of it...for the most part." by Richard Leonard Kuklinski (admitted to 250 murders, convicted of 5) Top 2.  "Every man has his passion; some like whist, I prefer killing people." by Rudolf Pleil (admitted to 25 murders, convicted of 10) Top 3.  "Big deal. Death always went with the territory." by Ricardo Leyva Mu√±oz Ram√≠rez (convicted of 13 murders) Top 4.  "It wasn't as dark and scary as it sounds. I had a lot of fun. Killing somebody's a funny experience." by Alberto de Salvo (admitted to 13 murders, still disputed) Top 5.  "I wished I could stop but I could not. I had no other thrill or happiness." by Dennis Nilsen (believed to have killed up to 12 victims, convicted of 6 murders) Top 6.  "My first murder was thrilling because I had embarked on the career I had chosen for myself, the career of murder." by John Christie (convicted of 8 murders) Top 7.  "I don't feel guilty for anything. I feel sorry for people who feel guilt." by Ted Bundy (believed to have killed up to 36 victims, convicted of 3 murders) This is a cluster‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• of a survival game.  Very unfair for new players.  I have never passed more than 10 minutes without getting killed while being unarmed and naked, OMG. If you find it very difficult to relax during the day, I worn you, don't you ever play this game.  But if you find killing people, in-game, let me be very clear about that first - LOL, as an outlet for your frustration, then do play this game.   My recommendation however, well it's 50-50 for me, like your chance or surviving this game in the first 10 to 15 minutes mostly on official servers. RUST IN PEACE.

text: Lovely charming game, with playability like no other ol' chap!
text_translate: Shoppe Keep isn‚Äôt going to be a game for everyone, in fact, I dare say that it‚Äôs not going to be a game for the majority of players who give it a once over. By and large, Shoppe Keep does a lot of things right, but the biggest problem here is that for everything it gets right, there tends to be much room for improvement. This is made apparent from the get-go. Shoppe Keep is, as you might have guessed, a shopping simulator that takes place within the confines of a magical environment. The best way to describe this game is by picturing any given RPG you have played, many of which come with merchants and shops that you can utilize to buy goods. Now picture swapping the role of the hero, for the role of one of those shop owners. First and foremost, it takes some time and perseverance to understand how this game works, despite the tutorials that are on offer. The overall aim of the game is to successfully run and manage your very own retail business. You begin the game with very little to go on, which is a standard for most management games. You have little gold and all but a small room to evolve into something meaningful and grand. You‚Äôre able to customize your shop keeper using a fairly decent pool of options, and although not as in-depth as expected, it gets the job done nevertheless, and then from here on out you‚Äôre ready to start expanding. Not only will you be managing your business, but protecting it too, which means slaying any greedy thieves that come sniffing for free loot. Obviously, the core focus within is to be as appealing to your customers as can be. It‚Äôs pretty bleak from the onset simply due to your limited space and wares, but before long, you‚Äôll be completing quests and unlocking a wider set of goods. This, in effect, will broaden your reach. That, however, is only the tip of the iceberg. You‚Äôll also need to ensure that your shop is clean and accommodating, at the same time as managing the upkeep of your stock and stock appliances. There‚Äôs a lot of things to keep on top of, but to the game‚Äôs credit, it never feels overwhelming thanks to the well set pace. Everything is manageable so long as you sink into a routine and stay on top of your needs. One issue that I think will be the make or break point for those that invest, is that the game doesn‚Äôt do a fantastic job at feeding you into the task at hand. Sure, there‚Äôs no shortage of information that will help you get by on a week by week basis, but the game really would have benefited from a more structured tutorial. Instead, you‚Äôre expected to read tiny-text filled sheets to get a firm understanding on what‚Äôs what. Due to the fact that Shoppe Keep is such an original and unique experience, some more thought and consideration for newcomers would have been a wise design choice. It doesn‚Äôt help matters that the first hour of play is about as exciting as watching a hamster on its wheel. NPCs will walk past your shop as though they‚Äôll catch a plague upon entry, forcing you to be more upfront and in-their-face, defeating the immediate appeal of the game in the process. First impressions are vital, but Shoppe Keep takes quite some time before the true magic of the game begins to pull through. The core functionality of the game and its progression system works well enough to get by, but the ugly UI and botched controls let this down in the long run. Management games are taxing enough by design, so to have to wrestle with poor control layout and confusing UI, is a nuisance to say the least. The developers have clearly put some thought and effort into ensuring that this game works well on console, but the end result lacks refinement and polish. It‚Äôs a shame really, because on the flip-side, Shoppe Keep is a very intriguing experience that will quite literally swallow hours of your time. The constant need to bulk up your shop and defend it from unwanted individuals is entertaining enough in itself, and is certainly worth the price of admission alone. I quite enjoyed the structure of the progression system too, which typically sees you completing quests and leveling up to achieve better merchandise. You can eventually hire help to take care of the mundane tasks, freeing you up of some much needed time to truly focus on business growth. This is one of the most important factors of the game. How much did you buy said item for? vs. How much you will sell it for? Set the price too high and you‚Äôll find customers going elsewhere. Set the price too low and it will take forever and a day to make some money. The balance of play is solid, and all of these systems and mechanics go hand in hand to produce a compelling business affair. Shoppe Keep goes much deeper than I was expecting, but again, I was constantly drawn back to the poor controls and shoddy UI. Furthermore, the loading screens are pretty excessive. Hopefully Shoppe Keep 2 will remedy this, if it does indeed make the hop to console like its predecessor. Visually, there‚Äôs not a lot going on here. Textures are bland, character design remains repetitive, and everything else in between is equally as such. CONCLUSION Shoppe Keep is a management game that delivers depth, innovative gameplay, and decent functionality. The problem, however, is that it doesn‚Äôt come without a fair share of issues; lengthy loading screens, poor UI, and wonky controls. This would have been a much better game had the developers spent more time optimizing and fine-tuning it for console.

text: demo is good but needs improvements for final game graphics specific button for knife  nemesis run speed needs a nerf
text_translate: AT LAUNCH: - The game is locked to 30fps - Its graphics are pretty terrible compared to other games that I can run on my PC at a solid 60fps. - Key rebinding rebinds the key but doesn't allow you to use the new bind. (I accidentally unbound shoot, so I binded it to Mouse1 again but now I cannot shoot. Which is kinda awful. Also rebound M to map, and I'm now stuck in the Tool Tips thing that you get about maps right after you get Lincolns car. This is why I only have 30 mins playtime.) - No binding of controls to extra mouse buttons such as M4, M5 (side buttons) and no binding availiable for side scrolling buttons either. This is quite frustrating as I do bind almost all of my mouse buttons in most of my games. VERDICT: - Don't buy it now, it's a broken piece of crap. - Refund it if you have bought it. - (Re)Buy when the FPS cap is fixed and integral parts of the game (such as keybinding) actually work. - The ability to not be able to bind anything to the same key makes the controls for the game a bit clunky but definately not unplayable.

text_translate: Fine until the Light Lord. Big paywall at that point, with out days of grinding. Heals faster then you can do damage to. Resist is way to high as well. Hard to poison or stone. No way to cancel out the healing, like in the previous one, nor has any weakness to exploit. The randomness with in randomness is not really needed either. Portals used to be good, but now you have the locked portal and two random ones, where one of the random one is often the same as the locked portal. Worst still, if you get a "healing fairy" from a random portal... more often then not, you are not healed, but poisoned, flame or other status effect, with no healing. Previous games was well balanced, even for free players. This one is not. Glad to save my money on this one.

text: The Park is a beautifully done psychological horror game about a mother trying to find her son, who is lost in an old amusement park after closing.  Its creepily entertaining and the story comes in bits and pieces as Lorraine explores the park chasing after her son. Pros:  Builds a creepy mood  Has a complex female protagonist  Interesting story The amusement park is like a character itself Cons: Very short at about two hours, probably less for faster players. A friend told me she finished it in 90 minutes! Some rooms are repeated No real puzzles Kinda expensive for what you get I really enjoyed this and I feel that others interested in horror games might really like this, especially if it goes on sale. :)

text_translate: Honestly.. This game is trying to fix something that isnt broken? why would i pay money to play a phone app version of legion when i can play a way more advanced version on starcraft for free.. or dota 2 for free... the servers are broken, the price is typical, like for real guys, i see people with "500" hours telling people its advanced and strategic and unpredictable, well ill tell you right now with like 20 mins on this game.. there is nothing advanced about it.. its lazy.. there is no challange what so ever, no background no upgrades, no in depth units, nothing is orginal, everything just ripped straight out of wc3 starcraft and dota.. i like the concept but this legion so extremely childish, the units have no reason to be there.. the creatures you fight are childish phone app monsters, flying chicken? quadrapus? serouisly? peewee... honestly you copy the peewee from wc3 and make it some stupid flying ship and then! to make it even more immersive, it upgrades to a useless idiot wearing some blowup robot with 1 animation of attacking.. and oh god lets not talk about the animation.. most boring combat animations ive ever seen in my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• life... serouisly i never review badly but this has been the biggest waste of my time since detention on ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• fridays.. -10/10

text: There's no way I can be the only person who thinks this is a bad DLC. Seriously, for all the build up this DLC gets, all you get for your money is bland grey Fallout 3 DC Area-esque terrain filled with baddies to kill for no real discernable reason. The story is boring, Ulysses is horrible to talk to, and the game tries to railroad all your player's actions.
text_translate: Unlike other reviewers, I actually quite enjoyed the color palette and overall visual aesthetic.  I dare say that was my favorite aspect of this rather short and unfortunately cliche detective romp with a pretense of cosmic horror.  The look appeals to my nostalgia both for 80s era games, and the 80s aesthetic in general.  Nonetheless, it did make locating certain key objects on screen challenging without using the feature to show all clickable spots on each location. Unfortunately, the rest of the game's features are mediocre at best.  The character images seem to be all (or at least mostly) stock.  While most more or less fit into the game, there are at least a couple that don't feel like they quite fit the role the developer slotted them into.  To make matters worse, a couple of the stock images are familiar enough that any sense of immersion was lost.  The music is all stock as well. The writing matches the character models perfectly (which is to say it was shallow).  The story was quite linear and cliche, with few twists or surprises, no development of atmosphere, and no depth or poignancy.  The characterizations all were quite one-dimensional.  While none of it was bad, per se, none of it was particularly good or memorable either. Needless to say, the story in this game fails to come close to Lovecraft, and indeed (like so many others) misses the whole point of what makes most of Lovecraft's stories both endearing and horrific.

text: Fading Visage looked promising before I bought it, It looked promising when I just started it and became terrible after the first bit of the game. It's nothing else then repeating yourself, follow a spirit, grab something, run back to the house, don't get caught by the shadows and repeat. When you did this enough times and got all the items you will get an abrupt ending (which did not work properly for me).  The game at first looks really big but it's actually a very small map and I believe in this kind of game, game physics are key. as example you run from the shadows and come to a branche on eye height, I would say you should get stopped by the branch. In this game you will just walk right through a lot of obstacles making the game extremly easy. This could be a game that makes your adrenaline rush when you are running from the shadows, but this game has no running in it and you hardly notice that you are being chased by something. It does have some achievements that adds a little to the time you can spent on this game but if you go through this game in one go it can be easily finished within 30-45 minutes. Pros: - The idea is nice - Very simple controls - It has a few achievements Cons: - Graphics are not that great - Loading times can be long - Bad physics - Very short playing time - No trading cards This game can be played by everyone although it can be scary for little kids and is just to boring for real gamers.
text_translate: For the first couple hours this game sucks because your ship is destroyed and you need to repair it. Then, you repair your ship and fly around for a couple of hours, gathering materials and exploring. Finally, 15 hours into the game you realize that there is no progression in the game because it is endless. Meaning, even if you explore a thousand planets, there are still billions more.
Microtransactions.

text: I have waited so long for this game to release. And when it finally did, I thought it was going to be the greatest game I have ever played... Until I found out that region-locking exists. The disappointment I felt at that time was almost crippling. I honestly prefer the alpha over this lame excuse of a beta. If you are thinking about buying this game, Don't. The game at its current point is unplayable. Its fun for like 10 hours but after that it loses its magic, this game is supposed to be open world. However it restricts your gear and other other items such as the boat to one region. Don't waste your money on this game.
text_translate: The tedium everyone mentions in the other reviews is real. This game ruined my ability to be patient.  FOREVER.

text: I know everybody buys it as a part of CS1 Anthology or some other bundle, but I think the developers should implement a single player campaign in the next version, since the servers for this one are virtually empty. ^_^
text_translate: The clearly overpriced game Montaro stands out due to the popular Internet dog, emoticons with her, skins, again, for her, expensive cards and this is where the pros end. Next comes the incorrect generation of levels, when, having fallen on a banana skin, you can fly upstairs, walk through the building, again fall onto another skin, failing to jump over it, fly onto the roof again, and so on until the lives run out. As a result, P√∂sel turns into a spinning something that is a pity to look at. The game puts in front of the player a bunch of traps that are placed completely incorrectly, sometimes there may be several deadly traps in a row, which in theory it is impossible to jump over and survive, because after each jump, two seconds must pass for the dog to jump again, at the same time it continues its movement ... straight into the hatch. As you could already understand, the main problem of Montaro is in its curve of jumping mechanics and level generation, which is critical for a platformer, P√∂sel can step and jump late, and another time he doesn‚Äôt have time to jump to the point and turn up again on some kind of skin or falls on a crow, which is tantamount to death. In short: this is a disgusting game, the only thing that saves her is this aforementioned dog and the ability to steal panties from Japanese schoolgirls (there is even an achievement for collecting 802 panties ^ _ ^), which play the role of health units here. Maybe for people whose life is limited to Counter-Strike and Dota 2 this game will go well, and in general, thanks to it, they will have a reaction of 0.2 seconds, which is useful in increasing the CS: GO rating, but for players who have other values ‚Äã‚Äãin life , a lot of games from sales have not been passed, I highly do not recommend buying this so-called game, you will not get any fun or good mood from it, unless in the first thirty minutes after launch.

text_translate: The games name is pretty much what you get. An Early Access Casual Indie Action Survival game. (involving a Project being Explore (ed)). Concept: - Does exist but changes every now and then Direction: - Nobody knows but it's probably related to Early Access Casual Indie Action Survival Artwork: - Same as Direction Mechanics: - Same as Artwork The bottom line: The developer started with a concept of some sort at the beginning and artwork fitting the game, over time it translated into a game that forced too many changes on you in terms of artwork, direction and mechanics, while the main release pipe equals the store front advertising, the experimental build pretty much doesn't fit that, due to drastical changes and experimenting a lot. That doesn't add to trust or confidence regarding this game and i simply cannot ask you to support the game as it is right now, especially when the current main pipe build is very different from the experimental branch. Don't get me wrong, the developer is not ignorant and he does care and listens and incorporates based on user feedback as much as possible but the keypoint remains, the game (or in this case the developer) doesn't have a long-term vision and concept for this game and that keeps it being stucked somehow in a loop of direction and artwork changes. A note to the developer: Focus on a concept - Add to it - Improve on it - Stop experimenting Afaik there should have been multiplayer in this game already but the experimenting got into it's way. Don't make it another game losing it's heart, being stuck in Early Access forever.

text_translate: I have read that many reviews criticize the single player campaign for being too short but it has seemed eternal to me. I find it incredible but I never wanted to play this game, basically for two reasons: control points (where the progress is automatically saved and if you die you have to repeat the scene over and over again) and extreme linearity (you just have to advance with your teammates and follow their orders, the player does not have to make any decision at any time). The only saving part is that visually it is very successful and that it is always fun to go shooting at anything. The driving part and the helicopter part add a bit of diversity and the story helps to tie it all together.

text: It's sad that it took me so long to realize that the mathematics in this game are broken. Purchasing a 100% increase in generation, should result in your production of that resource doubling. It's basic percentages. However, instead of going from 2 to 4 my resource went from 2 to 3. This is a 50% increase. This makes me question the other mathematics that are used within the game. This game is dependent upon its maths is correct. Therefore, from a fundamental perspective, the game is broken. Secondly, there is   taking place in the game making it not worthwhile in putting in the time and effort to succeed in their special events. This is because there are reward tiers. Why put in tens of hours when someone can jump on and beat your work without having earned it? A further failure of the developers here is their technical support. It's extremely hit or miss. For example, I am still waiting to receive my rewards from one of their Christmas events. This would have given me quite a few upgrades to my characters. Additionally, the developers do not communicate - or if they do it is extremely minimally - with their player base through the discussion forums here. Frankly, it's not good enough. Finally, the micro-transactions are hugely overpriced for the value that you receive. Therefore, they feel much more like donations to the developers than they do upgrades to your account. Putting so many hours into a game that is clearly broken is disappointing. A waste of what could be a very good game.

text_translate: About Call Of Duty Black Ops III: Price increased in Brazil, the standard price was R $ 129.90 and now it is R $ 159.90 (The deluxe version, which contains the season pass, has not had its price changed and remained R $ 199.90). That adding the standard version + season pass separately will pay R $ 259.80 The optimization is worse than Batman Arkham Knight and Assassin's Creed Unity. The game is unplayable, has absurd drops of FPS, when you are at the base, for example, in the selection of mission, upgrades, customization and company, it even consumed 13GB of RAM. I have an i7 4770k + 970 G1 + 16GB and I can't play the game satisfactorily. It may seem like a joke, but the minimum requirements for it, requires 6GB of RAM. The game in the first hours of launch crashed when starting, it may seem like a joke, but it gives the same problem as the beta, the exe stops working, at the time I managed to play it leaving the steam in offline mode. Poorly optimized to the extreme, the game barely uses the GPU, reaching an average of 50% of it (all normal games run at 99%), consumes more than 4GB of VRAM in the ultra (including anti-aliasing filters), reached consume more than 9GB of RAM, this, in FullHD huh. It fries the processor and drives it crazy, at that time it uses 30% of the processor and from nowhere it can jump to 86% of its use. Att: Game received several fixes, fixing several problems of his, including the choking of the game, some parts are possible to notice this, but only in the cgs ingame The game is fully dubbed in Portuguese, and they did not save words in bad words. However, there is no subtitle for the Portuguese version, and you cannot play in English with subtitles from other languages. If you like to play in English with language and / or subtitles together, you will have to download an additional 3.3GB, unless your steam is already set directly in English. About the censored version of the game it is only possible in the game with the English language, in Portuguese the plucking of members and bad words are included without prior choice. The graphic is very satisfactory, it is beautiful, the textures are much better than the other games, it is not surprising at all, but the facial part of the characters I found at an excellent level (for the main characters) The game has a split screen for 2 people on the same computer, has a level and ranking system, for character improvements whether in the campaign or multiplayer. And in total 4 people playing simultaneously (online coop campaign), I think it's a possibility, despite enjoying playing games in this style alone. The game has 12 missions in campaign mode, and 5 difficulties, including the realistic mode (that with 1 shot you knock your boots) A novelty of the game is that you now fight against women, yes, they are more present in everyday life, be it in the gaming of life, and in other functions. In the main menu you can select your character for a man or woman, with customized faces (they are not different, it is more a variation of the same face with some additional details such as hair color, etc.) The analysis is subject to changes during the course of the game.

text: Der zweite Teil der Saga ist gr√∂√ütenteils genau wie der erste. Das ist gut! Finde ich.  Die Spielmechanik ist bekannt und hat sich kaum ver√§ndert. Bis auf ein paar F√§higkeiten.  Die Videosequenzen sind atemberaubend und sehr gut synchronisiert (deutsch)! Die Sprecher verdienen ein gro√ües Lob! Die Grafik ist m.M.n. gleich geblieben. Mehr muss man da gar nicht sagen! Was aber wirklich frustrierend ist, ist folgendes: Nach einer gewissen Zeit wendet sich das Blatt und die eroberten Festungen werden nach und nach belagert. An sich nicht so schlimm. Mir hatte ein Kollege erst gestern geschrieben, dass ich jetzt 20 mal Festungen verteidigen muss. Ich dachte okay... so schlimm kanns nicht sein. Ist es aber!  Denn um deine Festung erfolgreich verteidigen zu m√ºssen, m√ºssen deine Hauptm√§nner oder H√§uptlinge trainiert werden bzw. im Rang aufsteigen. Das geht durch Kampfgruben oder dem "Anwerben" neuer Ork-Krieger. Oder durch Echtgeldk√§ufe im Shop. (Werde keinen halben Cent f√ºr sowas ausgeben). Macht man das nicht, steht man ab Etappe 3 schon bl√∂d da, wenn deine Festung von Hauptm√§nnern der Stufe 45+ angegriffen wird.  Genau an dem Punkt bin ich gerade. Top befestigte Festung verloren an den letzten angreifenden Hauptmann mit Stufe 54. Meine Hauptm√§nner (40+) fallen wie die Fliegen, ich sterbe - Festung verloren. Das wirklich abgefickte daran ist, dass dieser eine Dreckshauptmann seine Gesundheit regeneriert! Aber in was f√ºr nem bescheuerten Tempo!! Keine Ahnung, was die Entwickler sich dabei gedacht haben, aber anscheinend gibt es Menschen, die glauben, wenn man etwas lange genug herrausz√∂gert, wirds besser!? Soweit ich das gelesen habe, gibt es nach den 20!!! ZWANZIG Festungsverteidigungen nur ne magere Videosequenz zum Abschluss.  Fazit:  Gameplay = wie gewohnt - (sehr gut) Grafik = wie gewohnt - (gut) Ton = wie gewohnt - (okay) Geschichte = wie gewohnt - (sehr gut) Umsetzung = mi√üerabel (kacke)  Bis zum Ende der Geschichte sch√∂n, danach nur noch qu√§lend. Schade. Echt schade! Habe Teil eins 5 mal durchgespielt.
text_translate: From a somewhat decent little platformer,   fell to a plain mediocre game. Back one year ago, this game had pre-defined levels that were fun to play just to pass time. Now it has some badly designed generated levels. I often found myself playing the same level and it gets boring very easily. I'd suggest the devs go back to the previous stage of the game and improve it. + The Challenge levels are pre-defined and were fun to play; it took me a short while to complete them all, but they weren't that bad; - Generated repetitive levels, gets boring in a short while; -Lacks initiative, there are only 2 types of enemies, 2 types of traps and 1 weapon; -Boss levels are random aswell, many people complained that they had to play dozens of stages to finally reach a boss area; -More soundtracks were welcome.. I would recommend   only if you really can't afford any other platformer out there. Even then, you would probably put it away soon. The gameplay lacks many features and I see no real reason to replay the game after you have finished it. Personal rating: 30/100 - Awful

text: RIP
text_translate: "Northern Crusades" was released in 2011,one year after "Real Warfare 1242" and it has the same exact engine,same exact UI,same exact maps,same exact units,same exact graphics and the same exact gameplay.It even has the same crashes and bugs as the first game. Here is my review of the first game with a link on how to fix the black screen that occurs on nvidia graphic cards   . Even if the game is the same as the one released in 2010,it still has no siege maps.Manevouring units is still clunky probably because the terrain is too rough or badly scripted.Clicking on one spot may send units on the other side of the map for no apparent reason. Unlike the first game,"Northern Crusades" has a campaign story and map similar to Total War games.On this map you can only control one general at the begining.You cannot control the larger strategy of states only this one particular general.The campaign has a bland storyline and RPG elements like hiring troops,upgrading them,looting enemies after they have been defeated and equipping units with items.Also some items give a morale boost to your troops. This game builds on the first one and is actually better but still feels like a Total War game from 2005 in Alpha stage.

text: The gameplay on it's own is actually quite alright, good even. You have several options of engagement right off the bat and your options only get more numerous, with a dodge as a basic ability, rather than as a skill to actually implement skillful play beyond placement and building your character, and no conventional mana meter. There's no traditional stat placement, most of it governed by gear, such as Cards, giving passive bonuses as long as they are equipped, and your choice of clothing at the start of the game, reminding me of Monster Hunter in a sense. The game is surprisingly good looking for a small, rather unheard of release, too. The voice acting is also fairly high quality in comparison to some other unknown releases. My biggest gripe is the fact it's a literal ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• meme game. Gangnam style skeletons, the voice in your head making Stanley Parable references, the same voice also saying Keep Calm and Carry On, Christ this is a cringefest and I've only just got past the first boss at the time of writing this.
text_translate: The game has potential, who knows in the future .... but now I do not recommend the purchase, severe problems in connection with the server. I'm refounding, but I will definitely keep an eye on this game and buy it if I see improvements.

text: The story in this game is based on true events that happened in Tehran in the 1970's and i'll say this, they did a good job with keeping me interested in the story but after finishing the game, i can't recommend it. Diving into this game, you can choose to choose the violent, peaceful or neatrual approach but the gameplay doesn't change much based on your choices. The only thing it changes is if some characters like you or not. This game is fairly short (1 - 2 hrs) and after finishing the game, it just felt like this game was half done for some reason, but that can maybe come from the fact that i finished the game fairly quick and that the game ended on a cliffhanger which makes no sense unless they are making a sequel or adding more chapters to the game (which i think is highly unlikely). Unless you are interested in the subject matter, i wouldn't recommend this game.

text: Short Summary: The bad: Horribad game - Cannot change shoulders that you aim from, therefore favors aiming and shooting to the right of cover. Cannot aim over left should unless stuck to a wall. Awful controls - shift/double tap W is either roll or sprint, you cannot bind another key and you cannot disable this option, you cannot have split these options up. No secondary weapon (pistol) - you have a primary weapon (AR, smg, sniper shotty) and a melee weapon. No secondary firearm meaning if you get rushed while using a sniper, you have 2 options, go crazy with an axe and hope you dont get shot in the face or use a grenade to try and take them out along with yourself. Extremly laggy, (although ping is not displayed), but is evident by the fact that you can shoot someone, go back into cover, start reloading and then either you or the enemy drop dead mid reload. Shallow game modes, standard run-of-the-mill lobby shooter with no innovative or defining features. Uses third party account to sign up with - does not display EULA, does not display privacy policy, may sell your email to third party companies. Sign up with a dump email account to be safe. The good: Has an uninstall option. Verdict - You'd be better off stepping on Lego, at least that would be more interesting and less painful.
