text: Agreed, it took me about 4 hours to get my windows, NVIDIA and game settings to a point where the game would work... but hot damn, it's no only a beautiful game, but therefore also a technological masterpiece. To get these vast amounts of visuals processed on my humble GTX 980 Ti... never would have thought. Granted, I get the occasional 1-2minutes of freezes before some larger portion of the map gets loaded in, so there's a lot of optimization to be done. I also believe this should be prioritized before release more, not only in this game.  TL;DR: It's a beautiful masterpiece once you get it to run. But a lot of optimization still needs to be done and the FPS is mostly smooth, but quite unstable at times. EDIT: I have been debating for over a week now, but I have reached the point where I can no longer leave this as a positive review. It's been one game breaking but after the other these last few patches. First the sensitivity settings were completely botched, making flying virtually impossible. Last patch fixed that, but now I have completely random crashes to desktop, sometimes while loading in, sometimes 30mins into the flight, but EVERY flight without fail. I just tried verifying the integrity of my game files, only to find there is a preexisting bug that simply leads to the game deleting all your game files when doing this. Now I'm stuck with having to download the 100gb over again for a game I cannot really play anyway. I am so disappointed, especially since the game is so beautiful and has so much potential.
text_translate: NO MORE MOVE NO MORE MOVE NO MORE MOVE How to play this game: - Play match 3 rounds as normal until about level 100 or so. - Load new level - Hope RNGesus gives you enough chances to actually beat the level. - Lose hope, because of course you didn't get a good set up. - Move one crystal (maybe none at all), then get the ever-present "NO MORE MOVE" message. - Wait for a new set of crystals to fall into place. - Make another move or two. - "NO MORE MOVE" - Repeat ad nauseum. Oh, did you actually win? DON'T GO TO THE MENU!! Go to the next level first, or your completion won't be saved. /facepalm I'm not a huge fan of match 3 in the first place, but this grindy, luck-based feeling I get from it sucks. The first 50+ levels were fine, but nothing really special. Then, once you get far enough in, the level design makes it nearly impossible to get matches anywhere, and it is super frustrating. I keep at it for the completionist in me, but man do I hate myself after every session.

text: Some absolutely garbage design decisions get a "No" from me.   The majority of negative reviews echo my own thoughts on this game, but there is one major bad decision that is the nail in the coffin. At the end of the main world 1, there is an escape sequence, where you have to escape a giant tree verticially which is filling up with water.  Which is about 4 minutes of extremely precise and difficult platforming, with no checkpoints.  You die and you have to do the entire thing over. What makes this particularly frustrating is that the "platforming" involves jumping "off" of moving projectiles.  Which move at a fairly speedy pace.  Miss once, start the whole section again. Apparently, there's two more of these such moronic sequences for each of the two later worlds.  Frustrating and unfun.  I did actually beat this section that I'm complaining about, but it's unforgivably terrible.  Not recommended. EDIT:  I just beat the game.  Yes, these annoying chase sequences still happen.  On the whole, the game was frustrating and not fun.  I persisted because the overall vibe of the game was good in terms of design and music, but overall I can't say my playthrough was a positive one.

text_translate: This DLC is now just about USELESS thanks to Gearbox cutting the OP levels from it and requiring you to be level 80 to access 95% of the content from THIS DLC that was previously available. How is this even legal? Context: Prior to around June 2019 the "first Ultimate Upgrade Pack and Ultimate Upgrade Pack 2" DLCs raised level cap to 72 and allowed you to play through the "challenging ‚ÄúRaid on Digistruct Peak‚Äù map offering even more high-level play" by repeating progressively harder challenge runs from level 72 to OP8, effectively making the level cap level 80 in terms of gear, but skills were still capped at 72. Gearbox wanted to sell Commander Lilith DLC and apparently felt this made it awkward for them to sell a new level cap of 80, so instead they gutted this DLC that people HAD ALREADY PAID FOR and made it next to worthless, as all OP levels now require you to be level 80, which requires you to buy the new Lilith DLC. This is exactly how you burn customers and interest them in sailing discounts for your products, Gearbox.

text: It's a bit hard to describe how I feel about this game. I think that it is a good game, though as the years have gone on it's confused itself, and there are glaring issues about the game that need to be resolved for me to be able to recommend it to others. First off, the engine. It's no secret that this game is terribly unoptimized and full of hackers. This is largely due to the fact that it is running on adobe flash of all things, and it's really quite impressive how much they've done on such a bad engine for games of this scale. Though the game is being ported over to Unity with countless improvements as I'm writing this, it's currently still on flash and thus suffers because of it. The game will likely become so much better just from this port alone and I'll probably update this review after the unity port is completely done. Second, it's revenue model. This game makes its money off of dungeon keys, pets, and quality of life buffs like vault chests and character slots (I wouldn't really call these quality of life as a certain number of them are essentially required to be able to fully enjoy the game, but I didn't know how else to describe them.) While some of each of these are given out for free every once in a while, there are still some that you are probably going to have to drop some cash on to get full enjoyment out of the game. You start off with one character slot and one vault chest. Character slots are self explanatory, and vault chests are places where you can store items between characters so that you don't lose them when you die. It is extremely difficult to enjoy this game when you can only use one character at a time and can only store up to 8 items at a time. In order to try any other characters or other classes, you have to kill your character. This is why it is basically essential that you drop some money on character slots to enjoy the game. Additionally, once you get further into the game, there are a lot of good items that you are going to want to store in your vault, yet you are only given 8 vault slots to do so. Lastly, dungeon keys. A lot of in-game events rely on the sale of dungeon keys. Basically, people sit in the Nexus, the game's safe haven or lobby area, and wait for people to open dungeons using these dungeon keys. It completely skips the step of having to go out into the realm and fight enemies in order to have a chance of the dungeon spawning, and makes it much easier to get good loot when participating in these events. Unfortunately, this results in much of the gameplay these days being you sitting in the Nexus waiting for dungeons to be popped due to how common these events are. Next, on to pets. Pets give you buffs such as healing you insane amounts every couple second and restoring your mana points insanely fast. Pets are able to be levelled up without paying a dime, but the grind is an insane amount and these days, it's very hard to enjoy the game as a new player without a pet because most of the new content in the game revolves around the idea of you having a high level pet to keep your health up. Though pets are what saved the game from shutting down in 2014 by the revenue they generated, they ultimately hurt the game by making most of the game's content redundant and extremely easy. DECA took over the game in 2016 and have been good, for the most part. I believe that there has been some mishandling of the game here and there, but it is clear that their intentions are good and they're doing as much as can be realistically expected with their resources to allow the game to continue thriving. In order for the game to be successful in the future, it all depends on how they continue going forward from now. The unity port will be the largest determining factor for the future of this game, and it should be a clear sign of how they are going to handle it going forward. Final Verdict: Keep an eye on the game, wait til the unity port to get yourself invested. Expect to have to drop some cash here and there to have a fun experience.

text_translate: Update: Gonna thumbs down this one. Somehow my saves got erased and my game doesn't go past the intro. So yeah ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• you telltale. As I'm a hardcore fan of Telltale games, thought of giving a review for the first episode. Note that this review isn't biased to the dev.  Since I'm a big GoT fan , instantly got this, was not worried at all about the story and the decisions. The story is in parallel with the tv show especially , since the characters, voice acting and some elements of the story are alike. You represent House Forrester, atleast to a certain degree and you won't be confined to one character like in TWD or TWAU. This is somewhat similar to 'The tales from the Borderlands' as the story is given from multiple perspectives. It's a good take by Telltale games imo especially since you know the gravity of your decisions and how they'd affect you as another character. Moving on to the plot. The story so far , atleast in the first episode was top notch and I got to say I was pretty skeptical about the game after seeing how Polygon gave it a 6.5. But just for now the story has been great. The way it shows how major effects of the book/show affect minor houses is brilliantly executed.  The decisions are playing a major role like they've played in the previous Telltale games. But this time around like Totalbiscuit said, it's solely not emphasizing on dialogues and etc, but rather small ones like "taking this" or "not taking this". The weight of your decisions are felt by your own playable characters as they have to go through them. This game thus far have been the best Telltale game with hard decisions for me. It's not only that, they manage completely to nail the grim nature of of GoT. This game isn't rated R, it doen't certainly have boobies, but holy cow it's violent. In a good way which is what Game of Thrones is all about. Moving on the the gameplay, the devs have used the same gameplay elements they have used in previous games, if you are looking for a button smashing, sword blazing GoT, THIS ISN'T THE GAME FOR YOU. Point and click mechanics and quick times events have been in the game so far with nothing new gameplay wise. The voice acting was excellent, especially since they were done by some of the original cast. Not to mention some of the scores from the original series. However the only thing I have against this game is the new graphics they have used. It doesn't look bad, but it seems a bit muddy and unpolished in a way. At times you can see some of the textures blur for no reason, that's something Telltale should work on. And the weird animations of characters can get clunky at times. Improvement from these two departments would have made this game a much better experience for consumers. But then again no one plays Telltale games for graphics. Overall this game is pretty damn good. You should note, if you haven't seen the TV show nor read the books, be sure to do either of them. Because this game is heavily based on the what has already happened in the series so far. Hopefully Telltale would release other episodes rather quickly than what they did with TWUA but for now if you already have the game, you'll be playing it a multiple times to see what could have been if you had taken another choice. I'd give it a solid 9/10. However this may change with the coming episodes. For now it's an excellent game. A MUST BUY FOR GAME OF THRONES AND TELLTALE FANS!

Coletar um item espalhado pelo mapa realmente pouco vai acrescentar na sua jornada, mas em compensa√ß√£o proporciona um jogo de c√¢mera ao capturar a a√ß√£o em alta velocidade da CorpSeg perseguindo um HOVA, que talvez seja outro membro da Cloudpunk.  A   sintetizadora alinhando os   conseguem transmitir a sensa√ß√£o que a cidade nunca dorme. Ouvimos os ru√≠dos da cidade, instru√ß√µes nos alto-falante para os seus habitantes, a grande multid√£o falando junto ao mesmo tempo em ambientes fechados e o constante e intermin√°vel barulho da chuva batendo nas estruturas com carros voadores rasgando o c√©u em alta velocidade. Vamos encontrar diversos grupos √©tnicos, seja principal ou secund√°rio eles possuem uma voz e sotaque, infelizmente as vezes n√£o conseguem transmitir no tom de voz a verdadeira import√¢ncia e sentido de urg√™ncia transmitido pelo di√°logo, embora seja admir√°vel a variedade de vozes e sotaques envolvidos. Cloudpunk √© bem  , com suporte para legenda portugu√™s do Brasil, com apenas uma pequena falha de tradu√ß√£o, algo que n√£o compromete a experi√™ncia, sendo de f√°cil compreens√£o a leitura sobre assuntos tem√°ticos a cyberpunk e tecnologia para pessoas leigas no assunto, como por exemplo a explica√ß√£o de Rania para Camus, justificando o motivo do seu pensamento lento devido a limita√ß√£o de hardware do ve√≠culo. A jogabilidade via teclado ou controles de console s√£o simples e acess√≠veis que ao longo da jornada que durou 10 horas acaba se tornando natural a dire√ß√£o em meio ao tr√¢nsito.  devido ao seu grande excesso de trazer conte√∫do com pouco prop√≥sito. Transformando toda ambienta√ß√£o cheia de cores e luzes para algo preto e branco apagado, com pouca interatividade real, al√©m de possuir diversos personagens secund√°rios que s√£o salvos apenas algumas hist√≥rias que de fato acrescentou na narrativa. Provavelmente os desenvolvedores tentaram esticar o projeto, espero que ocorra novos conte√∫dos que de fato acrescente na narrativa e mais possibilidades de interatividade em sua ambienta√ß√£o. Tendo mec√¢nicas mon√≥tonas e ritmo bastante devagar quase parando, demorando muito para trazer o sentimento de urg√™ncia e perigo apresentado inicialmente pelo jogo.  Resumo das minhas impress√µes em uma m√∫sica: , deixe a sua opini√£o e o  . Cr√≠ticas, elogios ou d√∫vidas s√£o lidas e respondidas, ao obedecer o velho habito da educa√ß√£o.
text_translate: I have been playing the game for quite a long time. He closed 1 ru world for gold, saw many battles and saw many stories of different worlds. Unfortunately the old worlds are closing with good prizes, adults are slowly leaving this game. New worlds with * Eras * fly by quickly and close in less than a year + a rule for 1 player, a limit of 200k faith and prizes for closing the world are completely different and scanty. There is a lot of competition in ru worlds, new players can resist old ones + you can be put on an emergency (black list) and cut off your villages. If you try to play quietly for fun on the farm it is worth trying but not more. the developers are unfortunately not introducing new content. The game features donat in the form of buying crowns to purchase sets of cards and premium tokens. I definitely can‚Äôt recommend a game that the developers are not engaged in and where a degrading aggressive society is present with its ambitions at stake, you are just a pawn in their hands to achieve the goal.

Since the latest patch came out the game has been complete and utter ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. I really hope theres a fix soon that nerfs the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• out of the R8 and fixes the spray patterns on the rifles. GG Valve.

text_translate: , so at least says Wikipedia. A game? I agree. Computer? Indisputably. In the genre of a car simulator? And here, let's figure it out ... - the most important thing in a car simulator. And what do we have? You will not find realistic physics and responsive control system here! But there are trips in the style of "Wait a minute!" The car on the track will be thrown from side to side, it will not work cleanly to go through the trajectory. The weight of the car is not felt, drifts turn into sliding on ice, the type of drive does not matter, front, rear, full - all the same, the traction goes between the wheels. Somehow it turns out not in a car simulator and smacks of the latest "Need for speed". - this is a separate conversation, because you will have to compete not with race car drivers, but with tram drivers, because they mostly ride on rails and diligently do not notice any player's actions. Slowed down before turning - get hit in the ass, skidded - get hit in the side, not accelerated enough - get ... well, you get the idea. And all because you went on the invisible tracks of these "hardcore drivers". Do not get in the way under the wheels, these aggressive psychos here are engaged in "Autosport". will make you a real pro (but rather you will get lawnophobia). Flew out of the bend, hit the curb, lost time? Don't be sad, friend! Get a fine too! But remember - your opponents are not fined, because whoever rides on the rails is always right! (See above.) The game is good, but no more. Nice to the eye, but not wow ... a little weird. The quality is on the level, but desynchronization happens. On a manual gearbox, the sound often does not correspond to gear changes - the engine simply growls and does not slow down, and at the moment of a collision, you may not hear anything at all. I didn't like the music, but the taste and color, as they say .... Any game should first of all bring pleasure, and not annoy every minute. Better drive to the iconic "Race Driver: GRID" or the new "Project CARS". "GRID Autosport" amicably bypassed ...

Although it seems like a good game, the developers abandoned the game a year ago and several functions of the game are broken, among them a multiplayer interaction (which prevents achieving certain achievements) and as I have read, the microtransactions also stopped working, the people pay but do not receive the items or gems they bought.

1. Logos ("World Mind") is a turn-based strategy in which you take on the role of the world mind, as the name of the game hints at. You are the world mind of planet Earth and your task is to lead humanity to prosperity. ... 2. For each turn, 108 years pass. Each turn you are randomly given four cards (Destiny Cards) with different ideas (having both positive and negative effects), with the help of which humanity develops. Moreover, each of the cards belongs to one of the four elements (fire, water, earth, air). It is necessary to use (select) cards in such a way that the elemental cards that were used the most times would not be more than seven pieces compared to the elemental cards that were used the least number of times. Despite the randomness of the cards, the game allows you to predict which elements of the cards will fall out on the next turn, showing them on the left with their "backs" up. 3. The in-game manual says that the goal of the game is to save humanity and the planet until the end of the precession cycle, or the population of the Earth will reach 10 billion people. The latter, despite the claim of the game to the contrary, is not a condition for victory. Perhaps this is the only bug that came across to me in 5 hours of playing. 4. For the prosperity of humanity, you will have to maintain high levels of fertility (population reproduction), health, ecology, ethics, harmony, population, food, other resources, and at a low level - indicators of conflict and military points. True, the latter are necessary if you want to attack wild animals, aliens, zombies. 5. The graphics in the game are pleasing to the eye. The game "table" for a card game is a map of the Earth, which, due to the numerous drawn animals, plants, people, resembles a children's atlas. You will not see anything else on the screen, only the Earth map and the Destiny Cards issued to you. During the game, various events may occur, which partially depend on the indicators I mentioned in point 4, such as religious war, alien attack, arrival / departure of the fairy people, the last nuclear war, epidemic, plague, meteor impact, ice age, etc. .d. For example, Fairy Folk arrives when the level of ethics is high and leaves when it is low; hunger will occur when the amount of food is less than the amount of the world's population; Geyah will show rage at low ecology, etc. etc. Basically, in three or four playthroughs, you will see all the random events in the game. 6. The game has an interesting concept, but boring and repetitive gameplay. Unfortunately, the reason is not in early access, but in the very construction of the gameplay. each game will consist of getting random cards (you will see them all in a couple of playthroughs) and applying them. There is no plot or multiplayer in the game. And it is for this reason that I cannot recommend this game. The game also has no achievements, no game cards, no ability to save the game, which may appear in the full version of the game. If you liked the review, then you can read more if you subscribe to the curator:

text: Bike of the Wild is a free roaming physics based mountain biking game which is challenging to complete. Honestly the game lacked something‚Ä¶. That something is a bland game with little to no character apart from the classical music. I do recommend to have a reasonably high spec pc for this game as I experienced frame dropping with my 960 and also a controller to play optimally (although note I couldn‚Äôt get pc controls working effectively).  Progression in this game doesn‚Äôt correlate to any sense of accomplishment, apart from earning a new colour bike and progression statistics nor any real naming. Say you reach the end of any given mountain, terrain or landscape‚Ä¶ good luck bragging to a friend! A game of this type NEEDS some kind of competitive elements whether it is ranking, multiplayer or friend leader boards but quite frankly there isn‚Äôt much entertainment value here anyway to showcase.  That aside the core gameplay mechanics have potential, with quirky controls that make this game challenging yet equally FUSTRATING to complete. Remember to read the tutorial on the side wall as you go through the first stage as it is required for you to successfully pass that section. After completing this area you are able to free roam through different terrains using your skill and game mechanics to pass them.  This game is aimed at a niche group who‚Äôd enjoy mountain biking with difficult controls, but honestly I cannot see myself replaying this game nor recommend it to anyone I know regardless of any price involved.  This game was provided to me by Yolo Army but that does not influence this review in any way.

text_translate: Hero Sam 3 is probably the only game with a poor single player experience among all old-school FPS representative works. So if you are a lone wolf player and want to socialize before Hero Sam 4 is unlocked, it is recommended to go straight to play the opposite DOOM, or turn left and go next door to play the shadow warrior also issued by D agency. Of course, you can also find a player who has not played Hero Sam 3 online, because this will prevent you two from becoming unlucky children when you experience the game in the future. The weapon basically has no recoil, and there is no need to press the left button without letting go. The protagonist moves very fast. It is recommended to increase the viewing distance and experience flying close to the ground. In 3D, press H to switch to a third-person view with one key. The protagonist and guns do not have any RPG elements, and the player's own strength remains unchanged from beginning to end. Physical strength, armor, and bullets can only be increased by items. Auto-save only pays attention to important nodes, which is useless. It is recommended to save manually. There is no big map or small map, no obvious task direction, you need to explore and pay attention to the plot dialogue. Fight monsters to save the world. The content of the 3rd generation is not as rich as the 2nd generation. There are basically no interesting easter eggs. It is shooting from beginning to end. I like the design of the first few levels of the game very much. The city of Cairo, which has been ruined, is wide and bright, and the enemy is very conspicuous. It is especially happy to swing the hammer in the fierce street fighting. The appearance of different bosses at the bottom is also very sensational, and the length is reasonable, not making people feel tired. However, after the "Iron Team" chapter, the game's intensity suddenly soared. First, the estimated duration of each chapter surged from 20-30 minutes to 45-60 minutes. In addition, the bosses in the early stage will appear as mobs in the later stage. , The tendency to pile monsters is becoming more and more obvious. Every time a node is advanced, hundreds of them will be swiped from all directions. Too much intensity for single players. Hero Sam 3 has inserted several underground scenes, which are very, very, very dark. The protagonist‚Äôs small flashlight can‚Äôt take care of most of the screen at all. It‚Äôs easy to find the north when moving quickly in a spacious but invisible scene. The most uncomfortable thing is that the production team also arranged a lot of high-speed moving alien lizards in these dark scenes. They jumped over and touched the players and immediately jumped away, and the screams were sharp, and the calls were almost impossible to listen to. It is recommended to directly apply explosives to blow up all the pillars in the tomb. In the later stage, the enemy combination is impeccable. The open space is afraid of big scorpions and biochemical people, and the bunkers are afraid of bombers and skeleton horses. There are helicopters and snake girls flying around in the sky. It‚Äôs easy to kill a person if it is not trivial to play alone, but old-school FPS advocates high-speed shooting and often has a background of superpowers. Whether the enemy is swiping in front or behind, it is completely reasonable. For single player games, no cooperation is undoubtedly To make matters worse. The protagonist‚Äôs battery life is very poor. Unlike Doomslayer, which can tear monsters and regain blood, it cannot regenerate blood like Wang Luo. It is even more impossible to imitate BJ assassination, because all enemies are in perspective. The protagonist charges, even if he is hiding in a bunker, the enemy with a gun will blast his head against the wall, and he dare not show his head; if there is no bunker, because the enemy with the gun is touching, every bullet will be accurate if the player does not move. Into the protagonist‚Äôs head. In addition, if the protagonist is hit, the screen will have the effect of blurring and reddening. If you face multiple enemies with guns at a long distance, you will basically be unable to see the enemy's position, and then you will only be shot to death. Mental pollution, the Bomberman (headless death squad member) is probably the most representative monster in the entire hero Sam series. The first monster in the latest trailer released by the 4th generation is also the Bomberman, but it is too noisy. Especially when they appeared in groups, they almost got tinnitus after playing. There are too many weapons, but the roulette can't cut the gun. The skeleton horse rushes to the face and cuts the wrong gun. It often happens that he sends himself away with a missile. I suspect that the last level was driven to the rhythm of not letting the single player pass. I only chose the third level of the five levels of difficulty. In the early stage, it‚Äôs okay to spawn some creeps and bombers. In the later stage, the tauren, Sirius, and dinosaur robots continue to spawn like Nima spraying dung. I have been shooting for nearly two hours after the death restarts. Maybe Eastern Europeans are more persistent, even the games made by tm do not take a break, vomiting. PS: Hero Sam 3 may run on the core display by default and needs to be manually debugged. Although this game can also run on the core display, it will get stuck when spawning monsters. The first time I played at night, I dreamed that my eyeballs were cut out, it hurts.

text_translate: BottomLine at the Top:  A perfect example of why I wish Steam had a neutral option for recommendations.  Although the graphic style is nostalgic and it has some decent music, this game is mostly a mess and should be avoided. ------------------------------------- Pros ------------------------------------- -My favorite feature of this game, by a far margin, is the fact that you essentially have infinite save slots.  This is such a pet peeve of mine on modern games that only feature a few save slots.  Its save interface is very clunky (basically just opens up a standard windows save window in game that does not mesh at all with the aesthetics of the games interface) but the fact that you can make as many saves as you want is something I just loved.  It was def needed to, as there are multiple ways to die and there are both timing puzzles as well as the opportunity to miss items that you needed from earlier parts of the game. -I enjoyed the music in this game even if it did get repetitive. -Graphic styling holds up mostly well.  This was definitely a Broken Sword clone.  Animations have some rotoscoping. -It‚Äôs kind of funny picking fights with random people/pulling your gun on everyone.  ------------------------------------- Meh. ------------------------------------- -Has autosave but only one autosave slot.  If you missed something and didn‚Äôt save it‚Äôs not always easy to rely on the autosave to bring back to a point that you need to get what you required to complete the game. -No Steam overlay integration.  Can't take screenshots. No steam achievements. ------------------------------------- Cons ------------------------------------- -So, I think one of the biggest issues for most people is going to be this games jaw dropping racism/homophobia/and misogyny.  I won't go into pointing out the specific events, if you play they are hard to miss.  There is a big difference between risqu√© inappropriate humor and whatever this game has.  I'm not sure if it‚Äôs a translation or cultural issue (I believe this game was made from a Polish developer) but even for the late 90's when this game came out this game has some real tone-deaf moments.  I mean I used to work in construction and some of the stuff that was said in this game even made me blush.  I myself do not fall into any of those groups that are insulted but I can easily see how some players could be very offended.  -Voice work is terrible.  Actors sound professional enough sure, but I think another reviewer described it best by saying they all sounded "mechanical".  Dialogue is clunky and boring, especially Jack's description of items in his environment.  He literally just lists off what the things are with no other description. Also, I know Jack is supposed to be this acerbic character, but it sounds as though his voice actor is just actually mad himself that he has to be in this game.   -Voice audio recording quality is poor.  Game seems to have some kind of issue whereby it sounds like voices are coming from as far left or right as the speakers allow.  No positional audio for where the characters are on screen. -Control scheme is awful.  No in game documentation of how to open up inventory or how to talk to characters.  Often times an object that can be picked up won't "take" right away.  I usually have to move Jack or place my cursor back and forth and click a couple times before it finally recognizes what I‚Äôm trying to do.  Having to use the Function keys to open inventory is dumb (supposedly you are supposed to be able to click on Jack to open inventory, but I never got that to work.)   -Dialogue is really clunky.  It‚Äôs mostly translated from its originally Polish fine, but I think the original writing was just really weak. -The story is dumb.  I really lost interest halfway through and it felt like a chore to finish. -Some real "non-sequitur" scripting events (for instance you can't open a gate and now a can of grease randomly appears in a different location that you would have no idea to go and check to see if it‚Äôs there) -Poor proofreading, noticed several misspellings. -Poor "tone".  Is the game supposed to be a semi-serious film-noir style detective mystery?  If so, why does it awkwardly break the fourth wall by referencing things that don‚Äôt take place in the story's era? (i.e. referencing Miranda rights which didn‚Äôt come about until the mid-60's.  Or making a joke about reality shows... -Which by the way, that reality show joke was made in a bar.... with multiple tv's...that you only reached after going through a bunch of catacomb style screens (that were mostly empty of things to do) ...I really don't know what was up with that whole thing, but it was really bizarre. -Several other reviewers have given this negative reviews due to game crashing bugs/errors.  I only had this happen once after dying once in the harbor.  Not sure if it‚Äôs something that has been mostly addressed with patches or if I was just lucky. -Game messed up the order of icons on my desktop after alt-tabbing or closing the game.   -Not an easy game to pick up again if you haven‚Äôt played in a while.  Easy to forget what you were doing or what you need to do. -Definite examples of irritating pixel hunting. -Weird mechanic in this game of there being lots of "junk" items to pick up.  Not sure what the purpose was there.  It‚Äôs not easy to have to program in all these objects that you ultimately do nothing with and serve no purpose.  It also makes it easy to stay stuck as you can't do the old "click everything on everything" brute force attack to progress in the game when you don't know what to do.   Final Thoughts:  Overall I can't recommend this to most players. If you have a nostalgia for this era and style of P&C game...just go replay a Broken Sword game.  If you absolutely must try every P&C game out there, definitely wait for this to go on sale I think I picked it up for less than a dollar and if I paid any more than that I would have been pissed... For some examples of good point & click games, go check out our P&C fan group over at the   !!!

text: TL;DR:  I liked this game a lot when it came out on the PS2 originally, but it doesn't hold up well today as it has been surpassed in every way by better shooters.   I still like this game for nostalgia, but in my opinion, RF1 is the better game.   Don't buy this at full price but if you get it in a bundle or super cheap, it's worth checking out just to see what the Red Faction series started out like before it's more modern iterations Guerrilla and Armageddon. Red Faction II takes place a few years after the events of Red Faction, but this time moves the story away from Mars to Earth, where the simply named Commonwealth is ruled by the iron fist of the dictator Sopot.   You start the game as Alias, a demolitions expert who is part of a squad of Sopot's elite guard.   You come into possession of nanotechnology which can be used to enhance soldiers.   You and your squadmates volunteer to be enhanced, but Sopot becomes afraid of your power so he marks you and your squadmates for death and abandons the project in favor of creating Processed, nanoenhanced zombies.   Your squad vows revenge and joins up with the Red Faction on earth to help bring down Sopot.   Good: +  GeoMod allowing for destructive environments was still ground breaking (pun intended) for the time, and it is cool to take a grenade launcher and blow apart buildings. + Ambiance of the game is one of the reasons I like this series, this one takes place in a dictatorial city.  The environments are more varied than the first game which is an improvement. + Weapon variety, lots of weapons to choose from in this game.  Since you begin the game as a demolitions expert, your first weapon is a grenade launcher which is a way better starter weapon than a lame old pistol.    This game introduces duel wield weapons, allowing you to use either a single or duel pistol or machine pistol.   + Playing through the game allows you to unlock bonus content, such as concept art, character models, etc.  The game also has a built-in cheat mode system if you're into that sort of thing,  which includes crazy cheats for over the top explosions, deaths, etc.   + Multiplayer mode even with bots was fun.  Lots of late nights playing this with my brothers huddled in front of the TV. + Unlike RF1 on PC, this game doesn't need much modding or tweaking to make it playable on modern systems.   I was able to play at full settings without needing to install anything extra. + Campaign is split into "levels" which allows for checkpoints, one of my major gripes from RF1 was if you died you had to go back to your last save point.   I often forget to save because playing modern games we are spoiled by the auto-save.   This allieviates that somewhat. Bad:  + Even at the highest settings, this game is over a decade old and it looks it.   It's not the most horrible game to look at but you definitely know you're playing an old game.   Character models especially suffer here in cutscenes. + I hate the characters in this game.  They're condescending ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• to the people trying to help them for no reason.   Your character, unlike RF1 where you play as Parker, is mute and has zero personality.    + Story is predictable, even the twists are predictable. + Enemy AI is trash, although they did improve the questionable strafing and bullet spongery from the first game. + Difficulty jumps can make the game frustrating and not rewarding to play.

text: After this last operation I hope everyone realizes how disgusting this game is. 100 levels of a battle pass format in which 42 of them you get a reward and 58 of them you get nothing. Full price, to buy 100 levels, is $100 CDN. So basically $1 dollar per level. $58 gets you absolutely nothing while $42 gets you an item often a spray worth $0.08 cents. Clearly whoever is left developing this game doesn't care about quality but rather money. What is funny though... They would have made a lot more if they, instead of coming out with yet another weapon skin case, came out with a player customization option. Have a basic editor to choose gender, facial hair and colour, scars and so on. Simple things and realistic. Then release a case that had clothing items. Allow customized bullet proof jackets, gas masks, pants, shirts and helmets for CT and bandana's specific to T's. Allow the player to craft their own unique character while maintaining the theme of the game, realism to the extent that is CSGO and retain the hit boxes by keeping sizes of customization the same.  Nope instead all we have is elitist gloves in a case worth often hundreds of dollars that most your base won't ever own. You can always gamble away $3 at a time to get another $0.10 cent item. Quality content is non-existent while the continuous cash cow that is this game thrives. People should stop buying into it and wake up. You can do whatever you want with your money but why not ask for more from it? Buy 100 levels and get nothing for half those levels? Are you all happy with that? Had they added a customization option it could have breathed new life into the game. Every basic level could have given a neat accessory item like a tie, watches, glasses while cases could have had the bigger items with rarity tiers. More stickers, more useless sprays no one uses, more weapon skins. Seriously? You missed an opportunity here big time.

text: Don't get me wrong. I think this could be a great game. The reason why I don't recomend it is because not only I think it should have achievements, but I think it should have like 200 of them... The mechanic of the game is to survive, you can't "beat" the game. And, in the end, is a game about "doing things". I think that the idea is great, but I also think that it would be nice to have some goals, and some way to know what you've managed to achieve... I know it has been asked many times, and developers said the reason why the game doesn't have achievements is mainly because they don't want to. I respect that, but they use to give some reasons that, to me, sounds more like excuses (I don't really know how hard is to add this to a game, programming and so...). But that is the reason I don't recomend this game. After a few hours, I'd rather be playing something else. If, unlike me, you don't care about that (Achievements, leaderboards...) then you might like the game. It is original, well designed and you can have fun playing it to kill some time.

text_translate: This is one of the worst purchases in the past year. Let's start with the "easiest" one: 1) Departures and freezes even on powerful computers, if you have a lot of divisions, they move or attack 2) Generals, field marshals, after a successful attack, can change the front line, shorten it several times. Why, cool 3) Insanely few game modes. In the standard version, these are only 1936 and 1939. 4) In the standard version, there are very few national focuses, that is, the developer "forces" you to buy add-ons 5) It will be difficult for a beginner to master the game mechanics. Much remains unsolved. I went through fairly simple points that, to one degree or another, will not always bother you. Now, we turn to the most "sweet": 1) Sudden crashes and the "Paradox Interactive" window 2) To go online, you have to get old, tk. : 1) Servers are created by other players and they may not let you in at will, or kick out 2) You can sit for an hour, press the button "connect" to any server, to which only "connection failed" will fly out. Why, how, why? For which I gave 700 hard-earned money. The most interesting thing is that it continues, even if you clean the long-suffering cache, restart the game, or God forbid, update the firewood. 3) 70 divisions with tens of thousands of soldiers will lose to one, even if the last one is in the ring. You see, she is in the city and rebuilt the fortifications, which means that 700 thousand people will not be able to defeat 10 thousand. Yes, you don‚Äôt believe it yourself? 4) If one damn division went to your rear, even if you were the Soviet Union, it can capture half of the country in the process of its movement. Control over the occupied territories? The deployment of troops there? She, you what, why complicate? You can simply put a regime of different severity in the column of control over the occupied countries. B-C-F 5) Relations with other countries, incl. adversaries are driven into a dead end. For many hours of playing, not one of the countries with which I fought (whatever the outcome, even though I lose, even though I win) did not want to accept "peace" from my side. Other countries did not do this either. That is, absolutely useless icon Absolutely, in no case I will not recommend this product to you. Developers are not at all interested in the problems of ordinary "mortals" who bought this miracle. Grabbing money, staying satisfied and upsetting the buyer is the profit of the developers of this game. Score - 3/10.

On the first day, achievements did not work, on the second day, the save was completely lost. Shut up ... But this is still half the trouble. The game itself is disastrously boring. The plot is uninteresting, the gameplay is a burdensome walking through an absolutely empty forest. The developers have already finally hammered the line with the psychological problems of the protagonist, which they have in every game, being too lazy to make an intrigue out of it, but simply presented with the fact that the hero is not all right. And if before the launch of this game I hoped that while developing Layers of Fear 2, the main team was busy with this project, and that game was entrusted to some small group of students, now it seems to me that Blair Witch was made by people who saw the computer for the first time , and then there were at most one and a half excavators. The only conditions under which it can be launched, score on the advancement of the plot, open the snake in the main character's phone and play it.

text_translate: Well, I confess that I played little, I didn‚Äôt fully explore the game, but even so the little I played already has a lot to say in this analysis, I know the game is "NEW", it is an Indie game, of a genre not much explored by developers, which is Martial Arts and fighting, especially this game that is a multiplayer with up to several people fighting at the same time, but with all these characteristics I say that the game was not very well produced. One of the reasons that I think the game was not very well produced was the map, the map is small and gets in the way of fighting a lot of times. I was unable to execute such a command because I had no space to execute it, I took too much damage I died several times because I couldn‚Äôt dodge it I had full stamina and I couldn‚Äôt dodge it because of the map. Another reason is the combat techniques, there are 4 techniques and you press buttons to change them, and several times you pressed that button and didn‚Äôt change techniques, that was horrible because there was such a technique that gave better combos and other blows and you couldn‚Äôt execute -there is because of this technical change problem. The game even though it doesn't have realistic graphics, but rather cartonized graphics they have great graphics, similar to fortinite, a game that even without realistic graphics has extremely beautiful and simple graphics too, this makes the game not too heavy and run on any machine, even though I‚Äôm very weak. Speaking of MAP, the game has a very small but very beautiful map and with a lot of remarkable details, one of the problems is that when you go in the water you die, and that really hindered the game because there were things on the other side of the water and if you put a foot up you were already dead. One of the good things about this game is the Character Model, which has an excellent collision without problems "flying" on the ground, and without problems in combat too, many fighting games have collision problems in combat and this one does not. I found the multiplayer horrible, it is not divided into story mode and multiplayer mode it is all mixed up sometimes you are going to a location in the story mode and there are people wanting to attack you, and with the map problems I mentioned earlier. many times you die and only return to a certain place that is where you save the game, if you kill a boss and do not reach that place to save you can die or leave the game and when you come back you will have to do everything again. A compliment that I have to do is about the sounds of the game, his soundtrack is incredible, his ambient sound too and the sounds of combat are exceptional, very good congratulations to Sloclap on the sounds of the game, but the game is still has a lot to improve. I don't have much to say about this, the game is actually cheap, but if you buy it, I recommend buying it on the promotion, which is worth a lot more, alias the game is not everything it is for the price, so I recommend buying it on promotion. His gameplay is not the best, the game has no Run, that is, you can‚Äôt run on it, the game has no jump, nothing big the game doesn‚Äôt jump, several games also don‚Äôt and are great, like God of War, but it is normal not to jump when the game is linear. The gameplay in combat is good, but as I said before there are many bugs that hinder your gameplay, but apart from the avoidance, the techniques, the gameplay in combat is good. The game itself is good, but not a big deal, it has a lot of mistakes and a lot of things to be fixed, if the company pays attention to it, it can become an incredible game, before I bought it I really wanted to- it, but after I bought it I saw that it‚Äôs not all that and for that reason I don‚Äôt recommend buying the game now, if it improves, I do recommend buying alias the game has a lot of potential. 4.7 / 10

text_translate: Bohemia - cancer of a publisher that can be put in the same bag as Electronic Arts. Avoid their products. 2 years later update - ok, they finally decided to pick up a pace with updates, probably due to player numbers plummeting drastically. I've got mixed feelings about a new map. It's something refreshing but I feel like their resources could have been used elsewhere f.e. survival mechanics. Ok, survival. Damn I wish they implemented more of features like complex medicine (injuries, diseases) and ways of tending to those. More emphasis on hunting and foraging rather than visitng towns for few cans of peaches. And here we come to another survival related aspect: looting town and cities. These should be swarming with zombies which seems obvious contrary to woods and remote areas. A trip to city should be either a team effort or stealthy approach (if going solo) with high risk/high rewards. All in all I still enjoy coming back to Chernarus/Livonia from time to time but nowhere near as much as I did back in the days when the game was being actively developed. I still hope it will actually deliver it's full potential one day and I will see this great universe thrive again. Don't ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• it up Bohemia. Don't try to turn it into PUBG on oversized map. For now it still stays negative with a spark of hope.

text: Bei Release dachte ich:  Endlich wieder ein gutes Civ Game! Und dies wurde von jeder seite best√§tigt ob es nun Reviewseiten sind oder gar die Reviews auf Steam, jeder meinte CIv6 wird Civ5 ersetzen. Und vielleicht tut es das auch... Aber nicht zum aktuellen Stand.  Der aktuelle Stand ist dass:  es Steam zum laggen bringt  es 90% CPU Auslastung verursacht eine Multiplayer Party nach 300 Runden sich aufh√§nt und die gesamte Runde weggeschmissen werden muss da reload auch nicht mehr m√∂glich war es dauernd abst√ºrzt die KI ein geringeres Problem ist, wie Barbaren mein Premade im Multiplayer laggt  und seine FPS bei ihm von 160FPS langsam auf 40FPS fallen es hat leider keinen Sucht Faktor immernoch kein Patch kam Weitere Probleme zur Spielmechanik, Grafik, und co findet ihr ausf√ºhrlich in anderen Reviews. text_translate: Initially, the game showed promise, but in the end it turned out to be shit.

text: Think Tombraider, you know that moment when your looking at where you need to go but just cant get there.... This game oozes those moments over n over. The gaming world has been done so layer upon layer is stacked upon one another, it can be irritating and confusing but also engrossing. The story was great imo, with nice twists towards the end. Combat is poor and boils down to tapping the attack button as fast as possible to come out on top, no blocking whatsoever. The graphics are good and have a nice cel shaded effect with a wonderful use of colours n shades. There is a deep crafting interface but with so many items and ingredients it becomes overwhelming and uninteresting, your inventory being full always, meaning your movement suffers and with the world being so big long intervals of travelling become common place. Overall its not a bad game, its just not a good one either 5/10
text_translate: Specifically, I have no complaints about the game - you can say the founder of the genre and my favorite series. Not without jambs, of course, but all of them can be considered part of an EXTREMELY successful experiment, which cannot be said about the Remastered version: not only are there not so many changes themselves, the game still manages to give out stable errors at startup and lags in terms of optimization. Here you can also get stuck in textures () As for the graphics, the changes can be seen only in detailed comparisons on YouTube: somewhere they tweaked the shadows, somewhere they added light effects. However, nothing new The mini-map has finally arrived, but where are the other gameplay features !? Why is it still impossible to select quest tasks while in the transport? Why is running constantly interrupted by moving the stick to the side? All this is purely trifles, but during the local, and so monotonous boring gameplay (thanks to unprincipled side quests and a strange plot), the owners of the original got the updated version for free, and thanks for that.

text: Whispers of a Machine (v1.0.6) + Nordic-Noir-Setting + Vollvertonung (aber nur Englisch) + deutsche Texte + Protagonistin kann w√§hrend des Spiels drei Pers√∂nlichkeitsmerkmale weiterentwickeln: Einf√ºhlsam (Weg des Balder), Selbstbewusst (Weg des Tyr), Analytisch (Weg der Frigg); was sich auch auf die zur Verf√ºgung stehende Cyberware auswirkt + Cyberware in Form von Forensik-Scanner (z.B. zum erkennen von Blutgruppen, Alter, Todeszeitpunkt), Biometrie-Analysator (scannt ob ein Ziel z.B. entspannt oder √§ngstlich ist), Muskel-Boost und sp√§ter drei weitere Augmentationen + klassische und intuitive Point&Click-Steuerung + interaktive Objekte k√∂nnen angezeigt werden (Leertaste) + unterschiedliche L√∂sungswege + automatisches Notizbuch das auch gut ins Spiel eingebunden wird + vergr√∂√üerte Gesichter bei Konversationen die auch ihren Gesichtsausdruck √§ndern + Entscheidungen lassen sich nicht zur√ºcknehmen (da das Spiel automatisch speichert) + man kann sterben (so war das fr√ºher in Adventures) + Doppelklick um Weg zum Bildausgang abzuk√ºrzen + drei verschiedene Enden - Pixelgrafik - optisch einfallslose Bildschirmhintergr√ºnde - Vertonung nur auf Englisch - eher langweilige Protagonistin - wenig interessante NSCs - unspannende Geschichte - Bug: Figur kann in sehr seltenen F√§llen stecken bleiben und l√§sst sich dann nicht mehr wegbewegen (L√∂sung: Shift+Alt+Pfeiltaste um sich zu befreien) Whispers of a Machine von Mitte 2019 ist ein Scifi-Nordic-Noir-Adventure das nach dem sogenannten ‚ÄûKollaps‚Äú, in einer Post-KI-Zeit spielt, in der es verboten ist etwas zu erschaffen, das eigenst√§ndig denken kann. Man verk√∂rpert Vera Englund, eine kybernetisch verbesserte Sonderermittlerin f√ºr Gewaltverbrechen, der es leider an Charisma und Pers√∂nlichkeit fehlt. Man kann sie zwar in drei Richtungen entwickeln, aber dennoch fehlt ihr irgendwie das gewisse Etwas. Man k√∂nnte auch sagen die Protagonistin ist langweilig. Die Mordserie in der man ermittelt und die sich √ºber vier Tage hinzieht, schafft leider ebenfalls nicht den Durchbruch. Tag 1-2 fand ich noch interessant, aber ab Tag  3 war irgendwie die Luft raus und ich war froh als ich es dann letztendlich durch hatte. Dabei hatte die transhumanistische Geschichte um die Fanatiker des Konnektivs (Pro KI) und der christlich-orthodoxen EPOS-Kirche (Contra KI) viel Potenzial, war aber dann doch leider eher zum G√§hnen. Es passiert einfach kaum etwas spannendes oder fesselndes. Auch unter den Noir-Begriff, mit dem sich das Spiel schm√ºckt, h√§tte ich mehr erwartet. Die R√§tsel waren leicht, was kein negativer Punkt ist, aber dennoch gab es ein paar Stellen, bei denen ich die Komplettl√∂sung heranziehen musste um weiter zu kommen.  Insgesamt ist das Adventure nicht wirklich schlecht, aber eben auch nicht richtig gut. Und in solchen F√§llen werte ich stets ab. W√§ren die letzten beiden Tage genauso interessant wie die ersten beiden, h√§tte ich einen Daumen nach oben vergeben, aber so gibt es von mir nach l√§ngerer √úberlegung und innerem Ringen leider einen augmentierten Daumen nach unten. Dennoch danke an den User Criz-White f√ºr dieses Geschenk :-) Wenn ihr an weiteren Reviews von mir interessiert seid, dann folgt meiner  .

text: Don't get me wrong, I love this game and it's one of my favorite games of all time, mind you, but this new news is too disappointing. I doubt many people may have heard the news, since it was pushed over by everything else at e3, but all mods (and the company that makes mods for singleplayer) got a cease and desist, and are being removed in the game just to get more people to play online, which is already rife with microntransactions. I mean, take a look at the hydra; it's already in multiplayer, not buggy at all, but Rockstar and 2K refuse to put it in single player, just so they can drag more people into their money-hungry multiplayer.  TL;DR: Great game, so much fun and I would reccomend the buy, however you should wait if you want to show support for the mods being taken away.

I absolutely loved Far Cry 3 and having heard nothing but praises from everyone about blood dragon i decided to go ahead and buy it.Thing is wheather you will like blood dragon or not is solely depending upon on how much you are willing to overlook things.My biggest problem with BD is that it uses all the same mechanics from FC3 which is really annoying since it causes a disconnect,FC3 was pseudo realistic fps and encouraged realism but BD is the exact opposite.I also felt weird playing the game coz it essentially is reskinned version of FC3 although some of you may not have an issue with that. The asthetics were very appealing as everything is neon filled from the enimes to the dragons to the buildings everything lit in neon colors.The comedy especially some of the dialouges are really hilarious.The outlandish over the top settings with robots,dinasours is really refreshing.The length is pretty short can be completed in 2-3 hours and if trying to get 100% can be done in 5-6 hours, this might be a turnoff for some people but i absolutely love short games as time is an issue as we get older. Overall i have pretty mixed feelings for FC3 BD, i gave it a negative because of the huge disconnect between the game mechanics with the gameplay for example the hostage resuce missions are really a pain in the arse coz you have to be stealthy but its not enjoyable at all becuse of the way the mission is setup its nearly impossible to be not detected not to mention the fact you are encouraged throughout the game to blast your way though.I'd say if you want to pick it up do so when its discounted or maybe skip FC3 is a far superior game in every single way grab that if you dont already owe it.

text: TL:DR Game is nowhere near worth it's amount and has many problems that should be fixed. I rarely ever write reviews for the games I play whether I enjoy or hate them but given the circumstances for this game in particular, a review is a must. And from what I've played, this game is absolutely garbage. This game is a DEATHMATCH style moba, not a King of the Hill. You fight against 7 other opponents in a battle to the death. You have 4 lives. Last person left standing is the winner. Let's start with the classes. There are four classes in the game at the moment which consists of your generic Knight, Archer, Axeman and Mage. These classes are extremely unbalanced and the Knight class will win in a fight almost every single time. Playing a class such as Archer will only net you kills is if your enemy has noticeably health than you or you're not being directly targeted. You're also given no description of any of the classes, it's abilities, DPS, speed, or anything. All there is to see is the look and name of your character doing a certain animation. I'm not sure if I missed it during the loading times or anything but there seemed to have not been any proper place to select my character other than clicking on them in the profile screen then joining a queue, which forced me to play Archer the whole time whether I wanted to or not. Once you actually get yourself into a match, you'll find how dull the music is and how cheap and repetitive the sound effects are with the only thing keeping me playing is the cluster‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• of people going at it and getting some cheap kills at the knights before dying to one yourself. The majority of the content really is killing others until they run out lives, which isn't bad but isn't really good either. When the match is over, the back to main menu button is temporarily disabled.....HOW DOES THAT MANAGE TO OCCUR??!?  But for all I saw that is bad, there are a few pros being the controls feels really for how it plays although the buttons on the main menu is a bit iffy at times. The animations graphics are also pretty decent except the ones again in the main menu. And these are my opinions on the game I had created when I had started up and played for the first time. Given that I had played and created this review in early access, most of everything wrong here can be changed such as: These are all basic suggestions however and won't create a great game from hopefully fixing these alone. I leave the creativity part up to you guys.

text_translate: Such an awesome game in so many ways from suspense,team work,dope guns and equipment and it all works fairly and the game play is smooth and tactical,but in and among all that greatness lays the core issue stopping this game from taking off and that is matchmaking and the ability to train and still have fun at lower levels. Im level 30+ and even though i have a fairly good selection of weaponry and gear the game is just unplayable after level 25+ since once you pass that threshold youre now paired with all the level 100's since there isnt any kinda level wall after 25. it makes no sense its like giving a solider one week of training and sending him to the front. You go from having a fun time under 25 then you start getting your ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• pushed in. And i do want to go on the record of saying yes ive killed a few 100's and i know you can still stand a chance depending on location/situation but so much of the toe-to-toe fighting in this game relies on your gear choice and current hunters levels.  Simple level bracketing would solve this so quickly i dont care if im playing against 20-30 levels higher then myself i can handle that sometimes but tossing me to people who are 70+ levels ahead over and over just gets boring. The levels 100's fear losing nothing and are tough af so it forces you into a play style whether you like it or not since you'll just get your ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• pushed in otherwise. When matchmaking is fixed this game will be amazing until then i just dont have much fun playing a one sided game.

The game is very similar to 2015's Airport Firefighters - The Simulation, only worse. In addition to the voice acting, nothing pleases. The graphics are outdated, the characters have poor models who do not move their lips when talking and often get stuck in the doorway. The firefighter runs too leisurely for his profession. Even transport trips do not add dynamics. The location is large, but it looks empty. The details are shabby and the textures are worse than many indies created by lone developers. The overall impression is depressing. Still not happy with the price. It does not correspond to the quality (435 rubles without discount).

130 rubles .... bought for 800 in general. That feeling when you realize that you no longer need to take games outside of sales. And for the fact that you bought it for 800 rubles, you will not be given any bonuses. Lousy attitude towards the buyer.

text: So it's an inferior version of the XCOM reboot: 1) the gameplay is more linear, the characters are less customizable, no option to sell items. But that's the minor issue. 2) The major one is the plot and dialogues. In the former we deal from downgrade of "we were soldiers and tried to prevent aliens from conquering us, but failed, sadly. Then we were guerilla warriors and fought against human-stealing, mutants-making Elders on our land and succeeded, at last" to SJW "well, those aliens are OK, we are cops now and want to live in peace together". The dialogues between missions are cringy and do not provide character development. The only white dude is a bullied assistant. It's kinda same route as it was with the Wolfenstein series reboot: the first one was gorgeous and fun, the second one kinda lived up to the first one and the youngblood ruined it.

text_translate: It feels like the devs had a cool concept (a puzzler about changing gravitational directions), then very quickly realized they didn't have many ideas for actual puzzles to make with it. Because of this the game is rather short, and not really interesting to be honest. You've got cutscenes trying to convince you there's more depth than I felt there was, and a new game+ that's the same game only the puzzle keys are in minorly different locations. Another thing is while the game isn't really about platforming, there are a couple places that require you to jump from an edge at nearly the farthest spot you can go before you start falling off, which surprised me a great deal. Perhaps my frame-rate messed with the physics just enough to be noticeable there? Either way, I sadly can't really recommend the game.

text_translate: This is one of those great games that just gets hindered by the game developer using old game mechanics and gameplay from older games [Layers of Fear] which not only rip you out of the immersion, but also become more of an annoying headache to sit through than it's actually worth. Observer is great cyberpunk detective game, it feels as though the horror was almost shoved into this game to make it more in the "horror genre" whereas instead they should have pursued a more organic psychological thriller theme instead.  The detective work and looking for clues in apartments, as well as uncovering what's really going on in the apartment complex is a real treat. The part that really annoyed me and pushed my limit on playing this game were the points in the game where you find a body or a person and connect into them to see their memories. Then the game stops being Observer and jumps right back into the stale and annoying gameplay of Layers of Fear. Why is stuff floating? Why is everything getting pushed further and further away and always has to have a long pitched squeal attached to it? It goes from a great and interesting detective game into another "Boo! Spooky Objects!" game and that really pushed me from enjoying the game into having to sit through monotonous lengths of these "super spooky" moments. They drag on and on, your character speed changes and you have to sit through uninteresting and useless information as well as meaningless and borderline incompetent gameplay, either to stretch the longevity of the game further, or to pass it off as a "super scary game".  Overall I was disappointed with the game,  I really thought it was going to a detective thriller about a man finding his son and uncovering the mysteries hidden within this apartment complex, but instead I got floating chairs shooting across the room, glitchy people moving across my screen, and loud and repetitive jumpscare noises that not only ruined my immersion, but my enjoyment of the game overall.

text: This game is a hot mess and the more I think about it, the less I like it. But let's focus on the main problem - this is a TellTale-style decision driven game. You're told at every opportunity that your decisions matter, that it's you who will dexide the outcome of this game. And for the most part, it does kind of feel like you have an effect on the world. Some decisions are stupid, some are not actually decisions at all and result in the same thing, but if the endings are great, what does it matter? And there's the kicker - none of it matters. No matter how you play the game, what decisions you make, who you befriend or save, who you insult or hate - it always ends the same. With one decision, after 12 hours of gameplay, one decision is the only one that will actually have an effect. And no matter what you choose, it will all de-value every single decision you've made in the entire game. Especially since the one you're supposed to choose - the "sadder" one - makes no sense even in this time travel story. The time travel mechanics are just... senseless. The fact you retain objects when you travel back in time is ignored on different occassions because plot demands it. Like when one choice is to take a photo of a girl being bullied (which you should retain) or help out, if you first take the photo, go back, and then help out instead, you lose the photo - because it was an important choice and it doesn't matter that the rules just change as the plot demants it. The fact you don't move when you travel back is also ignored when the mechanic is established in the first place. The whole setup is frustrating if you even attempt to think about it. I would not reccomend this game. It fails as a choice-driven experience, as it never actually gives a player a single choice until 12 hours into the game. And it fails as a time travel story, as it either never explains its mechanics, or just ignores whatever was established, just because the plot demands it. Any of my investment in the story or characters was undercut by the ending, I can't bring myself to care for the decisions I made for them when none of it actually mattered and the game was just as linear as a Call of Duty shooter. A far cry from "drive your story" experience.
text_translate: Let me start this by saying that the   is quite good. The fighting is solid, the campaign is... eh... it's a campaign, and the available multiplayer modes are mostly good. The only game modes newcomers will be able to (reliably) enjoy are Duels (1v1s), Brawls (2v2s), or co-op of the other modes and even that's questionable.  The reason is this: Gear stats, revenge, and environmental kills. If you disagree that's fine, you don't have to agree with me as this is subjective. If you'd like to refute these points, that's also fine but you are very unlikely to change my mind. All I ask is you read them, and if you choose to respond do so in a measured manner. In Elimination, Skirmish, and Dominion the stats on your equipment becomes active. This, at lower levels (I'd say lower than level 30 gear) makes very little difference in gameplay, most heroes of this level have pretty basic stats. But, when you get to higher gear levels (let's say 50+) you've made substantial changes to your attack, defense, or (most importantly) your revenge mode. Revenge is a mechanic that automatically parries all incoming attacks upon use, turns your parries into knockdowns, turns your throws into knockdowns, makes your attacks uninterruptable, and increases your attack/defense by a significant amount. This, in of itself, is not a bad thing. It is a very cool idea, and gives someone who's being attacked by multiple opponents a fighting chance. It is influenced by a number of stats: Revenge mode attack, revenge mode defense, revenge gain on defense, and revenge gain on injury. If you inflate any of these stats to a significant degree (especially the two revenge gains) you border on making yourself overpowered. The reason being that your revenge mode will now activate faster/be more powerful than your opponent's. This wouldn't be so bad... You can buy gear using real world money. Not only can you do that, you can also buy "Champion Status" that causes you to receive more gear after matches, more experience, more steel (currency), and get more salvage from destroying extraneous equipment. Yes, these things can all be ground out via in-game orders (daily missions) or repeatedly completing matches. If that changes things for you, that's fine, but it doesn't fix the imbalance for me.  Experience level determines received gear level, the amount of salvage you have determines how quickly you can level that gear, meaning that those who stump up the time or money for champion status have a definite advantage in these modes. Now, you might be thinking, "What if I want to play Elimination or Domination without gear stats?" Well... Ubisoft thinks you should play custom games, because  Alternatively you might be questioning, "What about that Skirmish mode you mentioned?" To answer that all I really need to say is: Skirmish is so badly broken that I don't know a single person who enjoys it (Yes, you probably exist and might even tell me you enjoy it, but at time of writing I've never met anyone who does). Skirmish is so bad that Ubisoft not only left it out of the open beta, but they felt they had to tack it onto their Elimination matchmaking to actually get people to play it. Also, orders that apply to Elimination can't be completed in Skirmish and vice versa. Notice how we're all the way down here and I haven't even gotten into networking issues? So let's open that can of worms too. There are no dedicated servers, meaning that you are forever on a P2P network. So the host's system gets overtaxed, their bandwidth is exploited, and (sometimes) when they leave the lobby shuts itself down, denying anyone in it gear, steel, and experience. Not only that but P2P networking on PC is dangerous. Both in the realm of cheating and information protection. Yes, there are likely safeguards in place. Yes, they could be close to (or completely) ironclad in some way. Now, as I've run out of things to complain about (for now), I'll do a quick roundup of bugbears both mentioned and unmentioned. So... uPlay... uPlay uPlay uPlay... You poorly performing moneygrab of a platform. To clue anyone who isn't aware in, uPlay only exists because Ubisoft doesn't like paying Steam to carry their games, just like Origin. Unlike Origin and EA, Ubisoft sells their games on Steam as well, with the caveat that you must install and run uPlay at all times while playing their games. It's buggy, slow, and causes their games to interact very poorly with the Steam overlay. In fact you can't use Steam to invite your friends to Ubisoft games, because the games aren't built to work with it (Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't, it's always seemed intentional to me). To put the cherry atop the poorly frosted and slightly burnt cake, the sex split for heroes is even. 3 male, 3 female, 3 that you can decide their sex. I can't be the only one that remembers when Ubisoft said it'd be too expensive to make two models in Assassin's Creed Unity for male/female assassins. In this game there are... 18 models that all have multiple gear sets, not counting NPCs. Yes. I know. Extraneous, but I still like poking fun at a corporation that doesn't respond truthfully to criticism. If you've made it this far, you have my thanks. Have a good one, and... yeah... I heartily recommend you do not buy this game, for the moment.

text_translate: All in all, this game is pretty good. But only in the form of the first act, it is the longest and best presented. The other two acts are very stifling. The second half of the second act shows great potential, but everything ends abruptly and figs understand why you did all this at all. The third act is full of kalych, I speedrun with a creak. Why only the first act? Because in the second and third you have to do exactly the same extras. quests as in the first. And for some reason, a couple of key plot scenes were redone, it is also unclear. One feels Unreal Engine - a thousand and one bugs (parkour with a gap under the map, parkour as a whole is completely broken, stealth works every other time, NPCs teleport behind their backs (minus heart and stealth), AI likes to hang and stand in the aisles (also minus stealth), people sit in the air next to benches, etc.). Gameplay, storyline and in terms of pumping, again, only the first act. In the second, there are a lot of jokes that can be fooled and turn the character with endless stamina and hp, but everything stops abruptly and the act ends. It turns out that really useful opportunities open up only at the very end, in contrast to the first. There is also a lot in the game, there is a LOT of running back and forth, especially in a kilometer from the shelter from which you are doing fast travel. If in the first act it was tolerable, then in the rest it was already tired, especially when you already did it all in the first. Plot, as I have already said and will repeat myself, everything ends literally in the first act. Because in the third, after the credits, we are shown the same scene where you just make a choice, what will happen next and that's it. Perhaps something is revealed there in the 3 DLS that I have for this game, but she strangled me too much that I did not go through them and just questioned them in order to find out if there would be any progress in the plot or not ... And it was not, this is either a bold hint at the second part, or think out for yourself what is happening there. The only pluses are: the lore of the game and what is happening there, but as such there was no progress on it; Well, the music, the music is just excellent in this game (a fictional band, some tracks are slowed down and fed to a vaporwave); well, and a live action video that is shown and played throughout the city / speakers in the form of Uncle Jack. If there is a 2 part, then I'm waiting, but only for Arthur. It was no longer interesting to run in absolutely the same locations and do exactly the same thing. Arthurka van love

text: - Small variety of attacks, almost no combos - On many bosses you're supposed to just mash left click - Multi staged bosses where you have to kill them 3x and there's no checkpoint, so you always reset to start - Cheap boss attacks that deal 75% of your hp in one hit - Ranged attacks have aimbot, you have to perfect dodge - Special enemies, who can die 10x and still come back to life - You're stuck with a basic katana, that's it - Your unique prosthetic tools run OUT OF AMMO - Sad and depressing story, plus now if you die, you make NPCs suffer - Graphics are nothing impressive, 15 Gb download says all - You are the poorest samurai, one weapon, basic attacks - Auto targeting enemies based on who you look at, it takes time geting used to and turning it off doesn't work + Japanese voice acting with english subtitles + Stealth is a viable option and makes your life easier + Proper mouse and keyboard support This isn't quality game that people would expect by From Software, no character customization, locked gender, almost no RPG elements, no interesting weapons to use, boss fights don't feel fair. Even when you do beat crazy bosses, you don't get the feeling of accomplishment of anything, it's just Yay, boss is dead. There's so far not a single boss that I've liked to fight, unlike DS3. Open world bosses can have 1 life taken down by sneak attack, so you undermine the whole premise of epic boss fight. And you have to do this, otherwise you'll be facing them with ton of ads when you die to their unblockable combo. Especially samurai bosses show how lackluster is our character. You go through the game with basic left click attacks and block, there's parry but only for thrust attacks, sometimes it doesn't register and bosses randomly switch to the same telegraphed  whirl attack, which you can't block.  Bosses have interesting, complex combos, while you literally use basic left click attacks and try to time your blocks. It's honestly a disappointing samurai game, about sad life of a low life warrior, who's seen by all as traitor and literally drains life force out of those around him when he dies. There is no redeeming qualities about this game, that would make me recommend it to people. Buy Nioh and have some actual fun or go back to Dark Souls to enjoy your time.
