text: Absolutely horrible. I don't know how you butcher such a simple concept so badly. This is pong, yet somehow the controls are confusing. The tutorial says hold down the shoot button to charge a shot, but after that my ship just starts charging and shooting random shots independent of my controller inputs. I'm assuming there are some kind of game mechanics that are at work but they don't explain anything so I have no idea what's happening. It could just be the lag because for some reason the game responds to controller input really slowly so maybe my shots are just so far behind the actual button presses that it's creating a complete disconnect between my inputs and the actual action. The only other player in the game has a firm grasp on it however so he keeps beating the ever loving crap out of me. This game concept was already perfected 50 years ago, all you had to do was put a coat of polish on it and market it with a basic level of competence. How you screw that up is beyond me.
text_translate: I'm gonna be reviewing this on gameplay mostly from someone who really liked ins2. The optimization issues are apparent, performance isn't what it should be and i had to do some fixes to get it to stop stuttering. This is covered in every other review though and also wasn't entirely gamebreaking for me. Main issues I have are with the gameplay.  I had high hopes for the game, it was promised to be ins2 but with bigger and better mechanics in basically every way. Staged reloads, vehicles, etc. Sadly, it didn't turn out how i expected.  The gameplay just doesn't feel like the old game, Ins2 was at its core an arcadey shooter with realistic elements while this game is nothing like that. Ins2 was realistic in many of its mechanics but ultimately had pretty fast and accessible gameplay. This game is slower and is argued to be more tactical, but all that means at the end of the day is more camping.  Camping is not something i have a huge problem with in games, i play plenty of other FPS games and milsim games and don't have an issue with camping on its own. Ins2 had plenty of camping but also plenty of opportunity to rush if you were good enough. The open maps of this game combined with insurgency gameplay mean you usually have to decide between going down a camped corridor or the open, which the previous game lacked with its more well designed small maps. The open maps which were supposed to improve on the game lack the design of the last, and simply aren't as fun. Thats what it comes down to, fun. Even when i went 7-0 in a skirmish round and managed to revive my team as the last man standing i still wasn't really enjoying myself. Without fun why play? This game has some great features, audio, graphics, and promise. Without the fun element i can't suggest you buy it. Also, match making sucks compared to community servers, especially when it dumps you out every match. (Sorry for the repost if anyone recognizes this, review got glitched and couldn't be seen publicly after i refunded the game).

Graphics for 2019 3 out of 10 Management - 4 out of 10. We couldn't even copy it in Civilization and Heroes of Might and Magic, it is much more convenient and advanced. Plot - 4-10 There is a difference between fantasy and fantasy. This game is about fantasy. Delirium is not called fantasy. Playability - 1 out of 10. From the beginning you force yourself to play and understand this game, spend 20 hours on it and realize that there is no plot here. The game asks you to complete the same game 150 times with slightly modified victory conditions. In total, we get that free games on your phone, 10 years ago, are much more fun and interesting! I bought this game based on user reviews! Don't repeat my mistake!

text: Do not buy this game anytime soon. Why? I'll tell you Pros: - Career mode is a big improvment. - Animations are good. - Academy  Cons: - Wrong Kits (White kits for ODI and T20s). - Wrong Stats (Displaying First Class, List A, T20 stats for Test, ODI & T20I respectively. - Can't get past the main loading screen. - Randomly crashes. - Have to choose the line up again and again  in career mode. - Stats for international cricket are not available in career mode. - A bug where game gets blurrier. - Umpiring errors. - Graphics are meh. - Commentary will make your ears bleed. - Game is poorly optimized and runs in borderless windowed mode. Game will stutter from time to time on my 1060 and i5 3550 with 8 gigs of RAM.  - Max resolution is 1920x1080.  Devs don't give two ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• if you are having any problem. I was having an online issue in DBC 14 and I contacted the devs and this is what I was told  . It's pretty much the same support for this game too. Right now I'm stuck on the main screen and can't get past it. I paid $50 for a game that I can't even play atm.

text: I really wanted to like this game because it looks like an upgraded stronghold 2 but after playing it everything that should have been better is actually worse and everything that should have been the same is also worse. The graphics in general are ok but when you play the game the world just looks bland with little colour, the voice actors aren't anywhere near as fun as in 2, the UI is smaller and less inviting, placing buildings is more annoying to line up and manage space and some of the terrain doesn't look any different from the places you can place buildings but "Can't place that there me lord" in a less entertaining voice and when i did the first two levels of the economic campaign unlike stronghold 2 each level you start over rather than each level building off of the castle you built in the previous. also i had no idea what the story was so far because the audio for the comics is separate from game audio, i had even tried turning game audio off completely and the comic that explains everything was still too loud for me to understand let alone tolerate. All around i think you would be better off buying the stronghold collection for a cheaper price than this, you'll get stronghold 1, stronghold 2, stronghold crusader, crusader extreme, and legends for 29.99 full price rather than just one game that somehow isn't anywhere near as good as any one of those for 32.99 full price. Based on the reviews it might even be better to pay more money for stronghold crusader 2 for 44.99 but i haven't played that one yet so I might be wrong.

text_translate: Generation Zero was a breath of fresh air and showed an immense amount of potential at first. It's a great looking game with good and enjoyable game-play that is quite similar visually to PUBG. It seems like an immersive and great atmospheric game when playing alone, however that's quickly ruined as the game starts you with a fair amount of medical supplies but no way to craft them later on. Without a way to craft medical supplies and the enemies getting tougher and stronger rather quickly the immersion is broken by having to respawn repeatedly without medical supplies, leading to an even quicker death every time after that.  Before getting into the core problems, this game has a lot of polishing and what seem like bugs that take away from the game. Bullets visually create the same sparks when hitting a surface, as they do when hitting a robot. Some times you'll waste your ammo hitting the robot only to realize the object it's behind has an absolutely massive hitbox, which is pretty common occurrence. Usually this ends up with the player dying as ammo is valuable at the beginning, and every second and shot counts as enemies are charging towards you. This however isn't the same on the enemies end as a lot of the time bullets will clip through large objects near the sides and hit you, as if the bullets own hitbox is way smaller then the radius in which it can damage you. The biggest downfall of this game is the terrible design decisions that it has going for it, mostly in relation to the crafting system and equipping items. While at first you notice there is a crafting system and get excited in what things you can craft, you quickly come to realize the only thing you can make with your supplies it is clothing that provides a 1% or 2% bonus to a stat such as bullet resistance. Clearly that's pretty useless when a robot can rip apart half your health bar within a few seconds, or just leap at you to almost instantly kill you.  Equipping items isn't that bad but you're only allowed to place your items on specific slots. You have 2 primary weapon slots and 1 secondary slot that shares both your pistol and melee weapon. You're unable to put your pistol or melee weapon on anything except button 3. This though isn't much of a problem in the end because there isn't an opportunity to use it with the enemies detection range. This together makes resources more scarce, and enemy drops don't help the situation either. Larger enemies do significantly more damage, and require significantly more effort to take down as expected, but don't actually drop more then normal enemies, just rifle bullets for example instead of pistol bullets in low quantity which can usually be found quite frequently around the map.  In the end I wouldn't recommend this game except maybe on the current 60% off sale as these are core design decisions on a game over a year old and almost certainly won't be changed. While it might be fun at first, unless you look up gameplay and feel like this is a game you would want to play, it probably isn't worth the average 4, to at most 30 hours you'll spend in a game you bought for 25$.

text: First of all, i am a huge fan of the Baldurs Gate/Icewind Dale saga and i loved playing Pillars of Eternity. I supported and crowdfund the PoE II project, having high expectations. Unfortunately for me,PoE II did not deliver the goods.  Apart from the beautiful graphics,physics and sound effects, everything else felt rushed. Main storyline is too short and simple(in comparison with the original PoE),i found the game buggy at the beginning(it has improved with the patches) and glitchy(minilag and few glitches). Obsidian took a huge gamble with the pirates setting/naval combat/exploration and that was essentially a bad decision. It looks great for the first 20-30hours but then it gets repetitive and plain boring, for a game like this where you are gonna play ~200hrs it is a bad feeling after all. DLC policy, they should have included these levels in the main game or try and produce a decent expansion. PoE gets White March(at least 40hrs gametime and alot of new stuff) which is awesome and here we get three overpriced DLCs (very short,less than 20hrs combined).   PoE was the worthy spiritual successor to the CRPG era and people loved it. It has a story,it has a villain,it has a castle with a 15-level dungeon,it has a beautiful expansion. PoE II has no soul,has no true villain,has less content,less interesting quests,less everything.  P.S. Interesting facts,if you look at my playtime and you wonder, in PoE there is always something to do and i finished it 4-5 times with different characters, in PoE II almost half the time is travelling with your ship or walking ashore/inland and doing nothing. Plus my total body count/enemies defeated in PoE was around 4000 and in PoE II only 2500. Thanks for reading this and if i rate the original PoE(after patched and expansion) with a well deserved 90/100, i cannot give more 70/100 to PoE II

text_translate: Only On Playstation

Ever since i was in my early teens i always admired MMORPGs and wanted to try out...all of them pretty much, or if nothing, at least the most famous ones. Aion was surely on that list, as i heard a lot of things about it, but i never managed to play it until certain 5.0 patch part, few months before 6.0, and it somehow remained on the end of my list. Then, it seemed like somewhat casual MMORPG, with a lot of quests, but it also felt like it was missing a lot of interesting PvE things and exploring. Still, in that 5.0 patch i managed to have some fun, and there were quests to do, even if it didnt seem like most interesting game ever. I played up to level 12 or something, and it took me like 2 hours or so back then, since there was a lot of quests. I quit it so i can play something else, since person i played with wasnt that interested and thought i might come back later a bit. Few months later 6.0 arrived, and i decided to try the AION again, more seriously this time, from the start with new character. The classes didnt change, there are still 6 basic classes which evolve into one of 2 paths you must choose at level 10, 11 of them, considering bard class has only one path. Leveling became extremely fast now, you could get to level 10 under 30 minutes, everything was sped up and parts of map were cut off. Choosing the path is bad as it used to be, you get no introduction to your skills during those first 10 levels, rather you simply have to make a random choice. After picking the path for my class, one of the worst experiences in MMORPGs began. The quests in this game are so extremely linear and with 6.0 update every possible quest that could've been cut off to speed up the leveling has been cut off. You will find only few 2-3 side quests in each village and continue off with main quest. However these main quests had such ridiculous design where you'd have to enter a solo dungeon which is played for over an hour and you get a new one every 5-10 levels. While most MMORPGs offer you rewards to improve your weapon and interesting side quests, leveling in 6.0 system made me feel like someone was constantly pushing me from my back to level up as soon as possible, not to enjoy the game, but rather to become another server slot filler in it. I've barely seen 5 different players as i was leveling up. Maps looked somewhat interesting but game doesnt offer any quests that take you on a nice tour to explain it, rather tedious quests that focus on one small part of the map. This keeps getting worse, not only since for rewards you get only equipment on every 10 levels, but because game forces you to go through dozens of mobs (which take extremely long time to kill), and the useless wings you have can only be used on very rare special parts of the map where you can fly. I reached level 56 and i still havent seen a single mount in this game, and maps are quite large to walk all the time. The game offers you one option though, which is to drink "Transformation potion" which gives you huge boost but at same time turns you at weird looking furry monster or undead skeleton, depending on the potion (good job spending all the time making your character). These potions have legendary versions which offer boosts like +40% speed +35% attack +15% attack speed and much more with different buff combinations which are HUGE buffs and will make you even twice as strong. These potions are of course, very expensive as well , and have cash shop option for purchase. I've reached level 56 somehow through sheer curiosity and test to my endurance i suppose, and i really cant see myself playing much more, maybe in instances of 20 minutes and playing on and off, just so i could see how alive the endgame is, and that is if there really isnt anything else to play. Even the towns are so extremely filled with so many useless NPCs that have names above them to give you a fake illusion of other players being there. Whatever Aion used to be, it surely isnt this game. This is an attempt to make a very blatant cash cow game, and while there are many of those games, they at least try to cover it up and sometimes offer fun events and rewards for players.

text_translate: Returned for a refund. The basic concept of the game sounds like fun and the key functionalities are mostly implemented, but that's unfortunately pretty much everything that's positive about the game. The game is currenty in version 3.something, and 4.0 is planned as the release version. I found that hard to belief when I fired it up for the first time. Everythin about the game looks like it was made by 3 guys on a budget in one weekend.  The negative user experience starts with the main menu screen, which looks bang on like it came from 1998. Then you'll want to remap the keys. There's an option for that, cool. What it doesn't tell you, though, is that some keys have an unadvertised hard-coded funcionality in them, and while you can map the said button, the new mapping doesn't override the hard-coded action. So when you're in the game and you press 'R' to move forwards, the 'force respawn' function kicks in and you'll just die. There's no way to obviously tell which buttons are hard-coded and which are not, so you'll just have to find out by trial and error. When you actually make it onto a server and start playing you'll notice the character models which look like they're from 2007, only that they are animated like they're from 2002. The various weapons are fun in theory, but then you'll pick the rapier and see how the character is holding it like a hammer and swinging it like a tennis racket, and you'll really feel like a pirate in the sense that you'll just want to drown your sorrows in a bottle of rum. Then there's the actual combat. It could be fun, but the clunky feel of the controls, the stiff and minimalistic character animations and the less-than-optimised network code again make it feel like you're playing a low-budget FPS from the early 2000s, so it's not really particularly enjoyable. So yeah, good effort but the game is clearly just an early prototype still. The idea is good, so maybe I'll check back later, like in 2022, to see if it has finally been developed into a fully functional, quality product.

text: ‚òÖ ‚Äî 3/10 Ladders are more dangerous than any enemy. I really wanted to like this game but after having the game bug out on me three times on three different ladders leading my character to aimlessly slide through the world, passing through walls, and then getting killed by enemies because I couldn't turn the camera anymore just ruined it for me. The game does have nice visuals as well as sound design and I also like the idea and setting of it but after running into the same bug and having to restart the game three times in a matter of not even an hour of playtime, I simply didn‚Äôt feel like trying to continue anymore and quit, deleting the game.

text_translate: An extremely mediocre puzzle. And, what a shame, its problem is not in the concept (with proper refinement, it could be very much even nothing) Its problem is in the devil-may-care level design. Unfortunately, they are designed in such a way that you can get the coveted 3 stars in 2-3 times fewer steps than given by the author. And such methods are pretty obvious, they are not the fruit of some complex mental research. The music is pretty annoying and there is very little of it. As a result, this puzzle has nothing to hook on. For fans of brainwashing, it will not work due to its total simplicity

The unimpressive (by today's standards) graphics aside, it is the camera that ruined it for me. None of the angles seemed quite right, it responds slowly to player's movement and doesn't allow to rotate around at all. Maybe it would've benefited from some kind of "spring mechanic" where you change the angle with the joystick for a brief moment, then it returns to the default angle when you let go. Also the possibility to accurately choose the distance to the player model would've been nice.

text_translate: Letter of Complaint    Before i will start i want to warn you that i have got more than 1k of a game experience and was a Supreme in ranked games.   To whom it may concern,    I am writing to express my disappointment with the game called "CS:GO", which I bought 3 years ago.   I feel compelled to write to you in order to describe the problem, which started to spread months ago and it seems that it wont stop spreading until the community of this game wont stop playing it anymore.   First of all, i want to describe minor problems, which i have got in this game and it is relations between creators and community of this game. The second problem is with hitbox system, which is absolute disgrace for shooter with tournament level. And the main problem is the community, which is like an impolite 12 years old fat kid with cheats. This is a cancer of CS:GO, which kills the whole attractiveness and fun.   I strongly recommend that your organisation to fix these problems.   I suggest to start some action with the community, for example, speak with it, update the game in the right direction, fix the hitbox system, create a good ban system and on top of that rebrand this game from low-price shooter for annoying kinds to middle-price shooter with normal 12 years kids.   Forever yours,    Game Fan.

text_translate: Looks good in the videos but that's about it No Ultrawide Support Hard is a snoozefest- Reward me with instant death if I kill a green dude at point blank. State Feedback is rather boring - Needs more weapon trails, Clearer attack animations etc. I want to hear being ripped to shreds when i get too close or hit. Weapon design - Secondary Fire is really eh to the point why even add it? Swapping between weapons takes to long in hectic situations. Let me Melee lunge and instantly change to shotty, plz Map design and natural progression imho let the game down the most, The graveyard maze and all the rooms looking the same made it super boring to look at / fight in. Game banks on nostalgia to much and fails to delivery any of the good bits.

text: Shoppe Keep isn‚Äôt going to be a game for everyone, in fact, I dare say that it‚Äôs not going to be a game for the majority of players who give it a once over. By and large, Shoppe Keep does a lot of things right, but the biggest problem here is that for everything it gets right, there tends to be much room for improvement. This is made apparent from the get-go. Shoppe Keep is, as you might have guessed, a shopping simulator that takes place within the confines of a magical environment. The best way to describe this game is by picturing any given RPG you have played, many of which come with merchants and shops that you can utilize to buy goods. Now picture swapping the role of the hero, for the role of one of those shop owners. First and foremost, it takes some time and perseverance to understand how this game works, despite the tutorials that are on offer. The overall aim of the game is to successfully run and manage your very own retail business. You begin the game with very little to go on, which is a standard for most management games. You have little gold and all but a small room to evolve into something meaningful and grand. You‚Äôre able to customize your shop keeper using a fairly decent pool of options, and although not as in-depth as expected, it gets the job done nevertheless, and then from here on out you‚Äôre ready to start expanding. Not only will you be managing your business, but protecting it too, which means slaying any greedy thieves that come sniffing for free loot. Obviously, the core focus within is to be as appealing to your customers as can be. It‚Äôs pretty bleak from the onset simply due to your limited space and wares, but before long, you‚Äôll be completing quests and unlocking a wider set of goods. This, in effect, will broaden your reach. That, however, is only the tip of the iceberg. You‚Äôll also need to ensure that your shop is clean and accommodating, at the same time as managing the upkeep of your stock and stock appliances. There‚Äôs a lot of things to keep on top of, but to the game‚Äôs credit, it never feels overwhelming thanks to the well set pace. Everything is manageable so long as you sink into a routine and stay on top of your needs. One issue that I think will be the make or break point for those that invest, is that the game doesn‚Äôt do a fantastic job at feeding you into the task at hand. Sure, there‚Äôs no shortage of information that will help you get by on a week by week basis, but the game really would have benefited from a more structured tutorial. Instead, you‚Äôre expected to read tiny-text filled sheets to get a firm understanding on what‚Äôs what. Due to the fact that Shoppe Keep is such an original and unique experience, some more thought and consideration for newcomers would have been a wise design choice. It doesn‚Äôt help matters that the first hour of play is about as exciting as watching a hamster on its wheel. NPCs will walk past your shop as though they‚Äôll catch a plague upon entry, forcing you to be more upfront and in-their-face, defeating the immediate appeal of the game in the process. First impressions are vital, but Shoppe Keep takes quite some time before the true magic of the game begins to pull through. The core functionality of the game and its progression system works well enough to get by, but the ugly UI and botched controls let this down in the long run. Management games are taxing enough by design, so to have to wrestle with poor control layout and confusing UI, is a nuisance to say the least. The developers have clearly put some thought and effort into ensuring that this game works well on console, but the end result lacks refinement and polish. It‚Äôs a shame really, because on the flip-side, Shoppe Keep is a very intriguing experience that will quite literally swallow hours of your time. The constant need to bulk up your shop and defend it from unwanted individuals is entertaining enough in itself, and is certainly worth the price of admission alone. I quite enjoyed the structure of the progression system too, which typically sees you completing quests and leveling up to achieve better merchandise. You can eventually hire help to take care of the mundane tasks, freeing you up of some much needed time to truly focus on business growth. This is one of the most important factors of the game. How much did you buy said item for? vs. How much you will sell it for? Set the price too high and you‚Äôll find customers going elsewhere. Set the price too low and it will take forever and a day to make some money. The balance of play is solid, and all of these systems and mechanics go hand in hand to produce a compelling business affair. Shoppe Keep goes much deeper than I was expecting, but again, I was constantly drawn back to the poor controls and shoddy UI. Furthermore, the loading screens are pretty excessive. Hopefully Shoppe Keep 2 will remedy this, if it does indeed make the hop to console like its predecessor. Visually, there‚Äôs not a lot going on here. Textures are bland, character design remains repetitive, and everything else in between is equally as such. CONCLUSION Shoppe Keep is a management game that delivers depth, innovative gameplay, and decent functionality. The problem, however, is that it doesn‚Äôt come without a fair share of issues; lengthy loading screens, poor UI, and wonky controls. This would have been a much better game had the developers spent more time optimizing and fine-tuning it for console.

A√ßƒ±klama: Maalesefki Valve Corporation bu t√ºr oyunculara kar≈üƒ± VAC (Valve Anti Cheat (S√∂zde)) adƒ±nda ve antik √ßaƒüdan kaldƒ±ƒüƒ±na inanƒ±lan i≈ülevsiz bir yazƒ±lƒ±m kullanƒ±yor (Bir inanƒ±≈üa g√∂re Adem ile Havva nƒ±n Cennetten kovulmasƒ±nƒ±n ardƒ±ndan ilkel ara√ßlarla olu≈üturduklarƒ± ve D√ºnyadaki vah≈üi hayvanlara kar≈üƒ± kendilerine g√ºvenlik saƒülƒ±yan bir sistem). Maalesefki hile kullanan soysuz s√ºr√ºs√º kolaylƒ±kla bu g√ºvenlik yazƒ±lƒ±mƒ±nƒ± atlatƒ±p rekabet√ßi ma√ßlarda rahatlƒ±kla hile kullanarak diƒüer oyunculara kar≈üƒ± √ºst√ºnl√ºk saƒülƒ±yorlar. Bir hile yazƒ±lƒ±mcƒ±sƒ±nƒ±n s√∂ylediƒüine g√∂re VAC (Valve Anti Cheat (S√∂zde)) √ºzerinden ban yemek √ßok sa√ßma imi≈ü. Kullanƒ±cƒ±larƒ±n ve hile yazƒ±lƒ±mcƒ±larƒ±nƒ±n kendilerine g√ºvenleri olduk√ßa y√ºksek. Hileyi kullandƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± hissettirmediƒüin s√ºrece sorun yok √ß√ºnki OverWatch adƒ±nda bir oyun i√ßi uygulama sayesinde ≈ü√ºpheli oyunlarƒ± bizzat izliyerek ≈ü√ºpheliyi inceliyor ve bu oyuncunun hile kullanƒ±p kullanmadƒ±ƒüƒ±na karar veriyor ardƒ±ndanda oyluyorsunuz. Buda hile kullanƒ±cƒ±larƒ±nƒ±n √∂n√ºne k√º√ß√ºk bir engel koyuyor, RollPlay engeli ... Valve Corporation t√ºm steam community sinin uyarƒ±larƒ±nƒ± ve isteklerini, emeƒüi ile oyunu oynamaya √ßalƒ±≈üan kitlenin uyarƒ±larƒ±na, isteklerini ve isyanlarƒ±na kulak asmƒ±yarak oyuna yeni hile yazƒ±lƒ±mƒ± getirmektense daha fazla para getirebilecek yollara ba≈üvuruyor. Yeni kutular, yeni eldivenler, yeni bƒ±√ßaklar, yeni silahlar ve rozet gibi ara√ßlarƒ± tasarlƒ±yƒ±p fahi≈ü fiyatlarda satƒ±≈üa sunulmasƒ±nƒ± saƒülƒ±yor.Bu sayede steam i√ßindeki sƒ±cak para akƒ±≈üƒ±nƒ± hƒ±zlandƒ±rƒ±yor ve i√ßeriye giren ve istenilen miktar paranƒ±n dƒ±≈üarƒ±ya ka√ßmadan yada sƒ±cak para sistemine girmeden direk eline ge√ßmesini saƒülƒ±yor. text_translate: This game is great... not really... actually, because you NEVER GET IMPOSTER...

text: AT LAUNCH: - The game is locked to 30fps - Its graphics are pretty terrible compared to other games that I can run on my PC at a solid 60fps. - Key rebinding rebinds the key but doesn't allow you to use the new bind. (I accidentally unbound shoot, so I binded it to Mouse1 again but now I cannot shoot. Which is kinda awful. Also rebound M to map, and I'm now stuck in the Tool Tips thing that you get about maps right after you get Lincolns car. This is why I only have 30 mins playtime.) - No binding of controls to extra mouse buttons such as M4, M5 (side buttons) and no binding availiable for side scrolling buttons either. This is quite frustrating as I do bind almost all of my mouse buttons in most of my games. VERDICT: - Don't buy it now, it's a broken piece of crap. - Refund it if you have bought it. - (Re)Buy when the FPS cap is fixed and integral parts of the game (such as keybinding) actually work. - The ability to not be able to bind anything to the same key makes the controls for the game a bit clunky but definately not unplayable.

Fine until the Light Lord. Big paywall at that point, with out days of grinding. Heals faster then you can do damage to. Resist is way to high as well. Hard to poison or stone. No way to cancel out the healing, like in the previous one, nor has any weakness to exploit. The randomness with in randomness is not really needed either. Portals used to be good, but now you have the locked portal and two random ones, where one of the random one is often the same as the locked portal. Worst still, if you get a "healing fairy" from a random portal... more often then not, you are not healed, but poisoned, flame or other status effect, with no healing. Previous games was well balanced, even for free players. This one is not. Glad to save my money on this one.

(my internet connection was stable) ... or several lags like two or three seconds where you can gaze on a freezed game...   OR, even better, you try to escape and get stuck as soon as you climb up the roof of a car... so you can wait ... and wait ... and wait ... you¬¥re save from the enemies, can¬¥t get killed from your team mates and the only option that your team can play/win the round is ... DISCONNECT... but this time you have to leave by yourself ... so I can say ... from 10 Rounds of the 2nd Mission I tried, only one succeed... and 8 times was the reason an cheap early pre alpha game, released because of greed without propper testing and developing Is is worth it? Is it worth to launch an unfinished game and destroy the good reputation of former nice publisher? You are killing your own fanbase with this pile of s**t!

text: Unlike other reviewers, I actually quite enjoyed the color palette and overall visual aesthetic.  I dare say that was my favorite aspect of this rather short and unfortunately cliche detective romp with a pretense of cosmic horror.  The look appeals to my nostalgia both for 80s era games, and the 80s aesthetic in general.  Nonetheless, it did make locating certain key objects on screen challenging without using the feature to show all clickable spots on each location. Unfortunately, the rest of the game's features are mediocre at best.  The character images seem to be all (or at least mostly) stock.  While most more or less fit into the game, there are at least a couple that don't feel like they quite fit the role the developer slotted them into.  To make matters worse, a couple of the stock images are familiar enough that any sense of immersion was lost.  The music is all stock as well. The writing matches the character models perfectly (which is to say it was shallow).  The story was quite linear and cliche, with few twists or surprises, no development of atmosphere, and no depth or poignancy.  The characterizations all were quite one-dimensional.  While none of it was bad, per se, none of it was particularly good or memorable either. Needless to say, the story in this game fails to come close to Lovecraft, and indeed (like so many others) misses the whole point of what makes most of Lovecraft's stories both endearing and horrific.

text: For the first couple hours this game sucks because your ship is destroyed and you need to repair it. Finally, 15 hours into the game you realize that there is no progression in the game because it is endless. Meaning, even if you explore a thousand planets, there are still billions more.

text_translate: I'm very saddened to say that I can't recommend this game. While I understand that the dev made it with a big passion, the game has way too many problems that keep it from being enjoyable. The whole game concept is incredible. The idea is great, but the execution and presentation are bad. I'll try to talk about some of the main issues I faced, that kept me from enjoying the game, and therefore, asking for a refund. First, and one of the main issues this game has: The Sound Design. It's absolutely TERRIBLE. I've seen better sound design in free flash games around the internet. Every single sound on the game is terribly bad and underwhelming, with no impact. The ships, the thrusters, the weapons, the hits, the explosions... Everything.. They all sound bad. It's hard to put into words, but I can't feel any sort of immersion or joy.  Imagine getting a hail of bullets from a destroyer on your small fighter and all you hear is a faint "tud" as if someone is tapping their finger on a tent. I'm not exhagerating. That's exactly how it sounds. Sometimes I barely even notice I'm taking hits, and when I look to my 'HP', oh hey, I'm almost dead.  I don't know how he thought those sounds were a good idea. There are TONS of good examples of how to make a great sound design for a space game. While I do approve someone trying to be original, I can't aprove if that original is bad. Second, the controls. Do you want to use SHIFT as your After Burner? Alrite, you can, but first you must check an option that turns off EVERY SINGLE key involving two buttons (like shift + Q, alt + W, etc). If the option is checked, the game won't recognize SHIFT as a single input, but rather just an input to combine with another key....... WHY? The mouse and scroll feels like you're controlling a port of a console game that has a cursor controlled via analog stick. It has a weird "weight" to it, and it's terribly uncomfortable to control. Imagine playing a RTS with a weird sensitivity mouse, that no matter how much time you spend messing around with the sliders, you can't get it to move like a proper cursor on every single game. Yep, that's what you'll have to deal with, as the game turns into a RTS of some sorts, when you get to fleet command. The graphics... I won't ask for ultra detailed graphics like Everspace or Elite Dangerous. Simple graphics can work. But the artstyle and visual effects on this game are just.. Too underwhelming. The whole visual presentation doesn't sell too much the idea that you're on the vast space, with infinite stars and all stuff, flying on your ship. The visual effects from weapons and explosions are bad. Not as bad as the sound though. Nothing is worst than that. But anyway, I've seen older games with much better graphics and visual effects than this one. And while this issue is not enough to keep me from enjoying the game, it does sum with the others. And the list goes... tl;dr, this game has way too many problems in key aspects of the game, that ends up making it a bad experience. I'm sorry if I sound like I'm bashing on your hard work, but I'm just being honest, because I care about this game.

I had many expectations for this game but unfortunately it is just a shadow of civilization 5. It has less elements than its predecessor, it lacks in strategic depth and it has nothing new to add to civilization 5 from the gameplay point of view.  I have the feeling that I am playing a very nice civilization 5 mod not a new game that I bought for 40 euros

text_translate: PC:E ist ein Spiel, auf welches ich lange gewartet habe und mich freute, als ich es endlich runterladen konnte. Damals war es noch ein Early-Access-Spiel und hatte noch einige Probleme... Jedoch ist es seitdem noch nicht viel besser geworden. Es wurden einige Dinge ge√§ndert, die die Balance und diverse Bugs betreffen und es ist tats√§chlich etwas besser geworden aber es ist nichts Nennenswertes, da immer wieder neue Probleme reingepatcht werden. An sich hat das Spiel Potenzial, doch die Entwickler scheinen nicht zu wissen, eben dieses richtig umzusetzen. Details: + Bessere Texturen und Animationen als der Vorg√§nger (Primal Carnage) + Neuer Gamemode + Es kommen ein paar neue Dinosaurier- und Menschenklassen + Viele neue Skins und Ausr√ºstungsgegenst√§nde in neuer Klassenanpassung, welche im Kamp "gedroppt" werden - Hitboxen sind zum Teil noch etwas fehlerhaft - In-Game-Shop hat KEINE In-Game-W√§hrung, sondern verlangt Echtgeld - Items werden unbeeinflussbar zuf√§llig verteilt - Zum Teil unausbalanciert und zum Teil "zu stark ausbalanciert", so dass manche Klassen schw√§cher sind, als sie sein sollten - Serverbeitritt ist manchmal nicht m√∂glich durch Spielfehler - Steuerung erscheint etwas schwammig Ich pers√∂nlich bevorzuge und empfehle somit jedem, der mit diesem Teil (wie ich bisher auch) unzufrieden ist, den Vorg√§nger (Primal Carnage) zu spielen, denn dieser ist, verglichen mit Primal Carnage: Extinction, spielbar, auch wenn er ebenfalls noch etwas verbuggt ist. text: The games name is pretty much what you get. An Early Access Casual Indie Action Survival game. (involving a Project being Explore (ed)). Concept: - Does exist but changes every now and then Direction: - Nobody knows but it's probably related to Early Access Casual Indie Action Survival Artwork: - Same as Direction Mechanics: - Same as Artwork The bottom line: The developer started with a concept of some sort at the beginning and artwork fitting the game, over time it translated into a game that forced too many changes on you in terms of artwork, direction and mechanics, while the main release pipe equals the store front advertising, the experimental build pretty much doesn't fit that, due to drastical changes and experimenting a lot. That doesn't add to trust or confidence regarding this game and i simply cannot ask you to support the game as it is right now, especially when the current main pipe build is very different from the experimental branch. Don't get me wrong, the developer is not ignorant and he does care and listens and incorporates based on user feedback as much as possible but the keypoint remains, the game (or in this case the developer) doesn't have a long-term vision and concept for this game and that keeps it being stucked somehow in a loop of direction and artwork changes. A note to the developer: Focus on a concept - Add to it - Improve on it - Stop experimenting Afaik there should have been multiplayer in this game already but the experimenting got into it's way. Don't make it another game losing it's heart, being stuck in Early Access forever.

text: Sobre o Call Of Duty Black Ops III: Aumentaram o pre√ßo no Brasil, o pre√ßo padr√£o era R$129,90 e agora se encontra por R$159,90 (A vers√£o deluxe, que cont√©m o season pass, n√£o teve o pre√ßo alterado e permaneceu nos R$199,90). Que adicionar a vers√£o padr√£o + season pass separadamente vai pagar por R$ 259,80 A otimiza√ß√£o est√° pior que o Batman Arkham Knight e Assassin's Creed Unity. O game t√° injog√°vel, tem drops absurdos de FPS, quando voc√™ est√° na base, por exemplo, na sele√ß√£o de miss√£o, upgrades, customiza√ß√£o e companhia, chegou a consumir 13GB de RAM. Possuo um i7 4770k + 970 G1 + 16GB e n√£o consigo jogar o game de modo satisfat√≥rio. Pode parecer piada, mas os requisitos m√≠nimos dele, pede 6GB de mem√≥ria RAM.  O game nas primeiras horas de lan√ßamento dava crash ao iniciar, pode parecer piada, mas d√° o mesmo problema do beta, o exe para de funcionar, na hora consegui jogar ele deixando a steam no modo offline. Mal otimizado ao extremo, o game mal utiliza a GPU, chegando a usar em m√©dia de 50% dela (todos os jogos normais rodam ela a 99%), consome mais que 4GB de VRAM no ultra (incluindo filtros anti serrilhados), chegou a consumir mais de 9GB de RAM, isso, em FullHD hein. Frita o processador e deixa o uso dele louco, tal hora usa 30% do processador e do nada pode pular para 86% de uso do mesmo. Att: Jogo recebeu diversos fix, ajeitando v√°rios problemas dele, inclusive o engasgo do game, algumas partes √© poss√≠vel notar isso, mas apenas nas cgs ingame O game est√° totalmente dublado em portugu√™s, e n√£o economizaram palavras nos palavr√µes. Por√©m n√£o existe legenda para a vers√£o em portugu√™s, e voc√™ n√£o pode jogar em ingl√™s com legenda de outros idiomas. Se voc√™ gosta de jogar em ingl√™s com idioma e/ou legendas juntos, vai ter que baixar um adicional de 3.3GB, a n√£o ser que sua steam j√° esteja setada diretamente no idioma ingl√™s.  Sobre a vers√£o censurada do game √© apenas poss√≠vel no game com o idioma em ingl√™s, no portugu√™s o arrancar dos membros e palavr√µes est√£o inclu√≠dos sem pr√©via escolha. O gr√°fico √© bem satisfat√≥rio, √© bonito sim, as texturas est√£o bem melhores que os outros jogos, n√£o chega a ser nada espantoso, mas a parte facial dos personagens eu achei de um n√≠vel √≥timo (pros personagens principais) O game possui split screen para 2as pessoas no mesmo computador, possui sistema de level e ranking, para melhorias do personagem seja na campanha ou multiplayer. E no total 4 pessoas jogando simultaneamente (campanha coop online), acho daora essa possibilidade, apesar de curtir jogar jogos nesse estilo sozinho mesmo. O game possui 12 miss√µes no modo campanha, e 5 dificuldades, incluindo o modo realista (que com 1 tiro voc√™ bate as botas) Uma novidade do game √© que voc√™ luta agora contra mulheres, sim, elas est√£o mais presentes no dia a dia, seja no gaming da vida, e em outras fun√ß√µes. No menu principal voc√™ pode selecionar o seu personagem para um homem ou mulher, com costumiza√ß√£o de rostos (n√£o chegam a ser diferentes, √© mais uma varia√ß√£o do mesmo rosto com alguns detalhes adicionais como cor de cabelo, etc) A an√°lise est√° sujeita a modifica√ß√µes ao decorrer da jogatina.

text: From a somewhat decent little platformer,   fell to a plain mediocre game. Back one year ago, this game had pre-defined levels that were fun to play just to pass time. Now it has some badly designed generated levels. I often found myself playing the same level and it gets boring very easily. I'd suggest the devs go back to the previous stage of the game and improve it. + The Challenge levels are pre-defined and were fun to play; it took me a short while to complete them all, but they weren't that bad; - Generated repetitive levels, gets boring in a short while; -Lacks initiative, there are only 2 types of enemies, 2 types of traps and 1 weapon; -Boss levels are random aswell, many people complained that they had to play dozens of stages to finally reach a boss area; -More soundtracks were welcome.. I would recommend   only if you really can't afford any other platformer out there. Even then, you would probably put it away soon. The gameplay lacks many features and I see no real reason to replay the game after you have finished it. Personal rating: 30/100 - Awful

text: "Northern Crusades" was released in 2011,one year after "Real Warfare 1242" and it has the same exact engine,same exact UI,same exact maps,same exact units,same exact graphics and the same exact gameplay.It even has the same crashes and bugs as the first game. Here is my review of the first game with a link on how to fix the black screen that occurs on nvidia graphic cards   . Even if the game is the same as the one released in 2010,it still has no siege maps.Manevouring units is still clunky probably because the terrain is too rough or badly scripted.Clicking on one spot may send units on the other side of the map for no apparent reason. Unlike the first game,"Northern Crusades" has a campaign story and map similar to Total War games.On this map you can only control one general at the begining.You cannot control the larger strategy of states only this one particular general.The campaign has a bland storyline and RPG elements like hiring troops,upgrading them,looting enemies after they have been defeated and equipping units with items.Also some items give a morale boost to your troops. This game builds on the first one and is actually better but still feels like a Total War game from 2005 in Alpha stage.

text: NO MORE MOVE NO MORE MOVE NO MORE MOVE How to play this game: - Play match 3 rounds as normal until about level 100 or so. - Load new level - Hope RNGesus gives you enough chances to actually beat the level. - Lose hope, because of course you didn't get a good set up. - Move one crystal (maybe none at all), then get the ever-present "NO MORE MOVE" message. - Wait for a new set of crystals to fall into place. - Make another move or two. - "NO MORE MOVE" - Repeat ad nauseum. Oh, did you actually win? DON'T GO TO THE MENU!! Go to the next level first, or your completion won't be saved. /facepalm I'm not a huge fan of match 3 in the first place, but this grindy, luck-based feeling I get from it sucks. The first 50+ levels were fine, but nothing really special. Then, once you get far enough in, the level design makes it nearly impossible to get matches anywhere, and it is super frustrating. I keep at it for the completionist in me, but man do I hate myself after every session.

text: This DLC is now just about USELESS thanks to Gearbox cutting the OP levels from it and requiring you to be level 80 to access 95% of the content from THIS DLC that was previously available. How is this even legal? Context: Prior to around June 2019 the "first Ultimate Upgrade Pack and Ultimate Upgrade Pack 2" DLCs raised level cap to 72 and allowed you to play through the "challenging ‚ÄúRaid on Digistruct Peak‚Äù map offering even more high-level play" by repeating progressively harder challenge runs from level 72 to OP8, effectively making the level cap level 80 in terms of gear, but skills were still capped at 72. Gearbox wanted to sell Commander Lilith DLC and apparently felt this made it awkward for them to sell a new level cap of 80, so instead they gutted this DLC that people HAD ALREADY PAID FOR and made it next to worthless, as all OP levels now require you to be level 80, which requires you to buy the new Lilith DLC. This is exactly how you burn customers and interest them in sailing discounts for your products, Gearbox.

text: Update: Gonna thumbs down this one. Somehow my saves got erased and my game doesn't go past the intro. So yeah ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• you telltale. As I'm a hardcore fan of Telltale games, thought of giving a review for the first episode. Note that this review isn't biased to the dev.  Since I'm a big GoT fan , instantly got this, was not worried at all about the story and the decisions. The story is in parallel with the tv show especially , since the characters, voice acting and some elements of the story are alike. You represent House Forrester, atleast to a certain degree and you won't be confined to one character like in TWD or TWAU. This is somewhat similar to 'The tales from the Borderlands' as the story is given from multiple perspectives. It's a good take by Telltale games imo especially since you know the gravity of your decisions and how they'd affect you as another character. Moving on to the plot. The story so far , atleast in the first episode was top notch and I got to say I was pretty skeptical about the game after seeing how Polygon gave it a 6.5. But just for now the story has been great. The way it shows how major effects of the book/show affect minor houses is brilliantly executed.  The decisions are playing a major role like they've played in the previous Telltale games. But this time around like Totalbiscuit said, it's solely not emphasizing on dialogues and etc, but rather small ones like "taking this" or "not taking this". The weight of your decisions are felt by your own playable characters as they have to go through them. This game thus far have been the best Telltale game with hard decisions for me. It's not only that, they manage completely to nail the grim nature of of GoT. This game isn't rated R, it doen't certainly have boobies, but holy cow it's violent. In a good way which is what Game of Thrones is all about. Moving on the the gameplay, the devs have used the same gameplay elements they have used in previous games, if you are looking for a button smashing, sword blazing GoT, THIS ISN'T THE GAME FOR YOU. Point and click mechanics and quick times events have been in the game so far with nothing new gameplay wise. The voice acting was excellent, especially since they were done by some of the original cast. Not to mention some of the scores from the original series. However the only thing I have against this game is the new graphics they have used. It doesn't look bad, but it seems a bit muddy and unpolished in a way. At times you can see some of the textures blur for no reason, that's something Telltale should work on. And the weird animations of characters can get clunky at times. Improvement from these two departments would have made this game a much better experience for consumers. But then again no one plays Telltale games for graphics. Overall this game is pretty damn good. You should note, if you haven't seen the TV show nor read the books, be sure to do either of them. Because this game is heavily based on the what has already happened in the series so far. Hopefully Telltale would release other episodes rather quickly than what they did with TWUA but for now if you already have the game, you'll be playing it a multiple times to see what could have been if you had taken another choice. I'd give it a solid 9/10. However this may change with the coming episodes. For now it's an excellent game. A MUST BUY FOR GAME OF THRONES AND TELLTALE FANS!

barebones game, poorly desinged and optimised. then charges 10-25$ CAD to fix a part of the game, to get the complete game so far youll have to dump 120$ (and more in the future!) of your own hard earned money into a game programmed by lazy devs - and it shows they are lazy, i am a dev myself, go take a look how their coding is done, looks like a 5 year old can do better. at this moment, i CANNOT recommend this game. text_translate: P  A  I  D    M  O  D  S

text: Ok... just a HUGE NO. Please, PLEASE stick to the original script. I mean it. It should not be a copyright issue I guess, so just use the EXACT SAME. It was great. So use it. Please do. I mean it again. Do it. I look at this game in comparison to the original Gothic and it really SUCK. Details now: Maybe people already said that a dozen times, but Marvin (aka Nameless) should NOT be talking to himself like a whiny little girl in very first CUT SCENE! His looks is OK I guess, though I`d prefer not a blond, but rather dark\brown hair. And thats my complains after first 5 mins ingame, OMG... My own ophinion, and I think alot of people will agree - use original voice actors lines, dont change the script at all, just pay the original people again a little, like 10% or something, but give us back THE ORIGINAL VOICE ACTING. I still love the gothics vibe and its mostly about voice acting, bout 20-30% visuals. Please listen to this at least a little, choose voice actors VERY close to original if its impossible to use original lines. This is MAJOR. This WILL give the feeling of the original game, its how peoples memory works. And remove those damn cutscenes... and the very first one with this Snappers... a HUGE turn over for me. Use the original bandits "welcome". Barrier world is infested with criminals, animals should be dangerous, but hey, do you really think its the main threat? Orcs and bandits, that is. And please for God sake, use as much from original game, as you can, Scripts, models, voice acting.... thats what is all about. I know you will ignore this message, like many others, but at least try, THQ Nordic. I appreciate the fact that you guys try to revive the series, I really wish you all the best and hope Gothic Remastrered will be at least as good as it was back then. Please dont ruin it.

text_translate: It's a very fun game but.. There's so many black screens (although no crashes) on cutscenes which is very annoying. Apart from that, the game itself is very fun and easy to master just like any other musou games.  As of now.. I can't give my full recommendation on buying this game as the bug is super annoying for me.  Therefore I'll give this game a negative review to even out the positive review, so the devs will see what they need to do.  Will change my review after the blackscreen bug is fixed.  Minor note: no 2k graphics support and no cloud saves.

I will continue playing and update my review if it gets any better but at this point the game has been freezing up and glitching so hoping that will change and achievements are super easy, like I have seen 10 or more drop at one time. Still this game has nice potential. Hoping to make my review positive in the future. Keeping my eye on this one. <3

text_translate: Im Grunde genommen ist das Spiel soweit gut, wenn man es mag immer von null anzufangen sobald man gestorben ist (Rogue-like) Sonst ist die Grafik und der Soundtrack sch√∂n. Auch das Gameplay ist f√ºr zwischendurch mal gut, aber frustriert mich schnell. Hier wird per Karten gek√§mpft, auch gegen Bosse. In einem Gesch√§ft k√∂nnen Karten gekauft oder verzaubert werden. Aber auch nach gewonnen K√§mpfe erh√§lt man neue. Neue Mitk√§mpfer erh√§lt man ebenfalls nach einem siegreichen Kampf, auch Bosse k√∂nnen aufgenommen werden. Stirbt aber der Held ist der Kampf sofort beendet und ein kompletter Neustart ist erforderlich.  Eine Taverne heilt f√ºr Gold, ist nicht genug verf√ºgbar muss man immer halb angeschlagen in einen neuen Kampf gehen. Auch gerne mal so in einen Boss Kampf. Das sind nervige Sachen und eine Strategie muss entwickelt werden. Teilweise ist der Schwierigkeitsgrad schwammig, manchmal wirkt es so als sollte man sterben. Die Karten sind auch nicht 100% klar ausgedr√ºckt und ein unverschuldeter Fehler f√ºhrt zum Tod. Ich mag Rogue-like √ºberhaupt nicht und man muss sich hier reinh√§ngen und richtig drauf einlassen, um zu bestehen. Nur im Angebot ein Test wert. Insgesamt eine neutrale Bewertung. text_translate: "OMG a negative CS:GO review, this guy must be on LSD" Yeah, its a negative review and here¬¥s way: With about 1k hrs of game and LE as the highest rank achived i have to say, its really sad but i just can¬¥t thumb up this review ! The game itself isn¬¥t bad ! Good graphics, many game modes and a pretty good gameplay (the only issue i would say are the spawns in deathmatch mode) ! But we can¬¥t judge a game only by good graphics and performance and what rly ruins this game is people, his community ! 1. CHEATERS Its sad to see a game with so much competitive potential full of hackers ! I can¬¥t play 1 single competitive without finding a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•*ing cheater ! The point is, every game has cheaters, but in a normal game, they get banned, but ofc we talking about the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• CS:GO where banning accounts giving the opurtunity to cheaters to create another accounts and make steam profit even more is more important than providing players the best gameplay possible. What really disgusts me is seeing professional players geting VACban, it only shows up how terrible Valve is  i mean.... if they take so long to catch a pro with cheats imagine just a random player, this only reflects how bad and primitive Vac security systems are ! VAC should improve in 10000% their security systems ! Cheaty twa*s make this game unplayable (mainly in the weekend when daddys and mommys allow their kids to play) Every night i pray " Pls VAC, start ban the IP adress and not just the account" but they just don¬¥t.  You want solutions ? Ban the IP adress for a couple months, if the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• keeps hacking ban for 6 months, if he hacks a 3rd time ban him for a year. I can ensure you people would grow some balls and start playing legit, but ofc, once again, this wouldn¬¥t be proffitable for Gaben... so they just don¬¥t do it :) "Oh NB, you are so ignorant, what about Prime accounts?" Prime Matchmaking ? In other others "The biggest bull*hit i ever seen" In matter of fact, i played about 20 compt. since i joined prime and i find even more cheaters than in normal matchmaking. And just to make you see how awful the situation is you now can even find cheaters in casual and deathmatch games just because its fun for them... I can¬¥t even remember the last time VAC did a ban wave, i believe was more than 1 year ago... "On NB but you¬¥re not talking about overwatch" If you expect to ban some1 in overwatch it would take a lifetime to ban all the current cheaters, and im not ever considering they will create new acc¬¥s. The concept is pretty decent, however is far from enough. 2- SMURFS  Smurfs are those skilless noobs who are not good enough for their own ranks, so they just get a 2nd account and start killing inocente silvers and gold novas to fell better about their own lack of skills, silvers and golds who can¬¥t rank up due this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•*ing inbreds ! 1/2 - THE 50% PROMOTION The both problems listed before are even worse when steam makes those 50% promotions on CS:GO ! Cheaters and smurfs just take the chance to get a 2nd account for half of the price ! I just gave up playing 1 month after these promotions (1month and im being optimistic) 3- SH*T COMMUNITY / KIDS / RUSSIANS (east europe scum) This game is just surounded by kids hacking and screamming like reta*ds, russians (By russians i also mean ukrainians, polish and all those fu*king sh*t hole countries in east europe, habitated by ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•), i also "hate" Turkish people due the fact of 90% of the turkish i play with are hacking ! I rly have nothing against russians, im a half-communist, the point is i live 4500km from Russia, betwen my country and Russia there are more than 10 countries, including Spain, France, UK, Germany, Italy .... i just don¬¥t understand how the hell i still get russians in my servers ! And don¬¥t come with the "Use server picker" bull*hit cuz we all know that doesn¬¥t work. Pls steam.... just get the russians playing in russian servers ! Russians with russians, normal people with normal people, That would be a good start to make this game playable ! 4- IBERIAN SERVERS This isn¬¥t exactly a global issue, but its a few thousands people issue ! In Portugal (where i live) and Spain ! The iberian community can¬¥t just get a server with ping -70 ! Its just ridiculous playing with people with pings at 40/50 ! I rarely win a knife fight cuz the people who i fight with have ping lower than mine and then i get stabbed like a bitc*, even if its only 20 difference it matters (mainly in knife fights when every 0.001 second is important but we can see some delays with fire guns too) This only supports even more my argument of getting east europeans playing in their server and west europeans playing in western servers. Even tough in the last months i could find some decent iberian servers, the problem is iberian servers have Spanish players and there are only to types of them: the ones who hack, and the ones who su*k, the last one is about 70% based on my personal experience (the other 30% are cheaty twa*s. I rly think providing a good scurity system is the most important thing to do here ! Its an emergency ! I already gave up on this game, with me more toushands did and more toushands will, hope Steam and Valve take some drastic mesures before this game gets srounded only by 13yo fanboys to play it.  PS: Im sry about any english mistake you guys may find, english is not my main language. PS n¬∫2: Yes, Flusha was aimlocking, no metter what you believe, thats the truth.

text: BottomLine at the Top:  A perfect example of why I wish Steam had a neutral option for recommendations.  Although the graphic style is nostalgic and it has some decent music, this game is mostly a mess and should be avoided. ------------------------------------- Pros ------------------------------------- -My favorite feature of this game, by a far margin, is the fact that you essentially have infinite save slots.  This is such a pet peeve of mine on modern games that only feature a few save slots.  Its save interface is very clunky (basically just opens up a standard windows save window in game that does not mesh at all with the aesthetics of the games interface) but the fact that you can make as many saves as you want is something I just loved.  It was def needed to, as there are multiple ways to die and there are both timing puzzles as well as the opportunity to miss items that you needed from earlier parts of the game. -I enjoyed the music in this game even if it did get repetitive. -Graphic styling holds up mostly well.  This was definitely a Broken Sword clone.  Animations have some rotoscoping. -It‚Äôs kind of funny picking fights with random people/pulling your gun on everyone.  ------------------------------------- Meh. ------------------------------------- -Has autosave but only one autosave slot.  If you missed something and didn‚Äôt save it‚Äôs not always easy to rely on the autosave to bring back to a point that you need to get what you required to complete the game. -No Steam overlay integration.  Can't take screenshots. No steam achievements. ------------------------------------- Cons ------------------------------------- -So, I think one of the biggest issues for most people is going to be this games jaw dropping racism/homophobia/and misogyny.  I won't go into pointing out the specific events, if you play they are hard to miss.  There is a big difference between risqu√© inappropriate humor and whatever this game has.  I'm not sure if it‚Äôs a translation or cultural issue (I believe this game was made from a Polish developer) but even for the late 90's when this game came out this game has some real tone-deaf moments.  I mean I used to work in construction and some of the stuff that was said in this game even made me blush.  I myself do not fall into any of those groups that are insulted but I can easily see how some players could be very offended.  -Voice work is terrible.  Actors sound professional enough sure, but I think another reviewer described it best by saying they all sounded "mechanical".  Dialogue is clunky and boring, especially Jack's description of items in his environment.  He literally just lists off what the things are with no other description. Also, I know Jack is supposed to be this acerbic character, but it sounds as though his voice actor is just actually mad himself that he has to be in this game.   -Voice audio recording quality is poor.  Game seems to have some kind of issue whereby it sounds like voices are coming from as far left or right as the speakers allow.  No positional audio for where the characters are on screen. -Control scheme is awful.  No in game documentation of how to open up inventory or how to talk to characters.  Often times an object that can be picked up won't "take" right away.  I usually have to move Jack or place my cursor back and forth and click a couple times before it finally recognizes what I‚Äôm trying to do.  Having to use the Function keys to open inventory is dumb (supposedly you are supposed to be able to click on Jack to open inventory, but I never got that to work.)   -Dialogue is really clunky.  It‚Äôs mostly translated from its originally Polish fine, but I think the original writing was just really weak. -The story is dumb.  I really lost interest halfway through and it felt like a chore to finish. -Some real "non-sequitur" scripting events (for instance you can't open a gate and now a can of grease randomly appears in a different location that you would have no idea to go and check to see if it‚Äôs there) -Poor proofreading, noticed several misspellings. -Poor "tone".  Is the game supposed to be a semi-serious film-noir style detective mystery?  If so, why does it awkwardly break the fourth wall by referencing things that don‚Äôt take place in the story's era? (i.e. referencing Miranda rights which didn‚Äôt come about until the mid-60's.  Or making a joke about reality shows... -Which by the way, that reality show joke was made in a bar.... with multiple tv's...that you only reached after going through a bunch of catacomb style screens (that were mostly empty of things to do) ...I really don't know what was up with that whole thing, but it was really bizarre. -Several other reviewers have given this negative reviews due to game crashing bugs/errors.  I only had this happen once after dying once in the harbor.  Not sure if it‚Äôs something that has been mostly addressed with patches or if I was just lucky. -Game messed up the order of icons on my desktop after alt-tabbing or closing the game.   -Not an easy game to pick up again if you haven‚Äôt played in a while.  Easy to forget what you were doing or what you need to do. -Definite examples of irritating pixel hunting. -Weird mechanic in this game of there being lots of "junk" items to pick up.  Not sure what the purpose was there.  It‚Äôs not easy to have to program in all these objects that you ultimately do nothing with and serve no purpose.  It also makes it easy to stay stuck as you can't do the old "click everything on everything" brute force attack to progress in the game when you don't know what to do.   Final Thoughts:  Overall I can't recommend this to most players. If you have a nostalgia for this era and style of P&C game...just go replay a Broken Sword game.  If you absolutely must try every P&C game out there, definitely wait for this to go on sale I think I picked it up for less than a dollar and if I paid any more than that I would have been pissed... For some examples of good point & click games, go check out our P&C fan group over at the   !!!

This game is not only incredibly easy, but also incredibly boring. I played this game for a total of 12 minutes, I got bored after about 5 minutes. It consists of badly-animated monsters that make some 'scary' sounds running towards you, and of you easily killing them with some magical spells while trying to figure out what the point of the game is. In the end you are stuck with a... 'Boss' (a slightly bigger and 'scarier' monster) that is killed in 10 seconds. After that, you are stuck in the room in which the boss was, no way to end the level or something. Pros: Cheap (paid 0.2‚Ç¨ fpor it thanks to a -90% coupon) Has trading cards Cons: The game itself

text_translate: The game has become absolute garbage from where it used to be. They keep adding more "premium" ships and things that cost more and more money and events that quite literally take so much time that if you have any sort of actual life, you dont have a chance of completing... but dont worry... you can spend MORE real life money (quite honestly hunreds of dollars) to finish the event on time! Wargaming used to have an awesome game. And they have ruined it with simple greed. World of Tanks was the same way. Ruined by sheer greed. The game is super unbalanced and thhey keep adding more and more pay to win ships and neglecting older ships... such as Nagato, Pensacola, and even the Montana. With each ship they add, the older ships become less playable. The Russian line is simply littered with these type of ships that are pay to win (Im looking at you Moskva and Smolensk). Now they are giving a 95% discount for a starter pack... which only works if you never had an account. Your Normal WoWS account doesnt link with STEAM, so downloading through STEAM won let you play your normal WoWS account... hence why I have .1 hours on STEAM. Avoid this game like the plague. Wargaming has ruined the game to the point that its unplayable.

text: Still a meme after a year
text_translate: Whilst having an ambitious story, the uncoordinated art style and generally predictable characters in 'By Moonlight' tainted the experience. You're given the illusion of choice whilst going through a linear story line, with an unsatisfying ending. The story attempts to present endearing characters, though is unable to present them as anything other than two dimensional . The choice system implemented results in no real consequence, and the 'bad endings' often took an odd thematic turn, leaving an unpleasant taste. However, the game shines with clever dialogue and an exciting premise, albeit dissapointingly never fully developed.  When dedicated, the game presents a playful and fun vibe, genuinely enjoyable, though this is diluted through a weak story line and somewhat lazy art style. Considerable care has been clearly invested, yet this ultimately fails to pay off as a worthwhile experience.

text_translate: I got the game free and got 100% in under 1 hour, it's okay for that. I would not pay money for it tho. Starts lagging after you draw even a tiny bit too much, is not really a challenge at all and furthermore just a lazy, rather buggy port of a mobile game.

text: Bohemia - cancer of a publisher that can be put in the same bag as Electronic Arts. Avoid their products. 2 years later update - ok, they finally decided to pick up a pace with updates, probably due to player numbers plummeting drastically. I've got mixed feelings about a new map. It's something refreshing but I feel like their resources could have been used elsewhere f.e. survival mechanics. Ok, survival. Damn I wish they implemented more of features like complex medicine (injuries, diseases) and ways of tending to those. More emphasis on hunting and foraging rather than visitng towns for few cans of peaches. And here we come to another survival related aspect: looting town and cities. These should be swarming with zombies which seems obvious contrary to woods and remote areas. A trip to city should be either a team effort or stealthy approach (if going solo) with high risk/high rewards. All in all I still enjoy coming back to Chernarus/Livonia from time to time but nowhere near as much as I did back in the days when the game was being actively developed. I still hope it will actually deliver it's full potential one day and I will see this great universe thrive again. Don't ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• it up Bohemia. Don't try to turn it into PUBG on oversized map. For now it still stays negative with a spark of hope.

text: Absolutely not for me. The client won't load bms, 2 available but unplayable.
text_translate: The game itself is amazing, good graphics and makes you feel the adrenaline of each situation (taming attacking etc...). It plays grate, it looks grate, there is plenty to do and see... i have 900 hours and still there is stuff i have never done/seen. I have been in big tribes to small tribes and solo in  official and private servers. The thing that killed the game is the "Ark Travel": this feature allows other tribes to travl to another ark full equiped and wipe it. Obviously so in a few minutes, all the progress that u might have done its gone. As a friend of mine said " 90% of the time your fine but then a big group of players from a diffrent server comes and starts killing at random... with the reson of 'we just want to make fun'"   And its not a one off thing,it happens time and time again, you lose all your stuff and you never see them again. I want to recommend this game but this abouse on players doesn't allow me to do it. The grafics are fabulous, the game play is even better.... but the constant greefing is the game breaker, and the devs seem to not listen to the playes on this isue. But I recomend it to a solo game but it isn't much fun. You can take a private server but for one to four friends it might be expensive. Grafics 9/10 [some bugs and glitches] Content 10/10 Stability 7/10 [conection problems, crashing problems] 85% of the player base 10/10 [most are nice people that just want to have fun, trade items.... or just go fishing, its the 15% that make the game  unplayable].
everything you hear about it.... is all true

text: I absolutely loved Far Cry 3 and having heard nothing but praises from everyone about blood dragon i decided to go ahead and buy it.Thing is wheather you will like blood dragon or not is solely depending upon on how much you are willing to overlook things.My biggest problem with BD is that it uses all the same mechanics from FC3 which is really annoying since it causes a disconnect,FC3 was pseudo realistic fps and encouraged realism but BD is the exact opposite.I also felt weird playing the game coz it essentially is reskinned version of FC3 although some of you may not have an issue with that. The asthetics were very appealing as everything is neon filled from the enimes to the dragons to the buildings everything lit in neon colors.The comedy especially some of the dialouges are really hilarious.The outlandish over the top settings with robots,dinasours is really refreshing.The length is pretty short can be completed in 2-3 hours and if trying to get 100% can be done in 5-6 hours, this might be a turnoff for some people but i absolutely love short games as time is an issue as we get older. Overall i have pretty mixed feelings for FC3 BD, i gave it a negative because of the huge disconnect between the game mechanics with the gameplay for example the hostage resuce missions are really a pain in the arse coz you have to be stealthy but its not enjoyable at all becuse of the way the mission is setup its nearly impossible to be not detected not to mention the fact you are encouraged throughout the game to blast your way though.I'd say if you want to pick it up do so when its discounted or maybe skip FC3 is a far superior game in every single way grab that if you dont already owe it.
