text_translate: I really want to like Star Wars: Squadrons; when it was announced that this was mainly going to be a multiplayer space ship only helm'd by MOTIVE the same people responsible for the excellent star wars dogfight mode in Star Wars Battlefront 2 - it was a dream come true! AND with the ability to play in VR and using a joystick? Do you realize how exciting all that sounds?  Well for $40 you best get it on EA plays and here's why:  1) Two modes, small maps, 5 v 5.  Now you might say: "I don't see the problem, MOTIVE/EA is trying not to burden the server" that is the lamest excuse that i might ever heard of or any sort of reason not to bash this game. But you see just the idea of large scale space battles sounds awesome! That was the best part of EA Star Wars Battlefront 2 was the space fighting. However what we are reduce to is: Team Deathmatch, and Fleet Battles which is essentially a tug of war mode which pits two capital ships, two squadrons and you are essentially fighting back and forth until which either Capital ship explodes or time runs out.  And that's it. Yup, there's no 10 v 10; no Battle Royale (shockingly this game could've totally gotten one), no escort defend missions, no co-op side gigs; nothing really. Just two modes, small maps, 5 v 5. 2) Discrepancy lobbies As i mentioned at the start of this review you can play via joystick; why do you need to know this? Well in line with odd TTK placements; it's basically a death warrant if you decide to play with anything else BUT a joystick. It's an automatic pass if you don't have one; period. Even with adjustments to controls with a controller and/or mouse-keyboard. It also doesn't help that you are place in lobbies with higher ranking pilots that have a better loadout; sure the game recommends tutorials and such. But not the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, unranked bot lobbies (which should be your number one thing first to test the waters really). Buy a joystick, don't use mouse & keyboard, controller. You will regret it and rage a lot out on this game. 3) Customization is limited (Unless you grind for the renown and parts) to upgrade and fit your ship and pilot.  You can't REALLY customize a whole lot, the alien races of the Rebel Alliance are locked behind renown, you can't change hair styles, colors, nothing really. Just templates which reminds me of EA Sports Madden titles of today. That goes double with the helmets, outfits, ships, etc. Which is understandable but when you really break it all down - you begin to see that cracks and realize: "They could've done this a whole different way" and i agree 4) Technical bug and other issues Besides the top three issues apparently HOTAS joysticks are having issues, as well as refresh rates, supposedly TTK is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•'d and players are constantly abandoning the lobby. Hopefully this gets resolved quickly Is there any ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• positives?  Well the fact that you can fly cockpit mode in the iconic Star Wars ships of the Alliance and Empire is really freaking sweet! Even better in VR. The sounds, visuals are really great - as for the story; it's okay; it's your typical "Let's do a story but really the main meat is the multiplayer"  Also for closing statements; playing solo is rough in multiplayer definitely get your "own" squadron WHICH BY THE WAY THERE IS NO SQUADRON-CLAN TAG IN THIS GAME; SERIOUSLY?! You can level up through fighting bots but only in Fleet Battles which is an odd choice Overall more modes are sincerely needed, and for the love of god; i know this was a decision made already; but seriously increase the lobby size. And in addition add more cosmetic options you have bare bones here that could've been worth the $40 or heck even $60! But sadly, you missed the mark. Whether or not it's out of pettiness or spite who knows; do the research, wait and/or invest in EA plays and try the game out before committing to that $40 price tag.
This game is absolute ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• garbage. biggest waste of time and money

text: Such an awesome game in so many ways from suspense,team work,dope guns and equipment and it all works fairly and the game play is smooth and tactical,but in and among all that greatness lays the core issue stopping this game from taking off and that is matchmaking and the ability to train and still have fun at lower levels. Im level 30+ and even though i have a fairly good selection of weaponry and gear the game is just unplayable after level 25+ since once you pass that threshold youre now paired with all the level 100's since there isnt any kinda level wall after 25. it makes no sense its like giving a solider one week of training and sending him to the front. You go from having a fun time under 25 then you start getting your ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• pushed in. And i do want to go on the record of saying yes ive killed a few 100's and i know you can still stand a chance depending on location/situation but so much of the toe-to-toe fighting in this game relies on your gear choice and current hunters levels.  Simple level bracketing would solve this so quickly i dont care if im playing against 20-30 levels higher then myself i can handle that sometimes but tossing me to people who are 70+ levels ahead over and over just gets boring. The levels 100's fear losing nothing and are tough af so it forces you into a play style whether you like it or not since you'll just get your ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• pushed in otherwise. When matchmaking is fixed this game will be amazing until then i just dont have much fun playing a one sided game.
text_translate: 10/10 Masterpiece. - IGN

Path of Exile is an excellent game, but requires a significant investment of information and experience to become familiar with the game systems in order to just do whatever you want and be successful with it. If you are a newer player you must resort to using the game's forums to find a build that works at the current time of playing - and the website is very cluttered and disorganized when it comes to the forums.  Furthermore, you'll need a plethora of 3rd party websites in order to enjoy the game with an optimal experience. Beyond that, the more interesting mode of play are seasonal challenge modes that last for several months, where your character and possessions are sent to a nonseasonal mode that lacks any of the challenges from season, resulting in very stale and boring gameplay. It is worth noting that the customer support is incredibly slow, I've had a bug that has disconnected me every few times I hit a loading screen (which is incredibly often in this game using portals) - and it has taken over a week in the past just to get minor problems resolved - whereas this one is gamebraking (literally rendering the game unplayable). Lastly, this game used to be excellent for the F2P model, but now there are so many things you need to put into your very limited, free stash, that the handful of "bank" space they give you is by far unacceptable now. I would advise a minimum purchase of 20-40 dollars of ingame currency to expand your bank tabs in order to have an enjoyable experience. Overall, if you don't have an issue crawling the forums and referencing 3rd party websites several times an hour, investing $20, and diving deep into the poorly arranged/categorized build section of the forums, then this game can have a deep, fulfilling and rewarding experience. To me, the investment is just too deep of time and money to recommend this game as a F2P game to anyone new.

text: It feels like the devs had a cool concept (a puzzler about changing gravitational directions), then very quickly realized they didn't have many ideas for actual puzzles to make with it. Because of this the game is rather short, and not really interesting to be honest. You've got cutscenes trying to convince you there's more depth than I felt there was, and a new game+ that's the same game only the puzzle keys are in minorly different locations. Another thing is while the game isn't really about platforming, there are a couple places that require you to jump from an edge at nearly the farthest spot you can go before you start falling off, which surprised me a great deal. Perhaps my frame-rate messed with the physics just enough to be noticeable there? Either way, I sadly can't really recommend the game.

text: This is one of those great games that just gets hindered by the game developer using old game mechanics and gameplay from older games [Layers of Fear] which not only rip you out of the immersion, but also become more of an annoying headache to sit through than it's actually worth. Observer is great cyberpunk detective game, it feels as though the horror was almost shoved into this game to make it more in the "horror genre" whereas instead they should have pursued a more organic psychological thriller theme instead.  The detective work and looking for clues in apartments, as well as uncovering what's really going on in the apartment complex is a real treat. The part that really annoyed me and pushed my limit on playing this game were the points in the game where you find a body or a person and connect into them to see their memories. Then the game stops being Observer and jumps right back into the stale and annoying gameplay of Layers of Fear. Why is stuff floating? Why is everything getting pushed further and further away and always has to have a long pitched squeal attached to it? It goes from a great and interesting detective game into another "Boo! Spooky Objects!" game and that really pushed me from enjoying the game into having to sit through monotonous lengths of these "super spooky" moments. They drag on and on, your character speed changes and you have to sit through uninteresting and useless information as well as meaningless and borderline incompetent gameplay, either to stretch the longevity of the game further, or to pass it off as a "super scary game".  Overall I was disappointed with the game,  I really thought it was going to a detective thriller about a man finding his son and uncovering the mysteries hidden within this apartment complex, but instead I got floating chairs shooting across the room, glitchy people moving across my screen, and loud and repetitive jumpscare noises that not only ruined my immersion, but my enjoyment of the game overall.

Unfortunately it doesn't seem like Mediatonic are serious about maintaining the longevity of this game. The new season includes only 4 new maps, 2 of which can hardly be considered new, and they couldn't even be bothered to commit to the supposed medieval theme. The older maps haven't been touched and the game is now an aesthetic mess. Unity's level editor is extremely intuitive and I expected far more from something branded as an entirely new season. They had a long time to develop a substantial amount of content, and their team is more than large enough for it. Programming 101 issues like players being able to use style tags in their names STILL haven't been resolved after months as well. This is a woefully repetitive game and if its developers don't have the ability to produce new content for it at a reasonable pace then it will continue to bleed players until it's a husk of its former self. I'm confident that the playerbase will be back to its pre-update numbers in only a couple of weeks. This is a really fun little party game, and you'll definitely get some enjoyment out of it if you purchase, but don't expect its success to last.

Let me start this by saying that the   is quite good. The fighting is solid, the campaign is... eh... it's a campaign, and the available multiplayer modes are mostly good. The only game modes newcomers will be able to (reliably) enjoy are Duels (1v1s), Brawls (2v2s), or co-op of the other modes and even that's questionable.  The reason is this: Gear stats, revenge, and environmental kills. If you disagree that's fine, you don't have to agree with me as this is subjective. If you'd like to refute these points, that's also fine but you are very unlikely to change my mind. All I ask is you read them, and if you choose to respond do so in a measured manner. In Elimination, Skirmish, and Dominion the stats on your equipment becomes active. This, at lower levels (I'd say lower than level 30 gear) makes very little difference in gameplay, most heroes of this level have pretty basic stats. But, when you get to higher gear levels (let's say 50+) you've made substantial changes to your attack, defense, or (most importantly) your revenge mode. Revenge is a mechanic that automatically parries all incoming attacks upon use, turns your parries into knockdowns, turns your throws into knockdowns, makes your attacks uninterruptable, and increases your attack/defense by a significant amount. This, in of itself, is not a bad thing. It is a very cool idea, and gives someone who's being attacked by multiple opponents a fighting chance. It is influenced by a number of stats: Revenge mode attack, revenge mode defense, revenge gain on defense, and revenge gain on injury. If you inflate any of these stats to a significant degree (especially the two revenge gains) you border on making yourself overpowered. The reason being that your revenge mode will now activate faster/be more powerful than your opponent's. This wouldn't be so bad... You can buy gear using real world money. Not only can you do that, you can also buy "Champion Status" that causes you to receive more gear after matches, more experience, more steel (currency), and get more salvage from destroying extraneous equipment. Yes, these things can all be ground out via in-game orders (daily missions) or repeatedly completing matches. If that changes things for you, that's fine, but it doesn't fix the imbalance for me.  Experience level determines received gear level, the amount of salvage you have determines how quickly you can level that gear, meaning that those who stump up the time or money for champion status have a definite advantage in these modes. Now, you might be thinking, "What if I want to play Elimination or Domination without gear stats?" Well... Ubisoft thinks you should play custom games, because  Alternatively you might be questioning, "What about that Skirmish mode you mentioned?" To answer that all I really need to say is: Skirmish is so badly broken that I don't know a single person who enjoys it (Yes, you probably exist and might even tell me you enjoy it, but at time of writing I've never met anyone who does). Skirmish is so bad that Ubisoft not only left it out of the open beta, but they felt they had to tack it onto their Elimination matchmaking to actually get people to play it. Also, orders that apply to Elimination can't be completed in Skirmish and vice versa. Notice how we're all the way down here and I haven't even gotten into networking issues? So let's open that can of worms too. There are no dedicated servers, meaning that you are forever on a P2P network. So the host's system gets overtaxed, their bandwidth is exploited, and (sometimes) when they leave the lobby shuts itself down, denying anyone in it gear, steel, and experience. Not only that but P2P networking on PC is dangerous. Both in the realm of cheating and information protection. Yes, there are likely safeguards in place. Yes, they could be close to (or completely) ironclad in some way. Now, as I've run out of things to complain about (for now), I'll do a quick roundup of bugbears both mentioned and unmentioned. So... uPlay... uPlay uPlay uPlay... You poorly performing moneygrab of a platform. To clue anyone who isn't aware in, uPlay only exists because Ubisoft doesn't like paying Steam to carry their games, just like Origin. Unlike Origin and EA, Ubisoft sells their games on Steam as well, with the caveat that you must install and run uPlay at all times while playing their games. It's buggy, slow, and causes their games to interact very poorly with the Steam overlay. In fact you can't use Steam to invite your friends to Ubisoft games, because the games aren't built to work with it (Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't, it's always seemed intentional to me). To put the cherry atop the poorly frosted and slightly burnt cake, the sex split for heroes is even. 3 male, 3 female, 3 that you can decide their sex. I can't be the only one that remembers when Ubisoft said it'd be too expensive to make two models in Assassin's Creed Unity for male/female assassins. In this game there are... 18 models that all have multiple gear sets, not counting NPCs. Yes. I know. Extraneous, but I still like poking fun at a corporation that doesn't respond truthfully to criticism. If you've made it this far, you have my thanks. Have a good one, and... yeah... I heartily recommend you do not buy this game, for the moment.

text: *REFUNDED* expected a Defence Grid clone, what I got was something that needs a heck of a lot of work, yes it's still in early access but the game looks like it was meant for the late 90's (UI looks horrible & placement of towers needs working on) [maybe make the towers even darker red if you can't place them at the place where your trying too, as it's very difficult to tell the difference at the moment] not something due out this year or maybe next. Still following to see if changes get made for next sale time.
text_translate: I've been playing on-and-off since launch, both through Steam and the ARC launcher. * The premium current starships are outrageously expensive. Outside of combo-packs, a top-tier ship costs about US$30. * Trying to buy starships is a test of patience. I bought a US$130 pack, didn't get the ships, and support had no ETA to a fix. After several months, they refunded me. * Trying to buy premium currency (ZEN) is also a test of patience. It took a week for the staff to approve a $100 purchase. * Trying to use paid-for ships is also a test of patience. I was locked out of one of my premium starships, with an error message saying "Unable to complete transaction: the price of the product has changed. Please verify the new price before purchasing." I reported it to support immediately, and it took them 35 days to correct the fault. * Bugs, bugs, bugs and more bugs. I'm talking about characters sitting through chairs, snapping and rubber-banding, wrong bridge crew showing on the bridge, characters with invisible arms and legs, uniforms missing pieces, quests that bug out and become unfinishable, and so on. I wouldn't recommend this game unless you are a huge Star Trek fan and have the patience of Job.

text: For a game that is supposed to be 1.0, I find it is only of the quality of a Beta or Alpha release. Pros: Lots of content and recipies Innovative crafting system Excellent soundtrack Cons: Laggy and buggy, requiring a restart to make it playable again No decent mapping system, sometimes I have no idea where I am going Poor lighting effects (see above comment) One revuewer said it quite well, this game feels like a generic space Terraria ripoff. (Yes, I know Terraria let them use a similar version of Skeletron.) I'll probably visit this game in a afew months to see if much has improved, but for now, I cannot give it a passing grade. 4/10

Jeez, where to start? I'll adress some of the critiques I've read in the reviews so far. Confirmed: - Looks unfinished. (boring menus devoid of ANY of MvC's usual flair) - Backgrounds are lifeless. (very untraditional for this franchise) - Music (Is there any? I can't remember...not a good sign) - Mechanics (gotta bring in the casual gamers, I get it) The Roster: I purchased Injustice 2, on PS4, which came with a very good starting roster and is only getting better as new toons drop. This game, the starting roster is ok, not great, not good, just ok. I'm hoping the toons to come may help this situation. No X-Men: You can thank lawyers and licences for this. As long as Fox Entertainment holds the movie rights to the X-Men and Fantastic 4, don't expect Disney/Marvel to allow ANY kind of promotion of those characters on their part. What may have gone wrong?: Disney's true face is begining to show as they begin to push their greed and ideologies on us all. My guess is Disney charged way too much to licence their characters. (Notice how Rocket Racoon and Groot are represented by their movie likeness because they aren't real people, whereas Gamora does not look like the actress who protrayed her...that would cost more than Capcom could afford.) My guess is the game looks like this due to Capcom needing to reduce staff (animators are always first to go), probably demanding lots of unpaid overtime, all due to Disney's greedy prices for their licences, all resulting in the lack luster quality of this product. Conclusion: I'll be keeping this game, but purley from a market research perspective. If you want a good game, my suggestion, play Injustice 2. It's great. It beats this game in EVERY category. This game is in NO WAY near worth the asking price.

text: This game completely spits on Dota's face, then throws it out the window and uses its scalp to pick up the glass shards. Do not go into this game thinking it's as strategic as Dota, this game is 5% strategy, 95% RNG. I thought Hearthstone was an RNG riddled game until I played this game, jesus christ, everything here is RNG'd: Heroes you can get(I've had 3 games in which i've ended with no lv 3s and my oponents already were on their 2nd), which heroes targets which, when they use their abilities, moving randomly around the map, items are random as well, the only thing that's not random is the uninstall button at the end of this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• of a game. Not to mention sometimes spells don't cast at all, i.e kotl starts channeling his spell and for some reason, it doesn't release. This game is riddled with bugs, glitches and overall bad coding. Jesus christ, RNG games are not fun but for the lucky ones only.

text_translate: I bought this game end of October and I was quite impressed with it. But after playing it for 500 hours it's somewhat important to write a follow-up after getting some experience. So, here's my first, early access review:  "After playing this game for over 80 hours, I can say it's quite infectious and addictive. The game is flawed, the optimization is awful and BattlEye cheat detection isn't perfect, but overall it's a game with an original idea and is worth playing and is worth your 30 dollars." And today, end of February I can say that there is more bs from devs, more cheaters and less useful updates. We're getting useless cases nobody asked for, like the Militia and Fever crates. Why aren't we getting more bans. A few days ago I got teamkilled by a Chinese guy because I had a supressed AWM. I check his op.gg and even after my report, he's still playing like nothing happened. Also, a guy fires 20 bullets at me with a SCAR-L from over 200 meters with a 4x, and even after my cheating report, he's still playing. Why aren't you doing anything about the reports Bluehole? Where's our region lock so we can block out players that have a desync and high ping advantage? Am I paying this much for my 250 mbps internet to get killed by a asian cheater in PUBG? F-ck you Bluehole and Brendan Greene for even trying to blame the players and not the cheaters and arseholes. When we get a region lock, I'll consider giving the game a positive review.

I'm gonna be reviewing this on gameplay mostly from someone who really liked ins2. The optimization issues are apparent, performance isn't what it should be and i had to do some fixes to get it to stop stuttering. This is covered in every other review though and also wasn't entirely gamebreaking for me. Main issues I have are with the gameplay.  I had high hopes for the game, it was promised to be ins2 but with bigger and better mechanics in basically every way. Staged reloads, vehicles, etc. Sadly, it didn't turn out how i expected.  The gameplay just doesn't feel like the old game, Ins2 was at its core an arcadey shooter with realistic elements while this game is nothing like that. Ins2 was realistic in many of its mechanics but ultimately had pretty fast and accessible gameplay. This game is slower and is argued to be more tactical, but all that means at the end of the day is more camping.  Camping is not something i have a huge problem with in games, i play plenty of other FPS games and milsim games and don't have an issue with camping on its own. Ins2 had plenty of camping but also plenty of opportunity to rush if you were good enough. The open maps of this game combined with insurgency gameplay mean you usually have to decide between going down a camped corridor or the open, which the previous game lacked with its more well designed small maps. The open maps which were supposed to improve on the game lack the design of the last, and simply aren't as fun. Thats what it comes down to, fun. Even when i went 7-0 in a skirmish round and managed to revive my team as the last man standing i still wasn't really enjoying myself. Without fun why play? This game has some great features, audio, graphics, and promise. Without the fun element i can't suggest you buy it. Also, match making sucks compared to community servers, especially when it dumps you out every match. (Sorry for the repost if anyone recognizes this, review got glitched and couldn't be seen publicly after i refunded the game).

text: As a level 1200+ who unlock all the classes and units.... The game lost its former self.  Everything is pretty much dumb down.   There's zero competitive-ness.  Classes are non-existant they made every weapon similar just different skill animations.  Looking for a bow that nukes everybody? sorry not in this game, looking for a sword shield tanker? not in this game they are squishy af its like their shields are useless. What really made me stop playing this game is the virus mail.ru that they want you to run when you play the game.  No thanks.  I used to be able to play the game with it perma block on my firewall now I can't. Yeah right. OLD REVIEW: As a level 400++ I can tell you this.... Lots of toxic players on this game but that is not what you should be concerned about.  The amount of losers in this game! if they whine to mycom and the devs, you get the heat and short-end of stick.  The losers will always complain about something, anything and everything, its quite pathetic really.  The losers gets rewarded while the winners get penalize.  If you're looking for top notch competitive game, then this is not for you.
text_translate: After a couple of trials at a play through on the   setting, due to previously read reviews, and miserably failing at least half of the quests I can only confirm that the developers haven't play-tested this game at all. I understand people who want to get 100% achievements, but if you can't run through the game without too much stress on the easiest difficulty, you need to re-balance the game. Make the easiest run, easy, normal slightly harder and then amp up the difficulty for achievement hunters, but keep that only on the hardest of settings. * Overly-difficult and annoying even on the easiest difficulty. If this is easy, I don't want to try anything harder. * English translation is atrocious and often times incredibly difficult to understand. * The artwork and graphics are generally ok, with the bright colour palette being the saving grace. * Music and sound effects are ****. No effort put in here at all. * Many of the quests such as "Christianity" are not explained at all, nor do they give hints of what you need to do while you're getting punished for 20 turns. Only after you've already failed them do you get a hint as to how to pass it next time... and then you get punished literally 7 times worse for a further 20 turns. * Way too many bugs just randomly popping up. * It has potential to be a fun and relaxing game, but not at this punishing of a difficulty. * The price is right, particularly on a big sale. I cannot in my right mind recommend this game to anyone, unless the devs fix the difficulty and get someone to proof-read and update the text. The explanations and guides (in-game or on Steam community section) need to be made available because the game's just not fun when it's damn near impossible.

text_translate: Pour moi, il s'agit du pire volet de la saga. La bouillie, sans √™tre inf√¢me, est indigeste pour moult raisons √† commencer par son sc√©nario de progressistes 2.0 qui donne envie de se taper le cr√¢ne contre un mur tellement les tranches d'id√©ologies multiculturelles canadiennes sont distill√©es sans aucune g√™ne. D√©j√† que dans les autres volets, √ßa a tendance √† me gonfler mais alors l√†...Pocahontas de Disney est moins consensuel. C'est vous dire la dose de gerbe qu'il faut retenir √† chaque cin√©matique... Pire encore que le sc√©nario, les informations √† consulter dans l'animus sur les √©v√©nements, personnages ou lieux historiques. Vous aimez l'humour insupportable √† la Marvel ? Vous appr√©ciez taper sur l'histoire des m√©chants blancs au profit des minorit√©s opprim√©es ? Cette rubrique, fruit de l'accouplement de Satan et Bilal Hassani, est faite pour vous. J'ai jamais vu autant d'orientation id√©ologique et de conneries rassembl√©es dans une seule et m√™me production. Au dessus, c'est soit l'Histoire Mondiale de la France ou les √©missions d'Hanouna. Pour toutes ces raisons, le jeu est une disgr√¢ce inf√¢me. Le gameplay n'a pas boug√© d'un iota, on reprend donc les bons et les mauvais points. Votre personnage peut grimper un peu partout comme √† son habitude le truc c'est que courir √† proximit√© d'√©l√©ments du d√©cor ou d'un mur vous fera syst√©matiquement monter. On conna√Æt tous cela, dans certains cas c'est carr√©ment rageant. Contrairement aux √©pisodes pr√©c√©dents, le h√©ros est dot√© de gestuelles h√©rit√©es du parkour urbain en particulier lorsque vous sauterez par dessus des barri√®res. C'est pseudo styl√©, √ßa rappelle surtout que ce jeu s'adresse √† des ados et, par cons√©quent, me met mal √† l'aise car j'ai 31 ans. Bref, aucun changement significatif sur le gameplay hormis la navigation en mer. Introduction plut√¥t r√©ussie du prochain opus : Black Flag. La r√©alisation me conforte dans mon d√©sespoir et dans l'id√©e que m√™me avec beaucoup d'argent, du marketing √† √©chelle mondiale et une renomm√©e du m√™me type, Ubisoft ne sait pas faire de jeux sans sa pl√©thore de bug. En plus d'√™tre un jeu bugg√©, Assassin's Creed III est un jeu moche. Seule l'animation des personnages (du personnage central en fait) est r√©ussie, le reste est correct. Donc, le jeu est moche, la nature est laide m√™me T.E.S. Oblivion sorti en 2007 parvient √† rendre la nature dans un monde ouvert plus cr√©dible. Et Dieu sait que Besthesda en terme de moche et de bug sont champions hors-cat√©gorie. Bah non, Ubisoft en 2012 parviennent √† battre le record de m√©diocrit√©. Malgr√© un nombre de PNJ cons√©quent, les villes comme New-York et Boston sont comme d'habitude dans la s√©rie des Assassin's Creed, sans √¢me. Petit point positif les quelques monuments historiques sont, semble t-il, assez fid√®les √† la r√©alit√©. Le reste des villes est quelconque. Du c√¥t√© des petits trucs insupportables, il est assez impressionnant de voir le nombre incroyable de soldats de l'arm√©e royale dans les rues de Boston ou New-York. C'est juste sid√©rant. Il y a quasiment autant d'habitants que d'ennemis. Tu ne peux pas l√¢cher un pet tranquillement sans te retrouver avec douze soldats au fion pour te ratonner... Autre sujet, le menu est une bouse infinie +1 sans parler de la gestion du domaine tout sauf intelligible et ergonomique. A croire que les stagiaires pay√©s 2 Dollars de l'heure se soient charg√©s de r√©aliser cet aspect inutile du jeu. Ceci dit, cynisme √† part, j'ai bien aim√© les missions et l'ambiance qui r√®gnent sur le domaine : voir le village grandir, accueillir de nouveaux habitants etc. Un aspect que j'ai toujours appr√©ci√© dans les Assassin's Creed ! Tant que nous sommes dans les louanges, profitons-en, Ubisoft s'est enfin rendu compte que foutre des milliards de collectibles de merde √©tait une v√©ritable purge rajoutant artificiellement de la dur√©e de vie. Dans cet √©pisode, il y en a beaucoup moins sauf pour les plumes... Mais dans l'ensemble c'est positif. Pour conclure : sc√©nario nul √† chier sauf le twist du prologue, r√©alisation m√©diocre pour ne pas dire nulle, menu lourdingue et ergonomique comme le BIOS de votre ordinateur et bug √† foison. Merci Ubisoft d'oser sortir des merdes pareilles. Dieu merci j'ai pay√© ce jeu une bouch√©e de pain mais quand je pense qu'√† l'√©poque ces voleurs ont tent√© de vendre AC III 60 ‚Ç¨. Vous l'aurez compris, le Assassin's Creed III est le pire volet de la s√©rie officielle. Rien n'est bon, tout est moyen ou mauvais. J'esp√®re que Black Flag se rattrapera car la descente d'organe fut douloureuse. Je ne recommande pas sauf si on aime l'anale.

text_translate: I will explain why I can't recommend this game. It is a quality game, nice graphics, sound, story and gameplay. It's fun! Although it's quite a bit different from the other Metro's, I think the changes are interesting. All the Metro games are unique and worth the experience. But this game is heavily flawed. Lots of annoying bugs, like you being stuck frequently. Or worse, the game frequently crashes regardless if DX11 or DX12. It also lacks basic options for configuring Video settings. In this department it looks like a game from 20 years ago. The saving system is terrible, missing a basic manual save option. All in all, I can't recommend any bugged game, even it is a well made game where people worked a lot to get it done. This game is not worth playing until it's QA is properly done, and we are more than a year after it's launch, so the chances are low that it will get fixed. It's sad, the Metro franchised deserved better. The first two games are not bugged like this one is, and they were incredible.

text_translate: Tuttifrutti Interactive devs hire interns to hunt for people who play hidden object puzzle games and bribe them with a free key so they can write an "honest" - which is a totally dishonest positive review for Darkata. One of their interns with only 2 games in his library and level 1 profile found me and tried convincing me to play Darkarta, a game that came out in 2017 and that nobody cares about. When I told him I don't have this game in my library, he felt bad for me and out of complete pureness of his angelic heart and beautiful soul offered me a free key. On one condition though - if I promised to write an honest review. Nice chat with the intern: The devs banned my screenshot with the nice person for a reason - because they can't ban reviews. If they could, they would. A lot of positive reviews are coming from low level (lvl 1 - lvl 2) profiles that have 1-2 games in their library and no other reviews but "Darkarta". When I wrote this review on November 15th, 2020, today (November 17th, 2020) in two days alone, Darkarta gained 8 more fake positive reviews. Darkarta - a mediocre HOG game that came out in 2017 that nobody cares about. So here is my honest review: This game is just as generic as most hidden object games, the cheesy story and hollow characters, puzzles that don't make sense, bad voice acting, badly rendered scenes, strong & independent businesswoman. Nothing new here. If you're making a game to just grub a few bucks, what are you gaining from fake positive reviews? Does it feel good reading them knowing that you bribe people with free copies of your games? Why not just own up to it and accept your piece of art as it is? Why trick potential buyers with fake positive reviews?

text: Generation Zero was a breath of fresh air and showed an immense amount of potential at first. It's a great looking game with good and enjoyable game-play that is quite similar visually to PUBG. It seems like an immersive and great atmospheric game when playing alone, however that's quickly ruined as the game starts you with a fair amount of medical supplies but no way to craft them later on. Without a way to craft medical supplies and the enemies getting tougher and stronger rather quickly the immersion is broken by having to respawn repeatedly without medical supplies, leading to an even quicker death every time after that.  Before getting into the core problems, this game has a lot of polishing and what seem like bugs that take away from the game. Bullets visually create the same sparks when hitting a surface, as they do when hitting a robot. Some times you'll waste your ammo hitting the robot only to realize the object it's behind has an absolutely massive hitbox, which is pretty common occurrence. Usually this ends up with the player dying as ammo is valuable at the beginning, and every second and shot counts as enemies are charging towards you. This however isn't the same on the enemies end as a lot of the time bullets will clip through large objects near the sides and hit you, as if the bullets own hitbox is way smaller then the radius in which it can damage you. The biggest downfall of this game is the terrible design decisions that it has going for it, mostly in relation to the crafting system and equipping items. While at first you notice there is a crafting system and get excited in what things you can craft, you quickly come to realize the only thing you can make with your supplies it is clothing that provides a 1% or 2% bonus to a stat such as bullet resistance. Clearly that's pretty useless when a robot can rip apart half your health bar within a few seconds, or just leap at you to almost instantly kill you.  Equipping items isn't that bad but you're only allowed to place your items on specific slots. You have 2 primary weapon slots and 1 secondary slot that shares both your pistol and melee weapon. You're unable to put your pistol or melee weapon on anything except button 3. This though isn't much of a problem in the end because there isn't an opportunity to use it with the enemies detection range. This together makes resources more scarce, and enemy drops don't help the situation either. Larger enemies do significantly more damage, and require significantly more effort to take down as expected, but don't actually drop more then normal enemies, just rifle bullets for example instead of pistol bullets in low quantity which can usually be found quite frequently around the map.  In the end I wouldn't recommend this game except maybe on the current 60% off sale as these are core design decisions on a game over a year old and almost certainly won't be changed. While it might be fun at first, unless you look up gameplay and feel like this is a game you would want to play, it probably isn't worth the average 4, to at most 30 hours you'll spend in a game you bought for 25$.

I got this game because of the high percentage of positive reviews, but I should have known better, it's just another soulless cheap cash grab, which misuses the Early Access flag . You walk through the house, grab some keys and solve an easy "puzzle" to get out. It's super short, there's no story, bugs,  lvl design is abysmally poor and I could have sworn, I saw loads of the used assets in other UE4 games. If you don't get this game included in a bundle or just buy it because you want to have all games on steam - stay away. You'll find games with more depth and (horror)fun on gamejolt or itch.io for free.

text_translate: Counter Strike: Global Offensive ist das allseits bekannte Russische W√∂rterbuch mit Wutausbruch Garantie und nervigen Menschen die ins Mikrofon br√ºllen.  Nicht zu vergessen, die ‚ÄûGeldverschwender Schleuder‚Äú die als Skins bezeichnet werden. Mit dem Geld was Value durch Kisten und den anderen Extras verdient, k√∂nnten sie die Gewinne in ein neues Spiel wie ‚ÄûHalf Life 3‚Äú oder wie geschehen Half Life Alyx einflie√üen lassen. Vorteilhaft w√§ren auch 128 Tick Server. F√ºr das Spiel spricht der Preis. Es gibt keinen. Es ist eine kosteng√ºnstige M√∂glichkeit mit Freunden Spa√ü zu haben, was m√∂glich ist, wenn das Spiel nicht ernst genommen wird. Und absolut niemand wird in 2020 eine ausrede haben, dass der Rechner zu langsam ist. Das Spiel l√§uft auch auf einer Kartoffel (muss eine gro√üe sein). Da ich nun mal wieder einige Zeit CS:GO gespielt habe, ist mir aufgefallen (...) nun, es ist eigentlich alles so, wie ich es 2015 hinterlassen habe. Na gut, schlimmer als fr√ºher.  Es gibt deutlich mehr Cheater oder Smurfs. Da hilft oft nicht mal das "total tolle" 'Prime'. Edit: Das "Prime"-System wurde weiter entwickelt und nennt sich jetzt eigentlich "TrustFactor". Ob es aber wirklich hilft, kann ich nicht beurteilen. Zu mal ein Prime-Status nun nicht mehr nur √ºber eine Telefonnummer vergeben wird. Es ist m√∂glichen diesen zu kaufen. Also, was n√ºtzt es, wenn Leute mit Spinbots dennoch nicht direkt von dem ach so tollen VAC System erkannt wird. Stattdessen aber Programme wie "CheatEngine" einen VAC Authentication Error ausl√∂st. Das Konzept der Kisten und Skins hat sich nicht ver√§ndert. In der Zeit sind sogar Handschuh-Skins dazu gekommen. Ich frage mich ja, wann Helme oder Schuhe als Skin ver√∂ffentlicht werden.   Nichts desto trotz, ist dieses Spiel das Absolute gute Beispiel daran, wie trotz Abzocke und st√§ndigen Wutausbr√ºchen die Sucht bestanden bleibt. Selbst, wenn man √ºberhaupt keine Lust mehr hat, kommt der Zwang immer weiter zu spielen doch mal wieder. Edit: 23.10.2020 Muss noch die 3k vollmachen. Private Matches sind schon okey. xD

text: hahhahahahhahahahahahha
text_translate: This has been permanently free on the developer's website for a long time now (years, perhaps). Meaning that anyone who doesn't own this game who is reading this can be glad to know they can pay for this game exactly what this game is worth- nothing. [Meanwhile, having paid for the game, I just have to accept regret over the fact.] There's a laundry list of issues with the game, ranging from stability to interface to tech tree design to combat to AI to.. well, basically everything is lackluster. But see, I don't have to cover any of that in detail, because there's a much simpler way to describe this game: This game is a Master of Orion clone where each and every single gameplay system feels *significantly* dumbed down [combat most especially] compared to the game's spiritual predecessors, while none of the shortcomings of those predecessors are meaningfully addressed by this game.  In short, there's no real reason to play this game over games from the late 90s and early 2000s. Hell, even Wargaming's extremely shoddy MoO4 game is probably* somewhat more involved than this game [I haven't played MoO3, so I can't comment on that comparison].  * ( Honestly, both games have started getting confused in my head, with one mindnumbing, unpleasant, shallow MoO-imitating experience just kinda blurring into the other. ) The game does have several mods which improve the game, but with such a shallow foundation (this being one of the least fun 4x games I've ever played, along with MoO4) and with the mods only tweaking existing features using the limited modding functions the game has available, there's just not enough there to salvage this game. Again, this is free, so go make your own judgement. But if you've got something else to play, I really recommend you go spend your time there, instead. With both this and MoO4, I only feel like I wasted my time- and as someone who finds 4x/sim games [along with card, board, and racing games] easily appealing even when the games in question compare poorly to others in their genre, it's really a first for me to encounter games of that general style wherein I can't at least manage some sort of minor, niche engagement to make the experience worthwhile.  I've still got some hopes for Endless Space 2, since there's definitely a framework there that could be fun if it was fleshed out. The problem is that right now, you've got a skeleton without any flesh, that's even lacking internal organs in certain places [again, the combat is a huge disappointment, what with it effectively being nonexistant]. In essence, a prototype of a game. Which'd be fine if there weren't already other MoO clones, nevermind the original MoO games to compare [disfavorably] to.  Meanwhile, this game feels like the developers did hold an appreciation for the genre style they were working to, but that appreciation never seems to have turned into devotion, passion, or even just a strong interest. It feels like a child who loves puppies, got a puppy, and then realized that taking care of them was too much of a bother, and just kinda settled in the basic care necessities and then left the dog to its own devices. Put another way, the game (within its "collection" release) feels like the original Warlock: Master of the Arcane pre-DLCs, for anyone familiar with that rather shallow and lackluster experience. Unfortunately, that is a game which did also have several DLCs of its own, so that comparison isn't really a flattering one for Endless Space.

text: Only On Playstation

Ever since i was in my early teens i always admired MMORPGs and wanted to try out...all of them pretty much, or if nothing, at least the most famous ones. Aion was surely on that list, as i heard a lot of things about it, but i never managed to play it until certain 5.0 patch part, few months before 6.0, and it somehow remained on the end of my list. Then, it seemed like somewhat casual MMORPG, with a lot of quests, but it also felt like it was missing a lot of interesting PvE things and exploring. Still, in that 5.0 patch i managed to have some fun, and there were quests to do, even if it didnt seem like most interesting game ever. I played up to level 12 or something, and it took me like 2 hours or so back then, since there was a lot of quests. I quit it so i can play something else, since person i played with wasnt that interested and thought i might come back later a bit. Few months later 6.0 arrived, and i decided to try the AION again, more seriously this time, from the start with new character. The classes didnt change, there are still 6 basic classes which evolve into one of 2 paths you must choose at level 10, 11 of them, considering bard class has only one path. Leveling became extremely fast now, you could get to level 10 under 30 minutes, everything was sped up and parts of map were cut off. Choosing the path is bad as it used to be, you get no introduction to your skills during those first 10 levels, rather you simply have to make a random choice. After picking the path for my class, one of the worst experiences in MMORPGs began. The quests in this game are so extremely linear and with 6.0 update every possible quest that could've been cut off to speed up the leveling has been cut off. You will find only few 2-3 side quests in each village and continue off with main quest. However these main quests had such ridiculous design where you'd have to enter a solo dungeon which is played for over an hour and you get a new one every 5-10 levels. While most MMORPGs offer you rewards to improve your weapon and interesting side quests, leveling in 6.0 system made me feel like someone was constantly pushing me from my back to level up as soon as possible, not to enjoy the game, but rather to become another server slot filler in it. I've barely seen 5 different players as i was leveling up. Maps looked somewhat interesting but game doesnt offer any quests that take you on a nice tour to explain it, rather tedious quests that focus on one small part of the map. This keeps getting worse, not only since for rewards you get only equipment on every 10 levels, but because game forces you to go through dozens of mobs (which take extremely long time to kill), and the useless wings you have can only be used on very rare special parts of the map where you can fly. I reached level 56 and i still havent seen a single mount in this game, and maps are quite large to walk all the time. The game offers you one option though, which is to drink "Transformation potion" which gives you huge boost but at same time turns you at weird looking furry monster or undead skeleton, depending on the potion (good job spending all the time making your character). These potions have legendary versions which offer boosts like +40% speed +35% attack +15% attack speed and much more with different buff combinations which are HUGE buffs and will make you even twice as strong. These potions are of course, very expensive as well , and have cash shop option for purchase. I've reached level 56 somehow through sheer curiosity and test to my endurance i suppose, and i really cant see myself playing much more, maybe in instances of 20 minutes and playing on and off, just so i could see how alive the endgame is, and that is if there really isnt anything else to play. Even the towns are so extremely filled with so many useless NPCs that have names above them to give you a fake illusion of other players being there. Whatever Aion used to be, it surely isnt this game. This is an attempt to make a very blatant cash cow game, and while there are many of those games, they at least try to cover it up and sometimes offer fun events and rewards for players.

text: Returned for a refund. The basic concept of the game sounds like fun and the key functionalities are mostly implemented, but that's unfortunately pretty much everything that's positive about the game. The game is currenty in version 3.something, and 4.0 is planned as the release version. I found that hard to belief when I fired it up for the first time. Everythin about the game looks like it was made by 3 guys on a budget in one weekend.  The negative user experience starts with the main menu screen, which looks bang on like it came from 1998. Then you'll want to remap the keys. There's an option for that, cool. What it doesn't tell you, though, is that some keys have an unadvertised hard-coded funcionality in them, and while you can map the said button, the new mapping doesn't override the hard-coded action. So when you're in the game and you press 'R' to move forwards, the 'force respawn' function kicks in and you'll just die. There's no way to obviously tell which buttons are hard-coded and which are not, so you'll just have to find out by trial and error. When you actually make it onto a server and start playing you'll notice the character models which look like they're from 2007, only that they are animated like they're from 2002. The various weapons are fun in theory, but then you'll pick the rapier and see how the character is holding it like a hammer and swinging it like a tennis racket, and you'll really feel like a pirate in the sense that you'll just want to drown your sorrows in a bottle of rum. Then there's the actual combat. It could be fun, but the clunky feel of the controls, the stiff and minimalistic character animations and the less-than-optimised network code again make it feel like you're playing a low-budget FPS from the early 2000s, so it's not really particularly enjoyable. So yeah, good effort but the game is clearly just an early prototype still. The idea is good, so maybe I'll check back later, like in 2022, to see if it has finally been developed into a fully functional, quality product.

text_translate: Sometimes looks like SWAT4 but it's a really sh*t game. Graphics not for 2013-2014, AI teammates is low ( very low) .

text: The unimpressive (by today's standards) graphics aside, it is the camera that ruined it for me. None of the angles seemed quite right, it responds slowly to player's movement and doesn't allow to rotate around at all. Maybe it would've benefited from some kind of "spring mechanic" where you change the angle with the joystick for a brief moment, then it returns to the default angle when you let go. Also the possibility to accurately choose the distance to the player model would've been nice.

text: This game has been an absolute ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• nightmare for me. I have had to manually insert the I.P to join my mate in every single match, because otherwise there is no reasonable way for us to join a party, and hop into a sever together. And GOD forbid it be a server with mods: the game will display {Percent} ({Download}/{Total Size}) and never actually finish downloading: the latency is horrific no matter the setting. None of the update seemingly fix the game, only adding levels that I can barely play, or play alone. If you're going to keep this game running for two years on the unreal engine, maybe ask a couple of Russians to come and fix the coding for you because this is absolutely ridiculous. Jesus christ this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• is a nightmare.

text: Letter of Complaint    Before i will start i want to warn you that i have got more than 1k of a game experience and was a Supreme in ranked games.   To whom it may concern,    I am writing to express my disappointment with the game called "CS:GO", which I bought 3 years ago.   I feel compelled to write to you in order to describe the problem, which started to spread months ago and it seems that it wont stop spreading until the community of this game wont stop playing it anymore.   First of all, i want to describe minor problems, which i have got in this game and it is relations between creators and community of this game. The second problem is with hitbox system, which is absolute disgrace for shooter with tournament level. And the main problem is the community, which is like an impolite 12 years old fat kid with cheats. This is a cancer of CS:GO, which kills the whole attractiveness and fun.   I strongly recommend that your organisation to fix these problems.   I suggest to start some action with the community, for example, speak with it, update the game in the right direction, fix the hitbox system, create a good ban system and on top of that rebrand this game from low-price shooter for annoying kinds to middle-price shooter with normal 12 years kids.   Forever yours,    Game Fan.
text_translate: For Honor is not a bad game. I wouldn't call it a good game either.  I would call this game a victim of multiplayer games on the rage. While the singleplayer is bare bones of a tutorial when it could have been such a powerful, fighting, singleplayer game. This game doesn't know what it wants to be. For Honor is a Medieval, PVP, Fighting game thats... slow. Its different. Its a game of patience. Its... boring. Unbalanced. Its not the game for me. It can be frustrating going up against someone who counters you and refuses to make the first move. As soon as you make the first move, its over. There is little room for recovery and too much punishment.  For honor has a good variety of characters with unique abilities. It can be very entertaining to spend time mastering each character. However, after that time is spent, you will figure out the core mechanics of the game run exactly the same. Dodge. Parry. Swing. Dodge. Parry. Swing. This is expected with a fighting game... but everything just feels clunky. It all feels too slow for a fighting game. This game just makes you wish you were playing a fast paced street fighter of the sort.  This game has quite a few different gamemodes, but you will only play   one of them. Duels. 1 v 1's. Now, you could go play 4 v 4s... but thats  . Or you could grind. But Ubisofts terrible matchmaking will be sure to have to matched against someone with much better stats. So toss out all those gamemodes that are 4 v 4s. While satisfying rounds can happen in multiplayer, at the end of the day, toxicity and Irritation rule the community. The community is awful. You will always run into someone who thinks they are hercules and will be a very poor loser with the childish excuses for "why they let you win". Multiplayer is toxic, boring, and, most importantly, not fun. It isn't worth the time learning the game to get good at. Even with its small bursts of triumph.  Its.. Bad. Really bad. The singleplayer of this game is basicly the very long tutorial of how to play every character in the game (well the 9 base characters). As you fight your way through this "campaign" you cant help but think about how awesome it could have been. If this game had instead focused on a story based game with perhaps some coop elements. Perhaps even castle sieges. The game could of been a lot more interesting at least to get into. Overall, dont waste your time on this game. There are many other games to spend it on that can satisfy your competitive needs.

text: Looks good in the videos but that's about it No Ultrawide Support Hard is a snoozefest- Reward me with instant death if I kill a green dude at point blank. State Feedback is rather boring - Needs more weapon trails, Clearer attack animations etc. I want to hear being ripped to shreds when i get too close or hit. Weapon design - Secondary Fire is really eh to the point why even add it? Swapping between weapons takes to long in hectic situations. Let me Melee lunge and instantly change to shotty, plz Map design and natural progression imho let the game down the most, The graveyard maze and all the rooms looking the same made it super boring to look at / fight in. Game banks on nostalgia to much and fails to delivery any of the good bits.

text_translate: So I picked this game up today with a coupon Steam had given me from crafting a badge, so I received it for about 34 cents. I would not pay more than the one dollar price for this game because of how badly it was developed. 1.) For starters, the keyboard controls are delayed. I press a key to move and the ball takes a second to roll, which makes it hard to stop because when you move at a fast momentum, you can't instantly start slowing down. However, this issue is gone when using a controller. 2.) There are achievements in this game for dying so many times, which isn't hard to get because all you have to do to die is press the R key. Falling off the level does not count as dying for whatever reason, so you have to kill yourself with the press of a key. 3.) The camera angle is locked in, which is a bad choice. There are times when you have to roll the ball back towards yourself as the player and you can't tell how far to jump and it makes the perspective of the platform seem farther away than what it is. 4.) As for the good things in this game, the only props I can give it is the soundtrack, which isn't really that bad; it has some decently nice music in it. The developer really hit the nail on the head when they chose the name "DIGITAL MISTAKE" as their company name... I would not recommend this game to anyone unless they wanted to play something broken for the laughs, which a lot of my friends do. I give the game a 3/10, and that is only because of the soundtrack and the pug statue I found while playing.

text_translate: I hate to leave negative reviews, because I've played a lot of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• games on steam, and hav'nt even bothered to review them. This game could have been amazing, because it has that arcade feel to it, (thanks ATLUS) but unfortunately the Single player is just wrong. You have a minute of super monkey ball fun then it becomes a tedious tower defence with poor controls and no control over the ai launching attacks faster than you at the same time. The game would have been really fun if it was: 1: The levels get harder to navigate but you can still roll and build up points/levels 2: No poorly implemented tower defence aspect 3: AI building faster and better than a C&C hack

text: no lol
text_translate: WOW no just NOOOOOOOOO. As someone who has most of these silly Hentai/Anime games, this one is far the worst and buggiest.  The game is broken and glitches constantly ( your character will get stuck in a invisible walls and you will have to close the game and restart it up......which you probably shouldn't lol).   You will be going against enemies that all have guns and are usually 3 to a group and can kill you in 2 shots while your running around with a sword. The game will glitch so bad that your character will start running so fast and you wont be able to control anything that most likely you will end up dying.  The sound effects are terrible, like constant static or white noise, the rag doll physics are horrible. When you are killed your characters body parts will sometimes stretch across the screen. I know this is a fan service game and a cheap one but at least their other games were a bit more playable and not a hot mess like this.

text: BAD
text_translate: Tl;dr: the game is bland and boring. If you played the previous games - you played this one. Don't buy it. The game itself is mediocre and not really fun. Almost nothing new. Far away textures and models are looking super blurred. Amost no new gameplay features. 1 new feature to be exact - repelling. Totally worth the wait! Boring dialogues. Boring characters. Boring storyline. Boring gunplay and kills with no blood at all even when you stab them. Graphics is mostly mediocre too, but sometimes it's pretty (usually where Lara's face in close-up). It looks just like the previous game from 3 years ago (with couple of small downgrades), but with warmer color palette. Fps oten jumps from 60 to 30 (or from 144 to 40) in jungles or villages while there are nothing special on the screen (e.g in some homes or streets with 2-3 people). But when you move your sight just several degrees away - it's 60 (144) again, so it's bad optimisation, not hardware problems Looks like the devs didn't care much about the game. If you played the previous games - you played this one. I bought the Croft edition for early unlock. I was wrong. Don't make my mistake. Buy some really good game instead. Update: they added 50% discount 6 months after release. This is how pathetic this game is.

text: Cancer
text_translate: [I received this product for free from a giveaway]. Only played for a short time, but sheesh, it's a bit of a mess both visually and gameplay wise. There's not much I can really say that would differ from what's shown in the trailer (rather crude MS-paint looking drawings with a few short looping backgrounds). You jump when moving right or left, flappy-bird esque, you dodge stuff going across the screen and from the top, which is a bit boring to me, but some may enjoy it more. You also have to go out of the screen to dodge sometimes, but also if you go too far out (who knows how far) you'll die as well. It might be an okay time waster for free (like old flash games), but I wouldn't recommend spending your money on this.
Just. Don't. Play. In. This. Game.

text_translate: As much as i love WWE and 2k making the WWE themed games, WWE 2K20 Is just, and sadly, a no,I've played the game for 25 hours, but i stopped about two weeks later after i bought it. I've managed to play twenty matches at most, but everytime after few games, it just kept on crashing on loading. Tried numerous fixes, but it just didn't work, and when i saw there's no other way around to fix the game, i let it go. I've played WWE 2K18 Before, and i enjoyed it really, really much, but i wanted something 'alive' and 'fresh' and i got WWE 2K20 for a cheap price. I Had this spark of hope that whatever is being said about this game won't actually include me, and i'll be able to get an entertaining experience out of it, but well... I Didn't.Besides the issues connected to the port, and overall stability, the game is fine. I'm not really a big fan of MyCareer, but it was nice they added both genders this time.  Basically, if you ever played any other WWE game, it's basically the same but it has different MyCareer only. I Cannot recommend it as the shape of this game is at fatal level. You MAY not be able to play it, and get fun out of it...

text: After a few hours I can say: Wait... just wait a month, a year, a decade... wait until the publisher are able to deliver a full functionally game ... sooo... wait forever?!?  The gameplay itself is great... The idea behind it is really nice and challenging... (I recommend an full team of friends or at least  2 friends and one random) BUT ... this game is full of GAMEBREAKING bugs ... you can be as good as you want... u sneak the complete lvl, made it almost to the escape zone - DISCONNECT .. several times... (my internet connection was stable) ... or several lags like two or three seconds where you can gaze on a freezed game...   OR, even better, you try to escape and get stuck as soon as you climb up the roof of a car... so you can wait ... and wait ... and wait ... you¬¥re save from the enemies, can¬¥t get killed from your team mates and the only option that your team can play/win the round is ... DISCONNECT... but this time you have to leave by yourself ... so I can say ... from 10 Rounds of the 2nd Mission I tried, only one succeed... and 8 times was the reason an cheap early pre alpha game, released because of greed without propper testing and developing Is is worth it? Is it worth to launch an unfinished game and destroy the good reputation of former nice publisher? You are killing your own fanbase with this pile of s**t!

text_translate: I'm sure you have heard how bad the AI is in this game. It is.  In one game the  AI declared war on me  on turn 14.  It is literally impossible to get to the late game. The AI is always mad at you, even on the easiest difficulty. They have added too many systems which even the AI doesn't understand which means that the AI spams military units, settlers and Missionary throughout the game but is somehow still able to be ahead of you in the tech.  Until the AI gets updated don't buy.

text: Posting it cuz some friends often ask me if csgo is worth it in 2k20, hope it could help some others. Could recommand this game if the devs could cared about the hackers (who are more and more everyday) and people ruining the game by trolling/being stupid derankers, even on supreme/global ranks (anyway globals in 2k20 lmao.. 60% boosted). But it seems csgo's devs decided to kill the game themselves so whatever. Tbh go play Valorant, not the best fps but at least you can play and have fun! Btw, if you really want to play csgo, go on Faceit.. probably the only way to enjoy csgo today. It kills me to say it because I truly love this game, but when its own devs decide to not fix it at all.. :)

text_translate: Der erste DLC von Fallout 4 ist in meinen Augen eine herbe Entt√§uschung. Wieso,das erkl√§re ich in zwei Punkten.  Vorab: Ich bin besitzer des Season-Pass und trotzdem ist der Preis nicht gerechtfertigt. Der DLC befasst sich mit dem Roboter bauen und tunen bzw. ver√§ndern. Das macht auch grunds√§tzlich spa√ü, aber es ist in meinen Augen ehr ein fehlendes Feature. Man kann einen Roboter von Anfang an bauen, aber es ist nicht so komplex, dass man daf√ºr 10‚Ç¨ hinlegen muss. Es ist sehr befriedigend sich einen Roboter zu bauen ihn zu testen und dann wieder  zu ver√§ndern, aber es ist kein riesengro√ües  Sammelsurium aus Teilen.  Ich kann mir auch beim besten Willen nicht vorstellen, dass jemand da 7-8h mit verbringt.  Ich wei√ü  der DLC ist nichts f√ºr Leute die ein gute Story wie beim (ja ich wei√ü der Vergleich nervt) Witcher suchen,  aber sie ist nicht mal ansatzweise so gut wie manche Nebenquests bei Fallout 3. Die Aufgaben sind so spannend wie die Story. Man rennt von A nach B und t√∂tet.  Ein schlechter Witz. Fazit: Die Story w√§re egal gewesen, wenn das Roboter bauen komplexer gewesen w√§re.  Es macht zwar spa√ü, aber wenn man 10‚Ç¨ daf√ºr hinlegen soll bekommt  man doch etwas Besseres, wenn man  etwas anderes kauft.  Im Sale f√ºr 3-5‚Ç¨ lohnt es sich dann doch mehr

text: I'm very saddened to say that I can't recommend this game. While I understand that the dev made it with a big passion, the game has way too many problems that keep it from being enjoyable. The whole game concept is incredible. The idea is great, but the execution and presentation are bad. I'll try to talk about some of the main issues I faced, that kept me from enjoying the game, and therefore, asking for a refund. First, and one of the main issues this game has: The Sound Design. It's absolutely TERRIBLE. I've seen better sound design in free flash games around the internet. Every single sound on the game is terribly bad and underwhelming, with no impact. The ships, the thrusters, the weapons, the hits, the explosions... Everything.. They all sound bad. It's hard to put into words, but I can't feel any sort of immersion or joy.  Imagine getting a hail of bullets from a destroyer on your small fighter and all you hear is a faint "tud" as if someone is tapping their finger on a tent. I'm not exhagerating. That's exactly how it sounds. Sometimes I barely even notice I'm taking hits, and when I look to my 'HP', oh hey, I'm almost dead.  I don't know how he thought those sounds were a good idea. There are TONS of good examples of how to make a great sound design for a space game. While I do approve someone trying to be original, I can't aprove if that original is bad. Second, the controls. Do you want to use SHIFT as your After Burner? Alrite, you can, but first you must check an option that turns off EVERY SINGLE key involving two buttons (like shift + Q, alt + W, etc). If the option is checked, the game won't recognize SHIFT as a single input, but rather just an input to combine with another key....... WHY? The mouse and scroll feels like you're controlling a port of a console game that has a cursor controlled via analog stick. It has a weird "weight" to it, and it's terribly uncomfortable to control. Imagine playing a RTS with a weird sensitivity mouse, that no matter how much time you spend messing around with the sliders, you can't get it to move like a proper cursor on every single game. Yep, that's what you'll have to deal with, as the game turns into a RTS of some sorts, when you get to fleet command. The graphics... I won't ask for ultra detailed graphics like Everspace or Elite Dangerous. Simple graphics can work. But the artstyle and visual effects on this game are just.. Too underwhelming. The whole visual presentation doesn't sell too much the idea that you're on the vast space, with infinite stars and all stuff, flying on your ship. The visual effects from weapons and explosions are bad. Not as bad as the sound though. Nothing is worst than that. But anyway, I've seen older games with much better graphics and visual effects than this one. And while this issue is not enough to keep me from enjoying the game, it does sum with the others. And the list goes... tl;dr, this game has way too many problems in key aspects of the game, that ends up making it a bad experience. I'm sorry if I sound like I'm bashing on your hard work, but I'm just being honest, because I care about this game.

text_translate: EDIT: To those of you who think it's unfair that I'm giving the game a thumbs down, I cannot with good conscience recommend something that doesn't play through the tutorial without crashing on an Nvidia 780 Ti card, 16GB of RAM and an Intel i7 core with 3.4GHz. I'm ok with performance drops, not with outright crashing into unplayability. I THINK this is a good game. It feels like it from the tutorial. The tutorial which I've played about eight or nine times now because the game is constantly crashing, there's no autosave functionality and some good distance before you're allowed to save, as I've never reached that point before crashing. Even with the unofficial community patch that's out now, I'm still having a lot of issues. And yes I'm playing on an Nvidia card with an Intel i7 GPU so I'm not having any of those AMD-issues, it's crashing for an assortment of reasons, unfortunately. I'll write a proper review once the game gets fixed. Until then, I can't really recommend something that's as unstable as this. It still works for a lot of people but it seems to be a lottery of hardware and driver-combinations whether or not you're one of those people. Still, I don't regret buying the game, just hoping there's some official fixes coming soon. EDIT (AGAIN): I got a different GPU now (GTX 1080) and the game no longer crashes on me. So far I am having fun, but I still can't get myself to change to a positive recommendation, until the problem with the older card series has been explicitly adressed.

text: PC:E ist ein Spiel, auf welches ich lange gewartet habe und mich freute, als ich es endlich runterladen konnte. Damals war es noch ein Early-Access-Spiel und hatte noch einige Probleme... Jedoch ist es seitdem noch nicht viel besser geworden. Es wurden einige Dinge ge√§ndert, die die Balance und diverse Bugs betreffen und es ist tats√§chlich etwas besser geworden aber es ist nichts Nennenswertes, da immer wieder neue Probleme reingepatcht werden. An sich hat das Spiel Potenzial, doch die Entwickler scheinen nicht zu wissen, eben dieses richtig umzusetzen. Details: + Bessere Texturen und Animationen als der Vorg√§nger (Primal Carnage) + Neuer Gamemode + Es kommen ein paar neue Dinosaurier- und Menschenklassen + Viele neue Skins und Ausr√ºstungsgegenst√§nde in neuer Klassenanpassung, welche im Kamp "gedroppt" werden - Hitboxen sind zum Teil noch etwas fehlerhaft - In-Game-Shop hat KEINE In-Game-W√§hrung, sondern verlangt Echtgeld - Items werden unbeeinflussbar zuf√§llig verteilt - Zum Teil unausbalanciert und zum Teil "zu stark ausbalanciert", so dass manche Klassen schw√§cher sind, als sie sein sollten - Serverbeitritt ist manchmal nicht m√∂glich durch Spielfehler - Steuerung erscheint etwas schwammig Ich pers√∂nlich bevorzuge und empfehle somit jedem, der mit diesem Teil (wie ich bisher auch) unzufrieden ist, den Vorg√§nger (Primal Carnage) zu spielen, denn dieser ist, verglichen mit Primal Carnage: Extinction, spielbar, auch wenn er ebenfalls noch etwas verbuggt ist. WARNUNG: TRAILER UND "SCREENSHOTS" IM SHOP ZEIGEN NICHT DAS GAMEPLAY SONDERN WURDEN IN EINEM EXTERNEN PROGRAMM ANIMIERT UND POSIERT! -> ENTSPRICHT NICHT DER SPIELQUALIT√ÑT!

text: O jogo √© incr√≠vel em quest√£o de gr√°ficos, jogabilidade e hist√≥ria, conseguiu trazer boas mudan√ßas para o jogo. Mas, infelizmente n√£o se preocuparam com o maior problema deles (pelo menos para pc), desde os dark souls anteriores, os hackers. ¬†Durante a minha gameplay, tive no total umas 5 invas√µes (s√≥ comecei a jogar recentemente, os players n√£o est√£o ativos como no lan√ßamento, para invadir toda hora) e entre essas 5, duas foram de hackers. A primeira, o cara apenas me invadiu e quase crashou meu jogo de tanta magia e me matou. Na segunda, nem apareceu aviso que fui invadido e o cara come√ßou a dar v√°rios items automaticamente, tive que fechar o jogo. ¬†O real problema disso √© que, estou com v√°rios items de debug (que n√£o era para o usu√°rio ter acesso) no invent√°rio do meu char princ√≠pal e isso causar√° meu ban permanente no jogo, ao menos que eu delete o personagem e crie outro ou jogue offline para sempre. ¬†Ja tive amigos que perderam char de 100h+ por conta disso, e at√© hoje n√£o lan√ßaram patch para arrumar isso e impedir este tipo de situa√ß√£o, a produtora ta pouco se ferrando. N√£o recomendo comprar o jogo para PC, ele pode ser incr√≠vel, mas o estresse que se vai passar no online por conta de Hacker n√£o vale a pena.

text: This game would be the perfect reason not to make preorders. Also, it's the pure definition of greed, failure and false advertisement. Happily i wasn't hyped at all and i knew what to expect...even so...i preordered it. I'm not going into the whole bugs, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• port and optimization details. You all know the stories. My rig can handle everything launched this year on pretty much ultra settings with above average stable fps, but NMS is really ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• up. Ah, and this time, when i'm writing this "review" there is a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• beta opt-in for the game because day one patch wasn't enough for a game that we've been waiting for years and has a AAA game price. Maybe in a few months it will be bug free and the devs will change a few gameplay elements so it can be what they promised at first ... but for now my advice is to wait until the price drops below 10$. Also, I would nominate this game in the COTY awards ... Crap of the Year awards
text_translate: It's a nice game with a lot of potential but I can't recommend it at the moment as you can only load your most recent save and you can't quit without saving so if a zombie gets past your defences and starts destroying your base you have to start a new game as it will snowball really fast into a defeat and that combined with how long the games can be makes the early game feel like a grind with how easy it is. There are also no speed controls other than a pause button so you can't make it go any faster so just have to sit through the full lengh of it. That said I do still like the game and will probably play it a bit more and come back to it when it recieves more content as at the moment it is just one mode with 4 types of random maps and modifiers for how many in-game days it lasts (80-150) and the size of the zombie horde.

text_translate: Ich bin eigentlich Just Cause Fan der ersten Stunde und mich hat immer fasziniert was man alles mit dem Greifhaken anstellen kann, aber der vierte Teil ist ein klarer R√ºckschritt. Sicher gibt es auch ein paar Verbesserungen. Wie zum Beispiel dass man neuerdings Ballons und mini Raketen an Objekten anbringen kann. Praktisch ist auch dass man alle Eigenschaften des Greifhakens nach Bed√ºrfnis anpassen kann. Doch die wenigen Neuerungen entsch√§digen nicht die negativen Seiten des Spiels. Wir brauchen jetzt gar nicht erst √ºber Hintergrundgeschichte des Spiels reden, die ist bescheuert und kurz wie eh und je. Die Probleme fangen schon bei der unn√∂tig komplizierten Steuerung an, die sich nicht vollkommen frei konfigurieren l√§sst. Die Grafik ist einfach eine absolute Frechheit. Verwaschene Texturen, l√§cherliche Wassereffekte und Kantenflimmern ohne Ende, egal welche Einstellungen man w√§hlt. Um es kurz zu fassen, wer Just Cause mag sollte lieber beim dritten Teil bleiben, dort ist alles besser gemacht und macht vor allem auch mehr Spass.

text_translate: Where to start with this one? Well, umm... It's a shooter and that's about it. It's not even a particularly good one , truth be told.  The story is bland and un-original , basically : "We need to stop the bad guys from them acquiring nuclear warheads. Oh, we need to shoot the bad guys! Oh, we got betrayed! Oh, we magically have new friends (Because plot convenience!). Oh, we shoot the big bad guy and save the day! Hurray!".  And that's the game it a nutshell. Towards the game mechanics: 1. The game teaches you barely anything. Par example, it never mentioned that "Q" is to use the medkit, "E" to use the knife, or that the small grey bar situated at the middle foreground, was to show you if enemies could see you or not. (I figured that out in the last mission) 2. If you're using any gun other than a sniper rifle or the silence pistol, have fun with aiming at the Moon for most of the time due to the absurd level of recoil and no semi-auto setting. 3. If you're spotted by the enemy, prepare to load from the last checkpoint as all of the enemy soldiers have superhuman abilities and can shoot you down from 200m with an assault rifle. 4. Invisible walls, invisible walls f*cking everywhere you go. Thus to sum it up: Don't waste your money on this game. Yet if you do plan on buying it ,I highly recommend you do so when it's on sale.
