text_translate: This is a (just about )multi path branching choice based VN. The story is the fairly generic 'boy' moves to new area and goes to school and through some choices gets 'girls' out of his normal target range. +  reasonable art  good sound gothic lollies - Generic bland story no sense of connection with the characters Plot lines not utilised DS is a slice of life VN set on an island where no one is unhappy; the MC moves there after advice from his cousin and starts school, the problem is that its an incredibly dull slice. Nothing really happens and there is no real hook to get you invested in the characters nor the story. It lacks that little bit magic (no pun intended) that the DC series had. Parts of the story line are underutilised (e.g. the happy numbers) and others are just ropey (the MC suddenly remembering he lost his glasses after weeks of not using them) and everything plods mundanely through to the end leaving you wondering why anyone bothered writing it in the first place (maybe the producers needed a new porch extension or their drive repaved or something). Everything that happens is generic and predictable and even the 18+ patch fails to bring any real interest. If the game could be equated to a colour it would be dysentery beige If you want a dull plodding slice of life VN then go for it but I would suggest going for any of the DC stories instead

text_translate: Early Access game, so I give it some credit. My issues with the game are the amount of micro-managing you have to do in a colony sim. I personally want something a little more relaxed where I don't have to be turning structures on and off constantly to not die. Even with all that, having a thriving settlement a random event wiped my 80+ settlement down to 6 people. Rimworld is similar with random events, but Rimworld has very obvious solutions to the issues that can all be mitigated easily. Not so much here.

Game is beautiful but collision mechanics are SUPER shoddy. For a game that is completely story based, it should have more of a path/direction. Got through 4 or 5 dialogs of the first chapter, then spent nearly 30 minutes sliding around on rocks trying to get somewhere new, retraced the enire island area available 5 or 6 times. Narration is top-notch, atmosphere was impressive, the story is probably great too, but if I can't even get there, who cares. Those things make the path failure even more frustrating and infuriating. I really wanted to play this. Complete fail. Not even going to bother with the other chapters...even if I can find my way through them, who wants 3/4 of a great story?

text_translate: So Many waited for this game to hit Steam! List Time Pros: +Online Co Op +Forklift is great +Reminds me of back the day, in a good way somewhat +Fov Sliders are a nice touch +6 Games for the Price of 1 Cons: -Graphics look like trash, I still feel like I'm looking at a 360 game on a 360 when I play this -No Mouse Wheel Support at all as of late 2019 -Only Halo Reach you can play, all the other games will take a lot longer to come out -Not worth $40 at it's current state -Friendly Ai is stupid -Audio Lag is harsh and difficult to ignore -PC Port sucks, I've seen Indie Games with more polish & less resources and less cash do better -No Way to turn off Motion Blur -The Anti Cheat thing is a joke -A really big turn off Is the Xbox Live DRM that forces you to sign up or have a preexisting account, this is really bad and a step in the wrong direction, they didn't need to do that Microsoft has plenty of Money -People Waited so many years for a Trash experience overall, I understand people miss the glory days on the Xbox 360 but it doesn't justify a Lame port with next to no Graphics Options and day 1 bugs -The Game on a RTX 2070 Super with the Latest Nvidia Drives, runs Meh -Hopefully the game will improve for the better, but I doubt it will any time soon -For all the Halo Fan Boys out there, I love Halo Series and want to see it be a Masterpiece, Sadly it's not as of Today, if Read Dead 2 wasn't such Hot Garbage, I'd recommend that instead. Don't buy that anytime soon either

Jedoch sind Sie exakt identisch angebaut, wie auch die anderen. - Jedes Mal, wenn ein Spielstand geladen wird, hat man am ersten Tag den Bug, dass die Angestellten die zuletzt da waren, zeitgleich mit den neuen Angestellten im Laden sind. - Pizzen liegen auf dem Boden, nachdem man den Ofen verschiebt. Und lauter solche Sp√§√üe. Wobei man √ºber sowas noch hinwegsehen k√∂nnte. Es vergeht eigentlich keine Spielminute ohne gravierende und sogar offen sichtbare M√§ngel. Das ist so ziemlich das schlechteste Spiel (von der Programmierung her, nicht von der Art des Spiels), dass ich je gespielt habe. Und ich hab wirklich versucht, das Spiel zu m√∂gen. Das Spiel ist leider Betrug - es ist unspielbar. :( Schau euch einfach meine Screenshots an, das sagt schon alles...

Played for free to see if I wanted to buy the game at half off, which I was very much leaning towards.  After all, downloading nearly 50 gigs of the game takes some time.  As I started to play, I found the game interesting, but not at all what you would want from an "Open World Game".  The game immediately forces you into a story plot in which you are forced to take sword fighting lessons, and do a tutorial like quest.  When I am playing a game, I do not want it to feel like I am watching a T.V show,  this game accomplishes exactly that, it feels like watching a T.V drama.  The cutscenes are so long, i found myself watching a five minute long cutscene only to be baffled that I am still playing a game when I am throws into the action.  The NPCs are very unnatural looking and will seemingly walk around like a mindless drone, will not make eye contact with you, and will not budge when you walk into them.  They just kind of walk around with a blank stare on their face.     The Character Customization lacks.  They have made this game so "T.V showlike"  that, of course, you cannot customize your character.   If you unequip your gear at the beginning of the game, or sell it to a trader, YOUR CHARACTER WILL STILL BE WEARING THE SAME CLOTHES IN THE CUTSCENES.   Not being able to customize the character in any way pretty much makes the main character seem unrelateable.   Fighting is clunky.  The fighting is clunky and I mean really clunky.  You target an opponent, you can click or right click.  Depending on which you do, you will either perform a swing or a quicker stab move.  At least in the intro, you can end up in a few fistfights and do basic sword training.   I very much wanted to begin to react to the open world, but it seems I have lost interest after taking a break from the game after the first time playing it, which ended in getting shot off my horse in what seemed to be some kind of beginning cutscene sequence.  The bottom line is that if I am playing a Medeival Open World game, I want it to feel sandboxy, like the decisions I make will have a drastic and longterm effect on the world.  If I want to watch a T.V drama about Knights, I could just watch a show like "Knightfall".  This was a big disappointment.

Most disappointing game since Mafia III The story is mostly interesting and most of the characters are great, though they are plagued with cringey, try hard dialogue. Graphics are good, but never anything special. Big improvement over the first, though.  Gameplay is repetitive. Having to constantly(and I mean constantly) pick up health and armour, as opposed to just walking over it, is tedious and grating.  Despite teasing you with interesting environments like 60s Nazi controlled Roswell during a parade, they drop you into generic Nazi base #287 instead. This is the case throughout the entire campaign.  The game is riddled with bugs. It runs well over 60fps for me, with very rare dips, but there are occasional graphical glitches. Like the New York skyline not loading, leaving just a black box in the sky. The game freezes during loading far too often.  And to top it all off, they release the first update and it's somehow not compatible with your save data, you have to start over from the beginning of whatever chapter you were on. Which could be an hour+ of time wasted.

text: Im Grunde genommen ist das Spiel soweit gut, wenn man es mag immer von null anzufangen sobald man gestorben ist (Rogue-like) Sonst ist die Grafik und der Soundtrack sch√∂n. Auch das Gameplay ist f√ºr zwischendurch mal gut, aber frustriert mich schnell. Hier wird per Karten gek√§mpft, auch gegen Bosse. In einem Gesch√§ft k√∂nnen Karten gekauft oder verzaubert werden. Aber auch nach gewonnen K√§mpfe erh√§lt man neue. Neue Mitk√§mpfer erh√§lt man ebenfalls nach einem siegreichen Kampf, auch Bosse k√∂nnen aufgenommen werden. Stirbt aber der Held ist der Kampf sofort beendet und ein kompletter Neustart ist erforderlich.  Eine Taverne heilt f√ºr Gold, ist nicht genug verf√ºgbar muss man immer halb angeschlagen in einen neuen Kampf gehen. Auch gerne mal so in einen Boss Kampf. Das sind nervige Sachen und eine Strategie muss entwickelt werden. Teilweise ist der Schwierigkeitsgrad schwammig, manchmal wirkt es so als sollte man sterben. Die Karten sind auch nicht 100% klar ausgedr√ºckt und ein unverschuldeter Fehler f√ºhrt zum Tod. Ich mag Rogue-like √ºberhaupt nicht und man muss sich hier reinh√§ngen und richtig drauf einlassen, um zu bestehen. Nur im Angebot ein Test wert. Insgesamt eine neutrale Bewertung.  [war hier mal kostenlos verf√ºgbar]

text_translate: This is an interesting game to tackle for a review. When a game is free and very short, it's odd to choose whether to recommend it or not. the static speaks my name can be completed in about ten minutes. If you're curious enough to play it and are not put off by the subject matter, there's really no reason not to give it a whirl. At the same time, I'm not going around telling people to play it. There are upsides and downsides, but it is lacking and not worth going out of your way for. Let's first cover the parts that are simple to discuss. The graphics are good. It has a unique art style that I enjoyed. The music is easily forgotten. It is low-key and is fine for the atmosphere, so in context it is okay. The controls are simple and do the job they need to. Since it is a walking simulator, there is no need for anything beyond the movement and examination keys. The sound is fine, and the game runs well. I would like to say more about these things, but there isn't much else to cover for them. That leads us to the story. The store page already gives the main gist of the game away, and even if it didn't, you'd learn it quickly upon starting to play. You're a man who is about to kill himself. Before doing so, you have some objectives to complete. You can't leave your house, so there isn't much to explore. The rooms that are present have distinctive features and are intriguing for a minute or two, then there is nothing else to do with them. Your interactions are limited. There isn't much to the game before reaching the end. This is one of those games that falls into the "artsy" category. You know how some people say games aren't games at times, but rather an expression of art and little else? They try to get something across to the players and that's it? I don't subscribe to that way of thinking except on very rare occasions. I certainly call the static speaks my name a video game. However, it only seems to be trying to convey messages rather than doing much else. Since that appears to be the point, I'm fine with that concept. Players should know what they are getting into, though, especially if that is not the kind of thing they would enjoy. I felt a sense of unease while playing. That's a good thing in this case. The atmosphere seems like it should be bleak, and it feels like I should be questioning what I see. Yet there wasn't enough to it to make me become that engaged. It's difficult for me to describe this because it is a personal thing rather than one I can factually analyze. I wasn't sucked into the game like I was in some walking simulators I've played, and despite the story being open-ended, I didn't care much to look deeper into it. Perhaps it was simply too open-ended for me. With only the barest of explanations, along with not getting much of a look into the protagonist's life, I had no reason to do much beyond finish playing, shrug, and move on. One thing that I did find disappointing is that the game ends when it looks like it could be much longer. I won't give away the exact reason for this, but it is an idea that has potential. It just didn't go anywhere with the part at the end. If it was a really bad game, I would be glad that it ended quickly. Instead, I felt let down because this small idea barely took off. I've seen some people claim that the static speaks my name has changed their lives. Certainly plenty of players have enjoyed it. If you think you would be interested in it, give it a try. As for me, it felt like a short story that didn't have enough substance to make it worth recommending. I don't regret playing it, but I also don't see much of a reason to do so.

text: This game is not only incredibly easy, but also incredibly boring. I played this game for a total of 12 minutes, I got bored after about 5 minutes. It consists of badly-animated monsters that make some 'scary' sounds running towards you, and of you easily killing them with some magical spells while trying to figure out what the point of the game is. In the end you are stuck with a... 'Boss' (a slightly bigger and 'scarier' monster) that is killed in 10 seconds. After that, you are stuck in the room in which the boss was, no way to end the level or something. Pros: Cheap (paid 0.2‚Ç¨ fpor it thanks to a -90% coupon) Has trading cards Cons: The game itself

Wargaming used to have an awesome game. And they have ruined it with simple greed. World of Tanks was the same way. Ruined by sheer greed. The game is super unbalanced and thhey keep adding more and more pay to win ships and neglecting older ships... such as Nagato, Pensacola, and even the Montana. Now they are giving a 95% discount for a starter pack... which only works if you never had an account. Your Normal WoWS account doesnt link with STEAM, so downloading through STEAM won let you play your normal WoWS account... hence why I have .1 hours on STEAM. Avoid this game like the plague. Wargaming has ruined the game to the point that its unplayable.

text_translate: WARNING! Beware of this fraudulent developer/publisher! Purchased rOt 2 legally on a bundlesite in October 2018. Now, two years later, the developer revoked the keys from all accounts from users who bought rOt 2 in a bundle. He claimed that he has been ripped off by the bundle seller. So what's to do now? Yes, punish the customers who bought his game in good faith. After complaints in the forums, he deleted all his comments and changed his name from "Lospi" to "LaPlace". Hey dev, if you‚Äôre having trouble with a retailer that you‚Äôve given your keys to for sale, don't punish us, the buyers! We're not the ones who wanted to harm you.

text: Whilst having an ambitious story, the uncoordinated art style and generally predictable characters in 'By Moonlight' tainted the experience. You're given the illusion of choice whilst going through a linear story line, with an unsatisfying ending. The story attempts to present endearing characters, though is unable to present them as anything other than two dimensional . The choice system implemented results in no real consequence, and the 'bad endings' often took an odd thematic turn, leaving an unpleasant taste. However, the game shines with clever dialogue and an exciting premise, albeit dissapointingly never fully developed.  When dedicated, the game presents a playful and fun vibe, genuinely enjoyable, though this is diluted through a weak story line and somewhat lazy art style. Considerable care has been clearly invested, yet this ultimately fails to pay off as a worthwhile experience.

text: Schrott

The game itself is amazing, good graphics and makes you feel the adrenaline of each situation (taming attacking etc...). It plays grate, it looks grate, there is plenty to do and see... i have 900 hours and still there is stuff i have never done/seen. I have been in big tribes to small tribes and solo in  official and private servers. The thing that killed the game is the "Ark Travel": this feature allows other tribes to travl to another ark full equiped and wipe it. Obviously so in a few minutes, all the progress that u might have done its gone. As a friend of mine said " 90% of the time your fine but then a big group of players from a diffrent server comes and starts killing at random... with the reson of 'we just want to make fun'"   And its not a one off thing,it happens time and time again, you lose all your stuff and you never see them again. I want to recommend this game but this abouse on players doesn't allow me to do it. The grafics are fabulous, the game play is even better.... but the constant greefing is the game breaker, and the devs seem to not listen to the playes on this isue. But I recomend it to a solo game but it isn't much fun. You can take a private server but for one to four friends it might be expensive. Grafics 9/10 [some bugs and glitches] Content 10/10 Stability 7/10 [conection problems, crashing problems] 85% of the player base 10/10 [most are nice people that just want to have fun, trade items.... or just go fishing, its the 15% that make the game  unplayable].
everything you hear about it.... is all true

Negative Punkte weshlab das Spiel nen Daumen runter bekommt w√§ren da zb. - Das Matchmaking System ist unterirdisch schlecht , man wird in den Clankriegen mit Clans zusammengew√ºrfelt die zum einem vom Level und von der Ausr√ºstung her schon garnicht passen (zum beispiel man selbst zu 3 mit Level 1-15 und der Gegner zu 5 mit Level 37-50) also so fern man selbst niemanden hat der dort 3-4 stellige Betr√§ge an Echtgeld reinsteckt hat man von der Ausr√º√ütung (erfahrung ganz zu schweigen) gar keine chance  - Es gibt verschiede Spielmoduse die teilweise gar solo sein sollen (Battel Royal zb. , wobei das hier eher Hungerspiele hei√üt ^^) man aber dennoch √úBERALL die M√∂glichkeit besitzt mit seinen Leuten reinzugehen und dort dann den Server zu √ºbernehmen  - Das Spiel ist kostenlos aber dennoch bereits fertig und daf√ºr noch teilweise recht verbugt , wobei die h√§lfte von dem was nach einem Fehler ausschaut dann doch nur auf die fantastische Zusammenlegeung der Leute liegt , so wie es manchmal lagt , warscheinlich Leute aus Europa mit Leuten aus Asien zusammengeschmie√üen , wobei das nicht m√∂glich ist da Server immer Regions begunden sind ^^ aber es kommt halt so r√ºber :D ( Rechner defenitiv nicht dran schuld da neu und neue Spiele dort auf Ultra fl√ºssig laufen :P) - gibt vielleicht noch paar mehr dinge die mir jetzt gerade mal wieder nicht einfallen , schreibt sie halt dazu aber mir pers√∂nlich reicht das aus um dann doch wieder zur Wurzel Agar zur√ºck zu gehen da wie gesagt die Clan Sache eh nicht funzt.

text_translate: This game is a joke and nothing like CK2 was. CK3 is a game like Risk with added fluff in the form of dynasties. people and setbacks in the form of inheritances. If you never got a clue how to play CK2 you can be very happy of CK3, because you simply can't understand how complex CK2 was when compared to CK3, and hence what a bad joke CK3 is. That's why I can recommend CK3 to people who are clueless of CK2.  But if you are a CK2 veteran and think about getting the same depth in CK3 I can never recommend CK3 to you. All you get in CK3 is a lot of fluff while you lose a ton of depth and strategy available in CK2. I myself therefore give negative recommendation to this game because fluff aside this is a lot less than CK2 was, and simply bad, if you expect to get something more complex than Risk is and as you can expect. If you buy a Porche which have top speed of 80 km/h you are unhappy for a reason, and your opinion is justified. CK2 is a Ferrari disguised as an Opel. CK3 is an Opel disguised as a Ferrari. * * * The new guaranteed fabricated casus belli in short amount of time has made the game a loller faith game, meaning a huge layer of strategy and core game play has been removed. You used to have to do a lot of marriage game to get heirs and people with inherited claims. You also had to use weak claims, meaning claims you can only press if the current holder is incapable, underage, or woman.  In CK2 you treasured people with claims, they were very important. You even had to work on getting people who have claims to your lands to your court, so that CPU can not use so easily their claims against you. People mattered! They were the core. Now in CK3 people are nothing, you just click and get casus belli, automatically and guaranteed, after a short amount of time. And like that would not be enough cheese, you can use learning life style trait and buy a claim instantly with some small amount of piety.  That means that now you can just save your siblings for super OP automatic alliances, which does not even break if you don't go yourself help in war, and the CPU come help you like always in your wars. People do not matter anymore a bit, and you just keep your baby factory rolling for  super OP alliances. Imagine a game focused on people where those people does not actually matter anything? That is what CK3 is. In CK2 you had to evaluate very carefully will you use your kids to try get an alliance or should you use them to get claims inherited for their kids. If you married them off for trying to get an alliance you risked giving the possible ally claims on your lands via their future siblings. If you tried to get them marry for alliance and stay in your court the CPU answered "no, because of political concerns", they did not want to give you free claim for their lands, and in addition to that an alliance to keep you safe until you are good to attack them. That's why you even assassinated people having claims on your lands, so that you would be more safe and so that CPU would be more eager to make an alliance with you via marriage because they would get claims on your lands in the future. When you went to war you had to evaluate very carefully can you ask help because your ally could say "no", and then you were without protection of that alliance since alliance was broken, which could mess you a lot because it was not easy to get alliances and because of issues making alliances in the first place, and more, if you use your kids to get alliances you can not use your precious kid to get marriage where his siblings get claims for you. So you had to think are you a worthwhile ally for the CPU ruler you are allied with? What kind of ruler they have? What is their situation in the game map? Can they just break the alliance at first opportunity and then even attack you with claims you let them have with marriages you made for alliance in the first place?  In CK3 there is absolutely nothing of the very delicate diplomacy and strategies needed in CK2, of which some I very briefly explained above. It is just a loller click game. Therefore, sorry to say this, but the game is total crap. There is no uncertainty, hence there is no risk, and no risk makes the game just boring. There is no strategy and intrigue needed because you can just click & casus belli. The game is just bad if you expect to get an experience even remotely close to CK2. However, if you understand nothing of CK2 you can have very good time with CK3.

text: I really want to like Star Wars: Squadrons; when it was announced that this was mainly going to be a multiplayer space ship only helm'd by MOTIVE the same people responsible for the excellent star wars dogfight mode in Star Wars Battlefront 2 - it was a dream come true! AND with the ability to play in VR and using a joystick? Do you realize how exciting all that sounds?  Well for $40 you best get it on EA plays and here's why:  1) Two modes, small maps, 5 v 5.  Now you might say: "I don't see the problem, MOTIVE/EA is trying not to burden the server" that is the lamest excuse that i might ever heard of or any sort of reason not to bash this game. But you see just the idea of large scale space battles sounds awesome! That was the best part of EA Star Wars Battlefront 2 was the space fighting. However what we are reduce to is: Team Deathmatch, and Fleet Battles which is essentially a tug of war mode which pits two capital ships, two squadrons and you are essentially fighting back and forth until which either Capital ship explodes or time runs out.  And that's it. Yup, there's no 10 v 10; no Battle Royale (shockingly this game could've totally gotten one), no escort defend missions, no co-op side gigs; nothing really. Just two modes, small maps, 5 v 5. 2) Discrepancy lobbies As i mentioned at the start of this review you can play via joystick; why do you need to know this? Well in line with odd TTK placements; it's basically a death warrant if you decide to play with anything else BUT a joystick. It's an automatic pass if you don't have one; period. Even with adjustments to controls with a controller and/or mouse-keyboard. It also doesn't help that you are place in lobbies with higher ranking pilots that have a better loadout; sure the game recommends tutorials and such. But not the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, unranked bot lobbies (which should be your number one thing first to test the waters really). Buy a joystick, don't use mouse & keyboard, controller. You will regret it and rage a lot out on this game. 3) Customization is limited (Unless you grind for the renown and parts) to upgrade and fit your ship and pilot.  You can't REALLY customize a whole lot, the alien races of the Rebel Alliance are locked behind renown, you can't change hair styles, colors, nothing really. Just templates which reminds me of EA Sports Madden titles of today. That goes double with the helmets, outfits, ships, etc. Which is understandable but when you really break it all down - you begin to see that cracks and realize: "They could've done this a whole different way" and i agree 4) Technical bug and other issues Besides the top three issues apparently HOTAS joysticks are having issues, as well as refresh rates, supposedly TTK is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•'d and players are constantly abandoning the lobby. Hopefully this gets resolved quickly Is there any ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• positives?  Well the fact that you can fly cockpit mode in the iconic Star Wars ships of the Alliance and Empire is really freaking sweet! Even better in VR. The sounds, visuals are really great - as for the story; it's okay; it's your typical "Let's do a story but really the main meat is the multiplayer"  Also for closing statements; playing solo is rough in multiplayer definitely get your "own" squadron WHICH BY THE WAY THERE IS NO SQUADRON-CLAN TAG IN THIS GAME; SERIOUSLY?! You can level up through fighting bots but only in Fleet Battles which is an odd choice Overall more modes are sincerely needed, and for the love of god; i know this was a decision made already; but seriously increase the lobby size. And in addition add more cosmetic options you have bare bones here that could've been worth the $40 or heck even $60! But sadly, you missed the mark. Whether or not it's out of pettiness or spite who knows; do the research, wait and/or invest in EA plays and try the game out before committing to that $40 price tag.

text: Path of Exile is an excellent game, but requires a significant investment of information and experience to become familiar with the game systems in order to just do whatever you want and be successful with it. If you are a newer player you must resort to using the game's forums to find a build that works at the current time of playing - and the website is very cluttered and disorganized when it comes to the forums.  Furthermore, you'll need a plethora of 3rd party websites in order to enjoy the game with an optimal experience. Beyond that, the more interesting mode of play are seasonal challenge modes that last for several months, where your character and possessions are sent to a nonseasonal mode that lacks any of the challenges from season, resulting in very stale and boring gameplay. It is worth noting that the customer support is incredibly slow, I've had a bug that has disconnected me every few times I hit a loading screen (which is incredibly often in this game using portals) - and it has taken over a week in the past just to get minor problems resolved - whereas this one is gamebraking (literally rendering the game unplayable). Lastly, this game used to be excellent for the F2P model, but now there are so many things you need to put into your very limited, free stash, that the handful of "bank" space they give you is by far unacceptable now. I would advise a minimum purchase of 20-40 dollars of ingame currency to expand your bank tabs in order to have an enjoyable experience. Overall, if you don't have an issue crawling the forums and referencing 3rd party websites several times an hour, investing $20, and diving deep into the poorly arranged/categorized build section of the forums, then this game can have a deep, fulfilling and rewarding experience. To me, the investment is just too deep of time and money to recommend this game as a F2P game to anyone new.

text_translate: Usually i don't give games negative reviews but i'm seriously super iffy about this game. I entered it thinking it was a horror game with a plot twist somehow waiting to happen, but instead it turned out to be a interactive exploration game about some girl coming out to her family and running away with her lover. You explore a entire house and each room has clues of the story and you slowly stitch everything together. This might of been the kick off of the "Walking Simulator" genre popularity but it did not sit well for me. Either way, if you love short interactive explorers with serious story telling check it out, i'm sure you'll enjoy it

text: Unfortunately it doesn't seem like Mediatonic are serious about maintaining the longevity of this game. The new season includes only 4 new maps, 2 of which can hardly be considered new, and they couldn't even be bothered to commit to the supposed medieval theme. The older maps haven't been touched and the game is now an aesthetic mess. Unity's level editor is extremely intuitive and I expected far more from something branded as an entirely new season. They had a long time to develop a substantial amount of content, and their team is more than large enough for it. Programming 101 issues like players being able to use style tags in their names STILL haven't been resolved after months as well. This is a woefully repetitive game and if its developers don't have the ability to produce new content for it at a reasonable pace then it will continue to bleed players until it's a husk of its former self. I'm confident that the playerbase will be back to its pre-update numbers in only a couple of weeks. This is a really fun little party game, and you'll definitely get some enjoyment out of it if you purchase, but don't expect its success to last.

text: I've been playing on-and-off since launch, both through Steam and the ARC launcher. * The premium current starships are outrageously expensive. Outside of combo-packs, a top-tier ship costs about US$30. * Trying to buy starships is a test of patience. I bought a US$130 pack, didn't get the ships, and support had no ETA to a fix. After several months, they refunded me. * Trying to buy premium currency (ZEN) is also a test of patience. It took a week for the staff to approve a $100 purchase. * Trying to use paid-for ships is also a test of patience. I was locked out of one of my premium starships, with an error message saying "Unable to complete transaction: the price of the product has changed. Please verify the new price before purchasing." I reported it to support immediately, and it took them 35 days to correct the fault. * Bugs, bugs, bugs and more bugs. I'm talking about characters sitting through chairs, snapping and rubber-banding, wrong bridge crew showing on the bridge, characters with invisible arms and legs, uniforms missing pieces, quests that bug out and become unfinishable, and so on. I wouldn't recommend this game unless you are a huge Star Trek fan and have the patience of Job.

text: abandonware - don't touch
text_translate: As of right now, I would not recommend this game. It has so much potential, but it is ruined by a few things. The thing that absolutely kills this game is the input lag. It's like there is a 50ms input lag to the mouse and keyboard when playing this game. It almost makes me feel sick when I'm playing it. They should at least add a raw mouse input option in the final version of the game to alleviate the issue. I'm using a 144Hz G-sync monitor, and I'm playing the game at very high frame rates with high-end hardware. So my setup is not the cause of the input lag. It's the game. Another thing that ruins this is the match-making. It is pretty bad. There is no server browser so you have to rely on match-making. It takes around 20 minutes just to find a North American server, but it only takes a few minutes to find a European server. So if you are playing in the U.S. expect a high ping and further lag on top of the input lag. Also, expect your match to crash to the main menu often, and the only way to start a new match is to exit the game and wait until the match that you were in ends. Also, when you crash to the main menu, most of the interface gets broken. I do like that there is a global chat box in the main menu because you're gonna need to talk to people to get some help on the game mechanincs. The tutorials aren't that good, and they don't go into the details of how everything works. Once you figure out how everything works and you start playing the game, it can get somewhat addicting. The final thing that ruins the game is the repair times for weapons and armor. I've seen it take up to 18 real hours just to repair a damaged weapon or armor, and you can't upgrade your weapons or armor until they are repaired. In order to get fast repair times you have to pay real money. Kinda greedy there. If it wasn't for those major issues, the game would actually be really good. The graphics are fairly decent with beautiful atmosphere. Some of the textures are really low-res though. Also, the weapon models and textures look really good as well. There are tons of free weapons in this game, and each of the four factions have their own weapon sets. You can also spend real money on premium weapons. This kinda makes the game a little unfair though. There are three team-based game modes to play right now. There is TDM, a conquest-style mode called "Research", and a mode where teams fight to collect all of the batteries before the other team does called "Battery Retrieval". I only got to play TDM and Research because they are the only modes that match-making would find for me. The maps are also pretty large. They aren't even close to the size of Battlefield maps, but Survarium's TDM maps are much bigger than Battlefield's TDM maps. Also, the anomalies in the game are just purely frustrating. They block access to many parts of each map, and they will kill you if you just barely get in the vicinity of them. If you get a high enough isolation percentage on your armor you can capture them, but be prepared to grind for 50+ hours just to get to that point. I think there is a faction that is immune to anomalies, so that makes the game extremely unbalanced right off the bat. Once you collect an anomaly, they can be used as perks during that match. I don't know how useful they are because I never got good enough armor to collect them. The only purposed they served as for me were colorful, route-blocking death objects. The game gets extremely frustrating if you get paired up with players that are two or more tiers higher than you are. If you are a tier three player going against a tier five player or higher, prepare to get owned. At that point the enemies just become bullet sponges, and it becomes impossible to get kills. The only way to truely enjoy this game is if you are playing with people that are in the same tier as you (or with people no more than one tier higher than you are). The game is also slightly pay-to-win, but it's not that bad. I've had lots of fun with this game, but I eventually got fed up with the input and server lag, so I unistalled it. I will definitely reinstall this game when it leaves early access though.

text_translate: Buggy and inconsistent. One moment a power line works, then if you have to remove it and put it back, it no longer works.  A power line from the source, does not provide power to something with in 150u, despite the line being blue. Teleporting 150u works with one teleporter, but not the teleporter next to it. You have to trick things into filling correctly, to get what you want made on a base. Most buildings do not have snap points with other categories. Auto targeting can not be turned off, so regardless of where you aim, your shots will target an enemy close by, instead of blasting the doors. Boosting... if there what the game considered an "object of interest" (eg: Space Station) between you and your chosen destination, it will automatically lock onto said object and go there instead, forcing you to take a round about way to get there. So many arbitrary limits on things too, and none of it stated anywhere in-game. How long can a power line go? What is "short range" for a teleporter? Why do I have to read a guide for this information and why does it not even seem consistent? The game has come a long way, but the developers have yet to fix many of the bugs users complain about. New content is nice, but not if players stop playing due to these bugs. Suggestion to the developers: Fix issues for a while. There is enough content for the time being.

text_translate: This still feels like a very early access game even though it somehow isn't. The screenshots are very selective in making the game look better than it does when actually playing. The game was fun for a little while, until I decided to fight a large amount of zombies and position myself at the top of a set of stairs. The zombies then clipped through the stairs making them impossible to hit as they got closer and hit me anyways. It was frustrating and felt very janky. The really frustrating part however was when the game reloaded me at the last checkpoint without any guns making the game impossible to progress as there weren't any others around I could get and I searched all over for the ones I had. After the respawn it also wouldn't allow me to walk through a hallway I had walked down prior to dying, the game would just get buggy feeling when trying to aim the path finding movement. Walking a few feet from the main path and you can see through the terrain and see the inside of hollow floating rocks making the game feel very unfinished and definitely lacking any polish or attention to detail. The shooting mechanics work alright and the game feels fine when it works, but many issues led the game to be unplayable in less than an hour which is a big disappointment. This game is absolutely not worth $40, maybe on a very steep discount it is fine to screw around in, but the game feels unfinished and abandoned. The controls are regularly frustrating and just moving around is annoying as it subtly twists you each time you move making it hard to line yourself up. The game at best feels like a clunky old arcade light gun shooter, though most of the time it seems like it would actually feel better as a game on rails to help hide all of the bad aspects of the game. Being one of the early big VR titles it had some room for forgiveness, but at this point it feels very outdated and rushed out the door to be an early VR title to get out before the competition. Visually the game feels like an asset flip game with many visuals feeling like they were pulled from a PS3 game, once again the screenshots do not look like the true in game experience even with the highest graphics settings using a Valve Index.

text: Jeez, where to start? I'll adress some of the critiques I've read in the reviews so far. Confirmed: - Looks unfinished. (boring menus devoid of ANY of MvC's usual flair) - Backgrounds are lifeless. (very untraditional for this franchise) - Music (Is there any? I can't remember...not a good sign) - Mechanics (gotta bring in the casual gamers, I get it) The Roster: I purchased Injustice 2, on PS4, which came with a very good starting roster and is only getting better as new toons drop. This game, the starting roster is ok, not great, not good, just ok. I'm hoping the toons to come may help this situation. No X-Men: You can thank lawyers and licences for this. As long as Fox Entertainment holds the movie rights to the X-Men and Fantastic 4, don't expect Disney/Marvel to allow ANY kind of promotion of those characters on their part. What may have gone wrong?: Disney's true face is begining to show as they begin to push their greed and ideologies on us all. My guess is Disney charged way too much to licence their characters. (Notice how Rocket Racoon and Groot are represented by their movie likeness because they aren't real people, whereas Gamora does not look like the actress who protrayed her...that would cost more than Capcom could afford.) My guess is the game looks like this due to Capcom needing to reduce staff (animators are always first to go), probably demanding lots of unpaid overtime, all due to Disney's greedy prices for their licences, all resulting in the lack luster quality of this product. Conclusion: I'll be keeping this game, but purley from a market research perspective. If you want a good game, my suggestion, play Injustice 2. It's great. It beats this game in EVERY category. This game is in NO WAY near worth the asking price.

text: I bought this game end of October and I was quite impressed with it. But after playing it for 500 hours it's somewhat important to write a follow-up after getting some experience. So, here's my first, early access review:  "After playing this game for over 80 hours, I can say it's quite infectious and addictive. The game is flawed, the optimization is awful and BattlEye cheat detection isn't perfect, but overall it's a game with an original idea and is worth playing and is worth your 30 dollars." And today, end of February I can say that there is more bs from devs, more cheaters and less useful updates. We're getting useless cases nobody asked for, like the Militia and Fever crates. Why aren't we getting more bans. A few days ago I got teamkilled by a Chinese guy because I had a supressed AWM. I check his op.gg and even after my report, he's still playing like nothing happened. Also, a guy fires 20 bullets at me with a SCAR-L from over 200 meters with a 4x, and even after my cheating report, he's still playing. Why aren't you doing anything about the reports Bluehole? Where's our region lock so we can block out players that have a desync and high ping advantage? Am I paying this much for my 250 mbps internet to get killed by a asian cheater in PUBG? F-ck you Bluehole and Brendan Greene for even trying to blame the players and not the cheaters and arseholes. When we get a region lock, I'll consider giving the game a positive review.
text_translate: Ich habe damals, wie wahrscheinlich viele andere, mit der DayZ Mod f√ºr ARMA 2 angefangen. Mir hat die Mod sehr viel Spa√ü gemacht, mir war jedoch die Technik schlichtweg zu alt und zu gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig, ich freute mich also trotzdem sehr auf die Standalone. Nun, nach fast 150 Spielstunden, m√∂chte ich mich einmal √ºber das Spiel auslassen. 1) Technik Ich fange direkt mit dem schlimmsten an: Die Technik in der Standalone ist das Allerletzte. Es gibt Leute, die haben einen 0815-Aldi-PC und bei denen l√§uft das Spiel wie geschmiert - auf der anderen Seite sind dort Leute mit den teuersten High-End-Rechnern, die froh sind, wenn sie mal die 15-fps-Marke √ºberqueren. Auch ich hatte mit meiner Hardware noch nie Probleme mit √ºberhaupt irgendeinem Spiel, aber DayZ zwingt meinen PC in die Knie. In gro√üen St√§dten ist das Spiel beinahe unspielbar ... sollte ich dort mal in ein Feuergefecht geraten, ziehe ich definitiv den K√ºrzeren. Bugs wo man nur hinsieht. √úberall Bugs. Technisch gesehen l√§uft einfach nichts in diesem Spiel. Ich lese st√§ndig die Patchnotes, in denen mit riesigen Bugfixes geprahlt wird - bis ich feststelle, dass nur halb so viele Bugs gefixt wurden, wie Neue dazugekommen sind. Das macht mich einfach sauer. 2) Patches Es gab bereits unz√§hlige Patches mit Neuerungen. Auch hier kann ich die Entwickler nicht verstehen. Ich habe Verst√§ndnis daf√ºr, dass die Entwickler in einem Zwiespalt stecken ... die eine H√§lfte der Spiele m√∂chte endlich neue Features, die andere H√§lfte m√∂chte, dass die aktuelle Technik einfach funktioniert. Ich geh√∂re zur letzteren H√§lfte. Ich finde es schlichtweg unbegreiflich, wie man seine Priorit√§ten so setzen kann ... immer mehr und mehr und mehr Neuerungen ins Spiel bringen, obwohl nicht mal die Dinge funktionieren, die bereits ins Spiel implementiert sind. Es gab so viel √Ñrger bis dato ... ich kann mich an diesen gro√üen Patch erinnern, der alles √§ndern sollte. Der das Loot-System komplett √ºberarbeiten und das Spiel viel besser machen sollte. Was war? Das System hat danach √ºberhaupt GAR NICHT mehr funktioniert und man musste alles wieder r√ºckg√§ngig machen. Und so l√§uft es seit dem Release. Es macht einfach keinen Spa√ü mehr. 3) Survival-Aspekt und PvP Das, was das Spiel f√ºr mich ausmacht, ist der Survival-Aspekt. Man sollte sich am Leben halten. Hinzu kommt, dass DayZ ja ohnehin das Menschen-Experiment schlechthin ist ... trifft man auf Fremde, hat man nicht viel Zeit zu √ºberlegen, ob diese einem wohl freundlich gesinnt sind, oder eher nicht. Das hat das Spiel f√ºr mich spannend gemacht. Das hat das Spiel f√ºr mich ausgemacht. Die ersten 10-20 Stunden empfand ich das noch als relativ angenehm. Man hat viele freundliche Spieler getroffen. Heutzutage trifft man NUR NOCH (wirklich AUSSCHLIE√üLICH) unfreundliche Menschen ... es wird SOFORT geschossen. Die Regel in DayZ-Standalone: Wer zuerst entdeckt wird, ist schon sogut wie tot. Was f√ºr ein tolles Spielprinzip. Mir ist klar, dass das Bestandteil des Spiels ist, aber in der Standalone hat dies im Laufe der Alpha ein solches Ausma√ü angenommen, dass es nicht mehr feierlich ist. Zum Teil kann ich das sogar verstehen. Ich kann mich an die Zeiten erinnern, wo auf den meisten Servern das Loot-System so derma√üen kaputt war, dass man rein gar nichts mehr an Lebensmitteln gefunden hat. Da h√§tte wahrscheinlich jeder den anderen get√∂tet, um nur eine Flasche Wasser oder eine Banane abzugreifen. Als diese Zeit begann, h√∂rte ich auf zu spielen. Ich habs viele Monate sp√§ter wieder versucht, doch bis dato hat sich nicht viel dran ge√§ndert. Es ist sogar noch schlimmer geworden. Man findet teilweise stundenlang nicht mal einen einzigen Zombie. Man ist also quasi dazu gezwungen, PvP zu spielen, damit √ºberhaupt mal etwas passiert. Dieses Spielprinzip kotzt mich einfach nur an hoch 10. Das Spiel erlebt quasi regelm√§√üig einen kompletten Sinneswandel. Zu einem bestimmten Zeitpunkt findet man alle 5 Meter ein Maschinengewehr oder eine andere dicke Wumme samt Munition ... dann kommt der n√§chste Patch und pl√∂tzlich muss man 5 Stunden lang spielen, um mal etwas Dosenfra√ü zu finden. Was zur verdammten H√∂lle soll das? 4 Fazit) Das Einzige, was mich noch bei diesem Spiel h√§lt, sind meine Freunde. Ab und an ringt man sich dann doch einmal durch, das Spiel anzuschmei√üen und mit seinen Freunden √ºber die Map zu latschen. Bei mir pers√∂nlich h√§lt dies allerdings nicht sehr lang an ... wie oft ist es mir passiert, dass ich stundenlang spielte, eine sehr gute Ausr√ºstung hatte und pl√∂tzlich an einem 1m tiefen Graben gestorben bin? Ich habe darauf einfach keine Lust mehr. Ich pers√∂nlich bleibe zum aktuellen Zeitpunkt 100 mal lieber bei der Mod. H√§tte ich das alles vorher gewusst, h√§tte ich nie und nimmer 30‚Ç¨ f√ºr so einen Haufen Schrott ausgegeben. Ich hoffe wirklich sehr, sehr, sehr, dass das alles eine gute Wendung nimmt ... ich bin gespannt. Die Hoffnung stirbt zuletzt ... Kleine Nebeninfo: Wenn ihr mir jetzt mit dem Alpha-Ged√∂ns kommt, dann k√∂nnt ihr mir mal den Buckel runterrutschen.  Muss ein gutes Gef√ºhl f√ºr die Entwickler sein, sich auf dem sanften "Alpha-Versions-Kissen" auszuruhen. Egal was passiert, man kann immer sagen, dass ja √∂ffentlich darauf hingewiesen wurde, dass es sich lediglich um eine Alpha-Version handelt. Sch√∂n und gut, dass man darauf hinweist, man sollte eine solche Ausrede aber nicht nutzen, um seinen Kunden das Geld aus der Tasche zu ziehen und die ganze Sache bis aufs gr√∂bste hinauszuz√∂gern, sondern um einige, kleine Fehler zu entschuldigen und die Hilfe der Community anzunehmen und diese Fehler zu beseitigen. Das Spiel befindet sich seit 2 Jahren in einer Alpha und daran wird sich auch erstmal nichts √§ndern. Man muss sich das auf der Zunge zergehen lassen ... 2 Jahre und wir haben noch nicht mal eine Beta erreicht. Dank DayZ habe ich nun eine ganz andere Sichtweise von "Early Access" ... denn im Falle von DayZ ist "Early Access" wohl gleichbedeutend mit einer 10-j√§hrigen Alpha-Version. Das Spiel kommt einfach √ºberhaupt nicht voran, NULL. Ich pers√∂nlich fand DayZ in seinem Anfangsstadium sogar besser, als zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt. Eine wirklich peinliche Aktion und wenn das so weitergeht, wie bisher, dann wird das Spiel wirklich noch mindestens 2-3 Jahre in der Alpha-Phase bleiben ... UPDATE AM 05.01.2018 Nach etlichen Monaten habe ich mich nun noch einmal an DayZ versucht und nach etwa 20 Stunden in den letzten 2 Wochen muss ich sagen - ich bin positiv √ºberrascht. Die Performance hat mittlerweile einen deutlichen Schub bekommen, viele nervige Bugs wurden beseitigt und sogar das Loot System scheint mittlerweile zu funktionieren. Man findet ganz gut Loot, trotzdem aber nicht ZU viel, damit es zu einfach wird. Der Loot ergibt derweil auch Sinn - in Krankenh√§usern gibt es Medic-Loot, in Feuerwachen gibt es Feuerwehrklamotten und √Ñxte, in Polizeiwachen gibt es Pistolen und kleinere Maschinenpistolen. Die meisten Dinge funktionieren derweil nicht perfekt, aber doch schon bedeutend besser, als fr√ºher. Zombies gibt es derweil recht reichlich und sie agieren auch relativ nachvollziehbar. Sie sind nicht overpowered, aber auch nicht zu schwach. Derweil macht es sogar endlich mal Sinn, an ihnen vorbeizuschleichen. Einige Dinge sind noch etwas seltsam ... will man ein Lagerfeuer machen, nimmt der Spieler automatisch einen Stock in die Hand und legt daf√ºr die Nahkampfwaffe ab. So kann es passieren, dass man unbemerkt die Nahkampfwaffe verliert. Manchmal verschwinden auch Sachen im Inventar, weil diese v√∂llig unlogisch in irgendein Beh√§ltnis gepackt wurden. Das ist teilweise etwas nervig, ABER man kann sich dran gew√∂hnen und dann auch dagegen arbeiten und dann funktioniert es auch. Hier und da noch immer ein paar Bugs - aber ganz ehrlich ... es wird langsam. Ich bin wirklich positiv √ºberrascht von der 0.62. Nach ewig langer Zeit macht mir DayZ mal wieder Spa√ü. Bitte versaut es nicht wieder!!!!!! Den Daumen lasse ich trotzdem unten - die Entwicklungszeit ist einfach bis dato viel viel zu lang.

text_translate: I got the game expecting another metro game but honestly I cannot recommend this game. Overall it's clunky, they removed the health regen entirely and enemies have weird phases where at one point they aim like snipers and another they aim like stormtroopers so here is all I can say. Pros: - Beautiful game - Interesting enviornments - Enjoyable story Cons: - No health regen makes the game feel grindy because you need to constantly craft syringes - Obnoxious "blood splatter" effect on the corners of your screen even if you're lightly hurt - The smallest drops causes you to take damage - Enemy AI is just upsetting when it comes to humans Conclusion: I would only recommend buying this game when it goes on sale and even then expect a lot of nuisances and clunkiness that you wouldn't otherwise see in the other metro games. I feel all development went into the graphics rather than actualy gameplay.
I can't recommend this game because of the horrible FOV. Not to mention, it does not feel like an Ace Combat game anymore, but I'm fine with that. Wish they released AC6 instead.

text: After a couple of trials at a play through on the   setting, due to previously read reviews, and miserably failing at least half of the quests I can only confirm that the developers haven't play-tested this game at all. I understand people who want to get 100% achievements, but if you can't run through the game without too much stress on the easiest difficulty, you need to re-balance the game. Make the easiest run, easy, normal slightly harder and then amp up the difficulty for achievement hunters, but keep that only on the hardest of settings. * Overly-difficult and annoying even on the easiest difficulty. If this is easy, I don't want to try anything harder. * English translation is atrocious and often times incredibly difficult to understand. * The artwork and graphics are generally ok, with the bright colour palette being the saving grace. * Music and sound effects are ****. No effort put in here at all. * Many of the quests such as "Christianity" are not explained at all, nor do they give hints of what you need to do while you're getting punished for 20 turns. Only after you've already failed them do you get a hint as to how to pass it next time... and then you get punished literally 7 times worse for a further 20 turns. * Way too many bugs just randomly popping up. * It has potential to be a fun and relaxing game, but not at this punishing of a difficulty. * The price is right, particularly on a big sale. I cannot in my right mind recommend this game to anyone, unless the devs fix the difficulty and get someone to proof-read and update the text. The explanations and guides (in-game or on Steam community section) need to be made available because the game's just not fun when it's damn near impossible.

Pour moi, il s'agit du pire volet de la saga. La bouillie, sans √™tre inf√¢me, est indigeste pour moult raisons √† commencer par son sc√©nario de progressistes 2.0 qui donne envie de se taper le cr√¢ne contre un mur tellement les tranches d'id√©ologies multiculturelles canadiennes sont distill√©es sans aucune g√™ne. D√©j√† que dans les autres volets, √ßa a tendance √† me gonfler mais alors l√†...Pocahontas de Disney est moins consensuel. C'est vous dire la dose de gerbe qu'il faut retenir √† chaque cin√©matique... Pire encore que le sc√©nario, les informations √† consulter dans l'animus sur les √©v√©nements, personnages ou lieux historiques. Vous aimez l'humour insupportable √† la Marvel ? Vous appr√©ciez taper sur l'histoire des m√©chants blancs au profit des minorit√©s opprim√©es ? Cette rubrique, fruit de l'accouplement de Satan et Bilal Hassani, est faite pour vous. J'ai jamais vu autant d'orientation id√©ologique et de conneries rassembl√©es dans une seule et m√™me production. Au dessus, c'est soit l'Histoire Mondiale de la France ou les √©missions d'Hanouna. Pour toutes ces raisons, le jeu est une disgr√¢ce inf√¢me. Le gameplay n'a pas boug√© d'un iota, on reprend donc les bons et les mauvais points. Votre personnage peut grimper un peu partout comme √† son habitude le truc c'est que courir √† proximit√© d'√©l√©ments du d√©cor ou d'un mur vous fera syst√©matiquement monter. On conna√Æt tous cela, dans certains cas c'est carr√©ment rageant. Contrairement aux √©pisodes pr√©c√©dents, le h√©ros est dot√© de gestuelles h√©rit√©es du parkour urbain en particulier lorsque vous sauterez par dessus des barri√®res. C'est pseudo styl√©, √ßa rappelle surtout que ce jeu s'adresse √† des ados et, par cons√©quent, me met mal √† l'aise car j'ai 31 ans. Bref, aucun changement significatif sur le gameplay hormis la navigation en mer. Introduction plut√¥t r√©ussie du prochain opus : Black Flag. La r√©alisation me conforte dans mon d√©sespoir et dans l'id√©e que m√™me avec beaucoup d'argent, du marketing √† √©chelle mondiale et une renomm√©e du m√™me type, Ubisoft ne sait pas faire de jeux sans sa pl√©thore de bug. En plus d'√™tre un jeu bugg√©, Assassin's Creed III est un jeu moche. Seule l'animation des personnages (du personnage central en fait) est r√©ussie, le reste est correct. Donc, le jeu est moche, la nature est laide m√™me T.E.S. Oblivion sorti en 2007 parvient √† rendre la nature dans un monde ouvert plus cr√©dible. Et Dieu sait que Besthesda en terme de moche et de bug sont champions hors-cat√©gorie. Bah non, Ubisoft en 2012 parviennent √† battre le record de m√©diocrit√©. Malgr√© un nombre de PNJ cons√©quent, les villes comme New-York et Boston sont comme d'habitude dans la s√©rie des Assassin's Creed, sans √¢me. Petit point positif les quelques monuments historiques sont, semble t-il, assez fid√®les √† la r√©alit√©. Le reste des villes est quelconque. Du c√¥t√© des petits trucs insupportables, il est assez impressionnant de voir le nombre incroyable de soldats de l'arm√©e royale dans les rues de Boston ou New-York. C'est juste sid√©rant. Il y a quasiment autant d'habitants que d'ennemis. Tu ne peux pas l√¢cher un pet tranquillement sans te retrouver avec douze soldats au fion pour te ratonner... Autre sujet, le menu est une bouse infinie +1 sans parler de la gestion du domaine tout sauf intelligible et ergonomique. A croire que les stagiaires pay√©s 2 Dollars de l'heure se soient charg√©s de r√©aliser cet aspect inutile du jeu. Ceci dit, cynisme √† part, j'ai bien aim√© les missions et l'ambiance qui r√®gnent sur le domaine : voir le village grandir, accueillir de nouveaux habitants etc. Un aspect que j'ai toujours appr√©ci√© dans les Assassin's Creed ! Tant que nous sommes dans les louanges, profitons-en, Ubisoft s'est enfin rendu compte que foutre des milliards de collectibles de merde √©tait une v√©ritable purge rajoutant artificiellement de la dur√©e de vie. Dans cet √©pisode, il y en a beaucoup moins sauf pour les plumes... Mais dans l'ensemble c'est positif. Pour conclure : sc√©nario nul √† chier sauf le twist du prologue, r√©alisation m√©diocre pour ne pas dire nulle, menu lourdingue et ergonomique comme le BIOS de votre ordinateur et bug √† foison. Merci Ubisoft d'oser sortir des merdes pareilles. Dieu merci j'ai pay√© ce jeu une bouch√©e de pain mais quand je pense qu'√† l'√©poque ces voleurs ont tent√© de vendre AC III 60 ‚Ç¨. Vous l'aurez compris, le Assassin's Creed III est le pire volet de la s√©rie officielle. Rien n'est bon, tout est moyen ou mauvais. J'esp√®re que Black Flag se rattrapera car la descente d'organe fut douloureuse. Je ne recommande pas sauf si on aime l'anale.

text: I will explain why I can't recommend this game. It is a quality game, nice graphics, sound, story and gameplay. It's fun! Although it's quite a bit different from the other Metro's, I think the changes are interesting. All the Metro games are unique and worth the experience. But this game is heavily flawed. Lots of annoying bugs, like you being stuck frequently. Or worse, the game frequently crashes regardless if DX11 or DX12. It also lacks basic options for configuring Video settings. In this department it looks like a game from 20 years ago. The saving system is terrible, missing a basic manual save option. All in all, I can't recommend any bugged game, even it is a well made game where people worked a lot to get it done. This game is not worth playing until it's QA is properly done, and we are more than a year after it's launch, so the chances are low that it will get fixed. It's sad, the Metro franchised deserved better. The first two games are not bugged like this one is, and they were incredible.

Tuttifrutti Interactive devs hire interns to hunt for people who play hidden object puzzle games and bribe them with a free key so they can write an "honest" - which is a totally dishonest positive review for Darkata. One of their interns with only 2 games in his library and level 1 profile found me and tried convincing me to play Darkarta, a game that came out in 2017 and that nobody cares about. When I told him I don't have this game in my library, he felt bad for me and out of complete pureness of his angelic heart and beautiful soul offered me a free key. On one condition though - if I promised to write an honest review. Nice chat with the intern: The devs banned my screenshot with the nice person for a reason - because they can't ban reviews. If they could, they would. A lot of positive reviews are coming from low level (lvl 1 - lvl 2) profiles that have 1-2 games in their library and no other reviews but "Darkarta". When I wrote this review on November 15th, 2020, today (November 17th, 2020) in two days alone, Darkarta gained 8 more fake positive reviews. Darkarta - a mediocre HOG game that came out in 2017 that nobody cares about. So here is my honest review: This game is just as generic as most hidden object games, the cheesy story and hollow characters, puzzles that don't make sense, bad voice acting, badly rendered scenes, strong & independent businesswoman. Nothing new here. If you're making a game to just grub a few bucks, what are you gaining from fake positive reviews? Does it feel good reading them knowing that you bribe people with free copies of your games? Why not just own up to it and accept your piece of art as it is? Why trick potential buyers with fake positive reviews?

text: I got this game because of the high percentage of positive reviews, but I should have known better, it's just another soulless cheap cash grab, which misuses the Early Access flag . You walk through the house, grab some keys and solve an easy "puzzle" to get out. It's super short, there's no story, bugs,  lvl design is abysmally poor and I could have sworn, I saw loads of the used assets in other UE4 games. If you don't get this game included in a bundle or just buy it because you want to have all games on steam - stay away. You'll find games with more depth and (horror)fun on gamejolt or itch.io for free.

text: Counter Strike: Global Offensive ist das allseits bekannte Russische W√∂rterbuch mit Wutausbruch Garantie und nervigen Menschen die ins Mikrofon br√ºllen.  Nicht zu vergessen, die ‚ÄûGeldverschwender Schleuder‚Äú die als Skins bezeichnet werden. Mit dem Geld was Value durch Kisten und den anderen Extras verdient, k√∂nnten sie die Gewinne in ein neues Spiel wie ‚ÄûHalf Life 3‚Äú oder wie geschehen Half Life Alyx einflie√üen lassen. Vorteilhaft w√§ren auch 128 Tick Server. F√ºr das Spiel spricht der Preis. Es gibt keinen. Es ist eine kosteng√ºnstige M√∂glichkeit mit Freunden Spa√ü zu haben, was m√∂glich ist, wenn das Spiel nicht ernst genommen wird. Und absolut niemand wird in 2020 eine ausrede haben, dass der Rechner zu langsam ist. Das Spiel l√§uft auch auf einer Kartoffel (muss eine gro√üe sein). Da ich nun mal wieder einige Zeit CS:GO gespielt habe, ist mir aufgefallen (...) nun, es ist eigentlich alles so, wie ich es 2015 hinterlassen habe. Na gut, schlimmer als fr√ºher.  Es gibt deutlich mehr Cheater oder Smurfs. Da hilft oft nicht mal das "total tolle" 'Prime'. Edit: Das "Prime"-System wurde weiter entwickelt und nennt sich jetzt eigentlich "TrustFactor". Ob es aber wirklich hilft, kann ich nicht beurteilen. Zu mal ein Prime-Status nun nicht mehr nur √ºber eine Telefonnummer vergeben wird. Es ist m√∂glichen diesen zu kaufen. Also, was n√ºtzt es, wenn Leute mit Spinbots dennoch nicht direkt von dem ach so tollen VAC System erkannt wird. Stattdessen aber Programme wie "CheatEngine" einen VAC Authentication Error ausl√∂st. Das Konzept der Kisten und Skins hat sich nicht ver√§ndert. In der Zeit sind sogar Handschuh-Skins dazu gekommen. Ich frage mich ja, wann Helme oder Schuhe als Skin ver√∂ffentlicht werden.   Nichts desto trotz, ist dieses Spiel das Absolute gute Beispiel daran, wie trotz Abzocke und st√§ndigen Wutausbr√ºchen die Sucht bestanden bleibt. Selbst, wenn man √ºberhaupt keine Lust mehr hat, kommt der Zwang immer weiter zu spielen doch mal wieder. Edit: 23.10.2020 Muss noch die 3k vollmachen. Private Matches sind schon okey. xD

text_translate: You leave your selected spawn point , start crouch running . You frequently hide behind cover but it doesn't matter because you get killed by someone whose position you have absolutely no knowledge of . The game doesn't provide a killcam either so you can't figure out where the sniper / demolitionist who killed you 5 times in a row is . You will die more than all the other games you have ever played combined  just in the first 1 hour . And honestly I do not see the fun in that . You rarely get a kill if you haven't joined the game early and picked sniper . Some maps do not have enough cover so you find yourself dying even more . I am convinced that only hardcore fps gamers play this and enjoy it . I wouldn't recommend ever buying it unless you are very skilled at this type of game. Overall I give it a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•/10 . Gave me brain tumors .

text: This game is so ugly
text_translate: As an Assassin's Creed fanboi, for many years i wondered if i should give a try to Chronicles, since they are not included in the saga history. So far, i'm not enjoying Chronicles China. Chronicles China gives you the history of Shao Jun, the Chinese assassin, Ezio meets on Assassin's Creed Embers. Shao is fighting against the templars of China in order to seek vengeance of the fallen Chinese brotherhood. I like the way they tell Shao Jun's journey with small interactive drawings and amazing art behind them, but the main problem with this game, starts right in the story telling, the accent. HOW IN THE HELL, a game, set on china, has actors that speak American English? is cringe, and breaks the immersion. This happened on Unity, and it happened in here aswell. Worse than that? is probably the mechanics they implemented on this game. Gameplay is completly destroyed by the horrendous controls... Most of your actions work by using 2 buttons at the same time, for example: - Throwing a knife, you need to press (F + G) and that is extremely unconfortable. Most of your actions that not running, crouching or climbing, are like that. - Blocking an attack ( D + C or A + C), now imagine doing that... - Blocking and rolling to the enemies back (D+C+SPACE) how in the hell i m going to do that? Last but not least, many times i witnessed, that Shao Jun doesn't react when pressing a button. There was times, i was behind an enemy, pressing "Mouse" in order to assassinate, and she simply doesn't react. Despite all those negative aspects that for me, kills the experience, i like the game environment, and the setting is obviously the main reason i bought the game, not many games are set on China. If controls were better, it would be an enjoyable experience.

text: This has been permanently free on the developer's website for a long time now (years, perhaps). Meaning that anyone who doesn't own this game who is reading this can be glad to know they can pay for this game exactly what this game is worth- nothing. [Meanwhile, having paid for the game, I just have to accept regret over the fact.] There's a laundry list of issues with the game, ranging from stability to interface to tech tree design to combat to AI to.. well, basically everything is lackluster. But see, I don't have to cover any of that in detail, because there's a much simpler way to describe this game: This game is a Master of Orion clone where each and every single gameplay system feels *significantly* dumbed down [combat most especially] compared to the game's spiritual predecessors, while none of the shortcomings of those predecessors are meaningfully addressed by this game.  In short, there's no real reason to play this game over games from the late 90s and early 2000s. Hell, even Wargaming's extremely shoddy MoO4 game is probably* somewhat more involved than this game [I haven't played MoO3, so I can't comment on that comparison].  * ( Honestly, both games have started getting confused in my head, with one mindnumbing, unpleasant, shallow MoO-imitating experience just kinda blurring into the other. ) The game does have several mods which improve the game, but with such a shallow foundation (this being one of the least fun 4x games I've ever played, along with MoO4) and with the mods only tweaking existing features using the limited modding functions the game has available, there's just not enough there to salvage this game. Again, this is free, so go make your own judgement. But if you've got something else to play, I really recommend you go spend your time there, instead. With both this and MoO4, I only feel like I wasted my time- and as someone who finds 4x/sim games [along with card, board, and racing games] easily appealing even when the games in question compare poorly to others in their genre, it's really a first for me to encounter games of that general style wherein I can't at least manage some sort of minor, niche engagement to make the experience worthwhile.  I've still got some hopes for Endless Space 2, since there's definitely a framework there that could be fun if it was fleshed out. The problem is that right now, you've got a skeleton without any flesh, that's even lacking internal organs in certain places [again, the combat is a huge disappointment, what with it effectively being nonexistant]. In essence, a prototype of a game. Which'd be fine if there weren't already other MoO clones, nevermind the original MoO games to compare [disfavorably] to.  Meanwhile, this game feels like the developers did hold an appreciation for the genre style they were working to, but that appreciation never seems to have turned into devotion, passion, or even just a strong interest. It feels like a child who loves puppies, got a puppy, and then realized that taking care of them was too much of a bother, and just kinda settled in the basic care necessities and then left the dog to its own devices. Put another way, the game (within its "collection" release) feels like the original Warlock: Master of the Arcane pre-DLCs, for anyone familiar with that rather shallow and lackluster experience. Unfortunately, that is a game which did also have several DLCs of its own, so that comparison isn't really a flattering one for Endless Space.

La verdad este juego tan esperado por muchos merece una review, una espera de 8 meses para tener semejante port.... pero un port mal hecho o hecho a "medias". Jugablemente es divertido si, tiene infinidad de cosas, misiones, etc todos lo sabemos, lo habia probado en consola en su momento pero todos esperabamos la versi√≥n definitiva en PC, para tener un resultado que se queda a medio camino... apenas. En lo tecnico le faltan muchos opciones gr√°ficas, el A-Antialising y los famosos FXAA/TAA no cambian muchos que digamos, conviene NO ponerlos pero cuando te quedas quieto se notan a leguas los dientes de sierra. Eso de quitar el Renderizado de Volumenes (Volume Rendering) para ganar fps y que no tenga bajadas de fps en si, es una total tomadura de pelo, por no decir que el port deja mucho que desear. Que no se puedan saltar cinematicas... en serio Capcom? WTF. Ademas que en resoluciones minim√°s a modo de prueba que hice tmb tiene sus bajones, los 60 fps no son muy estables dentro de un rato hare una √∫ltima prueba a 1080p e inclusive a m√°s resoluci√≥n pero no espero milagros, (tengo una I5 8600K + 1070 de 8gb para que se ahorren los comentarios). Sin contar las desconexiones que tiene al tratar de unirse a una party, y los crasheos. Ah y algo importante, GRAFICAMENTE esperaba algo m√°s, por no decir que esta muy desfasado, le√≠ por ah√≠ que Capcom sacar√° un parche de texturas en ULTRA en un tiempo... cosa que da gracia, o sea, estos 8 meses que hicieron?, parece que agarraron el juego asi nom√°s le metieron 2 o 3 cositas y listo, sale el port en PC, que se arreglen...   Por el momento no merece su precio de salida (rebajado valdr√° la pena cuando mejoren el port) estoy a casi nada del refund, una pena.

text_translate: TL:DR BORING !!! - bland and boring characters - even more bland, boring and character-less characters! - huge empty and again boring open world with unnecessary long and boring travel distances between mission and another! - world building is bland, lifeless and boring - story is .... oh is there a story?!! - graphics are anything but like the screenshots! bland colors and bad antialiasing, and WHY NO HDR?!!

text: Alter das ist doch nicht deren Ernst. Die Controlls sind total schlecht und das Trefferfeedback gibt es auch nicht. Da spiel ich lieber Fortnite im Epic Games Store und selbst das will man besser nicht spielen.

not much of a graphics upgrade with this 2013 remake. still looks very 2004. text is too small even tho i set it to 'huge'. sound is not good. lots of text reading with no voices. not very clear what i shd be doing. i just did the tutorial and was very bored and unimpressed. it has text only missions, which i'm sure will suck. ai seems very dumb. 3d land based rts missions seem like the best part, yet they are optional. but you can do that men of war thing where you take over a unit if you want, which i like. space combat is just simple 2d. your equipment breaks down so you have to do a lot of busy work constantly replacing and repairing stuff.  seems like most of the mini games are crap. this does not seem like a game i wd like. i regret buying it for the very high price of $7. shdve waited to get it for 33 cents in tier 1 of a bundle.

Als Nachfolger von State of Decay 1, wift einen dieses Spiel erneut in eine von Zombies √ºberlaufene Welt in der nicht nur der Kampf gegen die wandelnden Toten sondern auch jegliche Entscheidungen permanente Konsequenzen haben kann. Wie in Teil 1, setzten die Entwickler auch in diesem Spiel wieder auf den Survival-Faktor, was bei immer knapper werdenden Rohstoffen auf h√∂heren Schwierigkeitsstufen auch sehr sp√ºrbar ist. Welcher Schritt wird der Letzte sein, welche Entscheidung ist die Richtige!? St√ºck f√ºr St√ºck k√∂nnen Spieler dies beim Spielen in State of Decay 2 heraus finden und entweder beim ersten mal erfolgreich sein oder bei einem neuen Versuch. Leider wird die Qualit√§t von State of Decay 2 zu stark von einer Menge, teils zuf√§llig ausgel√∂sten, Bugs gemindert. Meiner Meinung nach so stark, dass ich vom Kauf des Spiel in seinem derzeitigen Zustand leider abraten muss. Hier eine Liste der Bugs die durchaus als *Game-Breaking* bezeichnet werden k√∂nnen; - AI von Companions (DLC - Heartland) setzt aus. Von dem Punkt weg reagieren die Companions auf nichts mehr und der Bug l√§sst sich durch ein neues Laden des Speicherstandes auch nicht beheben. (Spiel ¬¥muss dann von vorne begonnen werden) - Das Reperatur-Kit f√ºr die Fahrzeuge werden zu bomben. Bei Reperaturen von dem Zeitpunkt aus, explodieren die Fahrzeuge nur noch anstatt dass sie repariert werden. - Gegner Spawnen direkt bei den gesteuerten Charakteren. Im schlechtesten Falle, sind es viele m√§chtige Gegner und sorgen f√ºr den schnellen Tod des Charakters. - (DLC - Heartland) Manche Missionen erscheinen nicht mehr und die Story kann nicht mehr weiter fort gesetzt werden. Grunds√§tzlich ist zu sagen, h√§tte das Spiel durchaus Potential gehabt, doch wenn derartige Bugs nicht behoben werden und sie zuf√§llig spielende Personen treffen k√∂nnen, sollten die Entwickler nochmal an dem Projekt arbeiten um diese zu beheben. --------------------------------- 7/10 Gameplay, 8,2/10 Survival-Faktor, 4,8/10 Grafik (schon stark veraltet *sogar f√ºr Launchjahr*), 4,6/10 Soundtracks (Keine neuen Tracks seit State of Decay 1), 2,8/10 Character-Design (Charactere wirken schlampig designed) ---------------------------- - derzeit kann wegen der vielen Fehler im Spiel von meiner Seite aus kein Kauf empfohlen werden! -

text: I tried to like this game so much, and tried with tons of mods as well. It's just bad. In my time (60~ hours ish I think) I managed to do every quest in the game + DLC, level up to above what should really be considered max, find just about every easter egg, reveal every map marker/fully explore them all. That's pathetically short for a game like this, and the thing was, the entire time I was just hoping it would get better and not end on such a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• low note. Garbage story, garbage weapons, garbage customization, garbage crafting system, bullet sponge enemies (100+ rounds to kill super mutants? ok lol), garbage everything.... Bethesda really made this one a huge letdown.

text_translate: I wasnt receiving supply drops correctly so i decided that i need to go to support and write them . In my country is their support time from 8 PM to 5 AM . So i waited till the 8 PM then chat was online and i joined the que , where i was 50 . So after 4 hours of waiting in que , it was already midnight , finally agent was there and we were doing a lot of steps to fix this . After another 2 hours finally something worked and i get 3 rare supply drops as a gift from them . ( I should get much more , because after 4 days of playing i knew i get at least 8+ . ) But i told myself np now it is fixed i can go play . And it was fixed maybe for a few hours. Now again im not receiving them however support said it is fixed and i dont have time to be awake again untill 3AM to fix this . Other aspects of the game are good - Graphic , Story mode and a lot of multiplayer modes which i like . But i cant recommend this game to anyone of this bug that was fixed (they said it was fixed , but as i can see it wasnt ) a year ago but still there is a lot of people having this issue .
