text: Suck

For Honor is not a bad game. I wouldn't call it a good game either.  I would call this game a victim of multiplayer games on the rage. While the singleplayer is bare bones of a tutorial when it could have been such a powerful, fighting, singleplayer game. This game doesn't know what it wants to be. For Honor is a Medieval, PVP, Fighting game thats... slow. Its different. Its a game of patience. Its... boring. Unbalanced. Its not the game for me. It can be frustrating going up against someone who counters you and refuses to make the first move. As soon as you make the first move, its over. There is little room for recovery and too much punishment.  For honor has a good variety of characters with unique abilities. It can be very entertaining to spend time mastering each character. However, after that time is spent, you will figure out the core mechanics of the game run exactly the same. Dodge. Parry. Swing. Dodge. Parry. Swing. This is expected with a fighting game... but everything just feels clunky. It all feels too slow for a fighting game. This game just makes you wish you were playing a fast paced street fighter of the sort.  This game has quite a few different gamemodes, but you will only play   one of them. Duels. 1 v 1's. Now, you could go play 4 v 4s... but thats  . Or you could grind. But Ubisofts terrible matchmaking will be sure to have to matched against someone with much better stats. So toss out all those gamemodes that are 4 v 4s. While satisfying rounds can happen in multiplayer, at the end of the day, toxicity and Irritation rule the community. The community is awful. You will always run into someone who thinks they are hercules and will be a very poor loser with the childish excuses for "why they let you win". Multiplayer is toxic, boring, and, most importantly, not fun. It isn't worth the time learning the game to get good at. Even with its small bursts of triumph.  Its.. Bad. Really bad. The singleplayer of this game is basicly the very long tutorial of how to play every character in the game (well the 9 base characters). As you fight your way through this "campaign" you cant help but think about how awesome it could have been. If this game had instead focused on a story based game with perhaps some coop elements. Perhaps even castle sieges. The game could of been a lot more interesting at least to get into. Overall, dont waste your time on this game. There are many other games to spend it on that can satisfy your competitive needs.

[English Review] What to say about Destiny Warriors: the Way of the Ninja... "Did anyone see a ninja in this game? Let the creator of this game know that this is false advertising!" If it wasn't enough, this game has ridiculous and badly done maps, uncreative names, bad use of graphic and sound resources of RPG Maker. The game has third-party systems, graphics and music ...and there is no credits to anyone in any part of the game! Again, if it wasn't enough, the game is pure plagiarism of the anime Naruto. However not even as a copy the game got to be functional. It has terrible characters, and they do not even have motivation. Outside you will find out fighting several times, without even knowing why! The story of the game, as someone already said, appears to have been written by a 7 years old child... And believe me, I've seen good games made by children that can be better than a lot of games here on Steam. Not to mention the countless programming bugs, bad balanced enemies ... Seriously, you have over 15 spells, and only one of them causes some damage to enemies. Seriously, do not buy this game, even if it is for free. Or even if they pay you, do not play this piece of junk! It is not worth it in any way possible... Oh, and the part of "over 12 hours of gameplay", read it as: you will be 5 hours trapped in each puzzle, inside a maze with several forced battles. Resulting in more than 20 hours of torment, because the game does not know when to finish... And, yes, it has a continuation... but I hope it never goes out. But I doubt the efficiency of Steam to know when a game should be published or not. And I ask ... How can someone recommend a game badly made like that? --------------------------------- [PT-BR Review] O que dizer sobre Destiny Warriors: the Way of the Ninja... "Alguem viu algum ninja nesse jogo? Avisem ao criador que isso √© propaganda enganosa!" Como n√£o bastasse ter mapas ridiculamente malfeitos, nomes sem criatividade, p√©ssimo uso dos recursos graficos e sonoros do RPG Maker. O jogo tem sistemas, gr√°ficos e m√∫sicas de terceiros... e n√£o h√° creditos a ninguem em nenhuma parte do jogo! Como n√£o bastasse, o jogo √© um plagio sem tamanho do Anime Naruto. Por√©m nem como c√≥pia o jogo conseguiu ser funcional. Ele tem pessimos personagens, nem motiva√ß√£o eles tem. Fora que voc√™ vai se ver lutando diversas vezes, sem nem saber o porqu√™! A hist√≥ria do jogo como ja disseram parece ter sido escrita por uma crian√ßa de 7 anos... E acreditem, ja v√≠ bons jogos feitos por crian√ßas que conseguem ser melhores que muito jogo aqui no steam. Fora a exist√™ncia de inumeros bugs de programa√ß√£o, inimigos mal balanceados... s√©rio, voc√™ tem mais de 15 magias, e s√≥ uma delas causa algum dano ao inimigo. √â s√©rio, n√£o comprem esse jogo, nem se ele estiver de gra√ßa. Ou melhor, at√© mesmo se te pagarem, n√£o joguem esse lixo de jogo! Ele n√£o vale a pena em nenhum aspecto... Ah, e quanto a parte do "mais de 12 horas de gameplay", leia como: voc√™ vai ficar 5 horas preso em cada puzzle, dentro de um labirinto, com inumeras batalhas for√ßadas. Resultando em mais de 20 horas de tormento, pois o jogo n√£o sabe a hora de terminar... E, sim, ele tem uma continua√ß√£o... mas espero que ela nunca saia. Mas duvido da eficiencia do Steam em saber quando um jogo deve ou n√£o ser publicado. E pergunto... Como alguem consegue recomendar um jogo malfeito como esse?

text: awfull how can you make a game then make a dlc this bad. same thing over and over again never ending plus when you die you restart the whole round. I almost killed myself playing this
text_translate: This game was a masterpiece until they added the "Sunken Sins DLC," which is not actually a DLC, but a mandatory update that turns this brilliant piece of socio-religious storytelling into, for lack of a better description, a disease management sim. The addition of "afflictions" causes everybody in your village to get sick, and you will be scrambling to cure them throughout the entirety of the extended five-year playthrough. I also have no idea why they decided to extend the length of the game, as it adds nothing of value. Unfortunately, this new focus on curing afflictions completely overshadows the core of what the game is supposed to be - the detective work being performed by the high priest to expose sinners and sentence them to death. Instead, your goal is now to transform all of your followers into hideous mutants to make them immune to illness. If you manage to survive the entire five years while doing this, good for you - The RNG gods have smiled upon you. Either way, it's a tedious process that lacks any sort of strategy. Every action you take is out of necessity rather than choice. For a time, the developers allowed the original version of the game to be played through the Betas menu in Steam, but as far as I can tell this has been removed. The option is still there, but it will not properly install. It's a shame, because that is the way this game is meant to be played, and now it's gone forever. In short, this game was ruined by a mandatory update that added nothing of value. I cannot recommend it in its current state and that is not likely to change.

text: So I picked this game up today with a coupon Steam had given me from crafting a badge, so I received it for about 34 cents. I would not pay more than the one dollar price for this game because of how badly it was developed. 1.) For starters, the keyboard controls are delayed. I press a key to move and the ball takes a second to roll, which makes it hard to stop because when you move at a fast momentum, you can't instantly start slowing down. However, this issue is gone when using a controller. 2.) There are achievements in this game for dying so many times, which isn't hard to get because all you have to do to die is press the R key. Falling off the level does not count as dying for whatever reason, so you have to kill yourself with the press of a key. 3.) The camera angle is locked in, which is a bad choice. There are times when you have to roll the ball back towards yourself as the player and you can't tell how far to jump and it makes the perspective of the platform seem farther away than what it is. 4.) As for the good things in this game, the only props I can give it is the soundtrack, which isn't really that bad; it has some decently nice music in it. The developer really hit the nail on the head when they chose the name "DIGITAL MISTAKE" as their company name... I would not recommend this game to anyone unless they wanted to play something broken for the laughs, which a lot of my friends do. I give the game a 3/10, and that is only because of the soundtrack and the pug statue I found while playing.
text_translate: so how bout that audio looping on top of itself over and over, SFX not playing/outright getting skipped mid-play because there aren't enough sound channels and/or the port just doesn't know how to handle anything over 60fps. text: WOW no just NOOOOOOOOO. As someone who has most of these silly Hentai/Anime games, this one is far the worst and buggiest.  The game is broken and glitches constantly ( your character will get stuck in a invisible walls and you will have to close the game and restart it up......which you probably shouldn't lol).   You will be going against enemies that all have guns and are usually 3 to a group and can kill you in 2 shots while your running around with a sword. The game will glitch so bad that your character will start running so fast and you wont be able to control anything that most likely you will end up dying.  The sound effects are terrible, like constant static or white noise, the rag doll physics are horrible. When you are killed your characters body parts will sometimes stretch across the screen. I know this is a fan service game and a cheap one but at least their other games were a bit more playable and not a hot mess like this.

I found the story to be boring and the combat to be obnoxious in how they constantly shout the name of their moves. My only motivation to play this game as long as i did was due to a lets play live stream series that ultimately left me falling asleep on camera out of sheer boredom.  To be fair I'm not a big fan of this style of combat, I prefer turn based, but I do love anime and these games are basically a playable anime series, but this one wasnt interesting to me in the least. It was given to me for free by a friend. I would recommend tales of symphonia instead

text_translate: AoE2 is a fun, but I don't think "Age of Empires 2 HD" is something you should buy.  These evil devs release DLC that divides and destroyes the community, regularly brake the game, even offline, but wont work on a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• resoution setting, something games have had since DOS.  The resolution fix should make this product completely unacceptable to buy, and even if you like AoE, you shouldn't support the company by buying this.  Don't do it.  I've gifted this many times, only to have it be unplayable to my friend, because their setup has a resultion that is too large.  Don't support that. The single player functions   the way the original game did, with only one particularly bad bug that happens in just about every game, single, or multi.  If you are only interested in nostalgia for Conqueres, and computers opponents, go ahead.  This is where Age of Empires 2 HD is strongest, and its certainly easier to drop 5 bucks during a steam sale, than it is to find a hard copy, and install resultion, and compatability fixes.  If that's your intent, the minority of you should go right ahead.  Age of Empires 2 HD is absolutely the game for you. Here is a conprehensive list of bugs, many of which I can comfortably say happen to me every time I boot the game.  Its important to remember that this product   Age of Empires 2 + Age of Empires 2:Conquerers but a very close approximation of it.  Some of these aren't even bugs, they're just laze on the part of the new developer.  The biggest, and most virulent bug, which has never been fixed or really adressed, is units passing straight through each other, which is, if you think about it, the single most important thing for units not to do in a game of rock paper scizzors between spears, bows, and cavalry.  We've been waiting to control our reslution in-program for half a decade, and haven't gotten it, dispite three waves of DLC. We'll talk about that in a moment, the DLC, but first, a qualifier about balance.  In any game that is at least NP hard complex, that is, there is no best strategy you can pick every time, and hypothetically optimize to a point of perfection and assured victory, understanding variables is increadibly important.  If you can't always know what the best move is, then at least knowing what the possible moves are within the system is absolutely, positively key, and the more familiar you are with those moves, and how they play out, the better.  The late Microprose very obviously understood this on a very deep, conceptual level, because of the way age of empire's variety is acheived, and the AI they had, but the DLC practices of the new people in charge are totally and completely antithetical.   Each DLC has at least a civ or two with powers that change the landscape of the game, but because its DLC, you won't be able to use it.  They tried to create a middle ground, by creating a rotation system, where you can   TEST the civ out, but you don't build foundational knowledge without some sort of repetition, or consistancy.  Image in Starcraft, if Zerg were DLC.  Imagine how difficult it would be to fight Zerg players, not only because they get to play Zerg all the time, and become familiar with them, but you can't even get a proper number of games   zerg, because nobody want to play a faction they can't consistantly get good at, or practice.  Were it a fighting game, the equivalent behavior would mean there was an entire set of characters, ripe for the buying, that everyone is going to be weak against.  Sounds like fun, right?  It doesn't help that some of these new DLC civs, on top of having playstyles you won't be able to acclimate to, have some   overpowered units (gbetos, anyone?  Anyone want to defend that trashfire?). At the end of the day, you can technically turn off the DLC, and I usually do, but it doesn't matter, because of the abslute state of the multiplayer.  To call it a jungle is an understatement.  Do not trust anyone, or anything, as the system encourages you to cheat it, and doesn't recognize any sort of effort to report people for abuse, so unless you're already in the top 50% percentile, you won't have any fun playing, or learning the game.  To complicate this issue, there is a horrible, horrible, discconection issue that the current developers blame on bad netcode, and can't seem to fix, dispite selling tons of workshop teir DLC that must have had a near 100% ROI.  Out of 15 games, about 14 of them will end in complete syncronization snafu, and everyone will have to quit after about 30-45 minutes.  I hope you didn't want to play Age of Empires for its deep, intuitive tech tree, because its rush, or go home, now, and not because of the way age of empires was actually designed. So lets make this absolutely clear.  You aren't buying the original Age of Empires 2, this game has tons of DLC designed to extract money from nerds who love to win too much, and it doesn't work well, even after half a decade.  I've played this game a lot, I will again, but I have no illusions about what it is, a cash in.  They got their fat, grubby hands on a classic, and decided they were going to make some money.  It just happened to be Age of Empires, today.

text: Tl;dr: the game is bland and boring. If you played the previous games - you played this one. Don't buy it. The game itself is mediocre and not really fun. Almost nothing new. Far away textures and models are looking super blurred. Amost no new gameplay features. 1 new feature to be exact - repelling. Totally worth the wait! Boring dialogues. Boring characters. Boring storyline. Boring gunplay and kills with no blood at all even when you stab them. Graphics is mostly mediocre too, but sometimes it's pretty (usually where Lara's face in close-up). It looks just like the previous game from 3 years ago (with couple of small downgrades), but with warmer color palette. Fps oten jumps from 60 to 30 (or from 144 to 40) in jungles or villages while there are nothing special on the screen (e.g in some homes or streets with 2-3 people). But when you move your sight just several degrees away - it's 60 (144) again, so it's bad optimisation, not hardware problems Looks like the devs didn't care much about the game. If you played the previous games - you played this one. I bought the Croft edition for early unlock. I was wrong. Don't make my mistake. Buy some really good game instead. Update: they added 50% discount 6 months after release. This is how pathetic this game is.

There's not much I can really say that would differ from what's shown in the trailer (rather crude MS-paint looking drawings with a few short looping backgrounds). You jump when moving right or left, flappy-bird esque, you dodge stuff going across the screen and from the top, which is a bit boring to me, but some may enjoy it more. You also have to go out of the screen to dodge sometimes, but also if you go too far out (who knows how far) you'll die as well. It might be an okay time waster for free (like old flash games), but I wouldn't recommend spending your money on this.

If you waded through the atrocious gameplay of Rescue Lucy and House 23 Escape DLC #1, you probably know that this DLC is not going to be good. Yet in the course of the eight days it took to release this after House 23 Escape DLC #1, even more problems somehow slithered into this add-on. It's rather amazing to see this game/series/whatever you might call it continue to roll downhill with no signs of stopping. Hopefully this is the last DLC they make, though I'm not getting my hopes up. House Escape DLC #2 (but not House 23 for whatever reason) is free, just like DLC #1. It's a small blessing to not cost anything, and it's another piece of the game to add to Rescue Lucy's ridiculously short length. Not that I get why it's part of Rescue Lucy, because once again, this has nothing to do with the dog or the girl. It also has nothing to do with DLC #1. Similar play-styles are there, but there are actually some odd changes as well. In Rescue Lucy, you had five seconds to kill monsters before they killed you. You had to use a different item for each monster. The five seconds part was an awful decision, but using the different items was a legitimately good choice. This DLC is where the developer finally figured out that the timer should be done away with. However, the unique items to kill monsters were taken out as well. Instead, you have a gun of all things, and you pick up some easily-found bullets to shoot whatever you find. There are only two exceptions to this, and it is not explained as to why you can't shoot those monsters too. Frankly, having a gun as a constant weapon in a point-and-click puzzle game is a poor choice. I am sure it could be used well some way or another, but not here. All the developer did was take a good and bad idea and switch them around, leaving us back at square one. The items zoom in each time you pick them up, but they have higher resolutions this time. Most of them are easy to identify, and thank everything for that, because they STILL don't have labels. The items menu works fine for combining items, and choosing to use them is as clunky as ever. This is especially bad with the number of keys you get. I swear that a good fourth of my gameplay in this DLC was swapping items around, with unlabeled keys being the biggest offenders. Most of the logic here is far more straightforward than in Rescue Lucy and DLC #1. There were only a few parts that stood out as bewildering to me, and they were still easy to figure out due to process of elimination. There has also been some sort of revelation between DLCs about needing to show what can be picked up and interacted with, for the mouse changes upon going over such locations. Hallelujah. As such, this DLC probably took less time for me than either the main game or its sibling DLC. Even so, it felt like it was about the same length, which means "not long at all." So I have mentioned some problems, but there are two that are far more offensive than what's already been listed. One is that there is a sliding tile puzzle. This is the first interactive game-puzzle-thing to be seen in this "series" and I applaud the developer for trying to add something new in. Then I boo and throw tomatoes because this puzzle is so poorly designed. Why? Because it isn't on its own separate plane. It overlaps the room you're in, and if you click where the door is that takes you back a room, you go there. Which means the puzzle resets. And you get to do it ALL. OVER. AGAIN. This happened TWICE to me despite me taking as great of care as I could to not click that door, and needless to say, I was boiling at the end of it. The other really obnoxious issue is the conclusion of the "story." I use quotes because there is no story to start out. At the end, you figure out what your goal was. And boy, is it a stupid goal. I won't spoil it in case you want to see the idiocy yourself, but get ready for out-of-place graphics, bad voice acting, and a stupid victory screen. On the bright side, since there's only two places with words in the whole game, there's no bad translations to read. Hey, avoiding written storytelling means there's less to screw up, so that makes this a masterful plan! At this point, I'm starting to think the DLCs are being produced to try and convince us that Rescue Lucy is not a bad game. With the DLCs being this bad, surely it must look good in comparison! Well, if that was the plan, it failed, because Rescue Lucy is still awful. DLC #1 is worse. DLC #2 is even worse. The amount of failure keeps increasing, and I am concerned that if a DLC #3 is released, it will be so bad that it will cause the internet to explode. Even if said third DLC were to be free, I would not want to be "graced" by its presence. Whether it does or not, avoid House Escape DLC #2 unless you really want to subject yourself to its horribleness.

text: I'm sure you have heard how bad the AI is in this game. It is.  In one game the  AI declared war on me  on turn 14.  It is literally impossible to get to the late game. The AI is always mad at you, even on the easiest difficulty. They have added too many systems which even the AI doesn't understand which means that the AI spams military units, settlers and Missionary throughout the game but is somehow still able to be ahead of you in the tech.  Until the AI gets updated don't buy.
text_translate: The game was a fun concept, mastermind vs the survivors but the real novelty ends after you play the game. The game wasn't a standalone product but an actual part of another game a dumb move from capcom to promote selling resident evil remake but in doing so didn't get a huge playerbase so you end up with a game where not many people played. Now the only players I've see are hackers and cheaters and it seems like they are still updating the game and releasing things,  they even got the nerve to put in a cash shop to buy rp to leve up quicker, if only this was available to people to play.  Another big issue is the unbalance play between survivors and mastermind and just trying to be a mastermind might take you anywhere from 30 minutes to 1 hour just to either lose the game instantly to someone cheating or lose to high level survivors, if you are jumping in now you are in for a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• The lack of anti cheat and dedicated servers have now killed this game for me.

text: Der erste DLC von Fallout 4 ist in meinen Augen eine herbe Entt√§uschung. Wieso,das erkl√§re ich in zwei Punkten.  Vorab: Ich bin besitzer des Season-Pass und trotzdem ist der Preis nicht gerechtfertigt. Der DLC befasst sich mit dem Roboter bauen und tunen bzw. ver√§ndern. Das macht auch grunds√§tzlich spa√ü, aber es ist in meinen Augen ehr ein fehlendes Feature. Man kann einen Roboter von Anfang an bauen, aber es ist nicht so komplex, dass man daf√ºr 10‚Ç¨ hinlegen muss. Es ist sehr befriedigend sich einen Roboter zu bauen ihn zu testen und dann wieder  zu ver√§ndern, aber es ist kein riesengro√ües  Sammelsurium aus Teilen.  Ich kann mir auch beim besten Willen nicht vorstellen, dass jemand da 7-8h mit verbringt.  Ich wei√ü  der DLC ist nichts f√ºr Leute die ein gute Story wie beim (ja ich wei√ü der Vergleich nervt) Witcher suchen,  aber sie ist nicht mal ansatzweise so gut wie manche Nebenquests bei Fallout 3. Die Aufgaben sind so spannend wie die Story. Man rennt von A nach B und t√∂tet.  Ein schlechter Witz. Fazit: Die Story w√§re egal gewesen, wenn das Roboter bauen komplexer gewesen w√§re.  Es macht zwar spa√ü, aber wenn man 10‚Ç¨ daf√ºr hinlegen soll bekommt  man doch etwas Besseres, wenn man  etwas anderes kauft.  Im Sale f√ºr 3-5‚Ç¨ lohnt es sich dann doch mehr

text_translate: Trash. For a Lucius game I expected much more. - Black screen on loading a save that takes ~5 minutes. - Loading an auto save breaks game mechanics forcing you to replay an entire chapter. - Transforming into a crow sometimes freezes the game. - Sometimes locations don't load exteriors.

What's wrong with you?
text_translate: It has been a while since I played a game this bad. The controls are terrible, I don't know who thought the default control setup would be a good idea. But even when remapping them you run into the issue of Jump doubling as "OK". There's no fixing that. The wall grab mechanic is a nuisance, and the jumping in the game feels forced. The i frames and everything tied to them as a hindrance. The level design seems to have taken the developers about 3 minutes to think about (3 minutes total - not even per level). There is nothing about the game that I could recommend, except possibly to mute all music and sound if you do decide to play it - or maybe puncture your ear drums, either option would spare you a lot of pain.

text_translate: La verdad es que hace tiempo que no juego aun juego tan mal optimizado, he tirado mi dinero a la basura la peor compro desde hace mucho tiempo.Si lo quereis jugar podeis descargarlo en el telefono o de BlueStacks no os gasteis vuestro dinero en tal porqueria 5h de mi vida tiradas a la basura, no vale la pena nada de este, aparte los servidores son una mierda teniendo una buena conexion y estando en europa voy a 300 de ping y eso con suerte, no me quiero imaginar a la gente de Latino America. En resumen MIERDA DE JUEGO NO ADAPTADO A PC.

text: no way
text_translate: Fallout 4 is a good game, just not a good PC game. With mods and tweaks you can make it into a good PC game but the amount of effort I have to put in just to have an enjoyable experience is just sad. I have a high refresh monitor and just to get the game to run at the correct speed I have to edit config files and use 2 outside programs. Its ridiculous. I would only recommend buying this on steam if you have experience with modding. 3/10 PC port 7/10 Game

text_translate: edit at 20 hours or so  I love the comments on the review I posted at 5 hrs , none have the game that are public profiles . I love these people that when you want help someone not buy a bad game they  pounce on you say my computer is 10 year old clunker yet it is 13 month old ASUS desk top  not going stoop to their childish level of slamming some one for honest reviewing . they should  say if they got there copies free or work for the company   I have had 3 crashes that send report to company 4 freeze ups crashing game  I went into the groups see if anything was posted . I am not only one having graphic, mouse scrolling issues to name few I went into setup down played to the least graphic , details and played with  fps as well a  2 second mouse click in PC1 takes 5  seconds just to get the mouse pointer to where you want it . I can only assume the company used a old platform that does not work well with quad cores or mid range systems  I also feel screwed in I bought product at 15 percent off pre sale 60 bucks that the base game in 40. I got no extra battles yet the 2 promised DLC's well be same price and id the base game is this broken worthless Dlc's will be given as well  I am going think long hard before I ever buy from Matrix again I have loads of them on steam and many not sold on steam .  they should be ashamed to have let this go out with such broken game streaming  5 hours at review and I hate it 1000 hrs of PC1 I bought this pre sell based on all the good pre videos been shown . Nope I have a medium set up  quad core can play just about any game I want yet this one is so clunky  poor graphic scroll  mouse scroll is crap I played with video settings  and kept going back to highest setting . My internet is top speed . I beta test for matrix from time to time and am appalled that  they have put out this junk at such high price  My suggestion is  wait 6 months even a year  for them to fix the massive problems in  game play  . They normally are pretty good at support and patch work   PC1 was based of good solid game play with decent graphics and at the time great turn based play this garbage  rather have pretty men and tanks flying around then game play  I can tell you I never give bad reviews if played under 20 hours but  this game is broken in so many ways  I be hard pressed to say it is worth 15.00 bucks much less the field marshal edition I got suckered into buying for 60 bucks pre sale  I see a streaming live game in bottom and looks great must be another version sure not what I got  in its current state do not buy it get PC1

The cars crash, swerve and blow up so easily and what makes it worse is it takes forever to get out of the car or it just doesn't ever let you, so I end up dying and having to restart the mission. text: EDIT: To those of you who think it's unfair that I'm giving the game a thumbs down, I cannot with good conscience recommend something that doesn't play through the tutorial without crashing on an Nvidia 780 Ti card, 16GB of RAM and an Intel i7 core with 3.4GHz. I'm ok with performance drops, not with outright crashing into unplayability. I THINK this is a good game. It feels like it from the tutorial. The tutorial which I've played about eight or nine times now because the game is constantly crashing, there's no autosave functionality and some good distance before you're allowed to save, as I've never reached that point before crashing. Even with the unofficial community patch that's out now, I'm still having a lot of issues. And yes I'm playing on an Nvidia card with an Intel i7 GPU so I'm not having any of those AMD-issues, it's crashing for an assortment of reasons, unfortunately. I'll write a proper review once the game gets fixed. Until then, I can't really recommend something that's as unstable as this. It still works for a lot of people but it seems to be a lottery of hardware and driver-combinations whether or not you're one of those people. Still, I don't regret buying the game, just hoping there's some official fixes coming soon. EDIT (AGAIN): I got a different GPU now (GTX 1080) and the game no longer crashes on me. So far I am having fun, but I still can't get myself to change to a positive recommendation, until the problem with the older card series has been explicitly adressed.

text: It's a nice game with a lot of potential but I can't recommend it at the moment as you can only load your most recent save and you can't quit without saving so if a zombie gets past your defences and starts destroying your base you have to start a new game as it will snowball really fast into a defeat and that combined with how long the games can be makes the early game feel like a grind with how easy it is. There are also no speed controls other than a pause button so you can't make it go any faster so just have to sit through the full lengh of it. That said I do still like the game and will probably play it a bit more and come back to it when it recieves more content as at the moment it is just one mode with 4 types of random maps and modifiers for how many in-game days it lasts (80-150) and the size of the zombie horde.

As far as i can see, this is a cash grab. Now, it does have its upsides. The condottieri can be both cool and really annoying. For example, i like the proxy war concept, it's pretty cool to use lesser countries as a way of weakening rivals without entering into a truce or fighting their entire alliance, but it is also really bloody stupid when you are in a war with a country and all your rivals rent out their entire ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• armies to the enemy side for free, i mean, come on! And I have NEVER recieved one condottieri offer ever. The condottieri has its ups and downs The Map mechanic is pretty obselete Barbary pirates are irrelevent most of the time Trade leagues: possibly the only good mechanic in this, although they can be annoying, it is fun to play as venice and have a massive income and start wrecking massive nations like austria. All in all, is this DLC worth 17.99(NZD)? No Is it worth like 5$? Maybe Should you buy it at full price? God no.... Either wait for a 75% of sale or don't buy it at all. That's my advice.

text_translate: Call of Duty Advancerd Warfare: Also das Game an sich ist echt gut gedacht. Die Umsetzung ist aber nicht ganz so gut gelungen! Es ist ja eine weiter Entwicklung von Modern Warfare. Es ist eine neue Generation aber es ist einfach zu weit in die Zukunft gedacht es ist nahe an Black Ops angelegt, daher ist es eher ein Kritikpunkt.  Die Story ist nett gehalten aber ziemlich strikt und beschr√§nkt wie es bei Call of Duty halt ist.  Der Mutliplayer hat wieder ein gro√ües Waffenspektrum aber wie es halt √ºblich ist sind manche Waffen sind einfach will st√§rker und besser als andere. Was die Hacker angeht sind sie auch in diesen spiel vorhanden aber es gibt auch kaum.  Was die Maps angeht, Die Maps sind immer zum teil an die Story angelegt. Hier ist es ist nicht gro√ü zuerkennen ich finde sie zu weit abweichend zur Story. Anders ist es aber gut dass manche der Maps sich w√§hrend dem Game ver√§ndern. so sind die Maps nicht ganz so langweilig.  Im Gro√üen und Ganzen ist das spiel wie jedes andere Call of Duty. Meine Empfehlung w√§re sich eventuell ein anderes Call of Duty zu kaufen was nicht zu alt und nicht so teuer ist.  Ich empfehle: Black ops 1 oder 2 und  Wer nicht zu in der Zukunft schwebt:  Modern Warfare 2 oder 3

text_translate: I don't get, why this VN is so well liked. Yeah, it has its moments, but overall I was quite boring. I kept going, hoping for it to get to a point which validated its high ratings... That point didn't come. Yeah, technically it just worked, no bugs whatsoever. I admit, that should be praised more, since bugs are just so ubiquitous everywhere. From a story perspective, it was lacking. Even the Sakura games, which aren't know for their writing quality, were on average better than this VN. I had several scenes I just clicked quickly through, because they were just so bad (especially all the ones with big baldy, only the very last one I read fully). It is OK for the price of free, but that's it. I cannot give it a thumbs up rating with a clear conscience. Sorry for this critique to the developer, it shows a work of passion, but it fell short of expectations.

text: Ich bin eigentlich Just Cause Fan der ersten Stunde und mich hat immer fasziniert was man alles mit dem Greifhaken anstellen kann, aber der vierte Teil ist ein klarer R√ºckschritt. Sicher gibt es auch ein paar Verbesserungen. Wie zum Beispiel dass man neuerdings Ballons und mini Raketen an Objekten anbringen kann. Praktisch ist auch dass man alle Eigenschaften des Greifhakens nach Bed√ºrfnis anpassen kann. Doch die wenigen Neuerungen entsch√§digen nicht die negativen Seiten des Spiels. Wir brauchen jetzt gar nicht erst √ºber Hintergrundgeschichte des Spiels reden, die ist bescheuert und kurz wie eh und je. Die Probleme fangen schon bei der unn√∂tig komplizierten Steuerung an, die sich nicht vollkommen frei konfigurieren l√§sst. Die Grafik ist einfach eine absolute Frechheit. Verwaschene Texturen, l√§cherliche Wassereffekte und Kantenflimmern ohne Ende, egal welche Einstellungen man w√§hlt. Um es kurz zu fassen, wer Just Cause mag sollte lieber beim dritten Teil bleiben, dort ist alles besser gemacht und macht vor allem auch mehr Spass.

Where to start with this one? Well, umm... It's a shooter and that's about it. It's not even a particularly good one , truth be told.  The story is bland and un-original , basically : "We need to stop the bad guys from them acquiring nuclear warheads. Oh, we need to shoot the bad guys! Oh, we got betrayed! Oh, we magically have new friends (Because plot convenience!). Oh, we shoot the big bad guy and save the day! Hurray!".  And that's the game it a nutshell. Towards the game mechanics: 1. The game teaches you barely anything. Par example, it never mentioned that "Q" is to use the medkit, "E" to use the knife, or that the small grey bar situated at the middle foreground, was to show you if enemies could see you or not. (I figured that out in the last mission) 2. If you're using any gun other than a sniper rifle or the silence pistol, have fun with aiming at the Moon for most of the time due to the absurd level of recoil and no semi-auto setting. 3. If you're spotted by the enemy, prepare to load from the last checkpoint as all of the enemy soldiers have superhuman abilities and can shoot you down from 200m with an assault rifle. 4. Invisible walls, invisible walls f*cking everywhere you go. Thus to sum it up: Don't waste your money on this game. Yet if you do plan on buying it ,I highly recommend you do so when it's on sale.

text: Bad game

This is a (just about )multi path branching choice based VN. The story is the fairly generic 'boy' moves to new area and goes to school and through some choices gets 'girls' out of his normal target range. +  reasonable art  good sound gothic lollies - Generic bland story no sense of connection with the characters Plot lines not utilised DS is a slice of life VN set on an island where no one is unhappy; the MC moves there after advice from his cousin and starts school, the problem is that its an incredibly dull slice. Nothing really happens and there is no real hook to get you invested in the characters nor the story. It lacks that little bit magic (no pun intended) that the DC series had. Parts of the story line are underutilised (e.g. the happy numbers) and others are just ropey (the MC suddenly remembering he lost his glasses after weeks of not using them) and everything plods mundanely through to the end leaving you wondering why anyone bothered writing it in the first place (maybe the producers needed a new porch extension or their drive repaved or something). Everything that happens is generic and predictable and even the 18+ patch fails to bring any real interest. If the game could be equated to a colour it would be dysentery beige If you want a dull plodding slice of life VN then go for it but I would suggest going for any of the DC stories instead

Early Access game, so I give it some credit. My issues with the game are the amount of micro-managing you have to do in a colony sim. I personally want something a little more relaxed where I don't have to be turning structures on and off constantly to not die. Even with all that, having a thriving settlement a random event wiped my 80+ settlement down to 6 people. Rimworld is similar with random events, but Rimworld has very obvious solutions to the issues that can all be mitigated easily. Not so much here.

text_translate: Sono molto indeciso per la valutazione di questo titolo. Ma alla fine ho pensato che fosse corretto sconsigliarlo (anche se costa 4.99 euro) a meno che gli sviluppatori non ripensino ad aggiungere un editor dei livelli e ad arirlo al modding anche tramite steam workshop. Le ragioni non sono nel gioco in se che √® fatto molto bene, curato, carino e anche appagante (ma fino a un certo punto.. vedi sotto). Il vero problema del gioco √® che √® veramente troppo (ma troppo) breve e tutto sommato anche facile. Nonostante gli achievement che per√≤ per essere sbloccati richiedono di giocare sempre i soliti quattro livelli in croce, il che potrebbe diventare noioso e frustrante. La longevit√† (esclusi gli achievement) si attesta su un'ora (se non addirittura meno)!!! sono quattro livelli in cui per sbloccarli bisogna risolvere facilissimi puzzle e spaventare tutte le persone (facile anche questo). Insomma √® tutto troppo piatto da gochillo flash per smerdfon... tuttavia ha potenziale. Il concept √® davvero bello se valorizzato a dovere. Agli sviluppatori suggerirei di consentire nello steam workshop la creazione di altri livelli fatti dagli utenti oppure la creazione di mod e espansioni (anche in forma dlc ma non a pagamento!). Che dire non ve lo consiglio al prezzo pieno ma magari ultra scontato si. Valutate voi quanto volete pagare un paio d'ore scarse di gioco. Nota per gli achievement hunter: il gioco √® facilmente completabile al 100%! EDIT: Sono stati aggiunti altri livelli gratuitamente. Una buona mossa ma anche i nuovi livelli sono troppo corti e troppo more of the same. Aggiungono un'oretta scarsa di longevit√†. Rimane prioritario il ricorso allo steam workshop imho. APPEAL &CONCEPT 7/10 (idea molto valida e con potenziale. Da curare meglio alcuni aspetti) SUPPORTO 5/10 (no dlc, no level editor, no steam workshop... insomma si pu√≤ fare di pi√π) GRAFICA 8/10 (stile carinissimo e fumettoso, belli i livelli e la caratterizzazione dei fantasmi) SONORO 5/10 (musiche carine ma ho dovuto azzerare il volume della musica che diventa troppo ripetitiva a lungo andare) GIOCABILITA' 6/10 (divertente ma alla fine i controlli e le cose da fare si esauriscono presto, consiglio il pad della xbox!) LONGEVITA' 2/10 (un paio d'ore e poco piu di gioco, anche dopo l'aggiunta dei nuovi livelli, ho detto tutto) ACHIEVEMENTS OK (facilmente completabile al 100%) VOTO FINALE 5.5/10 (non consigliato per la scarsa longevit√† a cui si potrebbe rimediare con lo steam workshop)

text_translate: ‚óè‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‡Æú€©€û€©‡Æú‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚óè Developer: DONTNOD Entertainment √ó¬∞√ó‚òÖSummary Review‚òÖ√ó¬∞√ó Overall Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ [2/5] Story: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Gameplay: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Sound: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ ‚óè‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‡Æú€©€û€©‡Æú‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚óè ‚òÖOVERALL‚òÖ I was severely disappointed by this game. The trailers make it look like an action packed thrill ride supported by a story rich environment; something like Batman meets Assassin's Creed in a Blade Runner universe, but sadly it fails at what should be a sure win formula. I'm only giving 2 stars for effort, but you've definitely flunked the class DONTNOD. ‚òÖSTORY‚òÖ This is one of the biggest drawbacks for me. It feels like they decided to make an action game based off the success of Batman and Assassin's creed set against a cyberpunk backdrop, but they forgot all about the story and just shoe-horned in something to justify why you're doing any of the crazy things they ask you to do. For instance, the first chapter of the game is all about you escaping from prison, because you'll surely die if you stay there. Fast-forward to chapter 4 and suddenly you're being asked to break back into the prison again. Because, you know, that makes sense. It's not like you could have just done whatever you needed to do in the prison while you were there in the first place. The character interaction is just... awkward. Dialog feels like it was written by a twelve year old boy that just saw Blade Runner for the first time and wanted to make a fanfic with boobies. ‚òÖGAMEPLAY‚òÖ Supposedly you're able to customize your combos and chain interesting moves together to "make your own" playstyle, but all the moves are basically the same and there's no real customization to be had. Not to mention you have to buy a $4 DLC just to get some extra moves. You can heal yourself by hitting people in the face, because, you know, that makes sense too. Zombies can cloak themselves like ghost in the shell meets Left 4 Dead, because, you know, that makes sense. And to make them visible, you have to turn on a conveniently placed light switch that only works for about three seconds, then you gotta hit it again with your virtual bullets (which doesn't break the light switch at all! even tho you just destroyed a crane with it early) because... that makes sense. You have these powerful combo chains that involve about five or six combos that you'll never get to the end of because you'll have to hop around the place like a rabbit on cocaine trying to avoid getting hit by your enemies. Say it with me now, "because that makes sense!" ‚òÖSOUND & MUSIC‚òÖ I never thought a game could have bad music, but I've been proven wrong here. The music is terrible. It's bland electro-house music mixed together on some free app on someone's phone, I think. Cutscenes are WAAAAY too loud and the rest of the game is far too quiet, so enjoy turning your volume up and down for the entire game, because that makes sense. ‚òÖBUGS & BOTHERS‚òÖ I'm not even gonna bother with the "Bugs & Bothers" section because this entire review is already filled with them.

text: Game is beautiful but collision mechanics are SUPER shoddy. For a game that is completely story based, it should have more of a path/direction. Got through 4 or 5 dialogs of the first chapter, then spent nearly 30 minutes sliding around on rocks trying to get somewhere new, retraced the enire island area available 5 or 6 times. Narration is top-notch, atmosphere was impressive, the story is probably great too, but if I can't even get there, who cares. Those things make the path failure even more frustrating and infuriating. I really wanted to play this. Complete fail. Not even going to bother with the other chapters...even if I can find my way through them, who wants 3/4 of a great story?
text_translate: Seid gegr√º√üt Vampirfreunde, hier meine blutsaugende Review zu Vampyr Genre: Action / Adventure +Pro: + apokalyptische Story in London 1918 + markant konzipierte Charaktere + interessante Konflikte und Beziehungen + √ºberraschende Wendungen + Ausbreitung der Seuche wird gut simuliert + sehr gute und ausf√ºhrliche Dialoge + Indizien und Beweise geben neue Dialogoptionen + Zufallsereignisse lockern Questalltag auf + eigenes Handeln wirkt sich auf Stadtviertel aus + viele optionale Nebenquests und kleinere R√§tsel + Zielmarkierung zeigt Gebiete + freies Spiel zwischen Brutalit√§t und Zur√ºckhaltung + Spielstil beeinflusst Schwierigkeitsgrad + fl√ºssiges und flottes Kampfsystem mit Kontern + gute Animationen + abwechslungsreiche Feindtypen + vier Schadensarten + einige Spezialman√∂ver + angenehmer und steigender Anspruch + einige gut inszenierte Bossk√§mpfe + diverse aufr√ºstbare Ein-, Zweihand & Schusswaffen + Charakterentwicklung mit vielen F√§higkeiten + innovativesBlut- & Erfahrungspunkte-Prinzip + weitgehend stimmungsvoll designte Stadtviertel + gute bis sehr gute englische Sprecher + sehr markanter, klasse gesprochener Protagonist + solide deutsche √úbersetzung + stimmungsvolle Musik, markante Soundeffekte + abschaltbare Feindinfos/Kampf-HUD + mehrere Enden -Kontra: - schwacher Einstieg - im letzten Drittel viele z√§he Laufwege - keinerlei Reaktion auf Diebstahl, alles einsacken - Stimme im Kopf wird nicht konsequent genutzt - Kanalisation nur in kleinen Abschnitten erkundbar - schwankende Bosskampf- Qualit√§t - wenig Erkundungsfreiheit in der Vertikalen - st√§ndiges Sammeln & Crafting f√ºr Waffen und Tr√§nke - einige recht plumpe Hiebwaffen f√ºr einen Vampir - nahezu √ºberfl√ºssige H√§ndler mit zu viel Krimskrams - einige h√ºfthohe Hindernisse ergeben unverst√§ndliche Barrieren - Vampir- Feinde k√∂nnen nicht in die H√∂he bzw. klettern - teilweise steife Mimik und Gestik - recht liebloses Design der Zusatzfunde - lange Ladezeiten bei neuen Gebieten/Geb√§uden - kein freies Speichern - etwas zu kleine Schrift f√ºr viele Texte - keine deutsche Sprachausgabe - nur ein Schwierigkeitsgrad Fazit: Sehr gute Ans√§tze, anfangs sehr interessante Story weckt Hunger auf mehr...aber das wars dann auch. Wieder mal wurde die Spielzeit mit nervigen sammeln & craften in die L√§nge gezogen. Ich habe sehns√ºchtig auf die Ver√∂ffentlichung des Spiels gewartet...es kam raus... und wurde √ºberwiegend entt√§uscht, daher Empfehle ich das Spiel trotz einigen guten Punkten NICHT. text_translate: It's fun at first, even with Rico's awkward body physics (feels like playing with a balloonman, Rico has no "weight"), but after several hours the game gets boring and gameplay feels stagnant and uninteresting.  The lack of ammo drops (like the ones in Mercenaries {Pandemic Studio 2005}) resulted in a rebuying of expensive weapon drops at $50,000 a piece instead of $2,000-$3,000 for ammo drops... and it unfortunately affects the gameplay in its unefficiency. Plus... the car/truck driving was stiff and not as fun as the driving in Sleeping Dogs- also from Square Enix. The world map is huge with plenty of places to go, and its scenery is incredibly diverse with snowy regions and tropical "Far Cry 3" locales... but the gameplay rarely changes. I don't know if I would pay any more money for Just Cause 3... maybe if it played like Sleeping Dogs I might buy it, but very unlikely. It is BORING.

text: So Many waited for this game to hit Steam! List Time Pros: +Online Co Op +Forklift is great +Reminds me of back the day, in a good way somewhat +Fov Sliders are a nice touch +6 Games for the Price of 1 Cons: -Graphics look like trash, I still feel like I'm looking at a 360 game on a 360 when I play this -No Mouse Wheel Support at all as of late 2019 -Only Halo Reach you can play, all the other games will take a lot longer to come out -Not worth $40 at it's current state -Friendly Ai is stupid -Audio Lag is harsh and difficult to ignore -PC Port sucks, I've seen Indie Games with more polish & less resources and less cash do better -No Way to turn off Motion Blur -The Anti Cheat thing is a joke -A really big turn off Is the Xbox Live DRM that forces you to sign up or have a preexisting account, this is really bad and a step in the wrong direction, they didn't need to do that Microsoft has plenty of Money -People Waited so many years for a Trash experience overall, I understand people miss the glory days on the Xbox 360 but it doesn't justify a Lame port with next to no Graphics Options and day 1 bugs -The Game on a RTX 2070 Super with the Latest Nvidia Drives, runs Meh -Hopefully the game will improve for the better, but I doubt it will any time soon -For all the Halo Fan Boys out there, I love Halo Series and want to see it be a Masterpiece, Sadly it's not as of Today, if Read Dead 2 wasn't such Hot Garbage, I'd recommend that instead. Don't buy that anytime soon either

okay this game is dated and it screams it. can't get past the tutorial because it's just awfully executed. the most noticeable thing launching it up is a starting fov of like 40 and it feels horrible. there   but it means binding a key to change the fov that you have to press at the beginning of the level. this is just a really, really bad implementation. when will first person devs wise up and make a game with a starting fov of 95 for once? i can get past this, though. i can look past a lot if a game is done well. subnautica is a buggy, unpolished mess, but at least it's playable. mirror's edge doesn't have an option to disable head bobbing. this game isn't worth $2.17, but i can't refund it because i waited a couple weeks after buying to play it. cool.

text: Ich habe mich echt auf dieses Spiel gefreut und auf den ersten Blick war es auch toll... Aber dieses Spiel ist KOMPLETT unspielbar und kompletter Schrott :( Ja, ok, ich wusste zwar, dass es ein Early Access... nein - stop - ist es ja garnicht... :3 Hier ein paar erheiternde Beispiele: - B√§cker machen ab einem Zeitpunkt Pizzen ohne Ende, auch wenn kein Kunde da ist, die Kosten f√ºr diese steigt ins Unermessliche und man ist nach 2 Tagen pleite, Spiel beendet. - Die Kellner tragen die Pizzen in die U-Bahn (?), laufen ein St√ºck nachdem sie mit der U-Bahn gefahren sind, bleiben stehen f√ºr ein paar Stunden und laufen dann wieder ins Restaurant. - Angestellt und Kunden finden Wege manchmal nicht, dann l√§uft garnichts mehr und man verliert endlos Geld. - Ordnungsgem√§√ü eingerichtete St√ºhle wackeln, was wohl symbolisiert, dass sie nicht korrekt angebaut sind(?). Jedoch sind Sie exakt identisch angebaut, wie auch die anderen. - Jedes Mal, wenn ein Spielstand geladen wird, hat man am ersten Tag den Bug, dass die Angestellten die zuletzt da waren, zeitgleich mit den neuen Angestellten im Laden sind. - Pizzen liegen auf dem Boden, nachdem man den Ofen verschiebt. Und lauter solche Sp√§√üe. Wobei man √ºber sowas noch hinwegsehen k√∂nnte. Es vergeht eigentlich keine Spielminute ohne gravierende und sogar offen sichtbare M√§ngel. Das ist so ziemlich das schlechteste Spiel (von der Programmierung her, nicht von der Art des Spiels), dass ich je gespielt habe. Und ich hab wirklich versucht, das Spiel zu m√∂gen. Das Spiel ist leider Betrug - es ist unspielbar. :( Schau euch einfach meine Screenshots an, das sagt schon alles...

text_translate: At first I liked this game... until the landlady kicked me out from the apartament. There are too many things to do : buy food, spy on people, go to work to earn money. All these actions consumes time and the money you earn are not sufficient for paying the rent, buy cages and food. There is no specific tutorial and the routine of watching people doing the same things everyday is boring. In conclusion, I feel like I'm being rushed, I can't properly enjoy this game; I like games like Beholder, Papers Please or Orwell, but this one is not for me !

text: Played for free to see if I wanted to buy the game at half off, which I was very much leaning towards.  After all, downloading nearly 50 gigs of the game takes some time.  As I started to play, I found the game interesting, but not at all what you would want from an "Open World Game".  The game immediately forces you into a story plot in which you are forced to take sword fighting lessons, and do a tutorial like quest.  When I am playing a game, I do not want it to feel like I am watching a T.V show,  this game accomplishes exactly that, it feels like watching a T.V drama.  The cutscenes are so long, i found myself watching a five minute long cutscene only to be baffled that I am still playing a game when I am throws into the action.  The NPCs are very unnatural looking and will seemingly walk around like a mindless drone, will not make eye contact with you, and will not budge when you walk into them.  They just kind of walk around with a blank stare on their face.     The Character Customization lacks.  They have made this game so "T.V showlike"  that, of course, you cannot customize your character.   If you unequip your gear at the beginning of the game, or sell it to a trader, YOUR CHARACTER WILL STILL BE WEARING THE SAME CLOTHES IN THE CUTSCENES.   Not being able to customize the character in any way pretty much makes the main character seem unrelateable.   Fighting is clunky.  The fighting is clunky and I mean really clunky.  You target an opponent, you can click or right click.  Depending on which you do, you will either perform a swing or a quicker stab move.  At least in the intro, you can end up in a few fistfights and do basic sword training.   I very much wanted to begin to react to the open world, but it seems I have lost interest after taking a break from the game after the first time playing it, which ended in getting shot off my horse in what seemed to be some kind of beginning cutscene sequence.  The bottom line is that if I am playing a Medeival Open World game, I want it to feel sandboxy, like the decisions I make will have a drastic and longterm effect on the world.  If I want to watch a T.V drama about Knights, I could just watch a show like "Knightfall".  This was a big disappointment.

text: Most disappointing game since Mafia III The story is mostly interesting and most of the characters are great, though they are plagued with cringey, try hard dialogue. Graphics are good, but never anything special. Big improvement over the first, though.  Gameplay is repetitive. Having to constantly(and I mean constantly) pick up health and armour, as opposed to just walking over it, is tedious and grating.  Despite teasing you with interesting environments like 60s Nazi controlled Roswell during a parade, they drop you into generic Nazi base #287 instead. This is the case throughout the entire campaign.  The game is riddled with bugs. It runs well over 60fps for me, with very rare dips, but there are occasional graphical glitches. Like the New York skyline not loading, leaving just a black box in the sky. The game freezes during loading far too often.  And to top it all off, they release the first update and it's somehow not compatible with your save data, you have to start over from the beginning of whatever chapter you were on. Which could be an hour+ of time wasted.

text_translate: Salutare Lume,uite ca a venit timpul si pentru review-ul lui Space Hulk.Ca si in jocul din 1993 ai la dispozitie Terminatori pe toata durata campaniei,care sunt impartiti in 3 clase:Heavy Flamer,Assault Cannon si Storm Bolters).Jocul are 2 campani una principala:Sin of Damnation si ce care este o campanie de introducere pentru cei care nu au jucat jocul clasic, aceasta campanie se numeste Boarding the Sin of Damnation. Salutare Lume,uite ca a venit timpul si pentru review-ul lui Space Hulk.Ca si in jocul din 1993 ai la dispozitie Terminatori pe toata durata campaniei,care sunt impartiti in 3 clase:Heavy Flamer,Assault Cannon si Storm Bolters).Jocul are 2 campani una principala:Sin of Damnation si ce care este o campanie de introducere pentru cei care nu au jucat jocul clasic, aceasta campanie se numeste Boarding the Sin of Damnation.   Povestea:Totul se invarte in jurul rasei umane si a unei rase extraterestre numita  Genestealer.Umanitatea trebuie sa anihileze exstraterestri inainte ca ei sa distruga rasa umana(suna a cliseu nu e asa?).Totusi un artefact a fost redescoperit dupa ce s-a crezut ca a fost pierdut.Ei bine v-as spune mai multe dar parca scriu prea   final povestea primeste un  6.   Gameplay: Intr-un final am ajuns si aici.Prima data sa mentionez ca este un joc turn base strategy.Acum sa enumaram niste soldati pe care ii gasim in fiecare clasa.Prima clasa,Heavy Flamer ei bine aceasta clasa are doar un soldat,Brother Zael, a doua clasa Assault Cannon la fel ca si in prima clasa doar un soldat,Brother Leon,si a treia clasa Storm Bolters care este ceva mai numeroasa, mai exact 6 soldati, acestia fiind:Brother Noctis,Brother Deino,Brother Goriel,Brother Valencio,Brother Scipio si Brother Omnio.Acum este timpul sa va prezint fiecare abilitate a lor.La Storm Bolter avem urmatoarele abilitati: Storm Bolter,Power Sword si inca 4 pentru mobiliate Overwatch,Guard,si Set Move and Fire Target.La Heavy Flamer avem doar o abilitate de atac Heavy Flamer si inca o de mobilitate, Guard. Si In final Assault Cannoncare are doar 3 abilitati de mobilitate Overwatch,Guard,si Set Move and Fire Target. Cand selectati o unitate va v-a aparea o camera in dreapta sus in acea camera puteti vedea din perspectiva acelei unitati. Si ca ultim detaliu aveti 2 tipuri de puncte: AP care sunt individuale fiecarui soldat mai exact 4 puncte pe soldat si puncte CP care sunt puncte comune care pot fi folosite doar cand vine vorba de mai mult de 4 miscari.Acestea fiind spuse gameplay-ul primeste o nota de 7 si nu 8 din cauza ca este prea repetitiv.     Grafica: Ei bine pentru anul 2013 as putea spune ca acest joc nu merita mai mult de 5 la capitolul grafica avand in vedere ca prin tot jocul am dat de Low Resolution Texture care mi-au sarit in ochi chiar daca nu eram atent la joc.Poate dar POATE daca s-ar mai fi lucrat la acest capitol si jocul era lansat in 2011 ar fi primit un 8 dar avand in vedere ca este anul 2013 aceasta sectiune v-a primi un 5.   Sunetul:Sunetul are o tenta de realistic dar nu prea reuseste.Totusi pentru incercare si pentru buna calitate a sunetului in toate aspectele ii dau nota 7.   Si cu asta ii acord jocului o nota finala de 6.5 si va astepam pe channelul nostru de youtube la noi livestream-uri si noi video-uri.

Bullsh*t. Instantly upon joining the game I felt the movment was a bit weird  let alone aiming was awkward  I hopped inside a car and noticed the weird AI running around the car like idiots untill they got in with glitchy animations one of them simply gave up and teleported in the car I started Driving and of course noticed the God Awful Driving mechanics, It felt like i was driving on a road covered with butter. The physics are even worse, You can scale an almost 90 degree mountain with your bike at full speed no problem You can jump off the mountain with your bike no problem and as you land you continue in full speed The shooting was pretty good aswell as the stealth system, tho it could of been better if the A.I wasnt retarded The game itself is very very repedetive. text_translate: Description: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege is a first-person multiplayer shooter that borrows from Counter Strike and hero shooters, mixing it together into a tactical, objective-based shootout where movement is slow and combat is fast. The game features asymmetrical gameplay where the teams are not always balanced in their abilities. Heavy emphasis is put on procedural environmental destruction allowing players to break certain structures by planting explosives, or shooting walls to make bullet holes or even larger ones to climb through. Pros: + Over 30 operators to choose from, based on real life counter terrorism units, each with their own unique weapons and gadgets. + No match will be the same thanks to the diverse cast of characters which is still getting expanded by Ubisoft, even 1.5 years after the game‚Äôs release. + Precise procedural destruction of most of the games floors and walls resulting in a tactical shooter like no other; simply running and gunning will only get you so far + Customization options for guns which also impact the way they operate. From a simple silencer to four different sights and weapon grips or fore grips, everything will change weapon behavior. + Pleasing graphics that look great and don‚Äôt require a monster PC to push 60 FPS or higher. + A fair use of micro-transactions where you can only buy skins and operators with real money but you can also unlock them through in-game currency. + You just can‚Äôt buy anything that gives you an advantage over other players. + Season pass owners get 1 week early access to new operators and all new operators in that year for free along with other skins and small benefits. + Maps are free for everyone, it doesn‚Äôt matter if you bought the season pass or not, everyone can play together. + Incredible sound engine that lets you hear precise enemy movement, like them walking into glass on the floor and other surfaces, or the exact direction where the steps are coming from. This is making good use of 5.1 surround sound or just good stereo headphones. + Music is fitting the game‚Äôs tone very well you just don‚Äôt hear much of it since it is only playing at the beginning and at the end of rounds which in turn is making you not really care for it all. Cons: - Lag compensation, netcode and tickrate is still broken and you sometimes die out of nowhere while your enemy could clearly see you. (This is being worked on and hopefully fixed in the near future) - Multiplayer against other players or against AI are the only two modes, there is no campaign which I think is a missed opportunity. - Steep learning curve that can be very frustrating for beginners since regular players of the game will know exactly what walls can be shot through, what angles work best and how to quickly peek corners to make the best use of the sometimes broken netcode. - Unlocking operators with in-game currency can take a long time based on your willingness to spend time with the game and how good you are. Just stay away from the starter edition or the game will be even more grindy since each base operators cost much much more than they normally would and you will be unable to upgrade to the standard edition once you bought the starter. Conclusion: While this iteration of the series is vastly different than it‚Äôs predecessors, I think it‚Äôs a solid addition to the series. Rainbow Six Siege is very unique in what it does and we have yet to see a game like it. I recommend it to fans of the Counter Strike Franchise, Call of Duty Series, and generally anyone who enjoys or is interested in tactical first person games where you have to be cautious of your surroundings, be aware of your enemies abilities, and a strong emphasis on teamwork. UPDATE: ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• game don't buy

text: This is an interesting game to tackle for a review. When a game is free and very short, it's odd to choose whether to recommend it or not. the static speaks my name can be completed in about ten minutes. If you're curious enough to play it and are not put off by the subject matter, there's really no reason not to give it a whirl. At the same time, I'm not going around telling people to play it. There are upsides and downsides, but it is lacking and not worth going out of your way for. Let's first cover the parts that are simple to discuss. The graphics are good. It has a unique art style that I enjoyed. The music is easily forgotten. It is low-key and is fine for the atmosphere, so in context it is okay. The controls are simple and do the job they need to. Since it is a walking simulator, there is no need for anything beyond the movement and examination keys. The sound is fine, and the game runs well. I would like to say more about these things, but there isn't much else to cover for them. That leads us to the story. The store page already gives the main gist of the game away, and even if it didn't, you'd learn it quickly upon starting to play. You're a man who is about to kill himself. Before doing so, you have some objectives to complete. You can't leave your house, so there isn't much to explore. The rooms that are present have distinctive features and are intriguing for a minute or two, then there is nothing else to do with them. Your interactions are limited. There isn't much to the game before reaching the end. This is one of those games that falls into the "artsy" category. You know how some people say games aren't games at times, but rather an expression of art and little else? They try to get something across to the players and that's it? I don't subscribe to that way of thinking except on very rare occasions. I certainly call the static speaks my name a video game. However, it only seems to be trying to convey messages rather than doing much else. Since that appears to be the point, I'm fine with that concept. Players should know what they are getting into, though, especially if that is not the kind of thing they would enjoy. I felt a sense of unease while playing. That's a good thing in this case. The atmosphere seems like it should be bleak, and it feels like I should be questioning what I see. Yet there wasn't enough to it to make me become that engaged. It's difficult for me to describe this because it is a personal thing rather than one I can factually analyze. I wasn't sucked into the game like I was in some walking simulators I've played, and despite the story being open-ended, I didn't care much to look deeper into it. Perhaps it was simply too open-ended for me. With only the barest of explanations, along with not getting much of a look into the protagonist's life, I had no reason to do much beyond finish playing, shrug, and move on. One thing that I did find disappointing is that the game ends when it looks like it could be much longer. I won't give away the exact reason for this, but it is an idea that has potential. It just didn't go anywhere with the part at the end. If it was a really bad game, I would be glad that it ended quickly. Instead, I felt let down because this small idea barely took off. I've seen some people claim that the static speaks my name has changed their lives. Certainly plenty of players have enjoyed it. If you think you would be interested in it, give it a try. As for me, it felt like a short story that didn't have enough substance to make it worth recommending. I don't regret playing it, but I also don't see much of a reason to do so.

No. But do I recommend it? Also no.

text_translate: In all honesty, I'm a seasoned player and regularly play FPS and TPS games, daily, oftentimes for hours on end. In roughly 25 years of gaming, I never had any problems with a single one of them. But this game... this game is 'special' in a really bad way. I don't mind some screenshaking and head-bobbing... lots of games have it and it never bothered me. But here it is RIDICULOUSLY high. On my search of a way to reduce it or turn it off, I stumbled upon so many threads on so many forums, where people are reporting that it renders it unplayable for them... more than I've ever seen for any other game before. And I can totally understand it. I'm a normal human being and not suffering from motion sickness. This game isn't inducing it either. I don't feel nauseous or anything... but it's really on the brink. It strains my eyes. They HURT. After just 30 minutes of playing this abomination of a screenshaking simulator, they're throbbing. I'm actually happy I alt-tabbed out of it right now, writing this review so my eyes can get a little rest. I'm not kidding! It really is THAT bad. Funnily enough they added it to give it a natural feeling. But it is SO MUCH that it feels completely unnatural and uncomfortable and it looks like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. Cut scenes are by far the worst. Even the cinematics that are no hand-cam shots and which are depicting fairly quiet scenes - like Lara sitting next to a camp fire - are shaking worse than the landing scene in Saving Private Ryan (again: I'm not exaggerating)! It's frantically jittering and flickering like crazy every second! When Lara is sitting at that camp fire, talking into the radio, you can't even fix her eyes in the close-up, because it's shaking so hard. She's calmly sitting next to a camp fire ffs! There are no explosions, no action, nothing. And the screen is shaking as if there's a Soviet artillery barrage at the start of the Berlin offensive... It is just ridiculous. If I were to refrain from sleeping for three days, drank 10l of coffee, get my hands broken and hosed down with icy water I could hold a handcamera more stable than that... When even someone who doesn't have motion sickness is having issues and can tell that this is totally overboard, something is really screwed up. Some people are making fun of the ones who get sick from this game... I feel like anyone who DOESN'T get affected at all by this amount of screen shaking can't possibly be sentient. I honestly cannot understand that they thought this was a good idea and it is absolutely pathetic that in more than 5 years they haven't patched an option into the game to turn this off, despite so many complaints and pleads from the players.  Same goes for the missing FoV slider... the terrible FoV basically goes hand-in-hand with the shaking and only makes it worse. There might be a good game underneath that earthquake footage that is going on on my screen, but after just 30 minutes of playing, I seriously don't know if I can torture myself to play through it.

text: WARNING! Beware of this fraudulent developer/publisher! Purchased rOt 2 legally on a bundlesite in October 2018. Now, two years later, the developer revoked the keys from all accounts from users who bought rOt 2 in a bundle. He claimed that he has been ripped off by the bundle seller. So what's to do now? Yes, punish the customers who bought his game in good faith. After complaints in the forums, he deleted all his comments and changed his name from "Lospi" to "LaPlace". Hey dev, if you‚Äôre having trouble with a retailer that you‚Äôve given your keys to for sale, don't punish us, the buyers! We're not the ones who wanted to harm you.
text_translate: I got this on sale for under two bucks and have found that the well-known bugs are indeed difficult to keep playing around. How could I completely resist a crime-themed pinball table--almost like a cross between pinball and PAYDAY! It's a shame this game is bug-ridden and will never be fixed, because the table seems pretty cool. You can play as a cop or a crook, meaning you'll get to try different missions on the table depending on which side you chose. The table looks good and the pinball seems like it might be pretty good. Unfortunately, the more I try it the more bugs I find. Forget portrait mode--the freaking menus will remain in landscape orientation, so you'll have to tilt your head sideways! Forget using a gamepad on this because it seems to be mapped incorrectly and you can't remap the controller at all. The files appear to be encrypted, so forget about trying to fix it that way. Really, this broken game should probably not be sold by any vendor any more.

text: This game is a joke and nothing like CK2 was. CK3 is a game like Risk with added fluff in the form of dynasties. people and setbacks in the form of inheritances. If you never got a clue how to play CK2 you can be very happy of CK3, because you simply can't understand how complex CK2 was when compared to CK3, and hence what a bad joke CK3 is. That's why I can recommend CK3 to people who are clueless of CK2.  But if you are a CK2 veteran and think about getting the same depth in CK3 I can never recommend CK3 to you. All you get in CK3 is a lot of fluff while you lose a ton of depth and strategy available in CK2. I myself therefore give negative recommendation to this game because fluff aside this is a lot less than CK2 was, and simply bad, if you expect to get something more complex than Risk is and as you can expect. If you buy a Porche which have top speed of 80 km/h you are unhappy for a reason, and your opinion is justified. CK2 is a Ferrari disguised as an Opel. CK3 is an Opel disguised as a Ferrari. * * * The new guaranteed fabricated casus belli in short amount of time has made the game a loller faith game, meaning a huge layer of strategy and core game play has been removed. You used to have to do a lot of marriage game to get heirs and people with inherited claims. You also had to use weak claims, meaning claims you can only press if the current holder is incapable, underage, or woman.  In CK2 you treasured people with claims, they were very important. You even had to work on getting people who have claims to your lands to your court, so that CPU can not use so easily their claims against you. People mattered! They were the core. Now in CK3 people are nothing, you just click and get casus belli, automatically and guaranteed, after a short amount of time. And like that would not be enough cheese, you can use learning life style trait and buy a claim instantly with some small amount of piety.  That means that now you can just save your siblings for super OP automatic alliances, which does not even break if you don't go yourself help in war, and the CPU come help you like always in your wars. People do not matter anymore a bit, and you just keep your baby factory rolling for  super OP alliances. Imagine a game focused on people where those people does not actually matter anything? That is what CK3 is. In CK2 you had to evaluate very carefully will you use your kids to try get an alliance or should you use them to get claims inherited for their kids. If you married them off for trying to get an alliance you risked giving the possible ally claims on your lands via their future siblings. If you tried to get them marry for alliance and stay in your court the CPU answered "no, because of political concerns", they did not want to give you free claim for their lands, and in addition to that an alliance to keep you safe until you are good to attack them. That's why you even assassinated people having claims on your lands, so that you would be more safe and so that CPU would be more eager to make an alliance with you via marriage because they would get claims on your lands in the future. When you went to war you had to evaluate very carefully can you ask help because your ally could say "no", and then you were without protection of that alliance since alliance was broken, which could mess you a lot because it was not easy to get alliances and because of issues making alliances in the first place, and more, if you use your kids to get alliances you can not use your precious kid to get marriage where his siblings get claims for you. So you had to think are you a worthwhile ally for the CPU ruler you are allied with? What kind of ruler they have? What is their situation in the game map? Can they just break the alliance at first opportunity and then even attack you with claims you let them have with marriages you made for alliance in the first place?  In CK3 there is absolutely nothing of the very delicate diplomacy and strategies needed in CK2, of which some I very briefly explained above. It is just a loller click game. Therefore, sorry to say this, but the game is total crap. There is no uncertainty, hence there is no risk, and no risk makes the game just boring. There is no strategy and intrigue needed because you can just click & casus belli. The game is just bad if you expect to get an experience even remotely close to CK2. However, if you understand nothing of CK2 you can have very good time with CK3.
