Dirt Rally 2.0 es el "mejor juego que han sacado en los √∫ltimos a√±os en lo referente y exclusivo a rally" Antes de comprar cualquier WRC es mucho mejor en Dirt en casi todo los sentidos menos que no tiene la licencia del campeonato del mundo WRC y quieras un juego arcade. En cuanto al contenido tienes que tener el juego con todos los DLC porque si no es muy escaso, lo cual el juego viene partido en 2, el juego base y los DLC, Tambi√©n comentar un punto muy importante, y es que el juego completo son 13 ubicaciones, pero solo 2 estapas diferentes por ubicaci√≥n aunque te las intentan vender como 12, haciendo la misma etapa hasta 6 tramos variando solo la distancia e invirtiendo la direcci√≥n del tramo. Pero realmente hay unos 25-35 km diferentes por rally, lo cual deja bastante que desear y sin mencionar que todo el contenido de los DLC es un refrito y el mismo del Dirt 1 por el cual en este te hacen pagar. Los coches si est√°n bastante bien, en cuanto a realismo y variedad y coches legendarios en la historia del rally cumple bien y es el mejor punto a favor del juego. La Optimizaci√≥n es asco literalmente, 110 GB de espacio que nadie sabe de donde salen y juego en cuanto a rendimiento del juego es malo en PC tambi√©n. Mi PC tiene una GTX 1050, Intel core  i5-8300H y 8 GB de Ram y desde la ultima actualizaci√≥n ya no puedo jugar a 60 FPS estables en calidad gr√°fica Muy Bajo lo cual hace la experiencia injugable. Pero decir que antes de la actualizaciones de Agosto 2020 tiraba el juego en calidad Medio sin ning√∫n problema. Por lo tanto, ¬ø Es Dirt Rally 2.0 recomendable ? la respuesta es si, siempre y cuando ames los rallys y tengas un PC pepino para tirarlo bien y pillandolo de oferta o key por menos de 15 euros el juego completo. Pero para alguien casual y que no tiene un buen PC hay otras opciones como Richard burns rally que es incluso mucho mas simulador y con bastantes mods por parte de la comunidad. O Assetto Corsa donde por menos dinero Tienes muchisimos tramos y todos los coches de rally gracias a los mods de la gran comunidad que tiene.

The main reason I was drawn to Bot Colony was because of the voice recognition.   After about 5-6 months I still get errors on startup. My Windows is a Dutch version while you need English recognition. I've tried numerous options on different computers, including downloading all necessary English files. Tried on desktop (Win7) and my laptop (Win 8.1) Still getting a wide range of errors on startup. Problem is a described on the discussion forum:  . Poster is a Dutchie as well, so I dont know if other languages get the same problems. Cancelling all error popups will result in the game to start. Its playable but without voice recognition. I'll redo my review once I get this game to work properly. Until now there's no reason for me to recommend it to anyone. Its still a promising game though imo.      Update april 20th 2016: Trying to get this to run on Windows 10 resulted in the same errors on startup and after clicking them away my pc had a bsd. Update june 17th 2016: I got an extremely rude comment from a "private" profile (a user with the same name as the main character of this game, how odd), which I deleted.   Anyone else who wants to insult me, grow up or just fix the damn game, I'll simply remove your comment. This is an honest review and I gave it a lot of hours to get this thing working.  Fact is, its STILL not working. I tried everything I could think of. Those 3.2h I have on this game, 0 minutes are playing time actually. And I dont count the hours I spent on searching for a fix. This means I WAS looking forward to playing this.

text: Dead by Daylight jest lepsze od Hide or die  Teraz ≈ºa≈Çuje ≈ºe kupilem to gre za 35 z≈Ç  wole dbd z hitboxami
text_translate: This game was a lot of fun back when it was fairly active, but now the game is lacking heavily in activity. Lag is pretty much a given due to the lack of players. It still has some in-game issues, bugs that were never fixed do occur, and disconnections happen every now and again.  On the other hand, lock boxes are easy to acquire, but sales in the market appear to be largely non-existent so there isn't much motivation to sell. So you just end up hoarding it all in your inventory, or you do trades with others to get onto the top skins leaderboard. Given the hours I put into this game, I would recommend the game. Obviously I have enjoyed it. It's a cheap game to play around in and because of its bare bones gameplay it's simple to get into, but the game is no longer in active development and with a dwindling player base there is less of a reason for people to pick it up and play.  In 2018 this game would had been good to pick up, but I can't say so at this point. I no longer recommend picking up this game. On sale? Might be worth it if enough new and old players joined in.

Usually i don't give games negative reviews but i'm seriously super iffy about this game. I entered it thinking it was a horror game with a plot twist somehow waiting to happen, but instead it turned out to be a interactive exploration game about some girl coming out to her family and running away with her lover. You explore a entire house and each room has clues of the story and you slowly stitch everything together. This might of been the kick off of the "Walking Simulator" genre popularity but it did not sit well for me. Either way, if you love short interactive explorers with serious story telling check it out, i'm sure you'll enjoy it

the basic idea seemed nice at first view. Manage your ship, fly around space anbd destroy other ships, customize your weapons and systems at stations, hire crew to boost stats. Classic rpg. Sadly, it feels like it was designed for you to be level 50 on the first mission. You dont take much damage but it takes about 5 minutes to destroy 1 ship and within the first 15 minutes of the game you encounter 7 ennemy ships.... There is hours of useless travel between missions, ship's hp vs weapons is really unbalanced, the voice acting is terrible and most of time cut out the last sentence. Im glad i got it for free because i would definitely not have paid for that. Unless you love spending alot of time holding a mouse click or holding the forward thrust without doing anything for 5 minutes, dont buy this. (on a side note, i think companies selling a game 50$ for a few months then giving it away for free are really unfair to all their customers whom paid for it. If i had paid 50$ for it and discover that everyone can get it permanently for free now, i would be really mad at the company and never buy any of their products anymore.)

text_translate: I admit I did not play this game a very long time but a lot of times you do not need 10 hours of playtime to see what the game is about. Right off the bat you are dropped in a police station with other players. You can talk to some npc's who give you a task and then off you go into the city to do this quest. Usually a quest involves just killing some zombies or fetching some item.  And that's basically all you do. Obviously you can get some new loot, which is most likely why there are still people playing this game.  I do not get excited by this formula anymore unless it's a really amazing game, which this one is not.  The game is free so if you are not looking to spend some money, at least you can give it a go.

text: As of right now, I would not recommend this game. It has so much potential, but it is ruined by a few things. The thing that absolutely kills this game is the input lag. It's like there is a 50ms input lag to the mouse and keyboard when playing this game. It almost makes me feel sick when I'm playing it. They should at least add a raw mouse input option in the final version of the game to alleviate the issue. I'm using a 144Hz G-sync monitor, and I'm playing the game at very high frame rates with high-end hardware. So my setup is not the cause of the input lag. It's the game. Another thing that ruins this is the match-making. It is pretty bad. There is no server browser so you have to rely on match-making. It takes around 20 minutes just to find a North American server, but it only takes a few minutes to find a European server. So if you are playing in the U.S. expect a high ping and further lag on top of the input lag. Also, expect your match to crash to the main menu often, and the only way to start a new match is to exit the game and wait until the match that you were in ends. Also, when you crash to the main menu, most of the interface gets broken. I do like that there is a global chat box in the main menu because you're gonna need to talk to people to get some help on the game mechanincs. The tutorials aren't that good, and they don't go into the details of how everything works. Once you figure out how everything works and you start playing the game, it can get somewhat addicting. The final thing that ruins the game is the repair times for weapons and armor. I've seen it take up to 18 real hours just to repair a damaged weapon or armor, and you can't upgrade your weapons or armor until they are repaired. In order to get fast repair times you have to pay real money. Kinda greedy there. If it wasn't for those major issues, the game would actually be really good. The graphics are fairly decent with beautiful atmosphere. Some of the textures are really low-res though. Also, the weapon models and textures look really good as well. There are tons of free weapons in this game, and each of the four factions have their own weapon sets. You can also spend real money on premium weapons. This kinda makes the game a little unfair though. There are three team-based game modes to play right now. There is TDM, a conquest-style mode called "Research", and a mode where teams fight to collect all of the batteries before the other team does called "Battery Retrieval". I only got to play TDM and Research because they are the only modes that match-making would find for me. The maps are also pretty large. They aren't even close to the size of Battlefield maps, but Survarium's TDM maps are much bigger than Battlefield's TDM maps. Also, the anomalies in the game are just purely frustrating. They block access to many parts of each map, and they will kill you if you just barely get in the vicinity of them. If you get a high enough isolation percentage on your armor you can capture them, but be prepared to grind for 50+ hours just to get to that point. I think there is a faction that is immune to anomalies, so that makes the game extremely unbalanced right off the bat. Once you collect an anomaly, they can be used as perks during that match. I don't know how useful they are because I never got good enough armor to collect them. The only purposed they served as for me were colorful, route-blocking death objects. The game gets extremely frustrating if you get paired up with players that are two or more tiers higher than you are. If you are a tier three player going against a tier five player or higher, prepare to get owned. At that point the enemies just become bullet sponges, and it becomes impossible to get kills. The only way to truely enjoy this game is if you are playing with people that are in the same tier as you (or with people no more than one tier higher than you are). The game is also slightly pay-to-win, but it's not that bad. I've had lots of fun with this game, but I eventually got fed up with the input and server lag, so I unistalled it. I will definitely reinstall this game when it leaves early access though.
text_translate: Another abandoned early access title. Very few early access games ever see their potential realized and this is another one. I am advising everyone not to support this developor and other's similiar.

text: Buggy and inconsistent. One moment a power line works, then if you have to remove it and put it back, it no longer works.  A power line from the source, does not provide power to something with in 150u, despite the line being blue. Teleporting 150u works with one teleporter, but not the teleporter next to it. You have to trick things into filling correctly, to get what you want made on a base. Most buildings do not have snap points with other categories. Auto targeting can not be turned off, so regardless of where you aim, your shots will target an enemy close by, instead of blasting the doors. Boosting... if there what the game considered an "object of interest" (eg: Space Station) between you and your chosen destination, it will automatically lock onto said object and go there instead, forcing you to take a round about way to get there. So many arbitrary limits on things too, and none of it stated anywhere in-game. How long can a power line go? What is "short range" for a teleporter? Why do I have to read a guide for this information and why does it not even seem consistent? The game has come a long way, but the developers have yet to fix many of the bugs users complain about. New content is nice, but not if players stop playing due to these bugs. Suggestion to the developers: Fix issues for a while. There is enough content for the time being.

text_translate: I can't recommend it until these problems get fixed. I'll review it again later, when these problems are adressed. *Updated 4/6/18

text: This still feels like a very early access game even though it somehow isn't. The screenshots are very selective in making the game look better than it does when actually playing. The game was fun for a little while, until I decided to fight a large amount of zombies and position myself at the top of a set of stairs. The zombies then clipped through the stairs making them impossible to hit as they got closer and hit me anyways. It was frustrating and felt very janky. The really frustrating part however was when the game reloaded me at the last checkpoint without any guns making the game impossible to progress as there weren't any others around I could get and I searched all over for the ones I had. After the respawn it also wouldn't allow me to walk through a hallway I had walked down prior to dying, the game would just get buggy feeling when trying to aim the path finding movement. Walking a few feet from the main path and you can see through the terrain and see the inside of hollow floating rocks making the game feel very unfinished and definitely lacking any polish or attention to detail. The shooting mechanics work alright and the game feels fine when it works, but many issues led the game to be unplayable in less than an hour which is a big disappointment. This game is absolutely not worth $40, maybe on a very steep discount it is fine to screw around in, but the game feels unfinished and abandoned. The controls are regularly frustrating and just moving around is annoying as it subtly twists you each time you move making it hard to line yourself up. The game at best feels like a clunky old arcade light gun shooter, though most of the time it seems like it would actually feel better as a game on rails to help hide all of the bad aspects of the game. Being one of the early big VR titles it had some room for forgiveness, but at this point it feels very outdated and rushed out the door to be an early VR title to get out before the competition. Visually the game feels like an asset flip game with many visuals feeling like they were pulled from a PS3 game, once again the screenshots do not look like the true in game experience even with the highest graphics settings using a Valve Index.

text_translate: Now this was one game i used to play down my local arcade all the time and i absolutely loved it,coin after coin would go into the machine and i would allways feel like i was playing the best game in all creation. Dragon's Lair 2: Timewarp Trailer - YouTube  Then i grew up,i still love this game (thats why i bought it and the original) but find that my love for it has dimminished somewhat.I think its because we have so many good and great games these days that we forget where games first came from and how simplistic they were,but i just dont feel the same playing this now as i did when i was that YOUNG man all them years ago. Don Bluth Talking About The Arcade Game Dragons Lair ...  Now let me say this the game itself is still the same,and DON BLUTHS animation is still as great as i remember and so is the voice acting and the in game music.Its just not the same experience as i remember and to be honest i have played through twice and dont think i will be doing so again in a hurry,which is a shame as one of the most fondly remembered games of my childhood has not stood the test of time and thats why i cant reccomend it to gamers of today. SPOILER ALERT*****DONT WATCH IF YOU WANT TO PLAY THROUGH AND SEE ALL THE GAME HAS TO OFFER FOR YOURSELF*****SPOILER ALERT Dragon's Lair II: Time Warp (1984 /1991) Start to Finish on ...  Video for Dragon's Lair 2 Time Warp Full Game‚ñ∫ 13:31‚ñ∫ 13:31 I still love the game but find that the magic has worn of and i dont know if i should have played it again as now i know what great games are i cant really settle for just sitting pushing buttons in one direction or the other and hitting A to use my sword at times. So i would reccomend it but only in the sales (and if it was cheap) and yes i would in a bundle also,but i cant in all good merit really reccomend it at the price it is. text: Ich habe damals, wie wahrscheinlich viele andere, mit der DayZ Mod f√ºr ARMA 2 angefangen. Mir hat die Mod sehr viel Spa√ü gemacht, mir war jedoch die Technik schlichtweg zu alt und zu gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig, ich freute mich also trotzdem sehr auf die Standalone. Nun, nach fast 150 Spielstunden, m√∂chte ich mich einmal √ºber das Spiel auslassen. 1) Technik Ich fange direkt mit dem schlimmsten an: Die Technik in der Standalone ist das Allerletzte. Es gibt Leute, die haben einen 0815-Aldi-PC und bei denen l√§uft das Spiel wie geschmiert - auf der anderen Seite sind dort Leute mit den teuersten High-End-Rechnern, die froh sind, wenn sie mal die 15-fps-Marke √ºberqueren. Auch ich hatte mit meiner Hardware noch nie Probleme mit √ºberhaupt irgendeinem Spiel, aber DayZ zwingt meinen PC in die Knie. In gro√üen St√§dten ist das Spiel beinahe unspielbar ... sollte ich dort mal in ein Feuergefecht geraten, ziehe ich definitiv den K√ºrzeren. Bugs wo man nur hinsieht. √úberall Bugs. Technisch gesehen l√§uft einfach nichts in diesem Spiel. Ich lese st√§ndig die Patchnotes, in denen mit riesigen Bugfixes geprahlt wird - bis ich feststelle, dass nur halb so viele Bugs gefixt wurden, wie Neue dazugekommen sind. Das macht mich einfach sauer. 2) Patches Es gab bereits unz√§hlige Patches mit Neuerungen. Auch hier kann ich die Entwickler nicht verstehen. Ich habe Verst√§ndnis daf√ºr, dass die Entwickler in einem Zwiespalt stecken ... die eine H√§lfte der Spiele m√∂chte endlich neue Features, die andere H√§lfte m√∂chte, dass die aktuelle Technik einfach funktioniert. Ich geh√∂re zur letzteren H√§lfte. Ich finde es schlichtweg unbegreiflich, wie man seine Priorit√§ten so setzen kann ... immer mehr und mehr und mehr Neuerungen ins Spiel bringen, obwohl nicht mal die Dinge funktionieren, die bereits ins Spiel implementiert sind. Es gab so viel √Ñrger bis dato ... ich kann mich an diesen gro√üen Patch erinnern, der alles √§ndern sollte. Der das Loot-System komplett √ºberarbeiten und das Spiel viel besser machen sollte. Was war? Das System hat danach √ºberhaupt GAR NICHT mehr funktioniert und man musste alles wieder r√ºckg√§ngig machen. Und so l√§uft es seit dem Release. Es macht einfach keinen Spa√ü mehr. 3) Survival-Aspekt und PvP Das, was das Spiel f√ºr mich ausmacht, ist der Survival-Aspekt. Man sollte sich am Leben halten. Hinzu kommt, dass DayZ ja ohnehin das Menschen-Experiment schlechthin ist ... trifft man auf Fremde, hat man nicht viel Zeit zu √ºberlegen, ob diese einem wohl freundlich gesinnt sind, oder eher nicht. Das hat das Spiel f√ºr mich spannend gemacht. Das hat das Spiel f√ºr mich ausgemacht. Die ersten 10-20 Stunden empfand ich das noch als relativ angenehm. Man hat viele freundliche Spieler getroffen. Heutzutage trifft man NUR NOCH (wirklich AUSSCHLIE√üLICH) unfreundliche Menschen ... es wird SOFORT geschossen. Die Regel in DayZ-Standalone: Wer zuerst entdeckt wird, ist schon sogut wie tot. Was f√ºr ein tolles Spielprinzip. Mir ist klar, dass das Bestandteil des Spiels ist, aber in der Standalone hat dies im Laufe der Alpha ein solches Ausma√ü angenommen, dass es nicht mehr feierlich ist. Zum Teil kann ich das sogar verstehen. Ich kann mich an die Zeiten erinnern, wo auf den meisten Servern das Loot-System so derma√üen kaputt war, dass man rein gar nichts mehr an Lebensmitteln gefunden hat. Da h√§tte wahrscheinlich jeder den anderen get√∂tet, um nur eine Flasche Wasser oder eine Banane abzugreifen. Als diese Zeit begann, h√∂rte ich auf zu spielen. Ich habs viele Monate sp√§ter wieder versucht, doch bis dato hat sich nicht viel dran ge√§ndert. Es ist sogar noch schlimmer geworden. Man findet teilweise stundenlang nicht mal einen einzigen Zombie. Man ist also quasi dazu gezwungen, PvP zu spielen, damit √ºberhaupt mal etwas passiert. Dieses Spielprinzip kotzt mich einfach nur an hoch 10. Das Spiel erlebt quasi regelm√§√üig einen kompletten Sinneswandel. Zu einem bestimmten Zeitpunkt findet man alle 5 Meter ein Maschinengewehr oder eine andere dicke Wumme samt Munition ... dann kommt der n√§chste Patch und pl√∂tzlich muss man 5 Stunden lang spielen, um mal etwas Dosenfra√ü zu finden. Was zur verdammten H√∂lle soll das? 4 Fazit) Das Einzige, was mich noch bei diesem Spiel h√§lt, sind meine Freunde. Ab und an ringt man sich dann doch einmal durch, das Spiel anzuschmei√üen und mit seinen Freunden √ºber die Map zu latschen. Bei mir pers√∂nlich h√§lt dies allerdings nicht sehr lang an ... wie oft ist es mir passiert, dass ich stundenlang spielte, eine sehr gute Ausr√ºstung hatte und pl√∂tzlich an einem 1m tiefen Graben gestorben bin? Ich habe darauf einfach keine Lust mehr. Ich pers√∂nlich bleibe zum aktuellen Zeitpunkt 100 mal lieber bei der Mod. H√§tte ich das alles vorher gewusst, h√§tte ich nie und nimmer 30‚Ç¨ f√ºr so einen Haufen Schrott ausgegeben. Ich hoffe wirklich sehr, sehr, sehr, dass das alles eine gute Wendung nimmt ... ich bin gespannt. Die Hoffnung stirbt zuletzt ... Kleine Nebeninfo: Wenn ihr mir jetzt mit dem Alpha-Ged√∂ns kommt, dann k√∂nnt ihr mir mal den Buckel runterrutschen.  Muss ein gutes Gef√ºhl f√ºr die Entwickler sein, sich auf dem sanften "Alpha-Versions-Kissen" auszuruhen. Egal was passiert, man kann immer sagen, dass ja √∂ffentlich darauf hingewiesen wurde, dass es sich lediglich um eine Alpha-Version handelt. Sch√∂n und gut, dass man darauf hinweist, man sollte eine solche Ausrede aber nicht nutzen, um seinen Kunden das Geld aus der Tasche zu ziehen und die ganze Sache bis aufs gr√∂bste hinauszuz√∂gern, sondern um einige, kleine Fehler zu entschuldigen und die Hilfe der Community anzunehmen und diese Fehler zu beseitigen. Das Spiel befindet sich seit 2 Jahren in einer Alpha und daran wird sich auch erstmal nichts √§ndern. Man muss sich das auf der Zunge zergehen lassen ... 2 Jahre und wir haben noch nicht mal eine Beta erreicht. Dank DayZ habe ich nun eine ganz andere Sichtweise von "Early Access" ... denn im Falle von DayZ ist "Early Access" wohl gleichbedeutend mit einer 10-j√§hrigen Alpha-Version. Das Spiel kommt einfach √ºberhaupt nicht voran, NULL. Ich pers√∂nlich fand DayZ in seinem Anfangsstadium sogar besser, als zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt. Eine wirklich peinliche Aktion und wenn das so weitergeht, wie bisher, dann wird das Spiel wirklich noch mindestens 2-3 Jahre in der Alpha-Phase bleiben ... UPDATE AM 05.01.2018 Nach etlichen Monaten habe ich mich nun noch einmal an DayZ versucht und nach etwa 20 Stunden in den letzten 2 Wochen muss ich sagen - ich bin positiv √ºberrascht. Die Performance hat mittlerweile einen deutlichen Schub bekommen, viele nervige Bugs wurden beseitigt und sogar das Loot System scheint mittlerweile zu funktionieren. Man findet ganz gut Loot, trotzdem aber nicht ZU viel, damit es zu einfach wird. Der Loot ergibt derweil auch Sinn - in Krankenh√§usern gibt es Medic-Loot, in Feuerwachen gibt es Feuerwehrklamotten und √Ñxte, in Polizeiwachen gibt es Pistolen und kleinere Maschinenpistolen. Die meisten Dinge funktionieren derweil nicht perfekt, aber doch schon bedeutend besser, als fr√ºher. Zombies gibt es derweil recht reichlich und sie agieren auch relativ nachvollziehbar. Sie sind nicht overpowered, aber auch nicht zu schwach. Derweil macht es sogar endlich mal Sinn, an ihnen vorbeizuschleichen. Einige Dinge sind noch etwas seltsam ... will man ein Lagerfeuer machen, nimmt der Spieler automatisch einen Stock in die Hand und legt daf√ºr die Nahkampfwaffe ab. So kann es passieren, dass man unbemerkt die Nahkampfwaffe verliert. Manchmal verschwinden auch Sachen im Inventar, weil diese v√∂llig unlogisch in irgendein Beh√§ltnis gepackt wurden. Das ist teilweise etwas nervig, ABER man kann sich dran gew√∂hnen und dann auch dagegen arbeiten und dann funktioniert es auch. Hier und da noch immer ein paar Bugs - aber ganz ehrlich ... es wird langsam. Ich bin wirklich positiv √ºberrascht von der 0.62. Nach ewig langer Zeit macht mir DayZ mal wieder Spa√ü. Bitte versaut es nicht wieder!!!!!! Den Daumen lasse ich trotzdem unten - die Entwicklungszeit ist einfach bis dato viel viel zu lang.

I got the game expecting another metro game but honestly I cannot recommend this game. Overall it's clunky, they removed the health regen entirely and enemies have weird phases where at one point they aim like snipers and another they aim like stormtroopers so here is all I can say. Pros: - Beautiful game - Interesting enviornments - Enjoyable story Cons: - No health regen makes the game feel grindy because you need to constantly craft syringes - Obnoxious "blood splatter" effect on the corners of your screen even if you're lightly hurt - The smallest drops causes you to take damage - Enemy AI is just upsetting when it comes to humans Conclusion: I would only recommend buying this game when it goes on sale and even then expect a lot of nuisances and clunkiness that you wouldn't otherwise see in the other metro games. I feel all development went into the graphics rather than actualy gameplay.

That's because the outcome is more or less similar regardless of which ending you get, in which the only thing that changes is the way Dianne ends up getting sexually abused. There‚Äôs also a 10-minute epilogue for each ending that plays more or less like an audio-CD, and to be honest they aren't worth it unless you really really want to get all the achievements in the game.  So yeah, avoid this one and play Magebuster: Amorous Augury instead.

text_translate: Admit it, we've all been there. Talking to a bot out of sheer loneliness. In the darkness, weeping while sipping out from an oversized glass of wine. Or maybe a keg of beer. No? No, neither have I. Hah! Why would I ever.. Talking to Hana is like talking to a kid that knows pretty much two word. Except maybe it's fifty instead, and the fact that she knows how to do this whole confusing math of kelvin vs celcius and how many second there is until the date is 27th of May. Or any other date, except you're talking to a bot.. So that's not a date, nuh-huh. In oracle mode she's supposed to be smart. All I got out of her was either "YES!" or "No, no, no, absolutely not!". Trigger-warning; Maybe it's the wrong time of the month. Meanwhile, in chat mode.. You get a response from certain words, like.. weight, boob, sex, age..  And you guessed it, she doesn't understand whole sentences, just singular words. Type in "age" and it'll automatically write "What's your age?" for you, but if you type in "What's your age?" yourself you'll get a Hana staring at you like you wrote something beyond her comprehension. Go figure. I should write something positive here before I turn into a bitter old lady; Selling the cards will make the game free and then some. People are weird. TL:DR; There's better options out there if you're ever THAT lonely.

text: Bought the game installed it and wouldn't start tried everything nothing works requested a refund ... so don't buy this game !!!!!!
text_translate: I guess I picked this up in a bundle nine months ago, and I was told 1.0 was coming soon, so I figured I would install and try it out for the first time to see how things are along with all the free weekenders... Game loads up on the wrong (secondary) screen, blinks then minimizes. Lots of background music playing. Stays minimized. Can't play a game minimized. The UE4-SurvivalGame Game has crashed and will close Fatal error! The UE4-SurvivalGame Game has crashed and will close Fatal error! The UE4-SurvivalGame Game has crashed and will close Fatal error! Uninstalled. I checked the Bug Report forum and saw threads regarding the wrong monitor issue dated back in January without the developers reacting to it, but I'm sure it's very known to them too. As mentioned above, this game was part of a bundle so my expectations weren't high to begin with, but if 1.0 is just around the corner tinyBuild needs to start cracking some whips before the release.

text_translate: Sky Mercenaries is "fast pased" action game with RPG elements i hated the game because of the graphics first of all i hate this graphic style because it looks cheap they could go for the pixel-art like most of them but what i really liked is the RPG elements which we don't see in most of the arcade games Pros: + RPG elements which aren't in most of this type of games + The color shifting is useful, You can dodge the lasers and the balls? when you shift to the same color of them but not the rockets + I've liked the bonus level , the escaping level it is a level that you escape in from the boss more than the levels in the game but the levels are decent Cons: -  The menu: after you select your character you can't go back to select another one so it is one way menu you can't return - Not much graphics options even for resolution there isn't - The most annoying part that game is "fast-pased" but it isn't , the space ship is faster than the rockets launches - Through the gameplay you'll see the the screen will slide to the right and the left , I mean what is the point of that, It would be better without it because i don't see any difference , It doesn't make the game better - The drones and the space ship are pretty big so, It is pretty hard to dodge like other arcade games and that is why they've added the color shifting, i think.. - No tutorial , The tutorial that they will give you is just about the controls and it is just a screen shows you the buttons, They don't show you what the bars are for what are the use of those bars so, You'll get confused in the first of the game - The game doesn't worth its original price, It is over-priced game more than a fast-pased game verdict: 4/10

text: Exact same issues as the original. Too focused on RNG and too little focus on change increase per reroll. Simply the same annoying game as before. Wanted to try it since it was Valve developing it, but I guess it's more fun to make an "RNG hates me" voice line instead of lowering or even removing it. It ruins your enjoyment that you cannot go for a strategy and stick with it because you don't get that one piece you lacked for 10+ rounds. I'll keep an eye open for updates on this game, but so far, super disappointed.
text_translate: The cringe is real with this title.

text: Que recuerdos jugar este juego en el 2013, con la primera tablet que me habia regalado en ese tiempo, en 2019 hard time lo agregaron a steam peroooooo esta muy mal porteado, da igual la pc que tengas siempre te ira a 15 fps, los controles estan mal hecho y hay teclas que no reaccionan, y zonas del juego que te dan bajones de fps (si hay muchos items en el suelo acostumbrate a los 9 fps) el juego nunca tuvo historia lo unico que hay que hacer es pasar x cantidad de dias en la carcel y cuando pasan esos x dias eres libre y puedes explorar el "mundo" es un mundo vacio sin nada, no vale la pena comprarlo almenos que te traiga nostalgia de haberlo jugarlo en el 2013. una lastima
text_translate: I am almost 40 and this is the first time I curse like there is no tomorrow for a single player game. I did not played pillars but I definetely not getting that one due to same mechanics.

text_translate: NOTE: Read the edit at the bottom. What the actuall hell is this? Is this a troll game or something? I know that the devs wanted this game to be hard, but seriously? This is stupidly difficult. I only had to play 7 minutes to know what type of game this was. The vast majority of players are not going to like it being THIS hard. At the very least, put a difficulty option in so more people would be open to playing this. I don't get making a game for players where most of them won't want to play it. I really don't. You would make more money and more people would be happy if you did. No options menu either. The game is loud as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, so I had to turn down my computer sound instead of in-game. And to top it all off, you just simply TELL US to get a refund, instead of listening to our concerns. Wow, just wow. I'd be happy to try this game out again if they majorly fix it (especially the difficulty options and general options menu), but I have a feeling they won't. Refunded for now. I'm so disappointed. I really thought that this game would be amazing, but I was wrong. EDIT: Since the intial review, the devs have already released 4 patches to help with the gameplay. I re-bought the game and already notice changes. While not everything is fixed, they are listening. That changes this whole thing completely. Once a few more patches come out, I expect this game will be a lot better. I still won't recommend for now, but they're on the right track.

Also the devs must be someone who has only been developing games for a few months before it was made because this is a game who someone with average skill could make in maybe a few days with a few bucks for the premade assets.

text: You leave your selected spawn point , start crouch running . You frequently hide behind cover but it doesn't matter because you get killed by someone whose position you have absolutely no knowledge of . The game doesn't provide a killcam either so you can't figure out where the sniper / demolitionist who killed you 5 times in a row is . You will die more than all the other games you have ever played combined  just in the first 1 hour . And honestly I do not see the fun in that . You rarely get a kill if you haven't joined the game early and picked sniper . Some maps do not have enough cover so you find yourself dying even more . I am convinced that only hardcore fps gamers play this and enjoy it . I wouldn't recommend ever buying it unless you are very skilled at this type of game. Overall I give it a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•/10 . Gave me brain tumors .

As an Assassin's Creed fanboi, for many years i wondered if i should give a try to Chronicles, since they are not included in the saga history. So far, i'm not enjoying Chronicles China. Chronicles China gives you the history of Shao Jun, the Chinese assassin, Ezio meets on Assassin's Creed Embers. Shao is fighting against the templars of China in order to seek vengeance of the fallen Chinese brotherhood. I like the way they tell Shao Jun's journey with small interactive drawings and amazing art behind them, but the main problem with this game, starts right in the story telling, the accent. HOW IN THE HELL, a game, set on china, has actors that speak American English? is cringe, and breaks the immersion. This happened on Unity, and it happened in here aswell. Worse than that? is probably the mechanics they implemented on this game. Gameplay is completly destroyed by the horrendous controls... Most of your actions work by using 2 buttons at the same time, for example: - Throwing a knife, you need to press (F + G) and that is extremely unconfortable. Most of your actions that not running, crouching or climbing, are like that. - Blocking an attack ( D + C or A + C), now imagine doing that... - Blocking and rolling to the enemies back (D+C+SPACE) how in the hell i m going to do that? Last but not least, many times i witnessed, that Shao Jun doesn't react when pressing a button. There was times, i was behind an enemy, pressing "Mouse" in order to assassinate, and she simply doesn't react. Despite all those negative aspects that for me, kills the experience, i like the game environment, and the setting is obviously the main reason i bought the game, not many games are set on China. If controls were better, it would be an enjoyable experience.

text_translate: Bethesda Game Studios  Open World, Role Playing  November 10 2015 TL;DR - The final score for this game, a 6 out of 10. Fallout 4 is a direct sequel to Fallout 3. The game sets in a futuristic apocalyptic Commonwealth or Boston, Massachusetts, riddled with dangers. It's running with Creation Engine, so it's a recycle engine from Skyrim. Without further ado, I am going to discuss in depth of this game's strengths and weaknesses. The game starts on Pre-War setting or before fallout apocalypse. You play as a   (what a shocker for hardcore fans but nonetheless I don't mind voiced customised character) and enlisted as a vault dweller for Vault 111. After you wake up from cryogenic sleep, you noticed that your only child has been taken away by an unknown assailant and killed your wife/husband (depending on what gender you're playing as). After you got out of Vault 111, the game gives you an amazing impression, where everything is... just chaotically beautiful. It is up to you how you find your child by unravelling the clues. There are multiple endings to choose from. The gunplay in Fallout 4 is simple. It feels like I am playing some sort of generic first person shooter game. The leveling system has perks and basic stats (also known as S.P.E.C.I.A.L.). It has RPG elements to it, such as apparel clothing, aids or temporary buffs, legendary loot system and crafting system. The game includes settlements, so let's make it in depth. Settlements are your base building, you need to maintain their happiness by building electricity, water, food, defenses and shelter. It can be frustrating at times where Preston Garvey bothers you to defend each settlements all the time, but I will save that discussion for later. You might come across with side quests and exploration during playthrough, it is your choice how you play. Power Armor will no longer needed the Power Armor training perk, so you can wear it in the beginning of your playthrough. Companion system is intact, now you can take whoever you want. I like the new V.A.T.S. system, it changes the pace of the gameplay. Instead of being stopped and pick any limbs, it's more of a bullet time. The crafting system is way better than its predecessors in my opinion. Weapons now have attachments. The loot system is a mixed reaction to me, like when killing countless of legendary enemies, I get the same loot unless I have to turn the difficulty up to increase the chance of getting better items. Companion system seems to be the same from Fallout New Vegas as I remember, it can be customised (wearing armor, equipping guns, carrying junk for you). You will earn a perk from companions by increasing the affection level of the companion. There are new factions added, but I'd rather not to spoil it. There are technical issues on this game. The graphics looked outdated for a 2015 triple A title until they release the HD texture download which is over 50GBs of texture files if you have DLCs implemented (holy ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, that's insane amount of storage). I'd suggest not to download the HD Texture Pack for now. The modding community are still angry about adding the paid mods called Creation Club, yes you heard me. I am sure you can get away with it by downloading mods from NexusMods (even though I am not into modding). This game is poorly optimized for the latest hardware. The AI in this game is horrendously dumb. Especially companion gets in your way but can't get out of the doorway (Dogmeat found something, dies by a trap). The game gets difficult when underlevel, so it is the best way to level up by doing side quest and exploration. The gunplay feels lackluster.   and   doesn't have an amazing gunplay but look how the gun handles. The gun keeps jamming when not repaired all the time, it's very simple and effective. I feel like this is the most repetitive and fetch fest game I have ever played, period. Like take an example of The Witcher 3, where the side quests are so fascinating and much freedom of how you get the reward. Can I talk about the settlements? Because that ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• is irritating as hell. "Our settlement needs our help", yes Preston Garvey I get it you piece of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. The quest design are poorly done, it's about fetch quests and dungeon clearing. Seriously, that is purely lazy as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. The main story is somewhat forgettable in first 10 hours since you have to figure out what to do. The story is kind of weak to me because there is nothing to change significantly and do some end game content, that's it. So, what is the verdict or my final score for this game? Well, the official critics nowadays are ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• suck, giving any game 90 out of 100 which is impossible to review the product in a day while they're in a middle of their playthrough. Do not listen to the critics. I bought this game around 30 Australian Dollars during sale and I don't think it is worth buying at full price. Besides, the GOTY edition is coming out soon. The final score for this game, a 6 out of 10. Seriously, if there was no fetch quests or boring endings, I can get away with a 7 or 8 even.

text_translate: So for starters, TL;DR - 3/10 Reason for this is simple. So i'll put it into a list. Upsides: - The hordes are cool - Robots. - Crafting feels nice - PvE is pretty nice. Downsides: - Feels too much like ARK (Uses arks engine) - PvP is dead. - Guns are garbage til end game. - Super repeatitive - Third person only - Character blocks your view alot of the time - Too many deer - Shelters are almost impossible to find unless playing single player - Glitchy at times - Good items are too rare or costly - No base building except in zones - Controls are Meh at best. Which hopefully it get's it. But currently in the current state, the game isn't worth it.

text: kuyruklu yƒ±lan playz
text_translate: -Performance/Optimisation is a bit better, I can now play at 4K@60FPS, but had to turn down the audience density to 80% otherwise it'll drop FPS in 8-Man matches. -Loading is a lot faster. -Up-to-date superstars. -Minor additions to the creation suite. -Able to adjust the hair shine. -More match types. -Tower mode, I like it but playing it too much times can bore you out. -IMO, I think the menu soundtracks are better than the some crap they put in the last game. -Fun with local co-op friends. -They have made the animations more faster. -Female Royal Rumble is finally here. -Better MyCareer story, although I'm not interested in it. -Faster custom creation loading in downloads section. -Reversals are a big pain in this game, even at 60FPS. They are similar to 2K16 and can be worse. You have really small reversal input window in major reversals. At many times you cannot even reversal despite not having that condition where you get major reversed. Minor reversals are OK at the beginning of matches. The only WWE game they made the reversals really perfect is in WWE 2K17. -Bugs, what can I say, this year is no different when it comes to the bugs. Let me start with stating what bugs there is in this game:      1. Shadow issues on entrances, the ring and outside the ring has a really bad shadow issue which solves itself once the       match starts.      2. When creating female CAWs, wearing specifics eyelashes prevents you wearing *CAPS*, as this isn't a bug, it is really stupid.      3. When previewing entrance music, eventually you'll encounter a bug where the entrance music will get cut out, this effect may also affect other CAWs and if that does happen, the CAW that was facing the issue will no longer have the       issue but another CAW will, so practically it's like a virus.      4. 8-Man tag team, the opponent team sometimes hit their own teammates several times before they leave each other alone.      5. When trying to do announcer table OMG, it ends up doing the powerbomb OMG. (A bug that occurs in WWE 2K18 and below games.      6. When previewing moves in move-sets, you can sometimes see a graphical bug which is below the opponent.      7. Some moves in movesets doesn't execute properly when previewing. And there's more. -Graphically, it looks a bit downgraded from the last game, I found that WWE 2K18's lighting was more better than WWE 2K19. -Copy & Pasted WWE 2K18 & put minor additions to the game like tower mode. -Payback has practically some abilities that was originally can be used in Ability Skills, just an excuse to not put the skills in the abilities skill anymore. -Menu is unattractive and sometimes can be confusing to navigate. -You can easily eliminate opponents in royal rumble despite having green health bar, short version of saying, Royal Rumble is absolutely $hit. -Game has a tendancy of randomly crashing. It can happen but randomly, during a match or during interacting with menu. -Still has auto target bug where running into an opponent doesn't get targeted infact the opponent behind the one who you trying to target/hit gets targeted. Manual target is a pain in the ass on 8-Man matches. -Developer support seems to heavily dropped this time around, hardly any updates to fix issues with the game. [NEW] -Major reversal timing are way more different compared to last year, when you get damaged, some major reversals can have so different timings, some may require to reverse at the beginning of move. -Playing more than 2 players, sometimes the reverse button on the top of the player get switched over to someone else who is playing with you, so for example, 1P get hit by someone, the 2P has the reversal button & option instead of 1P. -Playing 8-man matches, the game would like to destroy your friendship by auto targeting at your friends more than the bots themselves. -Targeting is absolutely bull$hit, if you run towards someone in front of your face in 8-man or 6-man ladders other matches, to attack them, it'll automatically targets someone who may be in the ring, or outside or even right across the outside ring, who is already attacking another bot. My recommendation is to wait for a sale, this game alone is worth ¬£25 or ¬£20, buying it at a full price is a madman's decision as it's the same as '18 but just few additions. Thankfully I found this game for ¬£25, so I'd say I'm fine with that. I would stay away from this game, till it's on sale, this game doesn't have much new features. It's practically a rip-off buying this game at full price, the new additions to the game is enough to make it possible to put it into a DLC. It's fun but can be ruined by annoying bugs. However not all bugs are annoying, there can be some funny unexpected ones, I've encounter many in 2K18. The one thing that bugged me with many WWE games, is that they keep changing the speed of animations every year, we can't keep getting used to the pace of the game if it's changing every year. Whoever says 2K/Yuke's don't make polished or great stable games, open your third eye, as your other two are blind.

text_translate: I first heard about   from a Rock, Paper, Shotgun article entitled "The Lighthouse Customer". I thought it sounded so cool when I was younger, yet I waited for years til I jumped on it. Sadly,   now rests in an abandoned, clunky state. The combat is slow and your character moves as though they have sprained all the joints in their body.  It's supposed to be a hardcore survival game where you must escape from mutated human/alien hybrids who lurk in the darkness of Syberia. You hunt animals, aliens, etc. while scavenging through the ruins of the old world.   has potential off the charts. Sadly the game is just pretty much zero fun to play. At this stage in its life - having not been updated in ages -   is a game that probably no-one will enjoy. And that's a shame.

text: When Dead Space meets Resident Evil and the mix is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.

text_translate: !!  It is a broken RPG that is not worth the $0.54 US Sale price.  There is a HINT that I should have noticed ==>  There are exactly ZERO { 0 } Reviews & ZERO { 0 } Screenshots.  Now certainly the Developer couldn't possibly have deleted ALL of them ?! Right ?? At the start, one may change the name of the Protagonist. However, the input is in a Cyrillic only alphabet Matrix. So use the Default name unless you are fluent in Russian. The Protagonist {PC} begins combat with only 1 { one } of nominally 450 Health Points {HP} !!  One must expend ever disappearing Magic Points {MP} to Heal the PC BEFORE   battle, just to be able to survive.  Then when PC leaves the battle, HP drops back to 1 point again.  AND the MP is not restored. AND Leveling up   either HP or MP. Also, the  . AND    Spells are the only effective offense, other than Fists :steamfacepalm:  Perhaps it is intended that the PC uses only a Sword. But that is not made explicit AND   in the early game. Perhaps there is a way to fix this, but the Developer has stopped responding to Forum comments. AND the game lacks instructions { at least in English}. NPC's responses are either in broken English or Russian.  It is not worth wasting my time to solve this; if that even is possible.

text: Als Nachfolger von State of Decay 1, wift einen dieses Spiel erneut in eine von Zombies √ºberlaufene Welt in der nicht nur der Kampf gegen die wandelnden Toten sondern auch jegliche Entscheidungen permanente Konsequenzen haben kann. Wie in Teil 1, setzten die Entwickler auch in diesem Spiel wieder auf den Survival-Faktor, was bei immer knapper werdenden Rohstoffen auf h√∂heren Schwierigkeitsstufen auch sehr sp√ºrbar ist. Welcher Schritt wird der Letzte sein, welche Entscheidung ist die Richtige!? St√ºck f√ºr St√ºck k√∂nnen Spieler dies beim Spielen in State of Decay 2 heraus finden und entweder beim ersten mal erfolgreich sein oder bei einem neuen Versuch. Leider wird die Qualit√§t von State of Decay 2 zu stark von einer Menge, teils zuf√§llig ausgel√∂sten, Bugs gemindert. Meiner Meinung nach so stark, dass ich vom Kauf des Spiel in seinem derzeitigen Zustand leider abraten muss. Hier eine Liste der Bugs die durchaus als *Game-Breaking* bezeichnet werden k√∂nnen; - AI von Companions (DLC - Heartland) setzt aus. Von dem Punkt weg reagieren die Companions auf nichts mehr und der Bug l√§sst sich durch ein neues Laden des Speicherstandes auch nicht beheben. (Spiel ¬¥muss dann von vorne begonnen werden) - Das Reperatur-Kit f√ºr die Fahrzeuge werden zu bomben. Bei Reperaturen von dem Zeitpunkt aus, explodieren die Fahrzeuge nur noch anstatt dass sie repariert werden. - Gegner Spawnen direkt bei den gesteuerten Charakteren. Im schlechtesten Falle, sind es viele m√§chtige Gegner und sorgen f√ºr den schnellen Tod des Charakters. - (DLC - Heartland) Manche Missionen erscheinen nicht mehr und die Story kann nicht mehr weiter fort gesetzt werden. Grunds√§tzlich ist zu sagen, h√§tte das Spiel durchaus Potential gehabt, doch wenn derartige Bugs nicht behoben werden und sie zuf√§llig spielende Personen treffen k√∂nnen, sollten die Entwickler nochmal an dem Projekt arbeiten um diese zu beheben. --------------------------------- 7/10 Gameplay, 8,2/10 Survival-Faktor, 4,8/10 Grafik (schon stark veraltet *sogar f√ºr Launchjahr*), 4,6/10 Soundtracks (Keine neuen Tracks seit State of Decay 1), 2,8/10 Character-Design (Charactere wirken schlampig designed) ---------------------------- - derzeit kann wegen der vielen Fehler im Spiel von meiner Seite aus kein Kauf empfohlen werden! -

After another 2 hours finally something worked and i get 3 rare supply drops as a gift from them . Other aspects of the game are good - Graphic , Story mode and a lot of multiplayer modes which i like . But i cant recommend this game to anyone of this bug that was fixed (they said it was fixed , but as i can see it wasnt ) a year ago but still there is a lot of people having this issue .

What an absolute technical mess this is. The menu is an entirely separate program and does not adhere to any settings and always runs in fullscreen. The actual racing games loads separately, which can lead to it appearing behind the menu, which then only says 'loading' without any info or button. What's the point of that? And if you tried the mouse steering options, then you're sol, as the cursor gets locked on the black screen and you can't do anything anymore. Is the racing any good? Can't say, as when I tried to start a second round it didn't load the race window and after 20 minutes of fiddling to get my cursor back, I couldn't bother anymore neither. Also the pictures on the store don't show how the gameplay actually looks like at all. All fake montages to show off graphics, despicable deceit.

text: [English Review] What to say about Destiny Warriors: the Way of the Ninja... "Did anyone see a ninja in this game? Let the creator of this game know that this is false advertising!" If it wasn't enough, this game has ridiculous and badly done maps, uncreative names, bad use of graphic and sound resources of RPG Maker. The game has third-party systems, graphics and music ...and there is no credits to anyone in any part of the game! Again, if it wasn't enough, the game is pure plagiarism of the anime Naruto. However not even as a copy the game got to be functional. It has terrible characters, and they do not even have motivation. Outside you will find out fighting several times, without even knowing why! The story of the game, as someone already said, appears to have been written by a 7 years old child... And believe me, I've seen good games made by children that can be better than a lot of games here on Steam. Not to mention the countless programming bugs, bad balanced enemies ... Seriously, you have over 15 spells, and only one of them causes some damage to enemies. Seriously, do not buy this game, even if it is for free. Or even if they pay you, do not play this piece of junk! It is not worth it in any way possible... Oh, and the part of "over 12 hours of gameplay", read it as: you will be 5 hours trapped in each puzzle, inside a maze with several forced battles. Resulting in more than 20 hours of torment, because the game does not know when to finish... And, yes, it has a continuation... but I hope it never goes out. But I doubt the efficiency of Steam to know when a game should be published or not. And I ask ... How can someone recommend a game badly made like that? --------------------------------- [PT-BR Review] O que dizer sobre Destiny Warriors: the Way of the Ninja... "Alguem viu algum ninja nesse jogo? Avisem ao criador que isso √© propaganda enganosa!" Como n√£o bastasse ter mapas ridiculamente malfeitos, nomes sem criatividade, p√©ssimo uso dos recursos graficos e sonoros do RPG Maker. O jogo tem sistemas, gr√°ficos e m√∫sicas de terceiros... e n√£o h√° creditos a ninguem em nenhuma parte do jogo! Como n√£o bastasse, o jogo √© um plagio sem tamanho do Anime Naruto. Por√©m nem como c√≥pia o jogo conseguiu ser funcional. Ele tem pessimos personagens, nem motiva√ß√£o eles tem. Fora que voc√™ vai se ver lutando diversas vezes, sem nem saber o porqu√™! A hist√≥ria do jogo como ja disseram parece ter sido escrita por uma crian√ßa de 7 anos... E acreditem, ja v√≠ bons jogos feitos por crian√ßas que conseguem ser melhores que muito jogo aqui no steam. Fora a exist√™ncia de inumeros bugs de programa√ß√£o, inimigos mal balanceados... s√©rio, voc√™ tem mais de 15 magias, e s√≥ uma delas causa algum dano ao inimigo. √â s√©rio, n√£o comprem esse jogo, nem se ele estiver de gra√ßa. Ou melhor, at√© mesmo se te pagarem, n√£o joguem esse lixo de jogo! Ele n√£o vale a pena em nenhum aspecto... Ah, e quanto a parte do "mais de 12 horas de gameplay", leia como: voc√™ vai ficar 5 horas preso em cada puzzle, dentro de um labirinto, com inumeras batalhas for√ßadas. Resultando em mais de 20 horas de tormento, pois o jogo n√£o sabe a hora de terminar... E, sim, ele tem uma continua√ß√£o... mas espero que ela nunca saia. Mas duvido da eficiencia do Steam em saber quando um jogo deve ou n√£o ser publicado. E pergunto... Como alguem consegue recomendar um jogo malfeito como esse?

text: This game was a masterpiece until they added the "Sunken Sins DLC," which is not actually a DLC, but a mandatory update that turns this brilliant piece of socio-religious storytelling into, for lack of a better description, a disease management sim. The addition of "afflictions" causes everybody in your village to get sick, and you will be scrambling to cure them throughout the entirety of the extended five-year playthrough. I also have no idea why they decided to extend the length of the game, as it adds nothing of value. Unfortunately, this new focus on curing afflictions completely overshadows the core of what the game is supposed to be - the detective work being performed by the high priest to expose sinners and sentence them to death. Instead, your goal is now to transform all of your followers into hideous mutants to make them immune to illness. If you manage to survive the entire five years while doing this, good for you - The RNG gods have smiled upon you. Either way, it's a tedious process that lacks any sort of strategy. Every action you take is out of necessity rather than choice. For a time, the developers allowed the original version of the game to be played through the Betas menu in Steam, but as far as I can tell this has been removed. The option is still there, but it will not properly install. It's a shame, because that is the way this game is meant to be played, and now it's gone forever. In short, this game was ruined by a mandatory update that added nothing of value. I cannot recommend it in its current state and that is not likely to change.

text: AoE2 is a fun, but I don't think "Age of Empires 2 HD" is something you should buy.  These evil devs release DLC that divides and destroyes the community, regularly brake the game, even offline, but wont work on a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• resoution setting, something games have had since DOS.  The resolution fix should make this product completely unacceptable to buy, and even if you like AoE, you shouldn't support the company by buying this.  Don't do it.  I've gifted this many times, only to have it be unplayable to my friend, because their setup has a resultion that is too large.  Don't support that. The single player functions   the way the original game did, with only one particularly bad bug that happens in just about every game, single, or multi.  If you are only interested in nostalgia for Conqueres, and computers opponents, go ahead.  This is where Age of Empires 2 HD is strongest, and its certainly easier to drop 5 bucks during a steam sale, than it is to find a hard copy, and install resultion, and compatability fixes.  If that's your intent, the minority of you should go right ahead.  Age of Empires 2 HD is absolutely the game for you. Here is a conprehensive list of bugs, many of which I can comfortably say happen to me every time I boot the game.  Its important to remember that this product   Age of Empires 2 + Age of Empires 2:Conquerers but a very close approximation of it.  Some of these aren't even bugs, they're just laze on the part of the new developer.  The biggest, and most virulent bug, which has never been fixed or really adressed, is units passing straight through each other, which is, if you think about it, the single most important thing for units not to do in a game of rock paper scizzors between spears, bows, and cavalry.  We've been waiting to control our reslution in-program for half a decade, and haven't gotten it, dispite three waves of DLC. We'll talk about that in a moment, the DLC, but first, a qualifier about balance.  In any game that is at least NP hard complex, that is, there is no best strategy you can pick every time, and hypothetically optimize to a point of perfection and assured victory, understanding variables is increadibly important.  If you can't always know what the best move is, then at least knowing what the possible moves are within the system is absolutely, positively key, and the more familiar you are with those moves, and how they play out, the better.  The late Microprose very obviously understood this on a very deep, conceptual level, because of the way age of empire's variety is acheived, and the AI they had, but the DLC practices of the new people in charge are totally and completely antithetical.   Each DLC has at least a civ or two with powers that change the landscape of the game, but because its DLC, you won't be able to use it.  They tried to create a middle ground, by creating a rotation system, where you can   TEST the civ out, but you don't build foundational knowledge without some sort of repetition, or consistancy.  Image in Starcraft, if Zerg were DLC.  Imagine how difficult it would be to fight Zerg players, not only because they get to play Zerg all the time, and become familiar with them, but you can't even get a proper number of games   zerg, because nobody want to play a faction they can't consistantly get good at, or practice.  Were it a fighting game, the equivalent behavior would mean there was an entire set of characters, ripe for the buying, that everyone is going to be weak against.  Sounds like fun, right?  It doesn't help that some of these new DLC civs, on top of having playstyles you won't be able to acclimate to, have some   overpowered units (gbetos, anyone?  Anyone want to defend that trashfire?). At the end of the day, you can technically turn off the DLC, and I usually do, but it doesn't matter, because of the abslute state of the multiplayer.  To call it a jungle is an understatement.  Do not trust anyone, or anything, as the system encourages you to cheat it, and doesn't recognize any sort of effort to report people for abuse, so unless you're already in the top 50% percentile, you won't have any fun playing, or learning the game.  To complicate this issue, there is a horrible, horrible, discconection issue that the current developers blame on bad netcode, and can't seem to fix, dispite selling tons of workshop teir DLC that must have had a near 100% ROI.  Out of 15 games, about 14 of them will end in complete syncronization snafu, and everyone will have to quit after about 30-45 minutes.  I hope you didn't want to play Age of Empires for its deep, intuitive tech tree, because its rush, or go home, now, and not because of the way age of empires was actually designed. So lets make this absolutely clear.  You aren't buying the original Age of Empires 2, this game has tons of DLC designed to extract money from nerds who love to win too much, and it doesn't work well, even after half a decade.  I've played this game a lot, I will again, but I have no illusions about what it is, a cash in.  They got their fat, grubby hands on a classic, and decided they were going to make some money.  It just happened to be Age of Empires, today.

text_translate: Being a huge fan of the original Primal Carnage, Primal Carnage: Extinction disappoints me. I spent almost 2,000 hours playing the original game, and I have to say that this game isn't fun to play at all. I thought during it's Early Access period that this game would get better, but it really didn't get too much better. The game has horrible balance, hit detection, hitboxes, and dinosaur movement. The game is also mostly filled with Roleplayers. There is no competitive community for this game like the original game had. Being a competitve player of the original, it just disappoints me to see Primal Carnage: Extinction become the game it is currently. The game seems to mostly revolve around people sitting around in servers and waiting for loot to drop. The whole game just seems to rely way too heavily on it's economy system. This game seems to be more about Quantity over Quality. Gameplay doesn't seem to be a priority for the developers which is saddening as that's what made the original game so great. The original game had excellent gameplay, and it was much more fun to play. If this game stopped being updated, it'd probably die quicker than the original would. Except for the Roleplayers, they would stay. All in all, this game is simply not worth it. Even it's name "Primal Carnage: Extinction" isn't right as the game simply has no carnage happening. If you want a game with carnage and action, go play the original Primal Carnage. It's cheaper and it's more fun than Primal Carnage: Extinction.

text: If you waded through the atrocious gameplay of Rescue Lucy and House 23 Escape DLC #1, you probably know that this DLC is not going to be good. Yet in the course of the eight days it took to release this after House 23 Escape DLC #1, even more problems somehow slithered into this add-on. It's rather amazing to see this game/series/whatever you might call it continue to roll downhill with no signs of stopping. Hopefully this is the last DLC they make, though I'm not getting my hopes up. House Escape DLC #2 (but not House 23 for whatever reason) is free, just like DLC #1. It's a small blessing to not cost anything, and it's another piece of the game to add to Rescue Lucy's ridiculously short length. Not that I get why it's part of Rescue Lucy, because once again, this has nothing to do with the dog or the girl. It also has nothing to do with DLC #1. Similar play-styles are there, but there are actually some odd changes as well. In Rescue Lucy, you had five seconds to kill monsters before they killed you. You had to use a different item for each monster. The five seconds part was an awful decision, but using the different items was a legitimately good choice. This DLC is where the developer finally figured out that the timer should be done away with. However, the unique items to kill monsters were taken out as well. Instead, you have a gun of all things, and you pick up some easily-found bullets to shoot whatever you find. There are only two exceptions to this, and it is not explained as to why you can't shoot those monsters too. Frankly, having a gun as a constant weapon in a point-and-click puzzle game is a poor choice. I am sure it could be used well some way or another, but not here. All the developer did was take a good and bad idea and switch them around, leaving us back at square one. The items zoom in each time you pick them up, but they have higher resolutions this time. Most of them are easy to identify, and thank everything for that, because they STILL don't have labels. The items menu works fine for combining items, and choosing to use them is as clunky as ever. This is especially bad with the number of keys you get. I swear that a good fourth of my gameplay in this DLC was swapping items around, with unlabeled keys being the biggest offenders. Most of the logic here is far more straightforward than in Rescue Lucy and DLC #1. There were only a few parts that stood out as bewildering to me, and they were still easy to figure out due to process of elimination. There has also been some sort of revelation between DLCs about needing to show what can be picked up and interacted with, for the mouse changes upon going over such locations. Hallelujah. As such, this DLC probably took less time for me than either the main game or its sibling DLC. Even so, it felt like it was about the same length, which means "not long at all." So I have mentioned some problems, but there are two that are far more offensive than what's already been listed. One is that there is a sliding tile puzzle. This is the first interactive game-puzzle-thing to be seen in this "series" and I applaud the developer for trying to add something new in. Then I boo and throw tomatoes because this puzzle is so poorly designed. Why? Because it isn't on its own separate plane. It overlaps the room you're in, and if you click where the door is that takes you back a room, you go there. Which means the puzzle resets. And you get to do it ALL. OVER. AGAIN. This happened TWICE to me despite me taking as great of care as I could to not click that door, and needless to say, I was boiling at the end of it. The other really obnoxious issue is the conclusion of the "story." I use quotes because there is no story to start out. At the end, you figure out what your goal was. And boy, is it a stupid goal. I won't spoil it in case you want to see the idiocy yourself, but get ready for out-of-place graphics, bad voice acting, and a stupid victory screen. On the bright side, since there's only two places with words in the whole game, there's no bad translations to read. Hey, avoiding written storytelling means there's less to screw up, so that makes this a masterful plan! At this point, I'm starting to think the DLCs are being produced to try and convince us that Rescue Lucy is not a bad game. With the DLCs being this bad, surely it must look good in comparison! Well, if that was the plan, it failed, because Rescue Lucy is still awful. DLC #1 is worse. DLC #2 is even worse. The amount of failure keeps increasing, and I am concerned that if a DLC #3 is released, it will be so bad that it will cause the internet to explode. Even if said third DLC were to be free, I would not want to be "graced" by its presence. Whether it does or not, avoid House Escape DLC #2 unless you really want to subject yourself to its horribleness.

text: The game was a fun concept, mastermind vs the survivors but the real novelty ends after you play the game. The game wasn't a standalone product but an actual part of another game a dumb move from capcom to promote selling resident evil remake but in doing so didn't get a huge playerbase so you end up with a game where not many people played. Now the only players I've see are hackers and cheaters and it seems like they are still updating the game and releasing things,  they even got the nerve to put in a cash shop to buy rp to leve up quicker, if only this was available to people to play.  Another big issue is the unbalance play between survivors and mastermind and just trying to be a mastermind might take you anywhere from 30 minutes to 1 hour just to either lose the game instantly to someone cheating or lose to high level survivors, if you are jumping in now you are in for a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• The lack of anti cheat and dedicated servers have now killed this game for me.

text: It has been a while since I played a game this bad. The controls are terrible, I don't know who thought the default control setup would be a good idea. But even when remapping them you run into the issue of Jump doubling as "OK". There's no fixing that. The wall grab mechanic is a nuisance, and the jumping in the game feels forced. The i frames and everything tied to them as a hindrance. The level design seems to have taken the developers about 3 minutes to think about (3 minutes total - not even per level). There is nothing about the game that I could recommend, except possibly to mute all music and sound if you do decide to play it - or maybe puncture your ear drums, either option would spare you a lot of pain.
text_translate: I am sorry guys, but I can't recommend this game. If you want a better way to start with Samurai Jack, watch all 5 seasons, that series is perfection. SPOILERS Okay, I of course was not expecting a masterpiece, as I am sure no one else was either, but for 40 dollars, I at least expected something decent. The story starts off where season 5 finale left off, you are about to head back in time to your homeland, but along the way, Aku manages to catch Jack and send him back to where he began his entire adventure, now you are going through all sorts of time portals, experiencing the shows most iconic places, meeting the most beloved characters of the show..(The Scotsman, Sam-Moo-Rhai, etc), and battling other well know villains and robots.  Jack has to find these Aku medallions and destroy them to advance further in time and get back to his home world. Right off the bat when you start the game, it looks terrible, the graphics seriously look like they can give late PS2 a run for it's money, character animations are horrid, and the gameplay/controls in general are stiff and clunky.  Keep in mind this is a third person hack n' slash, and holy balls is it basic, this whole game felt like a PS2 game, everything was outdated looking.  As with all hack n' slash, you will go through the games 8-9 worlds, leveling up your character and weapons with basic attack, defense, combos, the works..you collect coins and sort of magical fire/aura on the way to charge up your attacks. Sam-Moo-Rhai owns a store where you can buy, sell, upgrade, and repair your weapons and get healing items and other magical trinkets to aid you in battle. At the end of each stage is the obvious boss battle...and they suck.. I have never been so bored with end level bosses, and these take the cake, their attacks are easily choreographed and avoidable. Same thing can't be said for the main enemies, there are some parts where they all gang up on you and it is so broken, I had to use my haggis or hot water all up because I was trapped in a corner and like 10 zombies or metal bugs took their turns in a congo line to take shots at me. Their hit detections are atrocious and they hit you from across the galaxy with ease. Only really good thing about this was over time when you take damage, you lose pieces of your clothing and appear battle worn as in the shows, which was a nice detailed touch. That is pretty much it, music is okay at times but most it just feels generic, the whole thing just feels like a PS2 remake and not in a good way. I can't recommend the game for it's price, 40 bucks is not worth 5 hours of repetitive gameplay and boring outdated visuals. Trust me, if you want a better experience, watch the show instead, much...MUCH better!

text_translate: this game could become the best ARPG of the decade, too bad soo many bugs and glitches ruin the player experience...and i have love hate-like relationship with this game like with my ex-GF... it's buggy and unpolished, but i still keep playing it somehow :S - probably has the best graphics and animation above all ARPG diablo-like games (for now) - sound and the voice actor is really good tbh, i really like the sound of melee weapons and some magic spell when it cast. - freedom choice to make your character without skill/ability restriction depending of what passive/active skill and weapon that you used..the passive skill tree are more satisfying than diablo, PoE, or grim dawn..you could make your character a gun-mage build that could use turret gun while spamming AoE magic to wipe a mass of enemies group, or tanky-bruiser with 100% shield block but deals constant AoE attack spam if you have enough resources and regeneration, etc. - you have some equipments with 2 slot socket? good...roll it on NPC to get free 3 slot socketed gear :D - the UI are pretty similar from other ARPG like diablo - err...pretty cheap? 12$ if i converted the price to USD (at least in my region, idk about other region) - bug and glitches everywhere...and from what i've experienced are:  1. you often get stuck on some certain places, mostly between a ledge, wall, boxes, or something near the edge of the map, usually you cant do anything about it besides go back to menu and relog..oh and yes, you'll meet some of enemies that get stucked to..yay free hit! (for ranged weapon/skill, but you couldnt hit them with melee weap/skill ._. ) 2. your character sometimes will move like a beyblade..yes theyre spinning around when moving, i notices this when i moving through some stair or a small passage from upper ground to lower ground. 3. its so damn hard to click that damn items that lies on the floor !! ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•! ! you really need to click the item on the exact pixel to get it..this is happened too when you try to move or use item from your inventory 4. my char once get knockbacked so hard from a boss that makes it falling down (because the area is on a high places) to outside the area...the screen get blurry because of my character falling animation and TADA! my char is falling back to the town XD, but couldnt do anything to goes back to the boss area, cant even teleport to my friend who is still fighting that boss...and he killed it.. EZPZ 'freeloader' mode, i didn't even did anything LMAO B) 5. so both me and my friend died from a boss fight, usually if the both players on the party died, we will got transferred back to the town and restart from the last checkpoint portal before the boss fight, and our 'sidekick' NPC is still beating the boss..and we couldn't go back to the town, the return to town button isn't there...we waited a bit longer, and decides to go back to main menu, but our 'sidekick' NPC beated the boss singlehandedly XD and we got revived back at the same places we died before and the quest completed, we got the reward XD now idk if this is a good or bad thing..since we still finished the quest :D 6. once, i got my story progress far ahead of my friend, usually when we make a party, the player who got to story progress far ahead will go through the story progress of the player who is fall behind...but in my case, my friend skipped that entire gap between me and him, and now has the same main story progress with me..like wtf? he tried to leave the party and tried to do solo, but the progress is already the same like mine...it might be a good thing but, he couldnt get some unique/legendary reward from the story that he skipped. - online issues like disconnected when play in multiplayer mode still often happens - different character for offline and online mode..example: if you already have lv 50 character in online mode, and tried to play offline, you must start a new character exclusively for the offline mode. - no auto-sort item in the inventory, wtf...? - oh yeah almost forget to mention, don't bother to spend any attributes point on agility if you want to make melee DPS, somehow it doesn't matter how many point you spent on the agility (despite from the information it could boost your attack speed) , your hit will still slow af..just spam the AoE skill later in the end game >:) idk about ranged weapon if this affect their attack speed but my friend who's play as a gun-mage build, feels it's a needed attribute for reduces the casting speed. (maybe hes wrong or maybe im wrong, idk) - might add later if i found something new (and hilarious) ================================================================================================ i can't recommend this game for most people  but, if you don't care with all the bad aspect that i type above and its has a decent or cheap price in your region, you could buy this game if you want..it maybe buggy and unpolished, but still can make me feel addicted to play especially if you're like ARPG and grindfest/looter game.
