Fallout 4 is a good game, just not a good PC game. With mods and tweaks you can make it into a good PC game but the amount of effort I have to put in just to have an enjoyable experience is just sad. I have a high refresh monitor and just to get the game to run at the correct speed I have to edit config files and use 2 outside programs. Its ridiculous. I would only recommend buying this on steam if you have experience with modding. 3/10 PC port 7/10 Game

text_translate: Encountered many issues with this game Started off, it wouldn't let me download. My internet was fine and it just wouldn't do it. Somehow I managed to download it. Bootup the game, my controller is detected as 2 different ones, and made me play as both RedCup and BlueCup. This made me spend 20 minutes finding a fix for this. At this point I had spent 12 hours trying to actually get into the game, and I have done this finally, only to have a very small payoff. The soundtrack was decent but not good enough to warrant me spending an extra $10 on it, and the levels got stale very quickly. I only got to spend about half an hour on it before I just got bored of it.  The difficulty I found was rather pleasing, having played Hotline Miami 1 and 2 and Dark Souls, this game was one of the somewhat easier ones, but alas it got too boring before I could really do much.

text: edit at 20 hours or so  I love the comments on the review I posted at 5 hrs , none have the game that are public profiles . I love these people that when you want help someone not buy a bad game they  pounce on you say my computer is 10 year old clunker yet it is 13 month old ASUS desk top  not going stoop to their childish level of slamming some one for honest reviewing . they should  say if they got there copies free or work for the company   I have had 3 crashes that send report to company 4 freeze ups crashing game  I went into the groups see if anything was posted . I am not only one having graphic, mouse scrolling issues to name few I went into setup down played to the least graphic , details and played with  fps as well a  2 second mouse click in PC1 takes 5  seconds just to get the mouse pointer to where you want it . I can only assume the company used a old platform that does not work well with quad cores or mid range systems  I also feel screwed in I bought product at 15 percent off pre sale 60 bucks that the base game in 40. I got no extra battles yet the 2 promised DLC's well be same price and id the base game is this broken worthless Dlc's will be given as well  I am going think long hard before I ever buy from Matrix again I have loads of them on steam and many not sold on steam .  they should be ashamed to have let this go out with such broken game streaming  5 hours at review and I hate it 1000 hrs of PC1 I bought this pre sell based on all the good pre videos been shown . Nope I have a medium set up  quad core can play just about any game I want yet this one is so clunky  poor graphic scroll  mouse scroll is crap I played with video settings  and kept going back to highest setting . My internet is top speed . I beta test for matrix from time to time and am appalled that  they have put out this junk at such high price  My suggestion is  wait 6 months even a year  for them to fix the massive problems in  game play  . They normally are pretty good at support and patch work   PC1 was based of good solid game play with decent graphics and at the time great turn based play this garbage  rather have pretty men and tanks flying around then game play  I can tell you I never give bad reviews if played under 20 hours but  this game is broken in so many ways  I be hard pressed to say it is worth 15.00 bucks much less the field marshal edition I got suckered into buying for 60 bucks pre sale  I see a streaming live game in bottom and looks great must be another version sure not what I got  in its current state do not buy it get PC1

text_translate: This is the only Batman Arkham game that i couldn't get perfect game (100% achievement completed). Not because the achievement requirement is so hard but they shutdown the multiplayer server so that there is no chance for me to complete 11 mp achievement. The dev  diddn't want to make an acv patch or change mp acv to single player achievement after they shutdown the server, just 3 years after they launched the game. I am not an extreme completionist but saw another 4 of my Batman Arkham games got 100% achievement when this one was not completed is just not cool enough. So yeah this game is BIG NO for completionist. Not to mention i got 5-6 bug achievement (like Anyones See That, Silent Knight, etc) that won't pop up even i already repeat again in NG+ or I am The Night difficulty but still won't pop up or not work. The solution is make a new save game slot and play the game from zero again. just wanna say: HAPPY belated ANNIVERSARY SERVER SHUTDOWN FOR BATMAN: ARKHAM ORIGINS (12-4-2016)

text: As far as i can see, this is a cash grab. Now, it does have its upsides. The condottieri can be both cool and really annoying. For example, i like the proxy war concept, it's pretty cool to use lesser countries as a way of weakening rivals without entering into a truce or fighting their entire alliance, but it is also really bloody stupid when you are in a war with a country and all your rivals rent out their entire ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• armies to the enemy side for free, i mean, come on! And I have NEVER recieved one condottieri offer ever. The condottieri has its ups and downs The Map mechanic is pretty obselete Barbary pirates are irrelevent most of the time Trade leagues: possibly the only good mechanic in this, although they can be annoying, it is fun to play as venice and have a massive income and start wrecking massive nations like austria. All in all, is this DLC worth 17.99(NZD)? No Is it worth like 5$? Maybe Should you buy it at full price? God no.... Either wait for a 75% of sale or don't buy it at all. That's my advice.

text: Call of Duty Advancerd Warfare: Also das Game an sich ist echt gut gedacht. Die Umsetzung ist aber nicht ganz so gut gelungen! Es ist ja eine weiter Entwicklung von Modern Warfare. Es ist eine neue Generation aber es ist einfach zu weit in die Zukunft gedacht es ist nahe an Black Ops angelegt, daher ist es eher ein Kritikpunkt.  Die Story ist nett gehalten aber ziemlich strikt und beschr√§nkt wie es bei Call of Duty halt ist.  Der Mutliplayer hat wieder ein gro√ües Waffenspektrum aber wie es halt √ºblich ist sind manche Waffen sind einfach will st√§rker und besser als andere. Was die Hacker angeht sind sie auch in diesen spiel vorhanden aber es gibt auch kaum.  Was die Maps angeht, Die Maps sind immer zum teil an die Story angelegt. Hier ist es ist nicht gro√ü zuerkennen ich finde sie zu weit abweichend zur Story. Anders ist es aber gut dass manche der Maps sich w√§hrend dem Game ver√§ndern. so sind die Maps nicht ganz so langweilig.  Im Gro√üen und Ganzen ist das spiel wie jedes andere Call of Duty. Meine Empfehlung w√§re sich eventuell ein anderes Call of Duty zu kaufen was nicht zu alt und nicht so teuer ist.  Ich empfehle: Black ops 1 oder 2 und  Wer nicht zu in der Zukunft schwebt:  Modern Warfare 2 oder 3

text: I don't get, why this VN is so well liked. Yeah, it has its moments, but overall I was quite boring. I kept going, hoping for it to get to a point which validated its high ratings... That point didn't come. Yeah, technically it just worked, no bugs whatsoever. I admit, that should be praised more, since bugs are just so ubiquitous everywhere. From a story perspective, it was lacking. Even the Sakura games, which aren't know for their writing quality, were on average better than this VN. I had several scenes I just clicked quickly through, because they were just so bad (especially all the ones with big baldy, only the very last one I read fully). It is OK for the price of free, but that's it. I cannot give it a thumbs up rating with a clear conscience. Sorry for this critique to the developer, it shows a work of passion, but it fell short of expectations.

text: Sono molto indeciso per la valutazione di questo titolo. Ma alla fine ho pensato che fosse corretto sconsigliarlo (anche se costa 4.99 euro) a meno che gli sviluppatori non ripensino ad aggiungere un editor dei livelli e ad arirlo al modding anche tramite steam workshop. Le ragioni non sono nel gioco in se che √® fatto molto bene, curato, carino e anche appagante (ma fino a un certo punto.. vedi sotto). Il vero problema del gioco √® che √® veramente troppo (ma troppo) breve e tutto sommato anche facile. Nonostante gli achievement che per√≤ per essere sbloccati richiedono di giocare sempre i soliti quattro livelli in croce, il che potrebbe diventare noioso e frustrante. La longevit√† (esclusi gli achievement) si attesta su un'ora (se non addirittura meno)!!! sono quattro livelli in cui per sbloccarli bisogna risolvere facilissimi puzzle e spaventare tutte le persone (facile anche questo). Insomma √® tutto troppo piatto da gochillo flash per smerdfon... tuttavia ha potenziale. Il concept √® davvero bello se valorizzato a dovere. Agli sviluppatori suggerirei di consentire nello steam workshop la creazione di altri livelli fatti dagli utenti oppure la creazione di mod e espansioni (anche in forma dlc ma non a pagamento!). Che dire non ve lo consiglio al prezzo pieno ma magari ultra scontato si. Valutate voi quanto volete pagare un paio d'ore scarse di gioco. Nota per gli achievement hunter: il gioco √® facilmente completabile al 100%! EDIT: Sono stati aggiunti altri livelli gratuitamente. Una buona mossa ma anche i nuovi livelli sono troppo corti e troppo more of the same. Aggiungono un'oretta scarsa di longevit√†. Rimane prioritario il ricorso allo steam workshop imho. APPEAL &CONCEPT 7/10 (idea molto valida e con potenziale. Da curare meglio alcuni aspetti) SUPPORTO 5/10 (no dlc, no level editor, no steam workshop... insomma si pu√≤ fare di pi√π) GRAFICA 8/10 (stile carinissimo e fumettoso, belli i livelli e la caratterizzazione dei fantasmi) SONORO 5/10 (musiche carine ma ho dovuto azzerare il volume della musica che diventa troppo ripetitiva a lungo andare) GIOCABILITA' 6/10 (divertente ma alla fine i controlli e le cose da fare si esauriscono presto, consiglio il pad della xbox!) LONGEVITA' 2/10 (un paio d'ore e poco piu di gioco, anche dopo l'aggiunta dei nuovi livelli, ho detto tutto) ACHIEVEMENTS OK (facilmente completabile al 100%) VOTO FINALE 5.5/10 (non consigliato per la scarsa longevit√† a cui si potrebbe rimediare con lo steam workshop)
text_translate: There is something of a story here and three choices that either end the game or continue it, Don't waste your money. Unless... You want a ton of achievements. You get what you paid for, a ton of achievements at minimum price. This is not a game, it‚Äôs just a way of distributing achievements. All of these games work pretty much the same, you do some very basic things like clicking, leaving the game running, turning left or right, or solving very simple flash mini games to get stupid amount of achievements and more often than not very easy 100% perfect games to add to your profile, which if we can be honest is the only reason people buy these games.

text: ‚óè‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‡Æú€©€û€©‡Æú‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚óè Developer: DONTNOD Entertainment √ó¬∞√ó‚òÖSummary Review‚òÖ√ó¬∞√ó Overall Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ [2/5] Story: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Gameplay: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Sound: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ ‚óè‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‡Æú€©€û€©‡Æú‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚óè ‚òÖOVERALL‚òÖ I was severely disappointed by this game. The trailers make it look like an action packed thrill ride supported by a story rich environment; something like Batman meets Assassin's Creed in a Blade Runner universe, but sadly it fails at what should be a sure win formula. I'm only giving 2 stars for effort, but you've definitely flunked the class DONTNOD. ‚òÖSTORY‚òÖ This is one of the biggest drawbacks for me. It feels like they decided to make an action game based off the success of Batman and Assassin's creed set against a cyberpunk backdrop, but they forgot all about the story and just shoe-horned in something to justify why you're doing any of the crazy things they ask you to do. For instance, the first chapter of the game is all about you escaping from prison, because you'll surely die if you stay there. Fast-forward to chapter 4 and suddenly you're being asked to break back into the prison again. Because, you know, that makes sense. It's not like you could have just done whatever you needed to do in the prison while you were there in the first place. The character interaction is just... awkward. Dialog feels like it was written by a twelve year old boy that just saw Blade Runner for the first time and wanted to make a fanfic with boobies. ‚òÖGAMEPLAY‚òÖ Supposedly you're able to customize your combos and chain interesting moves together to "make your own" playstyle, but all the moves are basically the same and there's no real customization to be had. Not to mention you have to buy a $4 DLC just to get some extra moves. You can heal yourself by hitting people in the face, because, you know, that makes sense too. Zombies can cloak themselves like ghost in the shell meets Left 4 Dead, because, you know, that makes sense. And to make them visible, you have to turn on a conveniently placed light switch that only works for about three seconds, then you gotta hit it again with your virtual bullets (which doesn't break the light switch at all! even tho you just destroyed a crane with it early) because... that makes sense. You have these powerful combo chains that involve about five or six combos that you'll never get to the end of because you'll have to hop around the place like a rabbit on cocaine trying to avoid getting hit by your enemies. Say it with me now, "because that makes sense!" ‚òÖSOUND & MUSIC‚òÖ I never thought a game could have bad music, but I've been proven wrong here. The music is terrible. It's bland electro-house music mixed together on some free app on someone's phone, I think. Cutscenes are WAAAAY too loud and the rest of the game is far too quiet, so enjoy turning your volume up and down for the entire game, because that makes sense. ‚òÖBUGS & BOTHERS‚òÖ I'm not even gonna bother with the "Bugs & Bothers" section because this entire review is already filled with them.

text_translate: 12 ùê´ùêûùêöùê¨ùê®ùêßùê¨ ùê≠ùê® ùêßùê®ùê≠ ùê©ùê•ùêöùê≤ ùê≠ùê°ùê¢ùê¨ ùê†ùêöùê¶ùêû 1) It has no open land map like the previous Gothic games. Instead it has an one line map with no return possibility. That an big downside of the game. 2) It has not swimming ability anymore like in the previous Gothic games. You just straight die by go into the water.  3) It has not guilds ability anymore like in the previous Gothic games. Instead you can choose between three armors at one mile stone, and choose between another three at the next mile stone. 4) It has not skills ability anymore like in the previous Gothic games. As an example: You just have alchemy as an default skill instead. 5) The main charakter and the friends charakters like Diego, Xhardas, Milten do not have the same faces and look anymore like in the previous Gothic games.  6) You have no sprint ability anymore at all. In the previous Gothic games was forward move sprint (fastest), run (faster) and walk (slowest). Now it's removed sprint complety. The default movement is walking (slowest) instead of the default movement run (faster) like in the previous Gothic games. You can change the movement to run as default by edit the config file by follow my  . But even with this trick is the gameplay very slow. 7) There is no Mods at all. You can't find a single Mod at the Internet for this game. Not even one. Only some small Graphic Mod on Steam is found. But on Google search results is it complety invisible. Also are the existing Mods so small that i would even not call it as Mods. Its just some small changes on the game. 8) Instead of call the Game Gothic 4 they called it Arcania Gothic 4. The title is placed in the front like its an complety different game. 9) The game has no balancing. At the start of an new savegame, do one already die at the first monster. Only with cheats is an playthrough possible without die every few moments. 10) The developer has divided. With the separation from Piranha Bytes was an big quality loss follow. It show how big PB's quality impact was for the game. 11) The game (especially the boss fight) has lack of creativity. It's very poor and does not satisfy claims. 12) The game charaker is not bold and tough anymore. Instead he is exhausting and make bad jokes. Also does he make an uninterested impression. It's supposed to be an adventure game. What adventure has lack of motivation? The charakter just cry all game long how he not want this adventure, and he not suppose to save the word, and that he missing his wife so much. Its just super obnoxious.

text: I've played several other Telltale games and they all have a high quality to them that doesn't exist here. It is a single table of Poker with boring competitors. I played three tables just to see if anything changes. It doesn't. There is nothing interesting or fun nor are there achievements that may improve it. Do not buy this. Every other Poker game in the world is better and there is NO tale that is told.

It's fun at first, even with Rico's awkward body physics (feels like playing with a balloonman, Rico has no "weight"), but after several hours the game gets boring and gameplay feels stagnant and uninteresting.  The lack of ammo drops (like the ones in Mercenaries {Pandemic Studio 2005}) resulted in a rebuying of expensive weapon drops at $50,000 a piece instead of $2,000-$3,000 for ammo drops... and it unfortunately affects the gameplay in its unefficiency. Plus... the car/truck driving was stiff and not as fun as the driving in Sleeping Dogs- also from Square Enix. The world map is huge with plenty of places to go, and its scenery is incredibly diverse with snowy regions and tropical "Far Cry 3" locales... but the gameplay rarely changes. I don't know if I would pay any more money for Just Cause 3... maybe if it played like Sleeping Dogs I might buy it, but very unlikely. It is BORING.

text_translate: This game is adequate for the most part. The weapons are fun enough, The levels are pretty boring to look at but fun to explore, and the Geo-Modification aspect that the game really tries to sell to the player is only used MAYBE a handful of times, to be generous. The music is great, and in fact I would say that's the best part of it. You wouldn't get this game for the story, but that's to be typically expected in a game like this. So why would I NOT recommend it, although I'm saying the game is okay? Because of the inexplicable difficulty spike around the halfway point of the game. I say "spike," but it doesn't get any easier after this point; it's more like a difficulty  . This is whenever the Masako mercenaries come in. Before this point in the game, I would almost say the game was too  . Then, with the arrival of these mercenaries, you suddenly (I do mean suddenly; there's no gap between "too easy" and "instant death") and brutally have to switch to a different mode of playing. Whereas before you could almost go guns blazing, now you have to quicksave before you go around any corner, in case there's a railgun-wielding enemy who may or may not instantly shoot and kill you the second you peek around a corner; it seemed to be random. You also have to keep checking your flank in case the game decides to spawn an enemy wielding a railgun behind you. I can't speak for everyone, but having to constantly reload saves and hope that the AI decides to miss me is not my idea of fun. After dealing with this for a while, and making it to the 3/4 point or so, I gave myself invincibility just to finish. On top of this, at the very end of the game, you have to do a completely random minigame. Random here means two things: it comes out of nowhere, and it's random chance whether you'll get the right choices and complete it successfully. Rather than take everything you've learned to make some sort of climactic ending, the game throws this new, brief concept at you.  There was also the glitches I encountered while playing the game. I'm running a modern Windows 10 PC; any modern desktop can easily handle a game like this nowadays, to the point that the game gets a little overwhelmed. I had to cap my FPS at 30 at certain points so the game wouldn't inexplicably blow up important things I needed to use. The scope on the Railgun was unusable due to some bad texture or other, and the same thing happened to certain in-game display monitors. The game also skipped the final cutscene and instantly started rolling the credits after I completed the aforementioned minigame, so I thought that was the end until I decided to doublecheck. Ultimately, I would say that while this game is   it doesn't do enough good to outweigh the bad. I really wish they'd done more with the key feature advertised for their game (Geo-Modification.) I can't really say it left any impression on me other than frustration, but even that was only minor. Maybe get it for a sale if you feel like getting back to some oldies?

O jogo tem algumas similaridades com X-Com, seus gr√°ficos v√£o para o estilo realista, mas a jogabilidade deixa muito a desejar, a intelig√™ncia artificial √© bem simples o que acaba por n√£o ofertar desafio, os cen√°rios s√£o pequenos, falta mais detalhes t√°ticos que seriam muito bem recebidos no jogo, os equipamentos poderiam ser mais realistas como no jogo jagged alliance back in action, enfim n√£o vale o pre√ßo, pela mec√¢nica pobre eu avalio este game em 20 reais no m√°ximo. O tema √© bem interessante, e prometia muito, s√≥ compraria em mega descontos. Comprei e n√£o devolvo por gostar da tem√°tica de turnos e ter poucos games do g√™nero, √© um produto que poderia ser bem mais do que √©! =================== The game has some similarities to X-Com, its graphics go to the realistic style, but the gameplay leaves a lot to be desired, the artificial intelligence is very simple which ends up offering no challenge, the scenarios are small, lacking more tactical details than would be very well received in the game, the equipment could be more realistic as in the game jagged alliance back in action, finally not worth the price, by the poor mechanics I rate this game at 20 reais at most. The theme is very interesting, and promised a lot, would only buy at mega discounts. I bought and do not return because I like the theme of turns and have few games of the genre, is a product that could be much more than it is!

text_translate: Are you a complete newbie to this game?  Prepare to be completely dumped on by the remaining vets on the server. There were some very good parts to the game.  If you have VR, its an amazing experience.  The co-op vs AI can be fun with friends as well.  The land and water based fights are pretty basic but also good fun.   However, I got the game for the pvp air fights.  Unfortunately, the battle queue system puts you up against vehicles of the same level, it is not based on player experience.  Most games I played on the NA server i found myself flying towards battle for about 5-10 minutes but then being shot down within 3-4 seconds by the vets (who seem to be the majority of players left on the servers).  Those 5-10 minutes of flying into battle... top notch in vr.  The 'not getting the real chance to fight and improve at pvp', not so great.

text: Salutare Lume,uite ca a venit timpul si pentru review-ul lui Space Hulk.Ca si in jocul din 1993 ai la dispozitie Terminatori pe toata durata campaniei,care sunt impartiti in 3 clase:Heavy Flamer,Assault Cannon si Storm Bolters).Jocul are 2 campani una principala:Sin of Damnation si ce care este o campanie de introducere pentru cei care nu au jucat jocul clasic, aceasta campanie se numeste Boarding the Sin of Damnation. Salutare Lume,uite ca a venit timpul si pentru review-ul lui Space Hulk.Ca si in jocul din 1993 ai la dispozitie Terminatori pe toata durata campaniei,care sunt impartiti in 3 clase:Heavy Flamer,Assault Cannon si Storm Bolters).Jocul are 2 campani una principala:Sin of Damnation si ce care este o campanie de introducere pentru cei care nu au jucat jocul clasic, aceasta campanie se numeste Boarding the Sin of Damnation.   Povestea:Totul se invarte in jurul rasei umane si a unei rase extraterestre numita  Genestealer.Umanitatea trebuie sa anihileze exstraterestri inainte ca ei sa distruga rasa umana(suna a cliseu nu e asa?).Totusi un artefact a fost redescoperit dupa ce s-a crezut ca a fost pierdut.Ei bine v-as spune mai multe dar parca scriu prea   final povestea primeste un  6.   Gameplay: Intr-un final am ajuns si aici.Prima data sa mentionez ca este un joc turn base strategy.Acum sa enumaram niste soldati pe care ii gasim in fiecare clasa.Prima clasa,Heavy Flamer ei bine aceasta clasa are doar un soldat,Brother Zael, a doua clasa Assault Cannon la fel ca si in prima clasa doar un soldat,Brother Leon,si a treia clasa Storm Bolters care este ceva mai numeroasa, mai exact 6 soldati, acestia fiind:Brother Noctis,Brother Deino,Brother Goriel,Brother Valencio,Brother Scipio si Brother Omnio.Acum este timpul sa va prezint fiecare abilitate a lor.La Storm Bolter avem urmatoarele abilitati: Storm Bolter,Power Sword si inca 4 pentru mobiliate Overwatch,Guard,si Set Move and Fire Target.La Heavy Flamer avem doar o abilitate de atac Heavy Flamer si inca o de mobilitate, Guard. Si In final Assault Cannoncare are doar 3 abilitati de mobilitate Overwatch,Guard,si Set Move and Fire Target. Cand selectati o unitate va v-a aparea o camera in dreapta sus in acea camera puteti vedea din perspectiva acelei unitati. Si ca ultim detaliu aveti 2 tipuri de puncte: AP care sunt individuale fiecarui soldat mai exact 4 puncte pe soldat si puncte CP care sunt puncte comune care pot fi folosite doar cand vine vorba de mai mult de 4 miscari.Acestea fiind spuse gameplay-ul primeste o nota de 7 si nu 8 din cauza ca este prea repetitiv.     Grafica: Ei bine pentru anul 2013 as putea spune ca acest joc nu merita mai mult de 5 la capitolul grafica avand in vedere ca prin tot jocul am dat de Low Resolution Texture care mi-au sarit in ochi chiar daca nu eram atent la joc.Poate dar POATE daca s-ar mai fi lucrat la acest capitol si jocul era lansat in 2011 ar fi primit un 8 dar avand in vedere ca este anul 2013 aceasta sectiune v-a primi un 5.   Sunetul:Sunetul are o tenta de realistic dar nu prea reuseste.Totusi pentru incercare si pentru buna calitate a sunetului in toate aspectele ii dau nota 7.   Si cu asta ii acord jocului o nota finala de 6.5 si va astepam pe channelul nostru de youtube la noi livestream-uri si noi video-uri.
No permite ingresar a ninguna partida, y posee multiples fallos a la hora de iniciar el juego
text_translate: Confieso que yo era tercio superior en la UNI, pero comet√≠ el error de juntarme con unos compa√±eros que paraban evadiendo sus clases en el lan Beta que queda por Due√±as. Poco a poco me fue gustando el cifrut, los cuates y faltar a clases. Mi enamorada era linda, pero me termin√≥, a mi linda madre le ped√≠a dinero para mis "gastos" de la universidad, pero ese dinero lo destinaba a otras cosas poco productivas. Poco a poco comenzaba a oler a kk y me salieron granos en la cara producto del sedentarismo y de estar sentado 12 horas frente a una pantalla, sub√≠ de peso, entre tantas cosas, pero no me importaba en lo absoluto, porque mi rutina y meta era ser un jugador profesional de Dota como mi √≠dolo Smash.  Haciendo un recuento, perd√≠ dos valiosos a√±os de mi juventud, para colmo sigo estancado en  el tercer a√±o de la universidad, felizmente no hay mal que dure mil a√±os... Recapacite gracias al #Julgolero y su administrador Victor Ernesto Caballero Rodriguez (quien no pensaba en su viejita que vend√≠a huevito de codorniz frente al poder judicial para pagar sus estudios de periodista de Youtube), volv√≠ a la U y actualmente me encuentro trabajando por las tardes para apoyar en lo posible a mi honorable mamita, no quiero decepcionar m√°s a mis seres queridos.  Por cierto ya estoy bajando de peso y ya no tengo granos en la cara, deje los malos h√°bitos que hab√≠a adquirido gracias a ese maldito juego. Amigos, dejen el Dota, porque es un vicio que te lleva a la desgracia y a la perdici√≥n. Valoren el esfuerzo de sus padres y cu√≠denlos mucho si es que a√∫n los tienen en vida. Te desea V.E.C.R

text: this stupid game is run by stupid chimp baby dumb stoop baby monkeys
text_translate: I'm sorry, of course, but it's been so long and it's time to open your eyes to the truth. Hyip from the Witcher has already passed and you can soberly look at things. I've been trying to figure out for three years why everyone praises the Witcher so much. For me personally, he is head and shoulders below even the same of Skyrim. In the Witcher except for the beautiful nature and worked on quests (partly. The main story is only good in the first half of the game and all side effects should essentially do the same thing ‚Äî running on the trail using instinct) there is nothing at all. Gameplay the game is nothing. Absolutely deserted world, in which there is nothing to do but a dull grind of all the same villages and robber camps, which again makes no sense, as a reward you get absolutely useless stuff like a coil of wire or a handful of nails, which can only be sold for 5 cents. It is obvious that people did not even really try and just stupidly tried to "wind the timing" of game time, filling up the desert world with useless debris of the same type. The combat system is so poor and simple (not to mention that 90% of the abilok just useless) that I had a strong feeling that I was trying to get wet face in A. not Only that, to complete the game you just had to zaklikivat enemy (not even dodging at the same time, because you can just smear Kven and not strain the extra finger), so they still give you an abilka, so you can just hold down one button, close your eyes and quietly wait until Geralt does everything himself. And it's all at maximum complexity, of course. I can't even imagine what it's like to play on a lower difficulty. You must be accompanied by a group of vassals, clearing the way for you from any fall, or something like that. After two parts of the DS to play such a gameplay misunderstanding was for me a real torture.  Many criticize Skyrim for casualness, but the Witcher surpassed all possible limits. So oxazolines interactive kintz from the world of RPG, I haven't seen. Duck would be okay, was a fascinating story, but this is also a problem. Really interesting was the only quest line of the bloody Baron. Perhaps the most elaborate part of the game. But then everything went on rolled and rolled into an absolute banality. Im honestly dissapointed Ubisoft. From watching the trailers the game looked fun, interactive, intresting and most importently replayable So I said: "alright awsome ima buy this game"  I have a GTX 960 4GB and 8 RAM i think im able to run it on Very High - Ultra 40 FPS After 14 hours of downloading it, I get greeted with a cute main menu  I crank up the Video Settings and set off I notice the terriable FPS drops and I lowerd the video setting I had to lower them to High to get just 35 - 40 FPS? with my Video Card? Bullsh*t. Instantly upon joining the game I felt the movment was a bit weird  let alone aiming was awkward  I hopped inside a car and noticed the weird AI running around the car like idiots untill they got in with glitchy animations one of them simply gave up and teleported in the car I started Driving and of course noticed the God Awful Driving mechanics, It felt like i was driving on a road covered with butter. The physics are even worse, You can scale an almost 90 degree mountain with your bike at full speed no problem You can jump off the mountain with your bike no problem and as you land you continue in full speed The shooting was pretty good aswell as the stealth system, tho it could of been better if the A.I wasnt retarded The game itself is very very repedetive. Go there. Kill the bad guys. Do that thing (interrogate, kill, collect some random ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• etc..) and do it over and over and over and over again The In game menu is so cluttered and is a pain in the ass to navigate  There are lots of weapons but you will see yourself using maybe 6 out of all of them Play this only if you have friends so you can atleast get a giggle out of this poorly optimized, glitchy, wonky, repedetive piece of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• 4\10 It tried to be everything, ended up being nothing.

Description: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege is a first-person multiplayer shooter that borrows from Counter Strike and hero shooters, mixing it together into a tactical, objective-based shootout where movement is slow and combat is fast. The game features asymmetrical gameplay where the teams are not always balanced in their abilities. Heavy emphasis is put on procedural environmental destruction allowing players to break certain structures by planting explosives, or shooting walls to make bullet holes or even larger ones to climb through. Pros: + Over 30 operators to choose from, based on real life counter terrorism units, each with their own unique weapons and gadgets. + No match will be the same thanks to the diverse cast of characters which is still getting expanded by Ubisoft, even 1.5 years after the game‚Äôs release. + Precise procedural destruction of most of the games floors and walls resulting in a tactical shooter like no other; simply running and gunning will only get you so far + Customization options for guns which also impact the way they operate. From a simple silencer to four different sights and weapon grips or fore grips, everything will change weapon behavior. + Pleasing graphics that look great and don‚Äôt require a monster PC to push 60 FPS or higher. + A fair use of micro-transactions where you can only buy skins and operators with real money but you can also unlock them through in-game currency. + You just can‚Äôt buy anything that gives you an advantage over other players. + Season pass owners get 1 week early access to new operators and all new operators in that year for free along with other skins and small benefits. + Maps are free for everyone, it doesn‚Äôt matter if you bought the season pass or not, everyone can play together. + Incredible sound engine that lets you hear precise enemy movement, like them walking into glass on the floor and other surfaces, or the exact direction where the steps are coming from. This is making good use of 5.1 surround sound or just good stereo headphones. + Music is fitting the game‚Äôs tone very well you just don‚Äôt hear much of it since it is only playing at the beginning and at the end of rounds which in turn is making you not really care for it all. Cons: - Lag compensation, netcode and tickrate is still broken and you sometimes die out of nowhere while your enemy could clearly see you. (This is being worked on and hopefully fixed in the near future) - Multiplayer against other players or against AI are the only two modes, there is no campaign which I think is a missed opportunity. - Steep learning curve that can be very frustrating for beginners since regular players of the game will know exactly what walls can be shot through, what angles work best and how to quickly peek corners to make the best use of the sometimes broken netcode. - Unlocking operators with in-game currency can take a long time based on your willingness to spend time with the game and how good you are. Just stay away from the starter edition or the game will be even more grindy since each base operators cost much much more than they normally would and you will be unable to upgrade to the standard edition once you bought the starter. Conclusion: While this iteration of the series is vastly different than it‚Äôs predecessors, I think it‚Äôs a solid addition to the series. Rainbow Six Siege is very unique in what it does and we have yet to see a game like it. I recommend it to fans of the Counter Strike Franchise, Call of Duty Series, and generally anyone who enjoys or is interested in tactical first person games where you have to be cautious of your surroundings, be aware of your enemies abilities, and a strong emphasis on teamwork. UPDATE: ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• game don't buy

Have you ever wanted to play a game with "porno" in the title that had zero nudity? No? Well, here it is anyways: Porno Studio Tycoon.  I won this game in a giveaway on   and made a YouTube video on it, but honestly, this game is incredibly boring. The tutorial is also a mess and doesn't ACTUALLY teach you to play the game. You even ask the tutorial lady if you're going to do any tweaks to your final product and she says no and that she wants you to learn what happens when you're lazy. So you don't get to find out what you're doing or how to make your product "good". Then when you're in the actual game, it gets very, very repetitive.  Will I play it again? No. But do I recommend it? Also no.

In all honesty, I'm a seasoned player and regularly play FPS and TPS games, daily, oftentimes for hours on end. In roughly 25 years of gaming, I never had any problems with a single one of them. But this game... this game is 'special' in a really bad way. I don't mind some screenshaking and head-bobbing... lots of games have it and it never bothered me. But here it is RIDICULOUSLY high. On my search of a way to reduce it or turn it off, I stumbled upon so many threads on so many forums, where people are reporting that it renders it unplayable for them... more than I've ever seen for any other game before. And I can totally understand it. I'm a normal human being and not suffering from motion sickness. This game isn't inducing it either. I don't feel nauseous or anything... but it's really on the brink. It strains my eyes. They HURT. After just 30 minutes of playing this abomination of a screenshaking simulator, they're throbbing. I'm actually happy I alt-tabbed out of it right now, writing this review so my eyes can get a little rest. I'm not kidding! It really is THAT bad. Funnily enough they added it to give it a natural feeling. But it is SO MUCH that it feels completely unnatural and uncomfortable and it looks like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. Cut scenes are by far the worst. Even the cinematics that are no hand-cam shots and which are depicting fairly quiet scenes - like Lara sitting next to a camp fire - are shaking worse than the landing scene in Saving Private Ryan (again: I'm not exaggerating)! It's frantically jittering and flickering like crazy every second! When Lara is sitting at that camp fire, talking into the radio, you can't even fix her eyes in the close-up, because it's shaking so hard. She's calmly sitting next to a camp fire ffs! There are no explosions, no action, nothing. And the screen is shaking as if there's a Soviet artillery barrage at the start of the Berlin offensive... It is just ridiculous. If I were to refrain from sleeping for three days, drank 10l of coffee, get my hands broken and hosed down with icy water I could hold a handcamera more stable than that... When even someone who doesn't have motion sickness is having issues and can tell that this is totally overboard, something is really screwed up. Some people are making fun of the ones who get sick from this game... I feel like anyone who DOESN'T get affected at all by this amount of screen shaking can't possibly be sentient. I honestly cannot understand that they thought this was a good idea and it is absolutely pathetic that in more than 5 years they haven't patched an option into the game to turn this off, despite so many complaints and pleads from the players.  Same goes for the missing FoV slider... the terrible FoV basically goes hand-in-hand with the shaking and only makes it worse. There might be a good game underneath that earthquake footage that is going on on my screen, but after just 30 minutes of playing, I seriously don't know if I can torture myself to play through it.
Pros > looks sick Cons > you need nasas computer.

I got this on sale for under two bucks and have found that the well-known bugs are indeed difficult to keep playing around. How could I completely resist a crime-themed pinball table--almost like a cross between pinball and PAYDAY! It's a shame this game is bug-ridden and will never be fixed, because the table seems pretty cool. You can play as a cop or a crook, meaning you'll get to try different missions on the table depending on which side you chose. The table looks good and the pinball seems like it might be pretty good. Unfortunately, the more I try it the more bugs I find. Forget portrait mode--the freaking menus will remain in landscape orientation, so you'll have to tilt your head sideways! Forget using a gamepad on this because it seems to be mapped incorrectly and you can't remap the controller at all. The files appear to be encrypted, so forget about trying to fix it that way. Really, this broken game should probably not be sold by any vendor any more.

: One of the recent patches causes the game to completely freeze for a long duration every few seconds, making it utterly unplayable in Online mode. This remaster brings nothing new to the table for PC owners of PTD edition, so it should have been completely free like Skyrim SE. I can ONLY recommend this to people who have never played it before. It's certainly not worth even half the price (50% discount for owners of the the original release) as there aren't any noticeable improvements and some of the most critical glitches and exploits have NOT been fixed.

Antes de empezar decir que Dirt 2.0 Ya lo tenia de antes en PS4 as√≠ que las horas dedicadas son muchas m√°s de las que tengo en Steam. Dirt Rally 2.0 es el "mejor juego que han sacado en los √∫ltimos a√±os en lo referente y exclusivo a rally" Antes de comprar cualquier WRC es mucho mejor en Dirt en casi todo los sentidos menos que no tiene la licencia del campeonato del mundo WRC y quieras un juego arcade. En cuanto al contenido tienes que tener el juego con todos los DLC porque si no es muy escaso, lo cual el juego viene partido en 2, el juego base y los DLC, Tambi√©n comentar un punto muy importante, y es que el juego completo son 13 ubicaciones, pero solo 2 estapas diferentes por ubicaci√≥n aunque te las intentan vender como 12, haciendo la misma etapa hasta 6 tramos variando solo la distancia e invirtiendo la direcci√≥n del tramo. Pero realmente hay unos 25-35 km diferentes por rally, lo cual deja bastante que desear y sin mencionar que todo el contenido de los DLC es un refrito y el mismo del Dirt 1 por el cual en este te hacen pagar. Los coches si est√°n bastante bien, en cuanto a realismo y variedad y coches legendarios en la historia del rally cumple bien y es el mejor punto a favor del juego. La Optimizaci√≥n es asco literalmente, 110 GB de espacio que nadie sabe de donde salen y juego en cuanto a rendimiento del juego es malo en PC tambi√©n. Mi PC tiene una GTX 1050, Intel core  i5-8300H y 8 GB de Ram y desde la ultima actualizaci√≥n ya no puedo jugar a 60 FPS estables en calidad gr√°fica Muy Bajo lo cual hace la experiencia injugable. Pero decir que antes de la actualizaciones de Agosto 2020 tiraba el juego en calidad Medio sin ning√∫n problema. Por lo tanto, ¬ø Es Dirt Rally 2.0 recomendable ? la respuesta es si, siempre y cuando ames los rallys y tengas un PC pepino para tirarlo bien y pillandolo de oferta o key por menos de 15 euros el juego completo. Pero para alguien casual y que no tiene un buen PC hay otras opciones como Richard burns rally que es incluso mucho mas simulador y con bastantes mods por parte de la comunidad. O Assetto Corsa donde por menos dinero Tienes muchisimos tramos y todos los coches de rally gracias a los mods de la gran comunidad que tiene.

The main reason I was drawn to Bot Colony was because of the voice recognition.   After about 5-6 months I still get errors on startup. My Windows is a Dutch version while you need English recognition. I've tried numerous options on different computers, including downloading all necessary English files. Tried on desktop (Win7) and my laptop (Win 8.1) Still getting a wide range of errors on startup. Problem is a described on the discussion forum:  . Poster is a Dutchie as well, so I dont know if other languages get the same problems. Cancelling all error popups will result in the game to start. Its playable but without voice recognition. I'll redo my review once I get this game to work properly. Until now there's no reason for me to recommend it to anyone. Its still a promising game though imo.      Update april 20th 2016: Trying to get this to run on Windows 10 resulted in the same errors on startup and after clicking them away my pc had a bsd. Update june 17th 2016: I got an extremely rude comment from a "private" profile (a user with the same name as the main character of this game, how odd), which I deleted.   Anyone else who wants to insult me, grow up or just fix the damn game, I'll simply remove your comment. This is an honest review and I gave it a lot of hours to get this thing working.  Fact is, its STILL not working. I tried everything I could think of. Those 3.2h I have on this game, 0 minutes are playing time actually. And I dont count the hours I spent on searching for a fix. This means I WAS looking forward to playing this.

This game was a lot of fun back when it was fairly active, but now the game is lacking heavily in activity. Lag is pretty much a given due to the lack of players. It still has some in-game issues, bugs that were never fixed do occur, and disconnections happen every now and again.  On the other hand, lock boxes are easy to acquire, but sales in the market appear to be largely non-existent so there isn't much motivation to sell. So you just end up hoarding it all in your inventory, or you do trades with others to get onto the top skins leaderboard. Given the hours I put into this game, I would recommend the game. Obviously I have enjoyed it. It's a cheap game to play around in and because of its bare bones gameplay it's simple to get into, but the game is no longer in active development and with a dwindling player base there is less of a reason for people to pick it up and play.  In 2018 this game would had been good to pick up, but I can't say so at this point. I no longer recommend picking up this game. On sale? Might be worth it if enough new and old players joined in.

I admit I did not play this game a very long time but a lot of times you do not need 10 hours of playtime to see what the game is about. Right off the bat you are dropped in a police station with other players. You can talk to some npc's who give you a task and then off you go into the city to do this quest. Usually a quest involves just killing some zombies or fetching some item.  And that's basically all you do. Obviously you can get some new loot, which is most likely why there are still people playing this game.  I do not get excited by this formula anymore unless it's a really amazing game, which this one is not.  The game is free so if you are not looking to spend some money, at least you can give it a go.

Now this was one game i used to play down my local arcade all the time and i absolutely loved it,coin after coin would go into the machine and i would allways feel like i was playing the best game in all creation. Dragon's Lair 2: Timewarp Trailer - YouTube  Then i grew up,i still love this game (thats why i bought it and the original) but find that my love for it has dimminished somewhat.I think its because we have so many good and great games these days that we forget where games first came from and how simplistic they were,but i just dont feel the same playing this now as i did when i was that YOUNG man all them years ago. Don Bluth Talking About The Arcade Game Dragons Lair ...  Now let me say this the game itself is still the same,and DON BLUTHS animation is still as great as i remember and so is the voice acting and the in game music.Its just not the same experience as i remember and to be honest i have played through twice and dont think i will be doing so again in a hurry,which is a shame as one of the most fondly remembered games of my childhood has not stood the test of time and thats why i cant reccomend it to gamers of today. SPOILER ALERT*****DONT WATCH IF YOU WANT TO PLAY THROUGH AND SEE ALL THE GAME HAS TO OFFER FOR YOURSELF*****SPOILER ALERT Dragon's Lair II: Time Warp (1984 /1991) Start to Finish on ...  Video for Dragon's Lair 2 Time Warp Full Game‚ñ∫ 13:31‚ñ∫ 13:31 I still love the game but find that the magic has worn of and i dont know if i should have played it again as now i know what great games are i cant really settle for just sitting pushing buttons in one direction or the other and hitting A to use my sword at times. So i would reccomend it but only in the sales (and if it was cheap) and yes i would in a bundle also,but i cant in all good merit really reccomend it at the price it is. (I DO NOT OWN ANY OF THE CLIPS OF VIDEOS PUT UP IN THIS REVIEW AND THEY BELONG TO THEIR RESPECTIVE OWNERS AND ARE THEIRS BY COPYRIGHT)

I would lie if I said I liked this game. While the combat and the strategizing involved in the battle was interesting it ultimately felt wasted. That's because the outcome is more or less similar regardless of which ending you get, in which the only thing that changes is the way Dianne ends up getting sexually abused. There‚Äôs also a 10-minute epilogue for each ending that plays more or less like an audio-CD, and to be honest they aren't worth it unless you really really want to get all the achievements in the game.  So yeah, avoid this one and play Magebuster: Amorous Augury instead.

Admit it, we've all been there. Talking to a bot out of sheer loneliness. In the darkness, weeping while sipping out from an oversized glass of wine. Or maybe a keg of beer. No? No, neither have I. Hah! Why would I ever.. Talking to Hana is like talking to a kid that knows pretty much two word. Except maybe it's fifty instead, and the fact that she knows how to do this whole confusing math of kelvin vs celcius and how many second there is until the date is 27th of May. Or any other date, except you're talking to a bot.. So that's not a date, nuh-huh. In oracle mode she's supposed to be smart. All I got out of her was either "YES!" or "No, no, no, absolutely not!". Trigger-warning; Maybe it's the wrong time of the month. Meanwhile, in chat mode.. You get a response from certain words, like.. weight, boob, sex, age..  And you guessed it, she doesn't understand whole sentences, just singular words. Type in "age" and it'll automatically write "What's your age?" for you, but if you type in "What's your age?" yourself you'll get a Hana staring at you like you wrote something beyond her comprehension. Go figure. I should write something positive here before I turn into a bitter old lady; Selling the cards will make the game free and then some. People are weird. TL:DR; There's better options out there if you're ever THAT lonely.

I guess I picked this up in a bundle nine months ago, and I was told 1.0 was coming soon, so I figured I would install and try it out for the first time to see how things are along with all the free weekenders... Game loads up on the wrong (secondary) screen, blinks then minimizes. Lots of background music playing. Stays minimized. Can't play a game minimized. The UE4-SurvivalGame Game has crashed and will close Fatal error! The UE4-SurvivalGame Game has crashed and will close Fatal error! The UE4-SurvivalGame Game has crashed and will close Fatal error! Uninstalled. I checked the Bug Report forum and saw threads regarding the wrong monitor issue dated back in January without the developers reacting to it, but I'm sure it's very known to them too. As mentioned above, this game was part of a bundle so my expectations weren't high to begin with, but if 1.0 is just around the corner tinyBuild needs to start cracking some whips before the release.

Sky Mercenaries is "fast pased" action game with RPG elements i hated the game because of the graphics first of all i hate this graphic style because it looks cheap they could go for the pixel-art like most of them but what i really liked is the RPG elements which we don't see in most of the arcade games Pros: + RPG elements which aren't in most of this type of games + The color shifting is useful, You can dodge the lasers and the balls? when you shift to the same color of them but not the rockets + I've liked the bonus level , the escaping level it is a level that you escape in from the boss more than the levels in the game but the levels are decent Cons: -  The menu: after you select your character you can't go back to select another one so it is one way menu you can't return - Not much graphics options even for resolution there isn't - The most annoying part that game is "fast-pased" but it isn't , the space ship is faster than the rockets launches - Through the gameplay you'll see the the screen will slide to the right and the left , I mean what is the point of that, It would be better without it because i don't see any difference , It doesn't make the game better - The drones and the space ship are pretty big so, It is pretty hard to dodge like other arcade games and that is why they've added the color shifting, i think.. - No tutorial , The tutorial that they will give you is just about the controls and it is just a screen shows you the buttons, They don't show you what the bars are for what are the use of those bars so, You'll get confused in the first of the game - The game doesn't worth its original price, It is over-priced game more than a fast-pased game verdict: 4/10

NOTE: Read the edit at the bottom. What the actuall hell is this? Is this a troll game or something? I know that the devs wanted this game to be hard, but seriously? This is stupidly difficult. I only had to play 7 minutes to know what type of game this was. The vast majority of players are not going to like it being THIS hard. At the very least, put a difficulty option in so more people would be open to playing this. I don't get making a game for players where most of them won't want to play it. I really don't. You would make more money and more people would be happy if you did. No options menu either. The game is loud as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, so I had to turn down my computer sound instead of in-game. And to top it all off, you just simply TELL US to get a refund, instead of listening to our concerns. Wow, just wow. I'd be happy to try this game out again if they majorly fix it (especially the difficulty options and general options menu), but I have a feeling they won't. Refunded for now. I'm so disappointed. I really thought that this game would be amazing, but I was wrong. EDIT: Since the intial review, the devs have already released 4 patches to help with the gameplay. I re-bought the game and already notice changes. While not everything is fixed, they are listening. That changes this whole thing completely. Once a few more patches come out, I expect this game will be a lot better. I still won't recommend for now, but they're on the right track.

EDIT: Developers have been inactive for a few months so that is why I am changing it to not recommended. It had potential so I was going to see how it went but now that it is dead I will be completely honest.  I am a long time unity user to make indie games and one of the first thing I noticed is most if not all of the assets are pre-made from the POLYGON - Knights pack from synty studios and a few different asset packs from synty. The animations are basic and not very smooth they should have added more inbetweens.  UI is not very well drawn and the main menu looks to have been made by beginner devs as there is a lot of bugs. Overall, this game had a lot of potential but then ruined it. Also the devs must be someone who has only been developing games for a few months before it was made because this is a game who someone with average skill could make in maybe a few days with a few bucks for the premade assets.

Bethesda Game Studios  Open World, Role Playing  November 10 2015 TL;DR - The final score for this game, a 6 out of 10. Fallout 4 is a direct sequel to Fallout 3. The game sets in a futuristic apocalyptic Commonwealth or Boston, Massachusetts, riddled with dangers. It's running with Creation Engine, so it's a recycle engine from Skyrim. Without further ado, I am going to discuss in depth of this game's strengths and weaknesses. The game starts on Pre-War setting or before fallout apocalypse. You play as a   (what a shocker for hardcore fans but nonetheless I don't mind voiced customised character) and enlisted as a vault dweller for Vault 111. After you wake up from cryogenic sleep, you noticed that your only child has been taken away by an unknown assailant and killed your wife/husband (depending on what gender you're playing as). After you got out of Vault 111, the game gives you an amazing impression, where everything is... just chaotically beautiful. It is up to you how you find your child by unravelling the clues. There are multiple endings to choose from. The gunplay in Fallout 4 is simple. It feels like I am playing some sort of generic first person shooter game. The leveling system has perks and basic stats (also known as S.P.E.C.I.A.L.). It has RPG elements to it, such as apparel clothing, aids or temporary buffs, legendary loot system and crafting system. The game includes settlements, so let's make it in depth. Settlements are your base building, you need to maintain their happiness by building electricity, water, food, defenses and shelter. It can be frustrating at times where Preston Garvey bothers you to defend each settlements all the time, but I will save that discussion for later. You might come across with side quests and exploration during playthrough, it is your choice how you play. Power Armor will no longer needed the Power Armor training perk, so you can wear it in the beginning of your playthrough. Companion system is intact, now you can take whoever you want. I like the new V.A.T.S. system, it changes the pace of the gameplay. Instead of being stopped and pick any limbs, it's more of a bullet time. The crafting system is way better than its predecessors in my opinion. Weapons now have attachments. The loot system is a mixed reaction to me, like when killing countless of legendary enemies, I get the same loot unless I have to turn the difficulty up to increase the chance of getting better items. Companion system seems to be the same from Fallout New Vegas as I remember, it can be customised (wearing armor, equipping guns, carrying junk for you). You will earn a perk from companions by increasing the affection level of the companion. There are new factions added, but I'd rather not to spoil it. There are technical issues on this game. The graphics looked outdated for a 2015 triple A title until they release the HD texture download which is over 50GBs of texture files if you have DLCs implemented (holy ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, that's insane amount of storage). I'd suggest not to download the HD Texture Pack for now. The modding community are still angry about adding the paid mods called Creation Club, yes you heard me. I am sure you can get away with it by downloading mods from NexusMods (even though I am not into modding). This game is poorly optimized for the latest hardware. The AI in this game is horrendously dumb. Especially companion gets in your way but can't get out of the doorway (Dogmeat found something, dies by a trap). The game gets difficult when underlevel, so it is the best way to level up by doing side quest and exploration. The gunplay feels lackluster.   and   doesn't have an amazing gunplay but look how the gun handles. The gun keeps jamming when not repaired all the time, it's very simple and effective. I feel like this is the most repetitive and fetch fest game I have ever played, period. Like take an example of The Witcher 3, where the side quests are so fascinating and much freedom of how you get the reward. Can I talk about the settlements? Because that ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• is irritating as hell. "Our settlement needs our help", yes Preston Garvey I get it you piece of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. The quest design are poorly done, it's about fetch quests and dungeon clearing. Seriously, that is purely lazy as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. The main story is somewhat forgettable in first 10 hours since you have to figure out what to do. The story is kind of weak to me because there is nothing to change significantly and do some end game content, that's it. So, what is the verdict or my final score for this game? Well, the official critics nowadays are ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• suck, giving any game 90 out of 100 which is impossible to review the product in a day while they're in a middle of their playthrough. Do not listen to the critics. I bought this game around 30 Australian Dollars during sale and I don't think it is worth buying at full price. Besides, the GOTY edition is coming out soon. The final score for this game, a 6 out of 10. Seriously, if there was no fetch quests or boring endings, I can get away with a 7 or 8 even.

So for starters, TL;DR - 3/10 Reason for this is simple. So i'll put it into a list. Upsides: - The hordes are cool - Robots. - Crafting feels nice - PvE is pretty nice. Downsides: - Feels too much like ARK (Uses arks engine) - PvP is dead. - Guns are garbage til end game. - Super repeatitive - Third person only - Character blocks your view alot of the time - Too many deer - Shelters are almost impossible to find unless playing single player - Glitchy at times - Good items are too rare or costly - No base building except in zones - Controls are Meh at best. Currently, this game is worth the 15$ if you can wait for the devs to update and balance it. However BEWARE the dev's created Pixark and that game also died down a bit, and is known for being super unbalanced as well. The game needs a TON of polishing, Improvements, and content. Which hopefully it get's it. But currently in the current state, the game isn't worth it.
Worked great for a few months.. now it just opens a minimized version of the old desktop one but just freezes indefinitely. Wouldn't recommend anymore.

I thought this was the worst game MCF has ever made.  It was like a child's game.  The story was like a child's story.  What happened here?  This will be my last MCF game that I ever buy at full price.  Very disappointed.  While the puzzles were easy, some of them had no instructions so I had no idea what the developer wanted.  I hope this is worst MCF game, I don't ever want to pay for another game like this!  Shame on you all for putting an MCF label on this game.
super high price for short game. wait for sales around $2.5

-Performance/Optimisation is a bit better, I can now play at 4K@60FPS, but had to turn down the audience density to 80% otherwise it'll drop FPS in 8-Man matches. -Loading is a lot faster. -Up-to-date superstars. -Minor additions to the creation suite. -Able to adjust the hair shine. -More match types. -Tower mode, I like it but playing it too much times can bore you out. -IMO, I think the menu soundtracks are better than the some crap they put in the last game. -Fun with local co-op friends. -They have made the animations more faster. -Female Royal Rumble is finally here. -Better MyCareer story, although I'm not interested in it. -Faster custom creation loading in downloads section. -Reversals are a big pain in this game, even at 60FPS. They are similar to 2K16 and can be worse. You have really small reversal input window in major reversals. At many times you cannot even reversal despite not having that condition where you get major reversed. Minor reversals are OK at the beginning of matches. The only WWE game they made the reversals really perfect is in WWE 2K17. -Bugs, what can I say, this year is no different when it comes to the bugs. Let me start with stating what bugs there is in this game:      1. Shadow issues on entrances, the ring and outside the ring has a really bad shadow issue which solves itself once the       match starts.      2. When creating female CAWs, wearing specifics eyelashes prevents you wearing *CAPS*, as this isn't a bug, it is really stupid.      3. When previewing entrance music, eventually you'll encounter a bug where the entrance music will get cut out, this effect may also affect other CAWs and if that does happen, the CAW that was facing the issue will no longer have the       issue but another CAW will, so practically it's like a virus.      4. 8-Man tag team, the opponent team sometimes hit their own teammates several times before they leave each other alone.      5. When trying to do announcer table OMG, it ends up doing the powerbomb OMG. (A bug that occurs in WWE 2K18 and below games.      6. When previewing moves in move-sets, you can sometimes see a graphical bug which is below the opponent.      7. Some moves in movesets doesn't execute properly when previewing. And there's more. -Graphically, it looks a bit downgraded from the last game, I found that WWE 2K18's lighting was more better than WWE 2K19. -Copy & Pasted WWE 2K18 & put minor additions to the game like tower mode. -Payback has practically some abilities that was originally can be used in Ability Skills, just an excuse to not put the skills in the abilities skill anymore. -Menu is unattractive and sometimes can be confusing to navigate. -You can easily eliminate opponents in royal rumble despite having green health bar, short version of saying, Royal Rumble is absolutely $hit. -Game has a tendancy of randomly crashing. It can happen but randomly, during a match or during interacting with menu. -Still has auto target bug where running into an opponent doesn't get targeted infact the opponent behind the one who you trying to target/hit gets targeted. Manual target is a pain in the ass on 8-Man matches. -Developer support seems to heavily dropped this time around, hardly any updates to fix issues with the game. [NEW] -Major reversal timing are way more different compared to last year, when you get damaged, some major reversals can have so different timings, some may require to reverse at the beginning of move. -Playing more than 2 players, sometimes the reverse button on the top of the player get switched over to someone else who is playing with you, so for example, 1P get hit by someone, the 2P has the reversal button & option instead of 1P. -Playing 8-man matches, the game would like to destroy your friendship by auto targeting at your friends more than the bots themselves. -Targeting is absolutely bull$hit, if you run towards someone in front of your face in 8-man or 6-man ladders other matches, to attack them, it'll automatically targets someone who may be in the ring, or outside or even right across the outside ring, who is already attacking another bot. My recommendation is to wait for a sale, this game alone is worth ¬£25 or ¬£20, buying it at a full price is a madman's decision as it's the same as '18 but just few additions. Thankfully I found this game for ¬£25, so I'd say I'm fine with that. I would stay away from this game, till it's on sale, this game doesn't have much new features. It's practically a rip-off buying this game at full price, the new additions to the game is enough to make it possible to put it into a DLC. It's fun but can be ruined by annoying bugs. However not all bugs are annoying, there can be some funny unexpected ones, I've encounter many in 2K18. The one thing that bugged me with many WWE games, is that they keep changing the speed of animations every year, we can't keep getting used to the pace of the game if it's changing every year. Whoever says 2K/Yuke's don't make polished or great stable games, open your third eye, as your other two are blind.

Star Conflict use to be a lot of fun, but now its just a pay-to-win piece of trash. It had potential but through it out the window. For instance to change your name in game you have to spend $10.00 worth of in-game currency; like wtf? And they took away the only fun thing to do in this game which was to undock where you could explore with friends, take out random carriers and pretty much do whatever you wanted. but now you have to be rank 6 to undock which is nearly impossible to get to without paying your way to it. 4/10

I first heard about   from a Rock, Paper, Shotgun article entitled "The Lighthouse Customer". I thought it sounded so cool when I was younger, yet I waited for years til I jumped on it. Sadly,   now rests in an abandoned, clunky state. The combat is slow and your character moves as though they have sprained all the joints in their body.  It's supposed to be a hardcore survival game where you must escape from mutated human/alien hybrids who lurk in the darkness of Syberia. You hunt animals, aliens, etc. while scavenging through the ruins of the old world.   has potential off the charts. Sadly the game is just pretty much zero fun to play. At this stage in its life - having not been updated in ages -   is a game that probably no-one will enjoy. And that's a shame.

!!  It is a broken RPG that is not worth the $0.54 US Sale price.  There is a HINT that I should have noticed ==>  There are exactly ZERO { 0 } Reviews & ZERO { 0 } Screenshots.  Now certainly the Developer couldn't possibly have deleted ALL of them ?! Right ?? At the start, one may change the name of the Protagonist. However, the input is in a Cyrillic only alphabet Matrix. So use the Default name unless you are fluent in Russian. The Protagonist {PC} begins combat with only 1 { one } of nominally 450 Health Points {HP} !!  One must expend ever disappearing Magic Points {MP} to Heal the PC BEFORE   battle, just to be able to survive.  Then when PC leaves the battle, HP drops back to 1 point again.  AND the MP is not restored. AND Leveling up   either HP or MP. Also, the  . AND    Spells are the only effective offense, other than Fists :steamfacepalm:  Perhaps it is intended that the PC uses only a Sword. But that is not made explicit AND   in the early game. Perhaps there is a way to fix this, but the Developer has stopped responding to Forum comments. AND the game lacks instructions { at least in English}. NPC's responses are either in broken English or Russian.  It is not worth wasting my time to solve this; if that even is possible.

What an absolute technical mess this is. The menu is an entirely separate program and does not adhere to any settings and always runs in fullscreen. The actual racing games loads separately, which can lead to it appearing behind the menu, which then only says 'loading' without any info or button. What's the point of that? And if you tried the mouse steering options, then you're sol, as the cursor gets locked on the black screen and you can't do anything anymore. Is the racing any good? Can't say, as when I tried to start a second round it didn't load the race window and after 20 minutes of fiddling to get my cursor back, I couldn't bother anymore neither. Also the pictures on the store don't show how the gameplay actually looks like at all. All fake montages to show off graphics, despicable deceit.

Being a huge fan of the original Primal Carnage, Primal Carnage: Extinction disappoints me. I spent almost 2,000 hours playing the original game, and I have to say that this game isn't fun to play at all. I thought during it's Early Access period that this game would get better, but it really didn't get too much better. The game has horrible balance, hit detection, hitboxes, and dinosaur movement. The game is also mostly filled with Roleplayers. There is no competitive community for this game like the original game had. Being a competitve player of the original, it just disappoints me to see Primal Carnage: Extinction become the game it is currently. The game seems to mostly revolve around people sitting around in servers and waiting for loot to drop. The whole game just seems to rely way too heavily on it's economy system. This game seems to be more about Quantity over Quality. Gameplay doesn't seem to be a priority for the developers which is saddening as that's what made the original game so great. The original game had excellent gameplay, and it was much more fun to play. If this game stopped being updated, it'd probably die quicker than the original would. Except for the Roleplayers, they would stay. All in all, this game is simply not worth it. Even it's name "Primal Carnage: Extinction" isn't right as the game simply has no carnage happening. If you want a game with carnage and action, go play the original Primal Carnage. It's cheaper and it's more fun than Primal Carnage: Extinction.
