I am sorry guys, but I can't recommend this game. If you want a better way to start with Samurai Jack, watch all 5 seasons, that series is perfection. SPOILERS Okay, I of course was not expecting a masterpiece, as I am sure no one else was either, but for 40 dollars, I at least expected something decent. The story starts off where season 5 finale left off, you are about to head back in time to your homeland, but along the way, Aku manages to catch Jack and send him back to where he began his entire adventure, now you are going through all sorts of time portals, experiencing the shows most iconic places, meeting the most beloved characters of the show..(The Scotsman, Sam-Moo-Rhai, etc), and battling other well know villains and robots.  Jack has to find these Aku medallions and destroy them to advance further in time and get back to his home world. Right off the bat when you start the game, it looks terrible, the graphics seriously look like they can give late PS2 a run for it's money, character animations are horrid, and the gameplay/controls in general are stiff and clunky.  Keep in mind this is a third person hack n' slash, and holy balls is it basic, this whole game felt like a PS2 game, everything was outdated looking.  As with all hack n' slash, you will go through the games 8-9 worlds, leveling up your character and weapons with basic attack, defense, combos, the works..you collect coins and sort of magical fire/aura on the way to charge up your attacks. Sam-Moo-Rhai owns a store where you can buy, sell, upgrade, and repair your weapons and get healing items and other magical trinkets to aid you in battle. At the end of each stage is the obvious boss battle...and they suck.. I have never been so bored with end level bosses, and these take the cake, their attacks are easily choreographed and avoidable. Same thing can't be said for the main enemies, there are some parts where they all gang up on you and it is so broken, I had to use my haggis or hot water all up because I was trapped in a corner and like 10 zombies or metal bugs took their turns in a congo line to take shots at me. Their hit detections are atrocious and they hit you from across the galaxy with ease. Only really good thing about this was over time when you take damage, you lose pieces of your clothing and appear battle worn as in the shows, which was a nice detailed touch. That is pretty much it, music is okay at times but most it just feels generic, the whole thing just feels like a PS2 remake and not in a good way. I can't recommend the game for it's price, 40 bucks is not worth 5 hours of repetitive gameplay and boring outdated visuals. Trust me, if you want a better experience, watch the show instead, much...MUCH better!

this game could become the best ARPG of the decade, too bad soo many bugs and glitches ruin the player experience...and i have love hate-like relationship with this game like with my ex-GF... it's buggy and unpolished, but i still keep playing it somehow :S - probably has the best graphics and animation above all ARPG diablo-like games (for now) - sound and the voice actor is really good tbh, i really like the sound of melee weapons and some magic spell when it cast. - freedom choice to make your character without skill/ability restriction depending of what passive/active skill and weapon that you used..the passive skill tree are more satisfying than diablo, PoE, or grim dawn..you could make your character a gun-mage build that could use turret gun while spamming AoE magic to wipe a mass of enemies group, or tanky-bruiser with 100% shield block but deals constant AoE attack spam if you have enough resources and regeneration, etc. - you have some equipments with 2 slot socket? good...roll it on NPC to get free 3 slot socketed gear :D - the UI are pretty similar from other ARPG like diablo - err...pretty cheap? 12$ if i converted the price to USD (at least in my region, idk about other region) - bug and glitches everywhere...and from what i've experienced are:  1. you often get stuck on some certain places, mostly between a ledge, wall, boxes, or something near the edge of the map, usually you cant do anything about it besides go back to menu and relog..oh and yes, you'll meet some of enemies that get stucked to..yay free hit! (for ranged weapon/skill, but you couldnt hit them with melee weap/skill ._. ) 2. your character sometimes will move like a beyblade..yes theyre spinning around when moving, i notices this when i moving through some stair or a small passage from upper ground to lower ground. 3. its so damn hard to click that damn items that lies on the floor !! ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•! ! you really need to click the item on the exact pixel to get it..this is happened too when you try to move or use item from your inventory 4. my char once get knockbacked so hard from a boss that makes it falling down (because the area is on a high places) to outside the area...the screen get blurry because of my character falling animation and TADA! my char is falling back to the town XD, but couldnt do anything to goes back to the boss area, cant even teleport to my friend who is still fighting that boss...and he killed it.. EZPZ 'freeloader' mode, i didn't even did anything LMAO B) 5. so both me and my friend died from a boss fight, usually if the both players on the party died, we will got transferred back to the town and restart from the last checkpoint portal before the boss fight, and our 'sidekick' NPC is still beating the boss..and we couldn't go back to the town, the return to town button isn't there...we waited a bit longer, and decides to go back to main menu, but our 'sidekick' NPC beated the boss singlehandedly XD and we got revived back at the same places we died before and the quest completed, we got the reward XD now idk if this is a good or bad thing..since we still finished the quest :D 6. once, i got my story progress far ahead of my friend, usually when we make a party, the player who got to story progress far ahead will go through the story progress of the player who is fall behind...but in my case, my friend skipped that entire gap between me and him, and now has the same main story progress with me..like wtf? he tried to leave the party and tried to do solo, but the progress is already the same like mine...it might be a good thing but, he couldnt get some unique/legendary reward from the story that he skipped. - online issues like disconnected when play in multiplayer mode still often happens - different character for offline and online mode..example: if you already have lv 50 character in online mode, and tried to play offline, you must start a new character exclusively for the offline mode. - no auto-sort item in the inventory, wtf...? - oh yeah almost forget to mention, don't bother to spend any attributes point on agility if you want to make melee DPS, somehow it doesn't matter how many point you spent on the agility (despite from the information it could boost your attack speed) , your hit will still slow af..just spam the AoE skill later in the end game >:) idk about ranged weapon if this affect their attack speed but my friend who's play as a gun-mage build, feels it's a needed attribute for reduces the casting speed. (maybe hes wrong or maybe im wrong, idk) - might add later if i found something new (and hilarious) ================================================================================================ i can't recommend this game for most people  but, if you don't care with all the bad aspect that i type above and its has a decent or cheap price in your region, you could buy this game if you want..it maybe buggy and unpolished, but still can make me feel addicted to play especially if you're like ARPG and grindfest/looter game.

Encountered many issues with this game Started off, it wouldn't let me download. My internet was fine and it just wouldn't do it. Somehow I managed to download it. Bootup the game, my controller is detected as 2 different ones, and made me play as both RedCup and BlueCup. This made me spend 20 minutes finding a fix for this. At this point I had spent 12 hours trying to actually get into the game, and I have done this finally, only to have a very small payoff. The soundtrack was decent but not good enough to warrant me spending an extra $10 on it, and the levels got stale very quickly. I only got to spend about half an hour on it before I just got bored of it.  The difficulty I found was rather pleasing, having played Hotline Miami 1 and 2 and Dark Souls, this game was one of the somewhat easier ones, but alas it got too boring before I could really do much.

This is the only Batman Arkham game that i couldn't get perfect game (100% achievement completed). Not because the achievement requirement is so hard but they shutdown the multiplayer server so that there is no chance for me to complete 11 mp achievement. The dev  diddn't want to make an acv patch or change mp acv to single player achievement after they shutdown the server, just 3 years after they launched the game. I am not an extreme completionist but saw another 4 of my Batman Arkham games got 100% achievement when this one was not completed is just not cool enough. So yeah this game is BIG NO for completionist. Not to mention i got 5-6 bug achievement (like Anyones See That, Silent Knight, etc) that won't pop up even i already repeat again in NG+ or I am The Night difficulty but still won't pop up or not work. The solution is make a new save game slot and play the game from zero again. just wanna say: HAPPY belated ANNIVERSARY SERVER SHUTDOWN FOR BATMAN: ARKHAM ORIGINS (12-4-2016)

This game is adequate for the most part. The weapons are fun enough, The levels are pretty boring to look at but fun to explore, and the Geo-Modification aspect that the game really tries to sell to the player is only used MAYBE a handful of times, to be generous. The music is great, and in fact I would say that's the best part of it. You wouldn't get this game for the story, but that's to be typically expected in a game like this. So why would I NOT recommend it, although I'm saying the game is okay? Because of the inexplicable difficulty spike around the halfway point of the game. I say "spike," but it doesn't get any easier after this point; it's more like a difficulty  . This is whenever the Masako mercenaries come in. Before this point in the game, I would almost say the game was too  . Then, with the arrival of these mercenaries, you suddenly (I do mean suddenly; there's no gap between "too easy" and "instant death") and brutally have to switch to a different mode of playing. Whereas before you could almost go guns blazing, now you have to quicksave before you go around any corner, in case there's a railgun-wielding enemy who may or may not instantly shoot and kill you the second you peek around a corner; it seemed to be random. You also have to keep checking your flank in case the game decides to spawn an enemy wielding a railgun behind you. I can't speak for everyone, but having to constantly reload saves and hope that the AI decides to miss me is not my idea of fun. After dealing with this for a while, and making it to the 3/4 point or so, I gave myself invincibility just to finish. On top of this, at the very end of the game, you have to do a completely random minigame. Random here means two things: it comes out of nowhere, and it's random chance whether you'll get the right choices and complete it successfully. Rather than take everything you've learned to make some sort of climactic ending, the game throws this new, brief concept at you.  There was also the glitches I encountered while playing the game. I'm running a modern Windows 10 PC; any modern desktop can easily handle a game like this nowadays, to the point that the game gets a little overwhelmed. I had to cap my FPS at 30 at certain points so the game wouldn't inexplicably blow up important things I needed to use. The scope on the Railgun was unusable due to some bad texture or other, and the same thing happened to certain in-game display monitors. The game also skipped the final cutscene and instantly started rolling the credits after I completed the aforementioned minigame, so I thought that was the end until I decided to doublecheck. Ultimately, I would say that while this game is   it doesn't do enough good to outweigh the bad. I really wish they'd done more with the key feature advertised for their game (Geo-Modification.) I can't really say it left any impression on me other than frustration, but even that was only minor. Maybe get it for a sale if you feel like getting back to some oldies?

Are you a complete newbie to this game?  Prepare to be completely dumped on by the remaining vets on the server. There were some very good parts to the game.  If you have VR, its an amazing experience.  The co-op vs AI can be fun with friends as well.  The land and water based fights are pretty basic but also good fun.   However, I got the game for the pvp air fights.  Unfortunately, the battle queue system puts you up against vehicles of the same level, it is not based on player experience.  Most games I played on the NA server i found myself flying towards battle for about 5-10 minutes but then being shot down within 3-4 seconds by the vets (who seem to be the majority of players left on the servers).  Those 5-10 minutes of flying into battle... top notch in vr.  The 'not getting the real chance to fight and improve at pvp', not so great.

I'm sorry, of course, but it's been so long and it's time to open your eyes to the truth. Hyip from the Witcher has already passed and you can soberly look at things. I've been trying to figure out for three years why everyone praises the Witcher so much. For me personally, he is head and shoulders below even the same of Skyrim. In the Witcher except for the beautiful nature and worked on quests (partly. The main story is only good in the first half of the game and all side effects should essentially do the same thing ‚Äî running on the trail using instinct) there is nothing at all. Gameplay the game is nothing. Absolutely deserted world, in which there is nothing to do but a dull grind of all the same villages and robber camps, which again makes no sense, as a reward you get absolutely useless stuff like a coil of wire or a handful of nails, which can only be sold for 5 cents. It is obvious that people did not even really try and just stupidly tried to "wind the timing" of game time, filling up the desert world with useless debris of the same type. The combat system is so poor and simple (not to mention that 90% of the abilok just useless) that I had a strong feeling that I was trying to get wet face in A. not Only that, to complete the game you just had to zaklikivat enemy (not even dodging at the same time, because you can just smear Kven and not strain the extra finger), so they still give you an abilka, so you can just hold down one button, close your eyes and quietly wait until Geralt does everything himself. And it's all at maximum complexity, of course. I can't even imagine what it's like to play on a lower difficulty. You must be accompanied by a group of vassals, clearing the way for you from any fall, or something like that. After two parts of the DS to play such a gameplay misunderstanding was for me a real torture.  Many criticize Skyrim for casualness, but the Witcher surpassed all possible limits. So oxazolines interactive kintz from the world of RPG, I haven't seen. Duck would be okay, was a fascinating story, but this is also a problem. Really interesting was the only quest line of the bloody Baron. Perhaps the most elaborate part of the game. But then everything went on rolled and rolled into an absolute banality. In short, for me personally the Witcher 3 was the main failure of the last years. So hyped professional with ignorami and tachypnoe in community dummy I've never seen before. He played it for about 400 hours and the opinion was the most complete. Why did you suffer so much, you ask? Well, just so I have a principled approach. If you started to play something, then by all means drink from the game all the juices and explore every nook and cranny, even if you do not like. Especially because in the Wake of such a hyip in the heart until the very end glimmered hope: what if it just seems at first glance, suddenly it's just a bad piece of the game and over that turn will begin the real gameplay... But no. The miracle did not happen. In fact, in the first 10-20 hours of gameplay you can see absolutely everything on offer for the Witcher.  I can not even imagine what a masochist you need to be to pass the game more than once. Although I personally know these guys. Thank you for your attention. I'm done.
